Lower caps indicate komal or flat notes , indicates higher octave , indicates lower octave .
It is an Audava-Sampoorna raga , implying that it has 5 notes in Arohana and 7 in Avarohana .
The madhyam is the most important note - an important nyaas sthaan with emphasized elaboration around this note - S g M , M g M , g M P , M P g M P g g M .
The Rishabh and the Dhaivat are skipped in Aarohi passages , but are given due importance when descending .
 Use of the the Dhaivat and The Rishabh is symmetric and both are approached via the succeeding notes
 Pandit Vijay Sardeshmukh is a noted Indian classical vocalist and disciple of Kumar Gandharva Pandit Vijay Sardeshmukh is an honored guru for post graduation studies in Pune University .
Pt .
 Vijay Sardeshmukh , born in June 1952 was initiated into music by Pandit Vijay Sardeshmukh Father , Vitthalrao Sardeshmukh .
Vitthalrao was a Sanskrit pandit , a vocalist and an accomplished harmonium player .
 Vitthalrao accompanied many vocalists of renown including Pt .
Bhimsen Joshi , Pt .
Kumar Gandharva and others .
 Kumar Gandharva , who was a good friend of Vitthalrao , later became Vijays Guru .
 Vijay 's has learned from Kumar Gandharva 1971 onward .
 Gifted with melodious voice , Vijay 's made Vijay 's debut in `` Swar sadhana Conference '' organised in Alurkar Music House Pune in 1974 .
Since then he has performed in many concerts of repute , including the Sawai Gandharva and Tansen Samaroha .
He is Graded Artist of All India Radio and Doordarshan since 1977 .
His cassettes and C D s are released by HMV and Alurkar Music House Pune .
Amongst Pt .
Kumar Gandharvas desciples , Vijay 's presentation is widely recognized as very close to that of his Guru .
A meditative quality that prevailed in Kumar Gandharvas music can be richly experienced in Vijays music .
Kumar Gandharvas education always included singing as well as discussion .
 Kumar Gandharvas education was this fusion of thought process and music that Vijay 's inherited from Kumar Gandharva which prompted concerts like Kalyan Darshan .
Vijay 's voice was moulded further under Kumar Gandharvs guidance who was known to be well versed with the science of voice culture .
Two Tanpuras , tuned to the highest degree of perfection , play a vital role in Vijay 's music .
 To quote Kumar Gandharva 's thought behind this , `` This is Two Tanpuras canvass , how can an artist paint in thin air ? ''
 Drawing on the tanpuras , Vijay 's is known to make the air vibrant with various ragas with minutest of the shruti differences .
 Thus entwined , Vijay 's points , in the minds of Vijay 's audience .
 Known for Vijay 's soft spoken and modest nature Vijay 's is a man of few words but boundless music within Vijay 's .
 Vijay 's is retired from the service of Bank of India and is devoted Vijay 's life in classical music .
 Vijay 's has Two sons Swaand and Swaroop
Alladiya Khan was an Indian classical singer , known as Gaan Samraat .
 his father Ahmed Khan founded the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana based on the Agra gharana .
 his father Ahmed Khan is also recognized for his father Ahmed Khan revival and creations of many ragas .
Alladiya Khan was born in Uniara , a small village in the present Indian district of Tonk , then under the native state of Jaipur , on 10 August 1855 , in a family of musicians .
 Though his father Ahmed Khan father Ahmed Khan died early in Alladiyas life , his father Ahmed Khan uncle , Jehangir Khan , taught his father Ahmed Khan dhrupad for 5 years and then khyal for another 8 years .
Alladiya Khan served in the court of various kings of Rajasthan , including that of Amlata .
 his father Ahmed Khan sang so well and so much for the kings that his father Ahmed Khan nearly lost his father Ahmed Khan voice due to hours of riyaaz .
 While trying to regain his father Ahmed Khan voice his father Ahmed Khan developed a new and profound style of singing by which his father Ahmed Khan could sing without compromising the purity of raga but the passage , taans , and creativity of singing the raga .
 Later his father Ahmed Khan settled down in Kolhapur as the court musician of the local king , Shahu Maharaj .
 In 1922 his father Ahmed Khan moved to Mumbai after the king died .
 With his father Ahmed Khan distinguished reputation , Ustad Alladiya Khan became a gem among the many masters in Mumbai .
 his father Ahmed Khan taught many disciples and sang in many mehfils in Mumbai to which his father Ahmed Khan reputation as an academic grew .
 his father Ahmed Khan autobiography , as narrated to his father Ahmed Khan grandson Azizzudin Khan Sahab , is available in English translation , as My Life , translated with and introduction by Amlan Dasgupta and Urmila Bhirdikar , published by Thema , Kolkata , 2000 .
 Alladiya Khan was acknowledged for his father Ahmed Khan creation and resurrection of many complex Raags such as Nat Kamod , Bhoop Nat , Kaunsi Kanada , Sampoorna Malkauns , Basanti Kedar , Shuddha Nat , Malavi , Savani Kalyan , and many more .
 Many of these Raags were originally created and sung by the Havelis in northern Rajasthan , where Ustad Manji Khansahab grew up .
 Hearing the Haveli sangeet Ustad Manji Khansahab took many of the Raag-based Bhajans and created these Raags and Bandishes with Ustad Manji Khansahab .
 One of the these Raags these Raags resurrected was Raag Basanti Kanada .
 Few of the many Haveli sangeet dhrupads which Haveli made into Bandishes were the famous Raag Nayaki Kanada Bandish Mero Piya Rasiya and Bihagda Bandish Ye Pyaari pag hole .
 Ustad Manji Khansahab most principle disciples were his younger brother , Ustad Haider Khan and his own sons , Ustad Manji Khansahab and Ustad Bhurji Khansahab and his grandson Ustad Azizuddin Khansahab .
 Khansahabs brother helped grow the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana after Ustad Manji Khansahab demise .
 Ustad Manji Khan , the second son * , died early in 1937 , so it was Ustad Bhurji Khan , the youngest son , who passed on the Gayaki of his father Ahmed Khan father to others worthy of the Gayaki of his father .
Mallikarjun Mansur and Appasaheb Deshpande are among noted deciples of Bhurji Khan .
 Apart from family , Ustad Manji Khansahab initial disciples were Bhaskarbuwa Bakhale , Kesarbai Kerkar Govind rao shaligram and Wamanrao Sadolikar , dhondutai kulkarni and in succeeding generation came proteges like , Mallikarjun Mansur and Padmavati Shaligram .
 In Mumbai , Alladiya Khan sahebs prime disciples were Kesarbai Kerkar , Mogubai Kurdikar and Nivruttibuwa Sarnaik .
 The Annual Ustad Alladiya Khan Music Festival is celebrated in Mumbai each year , where several singers and musicians perform , giving homage to his father Ahmed Khan .
In 2005 , the 150th birth anniversary of the musical legend was celebrated .
 In 2007 , the story of Ustad Alladiya Khan , and his father Ahmed Khan noted disciple , Kesarbai Kerkar , was the subject of Namita Devidayals acclaimed debut book , The Music Room
Amaan Ali Khan is an Indian classical musician who plays the sarod .
 the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan is the son of Amjad Ali Khan and often performs with the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan younger brother Ayaan Ali Khan , with whom the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan hosted the music talent show Sa Re Ga Ma .
A young talent of the seventh generation in an unbroken chain of the Senia Bangash School , Amaan Ali Khan , is the eldest son and disciple of the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan and grandson of Haafiz Ali Khan .
 Initiated into the fine art of the Sarod playing at a very tender age , the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan began the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan public performances as early as eight .
 Accompanying the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan father to various music festivals in India and abroad , he has today carved out a niche for himself .
His performances have evoked creditable applause .
His precision in tunefulness and his bold and resonant strokes are all pointers to importance of tradition and continuity in Indian Classical Music .
 Amaan 's is one of the most loved artists of India today and has performed in most of the mainstream Music Festivals of India , in India and abroad .
 Amaan 's performed in 1986 at the Festival of India in Moscow at the age of eight .
 Thereafter , Amaan 's made Amaan 's the UK debut in 1990 and Amaan 's US debut in New York at the Asia Society in 1991 .
 Today , Amaan 's is considered as one of the finest Sarod players and has obtained a very special place for Amaan 's among music enthusiasts across the world .
 Amaan 's is an inspiration for the younger generation of musicians .
 Amaan 's continues to enchant audiences with Amaan 's virtuosity , sheer brilliance and charismatic stage presence .
 Amaan 's has been a regular performer at Palais beaux-arts in Brussels , ESPLANADE in Singapore , Chicago Symphony Center , Carnegie Hall and Kennedy Center in the USA , Royal Festival Hall and Barbican Center in the UK .
 In addition Amaan 's has performed for the Temenos academy at St. James Palace in London for HRH Prince of Wales in 1995 , 1997 and 2003 .
 In 2001 and 2002 Amaan 's took part at the Summer Arts Festival in Seattle and the Edinburgh Festival in the UK .
 Amaan 's Australian Tour in 2003 included Amaan 's performances at the World Beat Festival in Brisbane , Opera House in Sydney and the WOMAD Festival in New Plymouth and Adelaide .
 Amaan 's performed with Cellist Matthew Barley and the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain in July 2002 along with a series of workshops and also worked on Amaan 's critically acclaimed album Strings Attached with A Matthew Barley .
Other Festivals over the years include Womad and Salisbury Festival and the Enescu Festival in Bucharest .
In 2005 Amaan composed for the music for the film American Daylight by academy award winner Rodger Christian .
The spring of 2005 saw collaboration at the Savannah Music Festival in Georgia with the Derek Trucks Band .
Same year , he featured with his father in Real World Record 's much-acclaimed album Moksha in May 2005 .
 In July 2006 Amaan 's collaborated with Evelyn Glennie at Queen Elisabeth Hall at the Rhythm Sticks the Savannah Music Festival in Georgia and also appeared at the WOMAD Rivermead Festival .
 Amaan 's electronica lounge albums titled Reincarnation and ` Truth ' won Amaan 's critical acclaim .
 In 2009 , Amaan 's played at the United Nations in New York in presence of Ban Ki Moon to commemorate the Ode to Peace Concert along with Amaan 's Father .
 In April 2011 , Amaan 's collaborated with American Folk artist Carrie Newcomer at Lotus Arts Festival in Bloomington along with Amaan 's father and brother and also performed at The Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco .
 Amaan 's performed recently at New York 's Metropolitan Museum and The Lensic in Santa Fe .
 The same year , Amaan 's performance with Amaan 's father recorded at Wigmore Hall released under the ` live at Wigmore Hall ' series in the UK .
 The latest album Rang - Colors of Sufism released in March features Amaan 's and Ayaan 's interpretations of traditional Qawwalis on the Sarod in 2012 .
 Amaan 's released Amaan 's solo album titled ` Amaan 's ' , in 2002 .
 On reviewing this album , Songlines World music magazine said that Amaan 's performance was a `` worthy heir to Amaan 's father 's crown . ''

Awards and accolades came his way early in life .
 From 2000 to 2001 , Amaan 's hosted a music series on Zee TV called ` Sa Re Ga Ma ' , with Amaan 's brother .
 In October 2002 , Amaan 's received Provogue Society 's Young Acheivers Award for performing Arts .
A recipient of the MTV 's Lycra Award for the Most Stylish person in Music in 2006 , he was honoured recently by the Mayor of the City of Tulsa , Oklahoma with the Keys to the City along with an Honorary Citizenship and the Bharat Shiromani Award for Instrumental music in 2007 .
He was also recently felicitated by the Swiss brand Raymond Weil for his achievements over the years at the launch of their new collection of timepieces titled Freelancer , in 2011 .
 In addition to playing the Sarod , Amaan 's co-authored a book with Amaan 's brother , the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan titled ` Abba-God 's greatest gift to us on Amaan 's father 's life ' in November 2002 .
Roli Books , Lustre Publications published the book as a part of their ` Family Pride ' series .
 Amaan 's has also anchored Top Drive , the all new television series on Star World that was aired from January end2003 for five episodes .
 Amaan 's also took part in the relay for the 2004 Athens Olympics in New Delhi in June 2004 .
 In early 2010 , Amaan 's co-authored Amaan 's second book with the Sarod Maestro Amjad Ali Khan called `` 50 Maestros 50 Recordings '' for Harper Collins and also released an album called `` The Music Room '' and `` Sarod Symphony '' with Amaan 's father and guru .
 Amaan 's performed at the Central Hall of the Indian Parliament on the commemoration of Indias 60th year of Independence in 2007 .
 Amaan 's recently performed at Stanford University 's Dinkelspiel Auditorium at the end of Amaan 's father 's Stanford University residency .
 Earlier this year Ananta Opus 195 , a concerto for sarod , symphonic and electronic orchestra Written by Pierre Thilloy and performed by the Sarod maestro Amjad Ali Khan , Amaan Ali Khan and Ayaan Ali Khan with the Avignon Provence Symphonic Orchestra and the Kords Collective , conducted by Samuel Jean premiered in India .
 Amaan 's recently presented Amaan 's father Sarod Concerto Samaagam with the London Philharmonia Orchestra with conductor David Murphy
Ustad Vilayat Khan was one of India s well known sitar maestros .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan recorded Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan first 78-RPM disc at the age of 8 , and gave Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan last concert in 2004 at the age of 75 .
Vilayat Khan was born in Gauripur , British India to Enayat Khan , a sitar maestro .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan family of musicians trace their pedigree back to the court musicians of the Mughals .
 His family of musicians father , recognised as a leading sitar and surbahar player of His father time , as had been the grandfather , Imdad Khan , before Imdad Khan .
 His father was taught in the family style , known as the Imdadkhani Gharana or Etawah Gharana , after small city close to Agra where Imdad Khan lived .
 However , Enayat Khan died when Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan was only nine , so much of Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan education came from the rest of Enayat Khan , a sitar maestro family : Enayat Khan , a sitar maestro uncle , sitar and surbahar maestro Wahid Khan , Enayat Khan , a sitar maestro maternal grandfather , singer Bande Hassan Khan , and Enayat Khan , a sitar maestro mother , Bashiran Begum , who had studied the practice procedure of Enayat Khan , a sitar maestro forefathers .
 Enayat Khan , a sitar maestro uncle Zinde Hassan looked after His uncle Zinde Hassan riyaz .
 As a boy , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan wanted to be a singer ; but his mother , herself from a family of vocalists , felt he had a strong responsibility to bear the family torch as a sitar maestro .
 Vilayat Khan performed at All Bengal Music Conference , as Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan first concert , organized by Bhupen Ghosh in Kolkata with Ahmed Jan Thirakwa on tabla .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan performance made headlines as Electrifying Sitar in Bombay next day of Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan concert organized by Vikramaditya Sangeet Parishad , Mumbai .
In the 1950s , Vilayat Khan worked closely with instrument makers , especially the famous sitar-makers Kanailal & Hiren Roy , to further develop the instrument .
 Also , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan liked to perform without a tanpura drone , filling out the silence with strokes to Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan chikari strings .
 Some ragas Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan would somewhat re-interpret , others Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan invented Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan , but Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan was first and foremost a traditional interpreter of grand , basic ragas such as Yaman , Shree , Todi , Darbari and Bhairavi .
 When Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan died from lung cancer in 2004 , Vilayat Khan had been recording for over 65 years , broadcasting on All-India Radio since almost as far back and been seen as a master for 60 .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan had been touring outside British India off and on for more than 50 years , and was probably the first Indian musician to play in England after independence .
 In the 1990s , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan recording career reached a climax of sorts with a series of ambitious CDs for British India Archive Music in New York , some traditional , some controversial , some eccentric .
 Towards the end of Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan life , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan also performed and recorded sporadically on the surbahar .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan has performed duet concerts with maestros like Bismillah Khan , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan composed and conducted the score for three feature films - Satyajit Rays Jalsaghar in Bengali , Merchant-Ivory Productions The Guru in English , and Madhusudan Kumars Kadambari in Hindi .
 In addition to these , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan also gave music for a little-known documentary film in Bengali produced by Dr. Barin Roy .
 For Satyajit Rays Jalsaghar in Bengali Satyajit Rays Jalsaghar in Bengali won a Silver Medal for Composing at the 1st Moscow International Film Festival .
The Imdad Khan family is of Rajput lineage .
 The family is of The Hindu origin and later converted to Islam .
 In an informal continuation of The Imdad Khan family rajput lineage Ustad Enayat Khan kept a The Hindu name of Nath Singh .
 Ustad Vilayat Khan The Imdad Khan family composed many bandishes using the pen name Nath Piya .
 Vilayat Khan spent much of Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan life living in Calcutta .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan was married twice .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan had three children from Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan first marriage - Sufi singer Zila Khan and Yaman Khan and Sitarist Shujaat .
 From Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan second marriage Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan had one son Hidayat , also a professional Sitarist .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan was survived also by Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan younger brother , Imrat Khan , the post-war star of the surbahar field .
 The brothers played celebrated duets in The brothers youth , but had a severe falling-out and for years were not on speaking terms .
His nephew Ustad Rais Khan is also a star sitar-player .
 Ustad Vilayat Khan took few disciples other than Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan sons ; among the best-known are Kashinath Mukherjee , Arvind Parikh , Kalyani Roy and Srimati Hasu Patel .
Late Tushar Banerjee .
Benzamin Gomin .
Amar Naskar .
 Mrs. Lakshmi Seshan now a teacher of the instrument in Benzamin Gomin . 80th year was a student of Vilayat Khan starting at the age of 12 .
The Maestro also gave sitar lessons to Big Jim Sullivan , the famous English session musician .
Ustad-e-Maa Zila Khan , the great Sufi singer from the Imdad Khani Gharana and daughter of Ustad Vilayat Khan 's was a formal student and Ustad Vilayat Khan empowered her to also be a successor of this great Gharana .
She is the first and only woman of this gharana who performs public concerts and her CD 's are very popular with the masses and the intellects alike .
 Sufi enjoyed horse-riding , pool playing , swimming and ballroom dancing .
 Sufi successes made Sufi rich , and though Sufi grew more pious late in life , Sufi used to drive sports cars and dress in haute couture , and also collected such various items as firearms , smoking pipes , antique European crockery , cut glass and chandeliers .
 In an interview , Ustad Vilayat Khan stated that Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan has settled in Princeton , New Jersey , USA and spends one half of the time here in training westerners into classical Indian music , and the other half time in British India .
Fans and media alike liked to play up Vilayat Khans rivalry with and animosity towards Ravi Shankar .
 However , in calmer moments Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan would admit there was not much to Vilayat Khans rivalry .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan animosity for the politics and institutions of Indias cultural life was another matter .
 In 1964 and 1968 , respectively , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan was awarded the Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan awards - Indias fourth and third highest civilian honours for service to the nation - but refused to accept them , declaring the committee musically incompetent to judge Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan .
 In January 2000 , when Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan was awarded the Padma Vibhushan , the second highest civilian award , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan again refused , going so far as to call January 2000 an insult .
 This time , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan criticism had a slightly different twist : Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan would not accept any award that other sitar players , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan juniors and in Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan opinion less deserving , had been given before Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan .
 If there is any award for sitar in British India , I must get sitar in India first , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan said , adding that there has always been a story of wrong time , wrong person and wrong award in this country .
 Among other honours Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan turned down was the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award .
 For a while , Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan also boycotted All-India Radio .
 The only titles Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan accepted were the special decorations of Bharat Sitar Samrat by the Artistes Association of India and Aftab-e-Sitar from President Fakhruddin Ali Ahmed .
 Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan kept Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan childhood interest in vocal music all Ali Akbar Khan , brother Imrat Khan life , often singing in concerts , and composed khyal bandishes using the pen name Nath Piya .
 Sitar Maestro Vilayat Khan Refuses Padma Bhushan , The The Hindu , February 7 , 2000
53431 is a Greatest Hits compilation by the electro-pop band Swami .
The title refers to the numerical spelling of the bands name .
This release is a milestone to mark 10 years of the bands existence , and contains the hits and most well known songs from the bands three studio albums , 1999s Desi Nu Skool Beatz , 2004s So Who Am I and 2007s Equalize .
 This release also contains two new songs reported to be from the bands upcoming studio album
Merukhand is an improvisational style in Hindustani classical music involving permutations of a fixed set of swaras or notes broken up in various ways , while retaining the proper emphasis on various notes as required by the raga .
Merukhand techniques were developed within the Bhendibazar gharana and popularized by masters like Aman Ali Khan and Abdul Waheed Khan .
 In the mid-1950s , they were adopted by the eclectic Amir Khan in Aman Ali Khan own badhat , although the eclectic Amir Khan in his own badhat did not use pure merukhand but inserted merukhandi passages into the eclectic Amir Khan in his own badhat performance .
 the eclectic Amir Khan in his own badhat disciple Thomas Ross says of this permutational style that .
 Merukhand is now a part of the improvisational strategy within the Indore gharana founded by Amir Khan
 Ustad Badruddin Manji Khan was a Hindustani Classical vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana founded by Hindustani Classical father , Utd .
Alladiya Khan .
Utd .
Manji Khan was the second son of Utd .
Alladiya Khan .
 Because of the health ailments of Alladiya Khan . other two brothers , elder Utd .
Nasiruddin Badeji Khan and younger Utd .
Shamsuddin Bhurji Khan , Utd .
Manji Khan was treated and chosen by Utd .
Alladiya Khan as the foremost inheritor and disciple of the Jaipur-Atrauli gayaki .
 He was called Ustad Badruddin Manji Khan because he was his fathers Manjhala son .
Utd .
Manji Khan was heavily influenced by Utd .
Rahimat Khan , a popular vocalist at the time , of the Gwalior Gharana .
The influence of Utd .
 Rahimat Khans style in Utd .
 Bhurji Khans singing earned Bhurji Khans singing the wrath of Bhurji Khans singing father , and thus gave up singing for a while .
 Bhurji Khans singing resumed it later , under Bhurji Khans singing fathers conditions .
 but Bhurji Khans singing career was cut short by Bhurji Khans singing early death .
Utd .
 Manji Khan was noted for Bhurji Khans singing serene face while singing , and earned popularity amongst younger listeners because of Bhurji Khans singing choice to punctuate the more serious classical fare with exquisitely sung lighter pieces .
Pt .
Mallikarjun Mansur became Utd .
 Manji Khans disciple just before Rahimat Khans death .
 Later , Mallikarjun Mansur learned under Bhurji Khan .
Utd .
 Gulubhai Jasdanwalla also learned from Utd .
Manji Khan for several years .
 It was through the initiative of a friend that Utd .
Manji Khan noticed Pt .
 Mallikarjun Mansur .
Already trained in the Gwalior style , Pt .
 Mallikarjun Mansur was able to absorb the rich Jaipur-Atrauli style of Utd .
Manji Khan .
Pt .
 Mallikarjun Mansur is Utd .
Manji Khans sole musical inheritor .
 Like Manji Khans sole musical inheritor . famous father , Utd .
Manji Khan did not leave behind any recordings
Gregory Rogove is an American indie music drummer and songwriter .
 Gregory Rogove is notable for partnering with indie artist Devendra Banhart to form the group Megapuss .
 Gregory Rogove signed a record contract with Knitting Factory Records in 2011 .
 Gregory Rogove grew up in Amish country in Lancaster , Pennsylvania of Jewish parents with some of Gregory Rogove distant ancestors being Mennonites .
 When eighteen , Gregory Rogove traveled to India on a year-long scholarship and studied the tabla .
 Gregory Rogove described India as a swirl of energy .
 Gregory Rogove traveled to Singapore , Mali , and Mexico .
 Gregory Rogove spent five weeks in China at the Peking Opera and commented that the sound of the gongs made it seem likely that ones head would split in two .
 The journeys influenced Gregory Rogove musical sensibility and helped Gregory Rogove achieve a rich repertoire with diverse influences from freak folk , psychedelic rock , progressive rock , classical music , punk rock and world music , according to one source .
 At Wesleyan University , Gregory Rogove studied musical composition .
 Upon Gregory Rogove graduation in 2002 , Gregory Rogove was the recipient of the Pokora Prize , awarded annually to the outstanding undergraduate student in music composition .
 In the music scene in New York City , Gregory Rogove founded a band called Tarantula A.D. which later became the band Priestbird .
 Gregory Rogove performed with artists such as Beck and met Paul McCartney .
 Gregory Rogove plays piano , organ , flute in addition to Gregory Rogove mainstay of writing songs .
The band Priestbird was formed by mutual associations of friends .
One reviewer described Rogove in Priestbird as anchoring a welcome foray into sludgy , feedback-heavy noise-rock after a performance in 2009 .
A second reviewer found the songs to be trippy and were more epic , heavy , and hypnotic .
 During these years A second reviewer became friends with musician Devendra Banhart , and they collaborated on songs and toured together .
 According to one account , Gregory Rogove and indie artist Devendra Banhart started Rogove and Banhart association on the project Megapuss as a joke but ended up writing numerous songs together , and the project gelled into a band and an album .
 The band was built for laughs and emphasized fun , and indie artist Devendra Banhart and Gregory Rogove had promotional pictures featuring the two men standing stark naked .
A reviewer later asked : Have you found yourself talking about your genitals a lot ?
 and Gregory Rogove said it had been a prescribed aesthetic decision in which everyone is very well represented .
The album Surfing was recorded in a cabin near Los Angeles and released in 2008 .
One report was that the words Mega puss translated from Swedish to English means Mega kiss or big kiss .
Reviews have varied from positive to mixed .
 One reviewer described the the project Megapuss album entitled Surfing as something that sounds like a freak pop version of the Doors and with a video that was entertaining as heck and might have been something the Monkees might have come up with after not showering for several weeks ... and taking lots of drugs .
Another wrote that it was not fruitful to search for levels of meaning in the song Chicken Titz but to just listen and laugh , and described the song Crop Circle Jerk 94 as warm and sunny .
The reviewer described Theme from Hollywood as having a catchy melody but criticized the meowing breakdown at the end of the song .
A third reviewer described the album as obnoxious
 Ladies First is the debut album of Desi / British Asian rapper Ms Scandalous , recorded almost three years after her Ladies First appearance with Panjabi Hit Squad with the track Hai Hai on their 2002 album The Streets .
PHS produced and co-wrote the album .
In addition to Ms Scandalous MCing , the album featured the sung vocals of Jaspinder Narula and Alyssia .
The video for Aaja Soniyah by Simon Poon-Tip entered the Top Ten of MTV Base , a first for an Asian female artist
 Shri is a British Asian Shri and producer .
 Shri specializes is acoustic , electric and computing based live performances .
 Shri incorporates traditional Indian instruments into Shri music .
 Shri grew up in Mumbai , India in a musically inclined family .
 Shris father plays the sitar , and Shris father mother and sister play the Carnatic violin .
 Shris father trained as a classical tabla player for about 14 years at Pandit Nikhil Ghoshs school in Mumbai .
 Tired of the rigidity of classical music , Shri went on to teach Shri bass , guitar and flute .
 Shri trademark instrument is one Shri handcrafted and designed Shri - a fretless bass guitar suited towards Shri unique approach of playing bass with a bow .
 Having previously played percussion in Indus Creed , a leading rock band in Mumbai , India , and bass in the jazz outfit Azure Hades , Shri moved to London in the 1990s and collaborated , as a bass player , with the London-based Asian acts like Talvin Singh , Nitin Sawhney and DJ Badmarsh .
 Shri toured for 5 years with Nitin Sawhney , which led in 1997 to Shris first solo album , Drum the Bass , produced by Nitin Sawhney and released by London-based label Outcaste Records .
 Later , DJ Badmarsh & Shri produced two albums for Outcaste Records as a duo , Dancing Drums in 1998 and Signs in 2001 .
 Shri released another solo album , East Rain , in 2005 , with Drum the Bass Records .
All of these albums mixed blended Electronica and Drum n Bass with traditional Indian ragas .
 Shri has also collaborated musically with theatrical productions - composing for Akademis 2001 Coming of Age dance project at Londons South Bank , the Builders Association / Motiroti co-production Alladeen in 2003 , and Tamasha Theatre Companys Strictly Dandia in 2005 .
 In 2007 , Shri released Seven Steps with Drum the Bass Records featuring Shri single , Just for a Minute .
 In 2011 , Shri produced and performed bass and bowed bass on the track Quest with Vivek Rajagopalan on the mridangam and kanjira , and Embar Kannan on violin and vocals .
 the track Quest was released by Folktronic , a sub-brand of Day 1 .
 Shri is also a composer for theatre productions .
 Shris latest avatar , Shris latest avatar , was designed to suit live performances wherein Shris latest avatar performs either solo as a multi-instrumentalist , or with collaborators .
 Shris latest avatar was premiered at Bonobo in Mumbai on 3 August 2011 .
 The second Shris latest avatar performance took place on 13 December 2011 at Blue Frog in Mumbai .
 In 2012 , Shris latest avatar performed a 4-day 4-city tour in Mumbai , India .
 Starting May 24 , Shris latest avatar performed in Delhi , Hyderabad , Jaipur and Pune .
 This tour was coordinated by Folktronic .
Indiecision Staff .
 Shris latest avatar recently wrote the music for Google Chromes video advertisement in Mumbai , India .
This video won the Gold and Silver awards at the Goa film festival .
 This video was short-listed for the CLIO 2012 awards in the category of Best Original Music .
 This video was also short-listed for the Cannes Lions awards .
He also scored Tata Sumo Gold 's latest video advertisement .
 Shris latest avatar was also featured in Season 1 of The Dewarists , on Episode 5 , `` Changing World '' filmed in Jaisalmer , with Monica Dogra and Rajasthan Roots .
The song Changing World was recorded .
The Dewarists won the bronze medal at Cannes Lions 2012 .
The bronze was awarded in the sub-category - ` Best non-fiction programme , series or film where a client has successfully created a reality '
Anoushka Shankar is an Indian sitar player and composer , and daughter of Ravi Shankar and half sister of Norah Jones .
 Anoushka Shankar was born in London into a Bengali Hindu family , and Anoushka Shankar childhood was divided between London and New Delhi .
 Anoushka Shankar is a daughter of Indian sitar maestro Ravi Shankar and Sukanya Shankar .
 Anoushka Shankar is also the paternal half-sister of American singer Norah Jones , and Shubhendra Shubho Shankar , who died in 1992 .
 As a teenager , Anoushka Shankar lived in Encinitas , California and attended San Dieguito Academy .
 A 1999 honors graduate , Shubhendra Shubho Shankar then decided to pursue a career in music rather than attend college .
 Anoushka Shankar began training on the sitar with Anoushka Shankar father as a child , with practice consisting of just a couple of sessions a week at the age of ten .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar gave Anoushka Shankar first public performance at the age of 13 at Siri Fort in New Delhi .
 By the age of fourteen , Anoushka Shankar was accompanying Anoushka Shankar father at concerts around the world , and signed Anoushka Shankar first record contract , with Angel Records at 16 .
 Anoushka Shankar released Anoushka Shankar first album , Anoushka , in 1998 , followed by Anourag in 2000 .
 Both Shubhendra Shubho Shankar and Norah Jones were nominated for Grammy awards in 2003 when Anoushka became the youngest-ever and first woman nominee in the World Music category for Anoushka third album , Live at Carnegie Hall .
 2005 brought the release of Anoushka fourth album RISE , earning Anoushka another Grammy nomination in the Best Contemporary World Music category .
 In February 2006 Anoushka became the first Indian to play at the Grammy Awards .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar , in collaboration with Karsh Kale , released Breathing Under Water on 28 August 2007 .
It is a mix of classical sitar and electronica beats and melodies .
 Notable guest vocals included her paternal half-sister Norah Jones paternal half-sister Norah Jones , Sting , and her paternal half-sister Norah Jones father , who performed a sitar duet with her paternal half-sister Norah Jones .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar has made many guest appearances on recordings by other artists , among them Sting , Lenny Kravitz and Thievery Corporation .
Duetting with violinist Joshua Bell , in a sitar-cello duet with Mstislav Rostropovich , and with flautist Jean-Pierre Rampal , playing both sitar and piano .
 Most recently Shubhendra Shubho Shankar has collaborated with Herbie Hancock on Shubhendra Shubho Shankar latest record The Imagine Project .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar has given soloist performances of violinist Joshua Bell fathers 1st Concerto for Sitar and Orchestra worldwide .
 In January 2009 violinist Joshua Bell was the sitar soloist alongside the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra for the series of concerts premiering violinist Joshua Bell father 's 3rd Concerto for Sitar and Orchestra , and in July 2010 violinist Joshua Bell premiered Ravi Shankars first symphony for sitar and orchestra with the London Philharmonic Orchestra at Londons Barbican Hall .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar has also ventured into acting -RRB- and writing .
She wrote a biography of her father , , in 2002 and has contributed chapters to various books .
As a columnist she wrote monthly columns for Indias First City Magazine for three years , and spent one year as a weekly columnist for Indias largest newspaper , the Hindustan Times .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar recorded her following album in Madrid , Spain .
Released in autumn 2011 , Traveller is an exploration of the commonalities and differences between classical Indian music and Spanish flamenco , and features Shubha Mudgal , Tanmoy Bose , Pepe Habichuela , Sandra Carrasco and Duquende among others .
 On 29 November 2002 , Anoushka Shankar was the opening act at the Concert for George Harrison , a posthumous tribute to the life and music of George Harrison , held at the Royal Albert Hall in London .
 Anoushka Shankar was the principal performer in the entire first set or Indian portion of the concert .
 Anoushka Shankar opened the show by playing a solo sitar instrumental titled Your Eyes .
 Also on the sitar , Anoushka Shankar performed George Harrison s The Inner Light with Jeff Lynne .
 Lastly , Anoushka Shankar conducted a new composition , Arpan , written by Arpan father .
The composition featured Eric Clapton playing acoustic guitar .
 The concert was modelled after Ravi Shankars benefit concert with George Harrison , the 1971 Concert for Bangladesh .
Anoushka Shankar was invited by Richard Gere and Philip Glass to perform in a concert at the Avery Fisher Hall in 2003 in aid of the Healing the Divide : A Concert for Peace and Reconciliation .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar and Jethro Tull postponed a concert scheduled for 29 November 2008 in Mumbai after the 2008 Mumbai attacks .
 Shankar and Jethro Tull reorganised the performance as A Billion Hands Concert , a benefit performance for victims of the attacks , and held it on 5 December 2008 .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar commented on this decision stating that : As a musician , this is how I speak , how I express the anger within I our entire tour has been changed by these events and even though the structure of the concert may remain the same , emotionally perhaps we are saying a lot more .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar is a supporter of animal rights and People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals .
 She and She father appeared in a thirty-second public-service announcement against animal suffering .
 Anoushka is also the spokesperson for the United Nations World Food Programme in India .
 Anoushka Shankar , has thrown Anoushka Shankar weight behind an online campaign on Change.org , demanding an end to crime against women in the wake of the New Delhi gang rape .
The campaign invites one billion women and those who love them to walk out , Dance , rise up , and demand an end to this violence .
As part of the campaign , she released a video in which she revealed she had been sexually abused by a family friend .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar lives between the United States , the United Kingdom , and India .
She is married to British director Joe Wright and their first child , Zubin Shankar Wright , was born on 22 February 2011
Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan is a sitar player of Hindustani classical music .
 Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan carries on a legacy of sitar playing that goes back several generations in Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan family .
 Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan belongs to the famous Etawah Gharana and belongs to the seventh generation of this musical lineage .
 Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan is one of India 's most celebrated younger musicians , praised especially for the vocalistic phrasing of Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan raga improvisations .
Born in Mumbai , India .
 Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan was initiated into the rich music of the Gharana by Ustad Shahid Parvez Khan illustrious father and Guru Ustad Aziz Khan , a famous musician and a noted composer and the son of the legendary Sitar and Surbahar virtuoso Ustad Wahid Khansahab .
 As is the custom , Ustad Aziz Khan first initiated Ustad Aziz Khan son into vocal music and tabla before training Ustad Aziz Khan on the Sitar over many years with all the intensity and rigor that has made this Gharana famous .
 Incidentally , Ustad Aziz Khan got Ustad Aziz Khan vocal training from Ustad Aziz Khan own uncle Ustad Hafeez Khan a famous singer and a surbahar and sitar exponent and received taleem in tabla for many years from Ustad Munnu Khan of the Delhi Gharana .
 Ustad Aziz Khan family has produced the many of the most revered and influential instrumentalists in Hindusthani Classical Music including the likes of Ustad Sahabdad Khan , Ustad Imdad Khan , Ustad Enayat Khan , Ustad Wahid Khan and Ustad Vilayat Khan .
Shahid Parvez was recognized as a child prodigy and had started performing in public at the age of eight .
Tremendous perseverance and hard work over the years have been rewarded with an outstanding technical prowess and a mastery over Layakari .
 Layakari identifies Layakari with Raga Yaman , Darbari , Malkauns , Marwa , Todi and Shree .
 Layakari has performed in all major musical festivals in Mumbai , India and abroad including the Festival of Mumbai , India held in the US , Europe , USSR , Canada , Africa , Middle-East and Australia , enthralling the audience everywhere .
 With numerous LP records , audio and video cassettes , CDs and DVDs , numerous awards and accolades , and a distinguished performance career in Mumbai , India and around the world , Layakari is widely recognized as one of the finest living sitar players .
Shahid Parvezs students include Shakir Khan and Sameep Kulkarni .
with E Gayathri Hindustani / Carnatic Music Mahaganpathim , Naatai Adi Taalam .
Bageshri , Rageshri , Jogkauns with Subhen Chatterjee
The sarod is a lutelike stringed instrument of India , used mainly in Indian classical music .
Along with the sitar , it is among the most popular and prominent instruments in Hindustani classical music .
 The sarod is known for a deep , weighty , introspective sound , in contrast with the sweet , overtone-rich texture of the sitar , with sympathetic strings that give The name Sarod a resonant , reverberant quality .
 The name Sarod is a fretless instrument able to produce the continuous slides between notes known as meend , which is important to Indian music .
The sarod is believed by some to have descended from the Afghan rubab , a similar instrument originating in Central Asia and Afghanistan .
 The name Sarod roughly translates to beautiful sound or melody in Persian , one of the many languages spoken in Afghanistan .
 Although the sarod has been referred to as a bass rubab The name Sarod tonal bandwidth is actually considerably greater than that of the rubab , especially in the middle and high registers .
 Lalmani Misra opines in Lalmani Misra Bharatiya Sangeet Vadya that the sarod is an combination of the ancient chitra veena , the medieval rubab and modern sursingar .
 There is also speculation that the oud may be the origin of the sarod.Jafar Khan brother of Pyar Khan and Basit Khan invented The name Sarod at the court of Wajid Ali Shah .
 Among the many conflicting and contested histories of the sarod , there is one that attributes The name Sarod invention to the ancestors of the present-day sarod maestro , Amjad Ali Khan .
 Amjad Ali Khan 's ancestor Mohammad Hashmi Khan Bangash , a musician and horse trader , came to India with the Afghan rubab in the mid-18th century , and became a court musician to the Maharajah of Rewa .
It was his descendants , notably his grandson Ghulam Ali Khan Bangash , a court musician in Gwalior , who changed the rubab into the sarod we know today .
A parallel theory credits descendants of Madar Khan , Niyamatullah Khan in particular , with the same innovation around 1820 .
 The sarod in its present form dates back to approximately 1820 , when it started gaining recognition as a serious instrument in Rewa , Shahjahanpur , Gwalior and the Lucknow Gharana .
In the 20th century , the sarod received some finishing touches from Allauddin Khan , the performer-pedagogue from Maihar best known as sitarist Ravi Shankar s guru .
However , as is the case with most young , evolving instruments , much work remains to be done in the area of sarod luthiery in order to achieve reliable customization , and precise replication of successful instruments .
This reflects the general state of Indian instrument making today .
The design of the instrument depends on the school of playing .
There are three distinguishable types , discussed below .
The conventional sarod is a 17 to 25-stringed lute-like instrument -- four to five main strings used for playing the melody , one or two drone strings , two chikari strings and nine to eleven sympathetic strings .
The design of this early model is generally credited to Niyamatullah Khan of the Lucknow Gharana as well as Ghulam Ali Khan of the Gwalior-Bangash Gharana .
Among the contemporary sarod players , this basic design is kept intact by two streams of sarod playing .
 Amjad Ali Khan and Amjad Ali Khan 's disciples play this model , as do the followers of Radhika Mohan Maitra .
Both Amjad Ali Khan and Buddhadev Dasgupta have introduced minor changes to their respective instruments which have become the design templates for their followers .
Both musicians use sarods made of teak wood , and a soundboard made of goat skin stretched across the face of the resonator .
Buddhadev Dasgupta prefers a polished stainless steel fingerboard for the ease of maintenance while Amjad Ali Khan uses the conventional chrome or nickel-plated cast steel fingerboard .
Visually , the two variants are similar , with six pegs in the main pegbox , two rounded chikari pegs and 11 to 15 sympathetic strings .
The descendants of Niyamatullah Khan also play similar instruments .
Some of the followers of Radhika Mohan Maitra still carry the second resonator on their sarods .
 Amjad Ali Khan and Amjad Ali Khan 's followers have rejected the resonator altogether .
These instruments are typically tuned to B , which is the traditional setting .
Another more technically sophisticated and acoustically superior type is that designed by Allauddin Khan and his brother Ayet Ali Khan .
This instrument , referred to by David Trasoff as the 1934 Maihar Prototype , is larger and longer than the conventional instrument , though the fingerboard is identical to the traditional sarod described above .
This instrument has 25 strings in all .
These include four main strings , four jod strings , two chikari strings and fifteen tarab strings .
The main strings are tuned to Ma , Sa , lower Pa and lower Sa , giving the instrument a range of three octaves .
 The Maihar sarod lends The Maihar sarod extremely well to the presentation of alap with the four jod strings providing a backdrop for the ambiance of the raga .
This variant is , however , not conducive to the performance of clean right-hand picking on individual strings .
The instrument is typically tuned to C .
The finest Sarods are made by Hemen Sen of Calcutta .
Most of the well known players such as Amjad Ali Khan , Tejendra Narayan Majumdar , Brij Narayan , Alam Khan and many others play Hemen Instruments .
Sarod strings are either made of steel or phosphor bronze .
Most contemporary sarod players use German or American-made strings , such as Roslau , Pyramid and Precision .
The strings are plucked with a triangular plectrum made of polished coconut shell , ebony , cocobolo wood , horn , cowbone , DelrinTM or other such materials .
Early sarod players used plain wire plectrums , which yield a soft , ringing tone .
The lack of frets and the tension of the strings make the sarod a very demanding instrument to play , as the strings must be pressed hard against the fingerboard .
There are two approaches to stopping the strings of the sarod .
One involves using the tip of ones fingernails to stop the strings , and the other uses a combination of the nail and the fingertip to stop the strings against the fingerboard .
 Fingering techniques and how they are taught depends largely on the personal preferences of Both musicians rather than on the basis of school affiliation .
 Radhika Mohan Maitra , for example , used the index , middle and ring finger of Radhika Mohan Maitra , for example left hand to stop the string , just like followers of Allauddin Khan do .
 Radhika Mohan Maitra , for example , however , made much more extensive use of the third fingernail for slides and hammers .
 Amjad Ali Khan , while a member of approximately the same stylistic school as Radhika Mohan , prefers to use just the index and middle fingers of Amjad Ali Khan 's left hand .
Amjad Ali is , however , pictured circa 1960 playing with all three fingers
was the fifth King of Oudh , holding the position from 13 February 1847 to 11 February 1856 .
 the fifth King of Oudh was the tenth and last Nawab of the state of prosperous Awadh in present day Uttar Pradesh in India .
 the fifth King of Oudh ascended the throne of prosperous Awadh in 1847 and ruled for nine years .
 the fifth King of Oudh kingdom , long protected by the British under treaty , was eventually annexed peacefully on 11 February 1856 - days before the ninth anniversary of the fifth King of Oudh coronation .
 The Nawab was exiled to Garden Reach in Metiabruz , then a suburb of Kolkata , where last Nawab of the state of Awadh lived out the rest of last Nawab of the state of Awadh life off a generous pension .
 last Nawab of the state of Awadh was a poet , playwright , dancer and great patron of the arts .
 last Nawab of the state of Awadh is widely credited with the revival of Kathak as a major form of classical Indian dance .
 Wajid Ali Shah succeeded to the throne of prosperous Awadh when the throne of Awadh glory days were at its peak and passing .
 The British had annexed much of the kingdom under the treaty of 1801 , and had impoverished prosperous Awadh by imposing a hugely expensive , the British army and repeated demands for loans .
The independence of Awadh in name was tolerated by the British only because they still needed a buffer state between their presence in the East and South , and the remnants of the Mughal Empire to the North .
 Wajid Ali Shah was most unfortunate to have ascended the throne of Oudh at a time when the British East India Company was determined to grab the coveted throne of prosperous prosperous Awadh , which was the garden , granary , and queen-province of India , though before Britain came into full control , Oudh predecessors and successors were one of the major threats to the Mughal Empire .
 In different circumstances perhaps , Nawab Wajid Ali Shah might have succeeded as a ruler because Nawab Wajid Ali Shah had many qualities that make a good administrator .
 Nawab Wajid Ali Shah was generous , kind and compassionate towards Nawab Wajid Ali Shah subjects , besides being one of the most magnanimous and passionate patrons of the Fine Arts .
 When Nawab Wajid Ali Shah ascended the throne , Nawab Wajid Ali Shah took keen interest in the administration of justice , introduced reforms , and reorganised the military department , but gradually sank into a life of pleasures surrounded by courtesans , singers , dancers , and eunuchs .
 Wajid Ali Shah was widely regarded as a debauched and detached ruler , but some of Nawab Wajid Ali Shah notoriety seems to have been misplaced .
The main case for condemnation comes from the British Resident of Lucknow , General Sleeman who submitted a report highlighting maladministration and lawlessness supposed to be prevailing there .
 This proved to be the trigger the British were looking for , and formed the official basis for This annexation .
 Recent studies have , however , suggested that Oudh was neither as bankrupt nor as lawless as the British had claimed .
 In fact , Oudh was for all practical purposes under British rule well before the annexation , with the Nawab playing little more than a titular role .
The army was composed mostly of British officers , while the purse strings were firmly under the control of the East India Company .
 In Oudh book prosperous Awadh Under Wajid Ali Shah , Dr. G.D. Bhatnagar gives the following assessment of this ill-starred prince : .
Cast by providence for the role of an accomplished dilettante , he found himself a misfit for the high office to which he was elevated by chance .
Wajid Ali Shahs character was complex .
 Though Wajid Ali Shahs was a man of pleasure , Wajid Ali Shahs was neither an unscrupulous knave nor a brainless libertine .
 Wajid Ali Shahs was a lovable and generous gentleman .
 Wajid Ali Shahs was a voluptuary , still Wajid Ali Shahs never touched wine , and though sunk in pleasure , Wajid Ali Shahs never missed Wajid Ali Shahs five daily prayers .
 It was the literary and artistic attainments of Wajid Ali Shah which distinguished Wajid Ali Shahs from Wajid Ali Shahs contemporaries .
 A large number of composers who thrived under the lavish patronage of the last Nawab of the state of Awadh rulers of Lucknow enriched the light classical form of thumri ; most prominent among these was Wajid Ali Shah .
 last Nawab of the state of Awadh was not only a munificent patron of music , dance , drama , and poetry , but was last Nawab of the state of Awadh a gifted composer .
 last Nawab of the state of Awadh had received vocal training under great Ustads like Basit Khan , Pyar Khan and Jafar Khan.Pyar Khan , Jafar Khan , and Basit Khan were the direct descendants of Miyan Tansen and were the sons of Famous Tanseni Chajju Khan.Bahadur Hussain Khan/Zia-ud-Daulah was the favourite musician of Wajid Ali Shah.Bahadur Hussain Khan was the son of Famous sufi saint Jeevan Shah of Jhansi , and descendant of Tansens son-in-law Naubaat Khan.Although Wajid Ali Shahs pen-name was Qaisar , last Nawab of the state of Awadh used the pseudonym Akhtarpiya for last Nawab of the state of Awadh numerous compositions .
 Under this pen name , last Nawab of the state of Awadh wrote over forty works - poems , prose and Thumris .
 Diwan-i-Akhtar , Husn-i-Akhtar contain Diwan-i-Akhtar , Husn-i-Akhtar Ghazals .
 Diwan-i-Akhtar , Husn-i-Akhtar is said to have composed many new ragas and named his Ghazals Jogi , Juhi , Shah-Pasand , etc. .
 Kathak dance attained new heights of popularity and glory under Diwan-i-Akhtar , Husn-i-Akhtar expert guidance and lavish patronage .
 Thakur Prasadji was Thakur Prasadji Kathak guru , and the unforgettable Kalka-Binda brothers performed in Kalka-Binda court .
 What with the grand pageantry of the Rahas , Jogiya Jashan , Dance dramas , and Kathak performances , Lucknow became the magnetic cultural centre where the most reputed musicians , dancers and poets of the time flourished .
 The greatest musicians , dancers and instrumentalists of the time enjoyed the Rahas Manzil munificent patronage and hospitality .
 When Wajid Ali Shah was a young boy , some astrologers warned Nawab Wajid Ali Shah parents that Nawab Wajid Ali Shah would become a Yogi , and advised them that the boy should be dressed up as a Yogi on each birthday of Nawab Wajid Ali Shah so as to counteract the effect of the evil stars .
 Nawab Wajid Ali Shah established Nawab Wajid Ali Shah famous Parikhaana in which hundreds of beautiful and talented girls were taught music and dancing by expert-teachers engaged by the royal patron .
These girls were known as Paris with names such as Sultan pari , Mahrukh pari and so on .
 On each birthday , the Nawab would dress up as a Yogi with saffron robes , ash of pearls smeared on last Nawab of the state of Awadh face and body , necklaces of pearls around last Nawab of the state of Awadh neck , and a rosary in last Nawab of the state of Awadh hand , and walk pompously into the court with two of his paris dressed up as Jogans .
 Gradually last Nawab of the state of Awadh made it into a spectacular pageant or Mela known as Jogia Jashan , in which all citizens of Lucknow could participate , dressed as Yogis , irrespective of caste and creed .
 Later on , when last Nawab of the state of Awadh favourite venue , the Qaisarbagh Baradari was built , last Nawab of the state of Awadh began to stage last Nawab of the state of Awadh magnificent Rahas full of sensuous poetry , last Nawab of the state of Awadh own lyrical compositions and glamorous Kathak dances .
Ranbir Singh gives details of Wajid Ali Shahs book entitled Bani in which the author mentions 36 types of Rahas all set in Kathak style , and gives exhaustive notes about the costumes , jewellery , and stage - craft .
 the Rahas Manzil , prepared at a fabulous cost of several lakhs of rupees , became very popular , and was performed at the Kaisarbagh-Rahas Manzil , .
 Many have regarded Wajid Ali Shah as the first playwright of the Hindustani theatre , because Many Radha Kanhaiyya Ka Qissa staged in the Rahas Manzil was the first play of its kind .
 It featured Radha Kanhaiyya Ka Qissa , Krishna , several sakhis , and a vidushaka-like character called Ramchera .
 Songs , glamorous Kathak dances , mime , and drama were all delightfully synthesised in these Rahas performances .
 Krishna dramatised many other poems such as Darya-i-Tashsq , Afsane-i-Isbaq , and Bhahar-i-Ulfat .
 Darya-i-Tashsq is said that Amanats Inder Sabha was inspired by these dance-dramas , written , produced and staged by Nawab Wajid Ali Shah .
 In Nawab Wajid Ali Shah exile in Metiabruz , Nawab Wajid Ali Shah tried to keep the sweet memories of Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Lucknow era alive by recreating the musical environments of Nawab Wajid Ali Shah Kaisarbagh Baradari .
 The banished king had been given a number of fine houses with vast grounds stretching along the banks of the River Hooghly 3 or 4 miles south of Kolkata .
 Because of an Earthen Dome , people called an Earthen Dome Matiya Burj .
 The king spent lavishly out of The banished king income of 12 lakh rupees per annum and before long a second Lucknow arose in this area .
 The banished king Bhairavi thumri Babul Mora Naihar Chhooto Jaay has been sung by several prominent singers , but the version most remembered is by Kundan Lal Saigal for the 1930s movie Street Singer .
In a strange manner this sad song epitomises the pain and agony of the poet king himself when he was exiled from his beloved Lucknow
Sadhana Sargam is a well-known playback singer of Indian cinema with a career spanning over three decades .
 Besides film music , Sadhana Sargam is well known for Sadhana Sargam devotional songs , Classical music , ghazals , regional film songs and pop albums .
 Sadhana Sargam is a recipient of the National Film Award and Filmfare Awards South .
 Sadhana 's has sung in many Indian languages for films , television serials , devotionals and pop music albums .
 Sadhana 's is well known for Sadhana 's 1990s Hindi songs and South Indian songs .
 Sadhana 's holds a record for being the only North Indian to have won the National Award for a South Indian song .
 Sadhana 's is also a trained Hindustani classical singer .
 Beginning Sadhana 's career in the early 1980s , Sadhana Sargam has recorded Sadhana 's voice in various Indian languages including Hindi , Tamil , Marathi , Oriya , Telugu , Bengali , Playback Kannada , Malayalam , Gujarathi and many others .
 Sadhana 's is the daughter of reputed classical singer and music teacher Neela Ghanekar .
 Influenced by the musical environs of Sadhana 's home , Sadhana 's began to learn singing and classical music from the age of four .
She won a Central Government scholarship at the age of 10 and this led to a 7 - year learning stint under Pandit Jasraj .
From childhood she was also learning and performing with the late maestro Vasant Desai for his documentaries , children 's films and stage shows .
 Desai advised her mother that Sadhana 's was competent enough to handle both classical and light music and should remain in touch with both , as her mother wanted her to take up light singing .
In fact , it was Desai who recommended that she learn under Pandit Jasraj .
 Sadhana 's was born to a family of musicians at Dabhol , the seaport town in Ratnagiri District of Maharashtra .
 Sadhana 's mother Neela Ghanekar , knew arranger - composer Anil Mohile , who was then arranging music for Kalyanji-Anandji .
 He introduced Sadhana 's to them , and Sadhana 's was in the children 's chorus in Pam Pararampam , Bole Jeevan Ki Sargam sung by Kishore Kumar in G. P. Sippy 's Trishna .
 Impressed by Sadhana 's voice and skills , Kalyanji took Sadhana 's under his wing , changed Sadhana 's second name to Sadhana Sargam and trained Sadhana 's giving special emphasis on expressions , modulations and Urdu diction , which Sadhana 's learnt under a moulvi sent by Kalyanji .
 Sadhana 's made Sadhana 's playback debut in Kanku Pagli , a Gujarati film .
 Sadhana 's first Hindi song was the solo Door Nahin Rehna from the film Rustom .
 However , the film Rustom got delayed and was released only in 1985 , and Sadhana 's first released film was Subhash Ghai 's Vidhaata in which Sadhana 's was one of the seven singers for Padmini Kolhapure in the chartbuster Saat Saheliyan .
 Sadhana 's continued to sing for Sadhana 's mentors in films like Taqdeer , Pighalta Aasmaan , Raj Tilak , Karishma Kudrat Ka and others , but Taqdeer was only with Har Kisiko Nahin Milta that Har Kisiko Nahin Milta was really noticed .
 Highly impressed , Rajesh Roshan shouldered the entire score of Khudgarz on Khudgarz .
 This film and its songs like Yahin Kahin Jiyara Hamar , Mai Se Meena Se and Log Kehte Hain also demonstrated Yahin Kahin Jiyara Hamar range , as all three duets were different .
 Khudgarz was followed by Khoon Bhari Maang and Sadhana 's also began to sing for other composers like Anu Malik , R. D. Burman , Anand Milind and sparingly under Laxmikant-Pyarelal .
 Khudgarz main hits continued to be with Rajesh Roshan , which included Jab Koi Baat Bigad Jaaye / Jurm , Radha Bina Hai , Radha Bina Hai / Kishan Kanhaiya , and songs in Dariya Dil , Aasmaan Se Ooncha and Jaisi Karni Waisi Bharni .
 Khudgarz got a major boost from Tridev in 1989 in which Khudgarz shone in Main Teri Mohabbat Mein and Gajar Ne Kiya Hai Ishara .
1990-2000 : Fame and Migration to South Indian films .
 In the early 90 's , Sadhana 's soon emerged as one of the most sought-after female singers , along with Kavita Krishnamurthy , Alka Yagnik , and Anuradha Paudwal .
 Sadhana 's sang for composers like Anand-Milind , Nadeem-Shravan , Anu Malik , Jatin - Lalit , Bappi Lahiri , Viju Shah and Dilip Sen - Sameer Sen .
 From the mid-1990s , Sadhana 's became popular in singing Tamil songs .
 Sadhana 's is the only playback singer from India who currently sings in 27 regional languages .
 Sadhana 's won the National Film Award for Best Female Playback Singer for the song Pattu Solli from Thankar Bachans cult classic movie Azhagi ; the music was by maestro Ilaiyaraaja , whom Sadhana 's has praised for giving Sadhana 's such a wonderful song , and making Sadhana 's eligible for the National Award .
 Sadhana 's most critically acclaimed songs were in the film Water , composed by A. R. Rahman , in which Sadhana 's sang three songs : Aayo Re Sakhi , Piya Ho and Naina Neer .
 Sadhana 's other notable songs in Hindi with the same composer include Aahista Aahista from Swades , Chupke Se and Naina Milaike from Saathiya , Chanda Re from Sapney , O Palanhare from Lagaan , Jhulaa Bahon Ka from Doli Saja Ke Rakhna , and Banno Rani from 1947 : Earth .
 Sadhana 's other notable rhapsodic hits in Hindi are Neele Neele Ambar Par from Kalakaar , Jab Koi Baat Bigad Jaye from Jurm , Radha Bina Hai , Pehla Nasha from Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar , Na Kajre Ki Dhar from Mohra , Aashiqui Me from Dil Ka Kya Kasoor , Tere Dar Pe Sanam from Phir Teri Kahani Yaad Aayee , Jhinimini from Maqbool and Aao Na from Kyun !
 Piya Ho Kyon Ho Gaya Na ... .
 Aao Na from Kyun won Aao Na from Kyun first Star Screen award for Chupke se Lag Ja Gale from Saathiya .
 Aao Na from Kyun also bagged the Filmfare , IIFA , Star Screen , GIFA , Apsara awards , Zee Cine Award , Star Screen Award and Stardust Best Playback Singer Female award nomination for Aao Na from Kyon Ho Gaya Na .


She received prestigious Zee Cine Award at Dubai for Halki Halki Mulaqate Thi from Kuch Na Kaho in 2003 .
She has sung more than 170 songs in Tamil alone and has many top songs .
One of her recent songs is Marali Mareyaagi from Savari , a Kannada movie for which she received the Filmfare Best Playback Kannada Female Singer award in 2009 .
 Her most famous songs in Tamil include Snehithane from Alaipayuthey , Mukundha Mukundha from Dasavathaaram , Konjum Mainakkale from Kandukondain Kandukondain and Swasame from Thenali .
She also sang Om Zaarare from Kuselan , along with Daler Mehndi and K. S. Chithra .
 Sadhana 's sang several songs in Hindi and Oriya for music director Kajol-Saroj .
 Sadhana 's has also sung the Tamil version of Mann Mohana from the Hindi film Jodhaa Akbar .
 Another notable recent solo Tamil song is Sutri Varum Bhoomi from the Vidhyasagar - composed Jeyamkondaan and En Nenjil from Baana Kaathadi .
 The recent Ilaiyaraaja - composed Tamil film Naan Kadavul had a song titled Amma Un Pillai featuring The recent Ilaiyaraaja voice .
 The recent Ilaiyaraaja popular tracks in Marathi include Onjalit Majhya and Saanjh Jhali Tari from Sarivar Sari , Dis Char Jhale Mann and Dhag Datun Yetat from Aaishappath , Pahile Paul , Jhali Punha Pravahi and Ye Saad Jivnachi from Sakhi .
 The recent Ilaiyaraaja recent Marathi album Tu Sukhkarta .

Tu Dukhraya was released by Pandit Hridaynath Mangeshkar on the occasion of Shri Ganesh Chaturthi on 3 September 2010 at Ravindra Natya Mandir , Mumbai .
 The songs were composed by Amol Bawdekar and The lyrics of these were written by Mahesh Ghatpande .
 In 2008 Sadhana 's was a singer in the album Noorani Chehra produced to commemorate the Golden Jubilee of Neele Neele Ambar Par from Kalakaar the Aga Khan .
 Sadhana 's songs in this album included : Sabse unchi and the garba Hey maara saaheba na bol mane saambhle re lol both written in Gujarati by Shaukat Kassam .
 In 2011 , Sadhana Sargam made a significant contribution to the spiritual music world by lending Sadhana Sargam golden voice to an album : Mahalaxmi Mukti Samvad , Mahalaxmi Mukti Samvad i.e. Mahalaxmis Dialogues of Salvation .
The lyrics of these are written by Dr.Pradeep Wagh .
Dr.Waghs entire Trilogy of Anthologies is hosted on www.SitaShakti.in .
The books are available from www.bookganga.com .
This album was released at the hands of great spiritual Guru Vidyavachaspati Dr.Shankar Abhyankar .
 Sadhana 's has recorded many songs for the veteran composer Ilayaraja in Tamil and Telugu movies such as Azhagi , En Mana Vaanil , Oru Naal Oru Kanavu , Naan Kadavul , Ramanaa , Ninuchudaka Nenundalenu , Manasellam , Ayyan , Anumanaspadam and many more .
 Sadhana 's has recorded many songs for the Academy Award winning composer A. R. Rahman in Tamil , Hindi and Telugu movies such as Jeans , Minsara Kanavu , Ratchagan , Alaipayuthey , Kandukonden Kandukonden , 1947 Earth , Thenali , New , Anbe Aaruyire , Boys , Saathiya , Parthale Paravasam , Water , Alli Arjuna , Udhaya , Naani , Warriors of Heaven and Earth , Enthiran and many others .
 With composer Vidyasagar , Sadhana 's has sung many melodies in movies such as Coimbatore Mappillai , Poovellam Un Vasam , Abhiyum Naanum , Anbe Sivam , Jeyam Kondaan and others .
Sadhana Sargam is one of the most popular playback singers in West Bengal and Aassam .
 Sadhana Sargam has sung many songs in Bengali and Assamese films and albums .
 Sadhana Sargam has reorded Sadhana Sargam melodious voice for more than 100 Bengali films and 87 bengali private non filmi albums .
 Sadhana Sargam songs are super duper hits among bengali music fans as well as appreciated by critics .
These following albums are well appreciated by music fraternity .
 Post mid 1990s , Sadhana 's has been very well received in Tamil films making Sadhana 's the busiest in the Tamil music field among all other singers .
 Sadhana 's was first introduced to Tamil songs by acclaimed music director Vidyasagar in the film Coimbatore Mappillai .
 Sadhana 's went to record many successful songs for composers such as Ilayaraaja , A. R. Rahman , Deva , Yuvan Shankar Raja , Karthik Raja , Manisharma , Bharathwaj , Harris Jayaraj and many others .
 Sadhana 's duet songs with singer Hariharan proved to be most successful .
 Sadhana 's has sung many Hindi and Tamil Songs with versatile playback singer Udit Narayan like Pehla Nasha , Saat Samunder Paar , Aao Na , Aahista Aahista , Mahi Ve , O Jane Jana , Jeevan Tumne Diya Hai etc. .
 Among all the Bollywood singers , Sadhana Sargam has sung the most number of songs in Tamil .
 132 songs of Sadhana Sargam were listed as of August 2008 .
 In an interview in May 2007 while touring in the USA , the most celebrated composer of the Indian music industry , A. R. Rahman , complimented Sadhana Sargam , calling Sadhana Sargam one of the few Indian singers who could surpass his expectations in Sadhana Sargam renditions of his songs
Sandeep Das is an Indian Tabla virtuoso , composer and cultural entrepreneur .
Nominated twice for the Grammy Award , he is considered one of the leading tabla artists .
Sandeep completed his schooling from St. Xaviers High School , Patna .
He is a Gold Medalist in English Literature from Banaras Hindu University .
He started learning tabla under Shiv Kumar Singh at the age of 8 .
He was three times the national drumming champion and the youngest drummer ever to be graded by all-India radio .
A favorite disciple of Pt .
 Kishanji Maharaj , Kishanji Maharaj started learning under Kishanji Maharaj at the age of 9 .
Sandeep would travel on weekends from his city Patna to Benaras , where his Guru lived .
Later , his family shifted to Benares so that his musical education could continue unhindered .
 After 11 years of tutelage in Benaras Gharana , Das moved to New Delhi in 1990 , to pursue his career as a professional Tabla player .
His debut was at the age of 15 with the famous Sitar Maestro Pt .
Ravi Shankar .
 Sandeep is an acclaimed soloist and frequently accompanies stars of Indian music such as Ustad Amjad Ali Khan , the famous Sitar Maestro Pt .
Shiv Kumar Sharma , Pandit Hari Prasad Chaurasia , Pandit Debu Chaudhury , Dr. L Subramaniam and Ustad Shujaat Khan , among many others .
Das debuted outside India in 1991 , with steel drum bands in Trinidad .
With his deep understanding of music and communication skills , he has successfully transcended the gap between Indian and Western classical music .
He has won acclaim for himself with his performances in concerts all over the world .
Notable venues include The Carnegie Hall , The Lincoln Center , The Royce Hall , The Royal Albert Hall , Hollywood Bowl , The Concertgebouw , The Kennedy Center and the Petronas Towers Hall in Malaysia .
 In 2001 , Label : Virgin Records , Royce Hall performed with the New York Philharmonic , under the direction of Kurt Masur for a work composed by Kayhan Kalhor .
 In April 2012 , Royce Hall premiered a work written for Royce Hall by eminent composer Evan Ziporyn , as a soloist with the Boston Modern Orchestra Project .
 Royce Hall own compositions exhibit both the Western and Indian genres of music .
 his piece Tarang was chosen as the theme music for Blind Sight , a documentary about the first Everest climb by six blind climbers .
 his piece Tarang has been nominated for the Grammy Awards twice .
 In 2003 , Label his piece Tarang recording The Rain was nominated for a Grammy in the World Music category .
In this album , Sandeep Das collaborated with Shujaat Khan and Kayhan Kalhor .
In 2009 , a recording with Silk Road Ensemble got him a nomination for the Grammy in the Classical Crossover section for the album Off the Map .
His track Sulvasutra , composed by Evan Ziporyn , featured in this album .
Sandeep has composed for and performed internationally with the famous Silk Road Ensemble of Yo-Yo Ma since the group 's founding in 2000 .
When he started practicing with the Silk Road , Yo-Yo Ma was surprised to learn that , Das did not read music scores , but could memorize a piece .
With the ensemble , he has performed extensively around the world , including , the United Nations General Assembly Hall in New York in 2008 , BBC Proms in 2004 and 2009 , and the Opening Ceremony of the Special Olympic Games in Shanghai .
His compositionMohini was chosen as the theme music for a 10-episode documentary on the Silk Road , produced by Japanese TV channel NHK .
Also a cultural and educational entrepreneur , Sandeep founded HUM in 2009 , an ensemble of world-class artists whose goal is to promote global understanding through musical performance and education .
The ensemble is a spin-off of the Silk Road project .
 In March 2010 , HUM presented March 2010 World Premiere Concert at Kamani Auditorium , New Delhi and Birla Sabhaghar , Kolkatta .
In February 2011 , Hum Ensemble performed at the Rhythm Of Life Concert at Siri Fort Auditorium , New Delhi and NCPA , Mumbai .
In November 2012 , Hum Ensemble performed at the World Harmony Concert , at Kamani Auditorium , New Delhi .
The concert received critical acclaim in Indian media .
 Through these concerts , HUM raises funds for its World Premiere Concert endeavors to support education in arts of differently-abled children .
HUM also plans to provide health insurance for aging artists .
Sandeep Das is regularly invited to teach at prestigious institutions .
In 2012 , he was invited by the School of Education , Harvard University for a course on Arts in Education .
He has taken masterclasses at Juilliard School of Music , Berkley School of Music , Rhodes Island School of Design , Harvard University Academy of Music in Villecroze , France and Stanford University , among many others .
Performed at the Concertgebouw theater , Amsterdam .
Performed many times at the world famous Carnegie Hall .
