Paul Livingstone is an American sitarist , composer and multi-instrumentalist .
 Paul Livingstone is one of the few American disciples of Pt .
Ravi Shankar , also trained under Rajeev Taranath and Amiya Dasgupta all of the Senia Maihar Gharana .
 Paul Livingstone began Paul Livingstone study of sitar and tabla at age 15 living in India .
 Paul Livingstone has performed classical raga music with several of the leading tabla players of India and Nepal including Pt .
Swapan Chaudhuri , Abhijit Banerjee , Shashanka Bakshi and Hom Nath Upadhaya .
 Paul Livingstone also performs on fretless guitar and Requinto jarocho of Paul Livingstone own design .
 As a composer and director Paul Livingstone leads Paul Livingstone own Arohi Ensemble plays raga jazz chamber music as well as composing for film , TV , theater and dance Paul Livingstone has recorded and or toured with a number of popular artists such as Ozomatli , Alanis Morissette , Beck , HopPo !
, and Build an Ark. .
 Paul Livingstone has also performed in several music festivals around the world such as the World Festival of Sacred Music and Cumbe Tajin in Mexico Spain .
 Paul Livingstone was on the music faculty for 5 years at the California Institute of the Arts , founded the Sangeet School of World music in Los Angeles and has taught creative world music workshops in the US , Mexico Spain & India .
 Paul Livingstone also published Sitar Talim a workbook for learning sitar .
 Paul Livingstone has taught Indian and creative music for 3 years inner city teenage youth through the Music LA program with support from the Disney corporation , the City of Los Angeles , Cultural Affairs Department and Mayor Antonio Villaraigosa s office
Salil Bhatt is an Indian slide guitar player .
 Salil Bhatt created the musical instrument Satvik Veena .
 Salil Bhatt is the son of the fellow slide player and Grammy Award winner , Padmashree Pt .
Vishwa Mohan Bhatt .
, .
 Vishwa Mohan Bhatt . latest album , Slide to Freedom 2 - Make a Better World , was nominated for a Canadian Juno Award
The sarangi is a bowed , short-necked string instrument from South Asia which is used in Hindustani classical music .
It is said to most resemble the sound of the human voice - able to imitate vocal ornaments such as gamaks and meends .
There are different versions for the meaning and origins of sarangi The word sarangi could be a combination of two sanskrit words : saar and ang hence meaning the instrument that can summarize every style of music or playing .
 According to some musicians , the word Sarangi is a combination of two words ` seh ' and ` rangi ' corrupted as the word Sarangi .
The term seh-rangi represents the three melody strings .
 the word Sarangi is widely believed to mean `` a hundred colours '' indicating its adaptability to a wide range of musical styles , its flexible tunability , and its ability to produce a large palette of tonal colour and emotional nuance .
 the word Sarangi now enjoys the status of a solo classical instrument due to the single-handed efforts of Ram Narayan .
There is a variation to the fingering technique that was used by Ram Narayan .
It differs from the standard fingering as to when one shifts from the first finger to the second finger .
Well known sarangi players include Mamman Khan , Nathu Khan , Shakoor Khan , Sagiruddin Khan , Hanuman Prasad Mishra , Abdul Lateef Khan , Bundu Khan , Majid Khan , Basheer Khan , Mahmood Khan , Sabri Khan and Sultan Khan .
The repertoire of sarangi players is traditionally very closely related to vocal music .
Nevertheless , a concert with a solo sarangi as the main item will probably include a full-scale raag presentation with an extensive alap in increasing intensity and several compositions in increasing tempi called bandish .
As such , it is on a par with other instrumental styles such as for sitar , sarod , and bansuri .
 the word Sarangi music is often vocal music .
It is rare to find a sarangi player who does not know the words of many classical compositions .
The words are usually mentally present during performance , and performance almost always adheres to the conventions of vocal performance including the organisational structure , the types of elaboration , the tempo , the relationship between sound and silence , and the presentation of khyal and thumri compositions .
The vocal quality of sarangi is in a quite separate category from , for instance , the so-called gayaki-ang of sitar which attempts to imitate the nuances of khyal while overall conforming to the structures and usually keeping to the gat compositions of instrumental music .
The sarangi is also a traditional stringed musical instrument of Nepal , commonly played by the Gaine or Gandarbha ethnic group but the form and repertoire of sarangi is more towards the folk music as compared to the heavy and classical form of repertoire in India .
Carved from a single block of tun wood , the sarangi has a box-like shape with three hollow chambers : pet , chaati and magaj .
It is usually around long and around wide though it can vary as there are smaller as well as larger variant sarangis as well .
The lower resonance chamber or pet is covered with parchment made out of goat skin on which a strip of thick leather is placed around the waist which supports the elephant-shaped bridge that is made of camel or buffalo bone usually .
 The bridge in turn supports the huge pressure of approximately 35-37 sympathetic steel or brass strings and three main gut strings that pass through The bridge in turn .
The three main playing strings - the comparatively thicker gut strings - are bowed with a heavy horsehair bow and stopped not with the finger-tips but with the nails , cuticles and surrounding flesh .

The neck has ivory/bone platforms on which the fingers slide .
The remaining strings are resonance strings or tarabs , numbering up to around 35-37 , divided into 4 choirs having two sets of pegs , one on the right and one on the top .
On the inside is a chromatically tuned row of 15 tarabs and on the right a diatonic row of 9 tarabs each encompassing a full octave plus 1-3 extra notes above or below that .
Both these sets of tarabs pass from the main bridge to the right side set of pegs through small holes in the chaati supported by hollow ivory/bone beads .
 Between these inner tarabs and on the either side of the main playing The remaining strings lie two more sets of longer tarabs , with 5-6 strings on the right set and 6-7 strings on the left set .
They pass from the main bridge over to two small , flat and wide table like bridges through the additional bridge towards the second peg set on top of the instrument .
These are tuned to the important tones of the raga .
A properly tuned sarangi will hum and cry and will sound like melodious meowing , with tones played on any of the main strings eliciting echo-like resonances .
A few sarangis use strings manufactured from the intestines of goats -- these harken back to the days when rich musicians could afford such strings .
Three historic sarangi from The Metropolitan Museum of Art
Abhay Rustum Sopori is a Kashmiri Indian instrumentalist , composer & conductor of musical performances .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori is a player of santoor , an ancient stringed musical instrument native to Kashmir Valley .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori hails from Srinagar in Kashmir Valley and traces Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori lineage to ancient Santoor experts .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori belongs to the Sufiana gharana of Indian classical music .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori family has played santoor for over seven generations .
He is the son of Padma Shri winner Bhajan Sopori & the grandson of Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori , from whom he has learned Santoor in the traditional guru-shishya parampara .
 Abhay Sopori is credited for creating a new generation of music lovers across the country , bringing more recognition to the music , art and culture of the state of the Jammu & Kashmir Valley .
 A unique quality of Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori performances is that Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori sings along with Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori instrumental renderings .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori is known for Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori energetic performances , which involve rhythmic and melodic patterns .
 Associated with Spicmacay , Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori continues Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori research in music studies .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori efforts to promote music and musicians includes Haft Rang which consists of an ensemble of 80 folk musicians .
The troupe consists of lesser known musicians that were earlier lost in ignominy .
 The troupe includes both educated musicians who can read notes as well as illiterate musicians who have a keen sense of music .
 Abhay Rustum Sopori won the first prize in state music competition when Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori was 10 years old .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori started Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori musical career in 1997 from Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori first concert in New Delhi .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori has also learned Western Classical Music .
 Abhay Rustum Sopori has around thirty albums and releases , and Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori has given performances around the world .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori performances abroad include those in the USA , Japan , Korea , Malaysia , Singapore , Thailand , among other nations .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori has also played the signature tune for Indian news channel Aaj Tak .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori co-conducted Kashmiri Musicians with Zubin Mehta , conductor of Bavarian State Orchestra in the Shalimar Gardens of Srinagar in Kashmir Valley , Jammu & Kashmir , India on September 7 , 2013 .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori sopori has composed tunes for serials like - Tabla ka Itihaas , Guldasta , Do sheron ki kahani & Kabir bani amongst others .
Haft Rang , his instrumental orchestral ensemble which combines instruments of Kashmir with other Indian , as well as Western instruments , is a forty member ensemble designed to bring out the colour of each percussion instrument .
 The ensemble was performed at the the Jammu and Kashmir Valley festival at the Indira Gandhi National center for arts in New Delhi .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori has also composed music for documentaries .
Abhay Sopori won the Ustaad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puruskar in 2006 .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori was also awareded the the Jammu and Kashmir Valley state award in 2011 in recognition for Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori contributions in the field of music .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori was the youngest ever recipient of the award .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori other awards include National Dogri award , Bharat shiromani award , Ma Sharika Samman , Sangeet Bhushan Award , Kalawant Samman , Glory of India on September 7 , 2013 award amongst others .
 Santoor player Pandit S N Sopori was conferred with the Juenjo Korean international heritage award in 2005
Abdul Wahid Khan was an Indian classical singer , from the Kirana gharana .
 Abdul Wahid Khan initially learned vocal and sarangi from Abdul Wahid Khan father , Abdul Majid Khan .
 Around age 12 Abdul Wahid Khan moved to Kolhapur to learn from Haider Baksh Khan , a disciple of Bande Ali Khan .
 Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan founded the Kirana gharana musical family with Abdul Karim Khan .
Abdul Karim had married Abdul Wahid Khans sister , Gafooran Bibi .
 The relationship between Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan and Abdul Karim later soured when Abdul Karim neglected Gafooran Bibi and married Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan student , Tarabai Mane .
 Abdul Wahid Khans hearing was deficient and Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan was sometimes referred to as Behre Wahid Khan .
Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan was born in 1946 .
 Hafizullahs uncles trained Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan in music , and Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan became an accomplished sarangi player .
 Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan forbade recordings of Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan performances to avoid imitation by other singers .
Only three of his performances survived , recordings of the ragas Patdip , Multani , and Darbari Kanada , accompanied by Ram Narayan on tambura and Chatur Lal on tabla .
 Patdip , Multani , and Darbari Kanada were preserved by music producer Jivan Lal Mattoo , who secretly recorded a radio broadcast in 1947 , a few days before Jivan Lal Mattoo death , to document Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan style .
Abdul Wahid Khansahib died in 1949 in Lahore .
A number of Wahid Khans students became renowned musicians .
 They included Sureshbabu Mane , Hirabai Badodekar , Begum Akhtar , Saraswatibai Rane , Pran Nath , Ram Narayan , Shakoor Khan , Pandit Jaichand Bhatt , Hafizull Khan Sureshbabu Mane Son and Mohammed Rafi .
 Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan influenced Amir Khan .
 Abdul Wahid Khan and Abdul Karim Khan had started evolving the vilambit khyal and their work inspired Amir Khan to develop Wahid Khans son Hafizullah Khan trademark ati vilambit singing
Lewis Brian Hopkins Jones was the founder and original bandleader of the Rolling Stones .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones was a multi-instrumentalist , with future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones main instruments being the guitar , the harmonica and the keyboards .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones innovative use of traditional or folk instruments , such as the sitar and marimba , was integral to the changing sound of the band .
 Although future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones was originally the leader of the group , Joness fellow band members Mick Jagger and Keith Richards soon overshadowed future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones , especially after they became a successful songwriting team .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones developed a serious drug problem over the years and future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones role in the band steadily diminished .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones was asked to leave the Rolling Stones in June 1969 and guitarist Mick Taylor took 20-year-old guitarist Mick Taylor place in the group .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones died less than a month later by drowning in the swimming pool at future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones home on Cotchford Farm in Hartfield , East Sussex .
 Original Rolling Stones bassist Bill Wyman said of future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones , He formed the band .
He chose the members .
He named the band .
He chose the music we played .
He got us gigs .
... Very influential , very important , and then slowly lost it -- highly intelligent -- and just kind of wasted it and blew it all away .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones was born in the Park Nursing Home in Cheltenham , Gloucestershire , on 28 February 1942 .
 An attack of croup at the age of four left future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones with asthma , which lasted for the rest of future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones life .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones middle-class parents , Lewis Blount Jones and Louisa Beatrice Jones were of Welsh descent .
 Julian Brian had two sisters : Pamela , who was born on 3 October 1943 and who died on 14 October 1945 of leukaemia ; and Barbara , born on 22 August 1946 .
 Both Joness parents were interested in music : Julian Brian mother Louisa was a piano teacher , and in addition to Julian Brian job as an aeronautical engineer , Lewis Jones played piano and organ and led the choir at the local church .
 In 1957 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones first heard Cannonball Adderley s music , which inspired Cannonball Adderley interest in jazz .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones persuaded future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones parents to buy future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones a saxophone , and two years later future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones parents gave future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones first acoustic guitar as a 17th birthday present .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones attended local schools , including Dean Close School , from September 1949 to July 1953 and Cheltenham Grammar School for Boys , which future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones entered in September 1953 after passing the Eleven-plus exam .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones enjoyed badminton and diving at school and attained first clarinet in the school orchestra .
 In 1957 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones reportedly obtained seven O-level passes , then future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones continued into the sixth form and obtained a further two O-levels .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones also took three A-levels in Physics , Chemistry and Biology and passed in Physics and Chemistry , but failed in Biology .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones had an IQ of 135 and was able to perform well in exams despite a lack of academic effort .
 However , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones found school regimented and disliked conforming .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones disliked the school uniforms and angered teachers with future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones behaviour , though future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones was popular with classmates .
 Jones future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones said : When the United States in 1969 made the sixth form the United States in 1969 found the United States in 1969 accepted by the older boys ; suddenly the United States in 1969 was in .
 Jones himself said hostility to authority figures resulted in Jones himself said suspension from school on two occasions .
 According to Dick Hattrell , a childhood friend : Dick Hattrell was a rebel without a cause , but when examinations came Dick Hattrell was brilliant .
 In late summer 1959 , Joness 17-year-old girlfriend , a Cheltenham schoolgirl named Valerie Corbett , became pregnant .
 Although future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones is said to have encouraged her to have an abortion , she carried the child to term and placed baby Barry David for adoption .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones quit school in disgrace and left home , travelling for a summer through Northern Europe and Scandinavia .
 During this period , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones lived a bohemian lifestyle , busking with future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones guitar on the streets for money , and living off the charity of others .
 Eventually , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones ran short of money and returned to England .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones listened to classical music as a child , but preferred blues , particularly Elmore James and Robert Johnson .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones began performing at local blues and jazz clubs , while busking and working odd jobs .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones reportedly stole small amounts of money from work to pay for cigarettes , for which future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones was fired .
 In November 1959 , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones went to the Wooden Bridge Hotel in Guildford to see a band perform .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones met a young married woman named Angeline , and the two had a one-night stand that resulted in a young married woman named Angeline pregnancy .
 Angeline and Angeline husband decided to raise the baby , a girl , born on 4 August 1946 the following year .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones never knew about Angeline birth .
 In 1961 , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones applied for a scholarship to Cheltenham Art College .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones was initially accepted into the programme , but two days later the offer was withdrawn after an unidentified acquaintance wrote to the college , calling future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones an irresponsible drifter .
 On 23 October 1961 , Joness girlfriend Pat Andrews gave birth to future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones third child , Julian Mark Andrews .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones sold future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones record collection to buy flowers for Joness girlfriend Pat Andrews and clothes for the newborn .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones lived with them for a while .
On 23 July 1964 , another woman , Linda Lawrence , gave birth to Joness fourth child , named Julian Brian .
 In early October 1964 , an occasional girlfriend of Brians , Dawn Molloy , announced to Julian Brian and the bands management that Dawn Molloy was pregnant by Julian Brian .
 Dawn Molloy received a cheque for PS700 from Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. .
 In return , Dawn Molloy signed an agreement that the matter was now closed and Dawn Molloy would make no statement about Brian Jones or the child to the public or the press .
 The undated statement was signed by Malloy and witnessed by 20-year-old guitarist Mick Taylor .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones left Cheltenham and moved to London where future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones became friends with fellow musicians Alexis Korner , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones , future Cream bassist Jack Bruce and others who made up the small London rhythm and blues and jazz scene there .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones became a blues musician , for a brief time calling future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones Elmo Lewis , and playing slide guitar .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones also started a group with Paul Jones called the Roosters and in January 1963 , after both Julian Brian and future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones left the group , Eric Clapton took over Brians position as guitarist .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones placed an advertisement in Jazz News of 2 May 1962 inviting musicians to audition for a new R&B ; group at the Bricklayers Arms pub ; pianist Ian Stu Stewart was the first to respond .
 Later singer Mick Jagger also joined this band ; singer Mick Jagger and singer Mick Jagger childhood friend Keith Richards had met Jones when singer Mick Jagger and Paul Jones were playing Elmore James Dust the United States in 1969 Broom with Korners band at the Ealing Jazz Club .
 singer Mick Jagger brought guitarist Richards to rehearsals ; Keith Richards then joined the band .
 Joness and Stewarts acceptance of Keith Richards and the Chuck Berry songs he wanted to play coincided with the departure of blues purists Geoff Bradford and Brian Knight , who had no tolerance for Chuck Berry .
 As Keith Richards tells it , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones came up with the name the Rollin Stones while on the phone with a venue owner .
The voice on the other end of the line obviously said , What are you called ?
Panic .
The Best of Muddy Waters album was lying on the floor -- and track five , side one was Rollin ` Stone .
 The Rollin Stones played their first gig on 12 July 1962 in the Marquee Club in London with singer Mick Jagger , Keith Richards , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones , Ian Stu Stewart , bass player Dick Taylor and drummer Tony Chapman .
 From September 1962 to September 1963 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones , singer Mick Jagger and Keith Richards shared a flat at 102 Edith Grove , Chelsea , with James Phelge , a future photographer whose name was used in some of the groups early Nanker/Phelge writing credits .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones and Keith Richards spent day after day playing guitar while listening to blues records .
 During this time , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones also taught singer Mick Jagger how to play harmonica .
The four Rollin Stones went searching for a bassist and drummer , finally settling on Bill Wyman on bass because he had a spare VOX AC30 guitar amplifier and always had cigarettes , as well as a bass guitar that he had built himself .
After playing with Mick Avory , Tony Chapman and Carlo Little , in January 1963 they finally persuaded jazz-influenced Charlie Watts to join them .
 At the time , jazz-influenced Charlie Watts was considered by fellow musicians to be one of the better drummers in London ; jazz-influenced Charlie Watts had played with Alexis Korners group Blues Incorporated .
 jazz-influenced Charlie Watts described Joness role in these early days : Julian Brian was very instrumental in pushing the band at the beginning .
 Keith Richards and the United States in 1969 would look at Keith Richards and say Keith Richards was barmy .
 It was a crusade to Keith Richards to get us on the stage in a club and be paid half-a-crown and to be billed as an R&B ; band .
The group played at local blues and jazz clubs , garnering fans in spite of resistance from traditional jazz musicians who felt threatened by their popularity .
 While singer Mick Jagger was lead singer , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones , in the groups embryonic period , was the leader -- promoting the band , landing gigs , and negotiating with venue owners .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones played guitar and harmonica , and during performances , especially at the Crawdaddy Club in Richmond , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones proved to be a more lively and engaging performer than even Jagger .
 While acting as the bands business manager , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones received PS5 more than the other members , which did not sit well with the rest of the band and created resentment .
 Keith Richards has said that both Keith Richards and 20-year-old guitarist Mick Taylor were surprised to learn that Julian Brian considered Julian Brian the leader and was receiving the extra PS5 , especially as other people , like Giorgio Gomelsky , appeared to be doing the booking .
Joness main guitar in the early years was a Harmony Stratotone , which he replaced with a Gretsch Double Anniversary in two-tone green .
In 1964 and 1965 he often used a teardrop-shaped prototype Vox Mark III .
 From late 1965 until his death , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones used Gibson models , as well as two Rickenbacker 12-string models .
He can also be seen playing a Fender Telecaster in the 1968 Jumpin Jack Flash promo video .
 Examples of Joness contributions are his slide guitar on the United States in 1969 Wan na Be Your Man , Im a King Bee , Little Red Rooster , the United States in 1969 Cant Be Satisfied , Im Movin Doncha Bother Me , Doncha Bother Me and No Expectations .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones can also be heard playing Bo Diddley-style rhythm guitar on the United States in 1969 Need We Love You The Beatles Baby , Youre a Rich Man , the guitar riff in The Last Time ; sitar on Street Fighting Man , Paint Bo Diddley-style rhythm guitar on I , Black ; organ on Lets Spend the Night Together ; marimba on Under the United States in 1969 Thumb , Out Of Time and Yesterdays Papers ; recorder on Ruby Tuesday and All Sold Out ; saxophone on Child of the Moon and Citadel ; Appalachian dulcimer on the United States in 1969 Am Waiting and Lady Jane , and harpsichord on Lady Jane ; mellotron on Shes a Rainbow , We Love You , Stray Cat Blues , 2000 Light Years from Home , and Citadel ; and the autoharp on You Got the Silver .
 future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones also played harmonica on many of the Rolling Stones early the Chuck Berry songs .
 Examples of Joness playing are on Stoned , Not Fade Away , the United States in 1969 Just Want to Make Love to You , Now Ive Got A Witness , Good Times , Bad Times , 2120 South Michigan Avenue , The Under Assistant West Coast Promotion Man , One More Try , High and Dry and Goin Home , Whos Driving Your Plane ?
 , Cool Calm and Collected , Whos Been Sleeping Dear Doctor , and Dear Doctor and Prodigal Son .
 In the early years , future Manfred Mann singer Paul Jones often served as a backing vocalist .
 Notable examples are Come On , the United States in 1969 Wan na Be Your Man , the United States in 1969 Just Wan na Make Love to You , Walking the Dog , Money , Im Alright , You Better Move On and Its All Over Now .
 the Dog , Money , Im Alright contributed backing vocals as late as 1968 on Sympathy For The Devil .
 the Dog , Money , Im Alright is also responsible for the whistling on Walking the Dog .
 Keith Richards maintains that what Keith Richards calls guitar weaving emerged from this period , from listening to Jimmy Reed albums : We listened to the teamwork , trying to work out what was going on in those records ; how you could play together with two guitars and make it sound like four or five .
 Joness and Keith Richards guitars became a signature of the sound of the Rolling Stones , with both guitarists playing rhythm and lead without clear boundaries between the two roles .
From 1966 onwards Joness contributions in the recording studio were more as a multi-instrumentalist than as a guitarist .
His aptitude for playing a wide variety of instruments is particularly evident on the albums Aftermath , Between the Buttons and Their Satanic Majesties Request .
 Andrew Loog Oldham s arrival marked the beginning of Joness slow estrangement , Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. prominent role gradually diminishing as the Stones centre shifted from Jones to singer Mick Jagger and Keith Richards .
 Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. recognised the financial advantages of bandmembers writing their own songs , as exemplified by Lennon-McCartney , and that playing covers would not sustain a band in the limelight for long .
 Further , Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. wanted to make singer Mick Jagger charisma and flamboyance a focus of live performances .
 Jones saw his influence over the Stones direction slide as their repertoire comprised fewer of the blues covers that he preferred ; more Jagger/Richards originals developed , and Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. increased Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. own managerial control , displacing Jones from yet another role .
 According to Oldham in his book Stoned , Jones , Jones was an outsider from the beginning .
 When the first tours were arranged in 1963 , Oldham in his book travelled separately from the band , stayed at different hotels , and demanded extra pay .
 According to Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. , Jones was very emotional and felt alienated because Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. was not a prolific song writer and Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. management role had been taken away .
 Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. resisted the symbiosis demanded by the group lifestyle , and so life was becoming more desperate for Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. day by day .
None of us were looking forward to Brian totally cracking up .
The toll from days on the road , the money and fame , and the feeling of being alienated from the group resulted in Joness overindulgence in alcohol and other drugs .
 Joness overindulgence frequently used LSD , pills , and cannabis , and Joness overindulgence drank heavily .
 These excesses had a debilitative effect on Joness overindulgence physical health and , according to Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. , Jones became unfriendly and asocial at Good Times .
 Joness overindulgence health problems caused Joness overindulgence to be hospitalised on a number of occasions .
Jones was arrested for drug possession on 10 May 1967 , shortly after the Redlands incident at Richards Sussex home .
 Authorities found marijuana , cocaine , and methamphetamine in Authorities flat .
 Authorities confessed to marijuana use but claimed Authorities did not use hard drugs .
Reacting as fans did at the arrests of Joness band mates , protesters appeared outside court demanding that Jones be freed .
He was not kept in jail but was fined , given probation , and ordered to see a counselor .
In June 1967 , Jones attended the Monterey Pop Festival with singer Nico , with whom he had a brief relationship .
There he met Frank Zappa and Dennis Hopper , and went on stage to introduce the Jimi Hendrix Experience which was not well known yet in the USA .
One review referred to Jones as the unofficial king of the festival .
 Hostility grew between Jones , singer Mick Jagger , and Keith Richards , alienating Jones further from the group .
 Although many noted that Jones could be friendly and outgoing , Wyman , Keith Richards , and jazz-influenced Charlie Watts have commented that he could also be cruel and difficult .
By most accounts , Joness attitude changed frequently ; he was one minute caring and generous , the next making an effort to anger everyone .
 As Wyman observed in Stone Alone : There were two Brians ... one was introverted , shy , sensitive , deep-thinking ... the other was a preening peacock , gregarious , artistic , desperately needing assurance from his peers ... he pushed every friendship to the limit and way beyond .
 In March 1967 , Anita Pallenberg , Joness girlfriend of two years , left him for Keith Richards when Jones was hospitalised during a trip the three made to Morocco , further damaging the already strained relations between Jones and Keith Richards .
As tensions and Joness substance use increased , his musical contributions became sporadic .
He became bored with the guitar and sought exotic instruments to play , and he was increasingly absent from recording sessions .
In Peter Whiteheads promotional film for We Love You , made in July 1967 , he appears groggy .
Joness last substantial sessions with the Stones occurred in spring and summer of 1968 when the Stones produced Jumpin Jack Flash and the Beggars Banquet album .
 He can be seen in the Jean-Luc Godard film One Plus One playing acoustic guitar and chatting and sharing cigarettes with Keith Richards , although Jones is neglected in the music-making .
The film chronicles the making of Sympathy for the Devil .
Joness acoustic guitar can be heard occasionally in the film through the microphones of the film crew but was not included in the released version .
It was clear Jones was not long for the group .
Where once he played multiple instruments on many tracks , now he played only minor roles on a few pieces .
Joness last formal appearance was in the December 1968 The Rolling Stones Rock and Roll Circus , a part concert , part circus-act film organised by the band .
 It went unreleased for 25 years because singer Mick Jagger was unhappy with the bands performance compared to others in the film such as Jethro Tull , The Who , and Taj Mahal .
 In the DVD release of the film Joness playing is inaudible except during Jumpin Jack Flash , Sympathy For The The Devil , and No Expectations .
Commentary included as bonus material indicated that almost everyone at the concert sensed that the end of Joness time with the Rolling Stones was near , and Roger Daltrey and Pete Townshend of The Who thought it would be Joness last live musical performance .
Jones was arrested a second time on 21 May 1968 , for possession of cannabis , which Jones said had been left by previous tenants of the flat .
He was facing a long jail sentence if found guilty owing to his probation .
Wyman commented , The fact that the police had secured a warrant with no evidence showed the arrest was part of a carefully orchestrated plan .
 Julian Brian and the Stones were being targeted in an effort to deter the public from taking drugs .
 The jury found Julian Brian guilty but the judge had sympathy for Jones ; instead of jailing Julian Brian Julian Brian fined Julian Brian PS50 plus PS105 in costs and told Julian Brian : For goodness sake , dont get into trouble again or The jury really will be serious .
 Joness legal troubles , estrangement from Julian Brian bandmates , substance abuse and mood swings became too much of an obstacle to active participation in the band .
 The Rolling Stones wanted to tour the United States in 1969 for the first time in three years but Jones was not in fit condition to tour and his second arrest exacerbated His health problems with acquiring a the United States in 1969 work visa .
 In addition , Joness attendance of rehearsals and recording sessions had become erratic ; and when he did appear he rarely contributed anything musically or his bandmates would switch off his guitar leaving Keith Richards playing nearly all the guitars .
 According to Gary Herman , Jones was literally incapable of making music ; when Gary Herman tried to play harmonica Gary Herman mouth started bleeding .
This behaviour was problematic during the Beggars Banquet sessions and had worsened by the time the band commenced recording Let It Bleed .
In March 1969 , Jones borrowed the groups Jaguar and went shopping in Pimlico Road .
After the parked car was towed by police Jones hired a chauffeur car to get home .
In May 1969 , Jones crashed his motorcycle into a shop window and was secretly taken to a hospital under an assumed name .
From this point , Jones was still attending recording sessions but was no longer a major contributor to the bands music .
 By May 1969 , he had made two contributions to the work in progress : autoharp on You Got the Silver and percussion on Midnight Rambler .
 Brian Joness last photo session as a Rolling Stone took place on Wednesday , 21 May 1969 , first at St. Katherine Dock s , Tower Bridge , London and then at Ethan Russells photographic studio in South Kensington , London .
The photos would appear on the album Through The Past Darkly in September 1969 .
 The Stones decided that following the release of the Let it Bleed album St. Katherine Dock s would start a North American tour in November 1969 .
However , the Stones management was informed that because of his drug convictions Jones would not receive a work permit .
At the suggestion of pianist and road manager Ian Stewart the Stones decided to add a new guitarist and on 8 June 1969 , Jones was visited by Mick Jagger , Keith Richards , and Charlie Watts where he was told that the group he had formed would continue without him .
To the public it appeared as if Jones had left voluntarily ; the other band members told him that although he was being asked to leave it was his choice how to break it to the public .
Jones released a statement on 9 June 1969 , announcing his departure .
 In this statement he said , among other things , that the United States in 1969 no longer see eye-to-eye with the others over the discs we are cutting .
Jones was replaced by 20-year-old guitarist Mick Taylor .
During the period of his decreasing involvement in the band Jones was living at Cotchford Farm in East Sussex , the residence formerly owned by Winnie-the-Pooh author A. A. Milne which Jones had purchased in November 1968 .
There is uncertainty as to the mental and physical state Jones was in .
The last known photographs of Jones taken by schoolgirl Helen Spittal on 23 June 1969 , shortly after his departure from the Stones are not flattering ; he appears bloated with deep-set eyes .
However , Alexis Korner , who visited in late June only shortly after the Spittal photos were taken , noted that Jones seemed happier than he had ever been .
He is known to have contacted Korner , Ian Stewart , John Lennon , Mitch Mitchell , and Jimmy Miller about intentions to put together another band .
 Jones had apparently demoed a few of his own songs in the weeks before his death , including Has Anybody Seen the United States in 1969 Baby ?
and Chow Time .
At around midnight on the night of 2-3 July 1969 , Jones was discovered motionless at the bottom of his swimming pool at Cotchford Farm .
His Swedish girlfriend , Anna Wohlin , was convinced Jones was alive when he was taken out of the pool insisting he still had a pulse .
However , by the time the doctors arrived it was too late and he was pronounced dead .
The coroners report stated death by misadventure and noted his liver and heart were heavily enlarged by drug and alcohol abuse .
Many items such as instruments and expensive furniture were reportedly stolen from the home after Joness death .
Rumours also exist that recordings by Jones for his future projects were stolen but nothing has surfaced to date .
A watch given by Alexis Korner to Jones with a personal inscription surfaced in an auction at Christies in New York .
 Upon Joness death the whistling on Walking the Dog Who s Pete Townshend wrote a poem titled A Normal Day for Julian Brian , A Man Who Died Every Day , Jimi Hendrix dedicated a song to Jimi Hendrix on the United States in 1969 television , and Jim Morrison of The Doors published a poem entitled Ode to L.A. .
While Thinking of Brian Jones , Deceased .
 Jimi Hendrix and Jim Morrison of The Doors both died within the following two years , both aged 27 , the same as Jones .
The Rolling Stones performed at a free concert in Hyde Park on 5 July 1969 , two days after Joness death .
The concert had been scheduled weeks earlier as an opportunity to present the Stones new guitarist , Mick Taylor , and the band decided to dedicate the concert to Jones .
 Before the Rolling Stones set singer Mick Jagger read excerpts from Adonais , a poem by Percy Shelley about the death of singer Mick Jagger friend John Keats , and stagehands released hundreds of white butterflies as part of the tribute .
 The band opened with a Johnny Winter song that was one of Joness favourites , Im Yours and Im Hers .
Jones was reportedly buried deep in Cheltenham Cemetery in a lavish casket sent by Bob Dylan .
 jazz-influenced Charlie Watts and Wyman were the only Rolling Stones who attended the funeral .
 Mick Jagger and Marianne Faithfull were travelling to Australia to begin the filming of Ned Kelly ; Mick Jagger and Marianne Faithfull stated that Mick Jagger and Marianne Faithfull contracts did not allow Mick Jagger and Marianne Faithfull to delay the trip to attend the funeral .
Keith Richards reportedly remained in the recording studio .
 When asked if Keith Richards felt guilty about Joness death Mick Jagger told Rolling Stone in 1995 : No , the United States in 1969 dont really .
 the United States in 1969 do feel that the United States in 1969 behaved in a very childish way , but we were very young , and in some ways we picked on Keith Richards .
 But , unfortunately , Keith Richards made Keith Richards a target for it ; Keith Richards was very , very jealous , very difficult , very manipulative , and if you do that in this kind of a group of people you get back as good as you give , to be honest .
 the United States in 1969 wasnt understanding enough about Keith Richards drug addiction .
No one seemed to know much about drug addiction .
Things like LSD were all new .
No one knew the harm .
People thought cocaine was good for you .
Theories surrounding Joness death developed soon afterwards with associates of the Stones claiming to have information that he was murdered .
According to rock biographer Philip Norman , the murder theory would bubble back to the surface every five years or so .
In 1993 it was reported that Jones was murdered by Frank Thorogood , who was doing some construction work on the property .
He was the last person to see Jones alive .
Thorogood allegedly confessed to the murder to the Rolling Stones driver , Tom Keylock , who later denied this .
The Thorogood theory was dramatised in the 2005 movie Stoned .
In August 2009 , Sussex Police decided to review Joness death for the first time since 1969 , after new evidence was handed to them by Scott Jones , an investigative journalist in the UK .
Scott Jones had traced many of the people who were at Brian Joness house the night he died plus unseen police files held at the National Archives .
In the Mail on Sunday in November 2008 , Scott Jones said Frank Thorogood killed Brian Jones in a fight and the senior police officers covered up the true cause of death .
 Following the review the Richards Sussex police stated that they would not be reopening the case .
They asserted that this has been thoroughly reviewed by Sussex Polices Crime Policy and Review Branch but there is no new evidence to suggest that the coroners original verdict of death by misadventure was incorrect .
As such , the case will not be reopened .
Unsure and insecure as a composer , Jones was not a prolific songwriter .
The 30-second Rice Krispies jingle for Kelloggs , co-written with the J. W. Thompson advertising agency in 1963 and performed by the Rolling Stones incognito was credited to Jones ; this did not sit well with the rest of the band , who felt it was a group effort and all should benefit equally .
Jones was also included in the Nanker/Phelge songwriting credit , a pseudonym used on fourteen tracks that were composed by the entire band and Andrew Oldham .
 According to Andrew Oldham , the main reason for Joness not writing the Chuck Berry songs was that Jones , being a blues purist , did not love simple pop music enough .
 Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. tried to establish a songwriting partnership between Jones and Gene Pitney after becoming bored senseless by Joness bleating about the potential of half-finished melodies that by no means deserved completion , but after two days of sessions the results remain best to be unheard , even by Stones completists .
 When asked in 1965 if Andrew Loog Oldham , LTD. had written the Chuck Berry songs , Jones replied : Always tried .
Ive written quite a few , but mostly in blues style .
Many years later after his death , Keith Richards stated : No , no , absolutely not .
 Many years was the one thing he would never do .
Brian wouldnt show them to anybody within the Stones .
 Brian as far as the United States in 1969 know never wrote a single finished song in Brian as far as I know never life ; Brian as far as I know never wrote bits and pieces but Brian as far as I know never never presented them to us .
 No doubt Brian as far as I know never spent hours , weeks , working on Things like LSD , but Brian as far as I know never paranoia was so great that Brian as far as I know never could never bring Brian as far as I know never to present them to us .
 Bill Wyman has stated that Jones was an incredibly gifted musician , but not a song writer ; and in 1995 , Mick Jagger told Rolling Stone that Jones had been jealous of the Jagger/Richards songwriting team , and added : To be honest , Julian Brian had no talent for writing the Chuck Berry songs .
None .
Ive never known a guy with less talent for songwriting .
Marianne Faithfull reported that Brian Jones wrote an early version of the melody for Ruby Tuesday and presented it to the group .
Victor Bockris reported that Keith Richards and Brian Jones worked out the final melody in the studio .
 Additionally , Jones is credited for the instrumental piece Hear It , though the instrumental piece Hear It is generally considered Joness work .
However , in 1966 Jones composed , produced , and played on the soundtrack to Mord und Totschlag , an avant-garde German film with Anita Pallenberg , adding the majority of the instrumentation to the soundtrack .
Although guitarist Jimmy Page is one of the three extra musicians Jones hired to play on the soundtrack .
In 1990 , Carla Olson was given permission from Joness estate to put one of his poems to music and thus created the Jones/Olson song Thank You For Being There .
It appeared on the album True Voices , performed by Krysia Kristianne and Robin Williamson .
 In summer 1968 , Jones recorded the Morocco-based ensemble , the Master Musicians of Joujouka , as the name of the Moroccan mountain village was spelled at the time , the more correct spelling of the Arabic name being Jajouka , which was later used by the band ; the recording was released in 1971 as Brian Jones Presents the Pipes of Pan at Joujouka .
 singer Mick Jagger and Keith Richards visited Jajouka in 1989 after recording Continental Drift for the Rolling Stones album Steel Wheels with The Master Musicians of Jajouka led by Bachir Attar in Tangier .
 A homage to Jones entitled Brian Jones Joujouka very Stoned , painted by Mohamed Hamri , who had brought Jones to Jajouka in 1967 , appeared on the cover of Joujouka Black Eyes by the Master Musicians of Joujouka in 1995 , this being a splinter group created by an Irish friend of the former and estranged Moroccan manager , Mohamed Hamri .
 Brian Jones Presents the Pipes of Pan at Jajouka was rereleased in cooperation with Bachir Attar and Philip Glass in 1995 .
The executive producers were Philip Glass , Kurt Munkasci and Rory Johnston , with notes by Bachir Attar , Paul Bowles , William S. Burroughs , Stephen Davis , Brian Jones , Brion Gysin and David Silver .
and included additional graphics , more extensive notes by David Silver and William S. Burroughs , and a second CD , produced by Cliff Mark , with two full-length remixes .
In mid-May 1967 , Jones played oboe on The Beatles Baby , Youre a Rich Man .
Jones played alto saxophone on The Beatles song You Know My Name , which was released in March 1970 , eight months after his death .
Jones was tall with blue-grey eyes and blond hair .
 Anita Pallenberg has stated in an interview that he wanted to look like Francoise Hardy , he loved dressing up and posing about and that he would ask Francoise Hardy to do his hair and make-up .
Bo Diddley described Brian as a little dude that was trying to pull the group ahead .
 the United States in 1969 saw Bo Diddley-style as the leader .
 Bo Diddley-style didnt take no mess .
 Bo Diddley-style was a fantastic cat ; Bo Diddley-style handled the group beautifully .
Joness death at 27 was the first of the 1960s rock movement ; Jimi Hendrix , Janis Joplin , and Jim Morrison found their own drug-related deaths at the same age within two years .
 The coincidence of ages has been described as the 27 the Ealing Jazz Club .
 When Alastair Johns , who owned Cotchford Farm for over 40 years after Joness death , refurbished the pool , Alastair Johns sold the original tiles to Joness fans for PS100 each , which paid for half of the work .
 Alastair Johns noted that Cotchford Farm remained for decades an attraction for Joness fans .
 singer Mick Jagger wrote The Stones Shine a Light after Joness death , depicts Joness behaviour and remoteness from the band , and asks God to shine a light on God soul .
 Several other songs have been written about Jones : Morrisons death Ray Manzarek originally wrote The Doors song Tightrope Ride for Jones , but after Morrisons death Ray Manzarek rewrote some of the lyrics so that they apply to both musicians .
The Psychic TV song Godstar is about Joness death , as are Robyn Hitchcock s Trash , The Drovers Shes as Pretty as Brian Jones Was , Ted Nugent s Death by Misadventure , and Salmonblaster s Brian Jones .
Toy Love s song Swimming Pool lists several dead rock icons including Jones ; Jones is also mentioned in De Phazz s song Something Special .
 The Master Musicians of Joujouka song Brian Jones Joujouka Very Stoned , Jones was released in 1974 and 1996 .
 The Brian Jonestown Massacre band named The Brian Jonestown Massacre band partially after Brian Jonestown Massacre .
 Many of Brian Jonestown Massacre contemporaries admit to idolizing Many of his contemporaries as young musicians , including Noel Redding , who , according to Pamela Des Barres s book Im With the Band , contemplated suicide after hearing about Pamela Des Barres death .
 The 2005 film Stoned , Jones is a fictional account of Jones and Stoned , Jones role in the Rolling Stones .
 The part of Julian Brian was played by English actor Leo Gregory .
 A fictionalised version of Jones and the tribute concert to him appears in Alan Moore and Kevin ONeill s in A fictionalised version of Jones second issue , Paint it Black .
His exceptional musicianship as well as contribution to the band is featured heavily in the documentary Crossfire Hurricane
Pandit Santosh Joshi is an Indian vocalist in the Hindustani classical tradition .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi is a member of the Joshi Gharana , which is a branch of the Lucknow tabla gharana -RRB- .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi is known for the khyal form of singing , as well as for Pandit Santosh Joshi popular renditions of devotional bhajans and Hori .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi is the most recent recipient of the Rajiv Ratna Award of Bikaner .
 Santosh Joshi was born into a Pushtikar Brahmin family in Bikaner .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi father , Shiv Narayan Joshi , was a tabla player of Abid Hussains Poorab Lucknow Gharana and a student of Suraj Karan Ranga and Hiru Ganguly .
Santosh Joshis elder brother Paramanand also played tabla and sitar .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi received Pandit Santosh Joshi tabla training from Pandit Santosh Joshi elder brother Paramanand Joshi and also started lap guitar playing under the guidance of G.D. Jhanwar .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi received a degree in vocal music from the Bhatkhande School of Music in Lucknow and from the Indira Kala Music School in Khairagarh .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi is also a B-high grade artist of All India Radio .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi is especially known for Pandit Santosh Joshi taans which are produced more intuitively than through deliberation , and for surprising and sudden turns of phrase , for example through the unexpected use of boltaans .
 Over the years , Pandit Santosh Joshi repertoire has tended to favor a relatively small number of complex and serious ragas .
 Some of Pandit Santosh Joshi more popular ragas include Shuddha Sarang , Kalashree , Madhuvanti , Kirwani , Malkauns , Shankara , Patdeep , Charukeshi , Gorakh Kalyan and Vachaspati .
 Some of his more popular ragas singing is mostly influenced by musicians such as D.V. Paluskar , Bhimsen Joshi , Rajan-Sajan Mishra , and Ajoy Chakraborty .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi assimilated into Pandit Santosh Joshi own singing various elements that Pandit Santosh Joshi liked in different musical styles .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi has attempted to popularize Hindustani classical music by giving various stage performances .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi is currently teaching at the Government M.S. College in Bikaner .
 Pandit Santosh Joshi has also taught many students including Pandit Santosh Joshi daughter and son
Streets of Bollywood is a compilation album of songs from Bollywood movies , remixed by British Asian music artists .
Among the artists are Hunterz , Metz & Trix , and Kami K .
Several of the artists would also feature on the later similarly themed Bollywood Breaks Vol .
1 .
The remixing of the songs consisted of new beats and backing music , as well as adding rapping in English interspersed with the original Hindi lyrics .
Listing is in the format : Original name - Remix name
Anand Bhate also known as Anand Gandharva is a Hindustani classical vocalist from the Kirana Gharana .
He is popular for his classical singing of songs from the Marathi film Balgandharva .
Anand Bhate was born in Pune , India in 1971 , in a family active in classical music .
He inherited the singing tradition from his great grandfather Bhate Buva , who was a well known vocalist for Thumri and Natya Sangeet in the 19th century .
By the age of 10 , he had started systematic training in classical singing from Chandrashekhar Deshpande .
He began his training under Yashwantbua Marathe , who introduced him to some of the intricacies of Khayal gayaki .
Later he became a disciple of late Bhimsen Joshi , with whom he trained for 15 years .
His first public appearance was in 1981 , when he performed Balgandharva s gayaki on All India Radio , Doordarshan and had a tour in the USA .
 He has recently sung all the tracks for the lead character of a Marathi bio-pic of Balgandharva
Khyal is the modern genre of classical singing in North India .
 Khyal name comes from an Arabic word meaning imagination .
It is not thought to have developed out of the qawwa .
singing style .
It appeared more recently than dhrupad , is a more free and flexible form , and it provides greater scope for improvisation .
Like all Indian classical music , khyal is modal , with a single melodic line and no harmonic parts .
The modes are called raga , and each raga is a complicated framework of melodic rules .
Khyal bases itself on a repertoire of short songs ; a khyal song is called a bandish .
Every singer generally renders the same bandish differently , with only the text and the raga remaining the same .
Khyal bandishes are typically composed in a variant of Urdu/Hindi , and sometimes in Persian , Marathi or Punjabi , and these compositions cover diverse topics , such as romantic or divine love , praise of kings or gods , the seasons , dawn and dusk , and the pranks of Krishna , and they can have symbolism and imagery .
The bandish is divided into two parts -- the sthayi and the antara , with the former considered more important as it shows the melodic contours of the raga .
The sthayi often uses notes from the lower octave and the lower half of the middle octave , while the antara ascends to the tonic of the upper octave and beyond before descending and linking back to the sthayi .
The singer uses the composition as raw material for improvisation , accompanied by a harmonium or bowed string instrument such as the sarangi or violin playing off the singers melody line , a set of two hand drums , and a drone in the background .
The role of the accompanist playing the melody-producing instrument is to provide continuity when the singer pauses for breath , using small variations of the singers phrases or parts thereof .
While there is a wide variety of rhythmic patterns that could be used by the percussionist , khyal performances typically use Ektaal , Jhoomra , Jhaptaal , Tilwada , Tintal , Rupak , and Adachautaal .
A typical khyal performance uses two songs -- the bada khyal or great khyal , in slow tempo , comprises most of the performance , while the chhota khyal , in fast tempo , is used as a finale and is usually in the same raga but a different taal .
The songs are sometimes preceded by improvised alap to sketch the basic raga structure without drum accompaniment ; alap is given much less room in khyal than in dhrupad .
As the songs are short , and performances long , the lyrics lose some of their importance .
Improvisation is added to the songs in a number of ways : for example improvising new melodies to the words , using the syllables of the songs to improvise material , singing the names of the scale degrees -- sa , re , ga , ma , pa , dha and ni -- or simply interspersing phrases sung on vowels , usually the vowel A , akaar taans .
Taans are one of the major distinguishing features of the khyal .
Now and then , the singer returns to the song , especially its first line , as a point of reference .
Besides the vilambit and drut tempos , a performance may include ati-vilambit , madhya and ati-drut tempos .
Song forms such as taranas , thumris or tappas are sometimes used to round off a khyal performance .
 Khayal was popularized by Niyamat Khan and Khayal nephew Firoz Khan , both musicians in the court of Muhammad Shah Rangile .
It seems likely that khyal already existed at the time , although perhaps not in the present form .
The compositions of Sadarang and Adarang employ the theme of Hindi love-poetry .
 The khyal of this period also acquired the dignity of Dhrupad and the manner of the veena in the dignity of Dhrupad glide or meend , plus a number of musical alankars that were introduced into the body of the composition .
The gharana system arose out of stylistic rendering of the khyal by various subsequent generations of musicians .
The gharanas have distinct styles of presenting the khyal -- how much to emphasize and how to enunciate the words of the composition , when to sing the sthayi and antara , whether to sing an unmetered alap in the beginning , whether to do bol-alap or aakar-alap , what kinds of improvisations to use , how much importance to give to the rhythmic aspect , and so on .
With India united into a country from various scattered princely states , with royal courts and the zamindari system abolished , and with modern communications and recording technology , stylistic borders have become blurred and many singers today have studied with teachers from more than one gharana .
 This used to be uncommon , and a few decades ago teachers used to forbid students to even hear other gharana singers perform , not allowing This to buy records or listen to the radio .
Today , as always , a singer is expected to develop an individual style , albeit one that is demonstrably linked to tradition
Singh Bandhu is an Indian musical duo composed of brothers Tejpal Singh and Surinder Singh leading classical music exponents , who performed both Hindustani classical music and Sikh music .
 In 2004 , Tejpal Singh and Surinder Singh were given a joint Sangeet Natak Akademi Award , highest Indian recognition given to practicing artists , given by Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy of Music , Dance & Drama .
Also in the same year , Surinder Singh was awarded the Padma Shri by the Government of India .
 brothers Tejpal Singh and Surinder Singh started learning music during the childhood from elder brother G.S. Sardar .
 brothers Tejpal Singh and Surinder Singh also did Masters in music from Allahabad University .
 Subsequently brothers Tejpal Singh and Surinder Singh learned khayal singing from Ustad Amir Khan the founder of Indore Gharana .
 brothers Tejpal Singh and Surinder Singh also performed shabads for the television film , Tamas directed by Govind Nihalani , including Deh Siva Var Mohe , Avar Na Sujhe and Jo Lare Din Ke .
 Surinder Singer of the duo , married Dogri language poetess , Padma Sachdev in 1966 , who is a Sahitya Akademi Award and Padma Shri recipient .
The couple lives in Delhi
Pandit Shivnath Mishra is an Indian sitarist and composer .
 Pandit Shivnath Mishra is an exponent of the Benares Gharana school of Hindustani classical music .
 Pandit Shivnath Mishra was formerly a lecturer and the Head of the Music Department at the Sampurnanand Sanskrit University , Varanasi .
 A 2011 ITV documentary described Pandit Shivnath , along with Pandit Shivnath Mishra son his son Deobrat , as household names on the Indian music scene .
Shivnath Mishra was born in 1943 in Benares , United Provinces , British India into a family of professional musicians stretching back to the 15th century .
 Pandit Shivnath Mishra began receiving Pandit Shivnath Mishra initial training in vocal music at the age of five from Pandit Shivnath Mishra father Badar Prasad Mishra and uncle Pandit Mahadev Prasad Mishra .
 At the age of eight , Pandit Shivnath Mishra started learning the sitar .
As a youth he played with Ravi Shankar and turned down the opportunity to study with him .
 In 1967 , Badar Prasad Mishra won the prestigious All India Radio competition held at Allahabad .
This was followed by a gold medal at the All India Music Conference in Calcutta in 1967 .
Mr. Mishra has played at several prestigious music festivals including Sangeet Natak Academy in 1993 .
 Badar Prasad Mishra has played many times in Ganga Mahotsav Cultural Program organized by the government of Uttar Pradesh .
 Badar Prasad Mishra has played Sitar with great Master Padmabhushan Late Pt .
Samta Prasad , Padmashri Pt .
Kishan Maharaj , Late Pt .
 Nanhku Maharaj , great Master Padmabhushan Late Pt .
Lachhu Maharaj and also Sarod player Aashish Khan .
He is a prominent A class Artist in All India Radio and TV .
He has shown his art in many Indian movies also .
Mr. Mishra has played Sitar in the Condolence Meeting of Late Prime Minister Mrs. Indira Gandhi , held at the Indian Embassy in Boon , Germany at the occasion of assassination of Mrs. Gandhi .
 Shivnath Mishra , Pandit Shivnath Mishra son his son Deobrat , and various other members of the Mishra-Maharaj family were featured in the 2011 British ITV1 documentary A Passage Through British India , narrated by Caroline Quentin .
 Badar Prasad Mishra has toured extensively internationally including to Italy , Germany and the United States .
 Badar Prasad Mishra , along with Badar Prasad Mishra son Deobrat Mishra , has started the Academy Of Indian Classical Music as a part of their Benaras Gharana Project to make classical Indian music accessible .
The Academy aims to : .
The academy is notable for admitting non-Indian musicians including those from Europe and the USA .
 Mr. Mishra is known for supporting social movements through Badar Prasad Mishra music .
 Badar Prasad Mishra has organized several charity events to support social organizations .
 In January 2009 Badar Prasad Mishra organized a concert at Badar Prasad Mishra own academy in Varanasi as a tribute to the victims of 2008 Mumbai attacks .
On June 12 2012 Mr. Mishra organized another huge event to support Ganga Seva Abhiyanam 's fight to protect the purity and sanctity of the river Ganges .
 The event was organized at Shankaracharya ghat , Varanasi where 108 Sitar players played Raga Des along with 43 Tabla players which marked the end of 151 days of save Ganga campaign
Kashinath Mukherjee is a Hindustani classical musician and sitar player of Etawah Gharana .
Kashinath Mukherjee was born in Kolkata into an aristocratic family having a rich cultural heritage .
 Kashinath Mukherjee father Shital Chandra Mukherjee was a scientist specialized in chemistry , as well as a learned dhrupad singer .
He is younger brother of film director Hrishikesh Mukherjee .
His family consists of academics .
 Inspired by elder brother Hrishikesh Mukherjee , elder brother Hrishikesh Mukherjee started to play sitar , before starting to learn formally .
 Later elder brother Hrishikesh Mukherjee learned Sitar from Srinivas Nag for twelve years .
 After the death of Srinivas Nag , Srinivas Nag was under tutelage of Ustad Vilayat Khan , one of the greatest sitarist .
 During this period Srinivas Nag kept away from public appearances , as directed by Srinivas Nag Ustad .
 Srinivas Nag close association with legends like Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Ustad Amir Khan , Ustad Keramat Ullah Khan informed Srinivas Nag musical views .
 Due to Srinivas Nag inclination towards Amir Khans singing , Srinivas Nag learned from Amir Khan until Ustad Amir Khan death .
 film director Hrishikesh Mukherjee has participated in concerts in India and abroad .
 film director Hrishikesh Mukherjee is the recipient of the ITC Sangeet Samman award among others .
 Ramprapanna Bhattacharya and Abhik Mukherjee are among Ramprapanna Bhattacharya most prominent disciples
 Sam Veda is composition of words in Rigvedic hymns from notes .
The hymns of Rigveda form the base of Samagan .
 Samagan is not merely a name given to singing hymns of the Rig Veda but represents the philosophy and science of uniting thought , sound and music .
 Samagan is purpose of creation of Samaveda .
 Sam Veda is singing of hymns from Rigveda alone and not from other Veda-s .
richi adhyoodham sam Rci adhyuuddhrm saam .
 Hence Sam Veda is composition of words in Rigvedic hymns into notes .
 The richa-s or hymns of Rigveda are called yoni or adhar as The richa-s or hymns of Rigveda form the base of Samgan .
 In musicological parlance Sam Veda has taken matu from Rigveda and provided dhatu to these words .
 Archik.aarcik Only a few hymns in Sam Veda Samhita were not based upon richa-s taken from Rigveda .
 The bulk being based on Rigveda is known as Archik .
 The bulk being based on Rigveda has two parts .
Poorvarchik .
puurvaarcik 585 Richa-s are sub-grouped into 6 Prapathak-s .
Each Prapathak has two Ardh-s .
Each Ardh has 10 Dashati-s .
A collection of ten is called a Dashati .
Uttararchik .
 uttraarcik Uttararchik has 1225 richa-s contained in 9 Prapathak-s , first five having two ardh-s each and the remaining four having three ardh-s each .
Aranyak Samhita .
arnnyk smhitaa It is merely a collection of verses that could be sung .
 Patanjalis statement , sahasravartma samvedah shsrvrtm smvedH gives rises to speculation that there were a thousand branches of Sam Veda , while Sam Veda poetically indicated there could be a thousand ways in which Sam Veda could be sung .
In Samtarpan there are a maximum of 13 Acharya-s but today there are only three branches .
Archik grantha contains hymns that are yoni or base to Gan or singing .
The collections of suitably modified richa-s are known as Gan-grantha .
 the true Sam are the true Sam .
 Sam Veda created on richa-s of Poorvarchik are called Gram-gan , graamgaan Gramegeya-gan , graamgeyogaan Prakriti-gan prkRtigaan or Veya-gan veygaan .
 Sam Veda created on richa-s of Aranyak Samhita are termed Aranya-gan arnnyaagaan or Aranyageya-gan arnnygeyogaan .
 Sam Veda created on richa-s of Uttararchik are known as Ooh-gan .
uuhgaan .
The Sanskrit root ooh means to modify according to need .
Aranyageya-gan : Practiced in solitude of forest .
Also called Rahasyageyo-gan .
Ooh-gan : Pragath-s specially created for yajna on basis of Gramgeyo-gan .
Oohya-gan uuhygaan : Pragath-s created for yajna on basis of Rahasyageyo-gan .
There is a difference in number of songs attributed to different branches .
Shri Satvalekar in preface to Samveda Samhita has given the following table of songs .
Fox Strangways in Music of Hindustan says , Vocal scales are conceived downwards .
 They are so conceived , because the telling notes of the voice in Music of Hindustan upper register , and this presents itself , therefore as the starting point for a vocal scale .
 The Sayan # - bhashya on Sam-vidhan Brahmin establishes that note of Sam Veda were of nidhan prakriti and followed a descending order .
 In Naradiya Shiksha the seven notes of Sam Veda are First , Second , Third , Fourth , Mandra , Krushta and Atiswar .
 This indicates that initially only three or four notes were used for Samgan .
Archik songs were sung on the basis of just one note , e.g. Sa Sa Sa , or Ni Ni Ni .
This kind of chanting was well suited to Havan , Mantra-path and Jap .
Gathik songs were hymns in praise of deities and used two notes , e.g. Ni Ni Ni Ni , Sa Sa Sa Sa .
 Sam Veda songs for the first time used three notes .
 The word Sam Veda is taken to mean three notes .
The songs were like Ga Ga Re Re Sa Sa Sa .
Apart from these three basic notes , the singers came across a fourth which they called Swarantar .
 When they discovered a note lower than the lowest known note they called it Mandra .
 When a still lower note than Mandra was found they called a still lower note than Mandra Atiswar .
 A higher note determined was called Krushta after Sanskrit root Krush .
So the complete Samic Saptak in descending order contains : .
To preserve the Samik notes , Raga Sameshwari was created .
Dr. Lalmani Misra first translated the notes M G R S D N P into Shadja gram -- S N D P G M R -- and then created a Raga which is performed in the evening .
Shruti-jati is defined as the way in which a particular note could be applied to make the song appealing .
There are five with individual signs for three shruti-jati-s .
The hymn part of the Vedas are called Samhitas .
 the Brahmanas are the earliest known text after the Vedas were written , as explanation and appendices of the Vedas , and guides to the custom and practice of vedic singing and ritual .
The Upanisads and the Aranyakas became in turn appendices to the Brahmanas .
Upanishad or Vedanta deal with systematic treatment of metaphysical questions and form the philosophical basis of Hinduism .
 Upanishad or Vedanta are dated from 1000 BC to 300 BC , the end of the Vedic period to the beginning of Puranic period .
The Pre-Buddha time is considered Early Brahmana period and Post-Buddha period is considered the Later Brahmana period .
The oral texts were composed by a great number of rishis .
Though upanishads number more than a hundred , there are about 8 to 12 principal ones .
All upanishads are based on one of the four Vedas .
Upanisads deal with various subjects such as the nature of Brahman , the ideal human conduct , the practice of yoga , the nature of Atman , creation of the world , creation of humanity , the nature of reality , the nature of true knowledge and ignorance , the nature of consciousness , the concept of karma , and incarnation of soul .
A Rishi in Rig Veda is an author of a Rik , a hymn mantra , derived from oral tradition and direct insight , not from reasoning or intellect .
Envisioned are beings beyond the range of human senses , conceived from self-evident knowledge and realized Truth by direct intuition .
 Rishi Vamadeva , in hymn describes A Rishi in Rig Veda as the illumined one , expressing A Rishi in Rig Veda Truth revealed .
The term Rishi is defined as rishati jnanena samsara-param '' meaning one who goes beyond the mundane world by means of knowledge .
Further , some scholars think the root drish might have given rise to root rish meaning to see .
 The term Rishi is therefore a divine seer , a drastara , one who visualizes a mantra .
Also the one who hears the voices and song .
The seers were the hearers of the Truth .
Sri Aurobindo described Shruthi as divine recordings of cosmic sounds of truth heard by the Rishis .
The Vedas are thus Shruthis , revealed scriptures .
 Shruthis is the reason , the Vedas are Apaurusheya , not authored by any agency .
The Rig Veda contains 10,552 hymns ; grouped into 1,028 Sukthas each of roughly ten mantras , spread over ten Mandalas .
The Mandalas are of differing sizes .
These mantra songs are authored by some 400 Rishis of whom about 30 were women .
Of the ten Mandalas six Mandalas , numbering from 2 to 7 are homogenous in character and are considered the oldest parts of the Rig Veda .
 Each of these six books was composed by a The term Rishi and by members of the Rishi family/disciples and of the Gotra , and are therefore often called Family Books .
Books 1 , 8 and 10 composed by different individual Rishis .
 The Books 1 and 8 are almost Family Books as a majority of Each of these six books hymns are composed by the family of Kanvas and many hymns are found in both the Books .
The Book 9 is different from the rest ; all the hymns therein are addressed to Soma , from groups of Rishis .
The tenth Book is an addition of various early and late hymns .
Books 1 and 10 are the latest and longest , accounting for about 40 percent of the bulk of the Rig Veda .
Certain texts called Anukramani serve as Index to the Rig Veda and provide information about each hymn of the Rig Veda .
The most well-known of the Aukramani is Katyayana 's sarvanukramani and is dated around the 2nd century .
 The entries in the texts mention each hymn , specifying the name of the Rishi who authored the hymn , or transposed Katyayana 's sarvanukramani into writing ; the Devatha who inspired or to whom the hymn is addressed ; and the Chandas or the metre of the hymn .
 the true Sam are extremely useful in historical analysis of the Rig Veda
 Rajan and Sajan Mishra are Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra , renowned singers of the khyal style of Indian classical music .
 Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra were awarded the Padma Bhushan in 2007 , Sangeet Natak Akademi Award , jointly in 1998 , the Gandharwa National Award for 1994-1995 and the prestigious National Tansen Samman 2011-2012 on 14 December 2012 .
 Rajan and Sajan Mishra were born and brought up in Varanasi .
 Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra received Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra musical training from Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra grandfather , Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra , and also Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra father , Hanuman Prasad Mishra , and from Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra uncle , sarangi virtuoso , Gopal Prasad Mishra , and started performing while Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra were still in Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra teens .
 Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra moved to Ramesh Nagar in Delhi , in 1977 , where Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra continue to live .
 Rajan and Sajan Mishra are part of a 300-year old lineage of khyal singing of the Banaras gharana , the Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra brothers have been performing to audiences all over Indian and the world for many years .
 Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra were both accountants in a small shop when Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra gave a performance in the presences of Satguru Jagjit Singh .
 The Satguru , realizing Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra talent , offered to pay double Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra living wages in exchange for Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra to put in more time to practice Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra vocals .
 The rest was history and Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra gave Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra first concert abroad , was in Sri lanka in 1978 , and soon Bade Ram Das Ji Mishra went on to perform in many countries across the world including , Germany , France , Switzerland , Austria , USA , UK , The Netherlands , USSR , Singapore , Qatar , Bangladesh and Muscat .
