 Slovak much more unstable recovered a few days later , but was briefly kicked out of the band and replaced by DeWayne McKnight for a few shows .
 After a few days with DeWayne McKnight for a few shows , the band decided to give Slovak another chance , and DeWayne McKnight for a few shows rejoined for the European leg of the tour .
 audience member Anthony Kiedis attempted to take Slovak to drug addiction counseling , but Slovak had difficulty admitting that audience member Anthony Kiedis addiction was serious enough to require medical help .
 Upon returning home , Slovak isolated audience member Anthony Kiedis from the rest of audience member Anthony Kiedis bandmates , and struggled to resist the drug without the support of audience member Anthony Kiedis friends , and Kiedis in particular .
 audience member Anthony Kiedis stopped painting and writing in audience member Anthony Kiedis diary during this time , and little is known about audience member Anthony Kiedis life the weeks following the tour , aside from a phone call to audience member Anthony Kiedis brother on June 24 , in which Slovak told audience member Anthony Kiedis that audience member Anthony Kiedis was having difficulty staying clean despite audience member Anthony Kiedis desire to stop taking heroin .
A few weeks after the band returned from the tour , the members attempted to contact Slovak , but were unable to for several days .
 Slovak was found dead by police in audience member Anthony Kiedis Hollywood apartment on June 27 , 1988 .
 After police in his Hollywood apartment autopsy , authorities determined that police in his Hollywood apartment had died two days earlier due to a heroin overdose .
 police in his Hollywood apartment is interred at Mount Sinai Memorial Park Cemetery in Hollywood Hills , Southern California .
 Following Slovaks death audience member Anthony Kiedis fled town and did not attend the funeral , considering the situation to be surreal and dreamlike .
 Although audience member Anthony Kiedis found the death to be a shock , audience member Anthony Kiedis initially was not scared straight and continued to use heroin .
 However , a few weeks later audience member Anthony Kiedis friend convinced him both to check into rehab and visit Slovaks grave , which inspired him to get clean for five years .
 former Anthym-drummer Jack Irons was unable to cope with Slovaks death and subsequently quit the band , saying that former Anthym-drummer Jack Irons did not want to be part of something that resulted in the death of former Anthym-drummer Jack Irons friend .
 former Anthym-drummer Jack Irons has suffered from severe depression since Slovaks death .
 audience member Anthony Kiedis and Flea decided to continue making music , hoping to continue what Slovak helped build .
Slovak was primarily influenced by hard rock artists such as Jimi Hendrix , Santana , and Led Zeppelin .
 Jimi Hendrix , Led Zeppelin playing method was highly based on improvisation , a style commonly used in funk music .
 Jimi Hendrix , Led Zeppelin also was noted for Jimi Hendrix , Led Zeppelin aggressive playing style ; Jimi Hendrix , Led Zeppelin would often play with such force that Jimi Hendrix , Led Zeppelin fingers would come apart .
 audience member Anthony Kiedis observed that audience member Anthony Kiedis playing evolved during audience member Anthony Kiedis time away from the group in What is This ?
 , with Slovak adopting a more fluid style featuring sultry elements as opposed to Slovak adopting a more fluid style original hard rock techniques .
On Uplift , Slovak experimented with genres outside of traditional funk music including reggae and speed metal .
 Slovak adopting a more fluid style guitar riffs would often serve as the basis of the groups songs , with the other members writing This parts to complement Slovak adopting a more fluid style guitar work .
 Slovak adopting a more fluid style melodic riff featured in the song Behind the Sun inspired the group to create pretty songs with an emphasis on melody .
 audience member Anthony Kiedis describes the song as pure Hillel who first got me into hard rockin inspiration .
 Slovak also used a talk box on songs such as Green Heaven and Funky Crime , in which the sounds of audience member Anthony Kiedis amplified guitar would be played through a tube into audience member Anthony Kiedis mouth and then back into a microphone , creating psychedelic voice-like effects .
Slovak helped to incorporate new sounds in the groups work , including adding occasional drum machines .
 Despite the fact that the group billed itself as The Organic Anti-Beat Box Band , audience member Anthony Kiedis states that Slovak showed the group that drum machines could be used as artistic instruments .
Slovaks work was one of the major contributing factors to the Red Hot Chili Peppers early sound .
 When audience member Anthony Kiedis and Flea were searching for a new guitarist to replace Slovak , audience member Anthony Kiedis likened the experience to shopping for a new Mom and Dad because of audience member Anthony Kiedis influence over the band .
 Flea , who originally listened exclusively to jazz , added that Slovak introduced audience member Anthony Kiedis to a new genre of music , saying that it was Hillel who first got I into hard rockin .
 audience member Anthony Kiedis was also a huge influence on a young John Frusciante , who would later replace audience member Anthony Kiedis as guitarist in the band .
 Frusciante based a lot of his playing style on Slovaks work , and explained , I learned everything I needed to know about how to sound good with Flea by studying Hillels playing and I just took it sideways from there .
Just like Slovak before him , Frusciante developed a heroin addiction .
Unlike Slovak , Frusciante eventually managed to break and defeat the habit .
The songs Knock Me Down and My Lovely Man were written as tributes to Slovak .
In 1999 , a book titled Behind the Sun : The Diary and Art of Hillel Slovak was published .
 The book was authored by Slovaks brother , James Slovak , and features writings from his brothers diaries , paintings , photos and hand written notes from audience member Anthony Kiedis and Flea .
On December 7 , 2011 , the Red Hot Chili Peppers were announced as 2012 inductees to the Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame .
 In an interview with Rolling Stone , audience member Anthony Kiedis expressed audience member Anthony Kiedis excitement with Slovaks induction , explaining Hes a beautiful person that picked up a guitar in the 1970s and didnt make it out of the 1980s , and audience member Anthony Kiedis is getting honored for audience member Anthony Kiedis beauty .
 Flea echoed those comments on the same day : Hillel who first got me into hard rockin grew up loving rock and roll so much , audience member Anthony Kiedis has n't been here for some time , but I know how much it would mean to audience member Anthony Kiedis .
It 's a powerful thing
Shrikrishna Narayan Ratanjankar or S N Ratanjankar was a distinguished scholar and teacher of Hindustani classical music , from the Agra gharana .
 Foremost disciple of Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande and Faiyaz Khan of Baroda State , musicologist Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande also remained principal of Bhatkhande Music Institute , Lucknow , for many years , where musicologist Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande trained many noted names in the field of music .
 musicologist Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande father Narayan Govind Ratanjankar was born in Mumbai .
 Shrikrishnas grand father , Govindrao came to Mumbai in the middle of 19th century .
After graduation Shrikrishnas father , Narayanrao became a police officer in the then British regime .
At the age of 7 , S.N.Ratanjankar was trained under the guidance of Krishnam Bhatt of Karwar .
 S.N.Ratanjankar also received instruction from Anant Manohar Joshi and later under Faiyaz Khan of Agra gharana .
 In 1911 , S.N.Ratanjankar started training with musicologist Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande and is today musicologist Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande most well known disciple .
 S.N.Ratanjankar graduated from Bombay University in 1926 .
 In the year 1925 , Shrikrishna Narayan Ratanjankar graduated from the Wilson College , Mumbai .
 Shrikrishna Narayan Ratanjankar was the Principal of Bhatkhande Music University , at Lucknow for several years , later was appointed as Vice-Chancellor Indira Sangeet Kala Vishva Vidyalaya , Khairagarh , Madhya Pradesh .
 Later Shrikrishna Narayan Ratanjankar was once again called to head the Bhatkhande Sangeet Vidyapeeth on a 2 years contract .
 Shrikrishna Narayan Ratanjankar students include K. G. Ginde , SCR Krishnam Bhatt of Karwar , Chidanand Nagarkar , V.G. Jog , Dinkar Kaikini , Shanno Khurana , Sumati Mutatkar , Acharya Prabhakar Chinchore , C R Vyas , Chinmoy Lahiri , and Roshan Lal Nagrath .
 As a vocalist he sang Dhrupad and Khayal styles of Agra gharana .
A known vaggeyakara like his mentor Bhatkande , Ratanjankar has more than 800 compositions under his pen name Sujan , notated and documented diligently by his disciple K. G. Ginde .
He also published books including Geet Manjari , Taan Sangrah , Sangeet Shiksha , and Abhinava Geet Majari.In addition to these books he has also composed three operas .
He also composed some new ragas such as Marga Bihag , Gopika Basant , Kedar Bahar , Sawani Kedar , Ranjani Kalyan , Hansaranjani , Salagvarali and Yamani Bilawal .
He was appointed Chairman of the Jury of Auditions of AIR in the mid-1950s , during which time he was involved in a re-auditioning controversy , which involved re-auditioning of Indian musicians performing on AIR , who considered it an insult and opposed it and thus greatly diminished his reputation among Indian classical musicians .
In 1957 he was awarded the Padma Bhushan by the Government of India , and in 1963 the Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy for Music , Dance and Drama , awarded him its highest honour for lifetime achievement , the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship
Rakesh Chaurasia is an Indian composer and flautist , who plays the Indian bamboo flute .
He is the nephew and child prodigy of flautist Hariprasad Chaurasia .
He is one of his uncles most accomplished disciples .
These are major albums released by Rakesh Chaurasia , categorized by release dates
Dr. Bharati Vaishampayan is a Hindustani Classical Vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana and the current Dean and Head of Department of Music at Shivaji University .
Born on 1 January 1954 , in a family having a keen interest in music , Dr. Bharati Vaishampayan received her training in Hindustani classical music under Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar , Pandit Sudhakarbua Digrajkar and Pandit Nivruttibua Sarnaik .
She also imbibed the Light-Classical forms of Thumri and Dadra under the guidance of Shri Baburao Joshi .
Dr. Bharati completed her M.A. from SNDT Womens University , Mumbai in 1982 .
She has been honoured with the Sangeet Pravin by Gandharva Mahavidyalaya in 1985 .
 As a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana , a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana has performed in numerous concerts and festivals in various cities .
 a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana has broadcast widely for AIR since the year 1972 and has been honoured as an A grade artist in Classical and Light-Classical categories .
 a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana also has to a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana credit a number of special programmes and lecture-demonstrations on the rare and lesser performed Raagas of Hindustani music .
 a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana is involved in the propagation of the Hindustani music tradition to the next generation as Dean and Head of Department of Hindustani Classical Music at Shivaji University .
 a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana has visited many universities as expert for specialised lecture-demonstrations and refresher courses .
 a vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana has been awarded the title of Gaan Hira by SNDT Womens University , Mumbai .
Dr. Bharati started her journey into the world of Hindustani Classical Music at the age of 12 .
 Under the able guidance of Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar of Sangli Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar of Sangli evolved into a promising performer .
 Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar of Sangli was awarded the National Scholarship for Higher Education in Music by the Government of India in the year 1976 .
 Due to this Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar of Sangli got the opportunity to further Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar of Sangli learning under the guidance of Pandit Sudhakarbua Digrajkar of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana .
 This was a very important phase in Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar of Sangli evolution as a classical performer .
 Panditji gave Shri Chintubua Mhaiskar of Sangli a vision and direction on how to perform a Raaga and how to make the performance attractive without compromising on the purity of the Raaga .
This rigorous training resulted in an opportunity to perform on the AIR Tuesday Night Concert .
This turned out to be a turning point in the life of Dr. Bharati .
 Her performance on AIR was heard by the maestro of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana , Pandit Nivruttibua Sarnaik .
So impressed was he by the performance that he immediately wrote to Bharati and gave his blessings by accepting her as his student .
 Thereafter , whenever Panditji was in Kolhapur Panditji would teach her the gems of Jaipur-Atrauli gayaki in Panditji own style .
 During this period Dr. Bharati came in contact with Shri Baburao Joshi of Kolhapur who trained her in the Light-Classical forms of music like Thumri , Dadra , Kajri , Jhoola and Tappa .
 The blessings of her Gurus and her Gurus devotion to music led to her Gurus becoming a capable and confident performer .
 Dr. Bharati Vaishampayan has performed in over 500 live concerts all over India .
Some of the prestigious concerts are : .
Dr. Bharati Vaishampayan has also participated in various special programmes and lecture-demonstrations .
Chief among them are : .
Dr. Bharati Vaishampayan first performed on All India Radio in the year 1972 .
She has been honoured with the status of A Grade artist for Classical as well as Light-Classical categories .
 Apart from various concert broadcasts on radio , Dr. Bharati has also worked as an Expert on the Selection Committee at AIR , Sangli in 1990 .
 She has also participated in various discussions on AIR , notably Future of Classical Music and Swarlipi of Pandit Bhatkhande .
She has also given Classical performances on the Music Asia channel in the programme titled Alaap .
Currently this programme is being telecast on the Z Marathi channel .
Two CDs of various live performances of Dr. Bharati have been released by Musicians Guild .
These CDs feature Raagas like Shuddha Kalyan , Yaman , Shankara , Khambavati , Kaushi Kanada , Adana Bahaar and Malvi .
 Dr. Bharati has been actively involved in the Marathi tradition of Sangeet Naatak .
Her major contribution in this field , is the direction for Marathi Sangeet Naataks , Sangeet Sharda , Sangeet Maanapmaan and Sangeet Swayamvar .
Sangeet Swayamvar won the 1st prize for Best Naatak along with a total of 33 awards at Bruhanmaharashtra Shaikshanik Sanstha , Delhi .
Dr. Bharati is an examiner and member of the Board of Studies of various universities namely Dharwad university , Goa university , Marathwada university , Nagpur university , Pune university , M.S. university Baroda , Kurukshetra university and Amravati university .
Dr. Bharati Vaishampayan is the recipient of many awards and recognitions .
Chief among these are : .
A true performer not only entertains with her music , but also becomes a Guru for the next generation for the spread of her art .
Dr. Bharati has successfully worked for the spread of Indian music on various fronts .
Dr. Bharati is an able guide for Ph.D. students .
 So far 7 students have completed their Doctorate in Hindustani Classical Music under her guidance .
 Dr. Bharati has been involved in the nurture of the Music department of Shivaji University , Kolhapur , since its inception in 1984 .
She became the Head of the Music department in 1987 .
What started as a small classroom with a few students has now grown into an institution with various departments and courses on classical as well as folk music .
Hundreds of students of this prestigious institution are now successfully pursuing their career in music .
The tradition of music is being continued by Dr. Bharatis next generation under her guidance .
Her son Kedar is a post-graduate in Tabla , daughters Meera and Madhura are post-graduates in Vocal music and Sangeet Alankaar , and daughter-in-law Sheetal is a post-graduate in Vocal music
R. K. Bijapure , born January 7 , 1917 is an Indian harmonium player in the Hindustani classical tradition .
Pt .
Bijapure was born in 1917 at Kagwad .
 R. K. Bijapure father Dr.Sudhanshu Kulkarni Shri .
Kallopant Bijapure was a dramatist and composer .
Pt .
 Bijapures first Guru was Dr.Sudhanshu Kulkarni Shri .
Annigeri Mallayya .
 Annigeri Mallayya . took further training in harmonium from Pt .
Rajwade , Shri.Govindrao Gaikwad and Pt .
Hanmantrao Walwekar .
 Hanmantrao Walwekar . also learned vocal music from stalwarts like Pt .
Ramkrishnabua Vaze , Pt .
 Shivrambua Vaze , Pt .
Kagalkarbua , and Pt .
Utturkarbua .
Sangeet Visharad and Sangeet Alankar from Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya .
Pt .
Bijapure worked as a music Director and Harmonium player for Shri.Venkobrao Shirahatti 's drama company , as a harmonium player for HMV company , as a music examiner for Akhila Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya and for Karnataka Government .
 Pt.Bijapure has a music Director own unique style of Harmonium Solo .
 a music Director has rendered a music Director solo performances in all major music centers of the country including Pune , Hyderabad , Bangalore , Kolhapur , Hubli , Dharwad and on AIR .
During the Festival of Russia in India , a Russian delegation was mesmerized after listening to Panditji 's solo .
 They specially recorded on the video Panditji 's swift finger movements on harmonium keyboard .
As an accompanist he has accompanied four generations of vocalists right from Pt.Ramkrishnabua Vaze , Pt.Shivrambua Vaze , Pt.Kagalkarbua , Pt .
Sawai Gandharva , Pt.D.V.Paluskar , Pt.Utturkarbua , Ustad Amir Khan , Ustad Bade Gulam Ali Khan , Dr.Gangubai .
 Hangal , Pt .
 Bhimsen Joshi , Pt .
 Basavraj Rajguru , Pt .
 Mallikarjun Mansoor , Pt .
Kumar Gandharva , Vidushi Manik Verma , Dr. Prabha Atre , Vidushi Kishori Amonkar , Vidushi Malini Rajurkar , and many other stalwarts .
 Kumar Gandharva has Kumar Gandharva unique style of accompaniment .
 While complementing the main artistes Kumar Gandharva uses the pauses available in between to add charm to the concert .
 Building a continuous rapport with the audience is another feature of Kumar Gandharva presentation .
 Kumar Gandharva started `` Shri Ram Sangeet Mahavidyalaya '' in 1938 .
 Over 10,000 students have gained under Kumar Gandharva tutelage .
 Some of Kumar Gandharva well known disciples include Dr.Sudhanshu Kulkarni Shri .
Ravindra Mane , Dr. Ravindra Katoti , Smt .
 Kunda Welling , Dr.Sudhanshu Kulkarni Shri .
Shridhar Kulkarni , Mala Adhyapak , Aparna Chitnis , Madhuli Bhave , Deepak Marathe , Mahesh Telang .
Pt .
 R. K. Bijapure died on 19 November 2010 due to age related health issues .
 However R. K. Bijapure was still actively teaching R. K. Bijapure disciples until R. K. Bijapure last few days
Imrat Khan is a leading sitar and surbahar player .
 Imrat Khan is the younger brother of sitar maestro Ustad Vilayat Khan .
 Imrat was born in Calcutta into a family of musicians tracing Calcutta pedigree back for several generations , to the court musicians of the Mughal rulers .
His father was Enayat Khan , recognised as a leading sitar and surbahar player of his time , as had been his grandfather , Imdad Khan , before him .
His father died when Imrat was a child , so he was raised by his mother , Bashiran Begum and her father , singer Bande Hassan Khan .
In 1944 , the family moved with rising star Vilayat Khan , Imrats elder brother , to Bombay where both the brothers learned extensively from uncle Wahid Khan , Enayat Khans brother .
 Wahid Khan was one of the greatest surbahar players of Wahid Khan generation and a top-level sitar player , and taught Imrat on the instruments in the family style , known as the Imdadkhani gharana , or Etawah Gharana , after a village outside Agra where Imdad Khan lived .
 In 1952 Vilayat and Imrat moved in together in Calcutta .
 Vilayat and Imrat performed together for many years .
 From the 1960s onwards , Imrat has performed and recorded solo , playing both sitar and surbahar .
 For decades , Imrat has recorded extensively on both Imrat instruments .
 Imrat full performance practice starts with a surbahar alap in dhrupad ang , followed by a shorter alap on the sitar leading into gat in traditional Imdadkhani style .

He has toured in Europe , the Americas , and East and Southeast Asia .
 Surbahar players are rare today , and Imrat is the main living exponent .
 Imrat has five sons , Nishat , Irshad , Wajahat and Shafaatullah , and Azmat Khan , now only eight ; the first four sons are all classical musicians : Nishat plays the sitar , Wajahat concentrates on the sarod and Shafaatullah is accomplished on sitar , tabla , and surbahar .
The surbahar tradition is largely upheld by Irshad , who has made some very traditional solo recordings .
Imrat Khan currently spends a portion of each year teaching classical Indian music and instructing sitar students at Washington University in Saint Louis .
 In addition to Imrat Khan sons , Brian Jones of the Rolling Stones and George Harrison of The Beatles have been some of Nishat famous students
Zamzama is an Arabic word meaning Thunder , or Roar .
 As with many Arabic and Persian words , Arabic has been taken into Urdu and is now considered indegenous to that language .
The meaning is : addition of notes .
 Zamzama is a type of Alankara or Alankar -RRB- and part of the ornamentic in Indian Classical music , mainly for Raga performances - instrumental same as vocalistic .
Like a khatka , another type of Alankara , Zamzama is a cluster of notes , which is used by the musician to embellish the landing note .
The difference to a khatka is , that the notes in a Zamzama are rendered in progressive combinations and permutations .
 For the listener The difference to a khatka sounds like a complex taan pattern with sharp gamaks .
Zamzamas are an integral part of tappa singing and best applied herefore .
 In Khayal renditions - a vocal style of North Indian Classics a vocal style of North Indian Classics must be applied with great caution by the vocalist
The Sawai Gandharva Bhimsen Mahotsav is an annual Indian Classical music festival held in Pune since 1953 .
Arguably the largest , most popular , and sought-after Indian Classical music festival in the world , the festival is hosted by the Arya Sangeet Prasarak Mandal and initiated by Pt .
Bhimsen Joshi as a memorial music conference commemorating the life and work of Pt .
Joshis guru , Pt .
Sawai Gandharva alias Rambhau Kundgolkar , the festivals namesake .
While Pt .
Joshi was leading the organization of the festival , performing artists received personal invitations from Pt .
Joshi to perform at the festival .
With an emphasis on Hidustani Classical Khayal music , instrumentalists , dancers , dhrupadiyas , Bhakti musicians , Ghazal musicians , Qawwaliyas , and Carnatic musicians frequent the concert lineup .
 A younger artists debut performance at the festival connotes A younger artists arrival and promise to the Classical music scene of India .
Since its inception , the festival has grown into a prominent cultural soiree for Punes musical connoisseurs , featuring the foremost musicians of traditional Indian musical forms .
The festival was started in 1953 on a small scale , to commemorate the first death anniversary of Pt .
Sawai Gandharva , the acclaimed Hindustani Classical vocalist of the Kirana Gharana .
The festival played a key role in the development of Hindustani Classical music in Indias post-independence cultural history .
Prior to Indian Independence , Hindustani Classical musicians were supported by monarchs under patronage as court musicians since the beginning of the Mughal Empire .
 After independence , the political division between India and Pakistan culturally alienated many Hindustani musicians .
 The newfound Indian Republic resulted in an end to the patronage of many Hindustani musicians .
 Classical musicians were forced to find new methods of sustaining Hindustani Classical musicians and Hindustani Classical musicians art .
 Public performances of Classical musicians rose as a result , where the Sawai Gandharva Music Festival played an integral role in establishing a regional audience for Indian Classical music .
Within the first several decades following Indian Independence , a great number of music festivals or music conferences were founded in order to provide a platform for Classical musicians to perform .
Pt .
Bhimsen Joshi was leading the organization of the festival since its beginning until 2002 when his health problems became of concern .
Following , Pt .
Joshis youngest son , Shrinivas Joshi , and senior disciple , Shrikant Deshpande , succeeded Pt .
Joshi in organizing the music conference .
Since Bhimsen Joshi s death in 2011 , Shrinivas Joshi and Anand Deshmukh have been leading organizers of the music conference .
The festival was initiated specifically to showcase performers of the Kirana Gharana and started on a small scale .
 Gharana-specific music festivals were popular at the time because many Hindustani musicians wanted to commercialize many Hindustani musicians Gharana style and A younger artists .
Pt .
 Bhimsen Joshi was instrumental in inviting many Hindustani musicians from varying backgrounds to the festival because of his own appreciation and reverence for diverse approaches to presenting Indian Classical music .
 By the late 1970s , the festival established itself as a festival that had the fullest representation of the Classical music temperament in India .
As a result , the festival has become an annual event for music connoisseurs worldwide and reinforces the modernity of Indian Classical Music .
 The 2009 the Sawai Gandharva Music Festival was postponed to January 2010 due to an H1N1 scare in Pune .
This was the first instance in festival history of any kind of postponement .
Recently , many festival regulars have criticized the festivals growing commercial success for causing a decrease in musical quality .
Many attribute this to Pt .
Bhimsen Joshis retirement from organizing the festival after 2002 .
At the 59th festival in 2011 , the performances of senior musicians like Utd .
Amjad Ali Khan and Dr. Prabha Atre were interrupted due to time restrictions , angering audiences .
Many have also criticized the ASPM for inviting fewer musicians of less popularity to perform .
The ASPM has also been criticized for not publicly releasing vintage recordings of past festival performances .
After Pt .
Bhimsen Joshis death in January 2011 , the Arya Sangeet Prasarak Mandal decided to rename the festival Sawai Gandharva Bhimsen Mahotsav in honor of the legendary vocalist .
The Sawai Gandharva Music Festival is conducted every year in the first two weeks of December over three days .
In the past , the festival runs through whole the night and the days used to end in the morning .
Later on , when Pune Municipal Corporation set rule to finish the program before 10pm which leads to change in the schedule of the program .
Traditionally , each festival is inaugurated with a tribute honoring Pt .
Sawai Gandharva , with a Shehnai musician performing first , in the early morning .
During the first two days , programs begin in the late-afternoon and are supposed to officially end by 10 p.m. On the third and final day , the programme is conducted in two sessions , the first beginning in the early morning continuing until the early afternoon , the second session begins in the early evening and ends at 10 p.m. .
It has been tradition that the last , finale performance is presented by Pt .
Bhimsen Joshi .
Since Pt .
Joshis retirement in 2004 , other members of the Kirana Gharana have concluded the festival , including Pt .
Sangmeshwar Gurav in 2005 , leading disciples of Pt .
Bhimsen Joshi in 2006 .
Doyen of Kirana Gharana , eminent vocalist Dr. Prabha Atre has concluded every festival since 2007 .
 The festival officially concludes with the entire audience and remaining performers listening to the Thumri in Raag Bhairavi recording Jamuna Ke Teer by Sawai Gandharva , a tune made famous by and signature of the Thumri guru , Utd .
Abdul Karim Khan .
The Arya Sangeet Prasarak Mandal takes the task of recording details of the festival each year .
The festival has been recorded in picture , video and audio , some of which is commercially available .
 Gharana-specific music festivals are listed counter-chronologically .
The following musicians have performed at the Sawai Gandharva festival .
The featured musicians have included :
Ustad Wahid Khan was an Indian surbahar and sitar player .
 Ustad Wahid Khan was the son of Ustad Imdad Khan and belonged to the Imdadkhani gharana or Etawah Gharana of classical music .
 Ustad Wahid Khan brother Ustad Enayat Khan was also a sitar and a surbahar player .
 Ustad Wahid Khan and Ustad Enayat Khan were both trained by Ustad Wahid Khan and Ustad Enayat Khan father in sitar and surbahar .
 Ustad Wahid Khan specialised in the surbahar while Ustad Wahid Khan brother Ustad Enayat Khan specialised in sitar .
Ustad Wahid Khan was born in Etawah , Uttar Pradesh to the sitar maestro Ustad Imdad Khan .
 Ustad Wahid Khan was still quite young when Imdad Khan moved to Kolkata from Etawah with the sitar maestro Ustad Imdad Khan family .
 In kolkata the family lived in the house of the noted connoisseur Taraprasad Ghosh , where Ustad Imdad Khan rigorously trained the sitar maestro Ustad Imdad Khan two talented sons Enayat Khan and Wahid Khan .
 Wahid Khan , at a very young age , was first initiated into Dhrupad , Khayal and Thumri and then in trained extensively on the the Sitar and Ustad Wahid Khan by Ustad Wahid Khan father Imdad Khan for many years .
 Under the guidance and supervision of Ustad Wahid Khan father , Wahid Khan put in many years of very rigorous riyaz and mastered both the the Sitar and Ustad Wahid Khan .
The later generations regard him as the greatest Surbahar-player of his generation , however he was also one of the greatest sitar-players of his generation .
His available disc recordings of Khamaj and Piloo both on the Sitar offer a glimpse of his virtuosity on the instrument .
 In Kolkata , Wahid Khan used to accompany Ustad Wahid Khan father in many of the latters concerts on the Sitar and the Surbahar and received huge appreciation and critical acclaim everywhere .
 Imdad Khan , later , moved out of Kolkata to settle in the Indore Darbar as the Court-musician of the Maharaja Holkar of the Indore Darbar .
 the sitar maestro Ustad Imdad Khan sons Enayat Khan and Wahid Khan accompanied the sitar maestro Ustad Imdad Khan to the Indore Darbar .
 There Imdad Khan died , following which Enayat Khan left the Indore Darbar and returned to Kolkata , while Wahid Khan was appointed the Court-musician of the Indore Darbar , where Ustad Wahid Khan lived for 18 years on a very high salary .
 Wahid Khan also served the Patiala Darbar for 3 years as the Patiala Darbar Court-musician .
 Ustad Wahid Khan was also the Court-musician of the Nizam of Hyderabad .
Wahid Khan was a regular performer at the All India Radio .
 Ustad Wahid Khan also performed all over India and received numerous awards and medals from the famous institutions of Tikamgarh , Rewa , Baroda , Mysore , Dhaulpur , etc. .
 Ustad Wahid Khan also appeared in legendary filmmaker Satyajit Ray 's international award winning film Jalsaghar where Ustad Wahid Khan performs on the surbahar in one of the scenes .
Ustad Wahid Khan is the paternal uncle of noted sitar player Ustad Vilayat Khan and the famous surbahar player Ustad Imrat Khan .
 Ustad Wahid Khan grandson is the famous Ustad Shahid Parvez
Bharatiya Sangeet Vadya is a book written by Dr. Lalmani Misra .
 a book written by Dr. Lalmani Misra was published under the Lokodya Granthmala series of Bharatiya Jnanpith , New Delhi .
The first edition was published in 1973 , the second in 2002 .
The book was written in Hindi .
 a book written by Dr. Lalmani Misra was described in a 1974 review in Ethnomusicology , the journal of the Society for Ethnomusicology , as the most complete , authoritative work ever published on the history of Indian musical instruments .
The book carries an exhaustive documentation of musical instruments , right from the ancient Vedic age to modern times , with an emphasis on establishing that modern Indian instruments have their origins in ancient Indian , rather than in Muslim and Western , culture .
 The book has always been in great demand by scholars and musicians for a book written by Dr. Lalmani Misra also gives insight into fundamentals of playing instruments and traces the development in content along with that of the instrument .
The book is currently under translation ; an English version may soon be available
The Mohan Veena is a stringed musical instrument used in Indian classical music .
It derives its name from its inventor , the Grammy Award winning Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt who resides in Jaipur India .
The instrument is actually a modified Archtop guitar and consists of 20 strings viz .
three melody strings , five drone strings strung to the peghead , and twelve sympathetic strings strung to the tuners mounted on the side of the neck .
A gourd is screwed into the back of the neck for improved sound quality and vibration .
 A gourd is held in the lap like a slide guitar .
The Mohan Veena is under tremendous tension ; the total strings pull to be in excess of 500 pounds .
 Some of the popular performers include Some of the popular performers inventor , Grammy Award winner Pandit Vishwa Mohan Bhatt , Pandit Salil Bhatt and Pandit Satish Khanwalkar
Krishna Mohan Bhatt is a sitar player , teacher and scholar from Jaipur , India .
 the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt comes from a family of musicians in Jaipur .
 the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt father , the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt , a sitarist of great repute and a professor at the University of Rajasthan , Jaipur trained many musicians in the family including Krishna Bhatt , Manju Mehta in Ahmedabad and Vishwa Mohan Bhatt .
 Krishna Bhatt 's forefathers migrated from the south of Jaipur , India to the state of Rajasthan in the northwest , a princely state then , to seek employment in the `` Gunijankhana '' of the Maharaja of Jaipur .
 Krishna Bhatt 's forefathers were Sanskrit scholars , poets , and musicians .
 In the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt teens , Krishna 's musical grooming was further enhanced by many years of study under the tutelage of the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt Guru Pt .
Ravi Shankar , and musicians Pt .
Nikhil Banerjee and Ustad Ali Akbar Khan , who had a strong impact on Krishnas musical growth .
 While developing Nikhil Banerjee own individual style , Krishna 's music was greatly influenced by twentieth century stalwarts such as the vocalists Amir Khan , Bade Gulam Ali Khan , Abdul Karim Khan , Begum Akhtar , Shobha Gurtu as well as folk singers of Rajasthan , India .
Krishna 's repertoire in performance includes a wide variety of rare and old traditional compositions from these masters of music .
Krishna Bhatt has received numerous awards and honors including the Sangeet Kalaratna in 2009 .
 the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt was also presented the `` Gunijan '' award by the President of Jaipur , India Mrs. Pratibha Patil in 2005 and was conferred the `` Kalashiroman '' samman by the Maharaja of Jodhpur Shri Gajsinghji and Shri John Singhji of Jaipur Virasat Foundation in 2007 in Rajasthan , India , India .
Krishna Bhatt has been twice the recipient of the AIIS fellowship awards in 1998 and 2004 in the category of performing arts .
 In addition to performing Hindustani classical music , the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt has also performed and recorded with the American composer Terry Riley , Zakir Hussain , the Kronos Quartet , Jody Stecher , jazz saxophonist George Brooks , and Rajasthani folk musicians .
 the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt divides the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt time between Jaipur , Rajasthan , India and New York City , where the late Shashi Mohan Bhatt continues to perform and teach
Kumar Bose is an Indian tabla maestro and composer of Indian classical music .
Bose belongs to the Benaras Gharana style of tabla playing .
 Having honed Kumar Bose skills under the tutelage of the legendary Pandit Kishan Maharaj , Pandit Bose rose to prominence with Kumar Bose flamboyant performances with Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 In addition to Kumar Bose musical abilities , Bose is also an awarded sportsman , a carrom champion , and fluently speaks four languages .
 In a career spanning more than four decades , Pandit Kumar Bose has established Pandit Kumar Bose as one of the leading exponents of the tabla and an internationally recognised face in the world of Indian Classical Music .
 Pandit Kumar Bose received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2007 .
Bose was born in Kolkata in a musical family .
His father was Biswanath Bose , a distinguished tabla player who taught his son to play his first beat of rhythm .
 His mother Bharati Bose was an eminent sitarist and disciple of the great Dabir Khan and Ali Akbar Khan Bharati received several awards in His mother Bharati Bose career , including recognition as an All India Radio Artist and the Presidents Award for Best Sitar Performance in 1956 .
 His mother Bharati Bose guided His mother Bharati Bose son with the basic forms of classical music and helped him to groom himself as a professional tabla player .
His brothers are also noted musicians , who keep a traditional , thorough and vigorous training regime .
His brother Acharya Jayanta Bose is an internationally reputed composer , lyrist , harmonium soloist and singer , while his brother Debojyoti Bose is a noted sarod player and music director .
 Boses first teacher was Boses first teacher father .
 After Boses first teacher father 's untimely death , he was taught by Kishan Maharaj , a highly respected musician .
Bose has been applauded for evolving a distinctive style of his own without diluting the purity of tradition .
Bose has elevated the tabla as a musical instrument in its own right , both through solo performances as a main artist and through his accompaniment of others .
Bose has been devoted to the classic tabla for 35 years without interruption and is considered one of the most powerful players alive .
A master percussionist , Bose plays several other drums besides the tabla which include the sri-khole , the pakhwaj , the dholak , the nal , and the banga-kanga .
 However , it is the unusual way that A master percussionist plays the bnaya that has brought A master percussionist attention .
 A master percussionist plays the bass drum-like instrument with A master percussionist right hand , although A master percussionist plays the tabla with A master percussionist left .
 Though A master percussionist is right-handed , A master percussionist picked up this practice by sitting across from and mirroring A master percussionist father from early childhood .
 Bose gave A master percussionist first public performance at the age of 4 .
 By 14 , A master percussionist performed abroad and has played at almost every major music hall in the world since .
 A master percussionist has performed at the Royal Albert Hall and the Barbican Centre in London , the Kremlin in Moscow , the Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts and Carnegie Hall in New York , and at various venues throughout India.He also has the distinction of having performed for Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Charles as an accompanist to Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 A master percussionist has the rare distinction of highly-acclaimed performances with Zubin Mehta s Philharmonic Orchestra and participation in several symphony orchestras conducted by Ravi Shankar , Yehudi Menuhin , and Arnovich in England , Italy , China , Russia and the United States .
In addition to a 10 year exclusive tour as the tabla accompanist to Ravi Shankar from 1984 to 1994 , he has performed and composed with musicians globally .
Over the past 40 years , he has also performed and recorded in duets with his guru .
 From the Benaras Gharana , Benaras Gharana has played with Girija Devi , Rajan and Sajan Mishra , Kanthe Maharaj , and Kishan Maharaj .
 While Benaras Gharana has collaborated with leaders in jazz , pop and rock , it was Benaras Gharana duet with Iranian thumba player Professor Semurani that drew praise .
Boses collaborations have given an international reputation as a great musician .
Of the six established tabla gharanas or schools of tabla playing , the Benares Gharana , of which Bose belongs , has been the most staunch in its refusal to compromise the traditions when moving into more lucrative contemporary fusions .
While criticized decades ago for his rigidity and refusal to adapt modern fusion and film music , Bose is now credited with preserving classical musical style and philosophy .
He has kept the tradition of the Benares Gharana by subtly balancing the warm bass tones of the bayan with the higher-pitched crisp tones and syncopations of the dayan .
 Many of Boses compositions have been written to accompany the rhythmical movements of kathak dancers and are a specialty of the the Benares Gharana tradition .
 Bose currently conducts private lessons in the style of Many of Boses compositions mentors .
 Many of Boses compositions conducts classes daily with students from age 3 to 35 at Many of Boses compositions home in North Calcutta .
 Many of Boses compositions is known for maintaining high standards for Many of Boses compositions students , emphasizing the importance devoted practice and other aspects of the tradition .
 Many of Boses compositions high profile students also includes the likes of the Mumbai-based tabla player Shyama Prasad Das .
 Bose has produced or performed on over 200 recordings in several genres , while staying true to Many of Boses compositions classical Indian lineage .
 The first live international recording of Many of Boses compositions solo Virtuosity was released through the Darbar Festival 2006 in London .
 The album includes some rare gems from the archives of the the Benares Gharana repertoire , including the compositions of Ram Sahai , who founded the gharana at the beginning of the nineteenth century .
 Toward the end of the album , Bose demonstrates one of his specialities : playing a variety of cross rhythms on the dayan with Ram Sahai right hand while simultaneously holding down a fast repetitive beat on the bnaya with his left hand .
The Times reviewed the performance , declaring him the best tabla player in the world today .
Kumar Bose is married to Kaberi Bose , a classical singer and they have a daughter Trisha Bose , a vocalist
Equalize is an Urban Desi album by the UK band Swami released on September 24 , 2007 .
Their two previous albums were DesiRock in 2004 , and So Who Am I in 2005 .
The tracklisting was confirmed on April 16 , 2007 by BBC Radio 1 DJ Nihal , and the name was confirmed on May 8 , 2007 , by bandmember DJ Swami on the official Swami forum .
The album features South African vocalist Ishmael , French rap group Asuivre , Sonia Panesar , Lady Ru , Romesh Chohan , Bobby Panesar , El Feco , Pras of The Fugees , MC Spee of Dreadzone , Yam Boy , Boostylz , as well as Swami vocalists S-Endz and Sups .
On May 23 , 2007 , a one-minute clip of Electro Jugni was premiered on Swamis Official MySpace page , as well as the press release for the new album .
On June 15 , a live version of the song was premiered instead , recorded at the 2007 Wychwood Festival .
 Hey Hey premiered on Swamis Official MySpace page on August 1 , 2007 , and the album artwork was revealed at the same time .
 Following the premiere of the song and artwork , the Swamis Official MySpace page page was changed to reflect the new release date of September 2007 .
 On June 11 , 2008 , an all-new English language version of Electro Jugni , entitled Shes Mine was premiered by DJ Nihal on BBC Radio 1 .
 On September 10 , 2007 , September 10 , 2007 was announced on Swamis MySpace page that anyone pre-ordering the album through Swamis Official MySpace page would receive a limited signed edition and also receive the album before the official release date .
Tracks # 1-7 all appeared on the EMI India release of Equalize .
On August 29 , 2007 , a preview of a live video for Electro Jugni was uploaded to the video-sharing site YouTube .
 A month later , stills from a forthcoming video for Hey Hey were uploaded to Swamis MySpace blog and the full video was premiered a week later on YouTube .
In May 2008 , it was revealed that a full music video for Electro Jugni had been filmed .
 A preview of the video surfaced on YouTube around the same time but was later removed .
The video premiered later in the year and was very well received by fans , generating 200,000 plays on YouTube in less than 3 weeks
Altaf Hussain Tafo Khan is a master tabla player .
Tafo Khan was formed in the Punjab gharana .
 Altaf Hussain Tafo Khan teachers were Mian Qadir Bukhsh and Haji Fida Hussain .
 Mian Qadir Bukhsh is recognised for Mian Qadir Bukhsh matchless tayyari and Mian Qadir Bukhsh solo performances are characterised by Mian Qadir Bukhsh prowess over difficult bols .
 Altaf Hussain Tafo Khan has performed near lots of great legends including Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan
Natya Sangeet is a form of Indian classical and semi-classical music .
The name literally means Dramatic Music and the musical dramas are then called as Sangeet Natak .
 The name is also one of the two popular forms of vocal arts in Maharashtra and surrounding states .
The other one is Bhavageet .
Natya Sangeet is said to have originated in the 19th century in a region that is now the state of Maharashtra in India .
 In past music was monopoly of Princes and other rich class.common people could not enjoy classical music.Natya sangeet basically emerged so that the common people could also enjoy classical music as monopoly of Princes is based on classical base.The main difference between bhavgeet and natyageet is the former give much importance to words while later gives much importance to Raga .
 In 1879 , Playwriter and producer Trilokekar independently presented Playwriter musical play Nal-Damayanti to Marathi public .
It was the first musical play on Marathi stage .
 Later on Balwant Pandurang Kirloskar staged Playwriter first musical play Shakuntal on October 31 , 1880 which was based on Kalidass play Abhijnanasakuntalam .
 Annasaheb Kirloskar wrote shakuntal in 1880 which was based on Kalidass , thereby starting a new tradition of sangita natak in Maharashtra .
 During 1880 which was based on Kalidass early period , Sangeet natak was dominated by religious plays like Sangeet Saubhdra , which is legend in Marathi sangeet natak .
 The trend changed with coming of sangeet Manapman , which depicts bravery of sangeet Manapman hero Dheryadhar and Sangeet Natak love with Bhamini which was written by Krushnaji Prabhakar Khadilkar .
During 1960s , another turn came in natya sangeet with the emergence of Jitendra Abhisheki , who was credited with applying simplicity to the complex composition of Natya Sangeet
Mogubai Kurdikar was a renowned Hindustani classical music vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana .
Mogu Kurdikar was born in a Gomantak Maratha Samaj community in the village of Kurdi in the then Portuguese Goa .
 When Mogu Kurdikar was ten years old , Mogu Kurdikar mother , Jayashreebai , took Mogu Kurdikar to the temple at Zambavli , and arranged for a wandering holyman to teach music to Mogu for a while .
 Later Mogu Kurdikar took Mogu for a while to a traveling theater company , the Chandreshwar Bhootnath Sangeet Mandali , and the company took Mogu for a while in as an actress .
 While Mogu was with Chandreshwar Bhootnath Mandali , Mogu Kurdikar mother died .
 A legend says that on her deathbed the mother told Mogu for a while that Jayashreebai soul would not rest in peace until Mogu for a while became a famous singer .
 The theater company soon went bankrupt , and the rival Satarkar Stree Sangeet Mandali hired Mogu for a while .
 Mogu for a while played commendably the parts such as of Kinkini in the play , Punyaprabhav , and of the heroine Subhadra in the play with the same name , Subhadra .
 A conflict arose , however , between Mogu for a while and one of the senior women in the theater company , who then expelled Mogu for a while from the company .
 Mogu for a while moved to Sangli , and took some music lessons from Inayat Khan of the Rampur-Sahaswan gharana .
 For some reason , however , he too soon decided to terminate giving Mogu for a while further lessons .
 At this time , vocalist legend Gaansamrat Alladiya Khan Saheb was in Sangli for medical treatment , and on his way to and from his doctors , he walked by Mogu for a while residence , where he would hear Mogu for a while practice what Mogu for a while had learnt from Inayat Khan .
 One day he stopped , introduced himself and offered to teach Mogu for a while .
 Young Mogu of course agreed , but despite Alladiyas fame , Alladiyas had not heard of Young Mogu of course - Alladiyas fame was not until some time later , when Alladiyas observed dignitaries bow down to Young Mogu of course , that Alladiyas fully realised Young Mogu of course standing .
After some eighteen months , Alladiya Khan moved to Bombay , and Mogu followed .
Thus begun a time of intrigue in Bombays high-society and classical music circles .
 For Alladiya was supported in Bombay by wealthy patrons in exchange for music teaching , and they would not let him take other students .
 In desperation , Mogu turned to Bashir Khan of the Agra gharana , who agreed to teach Bombays high-society if Bombays high-society would perform the formal gandha-bandan ceremony of guru-shishya discipleship with fellow Agra ustad Vilayat Hussein Khan .
 This came to happen , and Alladiya heard of This .
 He demanded that Bombays high-society stop the discipleship and instead go to his brother , Hyder Khan .
 But as the Agra ustads had a lot of clout , Mogu for a while hesitated , and solicited a promise that Alladiya would teach Mogu for a while himself in the future if Hyder ever failed to do so .
 A deal was worked out , Hyder taught Mogu for a while for a while , but Alladiyas rich and powerful students were putting a lot of pressure on Hyder to put a stop to it , increasingly jealous of Alladiyas progress .
 About 1930 , Alladiya felt forced to persuade his brother to stop teaching and leave town , but came clean to the heartbroken Mogu about what had happened , essentially breaking Hyder Khan promise .
 At this stage in her career , Mogu for a while could likely have supported herself as a performer .
But she chose not to .
Not content with the prospect of being just another name on the scene , she wanted to become the best , the foremost representative of a tradition .
She gave birth to a daughter , Kishori , and kept practicing on her own , until one day Alladiya came back to her .
They performed the gandha-bandan , and he now kept teaching her to the end of his life .
She became one of the topmost singers in North India , even hailed as the queen by Alladiya in public .
She received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1968 and the Sangeet Research Academy Award in 1980 , and was decorated with the Padma Bhushan , Indias third highest civilian honour for service to the nation , in 1974 .
 Mogu for a while trained students such as Kaushalya Manjeshwar , Padma Talwalkar , Kamal Tambe , Wamanrao Deshpande , Suhasini Mulgaonkar , Babanrao Haldankar , Arun Dravid , and Mogu for a while own daughter , Kishori Amonkar Some of Mogubais recordings have been reissued as a volume of RPG Musics Vintage 78 RPM Recordings on CD series .
This was at a time when it was difficult for classical musicians , in however high esteem , to support themselves .
The subcontinents many royal courts had supported the music for centuries , but there was no large middle class and no widespread public appreciation ; now the courts were on the remove , and the budding recording industry did not have anything like todays large commercial base
Arup Chattopadhyay is an Indian tabla player .
 Arup Chattopadhyay was born at Chandannagar , West Bengal .
 Arup Chattopadhyay started learning tabla at the age of six from Arup Chattopadhyay father Pt .
 Pankaj Chattopadhyay , who Pankaj Chattopadhyay is a renowned tabla player of West Bengal .
 After a few years , Arupji came under the tutelage of world famous tabla maestro Pandit Sankar Ghosh of farukkhabad gharana with whom Arupji continues to learn .
 Gradually Arupji has established Arupji as a top class accompanist and a formidable soloist .
 Arupji performances are admired for its tonal quality , crystal clear sound of bols even at an electrifying speed , and tremendous sense of rhythm and melody .
 Arupji is a grade A artist of All India Radio and Doordarshan and Arupji performances are frequently broadcast throughout the country .
Arupjis performance with most of the leading artists like Pandit Ravi Shankar , ustad Ashish Khan , ustad Shahid Parvez , ustad Rais Khan , Pandit Rajan and sajan Mishra , Pandit Ajoy Chakraborty , Pandit Manas Chakraborty , Pandit Viswamohan Bhat , Ustad Rasid khan , Pandit Tejendra Narayan Majumder , Pandit Satish Vyass and many more has established himself as a topnotch accompanist throughout the world .
Since 1998 , he has been honoured to accompany the living legend Pt .
Ravi Shankarji in his tours throughout the U.S. , Canada , Europe and India .
He accompanied with Pt .
 Deepak Chowdhury in his U.K. tour , and with Pandit Kartick Seshadri in his U.S. , Canada , Australia and Mexico tours .
 Arupji is also a top class tabla teacher.He was a professor of tabla at Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan in London .
 Now , Arupji is a visiting lecturer of tabla at the University of California , San Diego
Anupam Shobhakar , born Anupam Shovakar , is an Indian musician , composer , instrumentalist , record producer , and classically trained sarodist currently living in Brooklyn , New York .
 Anupam Shobhakar has released three World Fusion albums , and one classical Indian music album .
 Anupam Shobhakar has performed live around the world at various venues and for charitable causes .
 Anupam Shobhakar track Water made it to the first round of the Grammy Awards .
 Anupam Shobhakar was born in the east Indian state of Kolkata , but was raised in Indias financial capital city of Bombay .
 Although Shobhakars parents are not Shobhakars parents , Shobhakars parents often played classical Indian records at home , which had an influence on Anupam Shobhakar .
 Anupam Shobhakar grandfather , Shri Bhavani Shankar Shovakar , played sitar , tabla , and sang , hosting concerts at Shri Bhavani Shankar Shovakar residence .
 Anupam Shobhakar first brush with Western Music was listening to Led Zeppelin and Deep Purple , followed by Megadeth , Joe Satriani and Metallica .
 Anupam Shobhakar was given a guitar , which Anupam Shobhakar strung lefty , and began practicing , eventually forming a band named Dead Sea Scrolls , which played Megadeth , Joe Satriani , Joe Satriani , and Steve Vai covers .
 During this same time , Anupam Shobhakar began experimenting with Jazz and Western Classical Music .
 In Anupam Shobhakar early teens , Anupam Shobhakar began to listen to Indian Classical Music again -- as Anupam Shobhakar says , What I was doing on the guitar was not enough to musically satisfy I .
 I heard a Shakti record ... that re-ignited I interest in the deep melodic gravitas .
Shobhakar experimented by crafting a fretless guitar , but found that nothing could match the microtonal subtleties of Indian Music like the traditional Sarode .
 Anupam Shobhakar met Ustad Aashish Khan briefly when Anupam Shobhakar came to do a concert in Bombay and stayed at Shobhakars apartment .
 Anupam Shobhakar states that Anupam Shobhakar was blown away by Khans command over the Sarode , and has been studying with Anupam Shobhakar ever since .
 Anupam Shobhakar lists Ustad Aashish Khan , and Anupam Shobhakar father , Ustad Allaudin Khan , as Anupam Shobhakar main playing style influences : Slightly aggressive in approach , but never at the cost of the melodic charm .
 Anupam Shobhakar was recognized for Anupam Shobhakar talents as an Indian Classical Music performer by the Priyadarshni Academy , who awarded Anupam Shobhakar the Best Young Artist Award .
Shobhakars current focus is World Fusion and Jazz Fusion .
 Anupam Shobhakar recorded Anupam Shobhakar first album Mysterious Awakening , in 2004 .
 Anupam Shobhakar handled every aspect of production on the record , including tracking the guitars with a goose neck internet chat mic .
 Anupam Shobhakar describes the sound of the music on the album as the best of both worlds .
 Anupam Shobhakar explains , Most Indian musicians do not understand harmony as its not a part of the musical system -- its a melodic and rhythmic tradition -- whereas a lot of western music is based on harmony .
The album was released by Saregama HMV .
 Anupam Shobhakar album was Anupam Shobhakar first major contribution to the World Fusion genre , something Shobhakar feels very passionately about .
 Anupam Shobhakar says , Apart from being a traditional concert sarodist , I want to really explore world music , and Ive been wanting to do that for a while .
 Ive been pretty much producing on I own : making all the music , adding all the MIDI instrumentation in I studio at home .
 But here its better , because I can meet a lot of different musicians , a lot of different , diverse people .
 Anupam Shobhakar has released a subsequent World Fusion album , Wine of the Mystic in 2005 , and is finishing production on titled Way of the Warrior , titled Way of the Warrior .
 In 2009 , Anupam Shobhakar released an Indian Classical album , Dream Theory .
 Anupam Shobhakar is currently working on a new project , The Joel Harrison - Anupam Shobhakar Quintet .
 Anupam Shobhakar has toured internationally , playing at major music festivals such as Canadas Vancouver Folk Festival , MTVs Independence Rock Festival in India , Omans Muscat Festival , and Italys Roma Rock .
 Anupam Shobhakar has also dedicated Anupam Shobhakar talents to charitable events such as YWCA Indias Concert for Peace , raising money for the survivors of the Gujarat earthquake .
 Anupam Shobhakar has collaborated and played with Shobhakars parents from all over the globe , including Joel Harrison , Dan Weiss , World Fusion Orchestra , Alessandro Gandola , Ivan Tucakov , Gordon Gridna , Heather Schmid , Rich Balmer , Juan de Marias , Joel Harrison
Ustad Ali Baksh was an Indian classical singer .
 Together with Fateh Ali Khan , Fateh Ali Khan founded the Patiala Gharana .
This gharana is claimed to combine the musical traditions of Delhi gharana , Gwalior Gharana and Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana .
The gharana has many notable pupils including Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Malika Pukhraj and Gauhar Jan .
Ustad Ali Baksh Khan regularly sang with Fateh Ali Khan .
 Before the partition of India they were the court musicians in Patiala .
Ali Bakash had one son , Ustad Akhtar Hussain
Ishima was originally in the group sounds band The Beavers , who had released some singles but not had major success .
 Ishima joined Flower Travellin Band in 1969 .
 When Flower Travellin Band broke up in 1973 , Ishima recorded the solo album One Day .
 Ishima then joined a group called Trans Am , which was followed by the Donjuan R&R ; Band with Kenichi Hagiwara .
 During the 1980s Ishima was in Co-Colo along with Nobuhiko Shinohara .
 In 2000 , Ishima recorded the album More-ish with the group Pythagorus Party
Ali Akbar Khan , often referred to as Khansahib or by the title Ustad , was a Hindustani classical musician of the Maihar gharana , known for his virtuosity in playing the sarod .
Khan was instrumental in popularizing Indian classical music in the West , both as a performer , and as a teacher .
He established a music school in Calcutta in 1956 , and the Ali Akbar College of Music in 1967 , which is now located in San Rafael , California and has a branch in Basel , Switzerland .
Khan also composed several classical ragas and film scores .
He was a Distinguished Adjunct Professor of Music at the University of California , Santa Cruz .
 Trained as a musician and instrumentalist by his father , Allauddin Khan , Khan first came to America in 1955 on the invitation of violinist Yehudi Menuhin and later settled in California .
Khan was nominated for five Grammy Awards and was accorded Indias second highest civilian honor , the Padma Vibhushan , in 1989 .
He has also won a MacArthur Fellowship and the National Endowment for the Arts s National Heritage Fellowship .
Ali Akbar Khan was born in the village of Shibpur , Comilla , in present-day Bangladesh , to renowned musician and teacher , Allauddin Khan and Madina Begum .
Soon after his birth , Khans family returned to Maihar where his father was the primary court musician for the Maharaja of the princely state .
From an early age Khan received training from his father in various instruments as well as vocal composition , but finally gravitated towards the sarod .
 Allauddin was a perfectionist and a strict taskmaster , and Khans family lessons started before dawn and often lasted 18 hours a day .
 Khan also learned to play the tabla and the pakhavaj from his uncle , Aftabuddin Khan , who he visited at Shibpur .
During this period he met several prominent musicians , such as the sarodist Timir Baran and flutist Pannalal Ghosh , who came to study with his father ; in later years he was joined in his lessons by his sister Annapurna Devi , who became an accomplished player of the surbahar , and fellow student Ravi Shankar .
 Ravi Shankar and Annapurna Devi were married in 1941 .
Ali Akbar Khan , after years of rigorous training gave his debut performance at a music conference in Allahabad in 1936 , at the age of 13 .
Three years later , in December 1939 , he accompanied Ravi Shankar on the sarod during the latters debut performance at the same conference ; this was the first of many jugalbandis between the two musicians .
In 1938 Khan gave his first recital on All India Radio , Bombay , and starting in January 1940 , he gave monthly performances on AIR , Lucknow .
 Finally in 1944 , both Ravi Shankar and Khan left Maihar to start both Shankar and Khan professional careers as musicians ; Ravi Shankar went to Bombay , while Khan became the youngest Music Director for AIR , AIR , Lucknow and was responsible for solo performances and composing for the radio orchestra .
 In 1943 , on Ravi Shankar fathers recommendation , Khan was appointed a court musician for the Maharaja of Jodhpur , Hanwant Singh .
 There , Ravi Shankar taught and composed music besides giving recitals and was accorded the title of Ustad by the Maharaja .
 When the princely states were wound down with Indias independence in 1947 and Hanwant Singh died in a plane crash in 1948 , Khan moved to Bombay .
 In Bombay , Indias won acclaim as a composer of several film scores , including Chetan Anand s Aandhiyan , Satyajit Ray s Devi , Merchant-Ivory s The Householder , and Tapan Sinha s Kshudhita Pashan , for which Tapan Sinha won the Best Musician of the Year award .
 Indias also played Sarod for a song in 1955 film Seema which had the music composed by Shankar Jaikishan .
 Later in 1993 , Indias would score some of the music for Bernardo Bertolucci Little Buddha .
 Beginning in 1945 , Khan also started recording a series of 78 rpm disks at the HMV Studios in Bombay .
For one such record he conceived a new composition Raga Chandranandan , based on four evening ragas , Malkauns , Chandrakauns , Nandakauns and Kaushi Kanada .
This record was a huge success in India , and the raga found a worldwide audience when a 22-minute rendition was re-recorded for the Master Musician of India LP in 1965 - one of Khans seminal recordings .
 He performed in India and traveled extensively in the West .
 In 1956 , Khan founded the Ali Akbar College of Music in Calcutta in 1956 , with the mission to teach and spread Indian classical music .
 He founded another school of the same name in Berkeley , California in 1967 and later moved it to San Rafael , California .
Khan performed in Boston with Shankar Ghosh in 1969 for the Peabody Mason Concert series .
 In 1985 he founded another branch of the Ali Akbar College of Music in Basel , Switzerland .
Khan was the first Indian musician to record an LP album of Indian classical music in the United States and to play sarod on American television .
Khan has participated in a number of classic jugalbandi pairings , most notably with Ravi Shankar , Nikhil Banerjee and violinist L. Subramaniam .
A few recordings of duets with Vilayat Khan also exist .
He also collaborated with Western musicians .
 In August 1971 , Khan performed at Madison Square Garden for the Concert for Bangladesh , along with Ravi Shankar , Alla Rakha and Kamala Chakravarty ; other musicians at the concert included George Harrison , Bob Dylan , Eric Clapton and Ringo Starr .
A live album and a movie of the event were later released .
Khan was based in the United States for the last four decades of his life .
He toured extensively until he was prevented from doing so by ill-health in the period prior to his death from renal failure .
Ali Akbar Khan married three times , and is survived by seven sons and four daughters .
The most notable of his children are Dhyanesh Khan , Pranesh Khan , and Alam Khan .
Khan was awarded the Padma Vibhushan in 1989 , among other awards .
He received a MacArthur Fellowship in 1991 .
In 1997 , Khan received the National Endowment for the Arts prestigious National Heritage Fellowship , the United States highest honour in the traditional arts .
Khan has received two Grammy nominations
Surinder Sandhu is a sarangi player and composer .
 Surinder Sandhu is a student of Sabri Khan of the Senia Rampur Moradabad gharana .
 Surinder Sandhu composes in multiple genres .
 Surinder Sandhu compositions combine jazz , western classical and Asian fusion music .
Guests performers on Sandhus albums include rock guitarist Steve Vai to saxophonist Andy Sheppard .
His album The Fictionist features the Royal Liverpool Philharmonic Orchestra , guest musicians , and The Surinder Sandhu Band .
 His album The Fictionist was well received by critics after His album The Fictionist release on September 29 , 2008 .
 The album includes a symphony commissioned to celebrate Royal Liverpool Philharmonic Orchestra as capital of culture 2008
Suresh Haldankar was an Indian classical singer , actor and teacher .
Born in Goa to a Daivajna family , Suresh Haldankar learned classical music from Jagannathbuwa Purohit , Ganpatrao Dewaskar and Manhar Barve .
 a Daivajna family performed in Marathi Sangeet Natak musicals and acted alongside Bal Gandharva .
 a Daivajna family most memorable performance was in the musical Honaji Bala .
 Acharya Atre conferred upon Acharya Atre the title of Maharashtra Gandharva after listening to Acharya Atre singing in Shri Ranga Kamala Kanta .
 Among Acharya Atre other popular songs are Vithu maza lekur wala and Govinda re gopala .
 Acharya Atre conducted Indian classical music classes at Dadar
Keshav is an Indian tabla player .
 Keshav is a prodigy and performed at the Delhi Commonwealth Games .
 Keshav was born at Auroville in Tamil Nadu to Gopika Dahanukar .
 Keshav is the grandson of painter , Prafulla Dahanukar .
 Keshav started learning tabla when Keshav was two years old .
 Keshav was spotted by Bharat Bala at an event , while Keshav was conceiving Rhythms of India , the first item of the Delhi Commonwealth Games opening ceremony
Indias Most Distinguished Musician In Concert is a 1962 live album released by Ravi Shankar .
It was recorded 19 November 1961 during one of Shankars early seminal American performances , at UCLA .
It was later digitally remastered and released in CD format through Angel Records .
The digital remastering was by Squires Productions .
Supporting musicians are Kanai Dutt on tabla and Nodu Mullick on Tamboura
Kamala Shankar was born in 1966 in the Tanjore district of Tamil Nadu -RRB- .
 Dr Kamala Shankar is a Hindustani classical guitar player .
 Dr Kamala Shankar is the first woman to have been awarded a doctorate in guitar .
 Dr Kamala Shankar was trained in music by Dr Kamala Shankar mother from the age of six , and went on to study with khyal singer Channulal Mishra and sitar maestro Bimalendu Mukherjee .
 Dr Kamala Shankar received a doctorate of music from vichitra-beenkar Gopal Shankar Mishra at Banaras Hindu University , and also holds bachelors degrees in both vocal music and zoology .
Dr Kamala Shankar has been awarded the Indias National Award in Music titled Rashtriya Kumar Gandharva Samman .
The guitar has only recently begun to be adopted to Indian classical music , and many players modify the instrument with their own developments to better suit the idiom .
 In this , Dr Kamala Shankar is no exception .
 Dr Kamala Shankar model , the Shankar guitar , is made from a single block of wood , with thicker walls and no sound hole .
 the Shankar guitar has four melody strings , four chikari and 12 taraf .
The guitar is named after Shankar Bhagwan .
 Dr Kamala Shankar calls The guitar a modified version of the Hawaiian guitar .
Meend over Matter , The Music Magazine , 7 January 2002
Rajeev Taranath is an Indian classical musician who plays the sarod .
 Rajeev Taranath is a disciple of Ali Akbar Khan .
Rajeev Taranath was born in Bangalore on 17 October 1932 .
 Rajeev Taranath received Rajeev Taranath initial training in vocal music from Rajeev Taranath father Pandit Taranath .
 Rajeev Taranath gave Rajeev Taranath first public vocal performance when Rajeev Taranath was nine years old .
 Rajeev Taranath was singing for the All India Radio before Rajeev Taranath was twenty .
 Although Rajeev Taranath held a PhD in literature , Rajeev Taranath soon decided to give up Rajeev Taranath career as a Professor of English Literature and moved to Calcutta , where Rajeev Taranath began Rajeev Taranath musical training under the tutelage of Ustad Ali Akbar Khan .
 Rajeev Taranath continued to learn from his Guru Guru till Khan Sahebs demise in 2009 .
 Rajeev Taranath has also had guidance from Pt .
Ravi Shankar , Smt .
Annapurna Devi , Pt .
Nikhil Banerjee and Ustad Aashish Khan .
In 1999-2000 he received the Indians governments highest award in the arts from the Sangeet Natak Akademi .
He researched and published the Teaching Techniques of the Maihar-Allauddin Gharana , as a Ford Foundation scholar .
He is respected for his in-depth understanding as he unfolds the raga , the tonal quality and power of his strokes .
His distinctive style shows technical excellence , imaginative power and emotional range .
 According to the New York Times , Rajeev Taranath TARANATHS sarod improvisations Sunday at Soundscape mixed the spiritual and the spirited .
 Rajeev Taranath performs extensively in India and the world .
 Rajeev Taranath has toured Australia , Europe , Yemen , the United States , and Canada .
 Rajeev Taranath has composed the music for many internationally acclaimed Indian films including Samskara , Kanchana Sita and Kadavu .
 Rajeev Taranath has also served as the head of the Indian music program at the World Music Department of the California Institute of the Arts from 1995 to 2005 .
 Rajeev Taranath currently lives and teaches in Mysore , Karnataka .
Rajeev Taranth taught English literature at the University of Aden in 1980s .
 Rajeev Taranath was the subject of a documentary made for the television in Aden entitled Fannan Min-Al-Hind
 Mazhar Ali Khan is a Hindustani classical vocalist of the Patiala Gharana , known for Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan performances of dadra and thumri .
 Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan has performed in India , Pakistan , and North America with Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan brother Jawaad Ali Khan .
Mazhar Ali Khan is grandson of the doyen of the Patiala Gharana , Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan
Hirabai Barodekar was a renowned Indian Hindustani classical music singer , of Kirana gharana .
 Hirabai Barodekar also sang along with Hirabai Barodekar younger sister , Saraswati Rane , whom Hirabai Barodekar also trained , in jugalbandi style .
 Hirabai Barodekar was born as Champakali to Kirana Gharana master Ustad Abdul Karim Khan and Tarabai Mane , who belongs to Gomantak Maratha Samaj .
Tarabai was the daughter of Sardar Maruti Rao Mane , a brother of princely Baroda states Rajmata during the middle of the 19th century .
 Abdul Karim Khan was the court musician in Baroda when Tarabai was young , and Ustad Abdul Karim Khan taught Tarabai music .
 The two fell in love and decided to get married ; but Tarabai parents disapproved of the alliance , and the couple had to leave the state .
 The couple moved to Bombay , and had The two sons : Suresh or Abdul Rehman , and Krishna ; and three daughters : Champakali , Gulab , and Sakina or Chhotutai .
In their adult lives , the five respectively became known as Sureshbabu Mane , Krishnarao Mane , Hirabai Badodekar , Kamalabai Badodekar , and Sarswatibai Rane .
 Krishnarao Mane had Krishnarao Mane initial training from Krishnarao Mane brother Sureshbabu Mane and later training from the doyen of Kirana Gharana , Ustad Abdul Wahid Khan , who was a cousin of Krishnarao Mane father , Ustad Abdul Karim Khan .
 Hirabai Badodekar was top most artist of Hirabai Barodekar time .
 Hirabai Barodekar was an expert in Khyal , Thumri , Marathi Natya Sangeet , and Bhajan .
 Hirabai Barodekar is credited with having popularized Hindustani Classical Music among the masses .
 Hirabai Barodekar was truly pioneer of concerts by women artists in India .
 She the real pioneer and was the first female artist who introduced ticketed concerts in India .
 Hirabai Barodekar was always amazingly popular on stages and Hirabai Barodekar shows were jam-packed .
 A very fragile , honey voice , emotive factor , peaceful and exorbitant vocal clarity are Hirabai Barodekar strengths .
 Hirabai Barodekar was admired by the real class and those were mass .
 Hirabai Barodekar amazing rendition of Taar Sa was very popular and became Hirabai Barodekar hallmark .
 Hirabai Barodekar made Kirana gharana more popular and rich .
 Hirabai Barodekar acted in several movies , including Suvarna Mandir , Pratibha , Janabai , and Municipality .
 Hirabai Barodekar also started a music school , Nutan Sangeet Vidyalaya , to teach music to girls .
The school staged several plays .
 In addition receiving in-numerous awards and titles as they all were actually proud to get announced for Hirabai Barodekar , Hirabai Barodekar was respected and asked to sing our national anthem vandemadaram at Red-fort Delhi during the independence day on Aug 15-1947 .
 Its say that Hirabai Barodekar renditions and voice could cure a sick man as Hirabai Barodekar music had access the corner stone .
 Hirabai Barodekar always a kind of more educating than entertaining and its proved Hirabai Barodekar can never be reservatifor any period and may guide and teach every generation .
 Hirabai Barodekar became a recording artist very early in Hirabai Barodekar career .

She was titled as Gaanhira .
Her nature was so down to earth and peaceful which was truly ideal .
 Hirabai Barodekar received several awards , including the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award and the Padma Bhushan Award .
 Vishnudas Bhave Award for Vishnudas Bhave contribution to theater .
 Vishnudas Bhave was chosen to sing the national anthem , Vande Mataram , from the Red Fort in India capital Delhi on the day India received India independence from the British Raj .
 Vishnudas Bhave visited China and the East African countries as a part of an Indian Delegation in 1953 .
 Vishnudas Bhave was titled Gaan kokila by Sarojini Naidu .
 An annual music festival is held in Mumbai by Vishnudas Bhave disciple Dr Prabha Atre by the name Sureshbabu - Hirabai Smruti Sangeet Samaroh since 1992 , which becomes one of the major festival of music in the country .
 her disciple Dr Prabha Atre was married to Shri .
 Manikrao Gandhi - Hirabai Barodekar .
 Manikrao Gandhi - Barodekar . passed through various troubles in Manikrao Gandhi - Barodekar . life especially to family requirements and the dependents to Manikrao Gandhi - Barodekar . were huge.Despite being such a talented and a blessed soul Manikrao Gandhi - Barodekar . was more ill treated and tactfully handled by people around to get Manikrao Gandhi - Barodekar . down .
 But Manikrao Gandhi - Barodekar . was so peaceful and truly ideal by Manikrao Gandhi - Barodekar . .
 Among Hirabais many students , Dr. Prabha Atre , Manik Varma and Saraswatibai Rane made Hirabais many students mark on Music horizon .
her some other students are Malati Pande , Janaki Iyer , Shaila Pandit and Suvarna Chandrashekharan
Sumati Mutatkar was an Indian classical music vocalist and musicologist from the Agra gharana of Hindustani classical music , and a Professor of Department of Music in University of Delhi .
 Sumati Mutatkar was awarded the highest award of the Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy for Music , Dance and Drama , for lifetime achievement , the 1979 Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship and the Padma Shri in 1999 , by Government of India .
 Sumati Mutatkar was also awarded the Kalidas Samman by the Government of Madhya Pradesh in 2001-2002 .
 Sumati Mutatkar was born in Balaghat in the then province of C.P. and Berar , the oldest child of Gajanan Amberdekar , a judge , and Sundari Subedar .
 Sumati Mutatkar received Sumati Mutatkar musical training in Hindustani classical music under various teachers including , promarily under Pandit Anant Manohar Joshi S.N.Ratanjankar , and later from Pandit Rajabhaiya Poochwale of Gwalior gharana , Ustad Vilayat Hussain Khan of Agra gharana , and Pandit Anant Manohar Joshi and Ustad Mushtaq Hussain Khan of the Rampur gharana .
 Sumati Mutatkar was also a student of Bhatkhande Music Institute at Lucknow under S. N. Ratanjankar .
 In 1953 , Sumati Mutatkar joined as the Director of Music at the All India Radio and subsequently became Deputy Chief Producer of Music .
 Later , in 1968 Sumati Mutatkar joined the Faculty of Music and Fine Arts , at the Delhi University , eventually retiring in September 1981 as the Dean of the Faculty .
 During Sumati Mutatkar tenure , Sumati Mutatkar supervised numerous research programs in the field of music , as well published several books on the subject .
 In Delhi , in Sumati Mutatkar last years , Sumati Mutatkar was considered a storehouse of musical knowledge and history and was visited by many musicians who often were in search of obscure information or compositions .
 Sumati Mutatkar love before music had been English literature , and later Sumati Mutatkar had acquired a formidable command over Sanskrit language and literature .
