If you listen to I CD Tana Mana , I have worked with electronic music 25 years ago .
 But I did all this without compromising on the solid foundation of our classical music .
 If few musicians didnt understand I then it was their problem .
 I have no regrets
 Sarosh Sami Khatib also credited as Sarosh Sami or Sarosh Khatib , is an Indian singer who is known for Sarosh Sami Khatib music album ` Hey Ya ' released by Universal Music .
Sarosh is a trained tabla player from the Sangeet Mahabharti Institute .
The Institute was founded by the Late Pandit Nikhil Ghosh .
 the Late Pandit Nikhil Ghosh started the Late Pandit Nikhil Ghosh career as a tabla player and then started singing .
The Forever Green anthem was created for an awareness campaign titled - Do We Really Think Green .
The campaign was run with the Mayor of Mumbai - Smt Shraddha Jadhav , with a free sapling distribution drive carried out across the city through colleges , schools and churches .
Sarosh Sami sang the anthem live at the Mayoral Bungalow along with the then Indian Idol finalists - Sreeram Chandra , Bhoomi Trivedi , Rakesh Maini & Swaroop Khan .
The campaign was also recognized by United Nations Environment Programme on World Environment Day .
The music for the anthem is given by the music composer Lalit Pundit
Ustad Inayat Hussain Khan was an Indian classical vocalist , and the founder of Rampur-Sahaswan gharana .
Born in Sahaswan , Badaun district to Ustad Mehboob Khan , a khayal singer and Veena player of the Rampur court .
 Ustad Mehboob Khan was taught traditional khayals and the exquisite taranas created by Bahadur Hussain in all major ragas and also many rare ones .
 Ustad Mehboob Khan was trained and lived in Rampur , and Ustad Mehboob Khan gharana came to be called Rampur-Sahaswan gharana .
 Ustad Mehboob Khan was a child prodigy .
 Ustad Mehboob Khan First married the daughter of Haddu Khan of the Gwalior gharana , and trained from Ustad Bahadur Hussain Khan , a descendent of Tansen .
 Ustad Mehboob Khan singing style has influences of the Dhrupad singing typical of the Gwalior gharana , and the Rampur-Shahaswan style is sometimes regarded as an off-shoot of the Gwalior gharana
Ayaan Ali Khan is an Indian classical musician who plays the sarod .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan is the son of Amjad Ali Khan and often performs with the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan older brother Amaan Ali Khan , with whom the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan hosted the music talent show Sa Re Ga Ma .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan has also released solo albums and collaborations with brother and father .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan was born 5 September 1979 as the son of sarod player Amjad Ali Khan and Subhalakshmi Barua Khan , a classical dancer .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan birth name was Bangash and the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan was born in at least the fifth generation of musicians ; the Bangash lineage claims to have invented the sarod .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan has an older brother , Amaan , and they were taught music by their father from a young age and later began to perform with their father on concert tours .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan has performed with the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan father and brother since the late 1980s and performed at Carnegie Hall in 1997 .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan released the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan solo debut album of classical music in 1999 .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan hosted the music talent show Sa Re Ga Ma on Zee TV with the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan brother for three years in the early 2000s .
 In 2002 , the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan and the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan brother wrote a book about Khan and his brother father , Abba : Gods Greatest Gift To Us .
 his father 's album Moksha , a 2005 album made in collaboration with Amaan and Amjad Ali Khan and released by Real World Records , was nominated for Grammy Award for Best Traditional World Music Album .
The brothers released Reincarnation , an album of world fusion music , in 2006 , and a thematic album , Mystic Dunes , in 2007 , and toured internationally .
 The brothers were awarded a Lycra Style Award from MTV India in 2006 .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan and the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan brother also sing , including on the 2007 tribute album Remembering Mahatma Gandhi .
 the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan joined the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan family to perform for the Parliament of India in 2007 .
In 2009 , after working under a movie contract that forbade public appearances for a year , the brothers returned to making music when the production by Bollywood director J. P. Dutta was cancelled .
 The brothers released a Sufi music album called Rang in 2012 .
 The brothers also released an album called Headwaters in October 2013 .
 `` Ayaan 's already shows some of Ayaan 's fathers authority .
Ayaan Ali Khan represents the seventh generation of a musical lineage known as the Senia Bangash School .
 The younger son and disciple of the Sarod Titan Amjad Ali Khan , Ayaan 's stepped into the world of music and the Sarod , at a very early age , with confidence , clarity , consistency and technical mastery that The younger son learnt at The younger son fathers knee .
 Ayaan 's has been performing concerts in MTV India in 2006 and world - wide , since Ayaan 's gave Ayaan 's solo debut at the age of eight .
 Ayaan 's has given many other solo performances and also assisted Ayaan 's illustrious father at concerts all over the world .
 Over the years today , Ayaan 's has carved out a special niche for Ayaan 's in the world of music .
 Ayaan 's approach , vision and versatility make Ayaan 's an icon for the youth in the music industry .
 Ayaan 's contribution in making the Sarod a cross-over instrument in a variety of genres has projected Ayaan 's as an artist of high repute .
 Ayaan 's has won the hearts of music lovers both in MTV India in 2006 and abroad .
 Ayaan 's made Ayaan 's UK debut in 1989 and the US Debut in 1991 at the Asia Society in New York .
 From 1997 onwards Ayaan 's has performed regularly at the Carnegie Hall and Smithsonian in the the US , Palais Beaux-Arts in Brussels , Chicago Symphony Center , ESPLANADE in Singapore , Summer Arts Festival in Seattle , Edinburgh Music Festival and the Royal Festival Hall in London .
 Ayaan 's made Ayaan 's debut tour in Australia early this year .
 Ayaan 's has also played concerts at the WOMAD Festival in Adelaide and New Plymouth , World Beat Festival in Brisbane WOMAD Rivermead Festival in UK , and the Opera House in Sydney .
 Ayaan 's performed at St. James Palace in July 1997 for the Temenos Academy and has also collaborated with the noted Cellist Mathew Barley of UK at the Royal Festival Hall in 2002 .
 In July 2002 , Ayaan 's conducted a workshop for the National Youth Orchestra of UK with Matthew Barley which followed by a concert with the NYO .
 In 2000 , Ayaan 's joined Ayaan 's father at the Dalai Lama 's Sacred Music Festival inauguration in New Delhi .
 Over the years Ayaan 's has been a regular performer at Konzerthaus in Vienna , - Symphony Hall in Birmingham , Bridgewater Hall in Manchester , Recital Hall , Het Concertgebouw in Amsterdam , Centre d ` Art Contemporain , Geneva and the UN International Labour Organisation auditorium , Geneva .
 In May 2003 , Ayaan 's performed for Prince Charles Ayaan 's High Grove Estate for Temenos Academy .
 In 2005 Ayaan 's composed the music score for Roger Christian 's film `` American Daylight '' .
 In the following years Ayaan 's played at Symphony Hall in Fukuoka , New York 's Town Hall , Metropolitan Museum and Salisbury Festival in UK , among other venues across the world .
 In 2005 Ayaan 's collaborated with Guitarist Dereck Truks of the Allman Brother 's band at the Savannah Festival .
 Ayaan 's also recorded with Real World Records and featured in one solo track in Ayaan 's father 's album Moksha the same year.In July 2006 Ayaan 's collaborated with Evelyn Glennie at Queen Elisabeth Hall .
 Ayaan 's performed at the Central Hall of the Indian Parliament on the commemoration of Indias 60th year of Independence in 2007 .
The Khans collaborated with American Folk artist Carrie Newcomer at Lotus Arts Festival in Bloomington and also performed at The Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco in 2011 .
 Ayaan 's concert at Wigmore Hall along with Ayaan 's father released under the Live at Wgmore Hall series was recorded in 2010 .
 In 2009 , Ayaan 's played at the United Nations in New York in presence of Ban Ki Moon to commemorate the Ode to Peace Concert along with Ayaan 's Father .
 Along with Ayaan 's many solo classical albums , Ayaan 's has crossed the bridge between Indian music and a variety of genres with Ayaan 's electronica and lounge albums like ` Reincarnation ' , ` Truth ' , ` Mysic Dunes ' , ` Passion ' and ` Dreamz ' .
 Ayaan 's also released two albums titled `` The Music Room '' and `` Sarod Symphony '' with Ayaan 's father and guru in 2010 .
The latest album Rang - Colors of Sufism was released in March 2012 featuring Amaan and Ayaan 's interpretations of traditional Qawwalis on the Sarod .
 From 2000 to 2001 , Ayaan 's hosted a very popular music and talent show air on Zee TV called ` Sa Re Ga Ma ' , with Ayaan 's brother .
 Bestowed with the MTV 's Lycra Award for the Most Stylish person in Music in 2006 , Ayaan 's was honoured by the Mayor of the City of Tulsa , Oklahoma with the Keys to the City along with an Honorary Citizenship and the Bharat Shiromani Award for Instrumental music in 2007 .
 In November 2002 , Ayaan 's co-authored a book with Ayaan 's brother , Amaan titled ` Abba-God 's Greatest Gift to us ' .
 This book was on Ayaan 's father 's life and was published by Roli Books , Lustre Publications under the ` Family Pride Series ' .
 In 2010 Ayaan 's and Amaan , released Ayaan and Amaan second book titled `` 50 Maestros 50 Recordings '' which was published by Harper Collins .
 Earlier this year Ananta Opus 195 , a concerto for sarod , symphonic and electronic orchestra Written by Pierre Thilloy and performed by the Sarod maestro Amjad Ali Khan , Amaan Ali Khan and Ayaan Ali Khan with the Avignon Provence Symphonic Orchestra and the Kords Collective , conducted by Samuel Jean premiered in MTV India in 2006 .
 Ayaan 's recently performed Ayaan 's father 's Sarod Concert Samaagam with the London Philharmonia Orchestra conducted by David Murphy .
 Ayaan 's and Amaan Ali Khan dropped their family surname Bangash in 2006
Mohammad Hashem Cheshti , also known with surname Chishti and as Ustad Hashem , was a contemporary classical musician and composer born in Kharabat area of Kabul , Afghanistan , who died in 1994 in Germany under unclear circumstances .
 Ustad Hashem was born and raised in an extremely musical family , which originally came from Kasur in Punjab , but settled in the 19th century in Kabul as court musicians .
 Several of Ustad Hashem close family members , including Ustad Hashem brothers and Ustad Hashem father are/were also famous musicians in their own right .
 Both he and his brothers appeared regularly on Afghan Television and Radio prior to the Russian invasion of Afghanistan and the subsequent wars .
He accompanied regularly other famous Afghan musicians like Ahmad Zahir and Ustad Mahwash on his tabla .
He was the teacher and mentor of Ustad Mahwash , the first Afghan female master musician and Zuleikha , a US American dancer and artist .
He mastered many different traditional Afghan instruments , but his greatest passion was for the tabla , his mastership of which was supreme .
 Following the Russian invasion of Afghanistan he had to flee his home country and emigrated to Germany where he died in 1994 , killed by one of his former students for reasons unknown
Ektal or Ektaal is one of the most famous talas in Indian music .
 Ektal is commonly used in classical music like kheyal , and semiclassical forms like Rabindra Sangeet .
In ektal the 12 matras are divided into 6 vibhags of two matras each .
 Tap , Clap , Wave , Clap , Tap , Clap , Wave , Clap , Tap , Clap , Clap , Clap .
It has a characteristic pattern of bols which goes as follows :
Jahan-e-Khusrau is an annual three-day sufi music festival held in New Delhi , India to commemorate the death anniversary of the saint Hazrat Amir Khusrau .
 Jahan-e-Khusrau was started in the year 2001 by noted film director , Muzaffar Ali .
 The festival is held at Chaunsath Khamba located in Hazrat Nizamuddin Basti and the lawns of the Humayun 's Tomb -- incidentally , this is where the saint Hazrat Amir Khusrau started the qawwali music tradition in the 13th century AD
Arvind Parikh is a Hindustani classical musician and sitar player .
 Arvind Parikh parikh was born in Ahmedabad into a Gujrati Business Family with cultural and spiritual influences .
 Arvind Parikh father was a businessman and mother was a painter .
 His father primary and secondary education continued in a nationalist school .
 At home His father was taught Indian music by musicians when His father used to play several instruments like dilruba , violin , mandolin , jaltarang and flute .
 Later His father started sitar , which His father found suited His father best .
 In 1944 , at the age of 17 , His father moved to Mumbai and started learning from sitar maestro Ustad Vilayat Khan .
 Per Khans wish Arvind Parikh entered Bombay University , along with the music education from sitar maestro Ustad Vilayat Khan .
 Arvind Parikh got admission in Elphinstone College , Bombay .
 Arvind Parikh musical education continued uninterrupted throughout Arvind Parikh performing career , from 1944 to 2004 until Per Khans death .
Arvind Parikh is having a performing career spanning over six decades .
 Association with different learned musicians and vocalists helped Arvind Parikh in Arvind Parikh research work on different rare ragas and compositions .
B. R. Deodhar , Latafat Hussain Khan , Amir Khan , Niyaz Ahmad-Faiyaz Ahmad Khan , D. T. Joshi , Radhika Mohan Maitra need special mention here .
 B. R. Deodhar has performed in Hindustani classical music n India and abroad .
 B. R. Deodhar has been featured at almost all major music festivals in Hindustani classical music n India and Europe , and has had very successful concert tours in several parts of West Asia , Far East and Australia .
 Arvind Parikh is a regular broadcaster on All India Radio .
 Arvind Parikh approach towards music , collection of authentic bandishes , and approach of teaching were praised .
 Arvind Parikh has numerous students internationally including musicologist Deepak Raja , music director Tushar Bhatia , sitarists Rafat Khan Niyazi , Vinayak Chitter , Ramprapanna Bhattacharya , Abhik Mukherjee , Ganesh Mohan , and more .
 Arvind Parikh daughter Purvi Parikh is also a classical vocalist and learnt music from many greats including His daughter Purvi Parikh parents .
Mrs. Parikh was disciple of Niyaz Ahmad-Faiyaz Ahmad Khan of Kirana Gharana .
 Arvind Parikh has documented most of the precious compositions and ragas .
 Sitar Guru , Bandish Parampara published by Navras records UK are some of the testimonies of Sitar Guru work .
 Arvind Parikh worked as musicologist , teacher , cultural ambassador , and promoted initiatives aimed at increasing interest in Hindustani classical music n Hindustani classical music n India and abroad .
 Arvind Parikh was vice president of the International Music Council during 1994-97 and is currently co-ordinator for the Indian sub-continent .
 Arvind Parikh is President of the Indian Musicological Society , chairman of the Western India Chapter of ITC-Sangeet Research Academy .
 Arvind Parikh conceived establishing a forum at which all segments of the music world could meet to discuss issues of common interests .
 Music forums are established in Mumbai , Chennai , Kolkata and Delhi .
 Arvind Parikh is currently spearheading an association of 12 classical musicians , called All India Musicians ' Group - drawn from the Carnatic and Hindustani traditions , to create greater support in government , industry and the media for Indian classical music .
 Arvind Parikh has been awarded the Gaurav Puraskar for the year 1997-98 by the Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy .
 Arvind Parikh has also been awarded the National Award by Sangeet Natak Akademi for Instrumental music for the year 2003 .
 Arvind Parikh is a top grade artist and a regular broadcaster of All India Radio .
 Arvind Parikh has handled the pursuits of business and music simultaneously .
Parikhs business is a logistics provider in 51 Indian cities .
 Parikhs business latest joint venture with Deutsche Post and DHL as DHL Lemuir Logistics Pvt. Ltd. .
 Arvind Parikh is chairman of an Indian transportation organization and director of a travel and tourism company , and Arvind Parikh family owned group owns a company for printing accessories
Vidya Rao is an Hindustani classical singer and writer .
 Vidya Rao is popular for Vidya Rao Thumri and Dadra .
 Vidya Rao wrote a book on the late Naina Devi , Heart to Heart : Remembering Nainaji .
Vidya Rao grew up in Hyderabad .
 Vidya Rao did Vidya Rao graduation in Madras , Vidya Rao joined the Delhi School of Economics to do M.A. in Sociology .
 Vidya Rao worked with Centre for Womens Development Studies as a researcher for five years before quitting to concentrate on music .
 Vidya Rao renders poetry of mystics like , Amir Khusro , Kabir etc
Mohammad Sharif Khan known as Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwaley , was a classical player of sitar , vichitra veena and raza been in the hindustani classical music tradition .
 Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala learned sitar from Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala father Ustad Rahim Bakhsh Khan , who Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala was a student of Ustad Imdad Khan .
 Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala learned vichitra veena from Ustad Abdul Aziz Khan Beenkar .
Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala , belongs to Poonch gharana of sitar .
 Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala played a key role in promoting the sitar in Pakistan .
 Everywhere Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala went Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala charmed audiences with Ustad Sharif Khan Poonchwala stylishness , registering the intricacies and subtleties of otherwise typical ragas .
Sharif Khan was awarded the Pride of Performance Award in 1968
Siddheswari Devi was a Hindustani singer from Varanasi , India , known as Maa .
 Born in 1908 , Siddheswari Devi lost Siddheswari Devi parents early and was brought up by Siddheswari Devi aunt , the noted singer Rajeshwari Devi .
 Despite living in a musical household , Siddheswari Devi came to music by accident .
 Rajeshwari Devi had arranged musical training for Rajeshwari Devi own daughter , Kamleshwari , while Siddheswari Devi would do small chores around the house .
 Once , while the noted sarangi player Siyaji Mishra , was teaching Kamleshwari , Kamleshwari was unable to repeat the tappa that she was being taught .
 Rajeshwari Devi ran out of patience , and started to cane Kamleshwari , who cried out for help .
 The only person to help Rajeshwari Devi was Rajeshwari Devi close friend Siddheswari Devi , who ran from the kitchen to hug Rajeshwari Devi cousin , and took the thrashing on Rajeshwari Devi own body .
 At this point , Siddheswari Devi told Siddheswari Devi weeping cousin , Its not so difficult to sing what Siyaji Maharaj was telling you .
 Siddheswari Devi then showed Siddheswari Devi how to sing it , performing the whole tune perfectly , much to the amazement of everyone .
 The next day , Siyaji Maharaj came to Rajeshwari Devi , and asked to adopt Siddheswari Devi into Siyaji Maharaj own family .
 So Siddheswari Devi moved in with the couple , eventually becoming a great friend and support for them .
 This moving incident was very vivid in Siddheswaris mind , and is detailed in the biography Maa , co-authored by Siddheswari Devi daughter Savita Devi .
 Subsequently Kamleshwari also trained under Rajab Ali Khan of Dewas and Inayat Khan of Lahore , but considered Kamleshwari guru mainly Bade Ramdas .
 Kamleshwari sang khyal , thumri and short classical forms as dadra , chaiti , kajri etc. .
 On several occasions Kamleshwari would sing perform through the night , for example on the overnight boating expeditions of Maharaja of Darbhanga .
 In 1989 , noted director Mani Kaul has made an award winning documentary , Siddheswari Devi , on Siddheswari Devi life .
 Siddheswari Devi won many accolades during Siddheswari Devi career , including : .
 Siddheswari Devi died in 1976 .
 Siddheswari Devi daughter Savita Devi is also a musician and lives in Delhi
Jagannath buwa Purohit was a singer and teacher of Hindustani classical music .
 Jagannath buwa Purohit learnt under various gurus , the chief being Vilayat Hussein Khan of Agra Gharana .
Buwas colophon was Gunidas .
unadulterated style , focus on correctness , laya-pradhan because of origins in .
 Buwas disciples include Jitendra Abhisheki , Pandit Ram Marathe , Pandit Vasantrao Kulkarni , C. R. Vyas , Pt Yashwant buwa Joshi and Manik Verma .
 Pt Bhai Gaitonde , living legend of Farukhabad gharana of Tabla , received Bhai Gaitonde initial training from Pt Jagannath Buwa .
 Pt Jagannath Buwa was devoted to Pt Jagannath Buwa teachers in a day when the teachers were known for being whimsical .
 One of them praised Pt Jagannath Buwa for Pt Jagannath Buwa devotion and said a real Gun-das are a real Gun-das , and this gave birth to Pt Jagannath Buwa pen-name Gunidas .
 Pt Jagannath Buwa was born in a Karhade Brahmin family in the erstwhile Nizam state of Hyderabad .
 Pt Jagannath Buwa had basic primary education in Marathi , Pt Jagannath Buwa mother tongue .
As was the tradition then and even now , musical talent of a person was carefully nourished through an age old custom .
Living with ones teacher , Guru .
This created a definite bond between the teacher and his disciple .
In Hyderabad , as well as many other princely states , certain musicians , be it vocal or instrumental , were patronized by the ruler .
 Therefore , young Jagannath picked up many a veteran musicians to learn young Jagannath trade .
 young Jagannath changed young Jagannath teachers as many times as young Jagannath could afford to .
 Not that young Jagannath paid any tuition of any kind .
Serving ones teachers fancies and temper is the fee .
 Learned Indian percussion instrument , Tabla , very well to the point that young Jagannath became a master .
Took lessons from famous teacher , Ustad Thirkawa .
 Ustad Thirkawa musical training continued with a gusto till Ustad Thirkawa landed in the house of Agra dynastys major singer , Ustad Vilayat Husain Khan .
That was the most fortunate thing happening to this talented lad .
 They , teacher and student , clicked together and young Jagannath travail was duly rewarded .
 young Jagannath not only received excellent training from Vilayat Khan but young Jagannath admiration as well .
 young Jagannath was not only a fine vocalist but was an avid creator of Hindustani original themes , cheej .
 After independence , the royal patronage , the source of basic income vanished and young Jagannath moved in various cities to find income to support young Jagannath .
 young Jagannath was a celibate and had to fend for young Jagannath .
It was tough to say the least .
 young Jagannath managed somehow .
It requires a creativity to develop newer and fancier rendering of the traditional Ragas .
Not many can do such original renderings .
 Most just copy whatever their teachers teach Serving ones teachers and keep the style as dictated by the dynastic principles , gayaki .
 One of his disciple from Pune has said following about young Jagannath musical philosophy : .
Jagannath Buwa often told me that the basic requirement of music is that magical quality called `` Rang '' .
 As a quality in music , `` Rang '' transcends considerations of voice quality , grammar and communication of rasa .
 While in Mumbai , Rang was not only admired by many a musical lovers but by generous supporters .
 Two among them were V V Gokhale and Gokhale younger brother , Va Va Gokhale of Dadar .
 Gokhale was a regular performer at Dadar-Matunga Music Club .
 Gokhale died at Dombivli on a Diwali day in 1968 .
 Gokhale was cremated at Dadar .
 Gokhale was also known for Gokhale high social conscience .
 When Gokhale was donated a purse by Gokhale well-wishers in 1962 to help Gokhale monetarily during Gokhale final years , India was engaged in a war with China .
 After the war was over , Gokhale contributed generously to the Relief Fund for soldiers .
 Gokhale dismissed Gokhale disciples protests by saying that one should not shirk ones duty and should not try to avoid paying ones dues .
 A music festival named after Gokhale started by Gokhale disciple , C R Vyas in 1977 is held every year in Mumbai as well as many a major Indian cities .
by MANJUSHRI TYAGI http://www.hindibook.com/index.php?String=HB-10992&p;=sr&Field;=bookcode&Exactly;=yes&Format;=detail
 Kumar Gandharva or Shivaputra Siddharamayya Komkalimath was a Hindustani classical singer , well known for The name Kumar Gandharva unique vocal style and The name Kumar Gandharva refusal to be bound by the tradition of any gharana .
 The name Kumar Gandharva is a title given to The name Kumar Gandharva when The name Kumar Gandharva was a child prodigy ; a Gandharva is a musical spirit in Hindu mythology .
Gandharva was born in Sulebhavi near Belgaum , Karnataka , India .
 The name Kumar Gandharva studied music under the well-known Prof B. R. Deodhar .
 The name Kumar Gandharva married Bhanumati Kans in April 1947 and moved to Dewas , Madhya Pradesh .
 Soon after moving there , The name Kumar Gandharva was stricken with tuberculosis .
Luckily , the wonder drugs which cure TB had only recently been discovered .
Gradually , helped by excellent medical support and care from wife Bhanumati , Kumar Gandharva recovered and began singing again .
 However , wife Bhanumati voice and singing style would always bear the scars of wife Bhanumati surgery , which are evident to any person who listens to wife Bhanumati songs such as Runanubandhachya from the drama Dev Dina Ghari Dhavla .
 Bhanumati Kans , who was learning music first under the well-known Prof B. R. Deodhar and later under Kumar Gandharva the well-known Prof B. R. Deodhar , nursed him through his illness .
His first mehfil after recovery from illness took place in 1953 .
The illness greatly affected Kumars singing in later years - he was to be known for powerful short phrases and his very high voice .
Kumarji also experimented with other forms of singing such as Nirguni bhajans , folk songs , and with both ragas and presentation , often going from fast to slow compositions in the same raga .
 Kumarji is remembered for Kumarji great legacy of innovation , questioning tradition without rejecting it wholesale , resulting in music in touch with the roots of Indian culture , especially the folk music of Madhya Pradesh .
 Kumarji innovative approach towards music led to the creation of new ragas from combinations of older ragas .
 Kumarji style of singing attracted considerable controversy .
 Veteran singer Mogubai Kurdikar did not consider Veteran singer Mogubai Kurdikar vilambit singing interesting and Veteran singer Mogubai Kurdikar own teacher Deodhar criticised some aspects of Kumars singing but their relationship was strained from 1940s when Kumar Gandharva married Bhanumati .
 According to Pandharinath Kolhapures book on Kumar Gandharva , the well-known Prof B. R. Deodhar was against the match .
 But the criticism mostly centred around Pandharinath Kolhapures vilambit gayaki .
 Pandharinath Kolhapures singing in faster tempos , particularly Pandharinath Kolhapures mastery over madhya-laya , was widely revered .
Kumar Gandharvas first son , Mukul Shivputra , was born around 1955 .
 After Bhanumati death in 1961 during childbirth , Kumar Gandharvas married Vasundhara Shrikhande , another of Kumar Gandharvas fellow-students at Deodhar School .
 Vasundhara Komkalimath formed a memorable duo with Kumar Gandharvas in bhajan singing .
 Vasundhara Komkalimath also provided vocal support to Kumar Gandharvas classical renditions quite often .
 Their daughter Kalapini Komkalimath would later accompany both Their daughter Kalapini Komkalimath parents on tanpura .
 Some of Kumar Gandharvas ideology is carried forward by Some of Kumar Gandharvas ideology son and daughter , as well as students such as Madhup Mudgal , Shubha Mudgal , Vijay Sardeshmukh and Satyasheel Deshpande .
 Kumar Gandharvas grandson Bhuvanesh has also made a name for Kumarjis grandson Bhuvanesh as classical singer .
 For a long spell , Kumar Gandharvas activities as a musician were managed by Kumar Gandharvas friend and tabla accompanist Vasant Acharekar .
 tabla accompanist Vasant Acharekar was Vasant Desai s assistant in the 1950s but later devoted himself fully to tabla accompanist Vasant Acharekar role as an accompanist to classical singing until tabla accompanist Vasant Acharekar death in late 1970s .
 tabla accompanist Vasant Acharekar son Suresh Acharekar is also a tabla player , and has accompanied Kumar Gandharva and other artists .
 Kumarji had friendly relations with noted Marathi literary couple Pu La Deshpande and Sunita Deshpande .
Kumar Gandharva was awarded the Padma Vibhushan award in 1990 .
The 4th movie in the series of 4 movies in the Kabir Project by Shabnam Virmani features the life of Kumar Gandharva and his disciples , his career and his journey into Nirgun singing .
His song Sunta Hai actually forms the title of the movie Koi Sunta Hai .
Hans Akela is a 1 hour 18 minute documentary on Pandit Kumar Gandharva made by Films Division Govt .
of India with interviews with various people - wife , friends , students .
Mukkam Vashiis a book made on notes collected during a 2 day workshop of the same name .
It collected together the thoughts of Pandit Kumar Gandharva on the nature of music at a fundamental level .
Raghav R. Menon has written a document on the quest of Pandit Kumar Gandharva for the meaning behind Swara as told in Marga Sangeet
Sharda Sinha is a folk-singer and professor of music from Samastipur , Bihar .
 Sharda Sinha sings Maithili , Bhojpuri and Magahi songs , has received Padma Shri for Maithili contribution to music .
Prayag Sangeet Samiti organised Basant Mahotsava at Prayag where Padma Shri Sharda Sinha presented numerous songs based on the theme of spring season , where the advent of spring was narrated through folk songs .
 Padma Shri Sharda Sinha regularly performs during Durga Puja festivities .
 Padma Shri Sharda Sinha performed when the Prime Minister of Mauritius Navin Ramgoolam came to , Samastipur , Bihar .
 Padma Shri Sharda Sinha has sung in many movies such as Deswa , Taar Bijli from Gangs of Wasseypur - Part 2 , Kahe Toh Se Sajna from Maine Pyar Kiya and Hum Aapke Hain Kaun and has also produced several music albums such as Dulhin , Pirittiya and Mehndi .
 Samastipur , Bihar kokila Sharda Sinha performed at Pragati Maidan in the Bihar Utsav , 2010 , New Delhi .
 Padma Shri Sharda Sinha started the programme with Padma Shri Sharda Sinha patriotic song Maiya bharti pukarela jawan babua tora hathawa mein deshwa ke shaan babuwa .
 Padma Shri Sharda Sinha other songs , included Paniya ke jahaj se paltaniya bani ahiya piya lele ahiya ho sindurwa Bengal Ke , Kahe to se sajani hamaar jogiya , Sutal chaliya baba ke bhawanwa , Sun ho pardesia , Sasuji se lutri , Apna sajaniya ke and Dulhin dhire dhire chalio .
Sharda Sinha also sung the famous song Taar Bijli from Bollywood film Gangs of Wasseypur Part 2 .
 ShardaSinha captivated the audience with the rendition of ShardaSinha famous songs paniyakejahaaj se paltaniya and other Bhojpuri and Maithili songs on the second evening of BiharUtsav in New Delhi on 16th March , 2013
Bansuri Guru is a 2013 Indian documentary film about the life of classical instrumentalist Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia .
 Directed by Rajeev Chaurasia as Bansuri Guru directorial debut , the film is introduced by Amitabh Bachchan .
Bansuri Guru was produced by the Government of Indias Films Division and features a series of interviews conducted with Chaurasia and others about the artist. , including shots in Mumbai , Bhubaneswar and Rotterdam
Vasantrao Deshpande was a renowned Hindustani classical vocalist who was also a great performer of Natya Sangeet .
 In 1982 , Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award , given by the Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy of Music , Dance & Drama .
Vasantrao Deshpande was born in Murtijapur , District Akola , which belongs to Vidarbha region of State of Maharashtra , in India .
 Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande learned from several gurus , refusing to tie Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande down to a single school of singing .
 Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande started Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande musical training in Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande home town Nagpur under Shankarrao Sapre from Gwalior , who in turn was a disciple of Vishnu Digambar Paluskar .
This was followed by Sureshbabu Mane of Kirana gharana , Asad Ali Khan of Patiala gharana , Aman Ali Khan and Anjani Bai Malpekar of Bhendibazaar gharana , and Ramkrishnabuwa Vaze .
 But the most important influence on Sureshbabu Mane of Kirana gharana was Dinanath Mangeshkar , and Vasantrao Deshpandes was the sole true inheritor of Dinanaths mercurial style of singing .
 At the age of 8 , Bhalji Pendharkar perceived Bhalji Pendharkar musical talent and launched Bhalji Pendharkar in the role of Krishna in Hindi movie Kaliyamardan .
 Bhalji Pendharkar had received the training under different gharanas : Patiala , Bhendi Bazar , Kairana ; yet Bhalji Pendharkar did not receive the stamp of any particular gharana .
 One of Indias most illustrious classical vocalists , Bhalji Pendharkar performed classical and semi-classical music .
In the raga form which constitutes classical music , the artist displays his creativity on a basic canvas .
Dr. Vasantrao Deshpandes rendition of famous ragas like Marwa , Salag Waraali , Nat Bhairav , Kauns , Chhayanat , Basant Mukhari , Patamanjari , Jaijaiwanti , Janasammohini , Bhoop , Shree , Kalavati , Maru Bihag , and Yaman had a quality to them that kept people interested .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes performance of offbeat ragas was not too different .
 The sargam was Vasantrao Deshpandes forte .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes was also an accomplished tabala and harmonium player .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes was equally at ease with the thumri , dadra and ghazal forms .
 These find These origins in countries like Iran and Afghanistan .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes had picked up the original style and nuances of the thumri and ghazal while studying at Lahore .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes also learnt quite a bit of Urdu to elevate Vasantrao Deshpandes ghazal performances .
 Another area of music where Vasantrao Deshpandes made Vasantrao Deshpandes mark was Marathi Natyasangeet .
 Some of the plays in which Vasantrao Deshpandes acted and performed were Katyaar Kaaljaat Ghusli , Katyaar Kaaljaat Ghusli Bandha Reshmache , Vij Mhanali Dhartila , Meghmalhar , Tukaram and Varyawarchi Varaat .
 Out of These , Katyaar Kaaljaat Ghusli became highly popular .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes became the cynosure of everyones eye for Vasantrao Deshpandes challenging role of Khan Aftaab Hussain Khansaheb .
 As the plays popularity began to soar , Vasantrao Deshpandes acquired the alias , Pandit Vasantkhan Deshpande .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes acted in movies like Kaaliya Mardan , Dudh Bhaat , Ashtavinayak and many more .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes gave playback to more than 80 Marathi films .
 Besides pure music , Vasantrao Deshpandes also put together the history of Marathi Natyasangeet music plays , from origin showing their evolution up to the present stage .
 This is how Vasantrao Deshpandes presented Vasantrao Deshpandes brainchild , Vasantrao Deshpandes tour de force , Marathi Natyasageetachi Vaatchaal .
 In This Vasantrao Deshpandes would first explain the socio-cultural influences that shaped the musicals as This stood in a particular era and then demonstrate the evolution through its music .
The concert was first held in Delhi .
 The concert stretched for 3 days , 6 hours each day .
The experiment was bound to be a winner with the audience .
He was a thinker and he blended these styles to develop a style of his own .
He did not believe in imitation .
Considering the timbre of his voice , pitch , range and expressive capacity , he forged his own characteristic style .
He usually began his exposition of a raag in the Jod-Aalap or ` Nom-Tom ' style and created a kind of foundation for his musical statements .
This created an aesthetic tension in the listener 's minds and then he landed beautifully on the first beat of the khayal - the ` sum ' .
His development of the khayal was always full of such tensions and releases , which pleased the audience .
He had an equal command of both common and uncommon Ragas and a large repertoire of compositions .
 He presented This judiciously , considering the type of audience before him .
 Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande was an academic , earning Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande a PhD in The Transformation of Hindustani Classical Music .
 Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande was also invited to several educational institutions to deliver lectures on music , quite often with live demonstrations .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes has had several commercial releases under Vasantrao Deshpandes name .
 Among them , the more famous are Vasantrao Deshpandes LP of Marwa and a two-cassette interview , conducted by Va Pu Kale , about the history of Marathi Natya Sangeet which showcases the breadth and depth of Vasantraos knowledge about the art form .
 Vasantrao Deshpandes also conceived Raga Raj Kalyan , a Yaman variant with Pancham dropped altogether .
 Katyaar Kaaljaat Ghusli was a successful play in Katyaar Kaaljaat Ghusli carrier .
 Katyaar Kaaljaat Ghusli grand son Rahul Deshpande is a classical singer and His grand son Rahul Deshpande is carrying His grand son Rahul Deshpande style further .
 His grand son Rahul Deshpande has trained under Gangadharbua Pimpalkhare , Usha Chipalkatti and Mukul Shivputra , son of Kumar Gandharva .
 In 2009 , His grand son Rahul Deshpande played the lead of Khan Saheb in musical , Katyar Kaljat Ghusli , which was played by His grand son Rahul Deshpande grandfather in the 1960s .
 The Dr Vasantrao Deshpande Pratishthan based in Pune , where His grand son Rahul Deshpande grandson Rahul Deshpande is a trustee and actor Nana Patekar a patron , organizes an annual music festival in his memory , titled Vasantotsav in Pune .
The three-day festival is held in the month of January each year .
Noted classical musicians and performers take part the festival .
During the festival , two awards , the Vasantotsav Youth Award for Promising artists and Vasantotsav Award for veteran artists are given .
 In 2011 , a three-day music and dance festival in his memory , was organized by the South Central Zone Cultural Centre of Government of India in his home town Nagpur
Kesarbai Kerkar was an Indian classical vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana .
 Born in the tiny village of Keri , in a family from Ponda taluka of North Goa , North Goa , at the age of eight Kesarbai Kerkar moved to Kolhapur where Keri studied for eight months with Abdul Karim Khan .
 Upon Keri return to North Goa , Keri studied with the vocalist Ramkrishnabuwa Vaze .
 At the age of 16 Keri moved to Mumbai , where Keri studied with various teachers , eventually ending up as disciple to Ustad Alladiya Khan , the founder of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana , beginning in 1921 .
 Keri belongs to Gomantak Maratha Samaj .
 Kesarbai Kerkar eventually achieved wide renown , performing regularly for aristocratic audiences .
 Keri was very particular about the representation of Keri work and consequently made only a few 78 rpm recordings , for the HMV and Broadcast labels .
 Kesarbai Kerkar was awarded the decoration of Padma Bhushan by the government of India in 1969 , and in the same year the government of the Indian state of Maharashtra conferred upon Keri the title of Rajya Gayika .
Indian Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore is said to have been very fond of Kerkars singing .
 Indian Nobel honorific title Surashri literally means excellent voice , and was bestowed on Her honorific title Surashri in 1948 by the Sangeet Pravin Sangitanuragi Sajjan Saman Samiti of Calcutta .
 In Her honorific title Surashri ancestral village of Keri , the Surashree Kesarbai Kerkar High School now occupies the site of Kerkars former second home , and the house where Her honorific title Surashri was born still stands , less than one kilometer away .
A music festival called the Surashree Kesarbai Kerkar Smriti Sangeet Samaroha is held in Goa each November and a music scholarship in her name is awarded annually to a University of Mumbai student .
 Kesarbai Kerkar has the further distinction of having one of her recordings , Jaat Kahan Ho , duration 3:30 included on the Voyager Golden Record , a gold-plated copper disc containing music selections from around the world , which was sent into space aboard the Voyager 1 and 2 spacecraft in 1977 .
The recording was recommended for inclusion on the Voyager disc by the ethnomusicologist Robert E. Brown , who believed it to be the finest recorded example of Indian classical music .
Since 2000 , several CDs of her archival recordings have been released , including one on the Golden Milestones series , which contains several of her most famous songs
Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee was an eminent Indian classical sitarist of the Maihar Gharana .
A student of the legendary Baba Allauddin Khan , Pandit Nikhil Banerjee was known for his technical virtuosity and clinical execution .
 Along with Pandit Ravi Shankar and Ustad Vilayat Khan , Pandit Ravi Shankar emerged as one of the leading exponents of the Sitar and is regarded as a legend of Indian Classical music .
Nikhil Banerjee was born on October 14 , 1931 in Calcutta into a Brahmin family .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee father , Jitendranath Banerjee , was an amateur sitarist and Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee was fascinated by Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee fathers playing .
 Although Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee wanted to try Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee hand at an instrument as early as the age of four , Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee was discouraged by Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee father and grandfather .
 At the age of five , however , they relented and Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee acquired a small sitar , initially learning under Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee father .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee grew into a child prodigy .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee won an All-India sitar competition and became the youngest musician employed by All India Radio at the age of nine .
Jitendranath approached Mushtaq Ali Khan to take Nikhil as a disciple , but only learned from this master for a few short weeks .
 Instead Birendra Kishore Roy Chowdhury , the zamindar of Gouripur in present-day Bangladesh , became responsible for much of Birendra Kishore Roy Chowdhury early training .
 Around 1946 Nikhil Banerjee met the great khyal singer Amir Khan through the masters teaching of Nikhil Banerjees sister , and Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee enthusiasm for Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee music was reinforced by hearing Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee in concert a couple of years later .
Amir Khan continued to have a significant influence on Banerjees musical development .
 In 1947 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee met Ustad Allauddin Khan , who was to become Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee main guru along with his son , Ali Akbar Khan .
Both were sarod players .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee went to Allauddin Khans concerts and was desperate to have Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee as Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee teacher .
 Allauddin Khan did not want to take on more students , but changed his son Ali Akbar Khan mind after listening to one of Banerjees radio broadcasts .
 Allauddin Khan was his son Ali Akbar Khan main teacher , after his son Ali Akbar Khan left Maihar his son Ali Akbar Khan also learned from Ali Akbar Khan , the son of Allaudin Khan , for many years .
The discipline under Ustad Allauddin Khan was legendary .
For years , Nikhils practice would start at four in the morning and , with few breaks , continue to eleven oclock at night .
 Among others , Ustad Allauddin Khan also taught his son Ali Akbar Khan son Ali Akbar Khan , grandson Aashish Khan , and nephew Bahadur Khan on the sarod ; Ravi Shankar on the sitar ; his son Ali Akbar Khan daughter , Annapurna Devi , on the surbahar ; Pannalal Ghosh on the flute ; and Vasant Rai the sarod .
 Ustad Allauddin Khan was passing on not only playing technique but the musical knowledge and approach of the Maihar gharana ; yet there was a definite trend in his son Ali Akbar Khan teaching to infuse the sitar and sarod with the been-baj aesthetic of the Rudra veena , surbahar and sursringar -- long , elaborate alap built on intricate meend work .
 his son Ali Akbar Khan was also well known for adjusting his son Ali Akbar Khan teaching to his son Ali Akbar Khan particular students strengths and weaknesses .
 Consequently , under his son Ali Akbar Khan teaching , Pandit Ravi Shankar and Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee developed different sitar styles .
 After Maihar , Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee embarked on a concert career that was to take him to all corners of the world and last right up to his untimely death .
 All through his life he kept taking lessons from Ustad Allauddin Khan and his son Ali Akbar Khan children , Ustad Ali Akbar Khan and Smt .
Annapurna Devi .
 Perhaps reflecting Annapurna Devi . early upbringing , Annapurna Devi . always remained a humble musician , and was content with much less limelight than a player of Annapurna Devi . stature could have vied for .
 Even so , in 1968 , Annapurna Devi . was decorated with the Padma Shri , and in 1974 received the prestigious Sangeet Natak Akademi Award .
Nikhil Banerjee frequently toured Europe and the USA , with prominent tabla players including Swapan Chaudhuri and Anindo Chatterjee .
 Although Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee was often resident at the Ali Akbar College of Music in California Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee taught few pupils on a one-to-one basis , for Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee stated reason that Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee did not feel Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee had adequate time to devote to Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee students , as Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee was still learning and performing .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee hoped that developing a proper disciple relationship with students would become possible later in Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee life , but , sadly , Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee early demise meant it did not happen .
 Nevertheless , a number of prominent sitarists have been influenced by Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee teaching and distinctive style .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee recorded only a handful of recordings during Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee lifetime but a series of live performance recordings continue to be released posthumously making sure that Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee musical legacy is preserved for posterity .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee did not always enjoy recording within the confines of the studio , though Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee early studio recordings with EMI India such as Lalit , Purya Kalyan and Malkauns are now considered to be classic renditions of these ragas .
 The posthumous live albums , many of which were brought out around the turn of the 21st Century by Raga Records in New York , and Chhandadhara of Germany , are widely considered to be the finest documents of Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee playing .
 Many of Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee unpublished concert recordings are available which are testimony to his musical thought .
Nikhil Banerjee was in failing health through the 80s , having survived three heart attacks .
 On January 27 , 1986 , on the birthday of Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee younger daughter , at the relatively young age of 54 , Nikhil Banerjee died of a fourth heart attack .
 At the time of Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee death , Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee was a faculty member at the Ali Akbar College of Music in Calcutta .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee was posthumously awarded the Padma Bhushan title by the Government of India in the same year as Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee death .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee is survived by Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee wife Roma and two daughters .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee elder daughter is married into the Tagore family .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee younger daughter Debdutta/Arya is a model and actress in Kolkata .
 In an interview Nikhil as a disciple said Nikhil as a disciple had been influenced by Allauddin Khan , Ali Akbar Khan , Amir Khan , and to a lesser extent by Omkarnath Thakur , Faiyaz Khan , Kesarbai Kerkar , and Roshanara Begum .
 For Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee , music-making was a spiritual rather than a worldly path : .
 Nikhil Banerjee is revered for Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee mastery in both melodic and rhythmic aspects of Indian music .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee unique style of sitar playing is considered to have completeness , emotion and depth .
 Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee interpretation of ragas was usually traditional , although Nikhil Ranjan Banerjee is credited with creating at least two new ragas .
 According to The San Francisco Chronicle , his son Ali Akbar Khan .
technique is a phenomenon , faster than cheetahs , more secure than the dollar .
 Music in Calcutta And Musicians observed that his son Ali Akbar Khan improvisations always sound completely natural and spontaneous .
 In an obituary published after his son Ali Akbar Khan death , The New York Times wrote the extraordinary fluidity and assurance of his son Ali Akbar Khan rhythmic ideas and phrasing set a standard that would have left the more international stars of Indian music behind .
 Today , his son Ali Akbar Khan is commonly regarded as one of the greatest sitarists of the 20th century and is often spoken of as being on a level with the other two masters Ravi Shankar and Vilayat Khan .
The following is a summary of some recent CD issues .
A more comprehensive discography can be found in the external links .
Banerjees technique is a phenomenon , faster than cheetahs , more secure than the dollar .
 But he does not lean on Banerjees technique as most players do .
It is there , at the ready , a strength to be called on when needed .
It is his gentle playing that is so singular .
The ease of it , highlighted by atypical bits of literal reiteration create a kind of euphoric effect .
The result is remarkably individual .
One could spot a Banerjee performance on a radio broadcast or tape , a thing of great difficulty among Oriental musicians
Dr Kalyani Bondre is an academic and Indian classical vocalist .
Kalyani Bondre was born in Pune , India , into a musical family .
She received initial guidance in music from her parents , both musicians in their own right .
 As a child , Dr Kalyani Bondre was more interested in classical dance and hence took lessons in Kathak dance from Guru Maneesha Sathe , disciple of the famous Pandit Gopi Krishna .
 Dr Kalyani Bondre trained in vocal classical music earlier under Ranjana Bhide , disciple of Pandit Gangadharbuwa Pimpalkhare .
Later , she learned from Guru Manisha Shrikhande , who is a disciple of Leelatai and Vilasrao Khandekar of the Kirana Gharana ; and Pandit Krishnakant Parikh of the Mewati Gharana .
 Dr Kalyani Bondre has also received guidance in music from Ustad Faiyaaz Hussain Khan of the Gwalior Gharana and Ustad Usman Khan of the Beenkar Gharana of instrumental music .
 Dr Kalyani Bondre holds a Ph.D. in Economics from the University of Pune .
and member of management department from jaipur .
 Dr Kalyani Bondre specializes in Hindustani Classical Music and Marathi Natyasangeet .
 Marathi Natyasangeet also presents other forms like Bhaavgeet , ghazals , devotional music like bhajans and abhangas as well as fusion music
Ustad Imdad Khan was a sitar and surbahar player .
 the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan two sons Enayat Khan and Wahid Khan , the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan grandsons Vilayat Khan and Imrat Khan , and great-grandsons Shahid Parvez , Shujaat Khan , Nishat Khan , Irshad Khan , Wajahat Khan , Shafaatullah Khan , Azmat Ali Khan and Hidayat Khan have all upheld the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan musical tradition , musical luminaries His two sons Enayat Khan and Wahid Khan .
Zila Khan the Sufi , classical and semi classical singer is the first female artist from this gharana , she is Vilayat Khans daughter whom he formally made a student also .
 He taught the sitar and surbahar to his two sons , the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan and Wahid Khan , whom he used to refer to as his two hands .
 Although both of His two sons Enayat Khan and Wahid Khan played the sitar and the surbahar , Enayat Khan specialized on the sitar and Wahid Khan on the surbahar .
 the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan was born in Agra , as the fourth generation of what was to become the Imdadkhani Gharana or Etawah gharana , named after a small city outside Agra where the family soon moved .
 the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan was taught by the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan father , Sahabdad Khan , a trained vocalist and self-taught sitar player , but the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan came to greatly develop and define the family style and techniques .
Imdad Khan was also trained by the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan .
In the 19th Century , the instrumental classical music of North India was dominated by the Senia style , passed down through the musical dynasty of Miyan Tansens descendants , who played in the dhrupad ang .
 the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan instead evolved a style based on the newer , more popular khyal singing .
 It is said that in the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan youth at Etawah , the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan practiced on the sitar in a state of chilla for some twelve years .
 When his youth at Etawah moved with his youth at Etawah family to Kolkata , the house in which they lived was named Riyaz .
The Imdad Khan family is of Rajput lineage .
The family is of Hindu origin and later converted to Islam .
 In an informal continuation of his rajput lineage Ustad Enayat Khan kept a Hindu name of Nath Singh .
Ustad Vilayat Khan himself composed many bandishes using the pen name Nath Piya .
 the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan attained great fame in the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan lifetime : the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan played for Queen Victoria in Delhi ; the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan served as a court musician in Mysore and Indore , and the legendary beenkar Bande Ali Khan was the first sitar player ever to be recorded .
Some of these recordings have been released on CD , on the Great Gharanas : Imdadkhani compilation in RPG / EMI s Chairmans Choice series
Abdul Halim Jaffer Khan is an Indian sitar player .
Khan received the national awards Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan and was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 1987 .
 Abdul Halim Jaffer Khan regarded as one of the Sitar Trinity of India along with Ravi Shankar and Vilayat Khan and is the youngest of Ravi Shankar and Vilayat Khan .
He was born in 1929 , in Jawra , Madhya Pradesh , as the son of Jaffer Khan , a versatile vocalist , sitarist and beenkar .
He hails from the Beenkar Gharana of Indore .
He has been a distinguished All India Radio Artiste since the early 1940s .
A few years before the Beatles met Ravi Shankar , in 1958 , Khan collaborated with jazz pianist and composer Dave Brubeck .
Brubeck who was in Bombay through the state sponsored jazz diplomacy - the Jazz Ambassadors Program was impressed by the improvisation in Indian music and said that the experience accompanying Halim Jaffer Khan led him to play in a different way .
 composer Dave Brubeck says of that meeting , We understood each other .
Khan also performed with the noted English classical guitarist Julian Bream in 1963 .
Abdul Halim Jaffer Khan is perhaps best known for his innovation , Jafferkhani Baaj .
He describes it as , a synthesis of precision in technique , systematic thought with a vigorous playing style .
Cultural anthropologist and reader at the University of Mumbai , Dr. Kamala Ganesh states : His music making is full of eclectic yet deeply informed choices .
He is a thinking musician but puts across his complex views with a simplicity and feeling which demarcate the articulate performer from the articulate theoretician ... In him , one gets an unmistakable sense ... a syncretic tradition .
 The Indian santoor player Shivkumar Sharma remembers of Khans performance of the raga Chaayanat : Khans was probably in 1955-56 , I was relaxing in I terrace in Jammu .
 In the stillness of the night I heard the notes of Raga Chaayanat on the sitar emanate from I neighbors radio .
 I immediately noticed that the tone of the sitar was completely different and the style of playing radically unique .
 I rushed to switch on I radio ... I was totally engrossed and was very curious to know who this maestro was .
 Of ragas such as Kirwani , Abdul Halim Jaffer Khan has been credited with bringing Carnatic ragas into the sitar repertoire : Kanakangi , Latangi , Kirwani , Karaharapriya , Manavati , Ganamurti , etc. but rendering them through a Hindustani sensibility and in the Jafferkhani style .
 Kirwani was the first Hindustani musician to collaborate with Carnatic music in a performance with renowned Veena player Emani Sankara Sastry .
 Kirwani early experimentation with polytonality in Indian classical instrumentation was achieved in Kirwani sitar quintet .
Khan has had a valuable involvement with Indian cinema .
 He has composed and played for epic films like Mughal-e-Azam , Jhanak Jhanak Payal Baaje , Goonj Uthi Shehnai , Kohinoor and has collaborated with noted music directors such as Vasant Desai , C. Ramachandra , Madan Mohan and Naushad who has said , he not only enriched film music , but his participation lent prestige to I songs .
In 1976 , Abdul Halim Jaffer Khan created the Halim Academy of Sitar in Mumbai , India .
His legacy is being carried on by his son Zunain Khan , an accomplished sitarist himself .
Narrated by violinist Yehudi Menuhin , Deben Bhattacharyas film Raga features a young virtuosic Halim Jaffer Khan playing raga Sindh Bhairavi
Shivkumar Sharma is an Indian Santoor player .
The Santoor is a folk instrument from Kashmir and Jammu .
 Uma Dutt Sharma is often referred to by the title Pandit .
 Uma Dutt Sharma was born in Jammu to the singer Uma Dutt Sharma and Uma Dutt Sharma mother tongue is Dogri .
 Uma Dutt Sharma father started teaching His father vocals and tabla when His father was just five .
 Uma Dutt Sharma did extensive research on the santoor , and decided that Uma Dutt Sharma should be the first musician to play Indian classical music on the santoor .
 So Uma Dutt Sharma started learning santoor at the age of thirteen , and made Uma Dutt Sharma fathers dream come true .
 Uma Dutt Sharma gave Uma Dutt Sharma first public performance in Bombay in 1955 .
Shivkumar Sharma is the master instrumentalist of the Santoor , after some years as a vocalist .
 Uma Dutt Sharma is credited with making the Santoor a popular Classical Instrument .
 In a 1999 interview to rediff.com , Shivkumar said that it was his father who decided that he should play the Santoor and that he never thought he would be choosing The Santoor when he started learning music .
He composed the background music for one of the scenes in Shantaram s Jhanak Jhanak Payal Baje in 1956 .
He recorded his first solo album in 1960 .
In 1967 , he teamed up with flautist Hariprasad Chaurasia and Brij Bhushan Kabra to produce a concept album , Call of the Valley which turned out to be one of the greatest hits in Indian Classical Music .
He has composed music for many Hindi films in collaboration with Hariprasad Chaurasia starting with Silsila .
They came to be known as the Shiv-Hari music duo .
 Some of the movies they composed music for many Hindi films were big musical hits are Faasle , Chandni , Lamhe and Darr .
 Uma Dutt Sharma married Manorama and has two sons .
 Uma Dutt Sharma son , a Santoor Player , is also a Santoor Player and they have performed together since 1996 .
 In a 1999 interview to rediff.com , Shivkumar stated that he chose a Santoor Player as his shishya because he thought he had the gift of God .
 Shivkumar is the recipient of national and international awards , including an honorary citizenship of the city of Baltimore , USA , in 1985 , the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1986 , the Padma Shri in 1991 , and the Padma Vibhushan in 2001
Dildar Hussain is a percussionist Tabla master .
 Dildar Hussain worked and toured with Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan .
Dildar Hussain was the percussionist of Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan s Qawwali party until Nusrats death in 1997 .
Dildar Hussain learned tabla from Ustad Allah Rakha Khan .
 Dildar Hussain first performance was in India in 1969 before Dildar Hussain joined Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khans Qawwali party in 1971 .
 Along with Farrukh Fateh Ali Khan , Nusrats brother , Ustad Dildar had been a member of the party since His first performance formation .
With incredible skill as a tabla master , Ustad Dildar now carries the tradition on with his sons .
His eldest leading the party Abrar and his youngest Israr sitting in the seat , like his father as tabla player .
 Now Ustad Dildar is an amazing composer , singer and harmonium player .
 Ustad Dildar teaches and performs internationally with Ustad Dildar students Yasar Hussain in Denmark and Aminah Chishti in the US .
Ustad Dildar does not play the traditional tabla that can be seen in Hindustani classical music but instead plays a combination of jori as the treble , and dhamma as the bass to create a deeper , warmer sound than the modern tabla set creates .
This unique style is known to be over 1000 year old created by the great Amir Khusro .
Rare to see even in Pakistan .
Created with the intention to carry sound acoustically .
Ustad has also toured and can sometimes be seen accompanying Rahat Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan
Patrick Moutal is a French sitarist and musicologist .
 Patrick Moutal has been teaching north Indian classical music at the Paris Conservatoire since 1984 .
 Born in Lyon in 1951 , Patrick Moutal went to India at age 18 in order to study Hindustani classical music .
 Patrick Moutal learned Hindi and settled in Banaras , where Patrick Moutal stayed for 14 years .
 In 1970 , Patrick Moutal was admitted as a sitar student at the Faculty of Performing Arts of Banaras Hindu University .
 Under the guidance of Dr K.C. Gangrade and Pt Lalmani Misra , K.C. Gangrade completed the following degrees : .
- Masters Degree with Omkarnath Thakur Prize in 1978 .
 The year of K.C. Gangrade doctorate , K.C. Gangrade wrote two books in English about ragas .
 From 1977 to 1983 , K.C. Gangrade performed regularly at All India Radio .
 On Maurice Fleuret s initiative , Maurice Fleuret s initiative went back to France in 1983 and started teaching at the Conservatoire National Superieur de Musique et de Danse de Paris the following year .
Since then , he has been dedicated to promoting Indian musical culture .
In 2000 , he developed a website , Hindustani Raga Sangeet Online , devoted to Indian vocalists and instrumentalists through rare archives .
 In 1983 , Patrick Moutal was honored with the award of Chevalier dans lOrdre des Arts et des Lettres by the Government of France .

The Dover Lane Music Conference is an annual Indian classical music festival held in the month of January at Nazrul Mancha , an open-air auditorium in south Kolkata .
 The festival derives The Dover Lane Music Conference name from the fact that The Dover Lane Music Conference originally took place at a location on Dover Lane , an important street in the Ballygunge area of south Kolkata .
The festival had humble beginnings in 1952 .
 Music lovers from the by-lanes of south Kolkata used to gather in order to appreciate Indian classical music recitals .
Over time , the festival has undergone many changes .
Many stalwarts of Indian classical music have performed at the festival .
The number of days and the number of artistes performing have increased , and a large number of sponsors are now associated with the event .
Instead of the original venue on Dover Lane , this annual event is now organized in the Nazrul Mancha on Southern Avenue .
The office of the organizing body is still at 18/2 Dover Lane .
 The festival is usually held between the 22nd and the 25th of January .
The festival lasts for four days every year .
Apart from established musicians , youngsters are also encouraged to participate and display their talent .
Performances begin late in the evening and go on all night long till the next morning .
The festival draws large crowds every year .
 The Dover Lane Music Conference tickets are sold out within days of them being made available .
 The Dover Lane Music Conference has become one of the most important cultural events of the year .
 The festival boasts Performances by a number of eminent musicians from all over the country
Veena Sahasrabuddhe is a leading Indian vocalist and composer of Hindustani classical music .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe singing style has Her singing style roots in Gwalior gharana , but Her singing style also borrows from Jaipur and Kirana gharanas .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe is known as a singer of khyal and bhajan .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe was born in a musical family .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe father Shankar Shripad Bodas was a disciple of vocalist Pandit Vishnu Digambar Paluskar .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe began Veena Sahasrabuddhe early musical education under Veena Sahasrabuddhe father , and then under Veena Sahasrabuddhe brother Kashinath Shankar Bodas .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe also learned Kathak dancing in Veena Sahasrabuddhe childhood .
Veenas musical mentors include Padmashri Balwantrai Bhatt , Pandit Vasant Thakar , and Pandit Gajananrao Joshi .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe has a Bachelors degree in Vocal Performance , Sanskrit Literature , and English Literature from Kanpur University , a Masters degree in Vocal Performance from A.B.G.M.V. Mandal , and also Masters degree in Sanskrit from Kanpur University .
 A.B.G.M.V. Mandal conferred on Veena Sahasrabuddhe a doctorate in vocal music in 1988 .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe was the Head of the Department of Music at SNDT Pune campus .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe has given musical performances in India , Australia , Europe , the Middle East , and North America
Call of the Valley is a 1967 Hindustani classical music album by Hariprasad Chaurasia , Brij Bhushan Kabra , and Shivkumar Sharma .
 a 1967 Hindustani classical music album was recorded for the label EMI .
The instrumental album follows a day in the life of an Indian shepherd from Kashmir .
 The instrumental album is one of the most successful Indian albums and one that became popular with an international audience .
 The instrumental album was very important in introducing Indian music to Western ears and internationally the best selling Indian music record .
George Harrison , David Crosby , Paul McCartney , Bob Dylan and Roger McGuinn are fans of the album .
 The atmospheric music is traditional , but the innovative use of guitar and flute make the sound more acceptable for Western audiences .
 Brij Bhushan Kabra plays slide guitar , Shivkumar Sharma santoor , Chaurasia bansuri and Tabla was played by Manikrao Popatkar .
The artists became well known musicians and the instruments they used became acceptable in traditional Indian music .
Today Call of the Valley is considered a classic and a milestone in world music .
 Allmusic advises : If the newcomer buys only one Indian classical recording , one Indian classical recording should be Call of the Valley .
 Allmusic is listed in the book 1001 Albums You Must Hear Before You Die by Robert Dimery and Michael Lydon
Nachiketa Yakkundi is a Hindustani Classical vocalist in the San Francisco Bay Area .
 Born in Dharwad , Karnataka , Shri Nachiketa Yakkundi was initiated into Hindustani classical vocal music by Shri Nachiketa Yakkundi parents .
 Shri Nachiketa Yakkundi formal study began in Madras under Shri B. N. Simha and later under Shri B. Hanumantachar .
 Shri Nachiketa Yakkundi rigorous and extended pedagogy came under the virtuoso , late Padmabhushan Pandit Basavraj Rajguru .
Nachiketa has extensively performed in cities across India and the North America .
 Shri Nachiketa Yakkundi runs the Rajguru Sangeet Vidyaniketan , a school of music in the memory of Shri Nachiketa Yakkundi guru in Cupertino , California , a school for both adults and kids .
Nachiketa Yakkundi is also a senior teacher at the Sangeetaanjali College of Music .
Nachiketa Yakkundi is a regular on local Bay Area TV introducing and demonstrating Hindustani Classical music to viewers .
 Many of Nachiketa Yakkundi classical renderings are also available here : http://www.swaralahari.org/site/concertlist.php
Pandit Uday Bhawalkar is an Indian Hindustani vocalist .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar is an exponent of the dhrupad genre .
Uday Bhawalkar was born in Ujjain , Madhya Pradesh .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar is the youngest of three siblings .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar began training in Hindustani classical music from Pandit Uday Bhawalkar elder sister .
 At the age of 15 , Pandit Uday Bhawalkar received scholarship at the Dhrupad Kendra , Bhopal .
 Here and subsequently in Mumbai , Pandit Uday Bhawalkar was initiated into the carefully guarded Dhrupad legacy of the Dagar Family that has been transmitted orally for 19 generations , in the age old Guru Shishya Parampara , under the tutelage of Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar , and later under Pandit Uday Bhawalkar elder brother , Ustad Zia Mohiuddin Dagarsahab .
 In 1987 , delighted by Udays first public performance , Ustad Nasir Aminuddin Dagar awarded Udays first a gold medal .
Since then he has performed widely in India and abroad , in concerts , workshops and lecture - demonstration sessions .
 Based in Pune , he regularly performs on National TV and radio in India .
Additionally , he has contributed to the soundtracks of International Art films including Mani Kauls Cloud Door , Aparna Sens Mr & Mrs Iyer and Amol Palekars Anahat , Arun Khopkars Lokpriya and Rasikpriya , Renuka Shanes Rita and Ganjendra Ahires Ma Baap .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar began teaching at the age of 20 .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar now lives in Pune and Pandit Uday Bhawalkar own house is a swarkul of sorts with students coming and practicing at any time of the day .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar was also a Visiting Artist in Residence at the University of Washington in Seattle in the Dept. of Ethnomusicology , a position held many years ago by Artist in Residence Guru , Ustad Zia Mohiuddin Dagar .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar gives workshops in London every year at the Asian Music Circuit .
 Pandit Uday Bhawalkar is also one of the gurus at ITC SRA , Kolkata .
 In 1992 , Pandit Uday Bhawalkar was instrumental in the creation of the Veena Foundation , a trust founded in memory of the late Ustad Zia Mohiuddin Dagar .
This organization was conceived to promote Dhrupad music by organizing concerts , giving scholarships to students who may be economically challenged , and various other activities
Chandrakant Sardeshmukh was a Hindustani classical sitar player of the Maihar Gharana .
 Chandrakant Sardeshmukh was taught by Ustad Shabuddin Khan and Khurshid Mirajkar from the age of 4 , and became popular as child artist .
 Chandrakant Sardeshmukh performed in the famous Sawai Gandharva Music Festival in Pune in 1963 .
 In the same year , at the age of eight Pandit Ravi Shankar declared Pandit Ravi Shankar as child prodidgy and accepted Pandit Ravi Shankar as a student .
Since then till 1976 he learnt with both Pandit Ravi Shankar and his then wife Annapurna Devi .
In 1976 he was awarded Sangeet Vibhushan by University of Rajasthan .
He did a Ph. D. in Samavedic Basis of Indian Music from University of Poona .
He has a Knowledge and background of Ayurveda from his father .
He does extensive research in Healing Music and has given several Healing Music sessions to individuals and groups .
He has toured around the world extensively , giving concerts in India , Germany Australia , Japan and the USA from 1982 .
He has recorded traditional Indian music as well as experimented with several western and Japanese musicians .
Chandrakant Sardeshmukh died in a car accident near Solapur on 15 August 2011
Zakir Hussain , , is an Indian tabla player , musical producer , film actor and composer .
 Zakir Hussain was awarded the Padma Shri in 1988 , and Padma Bhushan in 2002 , by Government of India .
 Zakir Hussain has also been awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1990 , given by the Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy of Music , Dance & Drama .
 In 1999 , Zakir Hussain was awarded United States National Endowment for the Arts s National Heritage Fellowship , the highest award given to traditional artists and musicians .
 Zakir Hussain was born in Mumbai , India to the legendary tabla player Alla Rakha .
 Zakir Hussain attended St. Michaels High School in Mahim , and graduated from St Xaviers , Mumbai .
 Zakir Hussain was a child prodigy , and was touring by the age of twelve .
 Zakir Hussain went to the United States in 1970 , beginning Zakir Hussain international career which includes more than 150 concert dates a year .
 Zakir Hussain is a founding member of Bill Laswell s World Music Supergroup Tabla Beat Science .
The first Planet Drum album , released in 1991 on the Rykodisc label , went on to earn the 1992 Grammy Award for Best World Music Album , the first Grammy ever awarded in this category .
The Global Drum Project album and tour brought Mickey Hart , Zakir Hussain , Sikiru Adepoju , and Giovanni Hidalgo together again in a reunion sparked by the 15th anniversary of the ground-breaking album Planet Drum .
The album Global Drum Project won the Grammy Award for Best Contemporary World Music Album at the 51st Grammy Awards Ceremony held on 8 February 2009 .
He composed , performed and acted as Indian music advisor for the Malayalam film Vanaprastham , a 1999 Cannes Film Festival entry which was nominated for the Grand Jury Prize at the AFI Los Angeles International Film Festival in 1999 , and won awards at 2000 Istanbul International Film Festival , 2000 Mumbai International Film Festival , and 2000 National Film Awards .
He has composed soundtracks for several movies , most notably In Custody and The Mystic Masseur by Ismail Merchant , and has played tabla on the soundtracks of Francis Coppola s Apocalypse Now , Bernardo Bertolucci s Little Buddha , and other films .
 He starred in several films specifically showcasing his musical performance both solo and with different bands , including the 1998 documentary Zakir Hussain and His Friends , and the documentary The Speaking Hand : Zakir Hussain and the Art of the Indian Drum .
 Zakir Hussain co-starred as Inder Lal in the Merchant Ivory Film Heat and Dust in 1983 , for which Zakir Hussain was an associate music director .
 Zakir Hussain married Antonia Minnecola , a Kathak dancer and teacher , who is also Zakir Hussain manager .
They have two daughters , Anisa Qureshi and Isabella Qureshi .
 Anisa Qureshi graduated from UCLA and is trying Anisa Qureshi hand in video production and film making .
 Isabella Qureshi is studying dance major in Manhattan .
He was named an Old Dominion Fellow by the Humanities Council at Princeton University , where he resided for the 2005-2006 semester as full professor in the music department .
He was also a visiting professor at Stanford University .
He now resides in San Francisco
Antara is the equivalent of a verse in Hindustani classical music .
 In Hindustani classical music , the fixed section is in four parts of which only the first two are performed regularly : the Sthayi - the first line of the Sthayi serves as a cadence , while the section itself serves as a base for the singer returns to the the Sthayi time and again after each part ; Antara - the intermediate part sung in a high register focusing on the tar shadja , with a good deal of text manipulation and repeated forays into sthayi ; the third section the Sanchari - created by the division of the Abhoga and it remains a free-moving section ; the fourth and concluding section Abhoga includes notes from all three registers , and in present-day performances , may well be sung with the the Sanchari , if these two sections are included
Suphala is a tabla artist , composer , and producer .
She is a protege of tabla players Ustad Alla Rakha and Zakir Hussain and is based in New York City .
 Born in the United States by Indian immigrant parents , Suphala has studied music in India .
 She is trained in both Indian and Western classical music , and has studied piano since the age of four .
 In January 2005 , Suphala was the first artist to perform in Afghanistan after the fall of the Taliban .
 According to The New York Times , Kabuls badly depleted music scene received a welcome injection of excitement last week with the arrival of Suphala , the New York-based tabla player and composer ... Suphala certainly brought brightness ... Kabuls touch and rhythm are sure .
 Suphala has recorded and/or performed with Norah Jones , Perry Farrell , Sean Lennon , Harper Simon , Yoko Ono , Edie Brickell , Vernon Reid , King producer King Britt , DJ Spooky , DJ Logic , DJ Fafu , Vijay Iyer , 4 Hero , Lady Ms. Kier , Nina Hagen , Joan Osborne , Kelly Clarkson , Timbaland , Michael Bland , Yuka Honda , Vikter Duplaix , Gingger Shankar , Niladri Kumar , Ustad Sultan Khan , Rakesh Chaurasia , Salim Merchant , and Carol C .
 Norah Jones is the daughter of Suhas V. Patankar , a pioneer in the field of computational fluid dynamics .
 Instru Mental , Suphala first album , was released in September 2000 .
 Norah Jones second album , The Now , released May 10 , 2005 , features contributions from guest artists Norah Jones , Salim Merchant , Vernon Reid , actor/singer Antonio Banderas , and Niladri Kumar .
 Norah Jones third album , Blueprint , released 2007 , includes the single I Feel Awake Even Though This Is A Dream , and features contributions from Edie Brickell , producer King producer King Britt , Vernon Reid , bansuri player Rakesh Chaurasia , Harper Simon , Mazz Swift , and David Gotay
Arnab Chakrabarty is a Hindustani classical musician and sarod player .
 Arnab Chakrabarty grew up in Mumbai , where Arnab Chakrabarty father was a professor of chemistry at the Indian Institute of Technology .
 Arnab Chakrabarty tutelage commenced under the Sarod exponent Brij Narayan , disciple of Arnab Chakrabarty father the Sarangi maestro Pandit Ram Narayan and also Ustad Ali Akbar Khan of the Seniya Maihar Gharana .
 Arnab Chakrabarty subsequently trained under Pandit Buddhadev Das Gupta of the Shahjahanpur Gharana .
 At the age of 18 Arnab Chakrabarty received a Ford Foundation scholarship , which led to a dual degree in ethnomusicology and international relations from Hampshire College in 2002 .
 This experience exposed Arnab Chakrabarty to other traditions of music , and led Arnab Chakrabarty to experiment with new ideas in sarod construction and design , as well as musical idioms .
Arnabs early training followed the Maihar and Shahjahanpur schools , which both derived from the Senia idiom founded by the legendary Mian Tansen .
 However , Arnabs early training has long been influenced by the vocalism-inspired style of the Etawah Gharana , which was taken to new heights by Ustad Vilayat Khan .
