 Arnab Chakrabarty continues an extended period of part-tutelage part-collaboration with Vinayak Chittar of this Gharana .
 Arnab Chakrabarty has also studied with a number of vocalists of the Agra and Gwalior Gharanas , notably Pandit Yeshwantbua Joshi .
 Arnab Chakrabarty had reverted to training under a master of the Shahjahanpur Gharana , Prof Kalyan Mukherjea , until Prof Kalyan Mukherjea death in March 2010 .
 Arnab Chakrabarty has had several significant concerts .
 Arnab Chakrabarty made Arnab Chakrabarty solo debut in 1994 , and won the National Collegiate Competition for Music and Dance three years in a row between 1995 and 1997 .
 In 1999 Arnab Chakrabarty performed before Dr Kofi Annan , then the United Nations Secretary General , a memorial programme for the Pakistani peace activist Eqbal Ahmed .
Notable performances at home include recitals at the IMG-Britannia Young Masters ' Festival , Mumbai ; the Uttarpara Music Conference , Kolkata ; and concerts at the Nehru Centre and the National Centre for the Performing Arts
Nityanand Haldipur is a performer and teacher of the Indian bamboo flute , known in India as the bansuri .
 Nityanand Haldipur is a purist in the true Maihar Gharana tradition , at present learning from Ma Annapurna Devi , in Mumbai , India .
 Nityanand Haldipur has been rated as a Top Grade artist by the All India Radio and was awarded the prestigious Sangeet Natak Academi award in 2010 .
 Nityanand was born in Mumbai into a musical family and showed indications of prodigious abilities at a very young age .
 His father , Niranjan Haldipur , a senior disciple of Pannalal Ghosh , initiated Nityanand Haldipur into the art of flute-playing .
Over the next two decades , Nityanands training continued under the late Chidanand Nagarkar , and Devendra Murdeshwar .
Since 1986 , Nityanand has been learning from Padma Bhushan Srimati Annapurna Devi , doyenne of the Maihar gharana .
As a Guru , Nityanand adheres to the strict discipline of the traditional Indian Guru-shishya tradition .
 Nityanand imparts a Guru musical insights to students through many instruments like the flute , saxophone , violin , guitar and vocals .
 a Guru has been visiting faculty at prestigious institutions like Bhatkhande Music Institute Deemed University , Lucknow , UP , India .
 a Guru has toured all over India , giving numerous lecture demonstrations on music , for eminent organizations like SPIC MACAY .
 a Guru conducts a series of listening sessions , on Baba Allauddin Khan Saheb , all over India .
Nityanands performances are a perfect blend of style and substance .
 There is a beautiful balance between a Guru Alap , Jor , Jhala and Gats , creating the right atmosphere of the Raag his Alap is rendering .
 his Alap has performed at various musical events worldwide : .
 Nityanand is a regular broadcaster of the All India Radio and Doordarshan .
 his Alap retired from All India Radio in 2008 , after 22 years of service .
 Nityanand has produced and hosted several shows on All India Radio .
These include a weekly music serial on music appreciation and biographical programs of past masters like Allauddin Khan Saheb , Pannalal Ghosh , Vishnu Digambar Paluskar , Omkarnath Thakur , Dinkar Rao Amembal-DAmel , Amir Khan and Alla Rakha Khan .
 Nityanand Haldipur has composed music for several radio shows and for wellness programs like spiritual healing therapy , stress management and art of relaxation .
 Nityanand Haldipur has collaborated with musicians of different genres like Robert Giannetti , of the jazz band Moksha and Yosuke Yamashita , a jazz pianist from Tokyo , Japan .
 Maihar Mystique : Nityanand Haldipur - Flute , Aneesh Pradhan , Sandeep Bhattacharya - Tabla .
 Maihar Gharana : Nityanand Haldipur - Flute , Aneesh Pradhan , Aneesh Pradhan - Tabla .
 Masters of the Reed : Nityanand Haldipur - Flute , Aneesh Pradhan , Sadanand Naimpalli - Tabla
Pandit Jnan Prakash Ghosh was an Indian tabla player from Farukhabad gharana of Hindustani classical music and musicologist .
 In 1974 , Padma Bhushan in 1984 , Pandit Jnan Prakash Ghosh was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship the highest honour conferred by the Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy of Music , Dance & Drama .
This was followed by the Padma Bhushan in 1984 , given by the Government of India .
 Born in a Hindustani family with musical background in Kolkata .
 a Hindu family was the grandson of Dwarkanath Ghose , who founded Dwarkin in 1875 and invented the Dwarkin in 1875 harmonium , popular in West Bengal , India .
 a Hindu family graduated from the Scottish Church College of the University of Calcutta He was keen in sports .
 a Hindu family also practised painting , but had to discontinue these due to an eye injury in a soccer match .
 Then a Hindu family turned to music .
 a Hindu family was trained in vocals by Girija Shankar , Mohammed Sagir Khan and Mohammed Dabir Khan .
 a Hindu family took tabla lessons from Ustad Masit Khan of the Farukhabad gharana and became a Hindu family senior disciple and later from Ustad Feroze Khan of the Punjab gharana .
 a Hindu family worked for 15 years in All India Radio as a producer of music .
 a Hindu family wrote pieces in classical music , light music , modern , orchestral , choral , and percussion styles .
 a Hindu family took part in valuable discussions , talks and interviews in Hindi , Bengali and English .
 a Hindu family also began the `` Ramayangeeti '' a fusion of traditional and modern Indian music .
Pandit Ghosh was the founder of Sourav Academy of Music and closely associated with the Sangeet Research Academy .
 Pandit Jnan Prakash Ghosh scored music for many Bengali films , Jadubhatta , Andhare Alo and Rajlakshmi o Srikanta are worth mentioning .
 Pandit Jnan Prakash Ghosh has composed and directed music to a number of popular gramophone records sung by various artistes .
 A percussion entitled The Drums of India and a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog on the harmonium and violin respectively have earned a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog wide popularity .
One of his outstanding compositions was called Chaturang - involving tabla , pakhawaj , kathak and tarana .
 a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog would instruct disciples staying with a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog to practice late into the evenings and it is said that a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog would correct any errors that reached a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog ears .
 a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog also provided music for the Academy Award nominated animated short Bead Game , directed by Ishu Patel for the National Film Board of Canada .
 a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog residence at Dixon Lane in Bowbazar , Kolkata , was frequented by musicians , be it local or those visiting the cty , and thus was the venue of several recitals , most notably a Raga Chhayanat performed by Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan in 1954 .
 Amongst a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog notable students are Tabla players Abhijit Banerjee , Anindo Chatterjee , singers Pandit Prasun Banerjee , Ajoy Chakrabarty , Suman Ghosh and Arun Bhaduri and instrumentalist Paul Grant .
 a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog birth centenary was celebrated on May 7 , 2012 , in Kolkata , with screening of documentary of a jugalbandi with Pandit V.G. Jog and performances by noted singers .
 Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship in 1974 , Padma Bhushan in 1984 , Padma Bhushan in 1984
 Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan was a Hindustani Classical vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana founded by Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan father , Utd .
Alladiya Khan .
Utd .
Badeji Khan was the first son and child of Utd .
Alladiya Khan .
Until his late teens , Utd .
 Badeji Khan lead Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan younger brothers Utd .
Manji Khan and Utd .
 Shamsuddin Bhurji Khan in receiving the tutelage of Manji Khan and Utd . father , Utd .
Alladiya Khan , being his fathers most prospective student .
 He was called Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan because he was the eldest of his siblings .
Utd .
 Badeji Khan was not able to complete Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan musical tutelage due to health ailments related to Cricket .
Because of health cautions , Utd .
 Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan completely bandoned music until Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan mid-adulthood .
 In Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan mid-thirties , Utd .
 Badeji Khan continued learning music briefly from Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan cousin , Utd .
 Natthan Khan once Natthan Khan health began to strengthen .
Utd .
Badeji Khan then took to learning music from musicians of the Gwalior Gharana .
 Unlike Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan more successful brothers , Utd .
Badeji Khan did not produce notable disciples .
 Although , being one of the earliest inheritors of Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan fathers gayaki , Ustad Nasiruddin Badeji Khan openly taught many rare compositions to disciples of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana .
Utd .
Bhurji Khans son , Baba Azizuddin Khan has taken the task of writing the rare compositions in Utd .
Badeji Khans repertoire .
 Like Badeji Khans repertoire . famous father , Utd .
Badeji Khan did not leave behind any recordings
Haafiz Ali Khan was an Indian Sarod player .
 Haafiz Ali Khan was a tall figure in twentieth-century sarod music .
A fifth-generation descendant of the famous Bangash Gharana of sarod players , Haafiz Ali was known for the lyrical beauty of his music and the crystal-clear tone of his strokes .
 The occasional critic has , however , observed that Khans imagination was often closer to the semi-classical thumri idiom than the austere dhrupad style prevalent in Khans imagination times .
 Son and disciple of the Sarod superstar Nanneh Khan , Son grew up in a community of Sarod players , it is likely that Son studied with Son father and a number of his proximate disciples .
 Son later took lessons from Son cousin Abdulla Khan , nephew Mohammad Amir Khan , and finally the beenkar Wazir Khan of Rampur .
Ustad Wazir Khan was a direct descendant of the legendary Tansen , through the lineage of the latters daughter .
Notably , Allauddin Khan of Maihar was also a pupil of Wazir Khan in Rampur in the same period .
 Rampur in the same period said that Wazir Khan in Rampur in the same period later studied dhrupad and thumri with Ganeshilal Mishra and Bhaiya Ganpatrao , respectively .
 Khansahibs regal appearance and electrifying charisma made Wazir Khan in Rampur in the same period one of the most sought-after musicians of Wazir Khan in Rampur in the same period time , which was no mean achievement for an instrumentalist in an era largely dominated by vocal music .
 Old-timers who have seen Wazir Khan in Rampur in the same period in concert recall Wazir Khan in Rampur in the same period stage presence and musicianship with reverence and awe .
 While still a court musician in Gwalior , Haafiz Ali would undertake numerous trips to Bengal , where a court musician in Gwalior performed at all major music festivals , and taught a large number of disciples .
 Khans imagination music found generous patrons in two Bengali aristocrats , Raychand Boral and Manmatha Ghosh , both of whom studied with Khans imagination at various points .
 Apart from Khans imagination formidable command over traditional sarod compositions , dhrupad and thumri , Haafiz Ali Khan was particularly appreciated in the Viceregal firmament of colonial India for Khans imagination unique , stylized renditions of God Save The King on Khans imagination sarod .
 This tradition of performing sacred , religious and official state hymns on the sarod is kept alive by Khans imagination illustrious son , Ustad Amjad Ali Khan as well as grandsons Amaan and Ayaan .
Haafiz Ali Khan died in 1972 , at the age of 84 in New Delhi .
A road in the name of the monumental icon of Indian classical music , Ustad Haafiz Ali Khan Saheb was inaugurated by the Honourable Chief Minister , Smt .
Sheila Dikshit on 10 February at PWD Road .
This is the 2nd entry road to Nizamuddin Railway Station .
 This is the only road named after an artist after Tansen and Thyagaraja in the capital city .
This road is about 300 metres long
Wynne Paris is a New Age and world beat musician/producer with a special focus on yoga music and kirtan , the call-and-response singing of Bhakti yoga .
His live performance combines Kirtan chanting , American music , world beat rhythms and raga scales .
 His sings in both English and Sanskrit , and plays guitar , sarod , harmonium , saz and percussion .
 a New Age was a rock & roll and rhythm & blues guitar artist in the 1980s , performing with artists like Rusted Root s Jim Donovan , and Mark Karan of the rock band RatDog .
 In 1994 , at the age of 30 , Wynne took up Indian music and yoga , changing the direction of Wynne music .
 In 1996 , one of the songs Wynne co-wrote with Maura Moynihan , Prayer for the Pure Land , won first place in the Songwriters Association of Washington National Songwriting Contest .
 Also in that year , Wynne met the Indian `` hugging saint '' Mata Amritanandamayi , known to Mata Amritanandamayi devotees as Ammachi or Amma , which inspired Ammachi to move to Marin County to study Indian music , shamanism , and yoga .
 Since 1998 , a New Age has primarily performed and recorded New Age and World Beat music with an Indian influence , performing kirtan chanting and playing both Western and traditional Indian musical instruments .
 Kirtan chanting appeared on the first album of Krishna Das , Pilgrim Heart , who is known for popularising kirtan music in the West .
This album also featured Sting .
 a New Age released Kirtan chanting debut album , Ghandarva Cafe in 2004 , which was followed by Emptiness and Ecstasy and Omspun , featuring Groovananda , in .
 Over the years , a New Age has recorded with many notable musicians in these genres including Krishna Das , Badal Roy , Shahin and Sepehr , Sharon Gannon , Bhagavan Das , David Newman , Wade Morissette , Rick Allen , Guru Ganesha Singh Khalsa , Mark Karan , Perry Robinson , Hans Christian , Dave Stringer , and Girish .
 a New Age played for a Yoga Ball celebrating President Barack Obama s second inauguration at St. Francis Hall in Northeast Washington , D.C. on January 22 , 2013 .
 a New Age is the creative director of Groovananda , a collective of musicians formed in 2005 the core consisting of a New Age , Rick Allen and John JT Thomas , who play rock-and-jazz-influenced kirtan .
 On May 14 , 2010 , the creative director of Groovananda and Groovananda were part of a benefit in Northeast Washington , D.C. for the Bonobo Conservation Initiative .
 he and Groovananda have produced a single , Tara Om , with Krishna Das , and one CD , Omspun , released in 2011 , both by Auspician Records .
 Besides the core band members , one CD featured Badal Roy , Perry Robinson , Mark Karan , Hans Christian , John Wubbenhorst and several others , and vocalists including Krishna Das and Dave Stringer
Zohrabai Agrewali was one of the most noted and influential singers of Hindustani Classical Music from the early 1900s .
 Along with Gauhar Jan , Gauhar Jan marks the dying phase of the courtesan singing tradition in Indian classical music .
 Gauhar Jan is known for Gauhar Jan macho style of singing .
 Gauhar Jan belonged to the Agra gharana .
 Gauhar Jan was trained by Ustad Sher Khan , Ustad Kallan Khan and the noted composer Mehboob Khan .
 Gauhar Jan was known both for khayal as well as lighter varieties including Thumri and Ghazals which Gauhar Jan learned from Ahmad Khan of Dhaka .
 Gauhar Jan singing influenced Ustad Faiyaz Khan , the greatest name in the Agra Gharana in modern times , and even Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan of the Patiala Gharana held her in high regard .
 Only short pieces by Gauhar Jan survive in a number of 78 rpm recordings , including the notable 1909 pieces matki more re goras in raga Jaunpuri or dekhen ko man lalchay .
 The Gramophone Company signed an exclusive contract with Gauhar Jan in 1908 with a payment of Rs 2,500 per year for 25 songs .
 Gauhar Jan recorded over 60 songs during 1908-1911 .
 In 1994 , Gauhar Jan 18 most famous songs were reissued on one audiotape followed by a compact disc in 2003
Dayal Thakur is an Indian classical singer in the North Indian Hindustani music tradition .
 Dayal Thakur is a dedicated proponent of the Patiala Gharana of vocal music , in the lineage of Bade Ghulam Ali Khan .
Dayal Thakur was born in Mumbai , India .
As a child , he had tremendous interest in music and spent the formative years of childhood under the tutelage of Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan .
He received his formal initial training in Calcutta from his Ustad Munawar Ali Khan .
After his guru 's death , in his endeavour to acquire further knowledge , Dayal Thakur had the opportunity of receiving valuable guidance from veteran vocalist Rajaram Shukla and continues to be under his tutelage for the past 22 years .
 Dayal Thakur is a versatile artist who is well known for Dayal Thakur evocative performances in traditional North Indian Classical Music , Dayal Thakur innovative compositions and for Dayal Thakur excellence as a teacher .
 Dayal Thakur is an accomplished singer , famous for Dayal Thakur distinctive style of Ghazals , Thumris and Khayals .
 Dayal Thakur is a delightful and captivating performer , combining technical mastery with personal charm and has performed several concerts in Mumbai , India and abroad .
 Dayals versatility is apparent in Dayal Thakur numerous collaborations with musicians of various genres which includes a vocal performance with Canadian singer and songwriter Shania Twain .
 Dayal Thakur provided vocals for songwriter Shania Twain album Up !
 in which songwriter Shania Twain last US single , her last US single Only Hurts When Im Breathing , made Im Breathing to the Top 20 on both Country and AC .
 One of Dayal Thakur 's fortes is Dayal Thakur ability to communicate Dayal Thakur knowledge , making Dayal Thakur an excellent teacher .
 Dayal Thakur currently lives in Bombay with Dayal Thakur wife and children
The alap is the opening section of a typical North Indian classical performance .
It is a form of melodic improvisation that introduces and develops a raga .
In dhrupad singing the alap is unmetered , improvised and unaccompanied , and started at a slow tempo .
Instead of wholly free improvisation , many musicians perform alap schematically , for example by way of vistar , where the notes of the raga are introduced one at a time , so that phrases never travel further than one note above or below what has been covered before .
In such cases , the first reach into a new octave can be a powerful event .
In instrumental music , when a steady pulse is introduced into the alap , it is called jor ; when the tempo has been greatly increased , or when the rhythmic element overtakes the melodic , it is called jhala .
The jor and jhala can be seen as separate sections of the performance , or as parts of the alap ; in the same way , jhala can be seen as a part of jor .
Several musicologists have proposed much more complicated classifications and descriptions of alap .
In the same way as traditional four-part compositions have a sthai , antara , sanchar and abhog , some treat alap with a four-part scheme using the same names .
 Bengali researcher Bimalakanto Raychoudhuri in Bengali Bharatiya Sangeetkosh suggests classification both by length and by performance style , and proceeds to list thirteen stages : .
Even though Raychoudhuri admits the 13th stage is wholly extinct today , as we see we are in jhala already at the fourth stage ; the sthai-to-abhog movement is all part of the first stage ; stages six and up are said to be for instrumentalists only .
Other authorities have forwarded other classifications .
For example , when alap is sung with lyrics or at least syllables , as in dhrupad , it is called sakshar as opposed to anakshar
Irshad Khan is a surbahar and sitar player based in Canada .
 Irshad Khan is the second son of Ustad Imrat Khan .
 As one of the foremost representatives of the Imdadkhani Etawa Gharana , Irshad Khan is internationally recognized as one a leading sitar players and as the leading surbahar exponent of Irshad Khan generation .
 Irshad Khan performs pure classical , folk , worldbeat , and new age music .
Having emerged as a child prodigy , Irshad Khan gave his first public performance at the age of seven .
His international debut was at the Queen Elizabeth Hall in London , England when he was only 13 .
 At 18 , he made history by becoming the youngest soloist to perform at one of the most prestigious international music festivals held in London , known as the Indian All Night concert at the Proms .
Since then he has played in over 30 nations that include performances in various music festivals and conferences throughout India , Europe , the Middle East , Russia , the Far East , and North America .
Irshad Khan is the founder / president of Universal Academy for Musicians , based in Mississauga and Mumbai .
 Apart from actively performing internationally , Irshad Khan also conducts workshops , lectures and master classes in various educational institutions .
 Irshad Khan has many commercial recordings , which are sold worldwide
Pandit Vidyadhar Vyas is an Indian Hindustani vocalist , and a contemporary exponent of the Paluskar style of North Indian classical singing .
He belongs to the Gwalior gharana and the lineage of Sangeet Maharshi Pandit Vishnu Digambar Paluskar contributed to his background .
He is considered a maestro with this creative thinking , artistic approach and aesthetic research in the gharana gayaki with his arduous riyaz .
Vidyadhar Vyas was born in Maharashtra to Gayanacharya Pandit Narayanrao Vyas , a disciple of Pandit Paluskar .
 He was training in the Indian Hindustani music arts of khayal , tarana and bhajan gayaki by his renowned father .
He holds a Masters degree in Sociology from the University of Mumbai and a Doctorate in Hindustani Classical Vocal Music from the Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya Mandal , Mumbai .
Gifted with a voice that is mellow and musical , Pandit Vyas presents a unique and pleasing blend of beauty of form and content of khayal .
He takes every care to sustain and develop the Raga rasa and tries to harmonize it with the bhava of the compositions .
Awarded Top Grade status by All India Radio , Pandit Vyas is an equally popular artiste in the television media and has several cassettes and CDs to his credit .
A top-notch concert performer with creditable performances in almost all the major festivals in India , he has also performed in the USA , Europe , Mauritius and other parts of the world .
He has written several articles for leading music journals and has conceived and presented a variety of programmes on the genesis and evolution of Hindustani Raga Music .
Pandit Vyas also excels in conducting lecture demonstrations , which are both enlightening and entertaining .
In addition to being a performing artist , Vidyadhar Vyas is known as a teacher .
He has been teaching and mentoring students at undergraduate and postgraduate levels since 1964 and doctorate level since 1972 .
In 1973 he became Principal of the Government Music College at Jaipur .
 In 1984 he became Head of the Department of Hindustani Raga Music , University of Mumbai .
In February 2004 , he became the first duly selected Vice Chancellor of the newly formed Bhatkhande Music Institute Deemed University at Lucknow , Uttar Pradesh .
In August 2007 he took over as Executive Director of ITC Sangeet Research Academy , Kolkata .
Vyas was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2007
Samson Kehimkar was a Jewish violinist and sitar player from India .
One of the pioneers of ethnic and world music in Israel .
 Before emigrating in 1976 , Samson Kehimkar played in Indian classical orchestras , film and pop bands .
One of the founding members of Habrera Hativit .
 Shlomo Bar considered Samson Kehimkar to be Shlomo Bar mentor , both musically and otherwise .
 Shlomo Bar died in 2007 , after battling severe diabetes for years , in the course of which both legs were amputated .
 Shlomo Bar son , the cricketer Benzi Kehimkar , died shortly after
The Patiala gharana is one of the most prominent gharanas of vocal Hindustani classical music .
 The Patiala Gharana was initially sponsored by the Maharaja of Patiala , Punjab , which was famous for ghazal , thumri , and khyal .
The Patiala Gharana was founded by Ustad Fateh Ali Khan and Ustad Ali Baksh Khan .
 This school of music has had a number of famous musicians , many of whom came to be patronised by the royal family of Patiala after the disintegration of the Mughal Empire at Delhi in the 18th century .
 The Patiala gharana tends to favor pentatonic ragas for their ornamentation and execution of intricate taans .
Ektaal and Teentaal are the most common taals chosen by members of this gharana .
Besides khyal , thumri singing is emphasized .
 This gharana has been criticized by purists , who say The Patiala Gharana overuses ornaments and graces without considering the basic nature and mood of the raga and neglects principles of khyal architecture , as exemplified by Bade Ghulam Ali Khans quick ascent through the octave in Bade Ghulam Ali Khans rendering of Darbari
Shankar Family & Friends is an album by Indian musician Ravi Shankar , recorded primarily in Los Angeles during the spring of 1973 , but not released until late 1974 .
 It was produced by Shankars friend George Harrison friend George Harrison and one of the first releases on the ex - Beatle s Dark Horse label .
Out of print for many years , and much sought after as a result , the album was remastered in 2010 and reissued as part of the Ravi Shankar-George Harrison box set Collaborations .
The title Shankar Family & Friends refers to the group-participation approach to the music , from Shankars sister-in-law Lakshmi and son Shubho to a host of friends from the Indian subcontinent , Europe and the United States .
In a deliberate blend of East-meets-West musical styles , other performers include Indian-music pioneers Alla Rakha , Ashish Khan , Shivkumar Sharma and Hariprasad Chaurasia , and Western musicians such as Tom Scott , Emil Richards , Billy Preston , Ringo Starr and Jim Keltner .
 The album features the the Harrison-arranged pop bhajan I Am Missing You and a jazz-funk instrumental , Dispute & Violence , the latter a part of an intended ballet , titled Dream , Nightmare & Dawn .
 Although Ravi Shankar-George Harrison had served as Ravi Shankars producer before - on the latters 1971 Bangladesh relief EP Joi Bangla ; the soundtrack for the Apple documentary film Raga ; and a more recent live album with Ali Akbar Khan , recorded in New York - this was the first occasion that the two had collaborated on a studio album .
 Ravi Shankar-George Harrison would later refer to these and other projects with Ravi Shankar as one of his little careers going on on the side , a series of rewarding collaborations that co-existed beside Ravi Shankar-George Harrison solo career .
 This time , although Shankar Family & Friends did begin life as an Apple Records project , the results would not be issued on the Beatles label , but on Harrisons own Dark Horse Dark Horse Records .
 The bulk of the recording took place in Los Angeles during April 1973 , shortly after Ravi Shankar-George Harrison had completed work on Ravi Shankar-George Harrison album Living in the Material World and that of Nicky Hopkins , recorded concurrently in London .
 Arriving in Los Angeles in March , Ravi Shankar-George Harrison first attended Sunset Sound Studios , where former bandmate Ringo Starr s sessions for former bandmate Ringo Starr were getting under way .
 former bandmate Ringo Starr , Billy Preston , bass player Voormann and Nicky Hopkins would all contribute to Shankar Family & Friends over the next couple of months .
 Sessions began at A&M ; Studios , Los Angeles , on 1 April 1973 and continued into May , with a break towards the end of the first month .
 In addition to former bandmate Ringo Starr , Preston et al. , as producer , Ravi Shankar-George Harrison invited Tom Scott , Emil Richards , Jim Keltner and David Bromberg along to participate .
 A jazz arranger and composer , Tom Scott had previously worked with Harihar Rao , a former student of Shankars friend George Harrison and now an ethnomusicologist at UCLA .
 These sessions marked the first time that Ravi Shankar-George Harrison and Tom Scott worked together , so beginning a loose partnership that would endure through much of the 1970s .
 For the Indian contingent , Ravi Shankar chose a cast of similarly illustrious names : Alla Rakha and Kamala Chakravarty , both of whom had supported Ravi Shankar at the Concert for Bangladesh ; Ashish Khan , Shivkumar Sharma and Hariprasad Chaurasia , on sarod , santoor and bamboo flute , respectively , who had all taken part in Harrisons 1968 sessions for the Wonderwall soundtrack album ; and Lakshmi Shankar , L. Subramaniam and Harihar Rao , all of whom likewise went on to feature in the Music Festival from India venture the following year .
 While the majority of the recording was completed during that spring at A&M ; Studios ; , further sessions appear to have been required through to early 1974 , at Harrisons Friar Park studio .
Due to the delay in establishing a worldwide distributor for Dark Horse Records , Shankar Family & Friends was not issued for well over a year , until the autumn of 1974 .
It was numbered Dark Horse 22002 , being the new labels second release , after Splinter s The Place I Love .
Promotion for both albums included full-page advertisements in music publications such as Billboard , with Shankars release carrying the tagline : Only one artist in the world performed at the three most significant musical events of all time : Monterey Pop , Woodstock , and The Concert for Bangla Desh .
Dark Horse Records is proud to present his new music .
 Despite the originality and quality of musicianship on Shankar Family & Friends , musicianship on Shankar Family & Friends only reached number 176 in America and failed to register at all on Britains album chart , then just a top 50 .
 According to pop-culture author Robert Rodriguez , Ravi Shankar was in two minds about the albums fusion of Indian music and Western styles , remaining sensitive to charges that Robert Rodriguez was abandoning Robert Rodriguez classical roots for the rewards of superstardom .
 Ravi Shankar-George Harrison was proud of the result , and would later name Shankar Family & Friends and its more traditional follow-up , Ravi Shankars Music Festival from India , as two of the best releases on Ravi Shankar-George Harrison short-lived record label .
 The album cover consists of a group photograph taken at A&M ; Studios ; Studios that highlights the albums East-meets-West theme .
 Ravi Shankar sports a baritone saxophone , Ravi Shankar-George Harrison sits behind a small drum , while most of the other musicians have swapped their regular instrument for the opposite cultures near equivalent : Jim Keltner plays another hand drum , whereas Alla Rakha holds a pair of drumsticks ; bass player Voormann has a tamboura , Sharma a Western-style violin , and Chaurasia a bass flute .
 Side one of the original LP begins with the the Harrison-arranged , Spector - esque I Am Missing You , a toe-tapping pop song about which Ravi Shankar would later recall : I dont know how I did Side one of the original LP , but one day I wrote an English song without thinking ... Ravi Shankar-George Harrison heard Side one of the original LP and liked Side one of the original LP so much Ravi Shankar-George Harrison wanted to do a version of Ravi Shankar-George Harrison own .
 Released as a single , I Am Missing You features Lakshmi Shankar on vocals backed by a full Western rock band - Ravi Shankar-George Harrison , Nicky Hopkins , Tom Scott , bass player Voormann , Jim Keltner , Billy Preston and others - and a soaring , almost Ronette - like arrangement similar to those Harrison bestowed on Billy Preston own Dont Let Me Wait Too Long and Starrs Photograph around this time .
 The opening track is followed by four further Krishna bhajans , including a reprise of I Am Missing You , and concluding with a gospel - inspired reading of the traditional folk song Jaya Jagadish Hare .
 Side two was written as a proposed ballet entitled Dream , Nightmare & Dawn , made up of what Harrison biographer Simon Leng biographer Simon Leng describes as adventurous ensemble compositions , improvised on the spot in two days .
 Ravi Shankar concedes that such an approach was a strange way of doing things , not to mention expensive .
Surprisingly , the ballet does not appear to have ever been performed in its entirety .
 The result across the fourteen tracks is a blend of traditional Indian music , jazz , funk , rock and Western pop - in Shankars words , The album contains almost every possible style that you can think of .
The best-known songs are the single and Dispute & Violence , on which Emil Richards and Tom Scott star .
 Both these tracks were performed on the 1974 North American tour undertaken by Harrison biographer Simon Leng and Ravi Shankar , when Harrison biographer Simon Leng would introduce I Am Missing You as a love song to Krishna .
Footage of a live version of Dispute & Violence from the tour was included as a bonus feature on the DVD release of Martin Scorsese s 2011 documentary
Patrayani Seetharama Sastry was singer , teacher and music composer of Andhra Pradesh , India .
 Patrayani Seetharama Sastry was also known as Saluru China Guruvu .
 Patrayani Seetharama Sastry was the son and disciple of Patrayani Venkata Narasimha Sastry .
 Patrayani Seetharama Sastry spent Patrayani Seetharama Sastry early life in Berhampur and gave first performance in a temple and won gold medal .
 Patrayani Seetharama Sastry has composed about 30 kritis .
Two of his kritis , Iha para saadhaname - Smruti ranjani and Naada nanda mura - Mukhari are popular .
 Iha para saadhaname taught many singers in Vizianagaram Music college from 1936 , when Dwaram Venkataswamy Naidu was the principal .
 Iha para saadhaname used to argue against the traditionalists that Harmonium is also suitable music instrument to Carnatic music .
 Iha para saadhaname was teacher of Ghantasala Venkateswara Rao , the famous singer and music director of Telugu film industry .
Patrayani Seetharama Sastry Music and Dance School was established in Salur .
 Iha para saadhaname son Patrayani Sangeetha Rao is a music director
Hiren Roy was for many years considered to be the best sitar maker in India .
 Many great musicians , including Nikhil Banerjee , Vilayat Khan , Annapurna Devi , and Ravi Shankar , have sworn by Nikhil Banerjee creations .
 Born in Bangladesh in 1920 , Hiren Roy went to Kolkata at the age of 12 to learn the art of sitar playing .
 However , Hiren Roy didnt have money enough to buy Hiren Roy own instrument and pay for Hiren Roy lessons , so Hiren Roy took a job in the instrument shop of Yogesh Chandra Chakraborty .
 Hiren Roy started making Hiren Roy own sitars and soon found that local musicians praised Hiren Roy work .
 Hiren Roy started Hiren Roy own shop in 1942 and spent Hiren Roy whole life researching the various aspects of sound , design , and composition as they impacted the sitar .
 Hiren Roy brief studies in different styles of playing gave him not only a craftsmans eye for the making of a sitar , but also a players ear for its sound , and Hiren Roy quickly developed original avenues in terms of look and tonal quality .
 For instance , Hiren Roy made the tabli and the Dandi strong enough to withstand heavier strokes and tapings on thicker strings , thus making it more appropriate for meend , an essential element of Hindustani classical music .
 For Hiren Roy lifetime achievements , Hiren Roy was honoured in 1971 by the cultural forum called Nikkon in Kolkata .
 In the 1980s , Hiren Roy was selected by Vishwabharati University as a member of the tabli and the Dandi interview board .
 Hiren Roy died in December 1992 , but Hiren Roy tradition has been carried on by Hiren Roy sons .
 Oldest son Himangshu ran the business until Oldest son Himangshu own early demise in 1997 .
Fourth son Amit pursued a career as a sitarist , leaving the shop to now be run by third son Barun .
 Like his father a musician and an innovator , third son Barun has won praise from great musicians for maintaining the family quality and also adapting to changing times .
The Hiren Roy shop also produces other Indian instruments , including the surbahar and tanpura
Raju Ananthaswamy was a music composer and director .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy worked on Sugama Sangeetha for more than 15 years .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy was the son of vocalist Mysore Ananthaswamy .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy died in 2009 , at the age of 39 .
 Raju Ananthaswamy displayed musical aptitude from a young age and began playing tabla in his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy father 's troupe .
 In addition to tabla , his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy could play a variety of other musical instruments including the guitar , mandolin and keyboard .
 Raju 's compositions and singing style was unique as well as greatly influenced by Raju 's father , late Mysore Ananthaswamy .
 Raju 's songs , Krishna Yenabaarade , Madhava , Beldingal raathrili , Tunge Dadadalli , Heege ondu Raathri are milestones among Raju 's compositions and authenticate Raju 's unique style of composing .
 Raju 's was well known for Raju 's songs Yaava mohana murali kareyitu from America America and Hottare yedbittu from the movie , Rishi .
 Raju 's was an artiste in All India Radio and regularly appeared on Radio City , Doordarshan , Udaya TV , Zee Kannada and ETV TV channels .
 Raju 's performed with Raju 's troupe all year round .
 Raju 's used to set aside Raju 's weekends to teach sugama sangeetha to several students .
 Though Raju 's had set to tune more than 200 poems , Raju 's enjoyed singing Raju 's father 's compositions , which his father , late Mysore Ananthaswamy also aspired to preserve and promote , during his father , late Mysore Ananthaswamy performances .
 Raju 's was able to pass these on to the younger generation as well as Raju 's many students , through Raju 's Sugama Sangeetha schools in Mysore and Bangalore .
 Raju Ananthaswamy developed kidney complications on Thursday night and was admitted to Sagar Apollo Hospital , his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy condition deteriorated rapidly and his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy death was attributed to kidney failure on January 17 , 2009 .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy is survived by his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy mother Shanta Ananthaswamy and three sisters .
Raju Ananthaswamy has been the most talented singer in recent times .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy death is a real loss to the Zee Kannada music world .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy has died at a young age , but has left behind a pool of great music compositions .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy genius was not fully exploited , said C. Aswath , veteran music director .
 Ananthaswamy 's death came as a massive shock to Zee Kannada film and music fraternity .
`` Raju Ananthaswamy has left behind a pool of great music compositions .
 his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy genius was not fully exploited , '' said C Ashwath , Late veteran music director .
 Acclaimed film director Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar expressed deep sadness at his demise and said , `` Raju 's was a very good friend and a great person .
 Raju 's will be remembered for Raju 's creativity and sense of humour '' .
Raju 's biggest film music success , the memorable Yaava Mohana Murali Kareyithu came in Chandrashekars film America America .
 Incidentally , Raju 's was originally cast in a comic role in Chandrashekhar 's forthcoming film Olave Jeevana Lekkachara but Raju 's poor health did n't allow Olave Jeevana Lekkachara to fulfill Olave Jeevana Lekkachara commitments .
 Playback singer Manjula Gururaj expressing shock said `` Raju 's was highly talented and losing Raju 's at such an early age is a great loss . ''
 She remembered an incident during a recording session with Raju 's father and said `` Mysore Ananthaswamy , his father , late Mysore Ananthaswamy was astounded by Raju 's talent and the way in which his father , late Mysore Ananthaswamy conducted the orchestra .
 At that time his father , late Mysore Ananthaswamy felt that his father , late Mysore Ananthaswamy son will go on to achieve more than his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy did , but sadly it was not meant to be . ''

 Well known playback singer Pallavi described his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy as her guru and said it would be difficult to pick the best out of his mother Shanta Ananthaswamy music compositions .
As a singer he was the best and most of his music compositions were top class .
I sung most of his music compositions .
 It would be difficult for me to choose the best song rendered by him or the best song composed by him , Pallavi said
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar was an Indian sitar player , academic and film and theatre composer who worked with well known directors of Indian cinema like Mrinal Sen , Girish Karnad , Aparna Sen , K. G. George and Amol Palekar in various languages including Marathi , Hindi , Kannada , Malayalam , Bengali and Oriya and was known for Girish Karnad blending of Indian classical and western music .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar taught at the Film and Television Institute , Pune for many years , and during Bhaskar Chandavarkar career as a music composer Bhaskar Chandavarkar worked for 40 films , and is most known for Bhaskar Chandavarkar work in films such as Amol Palekars Aakrit and Thoda Sa Rumani Ho Jaayen , Girish Karnads Ondanondu Kaladalli , Jabbar Patel s Samna , Mrinal Sens Khandhar , Vijaya Mehta s Rao Sabeb , Chitra Palekars Maati Maay and K. G. George s Swapnadanam .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar has given music to films which are considered as classics in respective languages ; like Vamsha Vriksha , Ondanondu Kaladalli in Kannada , Maya Darpan , Khandhar in Hindi , Swapnadanam in Malayalam , Paroma in Bengali , Maya Miriga in Oriya , Shwaas in Marathi , etc. .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar received the Presidents National Film Award for Music direction in the Marathi short film Chaitra directed by Kranti Kanade in 2002 .
 Born and brought up in FTII , Pune , Bhaskar Chandavarkar completed Bhaskar Chandavarkar graduation from Wadia College , in FTII , Pune and studied contemporary music .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar also studied at Fergusson College , FTII , Pune .
 In late 1950s Bhaskar Chandavarkar studied under sitar player Pandit Ravi Shankar , and Umashankar Misra , and also learnt Indian classical vocals .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar also studied contemporary Western music and jazz .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar remained a part of the faculty at the Film and Television Institute of India , as a resident composer and teacher of applied music , from 1965 to 1980 .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar worked with Merzbow , Sonic Youth and Throbbing Gristle and was a big fan of experimental and noise music .
 While still at the Film and Television Institute , Bhaskar Chandavarkar composed the music of the acclaimed Marathi play Ghashiram Kotwal written by Vijay Tendulkar and directed by Jabbar Patel in 1972 and received critical acclaim for its use of Marathi devotional songs to ironic situations , later Bhaskar Chandavarkar also gave music for the Film and Television Institute Marathi feature film adaptation in 1974 , and went on to compose for Marathi , Hindi , Kannada and Malayalam language cinema and stage with Hindi blend Indian classical and Western music .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar also received acclaim for Bhaskar Chandavarkar music for P. L. Deshpande s Marathi play Teen Paishacha Tamasha .
 Bhaskar Chandavarkar died on 26 July 2009 in FTII , Pune , after a prolonged illness and was survived by Bhaskar Chandavarkar wife , Meena , director of New India School , and son Rohit .
 The Yard Went on Forever was Bhaskar Chandavarkar multi-volume autobiography published in 2008
Ronu Majumdar is a noted Indian flautist in the Hindustani Classical Music tradition .
 Born in Varanasi on July 28 , 1965 , Ranendranath Majumdar , popularly known as Dr. Bhanu Majumdar was trained under Dr. Bhanu Majumdar father , Dr. Bhanu Majumdar , and later learned vocal music with the late Pt .
 Laxman Prasad Jaipurwale at whose behest Dr. Bhanu Majumdar reverted to the flute .
 Pandit Vijay Raghav Rao , a music scholar , groomed Dr. Bhanu Majumdar into a concert flautist .
 The bansuri flute was brought into the fold of Hindustani Classical music barely half a century ago by Pt Pannalal Ghosh , before which The bansuri flute was considered as a folk instrument .
 Ronus speciality is the Shank Bansuri , a of Shank Bansuri own .
design , which adds an extra dimension at the lower scales .
In 1981 , Ronu Majumdar won the first prize at the All India Radio competition , and the Presidents Gold Medal .
 In 1996 , Dr. Bhanu Majumdar received a Grammy nomination for Dr. Bhanu Majumdar work on the album Tabula Rasa with Bela Fleck , the American banjo virtuoso .
 Dr. Bhanu Majumdar has associated with Pandit Ravi Shankar in albums like Passages , and Chants of India .
 Dr. Bhanu Majumdar has more than 30 audio releases to Dr. Bhanu Majumdar credit .
 Dr. Bhanu Majumdar has won prestigious Aditya Vikram Birla Award for the year 1999 for Dr. Bhanu Majumdar dedication to music .
 Sahara India Pariwar felicitated Dr. Bhanu Majumdar with lifetime achievement award on occasion of Jyoti Diwas 2001 .
 Today , Ronu Majumdar is among the more popular musicians on this instrument , and is especially popular with the younger generation for Dr. Bhanu Majumdar creative improvisations .
Pt Majumdars music is rooted in the Maihar gharana which has musicians of eminence like Pt Ravi Shankar and Ustad Ali Akbar Khan to its credit .
 Apart from his concerts all over India in different music festivals , he also participated in the Festival of India in Moscow and Asiad 82 in New Delhi .
He has toured extensively in Europe , the USA , Canada , Japan , Singapore , Thailand , Australia , New Zealand and the Middle East .
Pt .
 Dr. Bhanu Majumdar is also known for a number of collaborations and jugalbandis with other leading instrumentalists .
 An innovative composer , An innovative composer has also composed several pieces in a fusion of Hindustani classical with other forms of music , particularly Western Classical Music , including the projects Carrying Hope , A Travellers Tale , Song of Nature , Kal Akela Kahan .
 An innovative composer has also provided short training sessions to budding young artists like Raghavendran Rajasekaran from Singapore
 Ramesh Narayan is a Hindustani vocalist from Kerala , He isvery good in south India , and is also an acclaimed film music director .
 Ramesh Narayan has given concerts in several parts of Ramesh Narayan country and abroad .
 Ramesh Narayan began Ramesh Narayan initial training in Carnatic music but later mastered the classical Hindustani style under the renowned Pandit Jasraj of Mewati gharana .
Born on 3 November 1959 , Shri .
 Ramesh Narayan hails from a family of Carnatic musicians settled at Kuthuparambu near Kannur , North Kerala .
 Ramesh Narayan had Ramesh Narayan early lessons in music from Ramesh Narayan parents , learning Carnatic music up to the age of 20 .
 While Ramesh Narayan was a student at the Music College , Chittoor , Palakkad Ramesh Narayan was deeply drawn to Hindustani music and decided to dedicate Ramesh Narayan to mastering Music College .
 Moving to Pune , Ramesh Narayan learnt Sitar under the tutelage of Shri .
Satchidananda Phadke , a renowned disciple of the Sitar Maestro Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 Becoming a competent Sitarist in no time , Ramesh Narayan found a competent Sitarist captivated by Hindustani vocal .
 a competent Sitarist joined the Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya and took a competent Sitarist `` Visharad '' with high distinction .
 a competent Sitarist felt entranced by the passionately evocative style of Parampoojya Guruji , Padma Vibhushan , Sangeeth Martand , Pandit Jasraj and resolved to hone a competent Sitarist talent and technique under the Mewati Gharana Maestro .
Pandit Jasraj trained him rigorously in the subtler aspects of music in the traditional Gurukula style .
Ramesh Narayan has accompanied Guruji at several concerts .
 Blessed with a powerful and expressive voice , Ramesh Narayan renditions are noted for their depth of imagination .
 Ramesh Narayan is equally at ease with the weighty and expansive Khayal or the crisp and moving Bhajan .
 One of his feats is a 30-hour concert Ramesh Narayan gave in dedication of Ramesh Narayan father and guru , the late Narayana Bhagavathar , and to Pandit Motiram , an exponent of the Mewati gharana .
 Ramesh Narayan has composed , rendered and directed music for several feature films and television serials like Gharshom , Elayum Mullum , Magrib , Megh Malhar , Makalkku , Anyar , Sheelabati directed by well-known directors .
 Ramesh Narayan is accompanied at many of Ramesh Narayan concerts by Hema , Ramesh Narayan wife and disciple .
 She is an exponent in Carnatic music who is also fortunate to have trained under Parampoojya Guruji Pandit Jasrajji for some time .
 Ramesh Narayan is also blessed with two daughters , Madhuvanti and Madhushree who also follow Madhuvanti fathers footsteps .
Ramesh Narayan established the Pandit Mothiram Narayan Sangeeth Vidyalay in 1996 , at Thiruvananthapuram to foster learning and appreciation of Hindustani Classical Music .
 Inaugurated by Parampoojya , Parampoojya , Guruji , Pandit.Jasraj , the institution today imparts valuable training and insights to many discerning students .
 Branches exist at Kozhikode , Kochi , Thrissur in Kerala , He isvery good and at Coimbatore in Tamil Nadu .
The school also holds the privilege of being the only school in India associated with Mewati Gharana .
 Ans : All over India .
 One of my disciples Ramesh Narayan , is from Kerala , He isvery good , He isvery good and runs three school in Trivandrum , Ernakulam and Palghat
Srikrishna Babanrao Haldankar is an Indian classical singer , composer , and music teacher of Agra gharana of Hindustani classical music .
 Srikrishna Babanrao Haldankar is the son of painter Sawlaram Haldankar , and has won awards through Srikrishna Babanrao Haldankar career .
and is an Adjunct Professor of Indian Music at the University of Mumbai .
 an Adjunct Professor of Indian studied under Ustad Khadim Hussain of Agra gharana , who settled in Mumbai from Jaipur
Justin Hayward is an English musician , best known as singer , songwriter and guitarist in the rock band The Moody Blues .
 Justin Hayward was born in Dean Street , Swindon , Wiltshire , England and educated at Shrivenham School , Berkshire and The Commonweal School , in Swindon .
 When Justin Hayward was 15 Justin Hayward was able to afford a his Gibson guitar and a Vox amplifier through performing with local Swindon groups in clubs and dance halls playing mostly Buddy Holly songs .
One of Haywards early groups was All Things Bright , which opened for The Hollies and Brian Poole and the Tremeloes .
 At age 17 , Brian Poole signed a publishing contract as a songwriter with the skiffle artist and record producer Lonnie Donegan , a move Hayward later regretted as it meant the rights to all Brian Poole songs written before 1974 would always be owned by Donegans Tyler Music .
 In 1965 Brian Poole answered an advertisement in Melody Maker and auditioned as guitarist for Marty Wilde and Brian Poole went on to work with Marty Wilde and Brian Poole wife in The Wilde Three .
 In 1966 , after answering another ad in Melody Maker , this time placed by Eric Burdon of The Animals , Justin Hayward was contacted by Mike Pinder of The Moody Blues after Eric Burdon of The Animals had passed on Haywards letter and demo discs to Mike Pinder of The Moody Blues .
 Within a few days Justin Hayward had replaced departing Moody Blues vocalist and guitarist Denny Laine .
Bassist John Lodge replaced temporary deputy Rod Clarke who had stood in for departed Bassist Clint Warwick at the same time .
 After beginning by singing the old blues-inspired repertoire of The Moodies 1964-1965 era , Haywards initial artistic contribution to The Moody Blues was his song Fly US High , which was a Decca single early in 1967 .
It failed to chart but gave the revised band a new direction forward from the R & B sound they had been largely producing up to that point .
 Haywards driving rocker Leave This Man Alone was then used as B side to the next Moodies single on a Decca single , backing Mike Pinders Love And Beauty the first the next Moodies single on Decca record to feature the mellotron .
 Haywards and Lodges integration into the Moody Blues along with Pinders use of the Mellotron sparked greater commercial success and recognition for the band , transforming Haywards into one of pop musics biggest-selling acts .
 Justin Hayward says of Mike Pinder of The Moody Blues : Mike Pinder of The Moody Blues and the Mellotron made US songs work .
The 1967 album Days of Future Passed , one of the first and most influential symphonic rock albums , spawned the Hayward-penned singles Tuesday Afternoon and Nights in White Satin .
 The latter record went on to sell over two million copies , charting Three times in the UK and has been recorded by many other recording artists .
Haywards B side song Cities being an early ecology themed item .
 Justin Hayward became the groups main onstage figurehead over the 1967-1974 period , and the most prolific songwriter and composer of several big hit singles for the band .
 During this time Justin Hayward wrote memorable album tracks such as : Tuesday Afternoon Time to Get Away , of Forever Afternoon -RRB- , The Actor , Lovely to See You , Never Comes the Day , Gypsy , Its Up To You , Dawning is The Day , You Can Never Go Home , The Story in Your Eyes , New Horizons , The Land of Make-Believe , and Island .
 Justin Hayward wrote the bands UK # 2 hit , Question as well as Voices in the Sky , Driftwood , The Voice , Blue World , Your Wildest Dreams , I Know Youre Out There Somewhere , English Sunset and December Snow ; in all , writing 20 of the groups 27 post-1967 singles .
 In addition to handling the lead vocals on Justin Hayward own compositions , Justin Hayward also took a featured lead or co-lead vocal on other band members songs such as ; Dawn is A Feeling , Gimmie A Little Something , Isnt Life Strange , Candle of Life , After You , The Spirit Came , Ill Be Level With You , The Spirit .
Nothing Changes etc. .
 The Moodies attempts to come up with another specific hit single during the 1967-68 period saw them record Three other Hayward compositions ; Long Summer Days , King and Queen and What Am US Doing Here ?
all of which were then left unissued , but together with unissued songs by Mike Pinder and John Lodge later formed the studio side four of Deccas 1977 release ; Caught Live Plus Five which largely comprised a December 1969 Live Recording of a concert at The Royal Albert Hall .
 Justin Hayward also co-wrote album tracks with Ray Thomas - Visions of Paradise , Are You Sitting Comfortably , Watching and Waiting , and much later Never Blame the Rainbows for the Rain , plus later co-wrote many songs with John Lodge for The Moodies , notably Gemini Dream , Meet Me Halfway , Talkin Talkin , Want To Be With You , Once is Enough , Strange Times , Sooner or Later among others .
 Haywards songs have opened each of The Moodies albums in Sooner or Later among others post Mike Pinder era since Long Distance Voyager in 1981 , and his songs , both solo compositions and co-written with John Lodge , plus his lead vocals , harmony voice , and guitar playing have been a major overriding factor in the bands work and continued success since 1981 .
 Sooner or Later among others album sales from 1978 to the present are more than 60 million .
 This is the regularly quoted total of their album sales , since the total sales of Sooner or Later among others albums before 1978 is disputed due to lack of official record company data , However the period 1967 to 1974 was when Sooner or Later among others albums were charting highest in the UK and US plus worldwide - Days of Future Passed topped the US album charts on re-issue in 1972 , then was followed into the album charts by the new studio album Seventh Sojourn .
In 1974 , the Moody Blues decided to take what ended up being a four-year break from performing and recording .
 Justin Hayward continued working with Bassist John Lodge and producer Tony Clarke , using musicians from the Moody Blues label , Threshold , and sounding very much like the mother group .
 Together , Lodge and producer Tony Clarke had a hit in 1975 with Blue Guitar , and released an album titled Blue Jays .
 In 1977 Justin Hayward recorded Justin Hayward first solo album Songwriter .
 Justin Hayward enjoyed international solo success in 1978 when Justin Hayward appeared on Jeff Waynes Musical Version of The War of the Worlds concept album , which yielded Justin Hayward hits Forever Autumn and The Eve of the War .
 Jeff Waynes later contributed to Haywards 1980 album Night Flight .
 Justin Hayward issued a rare non-album single Marie c/w Heart of Steel in April 1979 , both sides composed by Justin Hayward , the A side dedicated to Justin Hayward wife .
 These tracks were later included among the Bonus tracks on a CD re-issue of Justin Hayward Songwriter solo album in 2004 .
 During the 1980s , Justin Hayward composed and performed for film and television , including the theme song It Wont Be Easy for the 1987 BBC2 science fiction series Star Cops , Something Evil , Something Dangerous for the film , Eternal Woman for the film She and music for the animated television series The Shoe People .
 In 1989 , with producer-arranger Mike Batt , Justin Hayward released Classic Blue , an album of pop standards written by other composers , set to orchestration arranged by Mike Pinder of The Moody Blues .
Classic Blue included a cover version of Led Zeppelin s hit Stairway to Heaven .
Haywards solo album , The View from the Hill , was released in 1996 , and a live recording , Live in San Juan Capistrano , followed in 1998 .
 Justin Hayward contributed vocals to a song on Rick Wakeman s 1999 album Return to the Centre of the Earth .
 In 2003 Justin Hayward sang along with other rock singers on another orchestral album , consisting of Moody Blues songs with the Frankfurt Rock Orchestra , titled Justin Hayward and Friends Perform the Hits of the Moody Blues .
 Justin Hayward was later involved in a legal dispute , now resolved , arguing Justin Hayward was not paid for Justin Hayward participation on the album .
 In April 2006 , Justin Hayward took part in the stage tour of Jeff Waynes Musical Version of The War of the Worlds , reprising Justin Hayward role in Autumn 2007 in Australia and in the UK in December 2007 .
 Justin Hayward did so again in the UK in June 2009 , and appeared on the tour in November and December 2010 .
 In March 2007 Justin Hayward collaborated with a Manchester DJ Damian Corcoran , their work thrived in the underground dance scene with 1 track Its stopped entering the Billboard charts at number 3 , this track is cited as The reason US wanted to make music by Will US am .
 The Moody Blues , with Justin Hayward , Bassist John Lodge and original drummer Graeme Edge , continue to tour extensively and in a recent BBC World Service interview , Justin Hayward and Bassist John Lodge made BBC World Service clear they have no plans to stop working , regarding BBC World Service as a privilege to still be working in the music industry .
 In an interview , in 2005 , Graeme Edge said if Graeme Edge remained in good health , Graeme Edge could go on for 10 more years .
 On December 10 , 2011 Justin Hayward along with Ian Anderson from Jethro Tull and Bruce Dickinson from Iron Maiden played a concert together at Canterbury Cathedral .
Haywards album Spirits of the Western Sky was released on 26 February 2013 on the Eagle / Lagare International labels .
 On February 26 , 2013 Justin Hayward released Justin Hayward solo album Spirits of the Western Sky on the Eagle Rock label .
 Justin Hayward toured solo with this album on the east coast of the USA in August 2013 , to much acclaim , with Moody Blues backups keyboardist Alan Hewitt , and vocalist Julie Ragins and an opening act and accompanying guitarist for Justin Hayward in the show , UKs Mike Dawes , an amazing guitarist in Justin Hayward own right .
The final show of the solo tour in Atlanta , GA was recorded for a DVD project to be released soon .
 For the most part , Justin Hayward has used a red his Gibson ES-335 , though Justin Hayward also uses other guitars in both performing and recording , including a 1955 Martin D-28 Dreadnought , a James Olson six-string acoustic , a black Guild acoustic , a Squier Stratocaster , a Fender Telecaster , a blonde Guild 12-string acoustic , a 12-string his Gibson acoustic , and in 1967 a black Gibson Les Paul .
 Between 1965 and 1968 Justin Hayward was without Justin Hayward Gibson 335 and relied on other instruments , most notably a 1964 Fender Telecaster and a hand-built 12-string guitar Justin Hayward had renovated for Lonnie Donegan .
 However , in an interview included on the Lovely to See You concert DVD , Justin Hayward says the 1963 Gibson 335 has been with Gibson 335 since 1967 .
 Recently Justin Hayward has played a Collings D3 on stage and on recordings .
 Among other instruments , Justin Hayward also played mandolin on A Question of Balance and sitar on In Search of the Lost Chord .
 At the end of one love affair and the beginning of another , the song Nights in White Satin was , according to Justin Hayward , written in adoration of all women .
 Ann Marie Guirron & Justin Hayward were married on 19 December 1970 .
 Justin Hayward was awarded the first of numerous awards from the American Society of Composers , Authors and Publishers for songwriting in 1974 .
 In 1985 , the Moody Blues picked up the Ivor Novello Award for Outstanding Contribution to Music , and in 1988 Justin Hayward received the Novello , among other honours , for Composer of the Year .
 In 2000 , Justin Hayward was one of a handful of British artists to receive the Golden Note award for lifetime achievement by ASCAP .
 In 2004 , Justin Hayward was awarded the Gold Badge for lifetime achievement by the British Academy of Songwriters , Composers and Authors
Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan is an Indian vocalist in the Hindustani classical tradition , from the Delhi Gharana .
 Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan sings Khyal , Thumri , Dadra , Tappa , Tarana , Bhajans and Ghazals .
 Tanveer Ahmed Khan was born into a musical family of Dilli Gharana at Mausiqui Manzil in Darya Ganj , New Delhi .
 Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan started learning classical music at the early age of 4 years from Chand Khan .
 After Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan , Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan learnt from Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan grandfather Usman Khan and later on from Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan father Naseer Ahmed Khan .
 Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan has lived in New Delhi from Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan childhood and has done Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan schooling from St. James School , Munirka , New Delhi .
 After the death of Naseer Ahmed Khan in 1986 , Tanveer Ahmed Khan continued Naseer Ahmed Khan in 1986 musical training from various maestros of Dilli Gharana such as Zafar Ahmed Khan , Zahoor Ahmed Khan and Hilal Ahmed Khan .
 In 1994 , Naseer Ahmed Khan in 1986 started learning from Iqbal Ahmed Khan .
Miyan Achpal Khan is the fountainhead of the Dilli Gharana .
A senior contemporary and sangeet guru of Emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar , the last Mughal emperor , Miyan Achpal Khan trained the likes of Tanras Khan .
He belonged to the lineage of Meer Hasan Samant and was son and Mureed of Bheekan Shah .
Miyan Achpal Khan was both a musician and composer of high order .
 After Miyan Achpal Khan , the legacy continued with Miyan Achpal Khan grandson Chand Khan .
In Dilli Gharana , Gayaki is quite different from others .
The unfolding of the raga begins with nom-tom alaap followed by the vilambit khayal .
After enunciating the asthayi , the raga is elaborated with bol-alaap , after which the vocalist proceeds with the antara .
Dilli Gharana does not rigidly confine to note by note development of raga but makes judicious sortie into higher octaves .
This segment is embellished with gamak , meend , khatka , murki etc. .
 This style is especially known for This style lachav and ghulav .
The drut khayal begins with bol-banav , i.e. artistic variation of text .
 Dilli Gharana is reputed for The drut khayal variety of intricate taans , which may well be called The drut khayal hallmark .
Other outstanding features are the shapely amad , complex yet accurate tihaais , purity of raga and fidelity of compositions .
Tanveer Ahmed Khan has given many successful performances in various cities of India and abroad such as Australia , Holland , U.A.E. , Bangladesh , Pakistan and many Gulf countries .
 Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan has also performed for many prestigious music societies such as Shree Baba Harivallabh Sangeet Sammelan , Sangeet Natak Academy , Malhar Maha Ustav Gwalior , Sahitya Kala Parishad , Asavari , Haridas Tansen Music Festival , SEHMAT , SA MA PA Music Festival , Ustad Bade Gulam Ali Khan Yaadgaar Sabha and Khashi Baithak Sabha .
The guru-shishya tradition , lineage , or parampara , denotes a succession of teachers and disciples in traditional Indian culture and religions such as Hinduism , Sikhism , Jainism and Buddhism .
It is the tradition of spiritual relationship and mentoring where teachings are transmitted from a guru teacher to a disciple or chela .
Such knowledge , whether it be Vedic , agamic , architectural , musical or spiritual , is imparted through the developing relationship between the guru and the disciple .
It is considered that this relationship , based on the genuineness of the guru , and the respect , commitment , devotion and obedience of the student , is the best way for subtle or advanced knowledge to be conveyed .
The student eventually masters the knowledge that the guru embodies .
Tanveer Ahmed Khan is continuing the Guru-Shishya Prampara of the Delhi Gharana , including disciples from Faculty of Music and Fine Arts at Delhi University , and from Indraprastha University .
Tanveer Ahmed Khan has won many awards in music like Sangeet Ratna , Kala shree , Sahitya Kala Parishad , All India Music Award , Begum Akhtar Award , Surmani and Sangeet Shiromani .
 The Amir Khusro Institute Of Music awarded Ustad Tanveer Ahmed Khan the title Prince of Taan
 Apratim Majumdar , is an Indian classical musician from Kolkata , Swar-Sadhana Samiti , India .
He plays the Sarod .
His Dhrupadee Veenkar style of Ustad Alauddin Khan s Seni Veenkar Gharana : analytically imaginative prosodic progression with metrical waves of melodic phrases interwoven with highest order of technical brilliance and maturity reminds the great legends of the Gharana .
He is an internationally recognized instructor of classical Indian music .
He has been tutored and groomed by Rabin Ghosh , disciple of Ustad Alauddin Khan , under the strict discipline and style of Ustad Alauddin Khan Seni Veenkar Gharana of Maihar and Rampur for over nineteen years .
Apratims study in Music under Rabin Ghosh continues .
Apratim also received training for a period of three years from Shree Partho Sarothy , disciple of Ustad Dhyanesh Khan and Pt .
Ravishankar .
 Apratim received training for a period of three years from Shree Partho Sarothy , disciple of Ustad Dhyanesh Khan and Pt .
Ravishankar .
 Presently Ravishankar . is under training of Dr. Pradip Kumar Chakraborty , one of the seniormost disciples of Pt .
Ravi Shankar .
Awarded by West Bengal State Music Akademi and The Dover Lane Music conference .
Sur Mani title conferred by Sur Singar Samsad Mumbai .
 Ravi Shankar . Dhrupadee Veenkar style of Ustad Alauddin Khans Seni Veenkar Gharana , analytically imaginative prosodic progression with metrical waves of melodic phrases interwoven with highest order of technical brilliance and maturity reminds the great legends of the Gharana .
Apratim performed a number of prestigious concerts .
 Some of these are : at National Center for the Performing Arts - the Sur Singar Samsad Mumbai , Swami Haridas Sangeet Sammelan - the Sur Singar Samsad Mumbai , Vasantrao Chandorkar Smriti Pratisthan - Jalgaon , Kal Ke Kalakar Sangeet Sammelan - the Sur Singar Samsad Mumbai , Indian Classical Music Young Talents Conference - Kolkata , Swar-Sadhana Samiti , Swar-Sadhana Samiti - the Sur Singar Samsad Mumbai , Uttarpara Sangeet Chakra Annual Music Conference , India International Center and many others .
Apratim has also performed in Germany , France , Denmark , Switzerland , Italy , Holland , Austria and Bangladesh .
He was awarded prizes by West Bengal State Music Akademi and The Dover Lane Music conference in the year 2000 .
He received the prestigious Sur Mani title by the Sur Singar Samsad Mumbai .
He is `` Sangeet Bhaskar '' from Pracheen Kalakendra , Chandigarh .
Apratim has composed music for number of Short films .
He is teaching students in Guru-sishya-parampara style , doing Workshops and Lecture Demonstrations.He is also teaching online
It is a popular raga of the late night , which is meant to depict the emotion of a woman waiting for reunion with her lover .
It is said to have been first sung by Mian Tansen , the celebrated court singer of the Emperor Akbar in the sixteenth century .

Pandit Sankha Chatterjee is an Indian tabla player .
 Pandit Sankha Chatterjee studied under three traditional Tabla Gharana in strict Parampara tradition .
Born into a musical family in Calcutta , India .
 a musical family in Calcutta , India father was a Doctor and musical enthusiast , exposing His father to formal tuition early in life under the legendary Ustad Maseet Khan of the Farukhabad Gharana of Tabla .
 His father Studied under Ustad Maseet Khan , Pandit Sankha Chatterjee subsequently learnt from His father son Ustad Keramatulla Khan and later from Late Tabla Maestro Ustad Alla Rakha Khan of the Punjab Gharana .
 Sankha Chatterjee style is a blend of three leading Delhi Gharanas , the Farukkabad , the Punjab Gharana and Delhi Gharanas .
 Pandit Sankha Chatterjee still performs and teaches .
 Pandit Sankha Chatterjee divides Pandit Sankha Chatterjee time teaching in Berlin and Calcutta , India as Pandit Sankha Chatterjee bases and holds workshops across Europe and the United States .
 Pandit Sankha Chatterjee leading students are amongst some of the leading virtuosos of the younger generation of tabla players such as Gouri Shankar Karmakar , Subhojyoti Guha , Amit Chatterjee , Mihir Kundu , Friedemann Zintel and Federico Sanesi .
 Pandit Sankha Chatterjee daughter Sangeeta Bandopadhyay is a leading classical vocalist of the Patiala Gharana of Indian classical sangeet
 This is an India musical raga that appears in the Sikh tradition from northern India and is part of the Sikh holy scripture called Sri Guru Granth Sahib or Guru Granth Sahib for short .
 Every raga has a strict set of rules which govern the number of notes that can be used ; which notes can be used ; and This interplay that has to be adhered to for the composition of a tune .
 In the Guru Granth Sahib , the Sikh holy Granth there are a total of 31 raga compositions and this raga is the ninth raga to appear in the series .
The composition in this raga appear on a total of only 2 pages from page numbers 719 to 721 .
This raga appears in the Ragmala as the first ragini of Sri raga .
In the Mesakarna Ragmala , which is almost the same as that of the Guru Granth Sahib , the first ragini of Siri Raga is given as Vairati .
 However , modern sources do not give the old Bairari nor Vairati but Barari and Varari as well as Varati are listed .
 Kaufmann believes that all of these names refer to the same raga , Barari .
 Whether the same as the old Bairari is the same as the old Bairari is open to question .
 The possibility always exists that the old Bairari was a regional tune .
 The possibility was used by Guru Ram Das for six short hymns and by Guru Arjan for one .
This raga is performed during the evening and it is currently assigned to the Marva thata .
 It resembles Purva Kalyan , the main difference being the use of Pa which is strong in the old Bairari and weak in Purva-Kalyan .
Popley places Bairari in the same group as Sri Raga and this would agree with the Ragmala .
The following represents the order of notes that can be used on the ascending and descending phase of the composition and the primary and secondary notes : .
In the Guru Granth Sahib there are 2 pages dedicated to this raga from page 719 to 721
Kedar Naphade is an Indian harmonium player in the Hindustani classical tradition .
 Kedar Naphade was born into a Maharashtrian family in the city of Bharat Natya Mandir in Pune , India .
 Kedar Naphade father , Sudheer Naphade is a professional in the Merchant Navy and was the Nautical Advisor to the Government of Mumbai , India .
 Sudheer Naphade mother Pushpalata Naphade is a physician .
 His mother Pushpalata Naphade grew up in a traditional middle class environment in a suburb of Bharat Natya Mandir in Pune .
 His mother Pushpalata Naphade received initial music education and training in the harmonium from His mother Pushpalata Naphade grandfather Shri Dadasaheb Naphade and from Arwind Gajendragadkar .
 Since 1980 , from the age of 8 , His mother Pushpalata Naphade started learning harmonium solo and accompaniment from Tulsidas Borkar .
 His mother Pushpalata Naphade was also closely associated with and learnt from Padmavati Shaligram-Gokhale of the Atrauli-Jaipur Gharana from 1989-1993 .
 His mother Pushpalata Naphade finished His mother Pushpalata Naphade engineering degree at the Indian Institute of Technology in Mumbai in 1993 .
 Subsequently His mother Pushpalata Naphade relocated to the United States of America , where His mother Pushpalata Naphade finished His mother Pushpalata Naphade Ph.D. in Operations Research from Lehigh University in 1997 .
 Kedar Naphade has been performing harmonium solo and accompaniment concerts since 1982 .
 Kedar Naphade was featured as a child artist on the Mumbai Television Channel Doordarshan in the early 1980s and started performing professionally as a soloist and accompanist of Hindustani Classical music in 1990 , at the age of 18 .
 Kedar Naphade first came into limelight with a concert at the prestigious Annual Alladiya Khan Smruti Samaroha in Bharat Natya Mandir in Pune , India with Smt .
Padmavati Shaligram-Gokhalie in 1992 .
Kedars music derives inspiration from the stylistic genius and dexterous wizardry of Tulshidas Borkar and his guru P. Madhukar as well as the character of the traditional Hindustani vocal art form .
 In addition to classical music , Kedar Naphade also plays the semi-classical forms of Marathi Natyasangeet , Bhajans , Thumri etc. .
 Kedar Naphade has performed harmonium solo and has accompanied vocalists at numerous concerts in Mumbai , India , Europe and in the U.S. .
 Kedar Naphade has more than 500 concert appearances to Kedar Naphade credit , including prestigious festivals and venues such as the Alladiya Khan Smruti Samaroha , Dadar Matunga Cultural Center and Vile Parle Music Circle in Bharat Natya Mandir in Pune , Surel Samvadini Sanvardhan institute in Belgaum , Karnataka , Kala Academy in Panaji Goa , Bharat Natya Mandir in Pune , Mumbai , India , the London U.K. Marathi Mandal , The Lincoln Center in New York , Carnegie Hall in New York , The Smithsonian Institute in Washington D.C. , the LearnQuest Academy music conference in Boston , the Chhandayan Annual All Night Music Conference in New York etc. .
 Kedar Naphade has also been featured on radio stations such as the National Public Radio , WKCR 89.9 , e-Prasaran Internet radio etc. .
 Kedar Naphade has collaborated on stage with legendary musicians of India such as Kedar Naphade guru Smt .
Padmavati Shaligram-Gokhale , Pt .
 Jasraj , Smt .
 Veena Sahasrabuddhe , Pt .
 Ulhas Kashalkar , Smt .
 Prabha Atre , Smt .
 Laxmi Shankar , Pt .
 Phiroz Dastur , Smt .
Ashwini Bhide-Deshpande , etc. .
 Ashwini Bhide-Deshpande has also collaborated with other instrumentalists and worked in instrumental ensembles with other instruments such as the sitar , flute , violin and mandolin .
 Ashwini Bhide-Deshpande is a reputed teacher of the harmonium for Indian Classical music and two of his students Rohan Prabhudesai and Swarup Swaminathan have started providing professional accompaniment in Hindustani classical music .
 Kedar Naphade added a new chapter in Kedar Naphade Music life when Kedar Naphade started the First Online Music teaching school for the harmonium under Ace Open University in 2010
Bandish , Cheez or Gat is a fixed , melodic composition in Hindustani vocal or instrumental music .
 Bandish is set in a specific raga , performed with rhythmic accompaniment by a tabla or pakhavaj , a steady drone , and melodic accompaniment by a sarangi , violin or harmonium .
There are different ways of systematizing the parts of a composition .
A bandish provides the literature element in the music , for standard structured singing .
In the past many gharanas protected their bandishes from moving out of the family with gross incoherent vocal renditions .
 In the realm of vocal music , it is often known as Cheez .
The word Bandish is derived from Hindi language , and literally means binding together .
Sthayi or Asthayi : The initial , Rondo phrase or line of a fixed , melodic composition .
Antara : The first body phrase or line of a fixed , melodic composition .
Sanchari : The third body phrase or line of a fixed , melodic composition , seen more typically in Dhrupad bandishes .
Aabhog : The fourth and concluding body phrase or line of a fixed , melodic composition , seen more typically in Dhrupad bandishes .
 There are three variations of Bandish , regarding tempo : .
Vilambit Bandish : A slow and steady melodic composition , usually in Largo to Adagio speeds .
Madhyalaya Bandish : A medium tempo melodic competition , usually set in Andante to Allegretto speeds .
Drut Bandish : A fast tempo melodic composition , usually set to Allegretto speed , and onwards
Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan was an Indian tabla player , commonly considered the preeminent soloist among tabla players of the 20th century , and among the most influential percussionists in the history of Indian classical music .
 Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan was known for Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan mastery of the fingering techniques and aesthetic values of various tabla styles , technical virtuosity , formidable stage presence , and soulful musicality .
 While Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan had command over the traditional tabla repertoire of various gharanas , Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan was also distinguished by the way in which Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan brought together these diverse compositions , Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan reinterpretation of traditional methods of improvisation , and Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan own compositions .
 Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan solo recitals were of the first to elevate the art of playing tabla solo to an art in its own right in the popular mind .
 Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan style of playing influenced many generations of tabla players .
