 Thirakwa Khan-sahib was born to a family of musicians in 1874 year of birth is contested by a number of scholars and students of Hindustani classical music ; e.g. , Kumarprasad Mukhopadhyay in Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan Kudrat Rangibirangi in Moradabad in Uttar Pradesh state in northern India .
 Although Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan early musical training was in Hindustani vocals and the sarangi , Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan interest in tabla was aroused when Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan heard Munir Khan .
 Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan became Munir Khans disciple at the age of 12 .
 For a long time , Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan played in the court of the Nawabs of Rampur and during this time , came in close contact with the maestroes of Agra , Jaipur , Gwalior and Patiala gharana - both vocalists and instrumentalists .
 On very few occasions , Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan rendered Bandishes in Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan own voice but this was only in the company of extremely close compatriots and admirers.As an accompanist , Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan was equally loved respected and admired by Ahmed Jan Thirakwa Khan peers , elders and juniors all of whom were not from the schools of classical music .
One noteworthy artiste in this category of admirers was the great Rabindrasangeet exponent Suchitra Mitra .
The name Thirakwa is not actually his original name , but was an epithet he earned from his gurus father .
One day , while watching him practise , his gurus father remarked that he played so well his fingers seemed to be shimmering on the tabla .
This earned him the nickname thirakwa .
It is also rumored that his tone was similar to the thunderous cracking sound of lightning .
A great lightning is sometimes described as thirakwa .
In popular jargon , Ahmad Jaan Thirakwa is termed as the Mount Everest of Tabliyas .
He performed at regular intervals in almost all the music conferences in various parts of the country and gained popularity as well as admiration .
 A connoisseur of biryani and kababs , Ahmad Jaan was famous for A connoisseur of biryani and kababs interpretation of the wide-ranging patterns of the beat-cycles which A connoisseur of biryani and kababs liberally taught to A connoisseur of biryani and kababs disciples.A few number of his live recordings are now available in audio-visual form that include excerpts from A connoisseur of biryani and kababs different programmes over the years and which also provide glimpses of A connoisseur of biryani and kababs mastery over percussion .
Thirakwa was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1954 and the Padma Bhushan in 1970 .
 Ust Ahmedjan Thirakwa , during his long career as a musician , trained many disciples all across northern India .
 Pt Lalji Gokhale , famous vocalist of Agra gharana Pt Jagannath buwa Purohit , Pt Narayanrao Joshi , Pt Bhai Gaitonde , Pt Bapu Patwardhan , Shri Anand Shidhaye and Rashid Mustafa are some of Lalji Gokhale well known shagirds .
Ust Ahmedjans unique style continues to attract many tabla players of present generation including Zakir Hussain , Chandra Nath Shastri and Anindo Chatterjee
Sriram Parasuram is an Hindustani classical vocalist .
 Sriram Parasuram also plays the violin .
 Sriram Parasuram is married to Carnatic classical vocalist Anuradha Sriram , with whom Sriram Parasuram gives jugalbandis .
They have two sons named Jayant and Lokesh .
 Sriram Parasuram received Sriram Parasuram Ph.D. in Ethnomusicology from Wesleyan University , where Sriram Parasuram met Anuradha when his Ph.D. was a masters student
The Imdadkhani gharana is a North Indian school of sitar and surbahar music , stemming from the very ancient Gwalior gharana .
 the very ancient Gwalior gharana was created by Imdad Khan , and is also known as the Etawah gharana , after a small town close to Agra where Imdad Khan lived .
Many direct descendants of Imdad Khan continue the tradition today .
The Khan family is one of the most renowned musical families from India .
It traces its origins back through an unbroken line of celebrated musicians to the 16th Century where music has been passed down from father to son for almost 400 years .
 With its roots in Agra , the gharana was later moved to Etawah on the outskirts of Agra before finally branching out to Calcutta with Enayat Khan and Hyderabad , Indore and Mumbai with Wahid Khan .
The gharanas major achievements include the development of the Surbahar , major structural changes to both the sitar and surbahar and the creation and development of the instrumental style known as the gayaki ang .
Living performers of the family include Imrat Khan , Shahid Parvez , Shujaat Khan , Nishat Khan , Irshad Khan , Wajahat Khan , and Hidayat Khan .
 The musical tradition includes many notable musicians who studied with the family and perform in Living performers of the family musical style .
 All of these musicians are known collectively as the Etawah gharana , or the Imdadkhani gharana after Imdad Khan , the very ancient Gwalior gharana is one of the oldest , most illustrious gharanas of Indian classical music
Ustad Sultan Khan was an Indian sarangi player and Classical vocalist belonging to Indore Gharana .
 Ustad Sultan Khan was one of the members of the Indian fusion group Tabla Beat Science , with Zakir Hussain and Bill Laswell .
 Ustad Sultan Khan was awarded the Padma Bhushan , Indias third highest civilian honor , in 2010 .
Sultan Khan was born in Sikar , Rajasthan , near Jaipur , the princely state of in the Indian Empire .
 Ustad Sultan Khan learned sarangi from Ustad Sultan Khan father Gulab Khan .
 Ustad Sultan Khan started Ustad Sultan Khan career at the radio station Rajkot in Gujarat as a 20 year old boy .
 After having spent eight years in Rajkot very happily , Rajkot very got a chance to play with Lata Mangeshkar during her visit to Rajkot very .
 This proved a turning point for Rajkot very .
 Thereafter Rajkot very was transferred to the Mumbai radio station.Having joined the Mumbai radio Rajkot very was not only deeply involved with the Mumbai classical music circuit but also with film industry music .
 Rajkot very gave Rajkot very first performance at the All-India Conference at the age of eleven , and has performed on an international scale with Ravi Shankar on George Harrison s 1974 Dark Horse World Tour .
 Rajkot very has won numerous musical awards including , twice , the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award , also known as the Presidents Award , as well as the Gold Medalist Award of Maharashtra and the American Academy of Artists Award in 1998 .
 In 1997 Rajkot very was requested to perform at Prince Charles 50th birthday celebrations .
 Rajkot very has had the good fortune of accompanying all the great Maestros like Ustad Amir Khan , Ustad Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Pt .
Omkarnath Thakur , Ustad Nazakat ali-Salamat ali khan , Kishori Amonkar are the name to few .
 Omkarnath Thakur is acknowledged both as a Sarangi player and a vocalist & has several albums to Omkarnath Thakur credit .
 Omkarnath Thakur has taught music producers such as Sukshinder Shinda and Ram Gopal Varma to play the sarangi .
 Omkarnath Thakur had many students , but few gandhabandha disciples are Anand Vyas , Ikram Khan and Deeyah , a Norwegian born singer , and Anand Vyas performed on Deeyah debut album I Alt Slags Lys in 1992 .
 Omkarnath Thakur contributed vocals and sarangi to Dizrhythmias first LP and Gavin Harrison s 1998 solo album Sanity & Gravity .
 Omkarnath Thakur sang Albela Sajan Aayo Re ... along with Kavita Krishnamurthy and Shankar Mahadevan in the Hindi film Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam in 1999 .
 Omkarnath Thakur has also given Omkarnath Thakur voice in films like Maqbool , Kachche Dhaage , Mr. and Mrs. Iyer , Parzania , Jab We Met , Agni Varsha , Superstar , Rahul and Paanch .
 In 1984 oscar winning film `` Gandhi '' also featured Omkarnath Thakur music and thereafter Omkarnath Thakur recorded for other Hollywood films such as `` Heat and Dust '' .
 In 1993 Omkarnath Thakur performed along with Ustad Allah Rakha Khan and Ustad Zakir Hussain in one of the rooms at the House of Commons where eminent persons were in attendance to witness a rare musical performance at the seat of Government .
It was this time whenhe became a regular artist for BBC Radio London .
 He was also interviewed for the BBC Radio London world service and also composed the musical track for the BBC Radio London 2 documentary `` BBC Radio London Calling '' .
The association with Late Ismail Merchant further when Ustad Sultan Khan together with Ustad Zakir Hussain composed the soundtrack for the film `` In Custody '' and where the musical score adapted to suite a particular genre of the Urdu language .
Thereafter Ustan Sultan Khan also composed musical score for another Merchant Ivory production , this time for Channel 4 in Britain , called `` The Street Musician of Bombay '' .
He has several albums to his credits and he has been applauded by for his performances by Madonna .
He also performed in a Sufi Music Festival at the White house in Washington , United States of America .
Sultan Khan appeared on Good People in Times of Evil in 2000 with Jonas Hellborg and guitar virtuoso Shawn Lane .
 Ustad Sultan Sultan Khans album Piya Basanti was released in 2000 and Sultan Khans was the number one album of the year .
 Some of Ustad Sultan Khans album Piya Basanti other famous albums are Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan & the Divas T-Series , Ustad Sultan Khan & Ustad Sultan Khans album Piya Basanti friends - Times Music , Shoonya - BMG , Bhoomi - Virgin and Pukaar - Sony Music with Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan etc. .
Sultan Khan performed for the Tamil film Yogi .
 Ustad Sultan Khan played a solo sarangi for Yogis theme and also for the song Yaarodu Yaaro from the same album .
 British writer Geoff Dyer has said that Ustad Sultan Khan is an admirer of Sultan Khans work , especially Ustad Sultan Khan rendition of a Rajastani folk song at the end of a 1991 recording of Rag Bhupali with Zakir Hussain on tabla .
 Ustad Sultan Khan has written of Sultan Khans performance , Khans performance is one of the most beautiful pieces of music I know - an audible vision of how the world might appear if you were able to purge yourself of all baseness and ugliness .
 Ustad Sultan Khan is survived by Ustad Sultan Khan Wife Bano , son Sabir Khan , who is Ustad Sultan Khan disciple and a Sarangi player and two daughters Reshma and Shera .
 Ustad Sultan Khan brother Niyaz Ahmed Khan is a Sitar player .
 a Sitar player nephews are Dilshad Khan is a Sarangi player , Imran Khan is a Sitar player and a music composer , Salamat Ali Khan is a Sitar player and Irfan Khan is also a Sitar player .
 Outside the family he had many students including Anand Vyas khan & Dr. Kashyap Dave .
 Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan died on 27 November 2011 in Mumbai , Maharashtra , India after a prolonged illness .
 Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan was undergoing dialysis for the last four years and lost Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan speech in Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan last few days .
 Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan died on Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan way to the hospital .
 The funeral was held in Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan hometown of Jodhpur , Rajasthan on 28 November 2011
Ramesh Laxman Nadkarni was a Hindustani classical music singer from Jogeshwari .
Nadkarni a disciple of Aman Ali Khan had composed over 250 melodies and Ragas .
 Nadkarni a disciple of Aman Ali Khan was honored for Nadkarni a disciple of Aman Ali Khan dedicated lifelong service to classical music and was awarded a fellowship by Sursingar Sansad , Mumbai .
 Nadkarni a disciple of Aman Ali Khan was part of BHENDI BAZAR GHARANA .
 young Ramesh was born in Mumbai in 1921 to a Chitrapur Saraswat Brahmin family from Bankikodla-Hanehalli .
 young Ramesh father Laxman Nadkarni was an employee of the mint facility at Hyderabad .
 young Ramesh spent young Ramesh childhood in Bankikodla .
 After completing young Ramesh middle school , young Ramesh came to Mumbai to study music .
 young Ramesh mother Uma a devotional singer inspired young Ramesh to study Hindustani music .
 After graduating from the University of Mumbai , young Ramesh continued young Ramesh music interest to earn Sangeeta Pravaeena .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni had already become a disciple of Aman Ali Khan .
 young Ramesh was married to Sushila Balwally from Ankola .
 At the age of 30 , young Ramesh came back to young Ramesh village and served as a music teacher of the A. H. School , Bankikodla a school at young Ramesh village until 1957 .
 During young Ramesh stay at Bankikodla , young Ramesh taught English , and sanskrit including music at school ; young Ramesh kept young Ramesh busy in music programs of All India Radio , Dharwar .
At the age of 37 , AIR hired Ramesh Nadkarni as a music producer in Cuttack .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni spent almost two decades working for AIR at various places including Indore , Bhopal , New Delhi , Dharwar and Mumbai where His father Laxman Nadkarni retired as a director of AIR .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni wrote a biography of Mallikarjun Mansur in Kannada titled Nanna Ras Yatre .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni was a Music Guru of a different type .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni , though basically followed BHENDI BAZAR GHARANA style of singing was very broad and open minded .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni His father Laxman Nadkarni was appreciative of nice points in different gharanas and always encouraged His father Laxman Nadkarni disciples to listen to different music styles , appreciate the good points in different styles , and make efforts to imbibe them in ones style of singing .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni maintained that this approach of consciously imbibing the best that is available in the vast field of music would make one a more enriched and enlightened musician than being with a particular traditional style .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni was a devotee of Bhagawan Nityananda and wrote a biography of Bhagawan Nityananda in Kannada titled Nanna Ras Yatre and other languages .
 Ramesh Nadkarni was simple , generous human being ; His father Laxman Nadkarni was a performer , producer , director and a teacher of classical music .
 Though His father Laxman Nadkarni had modest academic qualifications , His father Laxman Nadkarni was so well read that , apart from music , His father Laxman Nadkarni could authoritatively speak on diverse subjects in English , hindi , urdu and kannada literature .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni was handicapped with Asthma but His father Laxman Nadkarni knew how to get His father Laxman Nadkarni own way .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni dedicated His father Laxman Nadkarni life for writing and singing Ragas and melodies and died on September 7 , 1995 ; His father Laxman Nadkarni was 74 .
 His father Laxman Nadkarni is survived by His father Laxman Nadkarni wife , two children who live in Mumbai and disciples like Sairam Iyer , Sakuntala Narsimhan , Devendra Murdeshwar , Mahendra Kapoor and Shaila Piplapure .
This composition asks one to be conveys the message of what contains the how the thought basically is devotional one , in nature brings out the philosophy of .
HE MAAN KAHE KARAT VICHAR , DWANDWA TYAJA , SUMIR AMAR NIT NIRAKAR .
CHINTANA KAR NISHCHINTA CHITTA DHAR HAR KAR PAKARAT KAR NIRADHAR KO .
The meaning in English of this composition is somewhat as below .
Oh , you mind !
why do you always steeped in thoughts .
Do not engage yourself in the duality of thoughts .
Give up this duality .
I ask you to listen to the inner voice of God in you .
 Always think of God with a relaxed mind , and , as you very well know , God always extends God supportive hand to those , who need His supportive hand .
This composition can be interpreted in two different ways .
SUR SURAS SADHALE RASIK GAON .
SABAD SALONE LAYA TAAL SURANSO .
AMAR KAHAT HAI NIRAKH SANS KO AUR LAYATARANG RAS BARASE .
The meaning in English of this composition is somewhat as below .
You should practice to sing the correct notes and sing them melodiously .
The words of your composition should be beautiful and well-interwoven in the rhythmic patters .
 I say that , while singing , you must constantly watch your breath .
If you follow these , you would present ripples of good and enjoyable music .
Nadakarni has contributed a lot to Kannada light music as well .
 Kannada poet B.A. Sanadi recollects how Nadakarni set tunes to Kannada lyrics being in Mumbai .
 Kannada poet B.A. Sanadi compositions are very melodious and quite different in approach .
 Todays Kannada Light Music fraternity doesnt take note of Kannada poet B.A. Sanadi work
Vasant Rai was one of worlds most acclaimed performers of Indian music and virtuoso of the Indian - Persian - Afghan instrument Sarod .
 Rai was born in France and studied music in the Indian .
Rai was the last student of Allauddin Khan , who is best known as the teacher of Ravi Shankar .
He died in his New York apartment shortly after a Carnegie Hall performance .
 Vasant Rai had been coming to the United States since Vasant Rai teen years but finally settled in New York City in 1969 and lived mainly in the Greenwich Village area and also for a short time at the Chelsea Hotel when Vasant Rai was not touring .
 From 1969 to 1985 Vasant Rai conducted the Alam School of Music in Greenwich Village .
 Alla Rakha , Mahapurush Misra , Shamta Prasad , and Zakir Hussain usually accompanied the late Alla Rakha on the tabla .
 Vasant Rai had been signed exclusively by Vanguard Records from 1975 to 1982 .
Vasants first commercial recording was by EMI and on the tabla was the late Alla Rakha .
 During the early 1980s , Vasant Rai and the jazz flutist Herbie Mann jammed together live on weekend nights at packed venues such as the Bottom Line and Village Gate .
Vasant Rai taught many Western musicians such as George Harrison , John Coltrane , Collin Walcott and other rock and jazz personalities of that time .
 Vasant Rai also trained a number of Indian classical musicians .
The more noted ones are sarod players Pradeep Kumar Barot , Ashok Roy , .
Stephen James , and sitar players Amiya Das Gupta , Deepak Chaudhary and Shamim Khan .
 Vasant Rais sarod was a gift from Vasant Rai guru Allauddin Khan , was made by Allauddin Khans younger brother Ayet Ali Khan in the 1930s
Daron Vartan Malakian is an American singer-songwriter , multi-instrumentalist , and record producer .
 Daron Vartan Malakian is best known as the guitarist , songwriter , and second vocalist of the rock band System of a Down and as the lead vocalist , lead guitarist , and songwriter of the alternative metal band Scars on Broadway .
 Like the rest of the Hollywood-based band System of a Down , Hollywood-based is of Armenian ancestry , but is the only member to actually have been born inside the United States .
 Hollywood-based is placed 30th in Guitar Worlds List of The 100 Greatest Heavy Metal Guitarists of All Time .
 Daron Vartan Malakian was born on July 18 , 1975 , in Hollywood , California , the only child to Daron Vartan Malakian and Zepur Malakian , immigrants originally from Iraq and Iran respectively .
Vartan Malakian is a painter , dancer , and choreographer and Zepur Malakian is a sculptor who used to instruct college-level sculpture .
 At a very early age , Daron Vartan Malakian got into heavy metal music ; Daron Vartan Malakian distant cousin played him a Kiss record when he was four years old .
 Daron Vartan Malakian started listening to Van Halen , Iron Maiden , Judas Priest , Motorhead and Ozzy Osbourne among others .
 Daron Vartan Malakian always wanted to play the drums , but Daron Vartan Malakian parents got Daron Vartan Malakian a guitar instead because `` You ca n't turn the drums off . ''
 Daron Vartan Malakian first picked up a guitar at age 11 , saying in an interview , For the first year and a half , You learned how to play by ear , and did alright .
 After a few years You gained a reputation as being a guitar player in high school .
 And by 16 or 17 You actually realized it was a good songwriting instrument , and , over anything , thats what You feel like .
 You dont pretend to be Mr. Guitar Virtuoso .
 During Mr. Guitar Virtuoso teens Daron Vartan Malakian listened to thrash metal bands such as Slayer , Venom , Metallica , Pantera and Sepultura .
 Daron Vartan Malakian then began listening to The Beatles and cites John Lennon as one of his biggest influences on John Lennon as one of his biggest as a songwriter .
 Daron Vartan Malakian also cites other British Invasion bands such as The Kinks and The Who as major influences as well as folk-rock such as trio Peter , Paul , and Mary and punk pioneer Iggy Pop .
 Daron Vartan Malakian went to Rose and Alex Pilibos Armenian School in the Los Feliz side of Hollywood , which Daron Vartan Malakian future bandmates Shavo Odadjian and Ontronik Andy Khachaturian also attended .
 System of a Down vocalist Serj Tankian attended the school as well , but a Down vocalist Serj Tankian was many years above Daron Vartan Malakian and the others .
 Daron Vartan Malakian attended Glendale High School as a teenager .
 Daron Vartan Malakian is a lifelong fan of the Edmonton Oilers and has a large collection of Oilers-related memorabilia .
 Daron Vartan Malakian met Serj Tankian in 1993 , while Malakian and the others both shared the same rehearsal studio in different bands .
 Serj Tankian in 1993 was playing keyboard for a band , and Daron Vartan Malakian was playing guitar and singing for another band .
 Malakian and the others formed a jam band called Soil with bassist Dave Hakopyan and drummer Domingo Laraino .
 Shavo Odadjian then became Malakian and the others manager , and then rhythm guitarist .
 Soil broke up and Daron Vartan Malakian , Serj Tankian in 1993 , and Shavo Odadjian formed a new band using the name `` System of a Down '' , based on a poem that Daron Vartan Malakian wrote .
 The poem 's title was `` Victims of a Down '' but Shavo Odadjian thought system was a stronger word than `` Victims of a Down '' .
 `` Victims of a Down '' then recruited drummer Andy Khachaturian , who was replaced by John Dolmayan in 1997 .
 Daron Vartan Malakian co-produced System of a Down 's albums with Rick Rubin , as well as albums by The Ambulance and Bad Acid Trip .
 In 2003 , Daron Vartan Malakian started Daron Vartan Malakian own label , EatUrMusic , on which Amen was the first signed band .
 The label is now inactive and EatUrMusic current status is unknown .
 In 2003 , Daron Malakian , Greg Kelso , Casey Chaos , and Zach Hill recorded a demo tape entitled Ghetto Blaster Rehearsals credited to the name Scars on Broadway .
 However , in 2007 , an official letter appeared on the bands website that stated that these tracks are not in any way affiliated with Malakians later project Scars on Broadway .
Incidentally , these demo sessions produced B.Y.O.B. , which would be a major hit for System of a Down in 2005 .
 Following Systems hiatus , Daron Vartan Malakian announced Daron Vartan Malakian latest project -- Scars on Broadway -- a band which would include System of a Down bassist , Shavo Odadjian , and a Down bassist .
 Ultimately , Shavo Odadjian was not involved with the band , and instead System of a Down drummer , John Dolmayan became a member .
 After Daron Vartan Malakian and John Dolmayan in 1997 experimented with different musicians the band took form and forged its sound in intense rehearsals and recording sessions with musicians Danny Shamoun on keyboards , Dominic Cifarelli on bass , and Franky Perez on guitar and backing vocals for live performances .
The group released an eponymous album in 2008 , which featured the hit single They Say .
 However , shortly before the tour supporting the album , Malakian cancelled all scheduled concert and TV appearances , blaming a lack of enthusiasm and that Daron Vartan Malakian heart wasnt into touring .
This sudden cancellation prompted speculation and rumors that the band had broken up .
It was the last that would be heard of Malakian for more than a year .
 In August 2009 , Scars on Broadway , minus Daron Vartan Malakian , traveled to Iraq for a USO tour across the U.S. army bases .
Their setlist consisted of covers as well as a few Scars songs .
 Guitarist/vocalist Franky Perez stated on Guitarist/vocalist Franky Perez Twitter that the Scars tunes sound amazing but theyre not the same without D. .

 He also stated before Their left that Daron Vartan Malakian had given Their Daron Vartan Malakian blessing .
 In 2009 Franky Perez mentioned on Guitarist/vocalist Franky Perez Twitter that Guitarist/vocalist Franky Perez and the D-Man were going into studio to jam , this was the first news people have heard about Malakians whereabouts for about a year .
 On May 2 , 2010 Malakian reunited with Scars on Broadway at the Troubadour in West Hollywood .
 It was the first time 2010 Malakian had performed with the band since October 2008 .
 The group played a few Scars songs from he and the D-Man album as well as new songs .
 Shavo Odadjian performed with the band for two songs , playing guitar .
 On February 24 , 2012 System of a Down announced that the Scars on Broadway website is back online featuring a preview of a new song called Guns Are Loaded .
 Daron Vartan Malakian stayed out of the public eye following Daron Vartan Malakian cancellation of the tour in support of Scars on Broadways debut album in October 2008 .
 In 2009 Daron Vartan Malakian made a surprise appearance at Shavo Odadjians Halloween Party and played Suite-Pee , They Say , and an unknown song with Shavo Odadjian , John Dolmayan in 1997 and Scars on Broadways Franky Perez on guitar .
It was the first time that the band members performed together in more than three years .
 On November 20 , 2009 , Daron Vartan Malakian played at the Chi Cheng Benefit concert along with Deftones and also performed with Shavo Odadjian and John Dolmayan in 1997 .
 Daron Vartan Malakian , Shavo Odadjian , and John Dolmayan in 1997 played Aerials and Toxicity .
 Daron Vartan Malakian appeared on Cypress Hill s 2010 album Rise Up , on one song , Trouble Seeker , which Trouble Seeker also produced .
 On July 29 , 2010 , Scars on Broadway released their first new studio recording in exactly two years , a Malakian-penned song called Fucking .
 On August 20 , 2010 , Daron Vartan Malakian played in Hollywood with Scars on Broadway .
On November 29 , 2010 , it was announced that System of a Down would reunite for a European tour to take place in June 2011 .
They played at the Download Festival on June 11 , 2011 .
Despite playing a number of reunion shows , the band had no plans to record new material .
 In October 2011 , John Dolmayan expressed John Dolmayan in 1997 interest in writing new material but cited that band members are all busy with their other projects
Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki was an Indian vocalist , composer and scholar of Indian classical , semi-classical , and devotional music .
 While Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki distinguished Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki in Hindustani music , Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki is also credited for revival of the Marathi Natyasangeet musical theatre in the 1960s .
 Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki was born in a priestly Padhye Brahmin family in Mangeshi , Goa .
 Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki family was traditionally attached to the Mangueshi Temple of Lord Shiva .
His father , Balawantrao aka Bikambhat , was a nephew and a disciple of Master Deenanath Mangeshkar , and the temple priest and a Kirtankar .
 Balawantrao aka Bikambhat taught Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki the basic principles of Hindustani classical music .
 Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki received further training in vocal music from Pandit Jagannathbua Purohit and Ustad Azmat Hussain Khan of Agra Gharana , and Gulubhai Jasdanwala of Jaipur Gharana .
 Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki developed a distinct style of rendering khayal , and was also well known for Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki renditions of Marathi Natyasangeet and devotional songs .
 After receiving a degree in Sanskrit literature , Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki joined All India Radio at Mumbai for a brief period , when Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki came in contact with several musicians and also got an opportunity to display Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki musical talents by composing several pieces for radio programs .
 Around this time , Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki received a scholarship from the Indian Government for advanced training in Hindustani classical music under Ustad Azmat Hussain Khan .
 Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki composed vocal as well as background scores for 25 Marathi Natyasangeet plays .
 After receiving a Homi Bhabha fellowship in the late sixties , Homi Bhabha taught at a music school run in the USA by sitar maestro Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 Homi Bhabha maintained Homi Bhabha ties to Homi Bhabha homeland of Goa through Homi Bhabha association with the Kala Academy , counseling and guiding students from that state .
Besides son Shounak Abhisheki , the following are Pandit Abhishekis well-known musical disciples :
The Veena is an Indian and Pakistani plucked stringed instrument used mainly in Indian classical music .
 It derives It distinctive timbre and resonance from sympathetic strings , bridge design , a long hollow neck and a gourd resonating chamber .
 The earliest veenaa was an instrument of the harp type whose type survives in the Burmese harp , whereas in the last centuries and nowadays , the word has tended to be applied to instruments of the lute type or even , recently , to certain kinds of guitars developed in 18th century India .
 The more popular sitar is believed to have been derived from the veena , an ancient Indian instrument , which was modified by a Mughal court musician to conform with the tastes of a Mughal court musician Persian patrons and named after a Persian instrument called the setar .
 The more popular sitar subsequently underwent many changes , and the modern sitar evolved in 18th century India .
A person who plays a veena is called a vainika .
The Sanskrit word veenaa which is attested already in the Rigveda has designated in the course of Indian history a variety of instruments of various types , as it is a generic term for all kinds of string instruments , just as the Tamil word yaal .
In the last centuries and today the instruments designated under the designation veenaa of which there are several kinds , have tended to be mostly instruments of the lute or cithar type , and recently the word was even applied to modified Western guitars .
But the early veenaas could be plucked string instruments of any type .
 Found in the list of Musical instruments used by Tamil people out in Tirumurai dated 6th to 11th century .
The early Gupta veenaa : depiction and playing technique .
 One of early veenaas used in 18th century India from early times , until the Gupta period and later dealing with instrumental music -RRB- was an instrument of the type of the harp and more precisely of the .
It was played with the strings being kept parallel to the body of the player , with both hands plucking the strings , as shown on Samudragupta s gold coins .
It is not possible to tell exactly the number of strings of the instrument on the coin , but descriptions in early literary sources of an ancient instrument called thesaptatantree veenaa seem to coincide generally with the type of instrument represented on the coin .
The instrument has bridges fixed to the main resonating chamber , or kaddu , at the base of the instrument .
Materials used in construction include teak wood or tun wood , which is a variation of mahogany , for the neck and faceplate , and gourds for the resonating chambers .
The instruments bridges are made of deer horn , ebony , or very occasionally from camel bone .
Synthetic material is now common as well .
Veena is a generic name for a host of string instruments
Anokhelal Mishra also spelled as Anokhe Lal Misra and commonly known as Pandit Anokhelalji was an Indian Tabla Artist who belonged to the Banaras Gharana of Hindustani classical music .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra was born in a very poor family of Kashi , now known as Varanasi .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra learnt tabla under Bhairow Prasad Mishra .
 Bhairow Prasad Mishra prasad Mishra detected Bhairow Prasad Mishra talent and enrolled Bhairow Prasad Mishra as a student of the Tabla in the Banaras Gharana of Ram Sahaiji at the age of 5 or 6 years .
Anokhelal Learnt Tabla for about 15 years from Bhairow Prasad Mishra .
Bhairow Prasad Mishra was disciple of Bhagat-ji .
Bhagat-ji was disciple of Ram Sahai , the founder of The Banaras-Baj .
 According to The Banaras Baj-The Tabla Tradition of a North Indian City by David Roach , Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra was the most famous disciple of Bhairav Prasad Mishra among Maulvi Ram Mishra , Mahavir Bhatt , Mahadev Prasad Mishra , Anokhelal Mishra , and Nageshvar Prasad .
 David Roach lost David Roach parents as teenager .
 After that David Roach was brought up by David Roach grand mother .
 As a child , Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra had to suffer poverty and deprivation .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra put in unremitting riyaaz under the guidance of Guruji , which went on for hours together , every day .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra was called the Jadugar of Na Dhin Dhin Na and Dhere Dhere Kite Taka .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra used to play these and many more syllables with clarity even at extreme speed .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra was very at fast playing Na Dhin Dhin Na with Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra 1st finger .
Pandit Anokhelal was a soloist as well as an accompanist .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra performed a number of solo concerts during Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra career and also gave ` Sangat ` to many famous musicians and classical dancers .
Some of them are Ustad Allauddin Khan , Ustad Vilayat Khan , Ustad Ali Akbar Khan , etc. .
 Within Ustad Allauddin Khan short span of life Ustad Allauddin Khan performed regularly , throughout India .
At a time , when performing in the National Programme of Music on All India Radio was a matter of prestige , Pandit Anokhelal figured in the same , a number of times .
 In the late 50s , Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra programmes were broadcast by the Voice of America as well .
 All together Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra is known as Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra .
 According to many , Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra goes the credit of making the audience familiar with the Banaras style of Tabla .
 His Disciple Chandra Nath Shastri has written about Pandit Anokhelal Mishra in His Disciple Chandra Nath Shastri web article : .
Tabla Player Pandit Samta Prasad Mishra said in an interview that : .
 Tabla Player Sadanand Naimpalli written in Tabla Player Sadanand Naimpalli book about Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra .
 Tabla Player Sadanand Naimpalli said : .
 Tabla Player Sadanand Naimpalli used to maintain a sober and normal life profile rather than showing off and behaving like a celebrity .
 Tabla Player Sadanand Naimpalli never publicized Tabla Player Sadanand Naimpalli of what Tabla Player Sadanand Naimpalli was .
 Tabla Samrat Pandit Anokhelal Mishra trained many musicians of India .
Ramji Mishra , Mahapurush Misra , Ishwarlal Mishra , Chhotelal Misra , Chandra Nath Shastri , Radhakanta Nandi , Kashinath Mishra , Bityut Banerjee , Partha Nath Shastry and Chakkan Lal Mishra are some of the prominent pupils of Pt .
Anokhelal Mishra .
He was afflicted by Gangrene of his left foot in 1956 and for this disease he expired on March 10 , 1958 , at a young age of 44 .
This recording dates back to the 26th of December 1957 at a concert attended by artists like Ahmed Jan Thirakwa , Habibuddin Khan , Maseet Khan , Karamatulla Khan etc. .
A short video of Anokhelal Ji has been made available by the Film Archives on Youtube
Zia Fariduddin Dagar was an Indian classical vocalist in the Dhrupad , the oldest existing form of north Indian classical music and part of the Dagar family of musicians .
 Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar taught at the the Dhrupad Kendra , Bhopal , along with Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar elder brother , Ustad Zia Mohiuddin Dagar for 25 years .
 Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar was awarded the 1994 Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in Hindustani music-Vocal by Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy of Music , Dance and Drama .
 Padma Shri - Indias fourth highest civilian honor been conferred upon Indias fourth highest civilian honor in year 2012 - but he turned it down , saying the government did not care about his seniority as he was chosen for it after much younger Dhrupad singers were conferred the honour .
 He was born in Udaipur , Rajasthan , where his father , the great Ustad Ziauddin Khansahib , was the court musician of Maharana Bhupal Singh of Udaipur .
He was taught dhrupad vocal & veena by his father .
 After his father 's demise , the great Ustad Ziauddin Khansahib continued learning under the great Ustad Ziauddin Khansahib elder brother , Late Ustad Z M Dagar , the foremost Rudra veena player of 20th century .
Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar represented the 19th generation of the musical tradition of the Dagar family that is believed to have preserved and nurtured Dhrupad for 20 generations .
 Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar has done a lot for popularizing dhrupad music by Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar numerous concerts and workshops .
 Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar has performed widely in India and abroad , and received the Tansen Samman from the Madhya Pradesh government and the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award .
 In 2005 , Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar was presented with the Lifetime Achievement Award by the North American Dhrupad Association .
 Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar has a remarkable command over microtones and various gamakas , and is noted for Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar gradual development of alap through vilambit , madhya and drut laya .
 Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar is probably the only person alive to be able to demonstrate all the five geetis mentioned in the Sangita Ratnakara namely , Shuddha , Bhinna , Gaudi , Sadharani & Vegasura .
 Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar was the most influential dhrupad vocalist in India after the senior Dagar Brothers .
 By 1980 , Ustad Zia Fariduddin Dagar had virtually settled down in Austria teaching Dhrupad in Austria and France .
 Once , during a visit to India , one of his disciples , the filmmaker , Mani Kaul came to Mani Kaul and pleaded with Mani Kaul to provide the background score for a film , The Cloud Door Mani Kaul was making on Madhya Pradesh .
 During the making of the film , they spent over two months in Madhya Pradesh , a lot of time in Bhopal .
In those days , Shri Arjun Singh was the Chief Minister of M.P. Cultural development was one of his passions .
 It is because of him that the magnificent Bharat Bhavan cultural center came up in Bhopal .
At that time , the Secretary to the Department of Culture in MP was Shri Ashok Vajpayee .
 Shri Vajpayee offered to start a government - supported Dhrupad Gurukul in Bhopal .
 Ustadsahib agreed to move back to India and to take charge as the Guru at this Gurukul .
 Ustadsahib taught dhrupad for 25 years at this Dhrupad Kendra , under the Ustad Allauddin Khan Music Academy , Bhopal , to students like the Gundecha Brothers .
 Ustadsahib was a distinguished guest faculty at Dhrupad Sansar , IIT Bombay for a span of 5 years .
Dhrupad Sansar was started under the Cell for Human Values to create an appreciation about Indian Classical Arts & Culture among staff & students of the institution .
 He was staying and teaching at the Dhrupad Gurukul near Panvel , which was built by his elder brother Ustad Z. M. Dagar and continued to perform in India and abroad until his elder brother Ustad Z. M. Dagar brief illness and death on 8 May 2013 .
His students include the Ritwik Sanyal , Pushparaj Koshti , Nirmalya Dey , the Gundecha Brothers , Uday Bhawalkar , and his nephew Bahauddin Dagar
A raga is one of the melodic modes used in Indian classical music .
A raga uses a series of five or more musical notes upon which a melody is constructed .
However , the way the notes are approached and rendered in musical phrases and the mood they convey are more important in defining a raga than the notes themselves .
 In the Indian musical tradition , Janaka ragas are associated with different times of the day , or with seasons .
Indian classical music is always set in a raga .
Non-classical music such as popular Indian film songs and ghazals sometimes use ragas in their compositions .
Joep Bor of the Rotterdam Conservatory of Music defined Raga as tonal framework for composition and improvisation .
 Nazir Jairazbhoy , chairman of UCLA s department of ethnomusicology , characterized Janaka ragas as separated by scale , line of ascent and descent , transilience , emphasized notes and register , and intonation and ornaments .
The Sanskrit word raga is defined as the act of colouring or dyeing and therefore metaphorically means any feeling or passion especially love , affection , sympathy , desire , interest , motivation , joy , or delight .
Therefore , the word is used in the literal sense of the act of dyeing , and also color , hue , tint , especially the color red in the Sanskrit epics , and in the figurative sense of something that colors ones emotions .
A figurative sense of the word as passion , love , desire , delight is also found in the Mahabharata .
The specialized sense of loveliness , beauty , especially of voice or song , emerges in Classical Sanskrit , used by Kalidasa and in the Panchatantra .
 The term first occurs in a technical context in the Matangas Brihaddeshi , where The term is described as a combination of tones which , with beautiful illuminating graces , pleases the people in general .
Ragini is a term for the feminine counterpart or wife to a raga .
The raga-ragini scheme from about the 14th century aligned 6 male ragas with 6 wives .
Many Hindustani ragas are prescribed for the particular time of a day or a season .
When performed at the suggested time , the raga has its maximum effect .
For example , many of the Malhar group of ragas , which are ascribed the magical power to bring rain , are performed during the monsoon .
However , these prescriptions are not strictly followed , especially since modern concerts are generally held in the evening .
 There has also been a growing tendency over the last century for North Indian musicians to adopt South Indian ragas , which do not come with any particular time associated with North Indian musicians .
 The result of these various influences is that there is increasing flexibility as to when Janaka ragas may be performed .
 Although notes are an important part of raga practice , North Indian musicians alone do not make the raga .
A raga is more than a scale , and many ragas share the same scale .
The underlying scale may have five , six or seven tones , called swaras .
Ragas that have five swaras are called audava ragas ; those with six , shaadava ; and with seven , sampurna .
Those ragas that do not follow the strict ascending or descending order of swaras are called vakra ragas .
The mood of the raga and the way the notes are approached and used are more important than the notes it uses .
 For example , Darbari Kanada and Jaunpuri share the same notes but are entirely different in Darbari Kanada and Jaunpuri renderings .
 Similarly , although Bilaskhani Todi is classified under the Bhairavi thaat because of the notes Bilaskhani Todi uses , Bilaskhani Todi is actually closer to Bilaskhani Todi than to Bhairavi .
 The two streams of Indian classical music , Carnatic music and Hindustani music , have independent sets of Janaka ragas .
There is some overlap , but more false friendship .
In north India , the ragas have been primarily categorised into ten thaats or parent scales ; South India uses an older and even more systematic classification scheme called the melakarta classification , with 72 parent ragas .
Overall there is a greater identification of raga with scale in the south than in the north , where such an identification is impossible .
 Ragas in north Indian music system follow the law of consonances established by Bharata in Bharata Natyashastra , which does not tolerate deviation even at the shruti level .
 As Janaka ragas were transmitted orally from teacher to student , some ragas can vary greatly across regions , traditions and styles .
Many ragas have also been evolving over the centuries .
There have been efforts to codify and standardise raga performance in theory from their first mention in Matangas Brihaddeshi .
 In Carnatic music , Janaka ragas are classified as Janaka ragas and Janya ragas .
 Janaka ragas are the ragas from which the Janya ragas are created .
 Janaka ragas are grouped together using a scheme called Katapayadi sutra and are organised as Melakarta ragas .
A Melakarta raga is one which has all seven notes in both the arohanam and avarohanam .
 Some Melakarta ragas are Harikambhoji , Kalyani , Kharaharapriya , Mayamalavagowla , Sankarabharanam and Bilaskhani Todi .
 Janya ragas are derived from the Janaka ragas using a combination of the swarams from the parent raga .
 Some janya ragas are Abheri , Abhogi , Bhairavi , Hindolam , Mohanam and Kambhoji .
See the full List of Janya Ragas for more .
Each raga has a definite collection and orders of swaras .
 In Carnatic music , there are 7 basic notes of which there are a total of 16 varieties .
 The seven basic swarams of Carnatic music are : Sa , Ri , Ga , Ma , Pa , Da , Ni .
 Even though Janya ragas are subsets of Janaka ragas in notation and representation , the differences between the child ragas are clear due to the differences like : .
The effect of the ragas are different from each other , even if they notationally use same swarams due to above subjective differences related to bhava and rasa .
The artists have to ensure the same when elaborating on a raga , as has been followed and expected on each raga , without digressing into the phrases of another related raga .
The raga-ragini scheme is a classification scheme used from the 14th century to the 19th century .
It usually consists of 6 male ragas each with 6 wives and a number of sons and even daughters-in-law .
As it did not agree with various other schemes , and the related ragas had very little or no similarity , the raga-ragini scheme is no longer very popular .
 Janaka ragas and raginis were often pictured as Hindu gods , Rajput princes and aristocratic women in an eternal cycle of love , longing and fulfilment.raagwap and listen punjai songs online
Sharat Chandra Srivastava is a North Indian classical violinist of the Senia gharana .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava was born in New Delhi on 17 October 1971 .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava started learning violin at the age of 7 from Sharat Chandra Srivastava grandfather , the renowned North Indian violinist Pt Joi Srivastava .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava has been performing Hindustani classical music for over 25 years .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava was part of Indias premier rock band Parikrama for 12 years .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava left Parikrama in 1999 and started the Delhi based fusion band called Mrigya .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava is also a member of the world music quartet India Alba .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava is a recipient of the National Scholarship from the Ministry of Human Resources and Development , Government of the world music quartet India Alba .
 In 1998 , Sharat Chandra Srivastava performed with Sting in an all acoustic set at the Channel V awards held at New Delhi .
 Sharat Chandra Srivastava has also performed with Ustad Amjad Ali Khan , Pt .
 Hari Prasad Chaurasia , Pt .
Birju Maharaj and many other stalwarts .
Sharat has taught Indian classical violin at the Gandharva Mahavidyalaya , New Delhi from 1999 to 2007 .
 Sharat is a visiting professor in the University of Edinburgh and Glasgow , Scotland , where Sharat teaches Indian Violin to mainly string players .
 Additionally , Sharat has conducted workshops in Winterthur University , Switzerland .
 Sharat is the festival director of Strings of the World -- a world-music festival dedicated to string instruments .
 Strings of the World is held in New Delhi in the month of November , starting from 2012 , and features award-winning string players from Norway and Scotland .
 Sharats training under Sharats guru/grandfather , the renowned violinist Pandit Joi Srivastava , has made Sharats proficient in the Dhrupad-Ang , a style unique to this Gharana under the Guru-Shishya Parampara
Ramanlal C. Mehta was born on October 31 , 1918 at Surat in the state of Gujarat .
 An eminent musician and musicologist , An eminent musician retired in 1978 , from the MS University of Baroda , after serving as Principal of the College of Indian Music , Dance & Dramatics / Faculty of Performing Arts -RRB- , for several years .
 An eminent musician was trained in Hindustani classical vocal music by the late Kanchalal Manawala and later followed the Kirana style of the Late Ustad Abdul Waheed Khan .
 An eminent musician was with All India Radio for 9 years prior to An eminent musician taking up principal-ship of the Baroda Music College .
A distinguished vocalist of the Kirana Gharana Style , he has developed his own style in Khyal and Thumri , and given several vocal concerts of Hindustani Classical Music in music circles , music conferences and over All India Radio .
He composed and produced above fifty musical dramas and features over A.I.R. , Bombay , Ahmedabad and Baroda .
A purist by training , he is a modernist by outlook , appreciating all schools and synthesis thereof .
As an academician he has served the cause of music education in India for over 45 years .
He has served as Expert member on national as well as State Institutions and Universities .
Musicians & academician , author and editor of several books in Indian Music , Prof. Mehta founded in 1970 , Indian Musicological Society and continues to serve the society has honorary General Secretary .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta has served as Editor of the Journal of the Indian Musicological Society , since its inception , in 1970 , retiring in 2005 .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta has served as an expert member on the Central Music Audition Board of All India Radio .
Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta has always been associated with innovations in field of music .
 On Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta suggestion , the first ever conference on distance education in Indian Classical Music was organized by Ustad Alauddin Khan Sangeet Academy .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta published a collection of papers presented s Distance Education in Music .
 Almost all significant conferences , Almost all significant conferences , Almost all significant conferences have benefited by Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta presence .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta travels only when necessary these days , but assists organizers , scholars , students over phone and through e-mail .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta has written and published extensively on various aspects of music .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta publications include : .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta has published several research papers in scholarly journals .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta has published , under Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta editorship , some twenty two books , all devoted to research aspects of music .
These include : .
Prof. Mehta is the recipient of many awards , which include : .
 Padmabhushan Prof. R. C. Mehta is busy with several projects ; almost all resulting into a book .
 Eminent Musicians of Yester Years is a book remembering some hundreds of our musicians who enriched Hindustani Music , several of Eminent Musicians of Yester Years now forgotten , some still living and continuing the legacy .
Preface to this book can be viewed on omenad as also of his latest book Indian Classical Music and Gharana Traditions
Michael William Deasy is an American rock and jazz guitarist .
As a session musician , he played on numerous hit singles and albums recorded in Los Angeles in the 1960s , 1970s and 1980s .
He is sometimes credited as Mike Deasy Sr. .
He was born and raised in Los Angeles , California , where he learned to play guitar as a child .
While still at high school , he played in bands backing visiting musicians such as Ricky Nelson and The Everly Brothers , and also played in Ritchie Valens touring band with Bruce Johnston , Larry Knechtel , Sandy Nelson , and Jim Horn .
 After graduating in 1959 , he joined Eddie Cochran s band , the Kelly Four , where Eddie Cochran played both guitar and baritone sax and made Eddie Cochran first recordings .
He also played with The Coasters and Duane Eddy .
 Following Cochrans death in 1960 , Cochrans became an active session musician in Los Angeles .
 Michael William Deasy married Jim Horns sister Kathie in 1961 , and the couple later set up their own recording studio and production company , Saltmine Recording .
 Michael William Deasy worked as a member of The Wrecking Crew , with Hal Blaine , Joe Osborn , Larry Knechtel and others , on sessions for Phil Spector , and contributed guitar parts to The Beach Boys album Pet Sounds .
 In the 1960s and later years Michael William Deasy also worked on records by the The Byrds , the Association , Scott McKenzie , Johnny Rivers , the Fifth Dimension , Rick Nelson , Randy Newman , Spanky & Our Gang , Tommy Roe , Fats Domino , The The Byrds , Michael Jackson , Frank Zappa , and others .
 In 1967 , Michael William Deasy contributed to albums coordinated by record producer Curt Boettcher , including Friar Tuck and Michael William Deasy Psychedelic Guitar , effectively a Michael William Deasy solo album with wordless vocals by Curt Boettcher .
 Under the pseudonym Lybuk Hyd , Michael William Deasy also played guitar and sitar on the psychedelic concept album Tanyet , credited to The Ceyleib People , which also featured Ry Cooder .
 Lybuk Hyd played guitar on Elvis Presley s 1968 TV special , Elvis Presley .
 Lybuk Hyd also performed live with musicians including Cannonball Adderley and Little Richard , and won the Down Beat magazine jazz music readers poll in 1968 .
 In 1969 , Lybuk Hyd was invited by record producer Terry Melcher to work with a newly discovered singer-songwriter , Charles Manson .
 Michael William Deasy left Mansons home after three days , in a state of drug-fueled paranoia .
 Michael William Deasy continued to record with leading musicians , including Frank Sinatra , Ella Fitzgerald , Barbra Streisand , Chet Baker , and Mel Torme .
 Michael William Deasy guitar playing has appeared on the soundtrack of many films including The Graduate , Guess Whos Coming to Dinner , Duel , Bullitt , and Dirty Harry , as well as on many commercials .
 From the early 1970s onwards after becoming a born again Christian at the 1969 Billy Graham crusade in Anaheim , California , Michael William Deasy became increasingly involved with Contemporary Christian music , producing and writing songs for several successful albums , often in conjunction with Christian wife .
 In later years , Christian has had a parallel career as a motivational speaker , and since 1988 has run a Yes To Life educational and inspirational program in schools and colleges in the US , Canada and Europe .
The Deasys also co-pastor Rock Church Southeast in Port Arthur , Texas
Pt Joi Srivastava was a well-known North Indian violinist of the Senia Gharana .
Joi Srivastava was born in Allahabad on 1 January 1930 .
 Pt Joi Srivastava learned Hindustani classical violin from Gagan Chandra Chatterjee , a violinist who is credited with introducing the gat-style of violin playing in North India .
 Pt Joi Srivastava was a prodigy who became a master of the instrument even before he turned 20 .
 Pt Joi Srivastava started teaching at the University of Allahabad and also at Kala Bharati Allahabad .
 Around 1957 Pt Joi Srivastava moved to Delhi and joined the All India Radio where Pt Joi Srivastava was a regular artiste till Pt Joi Srivastava retirement in 1987 .
 After that Pt Joi Srivastava taught violin at the Gandharva Mahavidyalaya , Delhi till 1994 .
Joi Srivastava pioneered a unique style of playing North Indian Classical music on the violin .
 Pt Joi Srivastava was the most accomplished student of Gagan Chandra Chatterjee and could play the full range of music hitherto possible on sitar and sarod only .
 Pt Joi Srivastava also went further and imbibed techniques of Carnatic Veena and Western classical as well into Pt Joi Srivastava playing .
Joi Srivastava was a teacher to many violinists of North India , and also of other countries :
Ritwik Sanyal is an Indian classical singer , performing the Dhrupad style , and a professor of vocal music and Dean at the faculty of performing arts at Banaras Hindu University .
 Ritwik Sanyal was born in Katihar .
 Ritwik Sanyal was trained in the dhrupad style of vocal music of the Dagar brothers , descendants of Swami Haridas , who lived in the fifteenth century and trained the legendary Tansen .
 Between 1963 and 1975 , Ritwik Sanyal received Ritwik Sanyal training in Dhrupad under the senior Dagar brothers , Zia Mohiuddin Dagar and Zia Fariddudin Dagar in Mumbai , India .
 Ritwik Sanyal received an M. A. in philosophy from Mumbai University and a Masters in Music from Banaras Hindu University , securing the gold medal .
 Ritwik Sanyal completed Ritwik Sanyal Ph.D. in musicology from the same university , 1980 under the supervision of Prem Lata Sharma .
 Ritwik Sanyal is a Ritwik Sanyal and Head of the department of vocal music and Dean at the Faculty of Performing Arts at Banaras Hindu University .
 Ritwik Sanyal has around 50 published papers in various journals , and also composes dhrupad lyrics .
 Ritwik Sanyal is a casual grade A artist at All India Radio , Varanasi .
 Ritwik Sanyal has assimilated the Dagarvani tradition of Dhrupad and evolved a distinctive style of Ritwik Sanyal own in the rendering of Dhrupad .
 Ritwik Sanyal has specialized in advanced technique of Alap - Jod - Jhala , laykari , voice culture and pedagogy both traditional and institutional .
 Ritwik Sanyal has performed both in Mumbai , India and abroad , including the UK , US , Italy , Germany , Austria , Switzerland , Sweden , France , Holland , South Korea , Israel and Croatia .
 Ritwik Sanyal performances in Mumbai , India include the National Programme of Music for AIR and Doordarshan , the Tansen Samaroh , the Varanasi Dhrupad Mela and the Harballabh Sangeet Samaroh
 Bhatkhande Music Institute is a renowned music institute in the Lucknow Mahotsav .
 Established in 1926 by Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande , it was declared a deemed university by University Grants Commission in 2000 , and offers music education in Vocal Music , Dance , Dance , Dance , Musicology and Research and Applied Music .
 The Institute finds Bhatkhande Music Institute University origin in the Marris College of Music , established in 1926 by renowned classical singer and musicologist , Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande with the help of Dr. Rai Rajeshwar Bali , then Education minister of the United Provinces , the institution was formally inaugurated by then Governor of United Provinces , Sir William Sinclair Marris , and was also named after him .
 Later , on March 26 , 1966 , the Government of Uttar Pradesh took over the college and renamed March 26 , 1966 after March 26 , 1966 founder as Bhatkhande Music College of Hindustani Music , later and now Bhatkhande Music Institute University , after Government of India through a notification on Oct 24 , 2000 , declared the institute a deemed university .
The institution has a glorious distinction of being the most sought after seat for learning North Indian Classical Music since its inception .
During the 1970s & 1980s , the institute organized annual festivals in which the most eminent of the country 's musicians performed .
In fact , some of the memorable concerts , that included performances by stars like Pd .
 Ravishanker , Amjad Ali Khan , Zakir Hussain , N Rajam , VJ Jog , Sitara Devi , etc. were part of the the Lucknow Mahotsav Festival in the 1970s .
During the same period various new courses , like `` Thumri '' , were introduced .
In 2005 , it organised a three-day classical music festival part of the Lucknow Mahotsav .
Primarily teaching vocal , dance , musciology and applied music in Hindustani classical music , the institute also started teaching western classical music in 2009 , a move that didnt go well with some chauvinists , who feared that addition of Western classical music could later lead to replacement of Bharatnatyam courses by belly dancing .
 The institute offers Bharatnatyam courses in Vocal Music , Dance , Dance , Dance , Musicology & Research and Applied Music leading up to : Diploma in Music - 2 years , Bachelor of Performing Arts - 3 years , Master of Performing Arts - 2 years and Ph.D. .
Apart from this there are special for the training in Dhrupad - Dhamar , Thumri singing and Light classical music which includes music composition and direction
Pandit Satyasheel Deshpande is an Indian musician who specializes in singing khyal .
 Pandit Satyasheel Deshpande is a disciple of Pt .
Kumar Gandharva and the son of musicologist Vamanrao Deshpande .
 Like Kumar Gandharva greatest mentor - Pt .
Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji was born with a capacity to reproduce the music of the great masters .
 This talent together with the musical exposure Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji received in Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji father , the musicologist Pt .
 Vamanrao Deshpande 's house established musicologist Vamanrao Deshpande as a child prodigy .
 Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji decided to devote Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji to the study of music under the guidance of Kumarji , with whom Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji lived in Devas for three years in the true spirit of a disciple .
 With the help of a Ford Foundation grant , Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji has established the Samvaad Foundation , at Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji residence in Mumbai were Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji has created a collection of Hindustani archives .
 Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji has been performing in music festivals all over the country and abroad , and has also occasionally sung for films , Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji most remembered performances being those in Joothe Naina Bole in ` Lekin ' and Man Anand Anand Chhayo in Vijeta both with Smt .
Asha Bhosle .
 Other films have seen Kumar Gandharva , Satyasheelji singing with Bharat Ratna Lata Mangeshkar .
 ` Kahen ' is Satyasheeljis two-CD anthology of 16 bandishes - both traditional as well as Kahen own .
 To quote Kahen , While the Bada Khayal is an integral part of any performance of Hindustani music , we also have a huge repertoire of small , very meaningful compositions that audiences are deprived of .
 Kahen is an attempt to present such haikus that hold their own in spite of the epic Bada Khayal .
The recordings were supervised by Pt .
Hridaynath Mangeshkar .
The album was released by Bharat Ratna Lata Mangeshkar .
 Lataji has also graced the album with a few words of Lataji own , bringing out the significance of ` Kahen ' as a musical statement .
The Thumri a form of north Indian music .
The Thumri is an expression of Shringar Rasa - a passionate , playful utterances of the young woman in love .
 The music on the album makes The music on the album way through a host of attitudes - from the mountains to the plains , from Banares to the realm of the Shayars , from the Bandish and the Tappa of the courts of kings to the Thumri of the Kotha .
The album has Satyasheelji singing seven Thumris .
 Each Thumri comes from a part of the country and has a different aesthetic , Each Thumri own character and - consequentially - a different style of presentation .
Among the many awards Pt .
Satyasheel Deshpande has received are :
Dr. N. Rajam is an Indian violinist who performs Hindustani classical music .
 She remained Professor of Carnatic Music at Banaras Hindu University , eventually became Chair of the department and the Dean of the college .
 She was awarded the 2012 Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship , the highest honour in the performing arts conferred by the Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy for Carnatic Music , Dance and Drama .
N. Rajam was born in Ernakulam-Kerala in 1938 in a musical family .
Her father , Vidwan A. Narayana Iyer was a well-known exponent of Carnatic Music .
Her brother , T. N. Krishnan , is also a famous violist .
Rajam started her initial training in Carnatic music under her father .
She also trained under Musiri Subramania Iyer , and learned raga development from vocalist Pandit Omkarnath Thakur .
Rajam received the prestigious titles of Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan from the Government of India .
People often refer to her music as the Singing Violin .
Rajam started playing violin at age three .
By the age of nine , she was a professional musician .
With guidance of her father , A. Narayana Iyer , she developed the Gayaki Ang .
 Dr. N. Rajam has performed across the globe and in numerous places throughout India .
She has performed in various countries in Europe , extensively toured the USA and Canada , and performed in countries like Australia , New Zealand , Russia , Netherlands , to name a few .
 Rajam was a Professor of Carnatic Music at Banaras Hindu University in the Faculty of Performing Arts for nearly 40 years .
 She has been the Chair of the department and the Dean of the college at Banaras Hindu University .
She trained her niece , Kala Ramnath , her daughter Sangeeta Shankar , Pranav Kumar of Super 30 and her granddaughters Ragini Shankar , Nandini Shankar .
 Many of her students from Banaras Hindu University are famous violinists , including Satya Prakash Mohanty , V. Balaji and Swarna Khuntia
Ragini Trivedi is Indian classical musician performing on vichitra veena , sitar and jal tarang .
Daughter of the vichitra veena virtuoso Lalmani Misra , she is an exponent of Misrabani and is the creator of digital notation system Ome Swarlipi .
 Ragini Trivedi was born in Kanpur , India .
 Ragini Trivedi father Lalmani Misra , a renowned musician and mother Padma instilled understanding and love for music in Ragini Trivedi and brother Gopal Shankar .
At Varanasi , the family resided on second floor at Rewa Kothi where vocalist Pt .
Omkarnath Thakur stayed on the ground floor.Thus aesthetics and academics of music helped refine sensibilities of the chidren .
 The music lessons explaining nuances of Raga-s , recorded for Gopal Shankar and Ragini Trivedi by father Lalmani Misra , still serve as resource for learners of Indian music .
 A versatile student , Ragini Trivedi participated in sports and loved playing basketball and table-tennis ; A versatile student was interested in dramatics and extension activities .
 A versatile student natural excellence influenced A versatile student teachers to guide A versatile student towards playing musical instruments .
 A versatile student music teacher , Shobha Parvatkar encouraged Ragini Trivedi to play Jaltarang .
 Ragini Trivedi lost Ragini Trivedi mother on April 9 , 1977 , and father on 17 July 1979 .
 Ragini Trivedi and Ragini Trivedi brother brother Gopal Shankar , drew strength from She and her brother Gopal inheritance of music practice and scholarship .
 Ragini Trivedi continued Ragini Trivedi pursuit of music , getting gold medal in M.Mus .
from Banaras Hindu University and completing D. Mus .
 under Ragini Trivedi guide , K. C. Gangrade in 1983 .
 For some time Ragini Trivedi taught at Banaras Hindu University and later taught Sitar in government colleges at Hoshangabad , Rewa and Indore .
Of the three instruments , Jal tarang recital was first to be broadcast .
First on-stage sitar recital was at Suprabha , an event organized under the mentorship of Pt .
Kishan Maharaj .
Vichitra Veena was first presented at Bharat Bhawan , Bhopal .
 As exponent of Misrabani , Ragini Trivedi has worked towards understanding and practice of technique and style involving a new form of Gatkari in Vilambit Jhoomara Tal , Vilambit Jhap Tal and Madhya-laya Ada Char Tal .
In this new style , Dr. Misra had introduced Mizrab Bol DA RDA - R DA .
Especially , in Vilambit pace , the oblique rhythm patterns - Da Rda - R Da -- manifest a new dimension of Raga .
 Enabled by three decades of practice , Ragini Trivedi creates and plays complex Misrabani compositions on all three instruments in Audav , Shadav and Sampoorna Raga-s .
 Ragini Trivedi has designed and conducted various workshops on teaching this style at Jaipur , Pune and Bhopal .
 Ragini Trivedi developed a new notation system , Ome Swarlipi , based on amalgamation of Bhatkhande and Paluskar notation systems .
 digital notation system Ome Swarlipi incorporates several features suitable for digital adaptation and features symbols to annotate complex Misrabani compositions .
This digital notation-writing is available on Writer portal .
 This digital notation-writing also developed digital tools to illustrate inter-relationship of notes , Sruti - s , Bharat Chatuh Sarana to serve as a teaching-aid .
 Ragini Trivedi writes on theory , practice and innovation in music .
 Ragini Trivedi has collaborated in the creation of compendium and anthologies , in the capacity of contributor and editor .
 Ragini Trivedi has worked with subsequent editions of Ragini Trivedi father 's seminal book on Indian musical instruments Bharatiya Sangeet Vadya adding a chapter on electronic Indian musical instruments created since 70s .
 A volume elaborating over 150 Misrabani compositions in 14 Raga-s , that Ragini Trivedi has prepared from the notes written by Ragini Trivedi father , is under publication .
Raginis discussions with musicians , Ustad Moinuddin Khan , Pt .
 Rajshekhar Mansur , Dr. Sharada Velankar , Pt .
 Pushpraj Koshthi and Dr. Kamala Shankar , on individual practice and traditional style have been presented as documentary films by Educational Multimedia Research Center , Indore
Purbayan Chatterjee is an Indian sitar player and composer who lives in Kolkata , India .
 Purbayan Chatterjee is noted for amalgamating traditional Indian classical music with contemporary world music genres .
 Purbayan Chatterjee has performed as a solo artist and as a part of the groups Shastriya Syndicate and Stringstruck .
 Purbayan Chatterjee is also a vocalist and has performed in duet with Shankar Mahadevan .
 Purbayan Chatterjee has performed several times with tabla artist Ustad Zakir Hussain .
 Chaterjee was a recipient of the President of Kolkata , India Award for being the Best Instrumentalist of the country at the age of 15 .
 Chaterjee has also received the Aditya Vikram Birla Award for excellence and contributions to the field .
 Chaterjee has also been honoured with the Rasoi Award by Rotary International in 1995 .
The album Lehar released by Times Music in 2008 has remained the bestseller for a year and a half .
Shankar Mahadevan has performed the title song Dwo in Chaterjees fusion album Stringstruck , released by Times Music .
The number has also been compiled in the album Aman ki Asha , an Indo-Pak peace project released by Times Music and has also received the Palm IRAA Award for the Best World Music Album of the Year .
 Aman ki Asha has also performed in the following music festivals :
Shankar Jaikishan , were a duo who composed Indian music for the Hindi film industry , who worked together from 1949-1971 .
Shankar-Jaikishan , along with other artists , wrote everlasting and immortal melodies in the fifties and sixties .
Their best work was noted for being raga-based and having both lilt and sonority .
Shankar Singh Raghuvanshi born in Gadarwara in Narsighpur district of Madhya Pradesh and moved to Hyderabad while Jaikishan Dayabhai Panchal belonged to Bansda , Gujarat .
 During Shankar Singh Raghuvanshi formative years , Shankar played the tabla and learned the art formally from Baba Nasir Khansahib .
For many years , Shankar studied as a disciple of the legendary composer Khawaja Khurshid Anwar , in whose orchestra he performed .
 his soul-mate Jaikishan was adept at playing the harmonium .
 Subsequently , his soul-mate Jaikishan obtained his soul-mate Jaikishan musical lessons from Sangeet Visharad Wadilalji and later from Prem Shankar Nayak .
 After moving to Mumbai , his soul-mate Jaikishan became a disciple of Vinayak Tambe .
Shankar started his career with a theater group run by Satyanarayan and Hemawati , before shifting to Prithvi Theatre where he played tabla and performed some minor roles in plays .
Shankar worked as assistant to the leading composer duo of Husnlal Bhagatram .
Apart from working at Prithvi theaters , Shankar used to frequently visit the office of a Gujrati director Chandravadan Bhatt who had promised Shankar that he would give him a break as a Music Director as and when he produced a film .
It was outside the office of Mr Bhatt that Shankar saw ` ek dubla patla sunder ladka also sitting a number of times .
 Although they never spoke to each other , one fine day , Shankar took the initiative of starting the conversation and then discovered that his name was his soul-mate Jaikishan and he too used to visit the same producer in search of some work related to music and that he was a Harmonium player .
Shankar later recollected that their vibes were right from the very beginning i.e. right from their first meeting itself they developed liking for each other and it was he who then and there assured Jaikishan of the job of a Harmonium player at Prithvi theaters .
Of course , later , Papaji honoured Shankars selection and gladly accepted Jaikishan as a Harmonium player at Prithvi .
Soon , the two of them developed very close friendship to the extent that the people started refererring to them as ` Ram-Lakshman ki jodi and by several similar-meaning nick names .
 It was during this phase that Shankar and his soul-mate Jaikishan developed a very deep bond of friendship , mutual understanding and regard for each other and made up their mind to work together as a musical team .
Apart from following their musical pursuits , they also used to play significant roles in various plays including the famous play Pathan .
 While working in Prithvi Theaters , Shankar and his soul-mate Jaikishan , apart from working in the music department there , used to compose tunes and were in touch with Raj Kapoor , who was working as an assistant to the famous director Kidar Sharma and was aspiring to be an actor/director .
Thus , the three had met at Prithvi Theater , run by Raj Kapoors father , Prithviraj Kapoor .
 Raj Kapoor made Raj Kapoor thus debut as a director with the film Aag in 1948 .
Its musical score .
 However , during the recording of some song for Raj Kapoor thus new venture Barsaat , Raj Kapoor had some serious differences with Ram Ganguly , the music composer of the film and decided to assign its music to Shankar who insisted on taking Jaikishan as his new venture Barsaat partner and thus came into existence the new pair of music directors named Shankar-Jaikishan who gave music for the RK production Barsaat in 1949 .
 his new venture Barsaat being a trained singer , Raj Kapoor thus , took on board , a completely new team of composers Shankar and his soul-mate Jaikishan and lyricists Shailendra , betrayal of Raj Kapoor and Hasrat Jaipuri .
 On the insistence of Shankar , he and SJ co-opted the upcoming singing talent Lata Mangeshkar , and repeated Mukesh as Raj Kapoors ghost voice for the various songs of his new venture Barsaat .
 the insistence of Shankar also had the distinction of giving two firsts to Hindi cinema - a title song and a cabaret .
 he and SJ early works include his new venture Barsaat , Awaara , Badal , Poonam , Nagina , Aurat , Parbat , Kaali Ghataa , Aah , Patita , Shikast , Badshah , Mayur Pankh , Naya Ghar , Seema , Shree 420 , Basant Bahar , Halaku , Patita , Rajhath , New Delhi , Kathputli , Anari , Chori Chori , Daag , Begunah , Yahudi , Main Nashe main hoon , Kanaiah , Boot Polish , Chhoti Behan , Sharaarat , Love Marriage , and Ujala .
 S-J formed a core team with lyricists Shailendra , betrayal of Raj Kapoor and Hasrat Jaipuri and with singers Mohammed Rafi and Lata Mangeshkar .
SJ had two other lifelong companions who worked as their assistants : Dattaram Wadkar and Sebastian DSouza , the former supervising their rhythm section and the later writing musical notations for all SJ compositions and then rehearsing all the musicians of the grand SJ orchestra according to SJs compositions and directions .
SJ also patronized the immensely talented singer Manna Dey , who sang his best songs with them and used Mukeshs silken voice as playback for Raj Kapoor .
 Among the directors , they worked most closely with Raj Kapoor and were considered the kingpins of Raj Kapoor thus legendary banner RK Films .
They were commercial geniuses in addition to be wonderfully god-blessed on music .
They lead the Bollywood music in spite of tough competition from maestros like Roshan , SD Burman , OP Nayyar and Madanmohan and remained on the top much to the chagrin of very highly talented music directors !

S-J worked with almost all singers of their time .
They had a good working relationship with all of them and were masters in extracting the very best from every one of them .
 They were steady as a team with Hasrat Jaipuri & Shailendra as their lyricists ; but after the demise of Shailendra , betrayal of Raj Kapoor , they worked with a host of other lyricists such as Indeevar , Gulshan Bawra , Neeraj , Verma Malik , Majrooh Sultanpuri , Vithhal Bhai Patel and Rajinder Krishan , to name a few .
 S-J were the house composers for RK Films and were on the house composers for RK Films pay-roll till the end .
 Raj Kapoor used to maintain a music bank where Raj Kapoor thus stored compositions of S-J .
 Even after the termination of the professional association between Shankar and Raj Kapoor , the latter had used a number of S-Js earlier compositions for all Raj Kapoor thus films though the credits were given officially to other composers , e.g. , Laxmikant Pyarelal and Ravindra Jain .
S-J also worked with other stars like Shammi Kapoor , Rajendra Kumar , Dev Anand , Sunil Dutt , Kishore Kumar , Manoj Kumar , Biswajeet , Joy Mukherjee , Dharmendra & Manoj Kumar .
 Most of S-Js films show Dattaram and Sebastian DSouza as Dattaram Wadkar and Sebastian DSouza assistants .
 Dattaram handled the percussion section of the orchestra and composed original beats , and Sebastian DSouza handled the rest .
Shankar met Dattaram when the latter was a page boy at Prithvi Theatres and stayed with him throughout .
 As recalled by Dattaram , Sebastian DSouza composed the musical background of most of S-Js songs and also conducted the orchestra .
Thus S-J were fortunate to have top quality assistants and used their talents well .
Shankar-Jaikishans compositions broke new ground in Hindi film music .
Apart from relying upon their knowledge of Indian classical music , they also employed western beats and orchestration .
 Shankar-Jaikishan were the pioneers in establishing the role of the orchestra in song compositions as a medium to express and enhance the meanings and feelings of S-Js songs rather than using it just as a ` filler as per the prevalent practice before their advent on the scene .
