Sipra Bose was a noted singer in the Hindustani classical music tradition from Kolkata , India .
 Sipra Bose is noted for Sipra Bose rendering of light classical songs in Bengali .
 Sipra Bose started Sipra Bose musical training under Chinmoy Lahiri , and was introduced into the Thumri and Ghazal of the Lucknow gharana under Begum Akhtar .
 Sipra Bose also worked with Naina Devi of the Benaras gharana and Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 Sipra Bose ghazal renditions , especially Sipra Bose enunciation of Urdu , has been noted by critics .
 Sipra Bose died from a heart attack in Kolkata on April 22 , 2008 .
 Sipra Bose husband is Gobindo Bose , a noted Tabla player .
 Her ghazal renditions have two sons and one daughter
The Jaipur-Atrauli gharana is a Khayal - based stylized singing family-hood , founded by Utd .
Alladiya Khan in the late 19th century .
 Evolved from Dhrupad singing , the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana acquired Dhrupad singing name and status as a Gharana in the early half of the 20th century as a result of the growing popularity of stalwarts of this Gharana , like Smt .
Kesarbai Kerkar , Smt .
Mogubai Kurdikar and Pt .
Mallikarjun Mansur .
The founder of this gharana , Utd .
 Alladiya Khan initially developed the unique Gayaki of this Gharana following the loss of Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan voice which prompted Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan to develop an adjusted singing style to accommodate Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan ailment .
Signature and specialty Raags of this Gharana include Sampoorna Malkauns , Basanti Kedar , Basant Bahar , Bihagda , Kaushi Kanada , and Nat Kamod among others .
 Four major Gharanas are recognized in Hindustani Classical Khayal music : Gwalior , Agra , Kirana and Jaipur-Atrauli .
Others are less pervasive , but no less enchanting , such as Indore , Rampur , Mewati , Patiala , and Bhendi-Bazar .
 The Jaipur-Atrauli gharana acquired its name and status as a Gharana from the time of Alladiya Khan in the early half of the 20th century .
 This Gharana mainly evolved from Dagar-bani of Dhrupad , however Dagar-bani of Dhrupad also absorbed finer essence of Gauhar-bani and Khandar-bani .
 The ancestral origin of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana was said to be from Nath Vishwambhar , noted for setting to the Raags the tunes of the shlokas in Nath Vishwambhar puja .
The great musician composer Swami Haridas was also born in this family and the great Tansen and Baiju were his pupils .
 Natthu Khan and Mantol Khan were two stalwarts of this Gharana , Four to five generations down the line .
 Natthu Khan and Mantol Khan imbibed the practices of both Hindu and Muslim traditions .
 Alladiya Khan , for instance , wore the Janva all Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan life , dressed like a Maharashtrian , complete with the Kolhapuri turban , yet did not skip a day of Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan Namaaz .
 Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan compositions praise Mahadev and Allah with equal fervor .
 Many of the the Raags and His compositions sung in the Jaipur Gayaki gharana come from the tradition of Haveli Sangeet , like the compositions Deva Deva Satsang in Raag Savani Kalyan , Aadidata Ant in Raag Malkauns , Anahat Aadi Naad in Raag Savani Nat , Devta Aadi Sab in Raag Kukubh Bilawal , Devi Durge in Raag Sukhiya Bilawal , and a host of others in which Hindu devotional themes were used by Utd .
Alladiya Khan .
 Scholars say the hyphenated moniker of this Gharana recognizes that Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana musicians originally came from Atrauli near Aligarh and migrated to the court of the Maharaja of Jaipur Gayaki , Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana musicians principal patron .
 Others say Others came to the Jaipur Maharajas court and then dispersed to various other courts in the area , like Jodhpur , Uniyara , Bundi , Atrauli etc. .
After establishing himself in the north , Utd .
 Alladiya Khan migrated to the court of Shahu Maharaj in Kolhapuri and became Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan court musician .
Utd .
 Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan was initiated into music by Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan father , Khwaja Ahmad Khan and Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan uncle , Jehangir Khan in both the Dhrupad and the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana styles .
 Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan also had the privilege of being guided by two famous composers of the time , Ramzan Khan Rangeele and Mehboob Khan Darasapiya .
 The young Alladiya Khan was closely associated with Wazir Khan binkar at Indore and Bombay .
 The Meend of Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan gayaki can be traced to this influence .
Today , only the Khayal tradition remains .
 The Meend of his gayaki was known to have been greatly influenced by Utd .
Mubarak Khans style that blended the Swar and Taal aspects of khayal singing for the first time .
 Most gharanas apply notes in simple succession in aalap and taan , whereas in the Jaipur Gayaki gayaki , notes are applied in an oblique manner with filigree involving immediately neighboring notes .
Instead of the flat taan , gamak makes the taan spiral into seemingly never-ending cycles .
Meend in aalap and gamak in taan are the hallmark of this gayaki .
 To his immense credit , the great exponent of Kirana gharana , Bhimsen Joshi is one of the very few singers outside the Jaipur Gayaki gharana , who has adopted the gamak taan to an extent , complete with long , uninterrupted patterns clearly showing an amazing breath capacity much like the old masters of Jaipur Gayaki gharana , but he has not quite achieved the intricacy and grace of gamak that is the signature of Jaipur Gayaki .
Sharp edged harkats and murkis are relatively uncommon .
Not only are the notes sung in rhythm with the taal but progress between the matras is in fractions of quarters and one-eighths .
While being mindful of so many factors , musicians of this gharana still have a graceful way of arriving at the Sam without having matras to spare !
This is particularly evident in the way bol-alaap or bol-taan is sung , where meticulous attention is given to the short and long vowels in the words of the bandish that are being pronounced , and the strict discipline of avoiding unnatural breaks in the words and in the meaning of the lyrics .
No other gharana has paid so much attention to the esthetics and laykaari in singing bol-alaaps and bol-taans .
 A highlight of Jaipur Gayaki gayaki is the mastery over Jod Raags .
Singers from other Gharanas tend to sing one Raag in Aaroh and the other in Avaroh .
Some others sing one Raag in the lower half of the octave and then switch to the other Raag in the upper half .
 Alternatively , Some others may sing alternate phrases of the two component Raags .
 In Jaipur Gayaki , there is such perfect fusion of the two raags that Jaipur Gayaki sounds like a homogeneous Raag in Jaipur Gayaki own right , giving the feel of both component raags , not as a heterogeneous mixture cobbled together .
The listener hears an amalgam of both raags without losing their distinctive identity .
 Alladiya Khan introduced many lesser-known or obscure raags in Ghulam Ahmad Alladiya Khan repertoire like Raag Basanti Kedar , Raag Jait Kalyan , Raag Kafi Kanada , Raisa Kanada , Raag Basanti Kanada , Raag Savani Nat , Raag Savani Kalyan , Raag Bhoop Nat , Raag Nat Kamod , Raag Bihari , Raag Khat , Raag Khokar , Raag Sampoorna Malkauns , and many others .
Trying to imbibe all these characteristics without losing the aesthetics is a tall order for any musician .
 Hence this Gayaki is called a thinking listeners or connoisseurs Jaipur Gayaki .
 However , Jaipur Gayaki gives equal pleasure to the uninitiated listener who may not understand the technical intricacies , but responds to the layakari and the melodic content of the presentation .
The Gharana purity of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana has been an avid discussion topic among connoisseurs and scholars alike , as a result of Utd .
Alladiya Khan purposefully teaching students to approach the same musical content differently , causing internal quarrels within the Gharana itself , as well .
For instance , the approach to certain Raags conflict between branches of the Gharana , as certain elements of a Raag are neglected , emphasized , de-emphasized or treated differently .
 As a result , Scholars feel the purity of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana can be traced from Utd .
 Alladiya Khan to a Raag brother Utd .
 Haider Ali Khan , to Haider Ali Khan sons Utd .
Manji Khan and Utd .
 Bhurji Khan and Bhurji Khan grandson Ut Azizuddin Khan , as well as Utd .
Gulubhai Jasdanwalla , the only purist outside of the Utd .
Alladiya Khan family
 Riwaayat earlier Riwaayat is a classical music event which sticks to the classical form of rendition .
The group belongs to Maihar gharana .
The event features fine artistes who still practice the traditional way of rendering music .
Riwaayat meaning Tradition in Urdu , started in 2010 in Hyderabad at Hyderabad Central University , S.N.School of Performing Arts & Communication .
 The event was held on the 9 and 10 December 2011 at Vidyaranya High School , Hyderabad
Emily Robison is an American songwriter , singer , multi-instrumentalist , and a founding member of the female country band the Dixie Chicks .
 Emily Robison plays banjo , dobro , guitar , bass , mandolin , accordion , and sitar .
 Initially in Emily Robison career with the Dixie Chicks , Emily Robison limited Emily Robison singing to harmony with backing vocals , but within Emily Robison role in the Court Yard Hounds , Emily Robison has taken on the role of lead vocalist .
Emily Erwin was born in Pittsfield , Massachusetts .
 Parents Paul Erwin and Barbara Trask moved the family to the northern suburban town of Addison , Texas on the edge of Dallas , where Barbara Trask was raised with Barbara Trask two older sisters , Julia and Martha .
 Barbara Trask parents were both educators and nurtured the growing interest that both Emily Erwin and Martha shared , and together both sisters became proficient on several instruments while in elementary school .
 Emily Erwin began playing the violin at age seven , and the banjo at age ten , afterward learning all the string instruments Emily Erwin could find .
 Years later , her sister Martie joked that Emily Erwin was better than Emily Erwin at the fiddle , and because Emily Erwin wanted to keep the fiddle as Emily Erwin instrument , her sister Martie forced Emily Erwin to learn something else .
 Emily Erwin responded by mastering the five string banjo , by reading books to teach Emily Erwin the chord progressions .
From 1984-1989 , Jane Frost , , remembers watching the sisters mature , teaming up with schoolmates Troy and Sharon Gilchrist .
 The foursome were touring in a teenage bluegrass group The foursome named the Blue Night Express , in part because of the amount of travelling The foursome had to do to reach far away festivals , frequently with a parent or friend of the family towing The foursome back home long after dark at night .
 The foursome thought it was worth the sacrifices to meet The foursome musical heroes and experienced the friendly camaraderie and tricks of the trade on instruments from others .
The sisters were said to have an almost obsessive interest in busking at small venues and attending bluegrass festivals .
 After her sister Martie graduated from secondary school at Greenhill School with Emily Erwin still completing Emily Erwin studies , both remained active in the bluegrass scene .
 In 1989 , after years of attending bluegrass festivals and busking where they could , Emily Erwin joined Emily Erwin sister her sister Martie , guitarist Robin Lynn Macy , and upright bass player Laura Lynch .
 Jane Frost , again , recalls being privy to the discussion that the four women had about the possibility of a successful career as musicians together .
 her sister Martie felt they could do well .
 Robin Lynn Macy said , .

 Its going to be a hot band , to which Emily Erwin responded , I give it six months , and if we arent making money by then , Im out of here !

 Emily Robison was shy , and the youngest member of the group .
 Emily Robison had enjoyed playing throughout school , but was at an age where Emily Robison was already entertaining thoughts of working hard to be accepted by the United States Air Force Academy .
By 1993 , the band had evolved into a new direction .
 Robin Lynn Macy left the group for a purer bluegrass sound .
 upright bass player Laura Lynch , thrust into the position of sole lead singer , was replaced by the sisters in 1995 with singer composer Natalie Maines after the group was unable to garner anything more than local interest .
 Emily Robison commented , We were prepared to pay We dues for as long as it took ; We were prepared for longevity .
 We know that We will always be playing music together , so We wanted to find someone who is just as determined and energetic as We are .
 But in later interviews , the sisters revealed what many had thought for a long time : the reason upright bass player Laura Lynch was replaced was not commitment but a perceived lack of talent .
 In an article in the April/May edition of Country Music Magazine , Emily Erwin stated , We felt We needed the next calibre of singer .
From there , massive commercial success ensued , with their 1998 and 1999 albums Wide Open Spaces and Fly both achieving diamond record status .
 Emily Robison was a key element of the groups look , with Emily Robison hair dyed blond to match the other two at first , and then allowing it to return to Emily Robison natural brunette color , and distinguishing Emily Robison visually from the other two .
 Emily Robison and Maguires instrumental virtuosity set the Chicks apart from many other country acts , male and female .
 Emily Robison songwriting has also been a factor in the Chicks recording career .
 Emily Robison stood by singer composer Natalie Maines when the controversy over singer composer Natalie Maines remarks about U.S. President George W. Bush hit the newswire on the eve before the Iraq War in 2003 .
 Emily Robison was the only bandmate to realize that , while in the U.K. , there was a big anti-war sentiment in the audience , but that back in the United States , singer composer Natalie Maines criticism of President Bush would not be well received .
 Nevertheless , even when Emily Robison home was trashed , and plenty of editorials were predicting the end of the Dixie Chicks successful careers in music , Emily Robison remained loyal to singer composer Natalie Maines , as did Emily Robison sister .
 Emily Robison spent at least half of her life busking and touring nearly non-stop since high school , first with Emily Robison older sister , and then with the changing lineups of the Dixie Chicks .
 After the bandmates celebrated their five Grammy Awards for Taking the Long Way , the trio all had young children and took time out to spend with them , but Emily Robison was eager to return to writing and touring .
 When Emily Robison marriage came to an end , Emily Robison began expressing Emily Robison by songwriting .
 Some of Emily Robison compositions include Some of her compositions feelings about the breakup with Some of her compositions former husband , and expected that soon , the band would resume its former schedule of writing and performing , but Natalie Maines was reluctant to do so .
 After four years , Emily Robison became angry and frustrated , and in sending Emily Robison new songs to Emily Robison sister , conveyed Emily Robison increasing disappointment .
 With Natalie Maines taking a break from music , Rolling Stone magazine announced in January 2010 that Emily Erwin and sister Martie have formed a side project called the Court Yard Hounds , with Emily Robison as lead vocalist .
The band made their live debut in March at South by Southwest with an album released in May , 2010 .
 Emily Robison wrote all but one of the songs on their album .
 On May 1 , 1999 , Emily Erwin married country singer Charlie Robison .
 her sister Martie later revealed on a VH-1 program that during their courtship , her sister Martie had written the romantic hit song , Cowboy Take I Away for them .
The Robisons have three children : Charles Augustus , called Gus , born November 11 , 2002 and twins Julianna Tex and Henry Benjamin born on April 14 , 2005 .
 Emily Erwin and Charlie divorced on August 6 , 2008 after nine years of marriage .
 Emily Robison and Emily Robison then-boyfriend , Martin Strayer , have a daughter , Violet Isabel Strayer , born on September 4 , 2012 .
 Emily Robison and Martin Strayer are now married
 Chhote Rahimat Khan , is a Hindustani classical sitar player of the Bande Ali Khan Gharana , taught by Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan father , Abdul Karim Khan , and grandfather , Ratna Rahimat Khan , as well as Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan older brothers .
 Belonging to the seventh generation of musicians from AIR Dharwad , Gwalior , Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan received the majority of Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan training from Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan father , Ustad Abdul Karim Khan , although Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan has also benefited from the influence of Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan legendary grandfather , Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan .
 Ratna Rahimat Khan , a disciple of the great master , Ustad Bande Ali Khan , was a rudra vina and sitar player who was responsible not only for modifiying the three-string sitar to the seven-string instrument that we have today , but also for reunifying the instrumental khyal of the Gwalior gharana with the instrumental dhrupad of Gwalior .
 It is this inimitable legacy that gives Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan music a unique and distinctive colour , rarely experienced in modern music circles .
 Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan music is a sonorous blend of both Gayaki Ang , which aims to imitate the tonal nuance of the human voice on the instrument , and Tantakari Ang , the more traditional instrumental style played on the instrument .
 Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan secured second prize in the All India Radio Music Competition held in AIR Dharwad in 1978 , at the age of 19 , and also won the first award in the preliminary and final round of the Yuva Sangeet Nrithya Mahotsav organized by the South Central Zone Cultural Centre at Nagpur on 6 October 1987 .
 Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan is a regular artist on AIR Dharwad and AIR Panaji , Goa .
 Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan is also a music director .
 Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan scored music to Vadhachakra , the first Marathi film of Goa , in 1992 , and also to Tulsi , a Konkani Tele Film , in 1994 .
 Sitar Ratna Rahimat Khan has also scored live music for one of Kalidasa 's plays , Abhidnyan Shakuntal , staged by Prof. Kamalakar Sonatakke , on 16 and 17 December 2005 .
Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan has been the Head of the Sitar Faculty at Kala Academy in Goa for several years now , and has also given public performances in numerous festivals in Asia and in Europe .
 Besides many concerts in India , Ustad Chhote Rahimat Khan has performed in the UK , Portugal , China , France , Finland , Malaysia and Singapore
Alhaiya Bilaval is a Hindustani classical raga .
 a Hindustani classical raga the most commonly performed raga of the large Shuddha Bilawal group , which mainly includes ragas based on the western major scale .
 It is often simply referred to as Shuddha Bilawal , although in the 17th century Alhaiya Bilaval and Shuddha Bilawal may have been separate ragas .
Writing about the musical theory of Indian classical music is fraught with complications .
First of all , there have been no set , formal methods of written notation .
Indian music is an aural tradition , and therefore writing is not an essential part of attaining talim .
 Related ragas : Shuddha Bilawal , Shuddha Bilawal , Devgiri Bilawal , Shukla Bilawal , Kakubh Bilawal .
Behavior refers to practical aspects of the music .
 It is complicated to talk about this for Hindustani music since many of the concepts are fluid , changing , or archaic .
 The following information can not be accurate , but The following information can attempt to reflect how the music existed .
Bor , Joep .
Rao , Suvarnalata ; der Meer , Wim van ; Harvey , Jane The Raga Guide : A Survey of 74 Hindustani Ragas .
Zenith Media , London : 1999
Anuradha Pal is a world-renowned , multifaceted tabla virtuoso , multi-percussionist and music composer who has been hailed as the first professional female tabla player by the Encyclopaedia Britannica , Who 's Who Journal of the World and the Limca Book of Records .
 A disciple of tabla legends Late Ustad Alla Rakha and Zakir Hussain , Anuradha Pal is the youngest and only female Indian musician to have performed at the prestigious Woodstock Festival in 2008 ; where Anuradha Pal performed with Anuradha Pal acclaimed world music band Recharge , for an audience of 4 lakh people .
Pal has performed extensively at some of the most prestigious music festivals in the world , like Woodstock , WOMAD , Voices of the World , Night of the Virtuosos , Rhythm Sticks Festival and Masters of Indian Music Festival ; amongst numerous others in the US , UK , Europe , Japan , Brazil , Australia , New Zealand , Africa , Singapore , Hong Kong and the Far East .
She became the first and the youngest woman Indian musician to perform at the WOMAD Festival in 1999 , where she presented her band Stree Shakti - Asia 's first and much acclaimed all-female , percussion based vocal-instrumental ensemble , for 1.5 lakh fans .
She has performed sensational tabla solos and has accompanied some of the best musicians of India such as Pt .
Jasraj , Pt .
 Shivkumar Sharma , Pt .
Hariprasad Chaurasia , Ustad Zakir Hussain , Smt .
 Girija Devi , Ustad Amjad Ali Khan , Ustad Sultan Khan , Ustad Shahid Parvez , Pt .
Vishwa Mohan Bhatt ; younger musicians like Rahul Sharma , Niladri Kumar , Rakesh Chaurasia , as well as , acclaimed jazz , Latin and African musicians in major Indian and international festivals .
 Girija Devi has also performed with renowned international musicians .
 Recently , Girija Devi performed at the Global Fusion Concert in Dubai with the classical crossover string quartet Bond , jazz drummer Sherrie Maricle , saxophonist Sharel Cassity , flamenco dancer Concepcion Jareno and guitarist Antonia Jimenez ; and ney artist Burcu Karadag .
 Anuradha Pal composed the background score for M.F. Husain 's film ; Gaja Gamini ; which was highly appreciated at the Cannes Film Festival for M.F. Husain 's film ; Gaja Gamini ; originality and evocativeness .
 Anuradha Pal has also composed music for short films , documentaries , theatre and other commissioned work and events .
 Anuradha Pal was invited as an artist-in-residence , at the New England Conservatory and Berkeley School of Music .
 Anuradha Pal contributed actively in the research of the `` Relationship between Brain , Music & Language '' at Neurosciences University , San Diego and the ` Study of Tabla , Aesthetics & Complexities ' at the Harvard Science Center .
 BBC Radio World Service Program featured Anuradha Pal as one of the Five Prominent Women Musicians of India in 1991 and as one of the World 's youth Icons & trendsetters in 2008 .
 Doordarshan National Archives featured Anuradha Pal in a film titled Woman of Substance in 2006 .
 Times Now channel featured Anuradha Pal in a documentary titled All About Anuradha Pal in 2004 .
Adventure Divas by the American Public Broadcasting Service made a film featuring Anuradha Pal as one of the great women achievers of India and the World in 2001 .
Films Division of India featured her in the documentary titled Aaj ki Nari in 1999
Shruti Sadolikar Katkar is an Indian classical singer of the khyal style in the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana .
 Shruti Sadolikar Katkar is a recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for Hindustani vocal music for 2011 .
 Wamanrao Sadolikar was born 1951 into a family from Kolhapur which was known for its musical tradition and owning sugar mills .
She received training in Indian classical music from childhood .
 Her initial training was given by her father , Wamanrao Sadolikar , who was taught by the founder of the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana , Alladiya Khan , and Alladiya Khan son Bhurji Khan .
 Following her studies with her father , Wamanrao Sadolikar learnt music for twelve years from Gulubhai Jasdanwala , who was known for Wamanrao Sadolikar large collection of raga compositions , including compositions in rare ragas .
 Wamanrao Sadolikar earned a masters degree from SNDT Womens University in Mumbai and wrote a thesis on Haveli Sangeet , a type of temple music .
 Wamanrao Sadolikar performs all forms of Indian classical and semi-classical music , including thumri , tappa , and natya sangeet , and has performed in India , Canada , the United States , France , Switzerland , Germany , and the West Asian countries .
She had several musical and educational recordings published and holds the Homi Bhabha Fellowship of the National Centre for the Performing Arts .
 In 1999 , Wamanrao Sadolikar produced a play named Sangeet Tulsidas for which she set the music , and she performed for SPIC MACAY to interest young Indians in Indian classical music .
 Wamanrao Sadolikar has regularly performed playback for Indian movies .
 She had Shruti Sadolikar Katkar added to Shruti Sadolikar Katkar name after marriage and is a student of Azizuddin Khan , son of Burji Khan .
 Wamanrao Sadolikar works as Vice Chancellor of the Bhatkhande Music Institute University in Lucknow , Uttar Pradesh
Zia Mohiuddin Dagar , popularly known as Z. M. Dagar , was a North Indian classical musician , one of the 19th generation of Dagar family dhrupad musicians .
 Zia Mohiuddin Dagar was largely responsible for the revival of the rudra vina as a solo concert instrument .
 Z. M. Dagar was born in the town of Udaipur , Rajasthan and began musical study with Z. M. Dagar father , Ustad Ziauddin Khan Dagar , court musician for the Maharana of Udaipur .
 Z. M. Dagar was trained both in vocals and in the rudra veena , an instrument used by vocalists to practice melodies .
 The veena was traditionally not played in public , but the young Zia Mohiuddin adopted it as the young Zia Mohiuddin primary instrument , giving the young Zia Mohiuddin first recital at age 16 .
 Although the young Zia Mohiuddin was discouraged by the young Zia Mohiuddin father from experimenting with the structure of the veena , the young Zia Mohiuddin nevertheless modified the instrument after the young Zia Mohiuddin fathers death to better equip it for solo performance , transforming it into a larger bass instrument : With the help of the instrument house Kanailal & Brother , the young Zia Mohiuddin enlarged the tumbas and dhandhi to create greater resonance and to allow the notes to sustain longer and so better reproduce the techniques used in dhrupad singing .
 Because of these modifications , the instrument was too heavy to be held in the standard Northern posture , so the young Zia Mohiuddin played instead in the Southern posture , with one tumba on the ground and one on the left knee .
After India gained independence the princely states were abolished .
 The Dagar family lost the patronage of the court of Udaipur , and had to seek employment elsewhere .
Finally they arrived in Mumbai .
For 25 years they had to make ends meet by working in garages , selling bread , and rarely , playing instruments for movie scores .
They did not have a tanpura , sitar , or veena , let alone a house .
There was much cynicism about dhrupad , as his son Bahauddin Mohiuddin Dagar recounted in an interview .
Dhrupad ?
Wholl listen ?
Rudra veena ?
Play something else .
Long alaaps ?
So boring !

 Z. M. Dagar was known particularly for Z. M. Dagar slow development of ragas , typically performed only with tanpura accompaniment , and for Z. M. Dagar meticulous attention to microtonal inflections .
 Z. M. Dagar was very active in the West , associating Z. M. Dagar with the American Society for Eastern Arts in Berkeley , California and with Wesleyan University , Rotterdam Music Conservatory , and the University of Washington , Seattle , where Z. M. Dagar was a visiting professor .
In 1990 , Ustad ji was awarded the Kalidas Samman , one of Indias most prestigious awards , by the Madhya Pradesh government .
 He also received the Sangeet Natak Academi Award , the Rajasthan Sangeet Natak Academi award , and the Maharana Kumbha award , to name a few .
 His younger brother , Ustad Zia Fariddudin Dagar , is a vocalist and teacher , and Ustad Zia Fariddudin Dagar son , Bahauddin Mohiuddin Dagar , is a vina player .
The concept of making a Gurukul was entirely Ustad Zia Mohiuddin Dagars .
 the Gurukul envisioned a place where the Gurukul would sit with the Gurukul disciple and .
impart training in the Guru Shishya Parampara a method in which a few selected students study under one roof whilst staying with the guru .
 Ustad sahib put at least twenty years of Ustad sahib time and effort to give shape to this idea on Ustad sahib own and thus , the Gurukul came into being in 1982 at Palaspa - a village near Panvel - Mumbai
Sanjeev Chimmalgi is an Indian Hindustani vocalist .
 Sanjeev Chimmalgi is a disciple of the revered guru , Pandit C. R. Vyas .
 Sanjeev Chimmalgi music reflects the voice culture of Kirana gharana as well as the bandish oriented singing of the Gwalior gharana / Agra gharana .
Sanjeev Chimmalgi was born in Mumbai to M.V. Chimmalgi , in a family hailing from Dharwad , Karnataka .
 Sanjeev Chimmalgi grandfather , Chimmalgi Master , was a noted tabla player .
 Chimmalgi Master is professionally trained as a Computer engineer .
 Sanjeev Chimmalgi had Sanjeev Chimmalgi initial training from Pandit Madhava Gudi .
 Later Sanjeev Chimmalgi came under the tutelage of late Pandit C R Vyas .
 Sanjeev Chimmalgi is also receiving training in Carnatic music under T.R. Balamani and Balachandran in Mumbai and in Konnakol ' under Mridangam exponent T. S. Nandakumar .
 Sanjeev Chimmalgi has performed at several venues in Mumbai , Pune , Indore , Kolkata , Miraj , Nagpur , etc
Bhajan Sopori is an Indian instrumentalist .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori is a player of santoor , an ancient stringed musical instrument .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori hails from Sopore in Kashmir Valley and traces Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori lineage to ancient Santoor experts .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori belongs to the Sufiana gharana of Indian classical music .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori family has played santoor for over six generations .
 His family first public performance was at a conference organised by Prayag Sangeet Samiti & the University of Allahabad when His family was 10 years old .
Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori is also a santoor player .
Both father and son have given several performances together .
Pandit Bhajan Sopori has taught music at Washington University , US .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori performances have been broadcast in India and seen by both cultural associations there and by audiences in countries such as Belgium , Egypt , England , Germany , Norway , Syria and the USA .
 Pandit Sopori , considered as the cultural link between the Jammu and Sopore in Kashmir Valley and rest of India , also runs a music academy called SaMaPa , which is actively involved in promoting Indian classical music .
SaMaPa is involved in promoting music with jail inmates , with the objective of using music for healing the prisoners and creating an emotional bond between the society & the prisoners .
The academy has trained several musicians and revived old instruments .
It was presented the state government dogri award in 2011 .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1993 and the Padma Shri in 2004 .
 In 2009 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori was honoured with the Baba Allaudin Khan Award .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori was also awarded the M N Mathur award in 2011 for Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori contribution to Indian classical music .
 Soporis son Abhay Rustum Sopori other awards include the the Jammu and Sopore in Kashmir Valley State Award , the National Flag Honour of the Arab Republic of Egypt , Delhi Ratna Award , Delhi Telugu Academy Award , Beenkar Samman , Sangeet Vibhuti Award and Sangeet Ratna Award
Hori is a genre of semi-classical singing , popular in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar .
It can be adorned with a Bhairavi , Thumri etc. .
 It comes in the series of season songs , like Chaiti , Sawani and Kajari , and is traditionally sung in the villages and towns of Uttar Pradesh : around Banaras , Mirzapur , Mathura , Allahabad and the Bhojpur regions of Bihar
Satyaki Banerjee is an Indian Bengali composer .
 Satyaki Banerjee is a part of an Anglo-Bengali band with members in Kolkata and London .
 Satyaki Banerjee plays instruments like Dotara and sarod give Satyaki Banerjee performance on both classical and folk .
 Satyaki Banerjee studied the sarod with the late Pandit Dipak Chowdhury and now trains under Pandit Tejendra Narayan Majumdar .
 Satyaki Banerjee picked up the dotara in the company of practising folk musicians , in akhras and melas and in him the classical and folk meld to evolve into a unique style of playing .
 Satyaki Banerjee is also a self-taught oud and rebab player , besides being a magnificent singer of mostly Indian Bengali mystical poetry , in the baul and kirtan traditions .
 Satyaki Banerjee is a historian by training and takes serious academic interest in the music Satyaki Banerjee practices .
 Satyaki Banerjee has been part of Parapar since 2005 , but Satyaki Banerjee has also performed independently with Mousumi Bhowmik in concerts at home and abroad , including in New York , London , Leeds , Dhaka and Chittagong
Sangeetha Katti popularly known as Sangeetha Katti is a Hindustani classical vocalist in India .
 Smt Bharati Katti was recently awarded the prestigious Suvarna Karnataka Rajyotsava award , 2006-07 by the Karnataka State Government .
 Sangeeta Katti was born in Dharwad , an abode of Music , Karnataka .
 Smt Bharati Katti is a daughter of Dr. H .
A .
 Smt Bharati Katti and Smt Bharati Katti , Sangeeta Katti was born in Dharwad , an abode of Music , an abode of Music , significantly on the Saraswati pooja day of Dasara as a child prodigy in music , on 7 October 1970 .
Sangeeta Katti has a rich performance experience in Hindustani Vocal as well as Bhajans , Vachanas , Dasavani , Abhangs , Bhavageet , Folk Music and Playback singing .
Sangeeta Katti is a distinct student in Chemistry Graduation and well versed in several languages like Kannada , Hindi , English , Marathi etc. .
 Sangeeta Katti has bagged several meritorious awards for Smt Bharati Katti melodious compositions and albums .
Leading recording companies like Master Rec .
Co. , Chennai , HMV , Lahari Rec .
 Co and Sangeet Sagar etc.have released a good number of Audio Cassettes and CDs of Smt Bharati Katti .
Sangeeta Katti has the privilege of having worked with the leading Music directors like Upendra Kumar , M.Ranga Rao , Vijay-Bhaskar , MM Keerawani , C Ashwath , Hamsalekha and Others and sung with leading maestros of India like Dr. M Balamurali Krishna , Dr.S.P.Balasubramanyam , Dr. K.J. Yesudas , Dr. Rajkumar , Dr. P.B Srinivas and others .
 Smt Bharati Katti is a A grade artist in Classical and Light Music both on AIR and Television , as a rich experience of singing 9 different languages .
 Having successfully toured abroad , all over Upendra Kumar , USA , Australia , New Zealand , Gulf and Canada , Smt Bharati Katti is the most popular figure there too .
 Sangeeta Katti is residing in Bangalore , India with Smt Bharati Katti husband Sri .
 Manmohan Kulkarni and Smt Bharati Katti two kids Chi .
Savani Kulkarni and Chi .
Ninad Kulkarni , musing on music .
Born into a family of musicians , Sangeetha Katti received initial lessons from her father.At the age of 4 , she met Naushad Ali which she considered a turning point in her life .
Naushad Ali asked her to sing some ragas and was impressed by the child prodigy and since then she became his student .
 Trained initially under Sri Sheshagiri Dandapur and Padmabhushan Pt .
Chanderashekhar Puranikmath , Sangeeta received advanced training in classical vocals from Padmabhushan Pt .
Basavaraj Rajguru of Kirana & Gwalior Gharana for about 12 years .
 Chanderashekhar Puranikmath , Sangeeta is presently under the tutelage of Padmavibushana Gana Sarswati Smt Kishori Amonkar of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana .
 Sangeetha to date has over 2500 concerts to Sangeetha to date credit , Sangeetha to date very first performance being at the age of 4 .
 Sangeetha to date has also performed in the United States , Upendra Kumar , and Canada .
 Sangeetha to date is a regular feature in most of the important music festivals in India .
 Sangeetha to date was a teaching faculty in Hindustani Vocal music at Bharathiya Vidya Bhavan , Bengaluru .
 Sangeetha to date has won numerous awards .

Ustad Akhtar Sadmani was a Indian classical vocalist .
Akhtar Sadmani was born in Dhaka , but was brought up in Calcutta .
 It was Ustad Akhtar Sadmani father who introduced Ustad Akhtar Sadmani to music .
At the age of ten , he received initial training from Bobby Daniel , a student of Zamiruddin Khan .
In 1955 , Bobby Daniel took him to the renowned musician Omar Khan , who continued his training .
In 1957 , Omar Khan personally introduced Akhtar Sadmani to Amir Khan .
Since then he received training and advice from Amir Khan as well .
He also received Khyal training from Amanat Ali , Fateh Ali , Manjur Hossain Khan and Foyez Mohammad , and Dhrupad training from Zahiruddin Dagar and Faiyazuddin Dagar .
 In 1961 , Akhtar Sadmani returned to Radio Bangladesh and joined Radio Pakistan a year later as an artist .
 Ustad Akhtar Sadmani became a Music Director in Radio Bangladesh in 1966 .
 In 1980 Ustad Akhtar Sadmani established the `` Sur Rang Academy of Classical Music '' .
 The academy was the first of its kind in Radio Bangladesh , solely devoted to Indian classical music .
Akhtar Sadmani suffered a severe heart-attack and died on 30 December 2003
Raga Bhoopeshwari is a rare Hindustani Classical Raga .
The Raga in not one of the traditional ragas of Hindustani Classical Music being sung for the past few centuries .
It has been developed within the last few decades .
The birth of this raga is something that eluded most people for a while .
It was believed that the raga was created by Ustad Alladiya Khan of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana .
However the time frame of Ustadjis lifetime and the ragas emergence do not match .
It is now however certain , that the raga was created by Pt .
Mani Prasad of the Kirana Gharana .
Apart from who created the raga , a major issue that arises is , how was it created ?
Being an audav raga , Raga Bhoopeshwari leads to a lot of ambiguity .
 Since the remaining notes/swars are unknown , it is quite difficult to determine the parent raga or scale of Raga Bhoopeshwari .
The raga does not fit into any of Bhatkhande s thats and so its origin is uncertain .
A similar problem persists in Carnatic Music as well .
 People associate A similar problem with the Melakarta Chakravam , Melakart Mararanjani , Melakarta Charukesi and even Melakarta Sarasangi , but no one is absolutely certain .
 Another matter of concern with the raga is Another matter of concern with the raga name .
The name Bhoopeshwari had an obvious inspiration from Raga Bhopali .
However , the raga has various names across India .
Pt .
Hariprasad Chaurasia , the legendary flutist , prefers the name Raga Bhoopkali , while most of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana musicians use Raga Prateeksha .
Other variations such as Bhoopeshri , Bhoopshri etc. are also present .
In Carnatic Music , the raga is called Raga Vaasanthi .
 Despite Carnatic Music complex origin and nomenclature , the raga isnt a very difficult one to sing .
 Carnatic Music has the same notes as Raga Bhopali / Deshkar , but instead of the shuddha Dha , uses a komal Dha .
The Raga is a morning raga .
Its designated time is the second prahar of the morning , from 6-9 a.m. Possibly due to its recent creation , the raga has not been performed very widely .
However , it has started being used in film music , light classcial music and ghazals .
Some of the most notable performances of Raga Bhoopeshwari are :
Ramashreya Jha was a distinguished composer , musician , scholar and teacher of Hindustani Classical music .
 Ramashreya Jha was the Head of the Department of Music in Allahabad University from 1980 to 1989 .
 Ramashreya Jha was known for Ramashreya Jha deep knowledge , creative genius and Ramashreya Jha gifts as a teacher .
 Ramashreya Jha five-volume anthology Abhinava Geetanjali ranks high among the most influential works in Hindustani music .
It contains critical analysis of ragas supplemented by numerous traditional and self-conceived compositions .
 Ramashreya Jha is popularly known to musicians , students and music lovers around India by Ramashreya Jha nom de plume ` Ramrang .
 Ramashreya Jha name is also spelled Ram Ashray Jha .
Among the first to notice Jha-sahabs magnificent compositions and parlay them was the famous maestro , the late Jitendra Abhisheki , who sang and taught Ramrangs many compositions .
 In 1968 , Jha-sahabs was appointed to the faculty of Allahabad University and later in 1980 promoted to the position of Head of the Music Department .
 This move by the University was in recognition of genuine merit because Ramrang held no formal college degrees .
 Ramrang retired from Ramrang active professorial duties in 1989 .
 In 2005 , Ramrang received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award from Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy for Music , Dance and Drama .
 Ramrang died January 1 , 2009 , in Kolkata , India , due to complications following heart surgery .
 Among Ramrang well-known disciples are Kamla Bose , Shubha Mudgal and Geeta Banerjee
Smt .
Lalith J. Rao is an Indian classical singer and a representative of the Agra gharana .
 Lalith J. Rao introduction to Hindustani classical music was at the age of three , at a concert by the Agra Gharana vocalist Faiyaz Khan .
 Hindustani started learning music from Rama Rao Naik , who initiated Rama Rao Naik into the Agra gharana style of singing .
Raos first public concert was at the Bangalore Sangeet Sabha at the age of 12 .
 When Raos first public concert was 14 , Raos first public concert won the All India Classical Music competition in Mumbai and became the youngest participant of the Swami Haridas Sangeet Sammelan the same year , and was well received .
 Lalith J. Rao completed Raos first public concert Bachelors and Masters in Electrical Communication Engineering , the latter from the University of New Brunswick .
 In 1967 , Raos first public concert married Jayavanth Rao and moved to Delhi to work .
 Raos first public concert husband convinced Lalith J. Rao to abandon Raos first public concert engineering career and pursue singing , and Raos first public concert received training from Dinkar Kaikini and later from Khadim Hussain Khan .
 Lalith J. Rao went back to the Sur Singar Sansad to restart Raos first public concert performance career and became a professional singer after a positive reception .
 Raos first public concert is as adept at singing khyal , dhrupad , dhamar , as well as thumri , tarana and hori .
 Under the guidance of Raos first public concert ustad , Lalith J. Rao developed a unique style of rendering taranas .
Her first concert abroad was in 1981 .
She has performed in France , UK , US and Canada and is a top-grade artiste of All India Radio .
 Lalith J. Rao regularly performs on the Radio and Television .
 Lalith J. Rao was one of the key figures in setting up a trust Sajan Milap in the mid-seventies , to popularise the music of her Ustad , who used the pen name Sajan Piya .
She was the chief coordinator for the Ford Foundation Archival project at the ITC Sangeet Research Academy from 1989-91 .
Few years later she herself sang for the Ethno-Musicology Department of the University of Washington in Seattle .
for them to archive the music of her Agra gharana .
 Lalith J. Rao lost her voice on the eve of a tour of Europe in 1994 but gradually recovered with the help of a voice trainer .
She lives and teaches music in Bangalore
Rupak Tala is a popular tala in Hindustani music that is common in Bhajans and Geets .
 Rupak Tala has seven matras in three vibhags .
Unlike the popular Tintal , the vibhags of Rupak Tala are not of equal length .
Also , both the khali and taali of Rupak Tala fall on the first matra .
The aavaratan of Rupak Tala has three vibhags .
The first vibhag has three matras and both the second and third vibhags have two matras .
Sam is on the first matra of the first vibhag .
The aavaratan of Rupak Tala may be written as follows : .
It is important to note that the empty cells in the above table at the end of vibhags two and three are not rests .
Each number is a whole matra of equal length .
Using the Clap & Wave system can be problematic for Rupak Tala .
 Traditionally one claps on sam , or taali , and waves on both the khali and taali of Rupak Tala .
The first matra of Rupak Tala , however , is both taali and khali .
If the clap were to be present on sam then Rupak Tala may be confused for a similar tala of seven matras , Tivra Tala , that has identical vibhags but differs in that the first matra is taali .
There a numerous examples of Rupak Tala that differ based upon the instrument used .
The following examples apply for the tabla .
 The most common theka for Rupak Tala tala contains the bols Tin , Na , and Dhin .
This theka is composed in the following manner by gautam dayal .
Prakars are fairly open to the individual performers flair .
 Prakars being said , however , the following is an example of three common Rupak Tala prakars .
A tihai for Rupak Tala must begin on either the third or the sixth matra to end on sam .
The following is an example of a simple tihai for Rupak Tala that begins on matra three
Dr Usha Parkhi is a Hindustani vocalist from Nagpur .
 Dr Usha Parkhi started learning under D G alias Bhayyaji Vazalwar .
 Later the eminent teacher and singer Jagannathbuwa Purohit Gunidas gave Later the eminent teacher tuition in 1960s but singer Jagannathbuwa Purohit Gunidas died soon after their association started .
Usha Parkhi has a doctorate in music from Gandharva Mahavidyalaya .
 Dr Usha Parkhi used to perform in concerts even in Dr Usha Parkhi early seventies .
 Dr Usha Parkhi has been a reputed music teacher in Nagpur
Kuldeep Joshi is a blind Indian student from Rajasthan who continuously played the tabla for 12 hours , setting a record .
 His father Manshankar Joshi is a native of Padardi bari , Dungarpur district in Rajasthan .
 Kuldeep Joshi lost His father Manshankar Joshi eyesight at the age of eight .
 His father Manshankar Joshi father Manshankar Joshi is a physical education teacher , and His father Manshankar Joshi mother Sarada Devi is a housewife .
 His father Manshankar Joshi has two brothers : one working in Mumbai , in Pune , the other is studying to be a Chartered Accountant .
 On 15 April 2012 , His father Manshankar Joshi started playing the tabla and performing a solo song at 5:00 am in the university auditorium , and continued until 05:00 pm .
 His father Manshankar Joshi teacher Gopal Mishra said that vice chancellor B. Pandey encouraged vice chancellor B. Pandey , and added that His father Manshankar Joshi has been topping His father Manshankar Joshi year at the university for the last two years , achieving 80 percent , for which His father Manshankar Joshi has received a gold medal in Lucknow .
 His teacher Gopal Mishra also said that His father Manshankar Joshi is the first handicapped person in India to continuously play the tabla for 12 hours .
 Kuldeeps father considered Kuldeeps father sons achievement as Asaram Bapu s blessing .
 Kuldeeps said that Kuldeeps will continuously play the tabla for 20 hours in order to register Kuldeeps name in Limca Book of Records , and Kuldeeps will try to register Kuldeeps name in Guinness World Records at Goregaon , Mumbai .
 Kuldeeps has met Member of the Legislative Assembly Surendra Bamania in a disabled camp organised by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department
 the now red-haired Nico was a German singer-songwriter , lyricist , composer , musician , fashion model , and actress , who initially rose to fame as a Warhol Superstar in the 1960s .
 She is known for both She vocal collaboration on The Velvet Underground s debut album , The Velvet The Velvet Underground 's `` I & the now red-haired Nico , and She work as a solo artist from the late 1960s through the 1980s .
 She also had roles in several films , including Federico Fellini s La Dolce Vita and Andy Warhol s Chelsea Girls , as She .
 the now red-haired Nico died in July 1988 , as a result of a heart attack while vacationing on Ibiza in the Balearic Islands in the Mediterranean Sea off the coast of Spain with She son .
 the now red-haired Nico was born Christa Paffgen in Cologne .
 When Christa Paffgen in Cologne was two years old , Christa Paffgen in Cologne moved with Christa Paffgen in Cologne mother and grandfather to the Spreewald forest outside of Berlin .
 Christa Paffgen in Cologne father was enlisted as a soldier during World War II , and sustained head injuries that caused severe brain damage ; Her father was variously said to have died in a concentration camp , or to have faded away as a result of the shellshock Her father suffered .
 In 1946 , the now red-haired Nico and Christa Paffgen in Cologne mother relocated to downtown Berlin , where the now red-haired Nico worked as a seamstress .
She attended school until the age 13 , and began selling lingerie in the exclusive department store KaDeWe , eventually getting modeling jobs in Berlin .
 At five feet ten inches and with chiseled features and porcelain skin , the now red-haired Nico rose to prominence as a fashion model as a teenager .
 According to conflicting accounts , the now red-haired Nico was raped by a member of the U.S. Air Force when she was 15 .
 the now red-haired Nico song Secret Side from the album The End makes oblique references to the rape .
 Discovered at 16 by photographer Herbert Tobias while both were working at a KaDeWe fashion show in Berlin , photographer Herbert Tobias christened Nico with her adopted name , which she used for most of her life .
 photographer Herbert Tobias named her this after photographer Herbert Tobias friend , filmmaker Nikos Papatakis .
 She soon moved to Paris that and began working for Vogue , Tempo , Vie Nuove , Mascotte Spettacolo , Camera , Elle , and other fashion magazines .
At age 17 , she was contracted by Coco Chanel to promote their products , but she fled to New York City and abandoned the job .
Through her travels , she learned to speak English , Spanish , and French .
 After appearing in several television advertisements , the now red-haired Nico got a small role in Alberto Lattuada s film La Tempesta .
 She also appeared in Rudolph Mate s For the First Kissin Time , with Mario Lanza , later that year .
In 1959 , she was invited to the set of Federico Fellini s La Dolce Vita , where she attracted the attention of the acclaimed director , who gave her a minor role in the film as herself .
By this time , she was living in New York and taking acting classes with Lee Strasberg .
She appears as the cover model on jazz pianist Bill Evans 1962 album , Moon Beams .
 After splitting her time between New York and Paris that , she got the lead role in Jacques Poitrenaud s Strip-Tease .
She recorded the title track , which was written by Serge Gainsbourg but not released until 2001 , when it was included in the compilation Le Cinema de Serge Gainsbourg .
 In 1962 , the now red-haired Nico gave birth to her son , Christian Aaron Ari Paffgen , commonly held to have been fathered by French actor Alain Delon .
 French actor Alain Delon always denied French actor Alain Delon paternity .
 The child was raised mostly by Delons mother and The child husband and eventually was adopted by Delons mother and her husband , taking Delons mother and her husband surname , Boulogne .
 Nico 's First performances as a singer took place in December 1963 at New York 's Blue Angel nightclub , where she sang standards such as US Funny Valentine .
 In 1965 , the now red-haired Nico met Rolling Stones guitarist Brian Jones and recorded her First single , Im Not Sayin with the b-side The Last Mile , produced by Jimmy Page for Andrew Loog Oldham s Immediate label .
Actor Ben Carruthers introduced her to Bob Dylan in Paris that summer .
 In 1967 the now red-haired Nico recorded the now red-haired Nico song Ill Keep his song Ill with Mine for her First album , Chelsea Girl .
 Bob Dylan in Paris that had written the tune for Judy Collins in 1964 , according to Judy Collins own liner notes from the Geffen Records album Judy Collins Sings Bob Dylan in Paris that album .
 After being introduced by Brian Jones , Judy Collins began working in New York with Andy Warhol and Paul Morrissey on Andy Warhol and Paul Morrissey experimental films , including Chelsea Girls , The Chelsea Girls , Sunset and Imitation of Christ .
 When Andy Warhol began managing The Velvet Underground Andy Warhol proposed that the group take on Nico as a chanteuse .
 Andy Warhol and Paul Morrissey consented reluctantly , for both personal and musical reasons .
The group became the centerpiece of Warhols Exploding Plastic Inevitable , a multimedia performance featuring music , light , film and dance .
 the now red-haired Nico sang lead vocals on three songs and backing vocal on Sunday Morning , on the bands debut album , The Velvet Underground & the now red-haired Nico .
 the now red-haired Nico tenure in the Velvet Underground was marked by personal and musical difficulties .
 Violist and bassist John Cale has written that the now red-haired Nico long preparations in the dressing room and pre-performance good luck ritual would often hold up a performance , which especially irritated band member Lou Reed .
 the now red-haired Nico partial deafness also would sometimes cause bassist John Cale to veer off key , for which bassist John Cale was ridiculed by other band members .
The album went on to become timeless in legend .
It scored # 13 on Rolling Stone s 500 Greatest Albums of All Time , though it was poorly received at the time of its release .
 Immediately following bassist John Cale musical work with The Velvet Underground , the now red-haired Nico began work as a solo artist , performing regularly at The Dom in New York City .
 At these shows , the now red-haired Nico was accompanied by a revolving cast of guitarists , including members of The Velvet Underground , Tim Hardin , Tim Buckley , Ramblin Jack Elliott and Jackson Browne .
 For Tim Hardin debut album , 1967s Chelsea Girl , Tim Hardin recorded songs by Bob Dylan , Tim Hardin and Jackson Browne , among others .
 Velvet Underground members Lou Reed , John Cale and Sterling Morrison contributed to the album , with the now red-haired Nico , Lou Reed and bassist John Cale co-writing one song , It Was a Pleasure Then .
Chelsea Girl is a traditional chamber-folk album , which influenced artists such as Leonard Cohen , with strings and flute arrangements by producer Tom Wilson .
 the now red-haired Nico was not satisfied with the album and had little say in production matters .
 In retrospect , Chelsea Girl said in 1981 : US still can not listen to it , because everything US wanted for that record , artists such as Leonard Cohen took it away .
 US asked for drums , artists such as Leonard Cohen said no .
 US asked for more guitars , artists such as Leonard Cohen said no .
 And US asked for simplicity , and artists such as Leonard Cohen covered it in flutes !
 artists such as Leonard Cohen added strings , and -- US didnt like artists such as Leonard Cohen , but US could live with artists such as Leonard Cohen .
But the flute !
 The First time US heard the album , US cried and The first time I heard the album was all because of the flute .
 In California , the now red-haired Nico spent Kissin Time with Jim Morrison of The Doors .
 Jim Morrison of The Doors encouraged the now red-haired Nico to write her own songs .
 She would later refer to Jim Morrison of The Doors as her soul brother .
 For The Marble Index , released in 1969 , the now red-haired Nico wrote the lyrics and music .
 Accompaniment mainly centered around the now red-haired Nico harmonium , while John Cale added an array of folk and classical instruments , and arranged the album .
 The harmonium became bassist John Cale signature instrument for the rest of bassist John Cale career .
The album has a classical-cum-European folk sound .
A promotional film for the song Evening of Light was filmed by Francois de Menil .
 This video featured the now red-haired the now red-haired Nico and Iggy Pop of The Stooges .
 Returning to live performance in the early 1970s , the now red-haired Nico gave concerts in Amsterdam as well as London , where she and John Cale opened for Pink Floyd .
 1972 saw a one-off live reunion of the now red-haired Nico , bassist John Cale and Lou Reed at Bataclan in Paris that .
 the now red-haired Nico released two more solo albums in the 1970s , Desertshore and The End ... .
 the now red-haired Nico wrote the music , sang , and played the harmonium .
Cale produced and played most of the other instruments on both albums .
The End ... featured Brian Eno on synthesizer and Phil Manzanera on guitar , both from Roxy Music .
 She appeared at the Rainbow Theatre , in London , with Cale , Eno , and Kevin Ayers .
The album June 1 , 1974 was the result of this .
concert .
 the now red-haired Nico performed a version of the Doors The End , which was the catalyst for The End ... later The End year .
 Between 1970 and 1979 , the now red-haired Nico made about seven films with French director Philippe Garrel .
 She met Garrel in 1969 and contributed the song The Falconer to Garrel in 1969 film Le Lit de la Vierge .
 Soon after , She was living with Garrel in 1969 and became a central figure in Garrel in 1969 cinematic and personal circles .
 Nicos First acting appearance with Garrel in 1969 occurred in his 1972 film , La Cicatrice Interieure .
 the now red-haired Nico also supplied the music for this film and collaborated closely with the director .
 She also appeared in the Garrel films Anathor ; the silent Jean Seberg feature Les Hautes Solitudes , released in 1974 ; Un ange passe ; Le Berceau de cristal , starring Pierre Clementi , the now red-haired Nico and Anita Pallenberg ; and Voyage au jardin des morts .
 Jean Seberg 1991 film Jentends Plus la Guitare is dedicated to the now red-haired Nico .
 On 13 December 1974 , the now red-haired Nico opened for Tangerine Dream s infamous concert at Reims Cathedral in Reims , France .
The promoter had so greatly oversold tickets for the show that members of the audience couldnt move or reach the outside , eventually resulting in some fans urinating inside the cathedral hall .
The Roman Catholic Church denounced these actions , ordered the rededication of the cathedral and banned future performances on church property .
 Around this time , the now red-haired Nico became involved with German musician Lutz Ulbrich , guitarist for Ash Ra Tempel .
 Lutz Ulbrich would accompany Nico on guitar at many of Ash Ra Tempel subsequent concerts through the rest of the decade .
 Also in this time period , the now red-haired Nico let her hair return to its natural color of brown and took to dressing mostly in black .
 Nicos public image from then would be the now red-haired Nico public image from then on .
 the now red-haired Nico and Island Records allegedly had many disputes during this time , and in 1975 the label dropped her from Nico and Island roster .
 In February 1978 , the now red-haired Nico performed at the Canet Roc 78 festival in Spain with her son .
Also performing at this event were Blondie , Kevin Ayers , and Ultravox .
 Blondie made a vocal contribution to Neuronium s second album , Vuelo Quimico as Neuronium was at the studio , by chance , while it was being recorded in Barcelona in 1978 by Michel Huygen , Carlos Guirao and Albert Gimenez .
 Blondie read excerpts from Ulalume by Edgar Allan Poe .
 Blondie said that was deeply moved by the music , so Blondie couldnt help to make a contribution .
 In 1978 , the now red-haired Nico briefly toured as supporting act for Siouxsie & The Banshees , one of many punk bands who admired the now red-haired Nico .
 In Paris that , Patti Smith bought a new harmonium for the now red-haired Nico after Patti Smith original was stolen .
 Other fans of the now red-haired Nico included John Lydon , Dave Vanian , and Tommy Gear .
 the now red-haired Nico returned to New York in 1979 where Patti Smith comeback concert at CBGB was reviewed postitively in The New York Times .
 Patti Smith began playing regularly at the Squat Theatre and other venues with Jim Tisdall accompanying Patti Smith on harp and Gittler guitar .
 the Squat Theatre and other venues played together on a sold-out tour of twelve cities in the East and Midwest .
 At some shows , Patti Smith was accompanied on guitar by Cheetah Chrome .
 In Reims , France , the now red-haired Nico was introduced to photographer Antoine Giacomoni .
 Giacomonis photos of the now red-haired Nico would be used for Patti Smith next album , and would eventually be featured in a book .
 Through Antoine Giacomoni , Patti Smith met Corsican bassist Philippe Quilichini .
 the now red-haired Nico recorded Patti Smith next studio album , Drama of Exile , in 1981 .
produced by Philippe Quilichini .
Mahamad Hadi aka Mad Sheer Khan played oriental rock guitar and wrote all the oriental production .
 It was a departure from Patti Smith earlier work with John Cale , featuring a mixture of rock and Middle Eastern arrangements .
 For this album , in addition to originals like `` Genghis Khan '' and `` Sixty Forty '' , the now red-haired Nico recorded covers of The Velvet Underground 's `` the now red-haired Nico 'm Waiting For The Man '' and David Bowie 's `` Heroes '' .
Uniquely , Drama Of Exile was released twice .
The second version appeared in 1983 .
 After relocating to Greater Manchester , England in the early '80s , the now red-haired Nico acquired a manager , Alan Wise , and began working with a variety of backing bands for her many live performances .
These bands included Blue Orchids , The Bedlamites and The Faction .
 In 1981 , the now red-haired Nico released the Philippe Quilichini-produced single Saeta/Vegas on Flicknife Records .
The following year saw another single , Procession produced by Martin Hannett and featuring The Invisible Girls .
Included on the Procession single was a new version of The Velvet Underground s All Tomorrows Parties .
 At this time , the now red-haired Nico was often cited as an influence on the gothic rock scene , admired by such artists as Peter Murphy of Bauhaus , among others .
 At Salford University in 1982 , the now red-haired Nico would join Bauhaus for a performance of `` I 'm Waiting For The Man '' .
That same year , Nicos supporting acts included The Sisters Of Mercy and Gene Loves Jezebel .
 The Marble Index has frequently been cited as the First goth album , while the now red-haired Nico dark lyrics , music and persona were also influential .
 In September 1982 , the now red-haired Nico performed at the Deeside Leisure Centre for the Futurama Festival .
The line-up for this show also included The Damned , Dead or Alive , Southern Death Cult , Danse Society , and Gene Loves Jezebel , to name a few .
The live compilation Do Or Die !
 the now red-haired Nico - In Europe : 1982 Tour Diary was released in November 1982 on the ROIR cassette label in November 1982 , followed by more live performances throughout Europe : 1982 over the next few years .
 Gene Loves Jezebel recorded Gene Loves Jezebel final solo album , Camera Obscura , in 1985 , with The Faction .
 Produced by John Cale , Camera Obscura featured the now red-haired Nico version of the Richard Rodgers / Lorenz Hart song US Funny Valentine .
 The albums closing song was an updated version of Konig , which bassist John Cale had previously recorded for La cicatrice interieure .
 This was the only song on the album to feature only the now red-haired Nico voice and harmonium .
 A music video for My Heart Is Empty was filmed at The Fridge in Brixton , London .
 The next few years saw frequent live performances by the now red-haired Nico , with tours of Europe : 1982 , Japan and Australia .
A number of Nicos performances towards the end of her life were recorded and released , including 1982s Heroine , Live In Tokyo , and her final concert , Fata Morgana , recorded on 6 June 1988 .
The double live album Behind the Iron Curtain was recorded during a tour of Eastern Europe , before the fall of the Berlin Wall , and made from recordings of concerts in Warsaw , Prague , Budapest and other cities , and was released before her death in 1988 .
A duet called Your Kisses Burn with singer Marc Almond was her last studio recording .
 A duet called Your Kisses was released a few months after her death on Almonds album The Stars We Are .
 the now red-haired Nico final recording was of her last concert , Fata Morgana , at the Berlin Planetarium on the 6th June 1988 .
 This was a special event created by Lutz Ulbrich and featured a number of new compositions by the now red-haired Nico and The Faction .
 As an encore , the now red-haired Nico performed a song from The End ... , `` You Forget To Answer '' .
A CD of this concert was released in 1994 and again in 2012 .
 the now red-haired Nico had an affair with French actor Alain Delon and from this relationship conceived a son Christian Aaron Boulogne , whom the now red-haired Nico called Christian Aaron Ari Paffgen .
 French actor Alain Delon denied paternity and the now red-haired Nico had difficulty raising Christian Aaron Ari Paffgen , so the boy was raised by Delons parents .
 Christian Aaron Ari Paffgen became a photographer and actor , and had a son in 1999 .
 the now red-haired Nico saw Delons as part of a tradition of bohemian artists , which Delons traced back to the Romanticism of the early 19th century .
 Delons led a nomadic life , living in different countries .
 Apart from Germany , where Delons grew up , and Ibiza in the Balearic Islands , where Delons died , the now red-haired Nico lived in Italy and Reims , France in the 1950s , spent most of the 1960s in the US , and lived in London in the early 1960s and again in the 1980s , when Delons lived intermittently between London and Greater Manchester .
 During the final years of Delons life , Delons was based around the Prestwich and Salford area of Greater Manchester .
 Although Delons was still struggling with addiction , Delons became interested in music again .
 Delons shared an apartment in Brixton , London , London , for a few months in the mid-80s with punk poet John Cooper Clark .
 the now red-haired Nico was a heroin addict for over 15 years .
 In the book Songs They Never Play on the Radio , James Young , a member of Delons band in the 1980s , recalls many examples of Delons troubling behaviour due to Delons overwhelming addiction - and also that the now red-haired Nico claimed to have never taken the drug while with the Velvets/Factory scene but only began using during Delons relationship with Philippe Garrel in the 1970s .
 Shortly before Delons death , the now red-haired Nico stopped taking heroin and began methadone replacement therapy and embarked upon a regimen of bicycle exercise and healthy eating .
 the now red-haired Nico was described by some friends and colleagues as a racist .
 Delons close friend Danny Fields , the American journalist who helped Delons sign to Elektra Records , described Delons as Nazi-esque , saying : Every once in a while thered be something about Jews and Id be , But the now red-haired Nico , Im Jewish , and Delons was like Yes , yes , US dont mean you .
 Delons had a definite Nordic Aryan streak , belief that Delons was physically , spiritually and creatively superior .
 During a performance in Berlin , the audience rioted after the now red-haired Nico performed the German national anthem Das Lied der Deutschen , including verses banned after 1945 for their Nazi associations .
 According to Danny Fields , Delons once attacked a mixed-race woman in a restaurant with a smashed wineglass , saying US hate black people .
 the now red-haired Nico was deaf in one ear , which made it difficult for Delons to hear what others were saying .
 On 18 July 1988 , while on a vacation on Ibiza with Delons son Christian Aaron Ari Paffgen , the now red-haired Nico had a heart attack while riding a bicycle , and Delons hit Delons head as Delons fell .
 A passing taxi driver found Delons unconscious , and A passing taxi driver had difficulty getting her admitted to local hospitals .
 Delons was incorrectly diagnosed as suffering from heat exposure , and Delons died at eight oclock that the song Evening of Light .
 X-rays later revealed a severe cerebral hemorrhage as the cause of Delons death .
 the now red-haired Nico was buried in Delons mothers plot in Grunewald Forest Cemetery in Berlin .
 A few friends played a tape of Mutterlein , a song from Desertshore , at Delons funeral .
 the now red-haired Nico has influenced many musicians , including Siouxsie and the Siouxsie & The Banshees , Bauhaus , Elliott Smith , Patti Smith , Paul Morrissey , Icelandic singer Bjork , Henry Rollins , Coil , Jocelyn Pook , Fabienne Shine , Dead Can Dance , Marcus Reeves as well as numerous contemporary goth bands .
 Kevin Ayers painted a withering and beautiful portrait of Nico in Decadence Late singer-songwriter Elliott Smith cited Kevin Ayers as a major inspiration and was said to have listened to The Marble Index for months .
 Smith performed covers of some of Kevin Ayers songs - most notably Chelsea Girls and These Days , both of which he performed live at Satyricon in Portland , Oregon in October 1999 .
Two of her songs from Chelsea Girl , The Fairest of the Seasons and These Days , both written by Jackson Browne , are featured in Wes Anderson s film The Royal Tenenbaums .
 Shannon Hoon of Blind Melon named Shannon Hoon of Blind Melon daughter Nico Blue partly after Nico Blue partly after Nico .
 Blind Melons album Nico was released after Shannon Hoon of Blind Melon death .
 Hedwig and the Angry Inch , a movie written by John Cameron Mitchell , mentions Nico as an influential artist in the Angry Inch song , Midnight Radio .
The song is written by Stephen Trask .
 Icelandic singer Bjork opened concerts on Icelandic singer Bjork 1995-1997 Post tour with Le Petit Chevalier from Mutterlein , a song from Desertshore .
 The Cult recorded the song Nico Blue partly after Nico , which celebrates the life of the singer , on Hedwig and the Angry Inch 2001 album Beyond Good And Evil .
 For her 2002 album , Kissin Time , Marianne Faithfull recorded Song for Nico Blue partly after Nico , cowritten with Dave Stewart .
 Los Angeles band The Warlocks recorded a different song , also entitled Song for Nico Blue partly after Nico on The Warlocks 2003 album , Rise and the fall of the Berlin Wall .
 Nico Blue partly after Nico was portrayed by Christina Fulton in the 1991 biopic The Doors .
She was later portrayed by Meredith Ostrom in the 2006 film , Factory Girl , which chronicles the life of fellow Warhol Superstar , Edie Sedgwick .
Soap & Skin ; portrayed Nico in the theatre play Nico - Sphinx aus Eis in 2008 , written by Werner Fritsch .
 In the play , Nico Blue partly after Nico was portrayed by several actresses .
 Soap & Skin ; also recorded her song Janitor of Lunacy .
Natasha Khan has quoted Nico as an influence in particular Desertshore .
 During 2007 Natasha Khan would start concerts with Le Petit Chevalier from that record .
 Singer-songwriter Patrick Wolf has been influenced by Nico Blue partly after Nico , and released cover versions of Afraid and Aris Song as b-sides on EPs .
 Rock band Anberlin named one of their songs after Natasha Khan : Dance , Dance Christa Paffgen on their album Never Take Friendship Personal .
 The song also makes reference to Natasha Khan death , and Natasha Khan drug use .
 Austin based band Shearwater dedicated their album Palo Santo to the memory of Nico Blue partly after Nico .
 The opening song depicts the now red-haired Nico death at Ibiza in the Balearic Islands , Spain .
Windsor for the Derby , another Austin-based band , released an instrumental track named Nico in 2000 on their Young God Release Difference and Repetition .
A live version of the song can be found on a limited edition 7-inch .
 Marc Almond recorded singer Marc Almond song Your Kisses Burn from singer Marc Almond The Stars We Are album together with Nico in 1988 .
It was to be Nicos last studio recording .
Low , an American indie rock group from Duluth , Minnesota , has a song titled Those Girls .
It is included on the box set , released in 2004 .
 Two Nico Blue partly after Nico tribute concerts took place in Europe in the autumn of 2008 to commemorate the 70th anniversary of the now red-haired Nico birth and the 20th anniversary of her death .
 On 11 October 2008 , John Cale , James Dean Bradfield , Fyfe Dangerfield of The Guillemots , Mark Linkous , Peter Murphy , Lisa Gerrard and Mark Lanegan appeared on stage at the Royal Festival Hall in London .
 On 17 October 2008 at the Volksbuehne in Berlin , the now red-haired Nico ex-boyfriend Lutz Ulbrich presented another tribute concert , which featured Marianne Rosenberg , Soap & Skin ; , Marianne Enzensberger and James Young , the keyboardist from The Faction , the now red-haired Nico last band .
Nicos son , Ari Boulogne , made a brief appearance on stage at the close .

This featured photographs by Jerry Schatzberg .
