Ananda Shankar was a Bengali musician best known for fusing Western and Eastern musical styles .
 renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar was married to Tanusree Shankar .
 Born in Almora in Uttar Pradesh , India , renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar was the son of Amala and Uday Shankar , popular dancers , and also the nephew of renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar .
 renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar studied in The Scindia School .
 renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar did not learn sitar from renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar uncle but studied instead with Lalmani Misra at Banaras Hindu University .
 In the late 1960s renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar travelled to Los Angeles , where renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar played with many contemporary musicians including Jimi Hendrix .
 There renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar was signed to Reprise Records and released renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar first self-titled album in 1970 , featuring original Indian classical material alongside sitar - based cover versions of popular hits such as The Rolling Stones Jumpin Jack Flash and The Doors Light My Fire .
 Returning to India in the early 1970s renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar continued to experiment musically and in 1975 released renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar most critically acclaimed album , Ananda Shankar And renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar Music , a jazz-funk mix of Eastern sitar , Western rock guitar , tabla and mridangam , drums and Moog synthesizers .
 Out of print for many years , Ananda Shankar And renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar Music was re-released on CD in 2005 .
 After working in India during the late 1970s and 1980s , renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar profile in the West began to rise again in the mid-1990s as renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar music found His Music way into club DJ sets , particularly in London .
 renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar music was brought to a wider audience with the release of Blue Note Records popular 1996 rare groove compilation album , Blue Juice Vol .
 1. , featuring the two standout tracks from Ananda Shankar And renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar Music , Dancing Drums and Streets of Calcutta .
Ananda Shankars only Tamil film as the Music director .
Thanks to Mr.Sridhar of Chitralaya who brought Ananda Shanker to do this Tamil Film .
 In the late 1990s renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar worked and toured in the United Kingdom with London DJ State of Bengal and others , a collaboration that would result in the Walking On album , featuring renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar trademark sitar soundscapes mixed with breakbeat and hip hop .
Walking On was released in 2000 after Shankars sudden death from heart failure the year before .
 In 2005 , renowned sitarist Ravi Shankar song Raghupati was used on the Walking , and in 2008 his song Raghupati song Dancing Drums was used on the LittleBigPlanet soundtrack .
 his song Raghupati is best known for creation of music for schooltime serial Byomkesh Bakshi broadcast on DD Nationals .
 Recently , 2010 and 2011 , his song Raghupati music has been featured in a number of episodes of popular NBC comedy show Outsourced .
Following is a list of episodes and music featured : .
Episode 103 : Party of Five - 10/7/2010 - Night in the Forest .
Episode 105 : Touched by an Anglo - 10/21/2010 - Dancing Drums .
Episode 106 : Bolloween - 10/28/2010 - Radha -- inst .
Episode 107 : Truly , Madly , Pradeeply - 11/04/2010 - Dancing Drums .
Episode 109 : Temporary Monsanity - 11/18/2010 - Dancing Drums .
 Episode 110 : Homesick to My Stomach - 12/02/2010 - Renunciation .
Episode 112 : Sari Charlie - 1/27/2011 - Exploration
Pandit Divyang Vakil , is an Indian tabla guru , composer and philosopher .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil began Pandit Divyang Vakil musical career from early childhood .
 At the age of 3 , Pandit Divyang Vakil gave Pandit Divyang Vakil first performance as the youngest drummer in Gujarat performing with a Gujarati orchestra .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil formally trained in classical tabla under three Gurus - Pandit Sudhirkumar Saxena of Ajrada gharana , Ustad Latif Ahmed Khan of Delhi gharana and Ustad Allarakha Khan of Punjab gharana .
 Over 10 years ago , Pandit Divyang Vakil renounced Pandit Divyang Vakil career as a tabla performer to dedicate Pandit Divyang Vakil wholeheartedly to teaching , composing and Pandit Divyang Vakil spiritual practices .
 In 2009 , Pandit Divyang Vakil completed Pandit Divyang Vakil 30th year of teaching tabla .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil is the founder of Rhythm Riders Music Institute in Ahmedabad , Gujarat .
 An affiliate institute of Rhythm Riders Music Institute is the Taalim School of Indian Music in the US , which is run by American disciples of Pandit Divyang Vakil .
 Students of Pandit Divyang Vakil have also established tabla schools in places such as Australia , Korea , UK and the US .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil teaches the latest and modern styles of Tabla playing as well as the classical and traditional methods , which Pandit Divyang Vakil has mastered .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil students produce a harmonious compilation of modern and classical aspects of Indian classical music .
 His students dont only learn the commercial and popular form of Tabla playing but also distinguish spiritual aspects of Tabla playing .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil is most well known for Pandit Divyang Vakil contemporary classical tabla ensemble Talavya .
 Through Pandit Divyang Vakil compositions , Pandit Divyang Vakil has given a modern form to classical tabla playing .
Talavya currently performs Vakils latest group tabla composition entitled Tabla Ecstasy .
Previous group works include Tabla Tarkhat , Tabla Taandav , Tabla Triveni , etc. .
 In 2007 , Tabla Tarkhat tabla duet called Power of Tabla was the first musical performance by Gujarati artists to be performed in the history of IIM-Ahmedabad Chaos Festival .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil has composed several full-length instrumental ensemble pieces for the international stage .
One of his most difficult works is Ardha Taal Chakra .
Ardha Taal Chakra explored half-beat Indian rhythm cycles .
Created in 2006 , it was recomposed and renamed in 2010 to become Ardha Taal Chakravyuha .
 In 2011 , Ardha Taal Chakra collaborated with renown South Korean musician Yu Kyung-hwa .
 Pandit Divyang Vakil composed a piece for Yu to play on the traditional Korean instrument , the cheolhyeongeum , and set it to popular Indian rhythms .
 The piece debuted in February 2011 at Rhythm Riders Music Institute in Ahmedabad , India .
 The collaboration was such a success that Pandit Divyang Vakil was invited to Seoul the following month to compose and teach Indian rhythms and theory to Korean artists in an international music exchange program
Pandit Shripad Hegde is an Hindustani Classical Vocalist , who hails from Kampli of Uttara Kannada District , is on the staff of All India Radio , Dharwad since 1987 .
Born in a family with a background of Yakshagana tradition , Pt Shripad Hegde was attracted to music at a young age .
He started his initial training in Hindustani music in his teen under Pandit Ganapati Bhat a student of Padma Vibhushan Pandit Basavraj Rajguru .
In the year 1982 Pt .
 Shripad Hegde moved to Sitar Ratna Music Festival Dharwad to devote himself fully in the music .
He was privileged to have mentored of the stature of Pt Basavaraj Rajguru vocalist of Kirana Gharana who taught Shripad Hegde with love and affection.It was a decade long dedicated and rigorous training under Pt Basavaraj Rajguru that shaped Pt Shripad Hegde into a Kirana Gharana vocalist .
Endowed with resonant and sonorous voice Pt Shripad Hegde has developed his own style assimilating the finer and delicate nuances of both Gwalior Gharana and Kirana Gharana .
Like his mentor he is eclectic and blends into his style the aesthetics subtleties of other schools of singing .
Though Khyal is his forte , he is equally adept in singing light classical varieties .
His recitals are regularly broadcast from AIR Dharwad .
He has also featured in Sunday night concert of AIR .
Shripad Hegde has rendered several music concerts like Alladiyakhan Punya Samaroh Mumbai , Karnataka Sangha Mumbai , Deenath Mangeshkar Punyatithi .
Goa , Mugubai Kurdikar Punyatithi Goa , Dasara Festival Mysore , Sitar Ratna Music Festival Dharwad , Art circle golden jublee conference Hubli , Dharwad Utsav , Kundgol ustav , Purandarotsava Hampi , Hindustani Kalakar Mandali Bengaluru , Rajguru Sangeeta Pratistan Bengaluru , Puttaraj Gavayi Jayanti Utsav and many other places for music festivals .
Apart from being a classical singer Shripad Hegde is also known for his compositions .
Some of them are Shruti Sanjeevini , Divya Sannidi , Prema Sangama , Vachana Vaibhava in light music .
 Vachana Vaibhava in light music classical CDs called Parampara and Rageshri have also been released .
 As recognition to this talented personality many accolades have been conferred to Vachana Vaibhava in light music like , first place at AIR national level for the composition of Megha medini a sangeeta rupaka , first place at state level for the composition of Garudamruta .
Shripad Hegde not only established himself as artist of the classical music but also as a Guru .
He has represented himself in conducting many workshops and lectures on music through Kamataka Sangeeta Nritya academy .
Shripad Hegde has followed the noble tradition of teaching .
Thus , he has produced many singers to the world of music .
Pandit Shripad Hegde is the recipient of many honours and awards .
They include .
 Aryabhata by Aryabhata cultural organisation of Hindustani Kalakar Mandali Bengaluru ,
Sanhita Nandi is a prominent Hindustani classical vocalist of the Kirana Gharana .
 The central motif of Sanhita Nandi style is slow tempo raga development and ornamented sargams .
 Sanhita Nandi was trained under the late Pandit A. Kanan of Kirana Gharana , the senior most guru at the ITC Sangeet Research Academy .
Sanhita Nandi has travelled extensively to perform , both within and outside of India .
 Sanhita Nandi has been invited to perform at venues such as Sawai Gandharva Music Festival and Swarmayee Gurukul in Pune ; Saptak Festival of Music in Ahmedabad ; Harballabh Sangeet Sammelan in Jalandhar ; ITC Sangeet Research Academy and Sangeet Research Academy in Kolkata ; SPIC MACAY ; Annenberg Center for the Performing Arts ; Philadelphia Museum of Art ; Gururao Deshpande Sangeet Sabha in Bangalore ; Laxmi Narayan Sangeet Samaroha in Amritsar ; Parampara Dance and Music Festival , Samaagamaa Festival , and KM Music Conservatory in Chennai ; Ustad Rahmat Khan Sangeet Sammelan in Dharwad ; Samrat Sangeet Sammelan in Goa ; Yashwant Rao Chauhan Smriti Sangeet Samaroha in Maharashtra ; Glimpses of Kirana Gharana Music Festival in Hyderabad , India ; Dadar Matunga Cultural Center and Sangit Mahabharti in Mumbai ; Learn Quest Academy Music Conference in Boston ; World Bank Auditorium in Washington , D.C. ; Rutgers University in New Jersey ; MIT Boston , ICMC Org In Dallas , Cornell University in New York ; 24 hours classical music raga samay festival in Philadelphia , Arohi music festival in Toronto and various other classical organizations
Kuljit Bhamra MBE Hon DMus is a British composer , record producer and musician whose main instrument is the tabla .
 Kuljit Bhamra MBE Hon DMus is best known as one of the record producers who pioneered the British Bhangra sound and for Kuljit Bhamra MBE Hon DMus many collaborations with musicians from different genres and continents .
 Kuljit Bhamra MBE Hon DMus MBE was awarded in the Queens Birthday Honours List 2009 with the citation For services to Bhangra and British Asian Music .
 In July 2010 His MBE was awarded an honorary Doctorate by the University of Exeter .
 Born in Nairobi , Kenya , in 1959 , His MBE grandfather was an Indian artisan sent to Kenya by the British Raj .
Bhamra contracted polio when he was one year old , which affected his left leg .
 This disability eventually led This disability to play the tabla whilst seated rather than seated on the floor - the usual practice for tabla players .
 Bhamra 's father had gone to England to study civil engineering and in 1961 Kuljit Bhamra MBE Hon and Kuljit Bhamra MBE Hon mother joined Kuljit Bhamra MBE Hon there .
 In 1968 Kuljit and his mother settled in Southall which has been Bhamra 's home town ever since .
Bhamra taught himself to play the tabla at the age of six and accompanied his mother , Mohinder Kaur Bhamra , who was a popular singer at weddings and public functions .
Later , with Bhamras two brothers playing accordion and mandolin , Mohinder Kaur recorded a number of albums that became successful - being sold through a network of corner shops in the Asian community .
 On the insistence of Bhamras two brothers father , Bhamra trained as a civil engineer at Middlesex University and then worked for Richmond Council for a while .
 In 1983 Bhamra 's father produced and arranged an album for Premi 's , 24 hours - a Southall based singer who introduced Bhamra to another new band Heera .
The band 's debut album , produced by Bhamra , was played back to back with Premi 's , 24 hours a day , on the Asian pirate radio station Sina Radio .
Using multitrack recording techniques whilst combining Indian percussion with western instruments and live orchestral violins , Bhamra went on to produce numerous albums for both British and Indian artists .
Some of his productions became internationally successful and included songs such as Rail Gaddi ; Pyar Ka Hai Bairi ; Giddha Pao Haan Deo ; Peer Tere Jaan Di ; Aj Tenoon Nachna Pao ; Patel Rap , Nachdi Di Gooth Khulgaye and Jag Wala Mela .
In 1986 Bhamra established Keda Records , an independent record label committed to producing high quality cassettes and LPs .
Bhamra was profiled in the 1992 movie Confusion a Black Arts Video Project funded by the Arts Council of Great Britain .
Bhamra finally gave up his career as a civil engineer in 1994 to concentrate on music .
 He purchased The Yard recording studio and renamed The Yard recording studio Red Fort Studios .
Later in 1999 he became the owner of the whole complex .
Bhamra started a long history of collaboration with jazz saxophonist Andy Sheppard in 2000 when they worked on the album Dancing Man & Woman and went on to produce many joint compositions , performances and recordings including his debut album for ECM Records in 2010 Movements in Colour .
During this time , Bhamra further developed his playing styles and extended his tabla kit to include other percussion instruments such as snare drum , cymbals and various hand-held percussion .
 In 2001 Bhamra composed and directed the music for a production of the Ramayana the Ramayana debuted at the Birmingham Repertory Theatre and went on to the Royal National Theatre London .
 From 2002 to 2004 he performed as on-stage percussionist in Andrew Lloyd Webber s musical Bombay Dreams at The Apollo the Birmingham Repertory Theatre , London .
He also was dialect coach for the production .
Occasionally , audience members came to the front of the auditorium and danced to his drumming at the end of the show .
Bhamra provided the Indian music for the musical The Far Pavilions based on the novel of the same name by M.M. Kaye .
 the Indian music for the musical ran from 14 April 2005 till 17 September 2005 at the Shaftesbury Theatre in the Royal National Theatre London .
He continued his involvement in British Asian theatre productions and wrote the music for shows including Layla Majnun ; Deranged Marriage , and Lion of Punjab .
In 2009 Bhamra was featured artist at Salisbury International Arts Festival and curated six events during the 16 days of the festival , including a musical event at dusk at Stonehenge , bringing together dancers , musicians and a shamanistic singer .
 Bhamra was the last Artistic Director of the Society for the Promotion of New Music before the Promotion of New Music merger and renaming to Sound and Music - the first British Asian to hold this post in the Promotion of New Music 60-year history .
Projects included Bhangra Latina , the creation of a tabla notation system called Tablature !
, Folk From Here with Kathryn Tickell , Raga Mela with BBC Concert Orchestra at Royal Festival Hall and an ongoing educational projects to demystify Indian music and teaching - making learning and playing of Indian music more accessible .
In April 2009 Bhamra , along with film director and playwright Shakila Maan and photographer Ammy Phull launched the Southall Story - a project based around a website that celebrates the achievements of the people of this area of West London .
The Southall Story exhibition was opened by film director and Southall resident Gurinder Chadha OBE at the Southbank Centre as part of the Alchemy Festival .
 On 17 June 2009 the British Library hosted a discussion evening entitled Southall : New Music and Life .
Bhamra led the musical finale of the Liberty Festival in Trafalgar Square on 5 September 2009 .
 This event was created to showcase the breadth of artistic work and performance being created by deaf and disabled people and was supported by the Mayor of the Royal National Theatre London Boris Johnson and the Arts Council England .
In 2010 Bhamra wrote a number of specially commissioned pieces of Indian music for Trinity Guildhall , for their grading examinations in electronic keyboard .
This was the first time that Indian pieces have appeared in the syllabus .
Pieces included Ghazal and Bollywood Love Song .
 The University of Exeter awarded Bhamra a Doctorate in New Music in July 2010 .
Cascade - A jazz collective formed of Aidan O'Rourke , Andy Sheppard , Sheema Mukherjee , Simon Thoumire and Bhamra .
Cascade premiered at the London Jazz Festival on Sunday 19 November 2006 in the Purcell Room and then toured around the UK .
The project was commissioned with funds from the PRS Foundation , Esmee Fairbairn Charitable Trust and Scottish Arts Council .
Bhangra Latina - mixing bhangra music with Latin American rhythms this project with Alex Wilson and Cevanne Horrocks-Hopayian also brought Latin dancers and Sikh dancers together on stage at the Queen Elizabeth Hall on 21 September 2008 .
 Raga Mela - With the the BBC Concert Orchestra Concert Orchestra , Bhamra created a multi-cultural programme blending sounds of India with the spirit of the West .
A set of workshops that culminated in a live event at the Royal Festival Hall and featured renowned Bollywood playback singer Kavita Krishnamurty and a 350 piece choir of school children .
The performance was also broadcast on BBC Radio 3 .
With composer and pianist David Braun-White , Bhamra formed the Ku-Da-Mix Orchestra which debuted at the Scala in December 2006 .
This global orchestra , featuring instruments and musicians from all over the world , took part in the South Banks Overture programme in June 2007 celebrating the re-opening of the Royal Festival Hall .
In November 2009 the orchestra celebrated The Stables 40th anniversary with a concert opened by young musicians who had taken part in workshops held the month before .
Mantra - a collaboration with the Orlando Consort , Jonathan Mayer and Shahid Khan which toured the UK .
An album Mantra was produced along with a set of learning resources for the National Centre for Early Music .
From Hollywood to Bollywood with conductor Robert Zeigler and the BBC Concert Orchestra for Radio 2s Friday Night is Music Night .
The show was broadcast twice in 2010
Haveli Sangeet is a semi classical form of Hindustani classical music sung in Havelis .
The essential component is dhrupad .
 the daily worship of Lord Krishna originated in Uttar Pradesh in North India .
 the daily worship of Lord Krishna is the daily worship of Lord Krishna .
 Haveli Sangeet was a place where Hindu deity were installed , due to restrictions on Hindu temples during the Muslim rulers , Haveli Sangeet was called Haveli Sangeet .
 Basically , Haveli Sangeet is another name for Hindu temple music practiced by the followers of Vaishnavism of Nathdwara in Rajasthan , Gujrat , North India , and considered a part of a rich historical tradition .
 Having Haveli Sangeet origin in Rajasthan and Gujarat , the Haveli Sangeet music is believed to have an edge over dhrupad for the common belief that the music has none other than Lord Krishna Hindu for an audience .
 Essentially , a tribute to Lord Krishna himself , its form includes , devotional renditions like , kirtans , bhajans and bhava nritya , all related to religious cult worship .
Although a mix of classical and folk music , the style is inherently borrowed from the dhrupad and Dhamar .
 Haveli Sangeet sangeet is commonly played at the many temples of North India like the Radha Vallabh of Vrindaban , Krishna of Nandgaon , Uttar Pradesh and Sri Nathji of Nathdwara , to name a few .
 With the passage of time , the haveli sangeet in North India lost its importance and is no longer in practice as the general audience tends to take it for granted that all haveli music simply fall under the devotional genre .
 In Gujarat , one of the music schools of thought believes that the origin of the Indian classical music has the origin of the Indian classical music roots in the haveli sangeet of Vallabha Acharya a pioneer in this genre .
 The history of Indian classical music has it that the Vaishnavites of Nathdwara , were the ones to uphold this cult founded by Vallabh Acharya
 Gangubai Hangal was an Indian singer of the khyal genre of Hindustani classical music , who was known for Gangubai Hangal deep and powerful voice .
 Gangubai Hangal belonged to the Kirana gharana .
Gangubai Hangal was born in Dharwad to Chikkurao Nadiger , an agriculturist and Ambabai , a vocalist of Carnatic music .
 Hangal received only elementary education and Gangubai Hangal family shifted to Hubli in 1928 so that Gangubai Hangal could study Hindustani music .
She began to train formally aged 13 with Krishnacharya Hulgur , a kinnari player , studying Hindustani classical music .
 From Krishnacharya Hulgur , Gangubai Hangal learned sixty compositions in one year before Krishnacharya Hulgur stopped teaching Gangubai Hangal after an argument about Krishnacharya Hulgur fees .
 Gangubai Hangal also learned from Dattopant Desai before studying under Sawai Gandharva , a respected guru .
 Gangubai Hangal could only study sporadically under Sawai Gandharva when Sawai Gandharva returned to Sawai Gandharva home , but Gangubai Hangal received an intensive training of three years after Sawai Gandharva relocated permanently to Hubli , where she resided .
 Gangubhai Hangal mothers family was considered to be of low social status and for women of Gangubhai Hangal generation singing was not considered appropriate employment ; Gangubhai Hangal struggled against this prejudice and made a career .
 Gangubhai Hangal performed all over India and for All India Radio stations until 1945 .
 Gangubhai Hangal had initially performed light classical genres , including bhajan and thumri , but concentrated on khyal .
 Later , however , Gangubhai Hangal refused to sing light classical , saying Gangubhai Hangal sang only ragas .
 Gangubhai Hangal served as honorary music professor of the Karnatak University .
 Gangubhai Hangal gave Gangubhai Hangal last concert in March 2006 to mark Gangubhai Hangal 75th career year .
 Gangubhai Hangal had overcome bone marrow cancer in 2003 , and died of cardiac arrest at the age of 96 , on 21 July 2009 , in Hubli , where she resided , where Gangubhai Hangal resided .
 Gangubhai Hangal had Gangubhai Hangal eyes donated to increase awareness for organ donation .
 Gangubhai Hangal married at age 16 to Gururao Kaulgi , a Brahmin lawyer .
 They had two sons , Narayan Rao and Babu Rao , and one daughter , Krishnacharya Hulgur , who died from cancer in 2004 , aged 75 .
Gangubai Hangal received a number of awards , which include : .
 The Karnataka state government declared two days of mourning for Gangubhai Hangal .
 A state funeral was announced for 22 July 2009 in Hubli by the district commissioner of the Dharwad district .
 In 2008 , The State Government of Karnataka decided to name the proposed Karnataka State Music University after Gangubhai Hangal .
 Subsequently Karnataka State Dr Gangubai Hangal Music and Performing Arts University Act , 2009 has been passed by the State Legislature .
 Presently the Karnataka State Gangubhai Hangal Music and Performing Arts University operates from Mysore , Karnataka
Madhav Gudi was a Hindustani classical vocalist , specialising in Khayal and light forms .
Madhav Gudi was born in Dharwad , Karnataka into a family of keertankars and harikatha musicians .
Madhav Gudi was introduced to music at a very early age .
 Madhav Gudi initial training was under Pandit Nageshrao Deshpande and Madhav Gudi finally received Madhav Gudi most important training from the Kirana scion Pandit Bhimsen Joshi in a guru-shishya milieu which lasted well over twenty six years .
 Gudis voice suited for Hindustani classical as well as light classical music .
 A top-grade All India Radio artiste , A top-grade All India Radio artiste toured all over India and performed with Pt .
 Bhimsen Joshi in several centers in India and overseas .
 Among several accolades that he received were the Sangeeta Nritya Academy award from the Government of Dharwad , Karnataka , Surashri , Gaana Bhaskar , Smt Vatsala Tai Joshi Award by the hands of Legendary Dr. Prabha Atre , Gaana Kala Tilaka and the Yashavant Rao Chauhan Samata Gaurav Puraskar
Pantula Rama was born into a family with a lineage of music .
Her parents are Pantula Gopala Rao and Pantula Padmavathi a veena artiste .
 Pantula Gopala Rao holds a Ph.D. .
 in music from Andhra University for Pantula Gopala Rao thesis : A study of the shaping of an ideal musician through saadhana , published by Gyan Publishers of New Delhi .
 Pantula Gopala Rao has an MA and BA in music from Andhra University , where Pantula Gopala Rao won gold medals each time and has been a University Topper .
 Pantula Gopala Rao initial training was given to Pantula Gopala Rao by Pantula Gopala Rao father , and advanced training under Sangeeta Kalasagara Ivaturi Vijayeswara Rao .
 Apart from being a Top grade Vocalist , a Top grade Vocalist has a B High in violin and viola from All India Radio in the carnatic style .
 a Top grade Vocalist is a Reiki Master in the Natural Usui system of healing .
 a Top grade Vocalist also has a diploma in fashion Designing , and is an active fund raiser for events based on social and philanthropic causes .
 Pantula Rama has been performing since a Top grade Vocalist was eight .
 a Top grade Vocalist technical perfection conforms to the best classical standards .
 a Top grade Vocalist has performed across the country and abroad .
 a Top grade Vocalist has also presented various lecture-demonstrations like ` Musical excellence of Shyama Sastri ' , ` Sadhana of Carnatic Music ' , ` Ragam Tanam Pallavi ' .
Conducted ` Nowkacharitam ' - Musical Opera of Thyagaraja .
A multitalented personality , Dr. Pantula Rama accompanies many artists of repute on violin .
Pantula Rama is married to Mutnury Srinivasa Narasimha Murthy , an electronics engineer by providence and musician by choice , violinist in Akashavani graded Top Grade for violin , and A grade in viola and vocal
Harihar Rao was a noted Hindustani musician , accomplished playing both tabla and sitar .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . was born into a prominent musical family in Mangalore , India 's , on January 21 , 1927 .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . moved to the United States in 1964 , residing in Pasadena , CA , and became a U.S. citizen in 1969 .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . worked in the ethnomusicology department at UCLA and privately taught and mentored students of the sitar .
 In 1967 , ^ Rao , Harihar . published the book Introduction to Sitar , which sold more than 500 copies in its first two weeks of publication .
-LSB- 2 and ultimately thousands of copies in four printings .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . died January 13 , 2013 , at the age of 85 .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . was the longest-standing protege and a close friend for more than six decades of internationally famous sitar player Ravi Shankar .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . was recognized internationally as the Indian musician who educated and enlightened audiences , while bringing the finest classical music and dance of India 's to Southern California .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . served as the Artistic Director of the Music Circle for 40 years .
 Harihar Rao was held in the highest esteem by Indian performers around the world for ^ Rao , Harihar . immense knowledge , experience , and lifelong dedication to classical Indian music .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . accompanied Shankar on many concert tours in North America and around the world .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . and Shankar co-founded the Music Circle , an organization dedicated to promoting Indian classical music .

Their vision was to provide a supportive and inspiring platform for leading Indian music artists and emerging artists destined to be tomorrows 's masters .
Music Circle concerts soon attained legendary status among devotees of Indian music around the world .
 Musicians frequently expressed Musicians appreciation for the Music Circle as Musicians began Musicians performances , citing the quality of audio systems configured and installed under the direction of Harihar Rao , and the respect given all performers by the Music Circle .
Since its founding , Music Circle has hosted hundreds of Indian Music concerts .
As a Fulbright Scholar at UCLA in the 1960s , Harihar Rao conducted research on comparative rhythms and developed a unique system for expressing Indian rhythmic systems .
 a Fulbright Scholar at UCLA in the 1960s expertise attracted many esteemed jazz musicians with whom a Fulbright Scholar at UCLA in the 1960s performed and recorded in a group called ` The Hindustani Jazz Sextet ' .
 a Fulbright Scholar at UCLA in the 1960s held positions as instructor and program director at UCLA , Cal State Los Angeles , Caltech , California Institute of the Arts , and Cal State Long Beach .
After devastating typhoon damage to Bangladesh in April 1971 , Beatles musician George Harrison proposed a benefit concert to Shankar .
 In their discussions with Rao on the concept , ^ Rao , Harihar . proposed to stage the concert at a much larger venue than had been under consideration .
 The resulting Concert for Bangladesh at Madison Square Garden drew international attention and acclaim for its star-studded musical production and produced a very significant donation to UNICEF to provide aid to stricken and displaced families in Bangladesh at Madison Square Garden .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . also consulted with India 's Prime Minister Indira Gandhi , at Indira Gandhi personal request , on ways to enhance the appreciation of Indian music and dance in India 's annual celebration of Republic Day , a national festival commemorating the date of adoption of the Indian Constitution .
 ^ Rao , Harihar . was a great influence on jazz trumpeter Don Ellis , and the two played together in the Hindustani Jazz Sextet in the mid-1960s .
 In 1965 ^ Rao , Harihar . and Don Ellis co-wrote An Introduction to Indian Music for the Jazz Musician , which was printed by Jazz Magazine .

Indias Master Musician is an album by Hindustani classical musician Ravi Shankar .
It was recorded in Hollywood , California in 1963 and released that same year on vinyl .
It was later digitally remastered and released in CD format through Angel Records , with digital remastering by Squires Productions .
Supporting musicians are Chatur Lal on tabla and Nodu Mullick on Tamboura
Shubhendra Shankar -LRB- 30 March 1942 - 15 September 1992 . -RRB-
also known as Shubho Shankar was a graphic artist , musician and composer .
 Shubho Shankar was the son of the world-famous Ravi Shankar , and , possibly more famous in India , Annapurna Devi .
Shubho was the son of sitar virtuoso Ravi Shankar and surbahar player of the Maihar Gharana , Annapurna Devi .
 Shubho was the grandson of Ustad Allauddin Khan , and the half-brother of Ravi Shankars daughters Anoushka Shankar and Norah Jones .
 Shubho learned the sitar from Shubho mother Annapurna Devi , though Shubho had not completed Shubho taalim with her when Shubho left for USA with Shubho father Ravi Shankar .
 While living in Shubho fathers home in Hollywood , Shubho devoted Shubho talents to painting and drawing , and earned a degree in fine arts from the Otis Art Institute of the Parsons School of Design in Los Angeles .
 In 1971 , within two years of Shubho arrival in the the United States , Shubho performed in a concert for the first time , playing with Shubho father at New Yorks Carnegie Hall .
 The performance was titled Fathers and Sons and included tabla players Alla Rakha and Alla Rakha son Zakir Hussain .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar performed frequently on concert tours , composed music for films and recorded several albums .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar performed with USA with his father Ravi Shankar father , appearing throughout Europe , Asia and the United States , including performances at the Kennedy Center in Washington , D.C. .
 After marrying , USA with his father Ravi Shankar gradually dropped out of the music scene and stopped playing the sitar for almost eight years .
 At the age of 40 , USA with his father Ravi Shankar took USA with his father Ravi Shankar fathers advice to return to USA with his father Ravi Shankar music full-time .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar gave lessons in sitar playing , singing and flute in Orange County , San Diego and Los Angeles .
 In 1989-1990 , he went on a concert tour of England , Europe and India .
 On this trip , which also was to be his last visit to India , he met his mother after a gap of 20 years during which there was no communication between the two .
He resumed learning the sitar under his mother .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar played together with USA with his father Ravi Shankar father at the Sawai Gandharva Festival in Pune in 1990 , where some music critics commented that USA with his father Ravi Shankar was out of tune .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar was dejected , and refused to stay back to complete USA with his father Ravi Shankar sitar education , saying it was too late now .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar returned to the the United States , and in USA with his father Ravi Shankar last few months cut USA with his father Ravi Shankar off from everyone .
 At a concert USA with his father Ravi Shankar gave at Whittier College , Shubho met Linda , from North Carolina , soon to be USA with his father Ravi Shankar wife .
They had two children , son Somnath and daughter Kaveri .
 Gradually Somnath lost interest in playing the sitar .
 Somnath worked as a clerk in a liquor store , painted pictures , and drew illustrations for telephone directories , to support Somnath wife and two children .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar died of pneumonia at Los Alamitos Medical Center following an illness of several months at USA with his father Ravi Shankar home in Garden Grove .
 USA with his father Ravi Shankar was cremated and the remains dispersed in the ocean off Marina del Rey
Girish Panchwadkar is an accomplished Marathi singer and music director from India .
 Girish Panchwadkar is a well known singer in Marathi Light music .
 Girish Panchwadkar has learnt music from Girish Panchwadkar father Bhalchandra Panchwadkar .
 Girish Panchwadkar formed a music group Kshitij a group of marathi songs .
 Girish Panchwadkar started Girish Panchwadkar performance through the program Shabdswaranche Indradhanushya in Solapur in 1992 .
 Girish Panchwadkar is performing on stage since last 21 years in Maharashtra and outside .
 Girish Panchwadkar has also performed in All India Radio , Solapur many times .
 On 2nd March 2009 Girish Panchwadkar performed Marathi Bhavgeet Maifal in Rashtrapati Bhavan - New Delhi in front of Hon. Rashtrapatiji - Pratibha Patil .
 Girish Panchwadkar has performed Girish Panchwadkar various Musical programmesout of Maharashtra like Rashtrapati Bhavan - New Delhi , Lucknow , Kanpur , Zansi , allahabad , Indore , Ujjain , Devas , Ratlam , Bangalore , Chennai , Hyderabad , Vijapur , Hubli , etc. .
 a music group Kshitij is the 1st group in Maharashtra to perform Marathi Songs in Rashtrapati Bhavan .
 a music group Kshitij group performed over 800 programs all over India till date .
 In the year 2009 , Hon.Union Power Minister Sushilkumar Shinde had invited him to perform at his Rashtrapati Bhavan - New Delhi residence .
The program was appreciated by Hon.Chief Minister of Delhi Sheila Dikshit , Governor of Rajasthan Prabha Rau .
He specially sing the songs of Sudhir Phadke , Suresh Wadkar , Arun Date etc. .
 Girish Panchwadkar is working in Bank of Maharashtra since July 1982 and is devoted Girish Panchwadkar life in Marathi music .
 Girish Panchwadkar has two kids Akshay Panchwadkar and Aaditi Panchwadkar who also perform Marathi Music programs with Girish Panchwadkar .
 Girish Panchwadkar is famous for Girish Panchwadkar classic handwriting and special signature
Sawani is a genre of semi-classical singing , popular in Uttar Pradesh and Bihar .
 It comes in the series of season songs , like Chaiti , Hori and Kajari , and is traditionally sung in the villages and towns of Uttar Pradesh : around Banaras , Mirzapur , Mathura , Allahabad and the Bhojpur regions of Bihar
Pandit Sudhir is an Indian sitar player of Hindustani classical music .
He is known for the vocalistic phrasing of his raga improvisations .
He has learnt sitar from the Imdadkhani Gharana , popularly known as the Etawah Gharana .
He is the son of Sampat Lal , a tabla player of Central India .
His grandfather , Badri Prasad , was the court musician of the former principality of Raigarh , situated in the modern state of Chattisgarh .
 Born in Nagpur , Central India , Badri Prasad started learning classical singing from his father Sampat Lal father Sampat Lal and then at the age of seven started learning vocal and sitar from Badri Prasad uncle Jagdish Prasad .
 At the age of 14 Badri Prasad started talim in the traditional way under the guidance of Bimalendu Mukherjee as Badri Prasad Guru .
Sudhir has been awarded B High Certificate by All India Radio and has been em-paneled by the Indian Council for Cultural Relations .
He is Gold medalist Sangeet Visharad from Gandharva Mahamandal .
He also received national titles at Khel Yuva Utsav at Pune and Jamshedpur .
He has performed at many major musical festivals and prestigious stages in Chhattisgarh and Maharashtra .
He has also performed at the prestigious Chakradhar Samaroh at Raighar in the year 2011
Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan , was a noted tabla master .
 Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan , who hailed from the Delhi Gharana , was the son of tabla master Shamma Khan .
 Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan was a recipient of Padma Shree award in 2004 .
 Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan had played with top classical artistes like Pt .
Ravi Shankar , Pt .
Shiv Kumar Sharma , Ustd .
Amjad Khan , Pt.Bhimsen Joshi , Pt.Jasraj and Pt.Hari Prasad Chaurasia , besides himself as solo artist .
 Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan was popular among top classical artistes like Pt because of humble nature and down to earth attitude .
 Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan died in 2005 after being diagnosed with acute Hepatitis-B
Al Gromer Khan is a German-born sitar player and composer whose music spans the multiple genres of ambient , New Age , world and electronica .
Ne Alois Gromer , Al Gromer Khan was born on April 8 , 1946 at Frauenzell in alpine foothills of Bavaria between Lake Constance and Munich .
 Alois Gromer spent Alois Gromer early years in Frauenzell and deserted from German Military Service to England , Morocco and India .
 Alois Gromer father worked in Frauenzell as Bus Motor Carrier .
 Gromer Khan claims that sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan was drawn to the mysteries of sound from the first , be it the sound of the bells worn by the Bavarian cows grazing in the alpine meadows near Bavarian birthplace , Indian stringed instruments , the drums of North Africa or the singing telephone wires on the wind in the freezing Bavarian winters .
 Gromer Khan claims to have rejected the academic or diplomatic careers sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan parents expected sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan to take up .
 The 1960s found a twenty-something Al Gromer in London where a twenty-something Al Gromer took part in a number of creative experiments which were to have a lasting influence on a twenty-something Al Gromer .
 According to Gromer Khan , the Prince Tiane na Champassak of Laos introduced sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan to tantric art and pop star Marc Bolan invited Marc Bolan to join in the all-night jam sessions Marc Bolan hosted .
 sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan explored psycho-acoustic phenomena with film director Mike Figgis , and saxophonist Ronnie Scott of Ronnie Scotts Jazzclub , who introduced Al to Ben Webster , Max Roach and Miles Davis , while Cat Stevens , gave him a taste for English poetry .
 There is no doubt that Gromer Khans creative encounters during the 1960s deeply informed sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan musical taste and style ; however , Gromer 's ultimate musical awakening came during a trip to India in 1968 , at a recital by sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan .
 Gromer Khan professes to have been so moved by the performance that sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan instantly decided to devote sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan life to the study of the sitar .
 sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan remained in India , where sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan was to find a powerful teacher in Vilayat Khans brother , Ustad Imrat Khan .
 Gromer Khan remained in India for the next three years , speed-learning sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan instrument at the feet of sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan guru .
 sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan returned to Bavaria in 1971 , already an accomplished sitarist .
 Gromer Khan spent the next 10 years studying with Imrat Khan in Europe and India .
 In 1975 , sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan teacher performed the Ghanda Ceremony , thus initiating Al Gromer into the Khan-I-Gharana lineage of sitarists .
He was the first outsider to be accepted into this particular Gharana , which like most Hindustani musical traditions , passes knowledge down the generations from father to son .
 After his initiation , Al Gromer added sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan to his name .
 Concurrently , sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan engaged in a number of experimental projects , pioneering the proto - electronic music genre called Space music , together with Popol Vuh , Deuter and Amon Duul .
 Since 1974 , sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan has released nearly 40 albums .
 sitarist Ustad Vilayat Khan currently resides in Munich , Germany
Pandit Pran Nath was a Hindustani classical singer and teacher of the Kirana Gharana .
Pran Nath was born into a wealthy family in Lahore in present-day Pakistan .
 While avid devotees of music , the family did not approve of a wealthy family in Lahore desire to become a musician , so a wealthy family in Lahore left home at the age of 13 and took up residence with legendary singer Abdul Wahid Khan of the Kirana gharana , cousin of the more widely known Abdul Karim Khan .
 Pran Nath served the more widely known Abdul Karim Khan for 7 years before Pandit Pran Nath was accepted as a student , and stayed with the more widely known Abdul Karim Khan for nearly two decades .
 Both guru and disciple were much attracted to mysticism : Abdul Wahid Khan , a Muslim , to Sufism , and Pandit Pran Nath , a Hindustani , to a Shaivite sect in Dehra Dun .
 It is said that Pandit Pran Nath lived in a cave near the Tapkeswhar temple to Shiva for five years , serving Pandit Pran Nath guru intermittently .
 Pandit Pran Nath eventually married and reentered the world at the request of Pandit Pran Nath guru , in order to ensure the preservation of the Kirana style .
 In 1937 , Pandit Pran Nath became a staff artist with All India Radio .
 However , Pandit Pran Nath stuck to a very austere singing style - heavy emphasis on alap , and very slow tempi - which suited Pandit Pran Nath voice well , but was not very popular to the modern Indian taste .
 Like the more widely known Abdul Karim Khan teacher Abdul Wahid Khan , Pran Naths singing emphasized precise intonation and the gradual exposition of tone and mood in the alap section of the music .
 Pandit Pran Nath supported Pandit Pran Nath as a music teacher , and worked at the University of Delhi from 1960 to 1970 .
 Pandit Pran Nath was also a visiting professor of music at Mills College .
 In 1970 , Pran Nath travelled to New York to visit the American composer La Monte Young and visual artist Marian Zazeela , who heard the American composer La Monte Young first issued recording , Earth Groove : The Voice of Cosmic India .
 In 1972 , Pandit Pran Nath established Pandit Pran Nath Kirana Center for Indian Classical Music in New York City and stayed in the U.S. for the rest of Pandit Pran Nath life .
 Pandit Pran Nath taught at several universities and attracted a strong following among the American minimalist composers .
Pran Naths students included La Monte Young , Marian Zazeela , Terry Riley , Michael Harrison , Sargam Shah , Alex Dea , Charlemagne Palestine , Henry Flynt , Jon Hassell , Douglas Leedy , Don Cherry , Lee Konitz , Jon Gibson , Yoshi Wada , Rhys Chatham , W. A. Mathieu , Sufi Pir Shabda Kahn , Catherine Christer Hennix , George Brooks , and Simone Forti .
 Like Pandit Pran Nath teacher , Abdul Wahid Khan , Pran Nath did not emphasize recording or the releasing of records , preferring live performance .
As such , little recorded documentation of the Kirana Gharana style is available .
 While only three recordings of Pran Nath were released during Pandit Pran Nath lifetime , a large number of recordings exist under the care of La Monte Young .
 In Pran Naths will La Monte Young , as executor of Pandit Pran Nath estate , was instructed to begin releasing only three recordings of Pran Nath
Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia is an Indian classical flautist .
Hariprasad Chaurasia was born in Allahabad in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh .
His father was a wrestler .
 His father mother died when His father was 6 .
 His father had to learn music without His father fathers knowledge , for His father father wanted His father to become a wrestler .
 His father did go to the Akhada and train with His father father for some time , although His father also started learning music and practising at His father friends house .
 His father often credits His father wrestling training for giving His father the immense stamina and lung power that are the hallmarks of His father flute playing , stating that , .
Hariprasad Chaurasia started learning vocal music from his neighbor , Pandit Rajaram , at the age of 15 .
Later , he switched to playing the flute under the tutelage of Pandit Bholanath Prasanna of Varanasi for eight years .
He joined the All India Radio , Cuttack , Odisha in 1957 and worked as a composer and performer .
Much later , while working for All India Radio , he received guidance from the reclusive Annapurna Devi , daughter of Baba Allaudin Khan .
Apart from classical music , he has made a mark as a music director for Indian films along with Shivkumar Sharma , forming a group called Shiv-Hari .
He has collaborated with world musicians in experimental cross-cultural performances , including the fusion group Shakti .
He serves as the artistic director of the World Music Department at the Rotterdam Music Conservatory in the Netherlands .
He is also the founder of the Vrindavan Gurukul in Mumbai and Vrindavan Gurukul in Bhubaneshwar .
Both of these institutes are schools dedicated to training students in Hindustani Bansuri in the Guru-shishya tradition .
 As a Guru , a Guru has produced many noted disciples including a Guru nephew Rakesh Chaurasia .
 a Guru has collaborated with several western musicians , including John McLaughlin , Jan Garbarek , and Ken Lauber , and has composed music for Indian films .
 a Guru has performed throughout the world , winning acclaim from varied audiences and fellow musicians including Yehudi Menuhin and Jean-Pierre Rampal .
Chaurasia was married to Kamla and Anuradha .
He has three sons Vinay , Ajay and Rajiv .
The 2013 documentary film Bansuri Guru features the life and legacy of Chaurasia and was produced by the Films Division , Ministry of Information and Broadcasting , Government of India .
These are major albums released by Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia , categorized by release dates .2 .
Along with Pandit Shivkumar Sharma he composed music for .
The music for the movie Sirivennela is composed by K. V. Mahadevan which revolves around the role of Pandit Hari Prasad , a blind flautist played by Sarvadaman Banerjee and flute renditions by Hariprasad Chaurasia .
 Some of the movie Sirivennela music is used in Mithaq Kazimi s 16 Days in Afghanistan
Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan is a Carnatic and Hindustani musician from Chennai .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan hails from a family of musicians spanning over two centuries .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan father , T.G.Viswanatha Bhagavathar , was a court musician for the Cochin Royal Family and a professor of music at the S.K.V. College in Thrissur .
 T.G.Viswanatha Bhagavathar is a vocalist , plays the violin and is also an exponent of the mridangam .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan started playing the mridangam at the age of four and had Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan arangetram at the Cochin palace at the age of six .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan is a disciple of Chembai Vaidyanatha Bhagavathar .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan students include Ilayaraja , A.R.Rahman , Sivamani , Kadri Gopalnath , Vidyabhushana .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan has also collaborated with drummer/composer Franklin Kiermyer on live performances .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan was given the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1990 .
 Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan has been awarded the Padma Bhushan by the Government of India in the year 2012 .
 Ghatam Maestro Late T V Vasan is Tirupanithurai Viswanatha Gopalakrishnan younger brother .
In his career spanning over five decades , many honours and awards that have been bestowed on Dr.TVG .

Vadi , in both Hindustani classical music and Carnatic music , is the dominant swara of a given raga .
 Vadi is the most sonant or most important note of a Raga .
 Vadi does not refer to the most played note but Vadi rather refers to a note of special significance .
It is usually the swara which is repeated the greatest number of times , and often it is the swara on which the singer can pause for a significant time .
Vadi swara in a raga is like a king in a kingdom .
 Specialty of any raga depends on vadi swara and because of Vadi , the vadi swara is also called the Jeeva swara or the Ansha swara .
A good artist uses vadi swara in different ways like singing vadi swara again and again , starting a raga with vadi swara , to end a raga with vadi swara , singing vadi swara many times in important places with different swaras or sometime singing vadi swara for a longer time in one breath .
Vadi swara is also helpful to identify the time of singing or playing a raga .
If vadi swara of a raga is from purvanga part of saptak i.e. `` Sa Re Ga Ma '' , then it is called as purvanga vadi raga and usually time for singing or playing purvanga vadi ragas are from 12 pm to 12 am for example ragas like Bhimpalasi , Pilu , Purvi , Marwa , Yaman , Bhoopal , and Bageshree etc. have purvanga vadi swara and so the time for singing and playing these ragas is between 12 pm to 12 am .
In the same way if vadi swara of a raga is from utranga part of spatak i.e. `` Pa Dha Ni '' then it is called as utranga vadi raga and time for singing or playing utranga vadi ragas is from 12 am to 12 pm .
 For example ragas like Bhairav , Bhairav , Bilawal , Kalingada , Sohini , and Asavari etc. have utranga vadi swara and so the time for singing or playing these raagas is between 12 am to 12 pm .
 Vadi swara , along with the Samvadi swara of a raga , usually brings out the uniqueness of the raga and the Samvadi swara of a raga bhava and rasa
Abhijit Pohankar is an Indian classical instrumentalist .
 Abhijit Pohankar plays classical music on the keyboard .
Abhijit was born to Ajay Pohankar .
 Abhijit is the grandson of Susheela Pohankar of Kirana Gharana .
 Abhijit learned for some time with Shivkumar Sharma .
 Abhijit was the first artist to play Indian classical ragas on the keyboard .
 After playing classical music on a keyboard , Abhijit started venturing into world music and fusion music .
 Abhijit biggest album was Piya Bawari with Abhijit father Ajay Pohankar , and in that album Abhijit experimented with classical music fused with lounge music .
 One of the youngest artists to be featured in Buddha Bar of France , Abhijit has started France , Abhijit new world music band Soundz of India & Urban Ragas and is performing all over the world .
 France , Abhijit is one of the most successful fusion music producers .
 France , Abhijit latex project/band is called Panch Tatva .
 His latex project/band has done major collaborative concerts with artists including Ajay Pohankar , Ghulam Ali , Hariharan , Rajan and Sajan Mishra , Anup Jalota , Pankaj Udhas , Vishwamohan Bhatt , and Sonal Mansingh .
 His latex project/band has also composed the title track of the 2003 film Boom , by Kaizad Gusted and starring Amitabh Bachchan and Bo-Derek
Lenny Seidman is a tabla musician/composer and World Music and Jazz curator at the Painted Bride Art Center in Philadelphia .
Seldman studied tabla in 1971 with Ishwarlal Misra , followed by Chotelal Misra and Kiran Deshponde , all from Benares , India .
 Previously Seldman was a student of classical and jazz piano .
 During the 1980s , Seldman integrated analogue electronic music with Seldman percussion , composing pieces for dance companies and Seldman various music ensembles and began a ten year musical relationship , studying the South Indian rhythm system .
 Seldman also performed with South Indian violinist Adrian L'Armand .
 Around the same , time Seldman toured with Bansuri flutist Paul John for lasted several years .
 Seldman studied with renowned tabla maestro Zakir Hussain in 1991 , and subsequently directed Seldman performing focus to tabla and composing for inter-cultural percussion ensembles which incorporated North and South Indian drumming traditions .
 Seldman is co-director of Spoken Hand Percussion Orchestra , which unifies the drumming traditions of North Indian tabla , Afro-Cuban bata , Afro-Brazilian samba and West African djembe into the Spoken own unique sound .
 the Spoken Hand , going into the Spoken 15th year , collaborated in 2002 with Zakir Hussain , and hip hop choreographer Rennie Harris in Flammable Contents .
He is director of the Lenny Seidman Tabla Choir , and is an original member of Atzilut , the Middle Eastern Jewish/Arabic music ensemble noted for their Concerts for Peace performed at the United Nations , throughout the U.S. and Europe .
He recently completed a four year international tour with Rennie Harris PureMovement s epoch piece , Facing Mekka as a musical collaborator and performer .
In 2011 he embarked on his first feature film as musical director and composer for Nadine Pattersons Tango Macbeth set for release in March , 2012 .
He has founded and coordinated several other ensembles including the Shamanistics and Splinter Group .
He has performed and or recorded throughout the Americas and abroad with numerous music artists including Zakir Hussain , Kenny Endo , Simon Shaheen , Philip Hamilton , Yacouba Sissoko , LL Cool J , Kenny Muhammed , Michael Daugherty , I Dewa Puta Berata , Butch Morris , Yair Dalal , Ursula Rucker , and choreographers Rennie Harris , Cynthia Lee , Viji Rao , Antonia Minnecola , Helmut Gottschild , Roko Kawai , Christine Cox , Nina Martin , Benoit LaChambre , Myra Bazell , Eko Supriyanto , Cheng-Chieh Yu , Ananya Chatterjea , Pallabi Chakravorty , Kim Arrow and Group Motion Dance Co. .
 Lenny Seidman has received two Pennsylvania Council on the Arts Fellowships and an Independence Foundation Fellowship for creative work .
 Lenny Seidman was co-recipient of an NEA grant and two Rockefeller Foundation MAP Fund grants to create new work for the Spoken Hand Percussion Orchestra .
 Lenny Seidman was commissioned by Phrenic New Ballet to compose a new piece for choreographer Christine Cox s Tabula Rasa and by Kim Arrow for his Quasimodo in the Outback .
 Lenny Seidman was awarded the APPEX Fellowship in 1999 , a six week inter-cultural residency at UCLA to collaborate and live with 35 performing artists from throughout Asia where Lenny Seidman works were performed .
 Lenny Seidman also was awarded a three month residency at Headlands Center for the Arts in Sausalito , CA .
in 1993 .
 Lenny Seidman has been a guest artist and tabla instructor at Swarthmore College since 1998 , where Lenny Seidman created several compositions for tabla/gamelan and tabla/taiko ensembles and co-directed their performances .
 Lenny Seidman has given workshops nationally , teaches tabla and rhythm theory privately and is the World Music and Jazz curator at the Painted Bride Art Center in Philadelphia .
Rain Man of Fitz .
 Mercy in honor of Rain Man of Fitz . brother , Murray , who was murdered in early 2011 .
This piece was performed by Spoken Hand Percussion Orchestra in May , 2011 .
`` Taal of the Wild '' ... Commissioned by the Independence Foundation .
Taal refers to the rhythmic system in Indian music ; of the Wild from Jack London s Call of the Wild .
 This piece is inspired by I trek into the Himalayas in Kashmir , and features theme and variations of a phrase played at 4 to the beat and 7 to the beat .
Taal of the Wild is part of Spoken Hand Percussion Orchestra s repertory , and has also been performed by the APPEX Percussion Ensemble at the Japan/American Theatre in Los Angeles .
 Bendir , Done Dat - Composed for the Spoken Hand Percussion Orchestra .
Features a trio of Bendir players .
 Bendir is now part of Spoken Hands repertory .
 Peshkar - Composed for the Spoken Hand .
 Peshkar is one of the primary compositional forms in the classical tabla repertoire .
 Peshkar is now in the Spoken Hand repertory .
 Mudra Hang '' ... Commissioned by choreographer Kim Arrow for Hang '' ... Commissioned multimedia work , his Quasimodo in the Outback in the Outback .
Composed for the tabla choir , this suite collaborates with both live and animated dance .
`` Dha Funk '' ... Inspired by the work of South Indian violin master , L.Shankar , this 19 beat cycle gets tongue-in-cheek treatment in a call and response recitation of the tabla drum strokes .
Dha Funk is part of Spoken Hands repertory .
`` Skinful '' ... This Spoken Hand Percussion Orchestra repertory piece in a cycle of 16 beats merges both North Indian and South Indian rhythmic concepts and features a Carnatic style of melodic instrument/drum interplay .
 Skinful was also performed by the APPEX Percussion Ensemble at UCLA .
Haitian Taiko ... Composed for tabla and Swarthmore College s Taiko Ensemble .
The primary rhythmic theme was inspired by an Afro/Haitian rhythm , developed for the tabla choir .
Batu-Batu Tukene ... Composed for tabla and Swarthmore College s Balinese Gamelan ensemble , Semara Santi .
Batu-Batu denotes a quick repetitive drum pattern that supports a fast passage in a gamelan composition , and tukene is a 3 count tabla phrase .
This piece merges both traditions in a contemporary format , set to a 6 beat cycle in a main subdivision of 9-7-5-3 .
 Dha Terekita Cak ... Composed for tabla and Semara Santi Gamelan Ensemble , this piece features the rhythmic recitation practices from the Balinese Gamelan gamelan and North/South Indian drumming traditions conversing with each other .
Tabula Rasa ... Commissioned by Phrenic New Ballet .
This piece was composed for choreographer , Christine Cox .
It is a recording studio suite consisting of multi track tabla layers of various pitches with an abstract electronic music section .
`` Meet Mr. R '' ... A 75 minute solo piece performed by Seidman for tabla and frame drum approximately 12 times during 1994 and 1995 for Helmut Gottschild 's `` Meet Mr. R '' performed at Oberlin College , Oberlin , Ohio , Allegheny College , Meadeville PA , University of the Arts Theater , Philadelphia PA , Painted Bride Art Center , Philadelphia PA
MC Yogi is the stage name of Nicholas Giacomini , an American hip hop musician and yogi .
 MC Yogi music style characteristically contains themes promoting Hindu philosophy and many of MC Yogi songs are bhajans .
MC Yogi is married to Amanda Giacomini and the pair divide their time between teaching at their Point Reyes yoga studio , Yoga Toes , and traveling for music performance .
 Yoga Journal reviewed MC Yogis work as surprisingly educational because MC Yogi makes rapping about Hindu deities little learning opportunities .
The New York Times said that MC Yogi may embody the ethos of the Wanderlust Festival more than any other performer .
In 2008 MC Yogi produced a video called Obama 08 - Vote for Hope promoting the presidential campaign of Barack Obama , and the video went viral on YouTube .
In 2009 Starbucks promoted an MC Yogi song as part of a campaign called Are You In ?
The purpose of the campaign is to promote community service and volunteering .
In 2012 , MC Yogi produced a video in celebration of Gandhi Jayanti .
The video is called , Be the Change
Writing about the musical theory of Indian classical music is fraught with complications .
First of all , there have been no set , formal methods of written notation .
Indian music is an aural tradition , and therefore writing is not an essential part of attaining talim .
 The bare scale of this raga has little unique musical meaning , and is , therefore , required to be documented in a manner that incorporates The bare scale of this raga zigzag phrasing pattern .
R N. S M / M M P g M / n P M P g M / P g M n D n P / g M n D N S g M D - N S / g M R S / R N S D n P / n n P M P g M / P g M R S. Related ragas : Shahana Kanada , Shahana Bahar , Basant Bahar , Adana Bahar .
Behavior refers to practical aspects of the music .
It is complicated to talk about this for Hindustani music since many of the concepts are fluid , changing , or archaic .
 The following information can not be accurate , but The following information can attempt to reflect how the music existed .
Raag Bahar is usually rendered in the Spring season .
 since the Spring season is the raga of spring , it can be considered that the raga has shringara rasa .
Bor , Joep .
Rao , Suvarnalata ; der Meer , Wim van ; Harvey , Jane The Raga Guide : A Survey of 74 Hindustani Ragas .
Zenith Media , London : 1999
Dr. Nagaraja Rao Havaldar is a Hindustani Classical vocalist from Karnataka , India .
 Dr. Havaldar is a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi , a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi a prime disciple of the Kirana scion Pandit Bhimsen Joshi .
 a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi is also a disciple of Pandit Panchakshari Swami Mattigatti , a senior disciple of Pandit Mallikarjun Mansur , of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana .
 During a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi study for Sangeetha Ratna , a six-year degree course in Hindustani Classical Music from Karnataka University , Dharwad , Karnataka , a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi studied under Pandit Mallikarjun Mansur , and luminaries like Panchakshari Swami Mattigatti , Pandit Basavaraj Rajaguru , Pandit Sangameshwar Gurav and Dr. B.D. Pathak who were faculty members .
 a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi holds with distinction , Sangeetha Ratna , a degree in Hindustani Classical Music from Karnataka University , Dharawada .
 a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi is also a gold medalist M.A. in History and Archeology , and holds a Doctorate in Music from Karnataka University , a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi doctorate thesis being The History of Classical Music in Karnataka .
 a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi has performed all over Karnataka , India , including prestigious venues such as the Hampi Utsava , Mysore Dassera Durbar Festival and Sankat Mochan Sangeet Samaroh at Varanasi .
 a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi has also toured the United States and the United Kingdom extensively .
 While a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi style reflects a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi extensive training from Kirana masters , a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi is equally at ease with the Jaipur-Atrauli specialities such as Basanti Kedar , Basanti Kanada and Nat Malhar .
 a disciple Pandit Madhava Gudi has pioneered to popularize the Kannada Khayal by adapting Vachanas , literary works of Haridasas and suitable contemporary poetry in the Kannada Khayal , to the traditional khayal form .
 Besides live performances , Dr Havaldar has cut numerous albums in the the Kannada Khayal and lighter genres .
 Dr Havaldar is the founder and president of Sunaada Art Foundation , an organization dedicated to the promotion of Indian classical Music .
 As a composer , Dr Havaldar has scored music for various plays and television shows such as Girish Karnad 's Taledanda , P. Lankesh 's Gunamukha staged by the theatre group Roopantara , the television version of Master Hirannayya 's Lanchavatara and T N Seetharam 's teleserial , Roopantara .
 He has also worked with a theatre group in Karnataka , India on the music of a play with a spiritual theme .
He regularly conducts lecture-demonstrations and workshops on music for companies like Wipro , Computer Associates , Birla 3M and Khodays among others , on topics such as Stress Management through Music and Appreciation of Hindustani Classical Music .
 Dr Havaldar has taught and continues to teach Hindustani Classical music , both locally in Bengaluru , as well as internationally to students in the United States and United Kingdom via workshops and telephonic sessions .
 Many of Dr Havaldar students have become prominent musicians themselves , notably Many of his students son Omkarnath Havaldar and the Kannada Khayal playback singer Chaitra HG .
Dr Havaldar has previously worked as a Programme Executive at the Music Archives , All India Radio , Hubli .
 Dr Havaldar was also formerly the chairman of Textbook Committee for Hindustani Music , for The Directorate of Textbooks , Karnataka .
 Dr Havaldar was born in Hosapete town in Bellary District , Karnataka , where Dr Havaldar spent Dr Havaldar early years until Dr Havaldar graduation .
 Dr Havaldar currently resides in Bengaluru .
 Dr Havaldar sons Omkarnath Havaldar and Kedarnath are upcoming musicians - Omkarnath is a vocalist while Kedarnath is a tabaliya

 Anita Singhvi is an exponent of sufi music .
Anita Singhvi was born into a business family in Jodhpur , Rajasthan .
 Anita Singhvi has a B.A. and LLB .
 Anita Singhvi became interested in ghazal singing at the age of fifteen and began training under the guidance of Pandit Kshirsagar from the Gwalior gharana .
