While any Indian music performance may feature two musicians , a performance can only be deemed a jugalbandi if neither is clearly the soloist and nor clearly the accompanist .
In jugalbandi , both musicians act as lead players , and a playful competition exists between the two performers
 Ragamala Paintings are a series of illustrative paintings from medieval India based on Ragamala or the Garland of Ragas , depicting various Indian musical modes , the Ragas , but also their wives .
 Ragamala or the Garland of Ragas stand as a classical example of the amalgamation of art , poetry and classical music in medieval India .
 Ragamala paintings were created in most schools of medieval India painting , starting in the 16th and 17th centuries and are today named accordingly , as Pahari Ragamala , Rajasthan or Rajput Ragamala , Deccan Ragamala , and Mughal Ragamala .
 In these painting each raga is personified by a colour , mood , a verse describing a story of a hero and heroine , India painting also elucidates the season and the time of day and night in which a particular raga is to be sung ; and finally most paintings also demarcate the specific Hindu deities attached with the raga , like Bhairava or Bhairavi to Shiva , Sri to Devi etc. .
The paintings depict not just the Ragas , but also their wives , , their numerous sons and daughters .
 The six principal ragas present in the Ragamala are Bhairava , Dipika , Sri to Devi , Malkaunsa , Megha and Hindola and these are meant to be sung during the six seasons of the year - summer , monsoon , autumn , early winter , winter and spring .
Sangeeta Ratnakara , is an important 12th century CE treatise on the classification of Indian Ragas , which for the first time mentions the presiding deity of each raga .
From the 14th century onwards , they were described in short verses in Sanskrit , for Dhyana , contemplation , and later depicted in a series of paintings , called the Ragamala paintings .
Some of the best available works of Ragamala are from the 16th and 17th centuries , when the form flourished under royal patronage , though by the 19th century , it gradually faded .
 In 1570 , Kshemakarna , a priest of Rewa in Central India , compiled a poetic text on the Ragamala in Sanskrit , which describes six principal Ragas -- Bhairava , Malakoshika , Hindola , Dipaka , Raga Shri , and Megha -- each having five Raginis and eight Ragaputras , except Raga Shri , which has six Raginis and nine Ragaputras , thus making a Ragamala family of 86 members .
 Most of the extant works of Ragamala are from Deccan style , where Ibrahim Adil Shah II of Bijapur , was Ibrahim Adil Shah II of Bijapur also a fine painter and illustrator , though some Rajput style also exist of which the work of an artist of the Chawand school of painting , Sahibdin , whose Ragamala series dated 1628 , are now in National Museum of India .
Six are male ragas ; the thirty raginis are their wives and the remaining forty-eight are their sons .
These are listed is as follows : .
 Wives : Bhairavi , Bilawali , Punyaki , Bangli , Aslekhi .
Sons : Pancham , Harakh , Disakh , Bangal , Madhu , Madhava , Lalit , Bilaval .
Wives : Gaundkari , Devagandhari , Gandhari , Seehute , Dhanasri .
Sons : Maru , Mustang , Mewara , Parbal , Chand , Khokhat , Bhora , Nad .
Wives : Telangi , Devkari , Basanti , Sindhoori , Aheeri .
Sons : Surmanand , Bhasker , Chandra-Bimb , Mangalan , Ban , Binoda , Basant , Kamoda .
Sons : Kaalanka , Kuntal , Rama , Kamal , Kusum , Champak , Gaura , Kanra .
Wives : Bairavi , Karnati , Gauri , Asavari , Sindhavi .
Sons : Salu , Sarag , Sagra , Gaund , Gambhir , Gund , Kumbh , Hamir .
Wives : Sorath , Gaundi-Malari , Asa , Gunguni , Sooho .
Sons : Biradhar , Gajdhar , Kedara , Jablidhar , Nut , Jaldhara , Sankar , Syama
Pandit Raghunath Prasanna was an Indian classical shehnai and flute player .
 shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna was known for introducing the techniques of vocal and shehnai in flute playing , a new style of playing the Indian bansuri , different from the style of Pandit Pannalal Ghosh .
Raghunath Prasanna was born in 1913 in Varanasi in the state of Uttar Pradesh .
 shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna was married to Saraswati Devi .
They had seven children .
One of them is well-known flute & shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna .
 Pandit Raghunath Prasanna was not only a refined artiste who could play both shehnai and flute with equal ease ; shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna was a great teacher and innovator .
 shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna got shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna musical training from shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna father Pandit Gauri Shanker , a shehnai player of repute , and gayaki ang from Pandit Dauji Mishra of Varanasi .
 shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna was the first person in the family to introduce the art of flute playing in Banaras Gharana of India which known for its shehnai playing for more than two and half centuries .
The shehnai in this family was earlier strengthen for many generations by Pandit Raghunath 's father Pandit Gauri Shanker , Pandit Tehal Prasad , Pandit Garib Das .
His flute playing has richly contributed by way of introducing novel techniques in blowing the flute , the manner of handling and fingering , methodical with emphasis on Gayaki Ang , the way of infusing shehnai techniques in flute playing particularly in playing the Jhala - the fast pace culmination of a Raga .
These novelties have gone a big way in strengthening the status of flute - from a folk instrument to the concert level .
He is mainly responsible for introducing various techniques of presenting light classical modes like thumri , chaiti , kajri and dhun in Bansuri playing , and play them with equal aplomb and telling effects .
Pandit Raghunath Prasanna was not only a legendary flute and shehnai player .
 shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna initiated into the art of flute playing from the instrument named Tripura bansuri and took this Tripura bansuri to Indian classical music and then shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna started Krishna Bansuri .
Pandit Raghu nath Prasanna also played sarod .
 shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna was an excellent instrument - maker , Ustad Bismillah khan used to call shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna Vishkarma - an Indian God , when saw shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna quality as an instruments maker .
And Pt .
 Hari Prasad Chaurasia used to call Hari Prasad Chaurasia Bade Guruji means grand teacher .
 Pandit Raghunath Prasanna is the first in shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna family to introduce flute , and after shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna style has spread all over India .
 It should be noteworthy that the tools and techniques developed by Pandit Raghunath Prasanna have been widely adopted by many of the Indian flautists including shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna younger brother and disciple Pandit Bholanath Prasanna and shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna disciple Pandit Hari Prasad Chaurasiya , Pt .
Vishnu Prasanna , Pandit Rajendra Prasanna , Pandit Ronu Mujamdar and many others flautists .
 shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna has numerous disciples like Pt .
 Bholanath Prasanna , Pt .
 Vishnu Prasanna , shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna son .
Pt .
 Rajendra Prasanna , Pt .
 Pranav Mukherjee , Pt .
 Bhanu Majumdar , Pt .
Anant Lal , and Ustaad Shivpreet Singh .
 Anant Lal is the first person in India to introduce a folk instrument in Classical music .
 Anant Lal is being recorded , Anant Lal shehnai and tripura bansuri in the album Anthology of Indian Classical Music : A Tribute to Alain Danielou .
with Pt .
Ravi Shankar and Ustad Ali Akbar Khan in the year 1955 .
 Pandit Raghunath Prasanna was the recipient of various awards and honors including Sangeet Natak Academi Award for shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna contribution to the cause of Indian Classical Music .
The title Prasanna have been entitled to Pandit Raghunath by the king of Kuch Bihar .
 The king honored the king of Kuch Bihar as Pandit Raghu Nath Prasanna made audience happy , from then shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna has been named as shehnai player Rajendra Prasanna
 Anjan Chattopadhyay , the sitar player , born in a Bengali aristocratic family in Calcutta , India , was initiated to the art of sitar playing by Anjan Chattopadhyay elder brother , a veteran Surbahar player , Pandit Gourisankar Chattopadhyay , a disciple of Pandit Birendra Kishore Roy Chowdhury .
 In addition to that Anjan Chattopadhyay started taking further training from Kalyani Roy , a reputed sitarist and one of the few disciples of Ustad Vilayat Khan .
 Anjan Chattopadhyay also had lessons in vocal music from late Muktipada Datta , a representative of Agra Gharana .
 Anjan Chattopadhyay also learned tabla under the late Ustad Shaukat Ali Khan of Farukhabad gharana .
 Anjan Chattopadhyay lives in Calcutta and teaches music .
 Anjan Chattopadhyay has performed in hundreds of concerts in India and abroad .
 Among them worthy of mentions are some of Anjan Chattopadhyay concerts in India : .
 In some of his concerts in India musical career , Anjan Chattopadhyay has got numerous awards , and felicitations
Vishnu Govind Jog , better known as V. G. Jog , was an Indian violinist .
He was the foremost exponent of the violin in the Hindustani music tradition in the 20th century , and is credited for introducing this instrument into Hindustani music .
Jog was a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan .
 a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan performed and recorded with many of the greatest Hindustani musicians of the 20th century and toured the world .
 a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan frequently performed for All India Radio s Calcutta division .
 a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan received the Padma Bhushan award in 1982 .
 a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan earned a masters degree in music from Bhatkhande College of Hindustani Music in Lucknow in 1944 and went on to teach there .
 a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan also taught at the Ali Akbar College of Music .
 Beginning in 1999 , a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan suffered from Parkinsons disease , and also suffered from respiratory problems in a disciple of Baba Allauddin Khan later years .
Pandit Vishnu Govind Jog , whose name is almost synonymous with the violin genre in Hindustani classical music , is a performer with the unique distinction of having occupied the top rungs of the Classical Musicians hierarchy with three consecutive generations of performers .
His career as a highly active and successful performer has spanned almost five decades .
Born in Mumbai in 1922 , he received his early training from S. C. Athavale and the late Ganpat Rao Purohit .
Subsequently , he had his training from Vishweswar Shastry , the renowned musician and musicologist Dr. S. N. Ratanjankar , and for a short time from the celebrated Ustad Allauddin Khan .
Groomed in the Gwalior , Agra and Bakhle styles , Pandit Jogs virtuosity , mastery of ragas and an uncanny realisation of space and time in the construction and knowledge of rhythm are his hallmarks .
 At a very young age , he rubbed shoulders with all time greats at the Bhatkhande College of Music , Lucknow in 1944 , in the 1930s -- the first great attempt at institutionalizing traditional music instruction .
 An unassuming person of infinite charm , An unassuming person of infinite charm is also regarded as an incomparable accompanist .
 An unassuming person of infinite charm duets with Ustad Bismillah Khan have met with spectacular successes in India and abroad .
 An unassuming person of infinite charm is gifted with the remarkable ability to sense the pulse and mood of An unassuming person of infinite charm audiences , and has toured extensively both in India and abroad , significantly in East Africa , Nepal , Sri Lanka , United Kingdom , France , the United States , and West Germany .
 In 1985 , An unassuming person of infinite charm performed to great acclaim under the auspices of the Festival of India in the United States .
Pandit Jog was awarded the Padma Bhushan in 1982 .
After prolonged illness Pandit Jog died on Jan 31 , 2004 in South Calcutta .
 Shri Jog had Shri Jog early training under Shri Shankar Rao Athavie , Ganpat Rao Purohit , and V. Shastry .
 Later Shri Jog received extensive training from Dr.S.N.Ratanjankar and Ustad Allauddin Khan .
 Groomed in the Gwalior , Agra and Bakhale gharanas , Shri Jog evolved Bakhale own characteristic style , which is blending of gayaki and gatkari , noted for purity of melody and tradition , a formidable layakari ability , dignity , crispness and easy musical communications .
 Bakhale has often enlightened audiences according to their taste with lighter themes and folk tunes , flowing with tilting and sparkling grace .
 Behala Shiksha book Behala Shiksha , published in 1944 , is recognized as a major piece of authoritative literature on the subject .
 Behala Shiksha joined All India Radio in1953 and served as music producer .
 Behala Shiksha retired as deputy chief producer , All India Radio .
 Behala Shiksha received many honors from various cultural institutions , including the Sangeet Natak Academy award in 1983 and the Padma Bhushan in 1985 by the president of India .
 Behala Shiksha had made successful tours to foreign countries and has got many number of LP/EP gramophone records of solo and jugalbandi with sangeet maestros at Behala Shiksha credit .
 Hailing from Maharashtra , Pandit Jog began his training at the age of twelve and was subsequently groomed under some of the finest musicians of India , like Baba Allauddin Khan and Pandit S. N. Ratanjankar .
To Pandit Jog goes the credit of single-handedly transforming a western musical instrument , the violin , into a major and independent instrument in Hindustani classical music .
He was unquestionably the Violin Samrat for all time to come .
Sri Lankas Pandith Amaradeva is a student of V.G Jog .
Since 1999 , Pandit Jog had been suffering from Parkinsons disease .
The disease had not only crippled the elderly maestro by taking away the violin away from his hands , but was also draining away all his resources .
Without music , his only source of income , the high cost of medical care became an unbearable burden for the Jog family
Qutub Festival is a three day festival usually held in November-December in the Qutub complex in the Indian metropolis of Delhi organized by Delhi Tourism , Govt .
 of Delhi organized by Delhi Tourism , Govt .
The festival showcases the cultural art forms of the country but also puts this classic structure of Qutub Minar in the cynosure of national and international attention
Dadra refers to two separate but originally linked concepts in Hindustani classical music .
 a Hindustani classical tala is a Hindustani classical tala , consisting of six beats in two equal divisions of three .
The most commonly accepted theka or basic pattern for this tala is dha dhi na , dha tu na .
There is a higher emphasis laid on the first swar in comparison the following two , that is , dha - higher emphasis following dhi na and again a higher emphasis on dha following tu na .
 In this context dadra is a light classical vocal form in Hindustani classical music , mostly performed in Agra and in Bundelkhand region .
It was originally accompanied by dadra tala , but later dadra compositions are often found in other light talas .
There have been some Bollywood songs as well based on the same for instance Madan Mohan composition - Lag Jaa Gale , a song from the movie Woh Kaun Thi
Sarpada is a raga in Hindustani classical music .
 Hindustani classical music is a Bhilawal raga sung in the morning .
 Amir Khusrau , the father of modern Hindustani music , is said to have created about twelve new melodies , among which is Sarpada
Aparna is an Indian classical vocalist living in Pune , Maharashtra , India .
Panshikar 's musical performances include pure Hindustani classical music to semi-classical music and experimentation in combining north Indian classical music with various other genres .
 The systematic online training method developed by Meera Panshikar won Meera Panshikar a lot of disciples across the globe .
 Meera Panshikar performs with the band The Khayal Groove consisting of Indian bassist Jayen Varma and French drummer Jean Davoisne .
Panshikar had an early introduction to north Indian classical music .
 Meera Panshikar first guru is late Pandit Bhaskarbua Joshi and is currently training under Meera Panshikar mother Meera Panshikar .
 Meera Panshikar is married to Nikhil Joshi and has a son Sohum Bilawal Nikhil Joshi .
 Meera Panshikar has released 9 musical albums which include - a Jugalbandi with Sudha Ragunathan released by Manorama Music in 1999 , 3 titles released as '' HMV presents a Voice for the New Millennium '' in 2000 , Winds from Ayuta in 2002 , Diamond Sutra and Punyapur ki Sarita in 2003 , Shivoham in 2005 and Reflections of a Purple Moon by The Khayal Groove in 2012
Stephen Day is an American composer , producer , instrumentalist , vocalist and teacher .
 Stephen Day credits range from scoring portions of the film Formula 51 , starring Samuel L. Jackson , to founding a nonprofit organization , Ombience , dedicated to spreading spirituality through art .
 Born in California and brought up in Canada and France , Stephen Day has worked for over 20 years as a composer , producer , instrumentalist , vocalist and teacher .
 After studying sarod with world-renowned sarod player Ustad Amjad Ali Khan in India for three years , Stephen Day embarked on various tours throughout the world .
He works in multiple genres , including Western classical , Indian classical , jazz , folk , and rock music .
 Stephen Days performance career has taken Stephen Days performance career to twenty-one countries throughout Europe , North America and Asia .
 Stephen Days performance career audiences are people from all nations , castes and creeds who are seeking to enrich His audiences own spiritual awareness .
 Stephen Days performance career has shared the stage with some of the great maestros of Indian classical music , including Ustad Amjad Ali Khan , Stephen Days performance career sons Amaan and Ayaan Ali Bangash , Nishat Khan , Sukivinder Singh , and Pratap Pawar .
 In the West Stephen Days performance career has collaborated with Matt Malley , Chris Cutler , Keith Bennett , Barrie Gledden , Patrick Hawes , Steve Dawson , Jeannette Singh , Levine Andrade , and the London Telharmonic Orchestra .
Ombience works with various individuals , groups , organizations and institutions in society to raise awareness of the spiritual nature of the arts and of the creative and spontaneous nature of spirituality .
 Ombience , literally meaning the ambience of Om , has worked with various institutions , including the California State Public School system , California State Universities and Colleges , private schools , art and music festivals , California State Universities , and yoga and meditation organizations .
The performing arts group has showcased at major venues including the House of Blues on the Sunset Strip in Los Angeles , University of California , Berkeley s Wheeler Hall , and at the Wiltern Theatre in Los Angeles
Benares gharana is one of the six most common styles of playing of the Indian tabla .
The Benares tabla gharana was developed a little over 200 years ago by Ram Sahai .
 Ram Sahai began studying the tabla with Ram Sahai father from the age of five .
 At the age of nine , Ram Sahai moved to Lucknow to become the disciple of Modhu Khan of the Lucknow gharana .
 When Ram Sahai was seventeen years old , Wazir Ali Khan , the new Nawab , asked Modhu Khan if Ram Sahai could perform a recital for Ram Sahai .
 Modhu Khan agreed , on the condition that Ram Sahai would not be interrupted until Ram Sahai finished playing .
It is said that Ram Sahai played for seven consecutive nights , and that after this incredible performance , Ram Sahai was praised by all the members of the community and was showered with gifts .
 Shortly after this performance , Ram Sahai returned to Benares .
 After some time performing in Benares , Ram Sahai felt the need to make a significant change in Ram Sahai tabla playing .
 For six months , Ram Sahai withdrew into seclusion , and worked to develop what is now known as the Benares baj or style of tabla playing .
The philosophy behind this new style of tabla playing is that it would be versatile enough to perform solo , and to accompany any form of music or dance .
The tabla would be able to play delicately , as required for khyal , or more aggressively , like pakhawaj , for the accompaniment of dhrupad or kathak dance .
Ram Sahai developed a new way of fingering the tabla strokes ; especially important is the sound Na , being played with a curved ring finger to allow for maximum resonance of the dahina .
 Ram Sahai also composed numerous compositions within existing compositional forms and created new forms , such as uthan , Benarsi theka , and fard .
Sharda Sahai was the 5th generation of tabla players in the family .
 Sanju Sahai , also known as Vishnu , is the current Head of the Benaras Gharana and represents the 6th generation and is one of the most sought after Tabla players of Sanju Sahai , also known as Vishnu generation .
 the direct descendents of Ram Sahai are the direct descendents of Ram Sahai .
 Today , the Benares tabla gharana is well known for The Benares tabla gharana powerful sound , though Benares players are also very capable of playing delicately and sensitively .
 The gharana is categorized into the Purbi baj , which includes the Farukhabad , Lucknow , and Benares gharanas .
The Benares style makes use of the more resonant strokes of tabla , such as Na , and Din .
 Benares players preferentially use the full-hand TeTe strokes , rather than the single finger alternation preferred by the Delhi style , though both stroke types are integrated into the Benares baj repertoire .
 Benares tabla players are successful in all forms of tabla playing , including tabla solo , instrumental , vocal , and dance accompaniment .
 The Tabla solo is highly developed in the Benares gharana , and some artists , such as Anokhelal Mishra , Kishan Maharaj , and Pandit Samta Prasad , have become famous as tabla soloists .
The direct descendants making up the 6th generation of tabla players are Chandra Nath Shastri , Ramji Mishra , Mahapurush Misra , Ishwarlal Mishra , Chhotelal Misra , Radhakanta Nandi , Kashinath Mishra , Bityut Banerjee , Deepak Sahai , Sanju Sahai and Shiv Sahai .
The 7th generation consists of Kumar Bose , Aditya Sahai , Krishna Sahai and Shubham Sahai .
Other noted artist include Kanthe Maharaj , uncle and Guru of Kishan Maharaj , and whose disciples were Badri Maharaj , Ashutosh Bhattacharya .
The Benares baj makes use of over twenty different compositional types , and has an enormously varied repertoire of each type .
Reputed players from the gharana include Anokhelal Mishra , Ramji Mishra , Kishan Maharaj , Samta Prasad , Mahapurush Misra , Chandra Nath Shastri , Ashutosh Bhattacharya and Sharda Sahai
A shruti box is a small wooden instrument that traditionally works on a system of bellows .
It is similar to a harmonium and is used to provide a drone in a practice session or concert of Indian classical music .
It is used as an accompaniment to other instruments and notably the flute .
Use of the shruti box has widened with the cross-cultural influences of world music and new age music to provide a drone for many other instruments as well as vocalists .
Adjustable buttons allow tuning .
Nowadays , electronic shruti boxes are commonly used , which are called shruti petti in Tamil and Telugu and sur peti in Hindi .
Before the arrival of the harmonium in India , musicians used either a tambura or a specific pitch reference instrument , such as the nadaswaram , to produce the drone .
Some forms of music such as Yakshagana used the pungi reedpipe as drone .
 After the the West small pump harmonium became popular , musicians would modify the harmonium to automatically produce the reference pitch .
Typically , one would open up the cover and adjust the stop of the harmonium to produce a drone .
Later , a keyless version of the harmonium was invented for the specific purpose of producing the drone sound .
It was given the name shruti box or sruti box .
These instruments had controls on the top or on the side of the box for controlling the pitch .
The shruti box is enjoying a renaissance in the West amongst traditional and contemporary musicians who are using it for a range of different styles .
In the early nineties traditional Irish singer Noirin Ni Riain brought the shruti box to Ireland , giving it a minor place in traditional Irish music .
 More recently Scottish folk artist Karine Polwart has championed the instrument , using Scottish on some of Scottish folk artist Karine Polwart songs .
 Singers find Scottish very useful as an accompaniment and instrumentalists enjoy the drone reference it gives to play along with
The Saptak Sangeet Samaroh is an annual 13-day classical music event , held in Ahmedabad , India , from the 1st to 13 January every year , and attended by hundreds of people .
The festival started in 1980 by Nandan and Manju Mehta , Rupande Shah , Bharti Parikh and D.D. Trivedi , with the blessings of Pandit Ravi Shankar and the late Pandit Kishan Maharaj .
The festival features both emerging talents and established performers .
 Besides pure classical music , The festival also includes performances of folk music , classical dance forms , and semi-classical forms such as thumri
Pandit Janardhan Mitta is a sitar player and Hindustani classical musician .
 Pandit Janardhan Mitta has had a presence in the Chennai film industry over the last 40 years and is also a noted musician in concert music .
Pandit Janardhan Mitta was born on 12 May 1934 , to a Telugu family in Hyderabad , India .
 Pandit Janardhan Mitta family was quite involved in music with a Telugu family in Hyderabad , India father , lawyer , playing the tabla and harmonium and a Telugu family in Hyderabad , India sister , the sitar , while a Telugu family in Hyderabad , India brother was a singer in college-level competitions .
 a Telugu family in Hyderabad , India began to play a Telugu family in Hyderabad , India sisters sitar after her marriage and began to teach a Telugu family in Hyderabad , India to play the instrument .
 Pandit Mitta auditioned for Deccan Radio , the predecessor of All India Radio in Hyderabad , in 1952 , impressing Shaik dawood khan , the tabla maestro with Shaik skill .
 Pandit Janardhan Mitta continued to play for Deccan Radio and in 1955 , Pandit Janardhan Mitta was introduced to Pandit Ravishankar by Pandit Janardhan Mitta colleagues at the radio station , after which Pandit Janardhan Mitta began Pandit Janardhan Mitta studentship under Pandit Ravishankar .
 In June 1958 , Pandit Janardhan Mitta played the sitar accompanying Pandit Janardhan Mitta brothers song at a Telugu film audition and impressed Ghantasala Venkateswara Rao , Telugu singer and composer .
 Pandit Janardhan Mitta was invited the next day to play at the inauguration of the then new Sarathy Studios in Hyderabad .
 This led to Pandit Janardhan Mitta first film compositions .
 Pandit Janardhan Mitta moved to Chennai in January 1959 and became a mainstay of sitar compositions in the Chennai film industry .
 This led on to Pandit Janardhan Mitta career in film composing .
 In 1967 Pandit Janardhan Mitta gave Pandit Janardhan Mitta first set of concerts as a member of the Government of Hyderabad , India sponsored youth delegation which toured several countries abroad .
 Pandit Janardhan Mitta is also noted for Pandit Janardhan Mitta partnership with Carnatic violinist Kanya Kumari , to create a fusion of the two styles of Carnatic and Hindustani classical .
 The duo released a music album in 2004 , titled Prashantham with the aim to promote peace and calm through Carnatic and Hindustani classical music .
 In Kanya Kumaris words , Its been established by now that music and more so instrumental music has therapeutic properties ... There must have been some internal stress factor somewhere , at some stage of life , which would have triggered a violent emotion that compels man to commit an offence ... If I could change at least one-tenth of such number of minds with I music , I will consider it an achievement .
One of Mittas compositions was also submitted by Sonoton Creative Sound Solutions for consideration to be played at the 2008 Beijing Olympic Games
Guru Rao Deshpande was a singer from Karnataka , India .
 Guru Rao Deshpande father , Narayanrao Deshpande , was a Carnatic musician who planned for Narayanrao Deshpande son to become a lawyer .
However , the young Gururao had exhibited an intense attraction for Hindustani classical music .
 the young Gururao parents had the young Gururao tutored by vocalists Dattopant Joshi and T. K.Pitre , when the young Gururao was just ten years old .
Renowned musician Bhimsen Joshi did not hear Gururao Deshpande sing until the latter was well known .
 Renowned musician Bhimsen Joshi then celebrated `` Shastabdi Samaroh '' for Gururao Deshpande on 14 April 1962 , in Pune .
During this function , guest of honour Krishna Rao described Deshpande 's music as the `` finest of pearls strung together '' .
 guest of honour Krishna Rao was versed both in Kannada and English and enjoyed reading both languages .
 guest of honour Krishna Rao mastered Kumaravyasa Bharata and Lakshmish Bharata , the two great epics of Kannada literature .
 guest of honour Krishna Rao innovation was to recite both these epics in Hindustani music Gamaka style , inspired by Bharat Bindurao .
 guest of honour Krishna Rao earned presenting the long discourses of Kumaravyasa and Lakshmisha Bharata .
 Throughout these Gamaka recitals across the State , the young Gururao was accompanied by Betageri Krishna Sharma , who provided the Vyakhyana .
The Gamaka conference at Hubli crowned Gururao with the title Gamaka Gauri Shankara .
 Gnyanpeeth poet D. R. Bendre kept close association with Gururao via discussions of Kannada literature .
 the young Gururao was equally proficient in English .
 the young Gururao passed Inter Arts and admired Wordsworth , Milton and Shakespeare .
 the young Gururao studied astrology and practiced Inter Arts for leisure
Rimpa Siva is an Indian musician known for being one of the few female tabla players .
 She was taught to play the Farukhabad gharana style by She father , Prof. Swapan Siva .
 She was the subject of the 1999 French documentary film Rimpa Siva : Princess of Tabla
Philip V. Francis was a tabla player , composer and Ghazal singer from Kerala , India .
 Philip V. Francis died at the age of 43 in a bike accident , leaving Philip V. Francis wife and son .
 Philip V. Francis was born in Thrissur , Kerala .
Philip started off as a conga drum player in the local orchestra group Neelambari , and under the able guidance of Joeboy a renowned player of drums , learnt the nuances of rhythm .
 Philip then migrated to Delhi to learn Tabla under the maestro Ustad Fiyaz Khan of the Delhi gharana .
 Thereafter Philip emerged as a Tabla player of national repute .
 Philip also learnt carnatic music and mrudangam for brief stints under Komattil Shanta Kumari and Purushothama Sharma of Thrisssur .
 Philip was never satisfied with what Philip learnt and later on studied western classical music and mastered the Guitar and Piano too .
 Philip also started composing and conducting Choir in Churches in and around Thrissur .
 Philip love for Ghazals saw Philip doing Ghazal programs and becoming popular as a Ghazal singer too in Philip short life span .
 Philip also worked with the late music Director Raveendran as an assistant in some films .
 Philip was the representative of the Delhi gharana School of music in Thrissur , Kerala and Philip had numerous disciples who were learning Tabla under Philip .
 Philip has performed in All India Radio , Doordarshan , Kairali , Asianet etc. as an accompanist on the Tabla for many leading singers like S. Janaki , P. Jayachandran , Gayatri Asokan , Pradip Somasundaran and performed as a Ghazal singer in many of the Television channels .
 Philip was a graded Artist of All India Radio both as a Tabla player and as a composer and Artist of All India Radio compositions used to be regularly broadcast in the All India Radio .
The Govt .
 of India recognised Philip talents and in 2003 Philip was deputed to Guyana , West Indies as a cultural ambassador by ICCR .
 Philip was back to Kerala after Philip contract was over in 2007 .
 Philip was one among the 50 eminent people of Thrissur , honoured by the Corporation of Thrissur in 2007 for Philip contributions towards music .
 Philip last work as a music director was for the film Oridathoru Puzhayundu directed by Kalavoor Ravikumar .
 Philip was a major influence on many of the music directors and musicians of the younger generation like Alphons Joseph and Gayatri Asokan .
 As a tribute music lovers of Thrissur formed Piano , an organisation in Philip memory which aims to promote music and harmony .
 The organisation plans to hold a yearly music festival at Thrissur , and institute an endowment in Philip name on an academic level .
Piano was formally inaugurated by the Nightingale of South India , S. Janaki on 3.05.08 .
Ustad Fiyaz Khan the Tabla Maestro and Philips Guru was present on the occasion
 Ravi Shankar , Ravi Shankar , KBE , often referred to by the title Pandit , was an Indian musician and composer who played the sitar .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE has been described as the best-known contemporary Indian musician .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE was born in Varanasi and spent Ravi Shankar , KBE youth touring Europe and Brand India with the dance group of his brother Uday Shankar .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE gave up dancing in 1938 to study sitar playing under court musician Allauddin Khan .
 After finishing Ravi Shankar , KBE studies in 1944 , Ravi Shankar , KBE worked as a composer , creating the music for the Apu Trilogy by Satyajit Ray , and was music director of All India Radio , New Delhi , from 1949 to 1956 .
 In 1956 , Ravi Shankar , KBE began to tour Europe and the Americas playing Indian classical music and increased its popularity there in the 1960s through teaching , performance , and Ravi Shankar , KBE association with violinist Yehudi Menuhin and rock artist George Harrison of the Beatles .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE engaged the West music by writing concerti for sitar and orchestra and toured the world in the 1970s and 1980s .
 From 1986 to 1992 Ravi Shankar , KBE served as a nominated member of Rajya Sabha , the upper chamber of the Parliament of India .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE was awarded Indias highest civilian honour , the Bharat Ratna , in 1999 , and received three Grammy Awards .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE continued to perform in the 2000s , sometimes with Ravi Shankar , KBE younger daughter , daughter Anoushka .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE was posthumously awarded two Grammy awards in 2013 , one for lifetime achievement , another for The Living Room Sessions Part 1 in the world music category .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE was born Robindro Shaunkor Chowdhury on 7 April 1920 in Varanasi , to a Bengali Brahmin family as the youngest of seven brothers .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE father , Shyam Shankar , a Middle Temple barrister and scholar who served as dewan of Jhalawar , used the Sanskrit spelling of the family name and removed dewan of Jhalawar last part .
 Tilak Shyam was married to Shankars mother Hemangini Devi , and later worked as a lawyer in London , England .
 There Tilak Shyam married a second time while Hemangini Devi raised Shankar in Varanasi , and did not meet Shankar in Varanasi son until Shankar in Varanasi was eight years old .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE shortened the Sanskrit version of Ravi Shankar , KBE first name , Ravindra , to Ravindra , for sun .
 At the age of ten , after spending Ravi Shankar , KBE first decade in Varanasi , Ravi Shankar , KBE went to Paris with the dance group of his brother , choreographer Uday Shankar .
 By the age of 13 Ravi Shankar , KBE had become a member of the group , accompanied its members on tour and learned to dance and play various Indian instruments .
 Udays dance group toured Europe and the United States in the early to mid-1930s and Ravi Shankar , KBE learned French , discovered the West classical music , jazz , cinema and became acquainted with the West customs .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE heard the lead musician for the Maihar court , Allauddin Khan , in December 1934 at a music conference in Kolkata and Ravi Shankar , KBE convinced the Maharaja of Maihar in 1935 to allow court musician Allauddin Khan to become court musician Allauddin Khan groups soloist for a tour of Europe .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE was sporadically trained by court musician Allauddin Khan on tour , and court musician Allauddin Khan offered Ravi Shankar , KBE training to become a serious musician under the condition that he abandon touring and come to Maihar .
 Shankars parents had died by the time Ravi Shankar , KBE returned from the European tour , and touring the West had become difficult due to political conflicts that would lead to World War II .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE gave up Ravi Shankar , KBE dancing career in 1938 to go to Maihar and study Indian classical music as court musician Allauddin Khan pupil , living with Ravi Shankar , KBE family in the traditional gurukul system .
 court musician Allauddin Khan was a rigorous teacher and Ravi Shankar , KBE had training on sitar and surbahar , learned ragas and the musical styles dhrupad , dhamar , and khyal , and was taught the techniques of the instruments rudra veena , rubab , and sursingar .
 court musician Allauddin Khan often studied with court musician Allauddin Khan children Ali Akbar Khan and Annapurna Devi .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE began to perform publicly on sitar in December 1939 and Ravi Shankar , KBE debut performance was a jugalbandi with Ali Akbar Khan , who played the string instrument sarod .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE completed Ravi Shankar , KBE training in 1944 .
 Following Ravi Shankar , KBE training , Ravi Shankar , KBE moved to Mumbai and joined the Indian Peoples Theatre Association , for whom Ravi Shankar , KBE composed music for ballets in 1945 and 1946 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE recomposed the music for the popular song Sare Jahan Se Achcha at the age of 25 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE began to record music for HMV India and worked as a music director for All India Radio , New Delhi , from February 1949 to January 1956 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE founded the Indian National Orchestra at AIR Delhi and composed for the Indian National Orchestra ; in Ravi Shankar , KBE compositions Ravi Shankar , KBE combined the West and classical Indian instrumentation .
 Beginning in the mid-1950s Ravi Shankar , KBE composed the music for the Apu Trilogy by Satyajit Ray , which became internationally acclaimed .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE was music director for several Hindi movies including Godaan and Anuradha .
 V. K. Narayana Menon , director of AIR Delhi , introduced the the West violinist Yehudi Menuhin to Shankar during Menuhins first visit to Brand India in 1952 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE had performed as part of a cultural delegation in the Soviet Union in 1954 and Menuhin invited Ravi Shankar , KBE in 1955 to perform in New York City for a demonstration of Indian classical music , sponsored by the Ford Foundation .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE declined to attend due to problems in Ravi Shankar , KBE marriage , but recommended Ali Akbar Khan to play instead .
 court musician Allauddin Khan reluctantly accepted and performed with tabla player Chatur Lal in the Museum of Modern Art , and court musician Allauddin Khan later became the first Indian classical musician to perform on American television and record a full raga performance , for Angel Records .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE heard about the positive response court musician Allauddin Khan received and resigned from AIR Delhi in 1956 to tour the United Kingdom , Germany , and the United States .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE played for smaller audiences and educated them about Indian music , incorporating ragas from the South Indian Carnatic music in South Indian Carnatic performances , and recorded Ravi Shankar , KBE first LP album Three Ragas in London , released in 1956 .
 In 1958 , Ravi Shankar , KBE participated in the celebrations of the tenth anniversary of the United Nations and UNESCO music festival in Paris .
 From 1961 , Ravi Shankar , KBE toured Europe , the United States , and Australia , and became the first Indian to compose music for non-Indian films .
 Chatur Lal accompanied Ravi Shankar , KBE on tabla until 1962 , when Alla Rakha assumed the role .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE founded the Kinnara School of Music in Mumbai in 1962 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE befriended Richard Bock , founder of World Pacific Records , on Ravi Shankar , KBE first American tour and recorded most of Ravi Shankar , KBE albums in the 1950s and 1960s for Bocks label .
 The Byrds recorded at the same studio and heard Ravi Shankar , KBE music , which led The Byrds to incorporate some of its elements in The Byrds , introducing the genre to The Byrds friend George Harrison of the Beatles .
 Harrison became interested in Indian classical music , bought a sitar and used Sitar to record the song Norwegian Wood .
This led to Indian music being used by other musicians and created the raga rock trend .
 Harrison met Shankar in London in June 1966 and visited Brand India later that year for six weeks to study sitar under Shankar in Srinagar .
 During the visit , a documentary film about Ravi Shankar , KBE named Raga was shot by Howard Worth , and released in 1971 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE association with Harrison greatly increased Shankars popularity and Ken Hunt of Allmusic would state that Ravi Shankar , KBE had become the most famous Indian musician on the planet by 1966 .
 In 1967 , Padma Vibhushan , Ravi Shankar , KBE performed at the Monterey Pop Festival and won a Grammy Award for Best Chamber Music Performance for the West Meets East , a collaboration with Yehudi Menuhin .
The same year , the Beatles won the Grammy Award for Album of the Year for Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band , which included Within You Without You by Harrison , a song that was influenced by Indian classical music .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE opened a the West branch of the Kinnara School of Music in Los Angeles , California , Los Angeles , in May 1967 , and published an autobiography , My Music , My Life , in 1968 .
 In 1968 , Ravi Shankar , KBE scored for the movie Charly .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE performed at the Woodstock Festival in August 1969 , and found Ravi Shankar , KBE disliked the venue .
 In the 1970s Ravi Shankar , KBE distanced Ravi Shankar , KBE from the hippie movement .
 In October 1970 Ravi Shankar , KBE became chair of the department of Indian music of the California Institute of the Arts after previously teaching at the City College of New York , the University of California , Los Angeles , and being guest lecturer at other colleges and universities , including the Ali Akbar College of Music .
 In late 1970 , the London Symphony Orchestra invited Ravi Shankar , KBE to compose a concerto with sitar .
 Concerto for Sitar and the Indian National Orchestra was performed with Andre Previn as conductor and Ravi Shankar , KBE playing the sitar .
Hans Neuhoff of Musik in Geschichte und Gegenwart has criticised the usage of the orchestra in this concert as amateurish .
 George Harrison organized the charity Concert for Bangladesh in August 1971 , in which Ravi Shankar , KBE participated .
 After the musicians had tuned up on stage for over a minute , the crowd broke into applause , to which the amused Shankar responded : If you like our tuning so much , My hope you will enjoy the playing more .
 Although interest in Indian music had decreased in the early 1970s , the concert album became one of the best-selling recordings to feature the genre and won Ravi Shankar , KBE a second Grammy Award .
 During the 1970s , Ravi Shankar , KBE and Harrison worked together again , recording Shankar Family & Friends in 1973 and touring North America the following year to a mixed response after Ravi Shankar , KBE had toured Europe with the Harrison-sponsored Music Festival from Brand India .
 The demanding schedule weakened Ravi Shankar , KBE , and Ravi Shankar , KBE suffered a heart attack in Chicago in November 1974 , causing Ravi Shankar , KBE to miss a portion of the tour .
 In Ravi Shankar , KBE absence , Shankars sister-in-law , singer Lakshmi Shankar , conducted the touring orchestra .
The touring band visited the White House on invitation of John Gardner Ford , son of U.S. President Gerald Ford .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE toured and taught for the remainder of the 1970s and the 1980s and released Ravi Shankar , KBE second concerto , Raga Mala , conducted by Zubin Mehta , in 1981 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Original Music Score for Ravi Shankar , KBE work on the 1982 movie Gandhi , but lost to John Williams E.T. Ravishankar : A Legend of Glory , produced by Prabir Roy represented Doordarshan in International TV Network Festival , held in Miami , Florida , in September 1984 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE served as a member of the Rajya Sabha , the upper chamber of the Parliament of India , from 12 May 1986 to 11 May 1992 , after being nominated by Indian Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE composed the dance drama Ghanashyam in 1989 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE liberal views on musical cooperation led Ravi Shankar , KBE to contemporary composer Philip Glass , with whom Ravi Shankar , KBE released an album , Passages , in 1990 .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE underwent an angioplasty in 1992 due to heart problems , after which George Harrison involved himself in several of Shankars projects .
 Because of the positive response to Shankars 1996 career compilation In Celebration , Ravi Shankar , KBE wrote a second autobiography , Raga Mala , with Harrison as editor .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE performed in between 25 and 40 concerts every year during the late 1990s .
 Ravi Shankar , KBE taught Ravi Shankar , KBE daughter Anoushka Shankar to play sitar and in 1997 became a Regents Lecturer at University of California , San Diego .
 In the 2000s , Ravi Shankar , KBE won a Grammy Award for Best World Music Album for and toured with daughter Anoushka , who released a book about daughter Anoushka father , Bapi : Love of My Life , in 2002 .
 daughter Anoushka performed a composition by Shankar for the 2002 Harrison memorial Concert for George and Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar wrote a third concerto for sitar and orchestra for daughter Anoushka and the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra .
 In June 2008 , Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar played what was billed as Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar last European concert , but Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar 2011 tour included dates in the United Kingdom .
 On 1 July 2010 , at the Southbank Centre s Royal the Harrison-sponsored Music Festival Hall , London , London , England , Anoushka Shankar , on sitar , performed with the London Philharmonic Orchestra , conducted by David Murphy what was billed the first Symphony by Ravi Shankar .
This performance was recorded and is available on CD .
 Chamber Music Performance is 40:52 minutes long and is composed of 4 movements , slow , scherzo , finale -RRB- like a classical the West symphony but uses an Indian raga as the mode for each movement : I. Allegro 9:21 minutes , World War II .
Lento 7:52 minutes , III .
Scherzo 8:49 minutes IV .
Finale 14:50 minutes .
The website of the Ravi Shankar Foundation provides the information that The symphony was written in Indian notation in 2010 , and has been interpreted by his student and conductor , David Murphy .
 The information available on the website does not explain this process of interpretation of Ravi Shankars notation by David Murphy , nor how Ravi Shankars Indian notation could accommodate the West orchestral writing .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar developed a style distinct from that of Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar contemporaries and incorporated influences from rhythm practices of South Indian Carnatic music .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar performances begin with solo alap , jor , and jhala influenced by the slow and serious dhrupad genre , followed by a section with tabla accompaniment featuring compositions associated with the prevalent khyal style .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar often closed Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar performances with a piece inspired by the light-classical thumri genre .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar has been considered one of the top sitar players of the second half of the 20th century .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar popularized performing on the bass octave of the sitar for the alap section and became known for a distinctive playing style in the middle and high registers that used quick and short deviations of the playing string and Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar sound creation through stops and strikes on the main playing string .
 Narayana Menon of The New Grove Dictionary noted Ravi Shankar , KBE liking for rhythmic novelties , among them the use of unconventional rhythmic cycles .
 Hans Neuhoff of Musik in Geschichte und Gegenwart has argued that Shankars playing style was not widely adopted and that Shankars playing style was surpassed by other sitar players in the performance of melodic passages .
Shankars interplay with Alla Rakha improved appreciation for tabla playing in Hindustani classical music .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar promoted the jugalbandi duet concert style and introduced new ragas , including Tilak Shyam , Nat Bhairav and Bairagi .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar won the Silver Bear Extraordinary Prize of the Jury at the 1957 Berlin International Film Festival for composing the music for the movie Kabuliwala .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 1962 , and was named a Fellow of the academy for 1975 , three Grammy Awards .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was awarded the three highest national civil honours of Brand India : Padma Bhushan , in 1967 , Padma Vibhushan , Padma Vibhushan , in 1981 , and Bharat Ratna , in 1999 .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar received the music award of the UNESCO International Music Council in 1975 , three Grammy Awards , three Grammy Awards , and was nominated for an Academy Award .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was awarded honorary degrees from universities in Brand India and the United States .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar received the Kalidas Samman from the Government of Madhya Pradesh for 1987-88 , the Fukuoka Asian Culture Prize in 1991 , the Ramon Magsaysay Award in 1992 , and the Polar Music Prize in 1998 .
 In 2001 , Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was made an honorary Knight Commander of the Order of the British Empire by Elizabeth II for Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar services to music .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was an honorary member of the American Academy of Arts and Letters and in 1997 received the Praemium Imperiale for music from the Japan Art Association .
 The American jazz saxophonist John Coltrane named his son Ravi Coltrane after Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar .
 In 2010 , Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar received an Honorary Doctor of Laws from the University of Melbourne , Australia .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was also awarded Frances highest civilian honour , the Knight of the Legion of the Bharat Ratna .
 Post Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar death , the lifetime achievement Grammy has announced Pandit Ravi Shankar as a recipient of the lifetime achievement Grammy like Glenn Gould , Charlie Haden , Lightnin ' Hopkins , Carole King , Patti Page and the Temptations .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was the first recipient of the Tagore Award in recognition of Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar outstanding contribution to cultural harmony and universal values .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar received a posthumous nomination in the 56th Annual Grammy Awards for Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar album The Living Room Sessions Part 2 .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar married Allauddin Khans daughter Annapurna Devi in 1941 and Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar son Shubhendra Shankar was born in 1942 .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar separated from Hemangini Devi during the 1940s and had a relationship with Kamala Shastri , a dancer , beginning in the late 1940s .
An affair with Sue Jones , a New York concert producer , led to the birth of Norah Jones in 1979 .
 After separating from Kamala Shastri in 1981 , Anoushka Shankar was born to Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar and Sukanya Rajan .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar , however , lived with Sue Jones until 1986 .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar married Sukanya Rajan , whom Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar had known since the 1970s in 1989 at Chilkur Temple in Hyderabad , India .
 Shubhendra Shubho Shankar often accompanied Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar father on tours .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar could play the sitar and surbahar , but elected not to pursue a solo career .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar died in 1992 .
Norah Jones became a successful musician in the 2000s , winning eight Grammy Awards in 2003 .
Anoushka Shankar was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best World Music Album in 2003 .
 daughter Anoushka and daughter Anoushka father were nominated for Best World Music Album at the 2013 Grammy Awards for separate albums .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was a Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar and a vegetarian .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar wore a large diamond ring which Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar said was `` manifested '' by Sathya Sai Baba .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar lived with Sukanya Rajan in Encinitas , California .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar performed Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar final concert , with daughter daughter Anoushka , on 4 November 2012 at the Terrace Theater in Long Beach , California , Los Angeles .
 On 6 December 2012 , Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar was admitted to Scripps Memorial Hospital in La Jolla , San Diego , California , Los Angeles after complaining of breathing difficulties .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar died on 11 December 2012 at around 16:30 PST .
 According to Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar spokesman , Stuart Wolferman , Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar died at a hospital near Stuart Wolferman home in Encinitas , California .
 The Ravi Shankar Foundation issued a statement that read Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar had suffered from upper-respiratory and heart issues over the past year and underwent heart-valve replacement surgery on 6 December 2012 .
 Condolences were extended by the President of Brand India , Prime Minister of Brand India and Indian parliament , Other reactions from the Indian political and cultural spheres included : Prime Minister Manmohan Singh s office which wrote on Twitter that Prime Minister Manmohan Singh was a national treasure and global ambassador of Indias cultural heritage .
 the President of India cabinet colleague Minister of State for Communications & State for Communications & Milind Deora wrote : Being a maestro wasnt his only achievement .
Pandit Ravi Shankar sold Brand India better than anyone else .
RIP .
 Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi added on Twitter : Sitar maestro Pandit Ravi Shankar was the legendary musician who gave new identity to Indian classical music .
 May Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi soul rest in peace .
While , Indias Ambassador to the U.S. Nirupama Rao also wrote on Twitter : Pandit Ravi Shankar : his last concert was particularly poignant .
 daughter Anoushka and he played together in perfect unison .
A torch was passed .
 Other apolitical reactions included : Bollywood composer Vishal Dadlani who wrote on Twitter : The worlds best-known exponent of Indian music , he influenced the Beatles , and hence everything since !
RIP Pt .
Ravi Shankar .
 Santoor players Shiv Kumar Sharma said : Twitter is a great loss , not just to Indian music but to world music .
 Shiv Kumar Sharma was a world musician .
 Novelist Hari Kunzru added on Twitter : RIP Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 My father performed hand surgery on Bapi : Love of My Life .
 Stakes not low there ... Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar also wrote on Twitter : Pandit Ravi Shankar was a legend in music and Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar took classical music to new heights .
 Spiritual guru Sri Sri Ravi Shankar death was also noted in the international and foreign language media .
The Swara Samrat festival organized on January 5-6 , 2013 was dedicated to Ravi Shankar and Ali Akbar Khan where musicians like Shivkumar Sharma , Birju Maharaj , Hari Prasad Chaurasia , Zakir Hussain , Girija Devi etc. performed
A mehfil is a gathering or evening of courtly entertainment of poetry or concert of Indian classical music and dance , performed for a small audience in an intimate setting .
Historically , mehfils were presented in the homes or palaces of Muslim royalty or noblemen , who acted as these artists patrons .
Today they are generally given in the homes of especially avid music lovers .
Ghazals are a common genre performed at mehfils .
Such performances are rarer today than in the past .
The word mehfil derives from the Urdu language , which in turn derives from the Arabic word mehfil , which means a gathering to entertain .
Mehfil-e-Naat is an Islamic mehfil in which people sit and recite poetry in the praise of the Prophet Muhammad .
Mehfil-e-Sama is a gathering held for Sufi devotional music such as Qawwali or prayer and chanting , Hadhra , part of Dhikr .
Several mehfil performances may be seen in the Satyajit Ray film Jalsaghar
Shounak Abhisheki -LRB- Devanagari : shaunk abhissekii is an Indian vocalist , composer of classical , semi-classical , and devotional music .
Shounak Abhisheki , the son and disciple of Maestro Pt .
Jitendra Abhisheki , is a vocalist who combines Agra and Jaipur styles of Hindustani Classical Music .
Albhisheki trained under Smt .
Kamaltai Tambe of the Jaipur Gharana .
Shounak has performed special programs such as Swarabhishek , Tulsi Ke Ram & Kabir and Abhang , based on on his fathers compositions .
In addition to several Indian music festivals , he has performed a series of concerts in the United States , the United Kingdom , the Soviet Union , the Persian Gulf and Thailand .
Shounak has been recorded by Sony Music , Music Today , Times Music , Ninad Music , Music Curry , and Fountain Music
Harballabh Sangeet Sammelan is the oldest festival of Indian Classical Music in the world , which is celebrated every year at the sacred seat of music , the samadhi of Baba Harballabh - a saint and an exponent of Hindustani Classical Music .
The first Sammelan was held in 1875 at the Sidh Peeth-Shri Devi Talab , in Jalandhar .
Since then it has been held every year .
The Sangeet Sammelan which has grown from strength to strength in the last 131 years has been attracting audiences and artists from all across the country and abroad .
This festival was declared as one of the National Festivals by the Department of Tourism , Govt .
 of the India .
 All prominent artists of Hindustani Classical Music from the India and Pakistan have come and performed at the Harballabh Sangeet Sammelan at one time or the other during the last 130 years .
Father of the Nation , Mahatma Gandhi accompanied by Vishnu Digambar Paluskar visited Baba Harballabh Sangeet Sammelan in the year 1919 .
 Union Ministers , Governors , State Chief Ministers , State Ministers and other VIPs have been visiting to pay Union Ministers reverence at this festival of music .
 The festival attracts thousands of music lovers from all over the the India and abroad every year .
This number is increasing year after year .
In 1956 a Sangeet Academy was constructed under the banner of Swami Hariballabh .
While we hear Swami Hariballabh it seems clear that `` The key to the mystery of a great artist is that for reasons unknown , he will give away his energies and his life just to make sure that one note follows another ... and leaves us with the feeling that something is right in the world . ''

The main aim of the festival was to attract and encourage more and more people for the development of classical Music .
There is also a proper syllabus for the pursuers of Music and there is a shrine at the banks of the river with the name Devi Talab .
There is a Shiva lingam in the temple nearby and one adores the exquisite phallic image of Lord Shiva .
On the day of the fair there is also free lodging and accommodation .
 It is held near the Samadhi of Saint Baba Harballabh , from the 27th to 30 December .
 During this time reputed musicians from all over the India gather in Jalandhar to celebrate Indian Classical Music
Pandit Chandra Nath Shastri is one of the most acclaimed and senior Tabla artists & musician from India , currently based in Kolkata .
He belongs to the Benares Gharana of Hindustani Classical Music .
He is retired Staff Artist in All India Radio and also performed regularly for Doordarshan - Indian National Television Channels .
In addition to his musical abilities , he is also an expert Astrologer .
 Born in Dhakuria area of Calcutta , West Bengal , in a well known Bramhin family , Chandra Nath Shastri has been groomed in a musical atmosphere since a well known Bramhin family birth .
 Soon a well known Bramhin family parents and family shifted to Varanasi , Uttar Pradesh , India .
 Where later a well known Bramhin family has a well known Bramhin family training in Banaras Gharana .
 a well known Bramhin family comes with a family link with the Indian Poet , Lyricist , Writer , Nobel Prize winner Rabindra Nath Tagore .
 a well known Bramhin family grandmother , Smt .
Indira Devi was niece of Rabindra Nath Tagore .
 His father Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri was a physician by profession but His father Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri was also a spiritual guru and musician , student of Rabindra Nath Tagore .
 His father Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri had also done many Theater , film Acting performances and some Theater Direction in His father Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri life time .
Grandfather of Chandra Nath Shastri was Shri Priya Nath Shastri , who was one of the first three trustees of Visva Bharati University .
 Chandra Nath Shastri done his schooling from C. M. Anglo Bengali Inter College , Varanasi , U.P. .
 After that he done his Graduation in Science from Banaras Hindu University , Varanasi .
 Discovering Chandranaths interest in hindustani classical music from very young age his father initially taught His father Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri to play some Taals on Tabla .
Then from the age of just 5 , Chandra Nath Shastri had started learning from his Guruji Pandit Anokhelal Mishra of Banaras .
 He and his elder brother Partha Nath Shastry used to go to his Guruji Pandit Anokhelal Mishra AnokhelalJi together to learn Tabla .
 After death of Tabla Samrat Tabla Samrat also took lessons from Pandit Ramji Mishra .
 Taking guidance from Tabla Samrat Gurujis his Gurujis became an excellent 5th generation Tabla maestro of Banaras Gharana .
From the very early teeanage he also became close to Pandit Mahadev Prasad Mishra , Pandit Kishan Maharaj , Pandit Samta Prasad , Pandit Sarda Sahai , Ustad Karamatullah Khan & many more and got blessed by them .
Chandra Nath Shastri Became The Champion in All India Radio National Competition just at the very young age of 23 .
Often referred to by the title Pandit , he is an All India Radio staff artist , Indian National Television Channel artist and also a stage performing artist .
As a regular performer in TV and radio and stage , till now he has done several thousands of performances and recordings .
 Now he is retired from All India Radio , Calcutta .
Chandra Nath Shastri has performed in many concerts in many places , including tabla solos , percussion ensembles and accompanied with countless instrumentalists and vocalists , and worked with some of the great music composers and film directors .
Beside performing solo he also performed with many renowned musicians , such as - Pandit Mahadev Prasad Mishra , Pandit V. G. Jog , Ustad Sagiruddin Khan , Ustad Rashid Khan , Pandit Lalmani Misra , Pandit Buddhadev Das Gupta , Pandit Shrichand Mishra , Pandit Jnan Prakash Ghosh , Pandit Rabindra Narayan Goswami , Ustad Mushtaq Ali Khan , Pandit Shalil Shankar , Bidushi Purnima Sen , Singh Bandhu Brothers , Pandit V. Balsara , Pandit Ramesh Mishra , Manilal Nag , Tejendra Narayan Majumdar , Debashish Bhattacharya and many more .
He has judged many musical competitions and talent hunt contests .
 He also has done many researches in Indian music and has done lots of unique creations on music especially in the field of Tabla .
He is also a Pakhawaj , Khol , Mridangam and other Indian percussion instruments expert .
Chandra Nath Shastri Became The Champion in All India Radio National Competition in 1972 .
Chandra Nath Shastri is awarded with many prestigious awards for his excellence in music .
 He also got awarded by President of India for his Tabla playing skills .
He perform both as a accompanist as well as a soloist .
 He is recognized as Taalmani for his excellence in rhythm and melody on Tabla .
 He has done several thousands of performances and recordings in All India Radio and Indian National Television Channel .
He enjoys teaching Tabla and other musical instrument to students all around the world .
He has taught in many music schools , academies and institutes & done many musical workshops , also presently he is into these activities .
 Beside Hindustani Classical Music , Chandra Nath Shastri also studies and research about Spirituality and on how Spirituality effect our life .
His father late Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri was grand disciple of spiritual guru Sri Sri Bijoy Krishna Goswami & disciple of Sri Kiran Chand Darbesh Ji Maharaj .
 His father late Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri is researching on the connection between Hindustani Classical Music and Spirituality for a long time and also gives advises to others on these topics .
 His father late Dr. Mouli Nath Shastri is also an expert Astrologer
Kamala Bose was a prominent Indian classical vocalist .
Kamala Bose was an eminent vocalist in Hindustani Classical music based in Allahabad .
She hails from a family that is deeply rooted in the field of performing and fine arts and boasts of a rich musical tradition .
She was initiated in this field by her father , the late J.D. Mazumdar , a reputed violinist and music composer with the All India Radio .
It was from him that she received her initial training , and at the age of 5 she already started humming the songs she would hear .
In 1969 , she came under the tutelage of the renowned vocalist , musicologist and teacher , Pt .
Ramashray Jha of the Bhatt Gharana .
 In 1977 , she completed her Masters Degree from the Allahabad University , in Allahabad with a distinction in Music Vocal .
She specialized in classical vocal or the khayal form , light classical i.e. Thumri , Dadra , Chaiti , Hori , Kajari etc. , with great finesse .
 Bose commenced her musical journey in 1970 with All India Radio , Allahabad as an A grade artist of classical vocal music .
Subsequently , she was appointed as a panellist in the Audition Board by The Director General , A.I.R , New Delhi .
Boses proscenium experience was wide and impressive .
She travelled and performed extensively in both India and abroad , participating in many major concerts , including the Sadarang Music Conference , Kolkata , Haridas Sangeet Sammelan , Mumbai , Sankat Mochan , Varanasi , Bangalore Sangeet Sabha , to name a few .
The A.I.R. in Sangeet Shiksha , a special feature of 26 episodes and the Gyan Vani Program on the FM Channel , comprising 10 episodes , invited her to disseminate her knowledge in classical music .
Through them she unravelled and simplified both the basics as well as the complex aspects in the development of the ragas .
 A Head of the Music Department with the Allahabad Degree College , Allahabad , Allahabad had great command over the theoretical aspects of Indian Classical Music in addition to Allahabad mastery over the performing side .
 Allahabad successfully conducted many workshops and lecture cum demo sessions prominent among which are : .
Kamala was married to Sri .
Bichitra Mohan Bose and they have one son named Jayanto Bose and two daughters named Nabonita Mitra and JoitaBoseMandal .
Bose has undertaken extensive foreign tours in US in 2009 and has also performed in France , Switzerland , Germany , Italy , Austria in 2003 .
 The Italian TV in 1998 and Swiss National Radio in 1999 have also recorded JoitaBoseMandal .
 Nandi Records released JoitaBoseMandal first CD titled Reverberation in 1998 .
Kamala Bose , a well-known disciple of renowned musicologist , Pandit Ramashreya Jha .
Renowned sitar player Gaurav Mazumdar , a disciple of Kamala Bose .
Performance at All India Radios National Program , April 20 , 2008
Tomi Koivusaari is the rhythm guitarist and former vocalist of the Finnish metal band Amorphis .
He started playing at the age of 12 , his first band was Violent Solution formed in 1987 , with him on guitars and vocals , Esa Holopainen on guitars and Jan Rechberger on drums .
The band played thrash metal , recorded a demo and an EP .
He also formed a death/doom band called Abhorrence in 1989 , and recorded a demo and an EP .
 Both bands broke up in 1990 , but Tomi was not a member of Violent Solution since Tomi formed Abhorrence in 1989 .
 In 1990 , Tomi , Esa , Jan and bass guitarist Olli-Pekka Laine formed the Finnish metal band Amorphis .
 In 1996 , Tomi formed Ajattara with Pasi Koskinen .
 Tomi used the Samuel Lempo name in the band
Gauhar Jaan was an Indian singer and dancer from Calcutta .
 She was one of the first performers to record music on 78 rpm records in Saregama India , and released by Gramophone Company of India .
Gauhar Jaan was born as Angelina Yeoward in on 26 June 1873 in Azamgarh , of Armenian descent .
Her father , William Robert Yeoward , worked as an engineer in a dry ice factory , and married her mother , Victoria Hemmings , in 1872 .
 Victoria , an Indian by birth , an Indian by birth , had been trained in music and dance .
 In 1879 the marriage ended , causing hardships to both mother and daughter , who later migrated to Banaras in 1881 , with a Muslim nobleman , Khursheed , who appreciated Victorias music more than Victoria , an Indian by birth husband .
 Later , Victoria , an Indian by birth , converted to Islam and changed Angelinas name to Gauhar Jaan and Victoria , an Indian by birth to Malka Jaan .
 In time , Victoria , an Indian by birth became an accomplished singer , Kathak dancer and a courtesan in Banaras , and made a name for Victoria , an Indian by birth , as Badi Malka Jan ; Victoria , an Indian by birth was called Badi because at that time three other Malka Jans were famous : Malka Jan of Agra , Malka Jan of Mulk Pukhraj and Malka Jan of Chulbuli , and Victoria , an Indian by birth was the eldest among them .
 Finally , Malka Jaan moved back to Calcutta in 1883 , and established Malka Jaan in the courts of Nawab Wajid Ali Shah , who had settled at Matiaburj , near Kolkata and within three years purchased a building at 24 Chitpore Road , for Rs .40,000 .
 Calcutta is here that young Gauhar started young Gauhar training , young Gauhar learnt pure and light classical Hindustani vocal music from , Kale Khan of Patiala , ` Kalu Ustad ' , Ustad Vazir Khan of Rampur , and Ustad Ali Baksh and Kathak from legendary Brindadin Maharaj , Dhrupad dhamar from Srijanbai , and Bengali Keertan from Charan Das .
 Soon young Gauhar also started writing and composing ghazals under the pen-name ` Hamdam ' and became proficient in Rabindra Sangeet .
 Gauhar Jaan gave her maiden performance at the royal courts of Darbhanga Raj in 1887 and was appointed as court musician , after receiving extensive dance and music training from a professional dancer at Banaras .
 Gauhar Jan started performing in Calcutta in 1896 and was called the first dancing girl in young Gauhar records .
 Gauhar Jaan first visited Madras in 1910 , for a concert in the Victoria Public Hall , and soon Hindustani Hindustani and Urdu songs were published in a Tamil music book .
In December , 1911 , she was famously invited to perform at the coronation of King George V at Delhi Durbar , where she sang a duet , Ye Hai Tajposhi Ka Jalsa , Mubarak Ho Mubarak Ho , with Jankibai of Allahabad .
 December is said that , Begum Akhtar in her early days wanted to pursue a career in Hindi films , but after listening to the singing of young Gauhar and young Gauhar mother , young Gauhar gave up the idea completely and devoted young Gauhar to learning Hindustani classical music , in fact , young Gauhar first teacher was Ustad Imdad Khan , who accompanied the mother-daughter duo on sarangi .
 Eventually , in Begum Akhtar in her early days final days , Begum Akhtar in her early days moved to Mysore , at the invitation of Krishna Raja Wadiyar IV of Mysore , and on August 1 , 1928 , Begum Akhtar in her early days was appointed as a Palace musician , though Begum Akhtar in her early days died within 18 months , on January 17 , 1930 in Mysore .
 In Begum Akhtar in her early days lifetime , Begum Akhtar in her early days recorded more than 600 records from 1902 to 1920 , in more than ten languages , including Bengali Keertan , Hindustani , Gujarati , Tamil , Marathi , Arabic , Persian , Pushto , French , and English .
 Begum Akhtar in her early days would round off Begum Akhtar in her early days performances for a record by announcing My name is Gohar Jan. .
 Begum Akhtar in her early days popularised light Hindustani classical music with Begum Akhtar in her early days thumri , dadra , kajri , chaiti , bhajan , tarana renditions , and also mastered the technique of condensing performing the elaborate melody Hindustani classical style to just three and a half minutes for a record .
 Begum Akhtar in her early days most famous song are , thumri sung in Bhairavi is Mora nahak laye gavanava , jabse gaye mori sud huna live , Ras ke bhare Tore Nain , Mere dard-e-jigar and Bhajans like , Radhey Krishna Bol Mukhse .
Indias first disc had Gauhar Jaan , singing a khayal in Raag Jogiya , recorded on November 2 , 1902 , by Fred Gaisberg , an assistant to Emile Berliner , the father of Gramophone record , who left America to become the first recording engineer with the Gramophone Company , London .
 The recording was done in a makeshift recording studio in two large rooms of a hotel in Kolkata , and at the end of the trial recording Gauhar Jaan announced - `` My name is Gauhar Jaan '' .
Gauhar Jaan agreed to do the recording session for a princely sum of 3,000 rupees .
By 1903 , her records started appearing in Indian markets and were in great demand .
 Saregama India -RRB- , is planning to re-release the milestone recordings of Gauhar Jaan , after retrieving them from Gramophone Company 's the Gramophone Company , London archives , and restoring them to their original glory .
 Her songs are also part of the Vintage Music From Saregama India audio album , and her image forms its cover .
There were four singing contemporaries of Gauhar Jaan with first names pronounced the same way as hers and sometimes spelled in English in different ways : .
- Miss Gohar , who was associated with Parsi Theatrical Company in Bombay ; .
 - Gohar Kayoum Mamajiwala , a singer actress who was associated with and mistress of Sardar Chandulal Shah of Ranjit Films , Bombay ; and
The pakhavaj or mridang is an Indian barrel-shaped , two-headed drum , a variant and descendant of the mridang .
 The pakhavaj or mridang is the standard percussion instrument in the dhrupad style and is widely used as an accompaniment for various forms of music and dance performances .
The pakhavaj has a low , mellow tone , very rich in harmonics .
Set horizontally on a cushion in front of the drummers crossed leg , the larger bass-skin is played with the left hand , the treble skin by the right hand .
The bass face is smeared with wet wheat dough which acts as the kiran and is the cause of the vivid , bass sound the pakhavaj produces .
The word or is of Prakrit origin , whose Sanskrit equivalent is .
This instrument is always known as pakhavaj and not pakshavadya .
This word is derived from the words , and .
As with the tabla , the pakhavaj rhythms are taught by a series of mnemonic syllables known as bol .
The playing technique vary from that of tabla in many aspects : in the bass face , the artist hits with his whole palm instead of the finger tip hitting which is done in tabla .
In the treble face , the artist hits his whole palm with the fingers properly placed on the skin to produce different bols .
In traditional pakhavaj styles a student would learn a number of different strokes which produce a specific sound .
These are remembered and practiced with corresponding syllables .
The very basic capacity is to play a theka in a particular tala or rhythmic cycle , as for instance chautala in 12 beats : .
| dha dha | din ta | | kite dha | din ta | tite kata | gadi gene | .
Advanced students learn reelas that are virtuoso pakhavaj compositions
 the Cheez means composition in Indian classical music , especially in vocal music of Hindustani music .
Closely related to bandish or compositions for instrumental music .
E.g. Bol Taans can be sung by utilizing the words of the Cheez .
The main components are meaningful words , which are set in a raga structure correlating with a tala .
 Therefore the Cheez can be understood as a concept for realizing a musical idea , as a basis on which the artist explores further on the raga , which is mainly of improvisational character .
 Nowadays Cheez finds the Cheez synonym in the term Vasta , which refers on the Cheez own to the plot of dramaturgic venture
William Rory Gallagher was an Irish blues-rock multi-instrumentalist , songwriter , and bandleader .
 Born in Ballyshannon where Monica once acted , County Donegal , and raised in Cork , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher recorded solo albums throughout the 1970s and 1980s , after forming the band Taste during the late 1960s .
 Cork was a talented guitarist known for Cork charismatic performances and dedication to Cork craft .
Gallaghers albums have sold in excess of 30 million copies worldwide .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher received a liver transplant in 1995 , but died of complications later that year in London , UK at the age of 47 .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was born in Ballyshannon where Monica once acted , County Donegal ; Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher father , Daniel , was employed by the Irish Electricity Supply Board , who were constructing a hydro-electric power plant on the Erne River above the town .
 The family moved , first to Derry City , where The family younger brother his brother Donal was born in 1949 , and then to Cork , where the two brothers were raised , and where Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher attended the North Monastery School .
