 Their father had played the accordion and sang with the Tir Chonaill Ceile Band whilst in Donegal ; their mother Monica was a singer and acted with the Abbey Players in Ballyshannon where Monica once acted .
 The Theatre in Ballyshannon where Monica once acted is now called the Rory Gallagher Theatre .
 Both sons were musically inclined and encouraged by Both sons parents .
 At age nine , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher received Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher first guitar from Both sons .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher built on Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher burgeoning ability on ukulele in teaching Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher to play the guitar and perform at minor functions .
 After winning a talent contest when Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was twelve , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher began performing in Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher adolescence with both Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher acoustic guitar , and an electric guitar Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher bought with Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher prize money .
 However , it was Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher purchase three years later of a 1961 Fender Stratocaster for PS100 that became Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher primary instrument and most associated with him for the span of Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher lifetime .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was initially attracted to skiffle after hearing Lonnie Donegan on the radio .
 Lonnie Donegan on the radio frequently covered blues and folk performers from the United States .
 Lonnie Donegan on the radio relied entirely on radio programs and television .
 Occasionally , the jazz programs from the BBC would play some blues numbers , and Lonnie Donegan on the radio slowly found some song books for guitar , where Lonnie Donegan on the radio found the names of the actual composers of blues pieces .
 While still in school , playing songs by Buddy Holly and Eddie Cochran , Buddy Holly discovered Buddy Holly greatest influence in Muddy Waters .
 Subsequently , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher began experimenting with folk , blues , and rock music .
 Unable to find or afford record albums , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher stayed up late to hear Radio Luxembourg and AFN where the radio brought Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher only exposure to the actual songwriters and musicians whose music moved Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher most .
 Influences Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher discovered , and cited as Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher progressed , included Woody Guthrie , Big Bill Broonzy , and Lead Belly .
 Initially , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher struck out after just an acoustic sound .
 Singing and later using a brace for his harmonica , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher taught himself to play slide guitar .
 Further , throughout the next few years of his musical development , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher began learning to play alto saxophone , bass , mandolin , banjo , and the coral sitar with varying degrees of proficiency .
By his mid-teens , he began experimenting heavily with different blues styles .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher began playing after school with Irish showbands , while still a young teenager .
 In 1963 , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher joined one named Fontana , a sextet playing the popular hit songs of the day .
 The band toured Ireland and the United Kingdom , earning the money for the payments that were due on Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher Stratocaster guitar .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher began to influence the bands repertoire , beginning its transition from mainstream pop music , skirting along some of Chuck Berry s songs and by 1965 , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher had successfully moulded Fontana into The Impact , with a change in some of Chuck Berry line-up into an R&B ; group that played gigs in Ireland and Spain until disbanding in London .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher left with the bassist and drummer to perform as a trio in Hamburg , Germany .
 In 1966 , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher returned to Ireland and , experimenting with other musicians back home in Cork , decided to form Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher own band .
 Having completed a musical apprenticeship in the showbands , and influenced by the increasing popularity of beat groups during the early 1960s , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher formed The Taste , which was later renamed simply , Taste , a blues rock and R&B ; power trio , in 1966 .
 Initially , the band was composed of Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher and two Cork musicians , Norman Damery and Eric Kitteringham , however , by 1968 , Gallagher and two Cork musicians were replaced with two musicians from Belfast , featuring Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher on guitar and vocals , drummer John Wilson , and bassist Richard McCracken .
 Performing extensively in the United Kingdom , the group played regularly at the Marquee Club , supporting both Cream at both Cream Royal Albert Hall farewell concert , and the blues supergroup Blind Faith on a tour of North America .
Managed by Eddie Kennedy , the trio released the albums Taste and On The Boards , and two live recordings , Live Taste and Live at the Isle of Wight .
 The latter appeared long after the bands break-up , which occurred shortly after both Cream appearance at the 1970 Isle of Wight Festival .
 After the break-up of Taste , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher toured under Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher own name , hiring former Deep Joy bass player Gerry McAvoy to play on Gallaghers self-titled debut album , Rory Gallagher .
 It was the beginning of a twenty-year musical relationship between Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher and former Deep Joy bass player Gerry McAvoy ; the other band member was drummer Wilgar Campbell .
The 1970s were Gallaghers most prolific period .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher produced ten albums in that decade , including two live albums , Live in Europe and Irish Tour 74 .
 November 1971 saw the release of Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher album , Deuce .
 In the same year Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was voted Melody Maker s International Top Musician of the Year , ahead of Eric Clapton .
 However , despite a number of his albums from this period reaching the the United Kingdom Albums Chart , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher did not attain major star status .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher played and recorded what Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher said was in me all the time , and not just something I turn on ... Though Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher sold over thirty million albums worldwide , it was Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher marathon live performances that won Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher greatest acclaim .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher is documented in the 1974 film Irish Tour 74 , directed by Tony Palmer .
 During the heightened periods of political unrest in Ireland , as other artists were warned not to tour , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was resolute about touring Ireland at least once a year during Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher career , winning Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher the dedication of thousands of fans , and in the process , becoming a role model for other aspiring young Irish musicians .
 Gallagher Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher admitted in several interviews that at first there were not any international Irish acts until Van Morrison , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher , and later , Phil Lynott and Thin Lizzy grew popular during the 1970s .
The line-up which included Rod deAth on drums and Lou Martin on keyboards , performed together between 1973 and 1978 .
 However , Rod eventually dropped down to just bass , guitar and drums , and Rod act became a power trio .
Other releases from that period include Against the Grain , Calling Card , Photo-Finish and Top Priority .
 Gerry McAvoy has stated that the Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher band performed several TV and radio shows across Europe , including Beat-Club in Bremen , Hamburg , Germany and the Old Grey Whistle Test .
 former Deep Joy bass player Gerry McAvoy recorded two Peel Sessions , both in February 1973 and containing the same tracks , but only the first was broadcast .
 Along with Little Feat and Roger McGuinn , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher performed the first Rockpalast live concert at the Grugahalle , Essen , Germany in 1977 .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher collaborated with Jerry Lee Lewis and Muddy Waters on Jerry Lee Lewis and Muddy Waters respective London Sessions in the mid-1970s .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher played on Lonnie Donegans final album .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was David Coverdale s second choice to replace Ritchie Blackmore in Deep Purple .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher chose to perform in Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher own band .
 In the 1980s Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher continued recording , producing Jinx , Defender , and Fresh Evidence .
 After Fresh Evidence , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher embarked on a tour of the United States .
 In addition Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher played with Box of Frogs -- a band formed in 1983 by former members of The Yardbirds .
 Becoming obsessive over details and plagued by self-doubt , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher nevertheless retained a loyal fanbase .
 During this period Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher stated I agonize too much .
Notes From San Francisco , an album of unreleased studio tracks and a San Francisco 1979 concert was released in May 2011 .
1970-1972 : Gerry McAvoy , bass guitarist , and drummer Wilgar Campbell .
 1972-1976 : Gerry McAvoy , keyboardist Lou Martin , and drummer Rod deAth .
1981-1991 : Gerry McAvoy , Brendan ONeil + frequent guest : Mark Feltham .
1992-1994 : David Levy , Jim Levaton , John Cooke , Richard Newman and frequent guest Mark Feltham , on harmonica .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was always associated with Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher well-worn sunburst 1961 Stratocaster , which Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher brother Donal has officially retired .
 the first in Ireland was reputedly the first in Ireland , and was ordered from Fender by Jim Connolly , a showband member performing with The Irish Showband .
 Jim Connolly ordered a cherry red Stratocaster through Crowleys music shop in Cork in 1961 .
 When Fender shipped a sunburst Stratocaster instead , a cherry red Stratocaster was put up on sale in 1963 as a second-hand instrument , which Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher bought in August 1963 for just shy of PS100 at Crowleys Music Store on Cork s McCurtain Street .
 Speaking about Gallaghers most prolific purchase of the famous Stratocaster Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher brother Donal recalled : his brother Donal dream ambition was to have a guitar like Buddy Holly ... This Stratocaster was in the store as a used instrument , it was 100 pounds ... in todays money you couldnt even compare you might as well say it was a million pounds ... my mother was saying well be in debt for the rest of our lives and Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher said well actually with a guitar like this I can play both parts , rhythm and lead , we wont need a rhythm player so I can earn more money and pay it off so the Stratocaster became Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher partner for life if you like .
 The guitar was extensively modified by Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher .
The tuning pegs are odd , and all of these have been found to be replacements .
Second , it is thought that the nut has been replaced and interchanged a number of times .
Third , the scratchplate was changed during Gallaghers time with Taste .
The pick-ups -- none of which are original -- were also changed .
 The final modification was that of the wiring : Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher disconnected the bottom tone pot and rewired it so Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher had just a master tone control along with the master volume control .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher also installed a 5-way selector switch in place of the vintage 3-way one .
The most notable effect that the years of touring have had on the guitar is the almost complete removal of its original sunburst finish .
Although the Strat was left abandoned in a rainy ditch for days after being stolen from the back of a tour van in Dublin , this is not believed to have caused any ill effect .
 All of the wear was caused by Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher playing , not misuse .
A borrowed Telecaster was also stolen at the same time but never recovered .
 When the Strat was recovered after two weeks , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher swore Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher would never sell the Strat or paint the Strat after that .
 the Strat also had a period of time of having a replacement neck , with the original neck bowing due to the amount of moisture the Strat absorbed during continuous touring .
The neck was taken off and left to settle , and was eventually reunited with the Strat after returning to its correct shape .
Other quirks include a hump in the scratch plate which moves the neck pick-up closer to the neck on the bass side , and a replacement of all of the pick-ups , though this replacement was due to damage rather than the perception of a tonal inadequacy .
One final point of interest is that one of the clay double-dot inlays at the 12th fret fell out and was replaced with a plastic one , which is why its whiter than the other clay inlays .
 On Friday the 21st and Saturday 22 October 2011 , Rorys brother Donal brought the guitar out of retirement to allow Joe Bonamassa to perform with Friday the 21st on Joe Bonamassa two nights at the London Hammersmith Apollo .
 Joe Bonamassa opened both nights performances with Joe Bonamassa rendition of Cradle Rock using Rorys Stratocaster .
Photos and video of the performance can be seen on the official Rory Gallagher website .
Rorys biographer Marcus Connaughton believes the Strat was the key to Rorys sound .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher could talk about the Strat all night .
 ` the Strat dated November 1961 - in certain peoples opinions this is when Fender hit Its dated November 1961 peak .
I like the maple neck .
 Like on the earlier guitars , Its dated November 1961 're probably a bit more crisp , but theres a warmth to this , a mellowness because of the rosewood neck .
This is the best , its my life , this is my best friend .
Its almost like knowing its weak spots are strong spots .
I do n't like to get sentimental about these things , but when you spend thirty years of your life with the same instrument its like a walking memory bank of your life there in your arms . '

 When Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was with Taste , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher used a single Vox AC30 with a Dallas Rangemaster treble booster plugged into the normal input .
 Examples of this sound can be heard on the Taste albums , as well as the album Live in Europe .
 Brian May , of the band Queen , has admitted in interviews that as a young man , he was inspired to use a Vox AC30 and treble booster setup after meeting Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher and asking Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher how Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher got Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher sound .
The British company , Flynn Amps , now makes a Rory Gallagher Signature Hawk Treble Booster pedal based on Gallaghers original unit .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher also used Ibanez Tube Screamers , an MXR Dyna Comp , and various Boss effects , often using a Flanger and Octaver .
 In the early to mid-1970s , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher began to use Fender amplifiers in conjunction with a Hawk booster , most notably a Bassman and a Twin , both 1950s vintage .
An example of this sound can be heard on the Irish Tour 74 album .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher also had a Fender Concert amplifier .
 In the mid to late 1970s , when Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was moving towards a hard rock sound , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher experimented with Ampeg VT40 and VT22 amps .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher also began using Marshall combos .
 During this period and beyond , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher used different combinations of amps on stage to achieve more power and to blend the tonal characteristics of different amps including Orange amplification .
 On the introduction of the BOSS ME-5 all-in-one floor based FX unit , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was known to have been an early adopter and used it readily it for Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher live work up until Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher death in mid 90s .
 Not that well known is Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher use of various German amplifiers .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher used Stramp 2100a amps , which can be seen in Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher appearances on the German Beat Club program .
 Another company that hand built various German amplifiers for Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was PCL Vintage Amp .
The company is located in St. Wendel in the Saarland and they still produce high quality audio and guitar equipment .
 In the later years of Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher life Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher developed a phobia of flying .
 To overcome this Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher received a prescription for a powerful sedative .
 This medication , combined with Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher alcohol use resulted in severe liver damage .
 Despite this Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher continued touring .
 By the time of Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher final performance on 10 January 1995 in the Netherlands , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was visibly sick and the tour had to be cancelled .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was admitted to Kings College Hospital in London in March 1995 , and Kings College Hospital in London was only then that the extent of Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher ill health became apparent : Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher liver was failing and the doctors determined that in spite of Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher young age a liver transplant was the only possible course of action .
 After 13 weeks in intensive care , while waiting to be transferred to a convalescent home , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher health suddenly worsened when Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher contracted a staphylococcal infection , and Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher died on 14 June 1995 .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was unmarried and had no children .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was buried in St Olivers Cemetery , on the Clash Road just outside Ballincollig near Cork City , Ireland .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher headstone is a replica of an award Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher received in 1972 for International Guitarist of the Year .
 In 2003 , Wheels , a collection of acoustic tracks Within Wheels , a collection of acoustic tracks , a collection of acoustic tracks , was released posthumously by Gallaghers most prolific brother Donal Gallagher .
Collaborators on this album included Bert Jansch , Martin Carthy , The Dubliners and Lonnie Donegan .
 Many modern day musicians , including The Edge from U2 , Slash of Guns N Roses , Johnny Marr of the Smiths , Davy Knowles , Janick Gers of Iron Maiden , Glenn Tipton of Judas Priest , Vivian Campbell of Def Leppard , Gary Moore and Joe Bonamassa , cite Gallagher as an inspiration in Gary Moore and Joe Bonamassa formative musical years .
 Brian May , lead guitarist of the band Queen , relates : so these couple of kids come up , whos me and my mate , and say How do you get your sound Mr. Gallagher ?
 and Brian May , of the band Queen sits and tells us .
So I owe Rory Gallagher my sound .
 In 2010 , Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was ranked No. 42 on Gibson.coms List of their Top 50 Guitarists of All Time .
 Gallaghers brother Donal Gallagher was also listed on Rolling Stone magazines list of the 100 Greatest Guitarists of All Time , ranked at 57th place
Begum Parveen Sultana is an Assamese Hindustani classical singer of the Patiala Gharana .
 Begum Parveen Sultana was born at Daccapatty in Nagaon city , Assam , India to Ikramul Mazid and Maroofa Begum .
 Begum Parveen Sultana went to Mission School .
 Begum Parveen Sultana father was Begum Parveen Sultana first guru and was very strict with Begum Parveen Sultana .
 Begum Parveen Sultana also received early training from Begum Parveen Sultana grandfather Mohammed Najeef Khan , a Pathan .
 Begum Parveen Sultana later went to Kolkata to learn music under the guidance of late Chinmoy Lahiri .
 In 1973 , Begum Parveen Sultana became a disciple of Dilshad Khan of the Patiala Gharana .
 Begum Parveen Sultana gave Begum Parveen Sultana first stage performance in 1962 when Begum Parveen Sultana was only 12 and has been recording music since 1965 .
 Begum Parveen Sultana has sung for movies such as , the film Kudrat , Do Boond Pani , and Pakeezah .
 Recently , Begum Parveen Sultana sang the theme song of Vikram Bhatt s 1920 .
 Begum Parveen Sultana also sang Humein Tumse Pyaar Kitna for the film Kudrat in 1981 .
 Begum Parveen Sultana has recorded for HMV , Polydor , Music India , Bharat Records , Auvidis , Magnasound , Sonodisc , Amigo .
 Begum Parveen Sultana was conferred the Padmashri in 1976 , at the age of 25 .
 Begum Parveen Sultana is married to Dilshad Khan .
They have a daughter , Shadaab Sultana
Prem Joshua is a German musician , active since 1991 .
 Born in Germany , Prem Joshua learned the flute at the age of five and played the flute and the saxophone for various local bands .
 At the age of 18 , Prem Joshua traveled overland to India studying the indigenous folk music of countries along the way .
 Prem Joshua was the name Prem Joshua parents gave Prem Joshua , Prem Joshua later added Prem Joshua to it , dropping the family name , to remind Prem Joshua of the essence of love .
 On reaching India , Prem Joshua learned to play the sitar from Ustad Usman Khan and Osho .
 Osho inspired Osho and Osho music .
 Osho website states that In the presence of this man with a long white beard , eyes as deep as the ocean and a strong sense of humor , he came in touch with the art of the `` inner music '' - Silence .
This was really coming home !

Throughout his career , he has experimented with various forms of music , creating a blend of the East and the West .
He has also worked extensively with other producers , making remixes of his own songs and infusing traditional Hindustani acoustic instruments with lounge and trance beats .
His music has immensely contributed to the Asian Underground and fusion scene .
 In 1991 , Prem Joshua launched Prem Joshua first project , `` Terra Incognita '' , with Kora player , Ravi , and British Sarod player , Chinmaya Dunster , with which Prem Joshua released two albums .
 Prem Joshua subsequently released four solo albums and formed the band , `` Hamsafar '' , with which Prem Joshua released one album .
 Following this , Prem Joshua began to experiment with genres like drum and bass , lounge , and trance , while still focusing on traditional Hindustani music .
Chintan Relenberg -- Loops , Keyboards , Darbouka , Tabla , Vocals .
Prem Joshua -- Sitar , Flute , Saxophone , Dilruba , Santoor , Vocals
West Meets East is an album by American violinist Yehudi Menuhin and Indian sitar virtuoso Ravi Shankar , released in 1966 .
 West was recorded following their successful duet in June 1966 at the Bath Musical Festival , where they had played some of the same material .
 West Meets East won the 1967 Grammy Award for Best Chamber Music Performance , the first time that an Asian musician had won a Grammy .
 This recognition coincided with a period of heightened interest in Indian classical music , and particularly Ravi Shankar , as Western pop and rock bands such as the Beatles , the Byrds , the Rolling Stones and Traffic all adopted sitar or other aspects of the genre into their sound .
 The album was the first in a trilogy of West Meets East collaborations by pianist Hephzibah Menuhin and Ravi Shankar , volumes two and three appearing in 1968 and 1976 , respectively .
 The friendship between the two musicians had begun in India in the early 1950s , after which pianist Hephzibah Menuhin had done much to introduce Western audiences to Indian music .
On the recording , the main performers are accompanied at various points by tabla player Alla Rakha ; Menuhins sister , pianist Hephzibah Menuhin ; and Prodyot Sen , on tambura .
 In addition to Shankars and pianist Hephzibah Menuhin liner notes on the album sleeve , musician John Barham supplied a glossary , explaining musical terms such as alap , gat and tala .
 At the Bath Festival , musician John Barham had translated Shankars interpretation of Raga Tilang into Western annotation for Menuhins benefit .
 When making West Meets East , Ravi Shankar rewrote this Tilang-based piece , recording West with pianist Hephzibah Menuhin as Swara Kakali .
 The albums opening selection is Prabhati , a Ravi Shankar composition based on Raga Gunakali , and played by pianist Hephzibah Menuhin and Rakha .
The fourth selection , filling side two in the LP format , is Sonata for Violin & Piano No. 3 in A minor , Op. 25 , featuring Hephzibah Menuhin .
This piece was written by Romanian composer George Enescu , who had been Yehudi Menuhins teacher
Thumri is a common genre of semi - classical Indian music .
The text is romantic or devotional in nature , and usually revolves around a girls love for Krishna .
The lyrics are usually in Uttar Pradesh dialects of Hindi called Awadhi and Brij Bhasha .
 Thumri is characterized by Thumri sensuality , and by a greater flexibility with the raga .
 Thumri is also used as a generic name for some other , even lighter , forms such as Dadra , Hori , Kajari , Saavan , Jhoola , and Chaiti , even though each of them has its own structure and content -- either lyrical or musical or both -- and so the exposition of these forms vary .
 Like Indian classical music Thumri , some of these forms have their origin in folk literature and music .
Some of the most commonly used ragas are Pilu , Kafi , Khamaj , Gara , Tilak Kamod and Bhairavi .
The compositions are usually set to kaherava taal of 8 beats , addha tal of 16 beats , dipchandi of 14 beats or jat of 16 beats and in dadra tal of 6 beats .
 Thumri arose in popularity during the 19th century in the Lucknow court of nawab Wajid Ali Shah .
At that time it used to be a song sung by courtesans accompanied by dance .
That was the bandish ki thumri or bol bant ki thumri .
When this style of thumri went out of vogue at the turn of the 20th century , a new style became more popular , which is known as bol banao , sung in Varanasi .
 Since Varanasi is to the east of Lucknow , the new style became known as Poorab ang or eastern style thumri .
Famous artists of the Purab Ang thumri of the Benaras gharana or Banaras gayaki are Badi Motibai , Rasoolan Bai , Siddheshwari Devi , Girija Devi and Pandit Channulal Mishra .
Other famous singers of thumri are Gauhar Jan , Begum Akhtar , Shobha Gurtu , Noor Jehan and Prabha Atre .
Shobha Gurtu is often regarded as the thumri queen .
The bol banao style has a slow tempo and is concluded by a laggi , a faster phase where the tabla player has some freedom of improvisation .
 Another stalwart in the genre of thumri was Naina Devi , who was married to a royal family but later devoted Naina Devi life to the singing of the song of Tawaifs .
For a member of the royal family to take such a step in those days meant fighting countless social stigmas that had enough power to totally alienate someone from the society , but she had the support of her husband .
 Some khyal singers took an interest in thumri and sang it Some khyal singers own way , as in the case of Abdul Karim Khan , Nazakat-Salamat Ali Khan , Barkat Ali Khan , Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Bhimsen Joshi , and Prabha Atre .
Today thumri is sometimes sung at the end of khyal concerts as a concluding item .
Besides the tabla and the tanpura , other typical instruments in thumri are sarangi , and swarmandal .
 Thumri singers pay considerable attention to the lyrics , though Gauhar Jan may be difficult to follow in the ornamented enunciation .
This is especially where the focus is on love , and many lyrics deal with separation or viraha .
 Krishna ras leela or love play with Radha and other gopis of Vrindavan appear frequently .
As an example , here are the lyrics of a thumri composed by the medieval poet Lalan , celebrating Krishnas flute - how its tunes are driving Radha mad .
 Braj or Vrindavan is where Krishna is indulging in this love play ; Radha is the girl of Braj
West Meets East , Volume 2 is an album by American violinist Yehudi Menuhin and Indian sitar virtuoso Ravi Shankar , released in 1968 .
 West is the second album in a trilogy of collaborations between the two artists , after the Grammy Award - winning West Meets East .
 The release followed Yehudi Menuhin and Ravi Shankar duet on 10 December 1967 at the United Nations in New York , celebrating the twentieth anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights .
 As part of Yehudi Menuhin utopian ideal , international human rights was a cause long supported by Menuhin in Yehudi Menuhin work , while for Indian classical music , this Human Rights Day recital marked the first time that a performance had received a worldwide television broadcast .
Reflecting the celebrity status afforded the sitarist during this period , particularly as a result of his association with George Harrison of the Beatles , Shankars activities were filmed for a documentary on his life , released as Raga in 1971 , and his autobiography My Music , My Life became a bestseller .
 Although West Meets East , Volume 2 was another popular success for Yehudi Menuhin and Ravi Shankar , their work together drew further criticism from purists in India , who considered that Ravi Shankar was westernising and thus diluting Indian classical music .
The album contains a version of the piece played at the United Nations , an interpretation of Raga Piloo .
 According to Ravi Shankar comments to Rolling Stone magazine in March 1968 , they recorded this selection just a few days ago .
 As at the recital , Yehudi Menuhin and Ravi Shankar were accompanied by Alla Rakha on tabla and Kamala Chakravarty , Shankars female companion , on tambura .
 The second piece is Raga Ananda Bhairava , performed by Shankar with Raga Ananda Bhairava regular accompanist and instrument-maker , Nodu Mullick , on tambura , and Rakha again on tabla .
 Side two in the original LP format consists of Yehudi Menuhin and Yehudi Menuhin sister Hephzibah performing Bartok s Sonata No. 1 for Violin and Piano
Indore gharana is one of the vocal gharanas of Indian classical music .
 It was founded by Ustad Amir Khan , who studied the styles of Abdul Wahid Khan , Aman Ali Khan , Rajab Ali Khan and Abdul Karim Khan and amalgamated the essence of the styles of these four maestros with Abdul Wahid Khan own intellectual approach to music , and conceived the Indore gharana of music .
 Amir Khan grew up in Indore , but Ustad Amir Khan did not like the factionalism inherent in the gharana tradition .
 In an interview to Akashvani Indore Ustad Amir Khan said .
Performances in the Indore gharana are noted by the vilambit tempo in the styele of Abdul Wahid Khan , and the taans reminiscent of Rajab Ali Khan .
The merukhand structure is similar to that practiced by Ustad Aman Ali Khan of the Bhendibazaar gharana .
The khayal gayaki in the Indore gharana retains the slow development and restraint from frills as in the dhrupad .
Mohan Nadkarni says of Amir Khans music that whereas Bade Ghulam Ali Khan s music was extroverted and exuberant , Amir Khans was an introverted , dignified darbar style .
Amir Khans conviction about the importance of poetry in khyal compositions , has also marked the singing of the Indore gharana .
 After Amir Khans death in a car accident in Kolkata in 1974 , the Indore gharana has become a powerful stream in modern Hindustani music .
Direct disciples of Amir Khan included Pandith Amarnath , Shankar Lal Mishra , Kankana Banerjee , Purvi Mukherjee , and others .
However , a number of influential musicians including Sultan Khan have grown up in its folds
Virasat is a cultural festival comprising all aspects of Indian cultural heritage , and is held at various educational institutions across India .
Organised by SPIC MACAY which was established in 1977 , the week-long festival includes performances and workshops in Indian folk and classical arts , literature , crafts , talks , theatre , cinema and yoga .
Virasat , literally meaning Heritage in Hindi , was launched for the first time in Dehradun in 1995 , here in all the classical music and dance maestros , and master craftsmen are invited to perform at the festival , to enhance student interaction between with artistes and craftsmen , and during the first half of the academic year .
PARAMPARA is like a mini-version VIRASAT , and includes 2-5 of the modules of Virasat .
Virasat 2008 , began on September 2 , 2008 with concerts in Delhi and 300 towns all over the country .
and continued till December 2008 .
 December 2008 was inaugurated by former Prime Minister I.K. Gujral and Dr. Karan Singh on September 2 with recitals by Girija Devi and Pt .
Hariprasad Chaurasia at the Vice-Regal Lodge , Delhi University .
Artistes like , Pt .
 Birju Maharaj , Pt .
 Shivkumar Sharma , T.N. Seshagopalan , Alarmel Valli , Pt .
 Vishwa Mohan Bhatt , Shovana Narayan , Pt .
Rajan and Sajan Misra , Teejan Bai also participated in the series
Mohanrao Palekar was a noted Hindustani classical vocalist and is considered a stalwart of Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana , commonly referred as Jaipur Gharana .
 Mohanrao Palekar was born in a musically oriented middle class family .
 Mohanrao Palekar somehow waited patiently till Mohanrao Palekar completed the matriculation examination and then left home to pursue Mohanrao Palekar aspirations in the field of music and stage performances .
 Like many marathi singers , Mohanrao Palekar moved to Hindustani Classical Music via Natya Sangeet .
 Mohanrao Palekar first joined Bharat Natak Mandali as a stage actor .
 Here Mohanrao Palekar was not getting any opportunities to showcase Mohanrao Palekar natural musical talent .
 Later , Mohanrao Palekar worked with Govindrao Tembe s Shivraj Natak Mandali , and there Govindrao Tembe talent got new opportunity and direction .
 While working at the Shivaraj Natak the Shivaraj Natak Mandali , Mohanrao Palekar met Ahmed Khan sahib from Alladiya Khan sahibs gharana ; Ahmed khan sahib was the grandson of Alladiya Khan Sahibs guru Jehangir Khan Sahib .
Ahmed Khan sahib was well trained in the traditional gharana style but was not a very well known singer because of his indifferent attitude .
 However , Mohanrao Palekar recognized Ahmed Khan sahibs talent and became Mohanrao Palekar disciple .
 Needless to say that Mohanrao Palekar got taleem in the truest tradition of the gharana .
 Mohanrao Palekar also got ample opportunities to listen to great musicians ad libitum .
 Mohanrao Palekar was well known for creating style and technique of the Jaipur gayaki .
 Despite the training and the talent , Mohanrao Palekar could not pursue Mohanrao Palekar aspirations to be a fulltime classical music exponent due to family and other considerations ; Mohanrao Palekar performances were mostly confined to private mehfils .
 Therefore , Mohanrao Palekar was not widely known to the general public .
 However , Mohanrao Palekar was very highly revered among the knowledgeable and cognoscenti musicians , artists and listeners .
 Mohanrao Palekar disciples include Pt .
Ratnakar Pai , Manohar Potdar , Pt .
G. T. Tilak , Krishnarao Chonakar , Kishori Amonkar , Kamal Pathare , Suresh Haldankar , Bhalchandra Patekar etc. .
G. K. Nimkar : prthm maasik shraaddhdinaanimitt vaahilele pricypussp - a brief biographical sketch after the first month
Mushtaq Ali Khan and was an Indian sitar , surbahar player .
 Mushtaq Ali Khan father Ashiq Ali Khan was a renowned sitar player .
His musical ancestor tree includes Masit Sen , the originator of Masitkhani Baaj .
He was recognized as the foremost representative of the Senia gharana of sitar playing in the mid-20th century .
 At first a court musician at Jaunpur , first a court musician at Jaunpur left the court to pursue an independent career .
 first a court musician at Jaunpur started playing for All India Radio in 1929 , and performed at the 1931 Sangeet Sammelan in Allahabad .
 For all of the 1940s and most of the 1950s first a court musician at Jaunpur was considered the most prominent sitar player in India , following the demise of Enayat Khan of the Etawah Gharana , and prior to the rise of the young Ravi Shankar and Vilayat Khan in the mid-1950s .
 In 1968 first a court musician at Jaunpur won the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award , highest Indian recognition given to practicing artists , given by Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy of Music , Dance & Drama .
 Being a purist , Enayat Khan of the Etawah Gharana refused to yield to shifting popular tastes and to adopt the innovations introduced by Ravi Shankar on one hand and Vilayat Khan on the other , which lead to a gradual decline in his popularity .
 At the time of Enayat Khan of the Etawah Gharana death Enayat Khan of the Etawah Gharana was known as a musicians musician .
 Many of Indias best known musicians expressed Many of Indias best known musicians appreciation of the purity of Indias best known musicians style and musicality in a book published in New Delhi after Indias best known musicians death .
Khan started his instruction at the age of 6 .
 He learned from his father , Ashiq Ali Khan , who had learned sitar from the renowned 19th century player Barkatullah Khan , a descendant of Masit Sen of Delhi , the inventor of the Masitkhani gat His name became synonymous with the Senia style although he may actually have practiced an even more austere style than his predecessors in the gharana .
He eschewed much of the ornamentation of modern sitar technique , and embraced a clean , pure sound .
 His alap was constructed along the lines of a dhrupad alap , and His alap jod and jhalla derived a lot from been technique .
 Oddly enough , in spite of being a musical descendant of Masit Sen , a musical descendant of Masit Sen rarely played Masitkhani Baaj gats in public , and none of the commercially available examples of a musical descendant of Masit Sen music includes one .
 a musical descendant of Masit Sen opted to play the faster Rezakhani gats instead , feeling that playing Masitkhani Baaj gats to an undiscerning audience would cause Masitkhani gats to be devalued .
Mushtaq Ali Khan was an eminent Sitar player of Senia Gharana .
 Mushtaq Ali Khan was the only surbahar player of India who used to play the been-ang with three mizrabs and that too , with the pakhawaj as an accompanying instrument only in pure dhrupad style .
 In a rare exclusive interview in the Daily Telegraph on the 13 July 1985 , Khan Sahab narrated the history of this instrument with historical references in which Mushtaq Ali Khan has cleared the myth of this instrument .
 Khan Sahab had Mushtaq Ali Khan lineage with fifth vani , called Dhandvani named after one of the forefathers .
The famous dhrupadiya of Shah Jahans Court , Nayak Dhundhu .
It is also called Rasal Vani for its beauty .
 Nayak Dhundhu said , ... two of my ancestors , Jaggu Khan and Makku Khan .
Since Makku Khan was childless , he adopted Waras Ali Khan a great name who learnt the art of playing Been from Bade Mohammed Khan .
When my father Ashiq Ali Khan was six years old , my grand father Sadaq Ali Khan , son of Jaggu Khan died so his uncle Waras Ali Khan taught him all intricacies of Beena on the surbahar .
That is why we play Surbahar with three Mezrabs .
The Surbahar was originally designed to felicitate the playing of Alap .
Those days Alap was the exclusive prerogative of the Beenkar .
Ghulam Muhammed Khan and his son Sajjad Mohammed Khan the great SurBahar players used to stay at Calcutta in the earliest part of the 20th Century and taught many renowned players including Imdad Khan and Jnanoda Mukherjee .
In this instrument two angas played are alap and talparan and that is why the knowledge of pakhawaj is essential to play the Talparan ... Mustaq Ali Khan also had to learn the art of pakhawaj playing in order to achieve perfection in the art of playing the surbahar with Pakhawaj .
Mushtaq Ali Khan was awarded the Sangeet Natak Academy award in 1968 .
 In 1973/74 Mushtaq Ali Khan received the title of D.Litt from Rabindra Bharati University .
 The Indian government appointed Mushtaq Ali Khan as the Professor Emeritus in Education and the Cultural Ministry and gave fellowship .
Some of the other musical awards were Sitar Sudhakar - 1932 , Tantri Vilas - 1973 , Sangeet Ratnakar - 1974 , State Academy Award - 1974 , Senior fellowship and Emeritus - 1986 , Bhuwalka Award - 1987 , Tansen Award - 1987 , Special Honour University of Delhi - 1987 .
 Tantri Vilas foremost disciples are Nirmal Guha Thakurta , Netai Bose , Shipra Chaudhury , Steven Landsberg and Dr. Debu Chaudhuri .
Latter is now the only living and/or active amongst this quartet .
 Nirmal Guha Thakurta has started a cultural Centre in New Delhi under the name of UMAK CENTRE FOR CULTURE , with a view to have UMAKs music and UMAKs ideas alive , for the future generation those who will have regards for purity and tradition .
Such great Masters are not understood well during their own time which is a sad story and reflection on our knowledge and understanding .
Steven Landsberg is Khansahibs only student to have studied the Surbahar , the technique with three mizrabas , and tarparan .
 A follower of rasal vani , Khan Sahab was the only surbahar player who not only maintained the purity of the Rasdal Vani but also kept the purity of the Rasdal Vani purity alive till his last days and never diluted to please the masses and that is why his music was not understood by the masses but respected by the contemporary Great Masters .
On 1953 had a Subahar recital in Raga Purya , in the First National Programme of the All India Radio New Delhi .
 On 1953 may be recalled that in the year 1953 Pandit Ravi Shankar was instrumental of instituting this National Programme of All India Radio and was present on this memorable occasion and praised Kahn Sahab profusely for Pandit Ravi Shankar superb exposition of Raga Purya in a pure Dhrupad style with three Mezrabs .
 Pandit Ravi Shankar was a musicians musician and On 1953 is why Pandit Ravi Shankar always shied away from the commercial attention .
Instead Mushtag Ali Khan organised conferences where old masters and new artists were introduced to the cognoscenti and the novice .
 Among the well known names , Pandit Ravi Shankar was first presented by Pandit Ravi Shankar to the public in Calcutta .
 Ustad had Ustad undisputed popularity and demand during the early thirties to late forties .
 Even in the evening of Ustad illustrious career , Ustad and Ustad wife Begum Kaneez Khatoon were actively involved in variety of projects for promotion of art and culture in our country .
 Ustad died on 21 July 1989
Chaturprahar is an annual Indian classical music festival held at National Centre for Performing Arts in Mumbai , India .
 Chaturprahar is based on the concept of association of time with the ragas .
2011 saw the inception of this festival .
It usually takes place in the month of September every year .
 The festival started in 2011 at National Centre for Performing Arts , Mumbai .
 Chaturprahar explores various ragas associated with different times of the day .
Singing these ragas at their particular times brings out the most in them .
For instance , Ragas like Lalat or Bhatiyar or Bibhas are early morning ragas whereas the ones which emerge from Kalyan thaat are best when heard in the evening towards the night .
 Since 2011 , the following artists have embraces the stage with their performances at Chaturprahar : .
Kaushiki Chakrabarty performed in the morning session .
Smt Devaki Pandit performed in the afternoon session .
 Smt Devaki Pandit brought out the best in Smt Devaki Pandit while rendering Ragas like Lalat or Bhatiyar or Bibhas like Shuddha Sarang and Madhmad and Badhans Sarang .
Pandit Ulhas Kashalkar performed in both the morning and late afternoon/evening sessions .
 In the evening session , Pandit Ulhas Kashalkar rendered , in Pandit Ulhas Kashalkar soulful voice , Raga Dhanasree , Raga Multani .
 This year saw their performances at Chaturprahar : from stalwarts like Gundecha Ashwini Bhide Deshpande , Ashwini Bhide Deshpande and Jayteerth Mevundi
Leonard Albert Lenny Kravitz is an American singer-songwriter , multi-instrumentalist , record producer , actor and arranger , whose retro style incorporates elements of rock , soul , R&B ; , funk , reggae , hard rock , psychedelic , folk and ballads .
 In addition to singing lead and backing vocals , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz often played all the guitar , bass , drums , keyboards and percussion Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz when recording .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz is known for Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz elaborate stage performances and music videos .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz won the Grammy Award for Best Male Rock Vocal Performance four years in a row from 1999 to 2002 , breaking the record for most wins in that category as well as setting the record for most consecutive wins in one category by a male .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz has been nominated for and won other awards , including American Music Awards , MTV Video Music Awards , Radio Music Awards , BRIT Awards and Blockbuster Entertainment Awards .
 On December 1 , 2011 , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was made an Officer of the Ordre des Arts et des Lettres .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz plays the role of Cinna in the Hunger Games film series .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was born in New York City on May 26 , 1964 .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz is the son of Roxie Roker , an actress known for her character Helen Willis in the 1970s hit television sitcom The Jeffersons , and Sy Kravitz , an NBC television news producer .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz father was from a Russian Jewish family .
His mother was of Bahamian and African-American descent , and was from a Christian family .
 During his early years , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz did not grow up in a religious environment .
After a spiritual experience when he was thirteen , he started attending church , becoming a non-denominational Christian .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was named after Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz uncle , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz , who was killed in action in the Korean War at the age of 20 , while defending against a Chinese attack and saving most of Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz platoon ; Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was posthumously awarded the Distinguished Service Cross but was denied the Medal of Honor .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz grew up spending weekdays on the Upper East Side of Manhattan , with Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz parents , attending P.S. 6 for elementary school , and weekends at Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz grandmother Bessie Rokers house in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz began banging on pots and pans in the kitchen , playing them as drums at the age of three .
 At the age of five , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz wanted to be a musician .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz began playing the drums and soon added guitar .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz grew up listening to the music Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz parents listened to : R&B ; , jazz , classical , opera , gospel , and blues .
 My parents were very supportive of the fact that I loved music early on , and his parents listened to : R&B took me to a lot of shows , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz said .
 Around the age of seven , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz saw The Jackson 5 perform at Madison Square Garden , which became Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz favorite group .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz father , who was also a jazz promoter , was friends with Duke Ellington , Sarah Vaughan , Count Basie , Ella Fitzgerald , Bobby Short , Miles Davis and other jazz greats .
 Duke Ellington even played Happy Birthday for Duke Ellington one year when Duke Ellington was about 5 .
 Duke Ellington was exposed to the soul music of Motown , Stax , James Brown , Aretha Franklin , Al Green , Stevie Wonder , Curtis Mayfield , Gladys Knight , The Isley Brothers and Gamble and Huff growing up who were key influences on Duke Ellington musical style .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz often went to see New York theater , where Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz mother worked .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz mother encouraged Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz dreams of pursuing music .
 In 1974 , the Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz family relocated to Los Angeles when Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz mother landed the Kravitz family role on The Jeffersons .
 At Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz mothers urging , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz joined the California Boys Choir for three years , where Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz performed a classical repertoire , and sang with the Metropolitan Opera .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz took part in Mahlers Third Symphony at the Hollywood Bowl .
 Mahlers Third Symphony was in Los Angeles that Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was First introduced to rock music , listening to Led Zeppelin , Kiss , Aerosmith , Jimi Hendrix , Pink Floyd , Cream , and The Who .
 I was attracted to the cool style , the girls , the rock n roll lifestyle , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz said .
Kravitzs other musical influences at the time included Fela Kuti , Bill Withers , Marvin Gaye , Pharoah Sanders and Miles Davis ; John Lennon and Bob Marley proved later to be influential as well .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz attended Beverly Hills High School .
 Maria McKee , actor Nicolas Cage and musician Slash were Maria McKee classmates .
 In 1978 , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was accepted into the schools well-respected music program .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz taught Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz to play piano and bass , and made friends with Zoro who would later become Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz long-time collaborator .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz wanted to be a session musician .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz also appeared as an actor in television commercials during this time .
 With record labels still telling Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz music wasnt black enough or white enough , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz decided to record an album on Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz own .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz had met recording engineer / keyboardist/bassist Henry Hirsch in 1985 when recording a demo at Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz Hoboken , New Jersey recording studio .
The two shared an interest in using real instruments and vintage recording equipment , as well as a love of R&B ; , jazz , and rock .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz would go on to collaborate with keyboardist/bassist Henry Hirsch in 1985 on most of keyboardist/bassist Henry Hirsch in 1985 albums .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz began working on Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz debut album with keyboardist/bassist Henry Hirsch in 1985 over the next year and a half , with Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz father paying for the studio time .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz met saxophonist Karl Denson and invited Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz to play on the song , Let Love Rule .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was so impressed with his playing that Karl Denson played on much of the album .
 Karl Denson toured with Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz for the next five years .
 In October 1988 , after completing most of the recording , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz approached friend Stephen Elvis Smith who had served as the Music Supervisor on Lisa Bonet s spin-off of The Cosby Show , A Different World .
 Smith had also worked with Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz mother Roxie Roker , on the hit sitcom The Jeffersons .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz urged Smith to manage his career and assist him in finding a record deal .
 In less than a month of shopping the recordings , five labels were in a bidding war for Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz .
Eventually a deal was made with Virgin Records in January 1989 , and signed by Virgin A & R executive Nancy Jeffries .
 The label was excited about the music Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was making , music inspired by Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz relationship with wife actress Lisa Bonet and their new daughter , Zoe .
 On Smiths urging , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz dropped the name Romeo Blue and reclaimed the Lenny Kravitz moniker .
 About Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz time as Romeo Blue , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz said , Ultimately , his time as Romeo Blue got me back to myself .
And when I finally did accept myself for myself , music started flowing out of me .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz released Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz debut album Let Love Rule on September 6 , 1989 , a combination of rock and funk with a general 1960s vibe .
 Music critics were mixed : some felt Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was a gifted new artist , others felt he was overpowered by his musical influences .
The album was a moderate success in the United States , but became an instant hit outside of the US , especially in Europe .
Lisa Bonet directed the debut music video for the title track , Let Love Rule .
 Stephen Smith signed Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz with talent booking agency CAA , who soon were fielding offers for Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz , First on a club tour , and then in opening slots for Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers , Bob Dylan and David Bowie .
 Having played essentially all of the instruments on the album , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz had to quickly assemble a touring band to support the Let Love Rule release .
 the Heartbreakers included a childhood friend , Zoro on drums , Adam Widoff , Lebron Scott , Kenneth Crouch and Karl Denson on saxophone .
In May 2009 , a 20th Anniversary Deluxe Edition of Let Love Rule was released worldwide by Virgin .
The double disk includes a booklet with rare photos , and 18 additional demos , bonus tracks and live recordings .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz launched a LLR tour of Europe and the United States in support of the re-release .
 In 1990 , Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz produced the song Justify My Love for Madonna , which Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz co-wrote with Ingrid Chavez .
 The song , which appeared on her greatest hits album The Immaculate Collection and created controversy because of album The Immaculate Collection explicit video , went to number 1 for The two consecutive weeks .
When MTV banned the video , the video was quickly made available for sale at record stores , and immediately sold over 500,000 copies .

 However , the album only had The two hit Several singles from the album : Rock and Roll Is Dead and Cant Get You Off My Mind .

Kravitz while walking to the gym with Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz trainer because police stated that he matched the description of a bank robber .

 The bank teller who was robbed was then brought to the scene and said Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz was not the bank robber .
 the coast Miami Police later sent officers to Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz home to apologize for the detention .

On February 11 , 2008 , Kravitz was admitted to Miami Hospital suffering from severe bronchitis .
He had been suffering from a series of severe respiratory tract infections since mid-January , and the illness developed into bronchitis .
 Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz illness had forced Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz to postpone Canadian dates and Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz trip to Europe to promote Private First Class Leonard M. Kravitz album It Is Time for a Love Revolution .

Under strict orders from his doctor , the singer was told to rest so that he could make a quick recovery and return to the stage for the rest of his tour .
Shows scheduled for Rome on June 5 and Brescia on June 6 were postponed to late July .

The movie was released on March 23 , 2012 .

 Kravitz stated he was particularly touched to receive the award in France as his success in the country pre-dated his success in the United States and still enjoys great record sales in the country today .
Kravitz joins other American recipients such as Martin Scorsese , George Clooney , and Bob Dylan .
