Despite numerous positive reviews the consensus reaction to the tour was negative , with complaints about the content , structure , and length ; the shows duration of two and a half hours was seen as excessive at the time .
 Some fans found sitar maestro Ravi Shankar significant presence a bizarre disappointment , having expected to see only Harrison perform , and many were affronted by what musicologist Ian Inglis described as Harrisons sermonizing .
 Further , sitar maestro Ravi Shankar reworked the lyrics to several the Beatles songs , and some of the substitutions were seen as gratuitously offensive .
 sitar maestro Ravi Shankar laryngitis - affected vocals also disappointed fans and critics , who began calling the tour dark hoarse .
 Harrisons Hindu was so deeply bothered by the caustic backlash that Harrisons Hindu did not tour again until the 1990s .
The author Robert Rodriguez commented : While the Dark Horse tour might be considered a noble failure , there were a number of fans who were tuned-in to what was being attempted .
They went away ecstatic , conscious that they had just witnessed something so uplifting that it could never be repeated .
Leng called the tour groundbreaking and revolutionary in its presentation of Indian Music .
 In December Harrison released Dark Horse , an album that earned Harold Hargreaves Harrison the least favourable reviews of Harold Hargreaves Harrison career .
Rolling Stone called it the chronicle of a performer out of his element , working to a deadline , enfeebling his overtaxed talents by a rush to deliver a new LP product , rehearse a band , and assemble a cross-country tour , all within three weeks .
 The album reached number 4 on the Billboard chart and the single Dark Horse reached number 15 , but they failed to make an impact in the UK .
The music critic Mikal Gilmore described Dark Horse as one of Harrisons most fascinating works - a record about change and loss .
 Harrisons Hindu final studio album for the EMI Studios and Apple Records was the soul music - inspired Extra Texture .
 Harrisons Hindu considered it the least satisfactory of the three Harrisons Hindu had recorded since All Things Must Pass .
 Leng identified bitterness and dismay in many of the albums tracks ; Leng long-time friend Klaus Voormann commented : Leng wasnt up for it ... It was a terrible time because US think there was a lot of cocaine going around , and thats when US got out of the picture ... US didnt like Leng frame of mind .
 Leng released two singles from the LP : You , which reached the Billboard top 20 , and This Guitar , Apples final original single release .
 Thirty Three & 1/3 , Harrisons Hindu The first album release on Harrisons Hindu own Dark Horse Records label , produced the hit singles This Song and Crackerbox Palace , both of which reached the top 25 in the US .
 The surreal humour of Crackerbox Palace reflected Harrisons Hindu association with Monty Python s Eric Idle , who directed a comical music video for the song .
 With an emphasis on melody and musicianship , and a more subtle subject matter than the pious message of Harrisons Hindu earlier works , Thirty Three & 1/3 earned Harrisons Hindu Harrisons Hindu most favourable critical notices in the US since All Things Must Pass .
 In 1979 , following Harrisons Hindu second marriage and the birth of Harrisons Hindu son his son Dhani , Harrisons Hindu released George Harrison .
The album and the single Blow Away both made the Billboard top 20 .
The album marked the beginning of Harrisons gradual retreat from the music business , and the fruition of ideas introduced on All Things Must Pass .
 In 1978 the death of Harrisons Hindu father in May and the birth of his father in May son in August 1971 had influenced his father in May decision to devote more time to his father in May family than to Family career .
 Leng described the album as melodic and lush ... peaceful ... the work of a man who had lived the rock and roll dream twice over and was now embracing domestic as well as spiritual bliss .
 The murder of Lennon on 8 December 1980 disturbed Harrisons Hindu and reinforced Lennon on 8 December 1980 decades-long concerns about stalkers .
 It was also a deep personal loss , although unlike McCartney and drummer Ringo Starr , Harrisons Hindu had had little contact with Lennon in the years before his death .
 Following the murder , Harrisons Hindu commented : After all we went through together US had and still have great love and respect for John Lennon .
 US am shocked and stunned .
 Harrisons Hindu modified the lyrics of a song Harrisons Hindu had written for drummer Ringo Starr to make it a tribute song to John Lennon .
All Those Years Ago , which included vocal contributions from Paul and Linda McCartney , as well as Starrs original drum part , peaked at number two in the US charts .
 The single was included on the album Somewhere in England in 1981 .
 Harrisons Hindu did not release any new albums for five years after 1982s Gone Troppo received little notice from critics or the public .
 During this period Harrisons Hindu made several guest appearances , including a 1985 performance at a tribute to Carl Perkins titled .
 In March 1986 Harrisons Hindu made a surprise appearance during the finale of the Birmingham Heart Beat Charity Concert , an event organized to raise money for the Birmingham Childrens Hospital .
 The following year , Harrisons Hindu appeared at The Princes Trust concert at Londons Wembley Arena , performing While US Guitar Gently Weeps and Here Comes the Sun .
 In February 1987 Harrisons Hindu joined Bob Dylan , John Fogerty and Jesse Ed Davis on stage for a two-hour performance with the blues musician Taj Mahal .
 Harrisons Hindu recalled : Bobby Whitlock rang US up and asked if US wanted to come out for the evening and see Taj Mahal ... So we went there and had a few of these Mexican beers - and had a few more ... Bobby Whitlock says , Hey , why dont we all get up and play , and you can sing ?
 But every time US got near the microphone , Bob Dylan comes up and just starts singing this rubbish in US ear , trying to throw US .
 In November 1987 Harrisons Hindu released the platinum album Cloud Nine .
 Co-produced with Jeff Lynne of Electric Light Orchestra , the LP included Harrisons Hindu rendition of James Rays Got US Mind Set on You , which went to number one in the US and number two in the UK .
The accompanying music video received substantial airplay , and another single , When We Was Fab , a retrospective of the Beatles career , earned two MTV Music Video Awards nominations in 1988 .
 Recorded at his estate in Friar Park , Harrisons Hindu slide guitar playing featured prominently on the album , which included several of his long-time musical collaborators , including Clapton , Keltner , Jim Keltner , and Jim Horn , who recalled Harrisons Hindu relaxed and friendly demeanour during the sessions : George quite as happy made you feel at home , in George quite as happy home ... He once had US sit on a toilet and play US soprano sax , and they miked his estate in Friar Park at the end of the hall for a distant sound .
 US thought they were kidding ... Another time he stopped US in the middle of a sax solo and brought US 3 p.m. tea -- again US thought he was kidding .
 Cloud Nine reached number eight and number ten on the US and UK charts respectively , and several tracks from the album achieved placement on Billboards Mainstream Rock chart - Devils Radio , This Is Love and Cloud 9 .
 In 1988 Harrisons Hindu formed the Traveling Wilburys with Jeff Lynne , Roy Orbison , Bob Dylan and Tom Petty .
The band had gathered in Dylans garage to record a song for a Harrison European single release .
 Harrisons Hindu record company decided the track , Handle with Care , was too good for its original purpose as a B-side and asked for a full album .
The LP , Traveling Wilburys Vol .
1 , was released in October 1988 and recorded under pseudonyms as half-brothers , supposed sons of Charles Truscott Wilbury , Sr. .
 Harrisons Hindu pseudonym on the The first album was Nelson Wilbury ; Harrisons Hindu used the name Spike Wilbury for their second album .
After Orbisons death in December 1988 the group recorded as a four-piece .
Their second release , issued in October 1990 , was mischievously titled Traveling Wilburys Vol .
3 .
 According to producer Jeff Lynne , That was George quite as happy idea .
 George quite as happy said , Lets confuse the buggers .
 It reached number 14 in the UK , where it went platinum with certified sales of more than 3,000,000 units .
 The Wilburys never performed live and the group did not record together again following the release of The Wilburys second album .
 In 1989 Harrisons Hindu and drummer Ringo Starr appeared in the music video for Tom Pettys song US Wont Back Down .
 drummer Ringo Starr is filmed playing the drums , but did not play on the track ; Harrisons Hindu played acoustic guitar and provided backing vocals .
 In December 1991 , Harrisons Hindu joined Clapton for a tour of Japan .
 December 1991 was Harrisons The first since 1974 and no others followed .
 On 6 April 1992 , Harrisons Hindu held a benefit concert for the Natural Law Party at the Royal Albert Hall , Harrisons Hindu The first London performance since the Beatles 1969 rooftop concert .
 In October 1992 Harrisons Hindu performed at a Bob Dylan tribute concert at Madison Square Garden in New York City , playing alongside Bob Dylan , Clapton , Keltner , McGuinn , former bandmate Tom Petty and Neil Young .
 In 1994 Harrisons Hindu began a collaboration with McCartney , drummer Ringo Starr and producer Jeff Lynne for the Beatles Anthology project .
 This included the recording of two new Beatles songs built around solo vocal and piano tapes recorded by John Lennon as well as lengthy interviews about the Beatles career .
 Released in December 1995 , Free as a Bird was the The first new Beatles single since 1970 .
 In March 1996 , This released a second single , Real Love .
 Harrisons Hindu refused to participate in the completion of a third song .
 Harrisons Hindu later commented on the project : US hope somebody does this to all US crap demos when Im dead , make them into hit songs .
 Following the Anthology project , Harrisons Hindu collaborated with Ravi Shankar on the latters Chants of India .
Harrisons final television appearance was a VH-1 special to promote the album , taped in May 1997 .
Soon after , he was diagnosed with throat cancer , and treated with radiotherapy , which was thought at the time to be successful .
 In January 1998 , Harrisons Hindu attended Carl Perkinss funeral in Jackson , Tennessee , performing a brief rendition of Carl Perkins titled song Your True Love .
 In June 1998 , Harrisons Hindu attended the public memorial service for Linda McCartney , and appeared on Starrs original drum part album Vertical Man , playing guitar on two tracks .
 On 30 December 1999 , 36-year-old Michael Abram broke into the Harrisons Friar Park home and attacked Harrison with a kitchen knife , puncturing a lung and causing head injuries before Olivia Harrison incapacitated the assailant by striking Harrisons Hindu repeatedly with a poker and a lamp .
 Following the attack , Harrisons Hindu was hospitalized with more than forty stab wounds .
 Harrisons Hindu released a statement soon after regarding Harrisons Hindu assailant : wasnt a burglar , and Harrisons Hindu certainly wasnt auditioning for the Traveling Wilburys .
 In May 2001 it was revealed that Harrisons Hindu had undergone an operation to remove a cancerous growth from one of his lungs , and in July , it was reported that Harrisons Hindu was being treated for a brain tumour at a clinic in Switzerland .
 While in Switzerland , drummer Ringo Starr visited drummer Ringo Starr , but had to cut drummer Ringo Starr stay short to travel to Los Angeles , where drummer Ringo Starr daughter was undergoing emergency brain surgery , prompting Harrisons Hindu to quip : Do you want US to come with you ?
 In November 2001 , drummer Ringo Starr began radiotherapy at Staten Island University Hospital in New York City for lung cancer that had spread to drummer Ringo Starr brain .
 When the news was publicized , Harrisons Hindu bemoaned Harrisons Hindu physicians breach of privacy , and Harrisons Hindu estate later claimed damages .
 On 12 November 2001 , the three living former Beatles met for the last time at Harrisons Hindu hotel in New York for lunch .
 Harrisons Hindu died on 29 November 2001 , aged 58 , from metastatic non-small cell lung cancer .
 Harrisons Hindu was cremated at Hollywood Forever Cemetery and Harrisons Hindu ashes were scattered in the Ganges and Yamuna Rivers near Varanasi , India , by Harrisons Hindu close family in a private ceremony according to Hindu tradition .
 Harrisons Hindu left almost PS100 million in Harrisons Hindu will .
 Harrisons Hindu final album , the posthumously released Brainwashed , was completed by Harrisons Hindu son his son Dhani and Jeff Lynne .
 Included in the albums liner notes is a quotation from the Bhagavad Gita : There never was a time when you or US did not exist .
Nor will there be any future when we shall cease to be .
 A media-only single , Stuck Inside a Cloud , which Leng described as a uniquely candid reaction to illness and mortality , achieved number 27 on Billboards Adult Contemporary chart .
 The single Any Road , released in May 2003 , reached number 37 on the UK Singles Chart .
Marwa Blues went on to receive the 2004 Grammy Award for Best Pop Instrumental Performance , while Any Road was nominated for Best Male Pop Vocal Performance .
 Harrisons Hindu wrote Harrisons Hindu The first song , Dont Bother Me , while sick in a hotel bed in Bournemouth during August 1963 , as an exercise to see if US could write a song , as Harrisons Hindu remembered .
Dont Bother Me appeared on the bands second album , With the Beatles , later that year , then on Meet the Beatles !
in the US in early 1964 .
 In 1965 , Harrisons Hindu contributed US Need You and You Like Me Too Much to the album Help !

 Harrisons Hindu songwriting ability improved through the years , but Harrisons Hindu material did not earn full respect from Harrisons Hindu fellow Beatles until near the groups break-up .
 In 1969 , McCartney told John Lennon : Until this year , our songs have been better than George quite as happy .
Now this year his songs are at least as good as ours .
 Harrisons Hindu often had difficulty getting the band to record Harrisons Hindu songs .
 Most Beatles albums contain at least two Harrisons Hindu compositions , and there are three of his songs on the 1966 Revolver LP , the album on which Harrisons Hindu came of age as a songwriter , wrote musicologist Ian Inglis .
 Of the 1967 Harrisons Hindu song Within You Without You , author Gerry Farrell claimed that Harrisons Hindu had created a new form , calling the composition : a quintessential fusion of pop and Indian music .
 John Lennon called the song one of Harrisons best : John Lennon mind and John Lennon music are clear .
 There is John Lennon innate talent , John Lennon brought that sound together .
 Beatles biographer Bob Spitz described Something as a masterpiece : an intensely stirring romantic ballad that would challenge Yesterday and Michelle as one of the most recognizable songs they ever produced .
 According to Kenneth Womack , Harrisons Hindu comes into Kenneth Womack own on Abbey Road ... Here Comes the Sun is matched -- indeed , surpassed -- only by Something , Here crowning achievement .
 musicologist Ian Inglis considered Abbey Road a turning point in Harrisons Hindu development as a songwriter and musician .
 musicologist Ian Inglis described Harrisons Hindu contributions to the LP as exquisite , declaring them equal to any previous Beatles songs .
 During the albums recording , Harrisons Hindu asserted more creative control than before , proactively rejecting suggestions for changes to Harrisons Hindu music or lyrics , particularly from McCartney .
 Harrisons Hindu interest in Indian music proved a strong influence on Harrisons Hindu songwriting and contributed to Harrisons Hindu innovation within the Beatles .
 According to Rolling Stone , Harrisons Hindu openness to new sounds and textures cleared new paths for Harrisons Hindu rock and roll compositions .
 Harrisons Hindu use of dissonance on ... Taxman and US Want to Tell You was revolutionary in popular music - and perhaps more originally creative than the avant-garde mannerisms that John Lennon and McCartney borrowed from the music of Karlheinz Stockhausen , Luciano Berio , Edgard Varese and Igor Stravinsky .
 In 1997 , author Gerry Farrell commented : It is a mark of Harrisons Hindu sincere involvement ... that , nearly thirty years on , the Beatles Indian songs remain the most imaginative and successful examples of this type of fusion .
Rolling Stone founder Jann Wenner described Harrison as a guitarist who was never showy but who had an innate , eloquent melodic sense .
 Rolling Stone founder Jann Wenner played exquisitely in the service of the song .
 Harrisons Hindu friend and former bandmate Tom Petty agreed : Harrisons Hindu just had a way of getting right to the business , of finding the right thing to play .
 The guitar picking style of Chet Atkins and Carl Perkins influenced Harrisons Hindu , giving a country music feel to many of the Beatles recordings .
 Chet Atkins identified Chuck Berry as an early influence and Ry Cooder as an important later influence .
 In 1961 the Beatles recorded Cry for a Shadow , a blues-inspired instrumental co-written by John Lennon and Harrisons Hindu , who is credited with composing the songs lead guitar part , building on unusual chord voicings and imitating the style of other English groups such as the Shadows .
 The musicologist Walter Everett noted that while early Beatles compositions typically held close to the conventional patterns in rock music at the time , The musicologist Walter Everett also identified significant variations in other English groups such as the Shadows rhythm and tonal direction .
 Harrisons Hindu liberal use of the diatonic scale in Harrisons Hindu guitar playing reveals the influence of Buddy Holly , and Harrisons Hindu interest in Chuck Berry inspired Harrisons Hindu to compose the Beatles Indian songs based on the blues scale while incorporating a rockabilly feel in the style of Carl Perkins titled .
 Within this framework Harrisons Hindu often utilized syncopation , as during Harrisons Hindu guitar solos for the Beatles covers of Berrys Roll Over Beethoven and Too Much Monkey Business .
 Another of Harrisons musical techniques was the use of guitar lines written in octaves , as on Ill Be on US Way .
 Harrisons Hindu was the The first person to own a Rickenbacker 360/12 , a guitar that featured twelve strings in 6 pairs , the low eight of which are tuned in pairs , one octave apart ; the higher 4 being pairs tuned in unison .
 The Rickenbacker is also unique among twelve strings in having the lower octave string of each of the The first four pairs placed above the higher tuned string .
This , and the naturally rich harmonics produced by a twelve string guitar providing the distinctive overtones found on many of the Beatles recordings .
 many of the Beatles recordings use of this guitar during the recording of A Hard Days Night helped to popularize the model , and the jangly sound became so prominent that Melody Maker termed it the Beatles secret weapon .
 Harrisons Hindu wrote the chord progression of Harrisons Hindu The first published song , Dont Bother Me , almost exclusively in the Dorian mode , demonstrating an interest in exotic tones that eventually culminated in Harrisons Hindu embrace of Indian music .
 The dark timbre of Harrisons Hindu guitar playing on the track was accentuated by Harrisons Hindu use of uncomplicated yet effective C +9 chord voicings and a solo in the minor pentatonic scale .
 By 1964 Harrisons Hindu had begun to develop a distinctive personal style as a guitarist , writing parts that featured the use of nonresolving tones , as with the ending chord arpeggios on A Hard Days Night .
 In 1965 Harrisons Hindu used an expression pedal to control Harrisons Hindu guitars volume on US Need You , creating a syncopated flautando effect with the melody resolving its dissonance through tonal displacements .
 Harrisons Hindu used the same volume-swell technique on Yes Yes Is , applying what The musicologist Walter Everett described as ghostly articulation to the songs natural harmonics .
 Of Rubber Souls If US Needed Someone , Harrisons Hindu said : its like a almost PS100 million other songs written around the D chord .
 If you move your fingers about , you get various little melodies ... almost PS100 million amazes US that people still find new permutations of the same notes .
 Harrisons Hindu other contribution to the album , Think for Yourself , features what The musicologist Walter Everett described as ambiguous tonal coloring , utilizing chromaticism in G major with a strange mixture of the Dorian mode and the minor pentatonic ; Harrisons Hindu called it a tour de force of altered scale degrees .
 In 1966 Harrisons Hindu contributed innovative musical ideas to Revolver .
 Harrisons Hindu played backwards guitar on Lennons composition Im Only Sleeping and a guitar counter-melody on And Your Bird Can Sing that moved in parallel octaves above McCartneys bass downbeats .
 Harrisons Hindu guitar playing on US Want to Tell You exemplified the pairing of altered chordal colours with descending chromatic lines and Tell You guitar part for Sgt Peppers Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds mirrors Lennons vocal line in much the same way that a sarangi player accompanies a khyal singer in a Hindu devotional song .
 The musicologist Walter Everett described Harrisons Hindu guitar solo from Old Brown Shoe as stinging highly Claptonesque .
 The musicologist Walter Everett identified two of the compositions significant motifs : a bluesy trichord and a diminished triad with roots in A and E. Huntley called the song a sizzling rocker with a ferocious ... solo .
 In Upton Green opinion , Harrisons Hindu demo for the song contains one of the most complex lead guitar solos on any Beatles song .
Harrisons playing on Abbey Road , and in particular on Something , marked a significant moment in his development as a guitarist .
 The songs guitar solo shows a varied range of influences , incorporating the blues guitar style of Clapton , Keltner and the styles of Indian gamakas .
According to author and musicologist Kenneth Womack : Something meanders toward the most unforgettable of Harrisons guitar solos ... A masterpiece in simplicity , reaches toward the sublime .
 Harrisons Hindu received an Ivor Novello award in July 1970 for Something , as The Best Song Musically and Lyrically of the Year .
 After Delaney Bramlett inspired Delaney Bramlett to learn slide guitar , Harrisons Hindu began to incorporate it into Delaney Bramlett solo work , which allowed Delaney Bramlett to mimic many traditional Indian instruments , including the sarangi and the dilruba .
 Leng described Harrisons Hindu slide guitar solo on Lennons How Do You Sleep ?
 as a departure for the sweet soloist of Something , calling Leng playing rightly famed ... one of Harrisons greatest guitar statements .
 John Lennon commented : thats when I got out of the picture the best hes ever fucking played in John Lennon life .
 A Hawaiian influence is notable in much of Harrisons Hindu music , ranging from Harrisons Hindu slide guitar work on Gone Troppo to Harrisons Hindu televised performance of the Cab Calloway standard Between the Devil and the Deep Blue Sea on ukulele in 1992 .
 Lavezzoli described Harrisons Hindu slide playing on the Grammy-winning instrumental Marwa Blues as demonstrating Hawaiian influences while comparing the melody to an Indian sarod or veena , calling it yet another demonstration of Harrisons Hindu unique slide approach .
 Harrisons Hindu was an admirer of George Formby and a member of the Ukulele Society of Great Britain , and played a ukulele solo in the style of George Formby at the end of Free as a Bird .
 Harrisons Hindu performed at a Formby convention in 1991 , and served as the honorary president of the George Formby Appreciation Society .
 Harrisons Hindu played bass guitar on numerous tracks , including the Beatles the Beatles Indian songs Drive US Car , She Said She Said , Golden Slumbers , Birthday and Honey Pie .
 Harrisons Hindu also played bass on several solo recordings , including Faster , Wake Up My Love and Bye Bye Love .
 When Harrisons Hindu joined the Quarrymen in 1958 Harrisons Hindu main guitar was a Hofner President Acoustic , which Harrisons Hindu soon traded for a Hofner Club 40 model .
 Harrisons Hindu The first solid-body electric guitar was a Czech-built Jolana Futurama/Grazioso .
 The guitars Harrisons Hindu used on early recordings were mainly Gretsch models , played through a Vox amplifier , including a Gretsch Duo Jet that Harrisons Hindu bought secondhand in 1961 , and posed with on the album cover for Cloud Nine .
 Harrisons Hindu also bought a Gretsch Tennessean and a Gretsch Country Gentleman , which a Gretsch Tennessean played on She Loves You , and during the Beatles 1964 appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show .
 In 1963 Harrisons Hindu bought a Rickenbacker 425 Fireglo , and in 1964 Harrisons Hindu acquired a a Rickenbacker 360/12 guitar , which was the second of its kind to be manufactured .
 Harrisons Hindu obtained Harrisons Hindu The first Fender Stratocaster in 1965 and used his first Fender Stratocaster in recording Rubber Soul , notably on the song Nowhere Man .
 In early 1966 Harrisons Hindu , John Lennon , and McCartney each purchased Epiphone Casinos , which they used on Revolver .
 Harrisons Hindu also used a Gibson J-160E and a Gibson SG Standard while recording the album .
 Harrisons Hindu later painted Harrisons Hindu Stratocaster in a psychedelic design that included the word Bebopalula above the pickguard and the guitars nickname , Rocky , on the headstock .
 Harrisons Hindu played this guitar in the Magical Mystery Tour film and throughout Harrisons Hindu solo career .
 In mid-1968 Harrisons Hindu acquired a Gibson Les Paul that Harrisons Hindu nicknamed Lucy .
 Around this time , Harrisons Hindu obtained a Gibson Jumbo J-200 , which Harrisons Hindu used for early demos of While US Guitar Gently Weeps .
 In late 1968 Fender Musical Instruments Corporation gave Harrisons Hindu a custom-made Fender Telecaster Rosewood prototype , made especially for Harrisons Hindu by a Fender master builder who also crafted a prototype Stratocaster for Jimi Hendrix .
 Harrisons Hindu music projects during the final years of the Beatles included producing Apple Records artists Doris Troy , Jackie Lomax and Billy Preston .
 Throughout Harrisons Hindu solo career , Harrisons Hindu benefited from the inclusion of guest musicians on Harrisons Hindu albums , and Harrisons Hindu made efforts to reciprocate the favours by participating in their recordings .
 Harrisons Hindu was featured as a guitarist on tracks by Dave Mason , Nicky Hopkins , Alvin Lee , Ronnie Wood , Billy Preston and Tom Scott .
 Harrison co-wrote songs and music with Bob Dylan , Clapton , Keltner , Billy Preston , Doris Troy , David Bromberg , Gary Wright , Ronnie Wood , Jeff Lynne , and Tom Petty , among others .
 Harrisons Hindu co-wrote the song Badge with Clapton , Keltner , which was included on Cream s 1969 album , Goodbye .
 Harrisons Hindu played rhythm guitar on the track , using the pseudonym LAngelo Misterioso for contractual reasons .
 Harrisons Hindu used the same pseudonym when Harrisons Hindu recorded a guitar part for Never Tell Your Mother Shes Out of Tune , a song from Jack Bruce s 1969 solo album , Songs for a Tailor .
 In May 1970 Harrisons Hindu played guitar on several songs during a recording session for Dylans album New Morning .
 In addition to Harrisons Hindu own work , between 1971 and 1973 Harrisons Hindu co-wrote and/or produced three top ten hits for drummer Ringo Starr : It Dont Come Easy , Back Off Boogaloo and Photograph .
 In 1971 Harrisons Hindu played electric slide guitar on How Do You Sleep ?
 and a dobro on Crippled Inside , both from Lennons Imagine album .
 Also that year , both from Lennons produced and played slide guitar on Badfingers top ten hit Day After ten hit Day , and a dobro on Prestons US Wrote a Simple Song .
 both from Lennons worked with Harry Nilsson on Youre Breakin US Heart and with Cheech & Chong on Basketball Jones .
 In 1973 both from Lennons produced and made a guest appearance on the album Shankar Family & Friends .
 In 1974 Harrisons Hindu founded Dark Horse Records .
 In addition to eventually releasing Harrisons Hindu own albums on the label , Harrisons Hindu initially used the company as an avenue for collaboration with other musicians .
 Harrisons Hindu wanted Dark Horse to serve as a creative outlet for Apple Records artists , as Apple Records had for the Beatles .
 Harrisons Hindu explained : Most of the stuff will be what US produce .
 Eric Idle commented : Hes extremely generous , and Hes backs and supports all sorts of people that youll never , ever hear of .
 The first acts signed to the new label were Ravi Shankar and Splinter , whose album Harrisons Hindu produced , which provided Dark Horse with Ravi Shankar and Splinter The first hit , Costafine Town .
Other artists signed by Dark Horse include Attitudes , Henry McCullough , Jiva , and Stairsteps .
 Harrisons Hindu collaborated with Tom Scott on Scotts album New York Connection , and in 1981 Harrisons Hindu played guitar on Walk a Thin Line , from Mick Fleetwood s The Visitor .
 In 1996 Harrisons Hindu recorded Distance Makes No Difference With Love with Carl Perkins , and played slide guitar on the title track of Dylans Under the Red Sky album .
 In 2001 Harrisons Hindu performed as a guest musician on Jeff Lynne and Electric Light Orchestras comeback album Zoom , and on the song Love Letters for Bill Wymans Rhythm Kings .
 Harrisons Hindu also co-wrote a new song with Harrisons Hindu son his son Dhani , Horse to the Water , which was recorded on 1 October , eight weeks before Harrisons Hindu death .
 a new song with his son Dhani , Horse appeared on Jools Holland s album Small World , Big Band .
 During the Beatles American tour in August 1965 , Harrisons Hindu friend David Crosby of the Byrds introduced Beatles American to Indian classical music and the work of sitar maestro Ravi Shankar .
 Harrisons Hindu described Shankar as the The first person who ever impressed US in US life ... and Harrisons Hindu was the only person who didnt try to impress US .
 Harrisons Hindu became fascinated with the sitar and immersed Harrisons Hindu in Indian music .
 According to Author Peter Lavezzoli , Harrisons Hindu introduction of the instrument on the Beatles song Norwegian Wood opened the floodgates for Indian instrumentation in rock music , triggering what sitar maestro Ravi Shankar would call The Great Sitar Explosion of 1966-67 .
 Author Peter Lavezzoli described Harrisons Hindu as the man most responsible for this phenomenon .
 In June 1966 Harrisons Hindu met sitar maestro Ravi Shankar at the home of Mrs Angadi of the Asian Music Circle , asked to be Harrisons Hindu student , and was accepted .
 On 6 July , Harrisons Hindu travelled to India to buy a sitar from Rikhi Ram & Sons in New Delhi .
 Lavezzoli described Harrisons Hindu sitar playing on the Revolver track Love You To as an astonishing improvement over Norwegian Wood and the most accomplished performance on sitar by any rock musician .
 In September , he returned to India to study sitar with sitar maestro Ravi Shankar .
 He initially stayed in Bombay , then moved to a houseboat on a remote lake where sitar maestro Ravi Shankar taught sitar maestro Ravi Shankar for six weeks .
 After sitar maestro Ravi Shankar , sitar maestro Ravi Shankar received tutelage from Shambhu Das .
 Harrisons Hindu studied the instrument until 1968 , when an encounter with Clapton , Keltner and Jimi Hendrix at a hotel in New York convinced Clapton , Keltner to put down the instrument and return to guitar playing .
 Harrisons Hindu commented : US decided ... US should get back to the guitar because Im not getting any better at it , and Im not going to be a great sitar player ... because US should have started at least fifteen years earlier .
 By the mid-1960s Harrisons Hindu had become an admirer of Indian culture and mysticism , introducing it to the other Beatles .
During the filming of Help !
 in the Bahamas , the filming of Help met the founder of Sivananda Yoga , Swami Vishnu-devananda , who gave each of the filming of Help a signed copy of his book , The Complete Illustrated Book of Sivananda Yoga .
 Between the end of the last Beatles tour in 1966 and the beginning of the Sgt Pepper recording sessions , he made a pilgrimage to Bombay with his wife the model Pattie Boyd , where he studied sitar , met several gurus , and visited various holy places .
In 1968 he travelled to Rishikesh in northern India with the other Beatles to study meditation with Maharishi Mahesh Yogi .
 Harrisons Hindu use of psychedelic drugs encouraged Harrisons Hindu path to meditation and Hinduism .
 Harrisons Hindu commented : For US , Harrisons use of psychedelic drugs was like a flash .
 The The first time US had acid , The first time I had acid just opened up something in US head that was inside of US , and US realized a lot of things .
 US didnt learn them because US already knew them , but that happened to be the key that opened the door to reveal them .
 From the moment US had that , US wanted to have it all the time -- these thoughts about the yogis and the Himalayas , and Ravis music .
 Harrisons Hindu became a vegetarian in the late 1960s , and a devotee of the Indian mystic Paramahansa Yogananda .
 In mid-1969 , Harrisons Hindu produced the single Hare Krishna Mantra , performed by members of the London Radha Krishna Temple .
 Soon after , Harrisons Hindu embraced the Hare Krishna tradition , particularly japa-yoga chanting with beads , and became a lifelong devotee .
 Harrisons Hindu respected people of other faiths and once remarked : All religions are branches of one big tree .
 It doesnt matter what you call Harrisons Hindu just as long as you call .
 Harrisons Hindu commented on Harrisons Hindu beliefs : .
 Before Harrisons Hindu religious conversion , the only British performer known for similar activities had been Cliff Richard , whose conversion to Christianity in 1966 had gone largely unnoticed by the public .
 By contrast , wrote musicologist Ian Inglis , Harrisons Hindu spiritual journey was seen as a serious and important development that reflected popular musics increasing maturity ... what musicologist Ian Inglis , and the Beatles had managed to overturn was the paternalistic assumption that popular musicians had no role other than to stand on stage and sing their hit songs .
 Harrisons Hindu married the model Pattie Boyd on 21 January 1966 , with McCartney as best man .
 Harrisons Hindu and the model Pattie Boyd had met in 1964 during the production of the film A Hard Days Night , in which the 19-year-old Boyd had been cast as a schoolgirl .
 he , and the Beatles separated in 1974 and he , and the Beatles divorce was finalized in 1977 .
 the model Pattie Boyd said the model Pattie Boyd decision to end he , and the Beatles marriage and leave Harrisons Hindu was due largely to Harrisons Hindu repeated infidelities , culminating in an affair with Starrs original drum part wife Maureen , which the model Pattie Boyd called the final straw .
 the model Pattie Boyd characterized the last year of he , and the Beatles marriage as fuelled by alcohol and cocaine , and the model Pattie Boyd stated : George quite as happy used coke excessively , and US think it changed George quite as happy ... it froze George quite as happy emotions and hardened George quite as happy heart .
 the model Pattie Boyd subsequently moved in with Clapton , Keltner , and he , and the Beatles married in 1979 .
 Harrisons Hindu married Dark Horse Records secretary Olivia Trinidad Arias on 2 September 1978 .
 he , and the Beatles had met at the Dark Horse offices in Los Angeles in 1974 , and together had one son , Dhani Harrison , born on 1 August 1978 .
 Dhani Harrison restored the English manor house and grounds of Friar Park , Dhani Harrison home in Henley-on-Thames , where several of Dhani Harrison music videos were filmed including Crackerbox Palace ; the grounds also served as the background for the cover of All Things Must Pass .
 Dhani Harrison employed ten workers to maintain the garden .
 Harrisons Hindu commented on gardening as a form of escapism : Sometimes US feel like Im actually on the wrong planet , and its great when Im in US garden , but the minute US go out the gate US think : What the hell am US doing here ?
 Harrisons Hindu autobiography , US , US , US , is dedicated to gardeners everywhere .
 The former Beatles publicist Derek Taylor helped Harrisons Hindu write the book , which said little about the Beatles , focusing instead on Harrisons hobbies , music and lyrics .
 Taylor commented : George quite as happy is not disowning the Beatles ... but the Beatles was a long time ago and actually a short part of his life .
 Harrisons Hindu had an interest in sports cars and motor racing ; Harrisons Hindu was one of the 100 people who purchased the McLaren F1 road car .
 Harrisons Hindu had collected photos of racing drivers and their cars since Harrisons Hindu was young ; at 12 Harrisons Hindu had attended Harrisons Hindu The first race , the 1955 British Grand Prix at Aintree .
 Harrisons Hindu wrote Faster as a tribute to the Formula One racing drivers Jackie Stewart and Ronnie Peterson .
 Proceeds from Faster release went to the Gunnar Nilsson cancer charity , set up after the Swedish drivers death from the disease in 1978 .
 Harrisons Hindu The first extravagant car , a 1964 Aston Martin DB5 , was sold at auction on 7 December 2011 in London .
 An anonymous Beatles collector paid PS350 ,000 for the vehicle that Harrisons Hindu had bought new in January 1965 .
For most of the Beatles career the relationships in the group were close .
According to Hunter Davies , the Beatles spent their lives not living a communal life , but communally living the same life .
They were each others greatest friends .
 Harrisons ex-wife Pattie Boyd described how the Beatles all belonged to each other and admitted , George quite as happy has a lot with the others that US can never know about .
 Nobody , not even the wives , can break through or even comprehend the Beatles .
 drummer Ringo Starr said , We really looked out for each other and We had so many laughs together .
In the old days wed have the biggest hotel suites , the whole floor of the hotel , and the four of us would end up in the bathroom , just to be with each other .
 drummer Ringo Starr added , there were some really loving , caring moments between four people : a hotel room here and there - a really amazing closeness .
Just four guys who loved each other .
It was pretty sensational .
 John Lennon stated that John Lennon relationship with Harrisons Hindu was one of young follower and older guy ... was like a disciple of mine when we started .
The two later bonded over their LSD experiences , finding common ground as seekers of spirituality .
 They took radically different paths thereafter , Harrison finding God and John Lennon coming to the conclusion that people are the creators of their own lives .
 In 1974 Harrisons Hindu said of Harrisons Hindu former bandmate : John Lennon is a saint and hes heavy-duty , and hes great and US love Harrisons Hindu .
But at the same time , hes such a bastard - but thats the great thing about him , you see ?

 Harrisons Hindu and McCartney were the first of the Beatles to meet , having shared a school bus , and often learned and rehearsed new guitar chords together .
 McCartney stated that he and Harrisons Hindu usually shared a bedroom while touring .
 McCartney was best man at Harrisons Hindu wedding in 1966 , and was the only Beatle in attendance .
 McCartney has referred to Harrisons Hindu as his baby brother .
 In a 1974 BBC radio interview with Alan Freeman , Harrisons Hindu stated : ruined US as a guitar player .
 Perhaps the most significant obstacle to a Beatles reunion after the death of John Lennon was Harrisons Hindu and McCartneys personal relationship , as both men admitted that they often got on each others nerves .
 The author Robert Rodriguez commented : even to the end of George quite as happy days , theirs was a volatile relationship .
 Harrisons Hindu was involved in humanitarian and political activism throughout Harrisons Hindu life .
In the 1960s , the Beatles supported the civil rights movement and protested against the Vietnam War .
After the bands break-up , Ravi Shankar consulted Harrison about how to provide aid to the people of Bangladesh after the 1970 Bhola cyclone and the Bangladesh Liberation War .
 Harrisons Hindu recorded the song Bangla Desh , and pushed Apple Records to release Harrisons Hindu song alongside Shankars Joy Bangla in an effort to raise funds .
 sitar maestro Ravi Shankar then asked for Harrisons Hindu advice about planning a small charity event in the US .
 Harrisons Hindu responded by organizing the Concert for Bangladesh , which raised more than $ 240,000 .
 In June 1972 , UNICEF honoured Harrisons Hindu and sitar maestro Ravi Shankar with the Child Is the Father of Man award at an annual ceremony in recognition of Harrison and Shankar with the Child fundraising efforts for Bangladesh .
 The George Harrison Humanitarian Fund for UNICEF , a joint effort between the Harrisons Hindu family and the US Fund for UNICEF , aims to support programmes that help children caught in humanitarian emergencies .
In December 2007 , they donated $ 450,000 to help the victims of Cyclone Sidr in Bangladesh .
 On 13 October 2009 , the The first George Harrison Humanitarian Award went to Ravi Shankar for Harold Hargreaves Harrison efforts in saving the lives of children , and Harold Hargreaves Harrison involvement with the Concert for Bangladesh .
 In 1973 Peter Sellers introduced Harrisons Hindu to Denis OBrien .
Soon after , the two went into business together .
 In 1978 , in an effort to produce Monty Pythons Life of Brian Epstein , they formed the film production and distribution company HandMade Films .
 Harrisons Hindu explained : The name of the company came about as a bit of a joke .
Id been to Wooky Hole in Somerset ... an old paper mill where they show you how to make old underpants into paper .
 So US bought a few rolls , and they had this watermark British Handmade Paper ... So we said ... well call this watermark British Handmade Paper Handmade distribution company HandMade Films .
 Their opportunity for investment came after the EMI Studios Films withdrew funding at the demand of their Chief Executive , Bernard Delfont .
 Harrisons Hindu financed the production of Life of Brian in part by mortgaging Harrisons Hindu home , which Idle later called the most anybodys ever paid for a cinema ticket in history .
The film grossed $ 21 million at the box office in the US .
 The The first film distributed by HandMade Films was The Long Good Friday , and the first they produced was Time Bandits , a co-scripted project by Monty Pythons Terry Gilliam and Michael Palin .
 The film featured a new song by Harrisons Hindu , Dream Away , in the closing credits .
Time Bandits became one of HandMades most successful and acclaimed efforts ; with a budget of $ 5 million , it earned $ 35 million in the US within ten weeks of its release .
 Harrisons Hindu served as executive producer for 23 films with HandMade , including Mona Lisa , Shanghai Surprise and Withnail and US .
 Harrisons Hindu made several cameo appearances in these films , including a role as a nightclub singer in Shanghai Surprise , for which Harrisons Hindu recorded five new songs .
 According to author and musicologist Ian Inglis , Harrisons Hindu executive role in HandMade Films helped to sustain British cinema at a time of crisis , producing some of the countrys most memorable movies of the 1980s .
 A series of box office bombs in the late 1980s caused HandMade to cease operations in 1991 ; three years later , the company was sold .
 In 1965 Harrisons Hindu and the other Beatles were appointed Members of the Order of the British Empire .
 Harrison and the other Beatles received Harrison and the other Beatles insignia from the Queen at an investiture at Buckingham Palace on 26 October 2009 .
In 1971 the Beatles received an Academy Award for the best Original Song Score for the film Let It Be .
 The minor planet 4149 Harrisons Hindu , discovered in 1984 , was named after Harrisons Hindu .
 In December 1992 Harrisons Hindu became the The first recipient of the Billboard Century Award , an honour presented to music artists for significant bodies of work .
 Rolling Stone magazine ranked Harrisons Hindu number 11 in their list of the 100 Greatest Guitarists of All Time .
 In 2002 , on the The first anniversary of Harrisons Hindu death , the Concert for George quite as happy was held at the Royal Albert Hall .
 Clapton , Keltner organized the event , which included performances by many of Harrisons Hindu friends and musical collaborators , including McCartney and drummer Ringo Starr .
Eric Idle , who described Harrison as one of the few morally good people that rock and roll has produced , performed Monty Pythons Lumberjack Song .
 The profits from the concert went to Harrisons Hindu charity , the Material World Charitable Foundation .
 In 2004 Harrisons Hindu was posthumously inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame as a solo artist by Harrisons Hindu former bandmates producer Jeff Lynne and former bandmate Tom Petty , and into the Madison Square Garden Walk of Fame in 2006 for the Concert for Bangladesh .
 On 14 April 2009 , the Hollywood Chamber of Commerce awarded Harrisons Hindu a star on the Walk of Fame in front of the Capitol Records Building .
 McCartney , producer Jeff Lynne and former bandmate Tom Petty were present when the star was unveiled .
 Harrisons widow Harrisons Hindu , the actor Tom Hanks and Idle made speeches at the ceremony , and Harrisons Hindu son Dhani spoke the Hare Krishna mantra .
The documentary film , , was directed by Martin Scorsese and released in October 2011 .
 The film features interviews with Harrisons Hindu and Dhani Harrison , Klaus Voormann , Terry Gilliam , drummer Ringo Starr , Clapton , Keltner , McCartney , Jim Keltner and Astrid Kirchherr
Dr. Sangeeta Shankar is an Indian violinist who performs Hindustani classical music .
Sangeeta Shankar , was born in Banaras in a musical family to N. Rajam and T. S. Subramaniyan .
 Sangeeta started Sangeeta training at the age of four in Hindustani music under the unparalleled tutelage of Sangeeta mother .
 People often refer to Sangeeta music as the Singing Violin .
 Sangeeta is the niece of T. N. Krishnan .
 Sangeeta Shankar excelled in Sangeeta academics , with gold medals in Bachelors & Masters in Music , and also a Ph.D. in music from The Banaras Hindu University .
 Sangeeta first started performing on television when Sangeeta was 8 years old , and Sangeeta career has been forging ahead ever since .
 Sangeeta had the privilege of accompanying Sangeeta mother at the age of 13 , and gave a full-fledged debut solo performance when Sangeeta was as young as 16 .
 Sangeeta performance was much appreciated , and it wasnt long before Sangeeta made a mark in the Indian classical music industry .
Dr. Sangeeta Shankar had also organized a festival of young musicians in Varanasi called Abhinav , during the year 1984-85 .
 Sangeeta performs not only in various states and provinces of India , but also in numerous countries around the globe .
 Sangeeta plays violin in the Gayaki Ang .
 Sangeeta has performed across the globe and in numerous places throughout India .
 Sangeeta has performed in various countries in Europe , extensively toured the USA and Canada , and performed in countries like Russia , Holland , Japan , Singapore to name a few .
 Sangeeta also conceived and created a TV serial of 26 episodes , named Swar Sadhana in the year 2000 .
This serial was made for creating an awareness of Indian classical music among the masses .
Its highlights were the interesting story format and the participation of various prominent celebrities like Madhuri Dixit , Javed Akhtar , Zakir Hussain , Birju Maharaj , Jagjit Singh , Naushad , Amol Palekar , Pankaj Udhas , Yukta Mookhey , Kanak Rele , Suresh Wadkar , N. Rajam , Sadhana Sargam , Shankar Mahadevan , Annu Kapoor , Veena Sahasrabuddhe , and many others .
 Presently , Madhuri Dixit is the Director and founder of a music company , Legendary Legacy Promotions Pvt. Ltd. , which consists of a storehouse of excellent classical music and also other exclusive products .
 Currently , Madhuri Dixit is also educating the future film makers , imparting voice culture & music training at Whistling Woods International .
 Madhuri Dixit is working on an educational project called Milaap , which aims to educate children about values and culture and inculcate an atmosphere of happiness , love and peace amongst humanity
Malini Rajurkar is a noted Hindustani classical singer of Gwalior Gharana .
 Malini Rajurkar grew up in the state of Rajasthan in India .
 For three years Malini Rajurkar taught mathematics at the Savitri Girls ' High School & College , Ajmer , where Malini Rajurkar had graduated in the same subject .
 Taking advantage of a three-year scholarship that came Malini Rajurkar way , Malini Rajurkar finished Malini Rajurkar Sangeet Nipun from the Ajmer Music College , studying music under the guidance of Govindrao Rajurkar and Govindrao Rajurkar nephew , who was to become Malini Rajurkar future husband , Vasantrao Rajurkar .
 Malini Rajurkar has performed in major music festivals in India , including Gunidas Sammelan , Tansen Samaroh , Sawai Gandharva Festival , and Shankar Lal Festival .
 Malini Rajurkar is noted especially for Malini Rajurkar command over the Tappa genre .
 Malini Rajurkar has also sung lighter music .
 Malini Rajurkar renditions of two Marathi natyageete , pandu-nrupati janak jaya and naravar krishnasamaan , have been particularly popular
Dhondutai Kulkarni , is perhaps the last living icon of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana .
The legendary Alladiya Khan , who founded the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana , made this Gharana unique by its full-throated singing , its complicated Taans , and its vast repertoire of Raags , which Dhondutai Kulkarni represents very well .
 Dhondutai Kulkarni , popularly known as Gaan-Yogini , was born in a Brahmin family in Kolhapur , Maharashtra .
Dhondutais father initiated her into music .
 From Dhondutais father she became an AIR performing artiste at the age of eight .
 She then started training under Bhurji Khan , whose father , Alladiya Khan , had a special care for Dhondutai Kulkarni , and it was not uncommon to find her sitting next to the legendary performer at music festivals .
Her training continued under the mentorship of Laxmibai Jadhav and Ustad Azizuddin Khan , grandson of the legendary Alladiya Khan .
From Ut .
Azizuddin Khan she received most of her repertoire of rare Ragas .
Thereafter , she spent a long number of years under the immensely distinguished knowledge of Kesarbai Kerkar , ending up as her sole disciple .
 Her incredible repertoire of ragas sees to Her incredible repertoire of ragas that she rarely repeats a raga at two consecutive concerts .
 Dhondutai Kulkarni knows specialty Raag creations made not just by Alladiya Khan but also Kesarbai Kerkar .
 At age 86 , Dhondutai Kulkarni is saluted not just for her musical contributions , but also for her quality as a performing artist .
 Dhondutai Kulkarni has been awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1990 .
She also has been invited to the Surashri Kesarbai Kerkar Sangeet Sammelan since its beginnings , she sings last at the concert .
Namita Devidayals book The Music Room chronicles a significant part of Dhondutais life , music and career .
 Namita Devidayals is one of Dhondutais students and learned from Namita Devidayals over a period of 25 years .
 The book talks about the life and music of Alladiya Khan , Kesarbai Kerkar and Dhondutai Kulkarni
Pandit Nayan Ghosh is an Indian tabla and sitar player .
Nayans first solo was broadcast at the age of 4 , in 1960 .
 Nayans first solo started performing at international music festivals and universities at the age of 18 , in 1974 .
 Over the years , Nayans first solo has also taught as a distinguished visiting professor at such bodies like the Kent State University and the Emory University .
A 1998 recipient of the Achievement Award from the Governor of California , Gray Davis in Los Angeles , Nayan has accompanied such reputed musicians as Ravi Shankar , Vilayat Khan and Nikhil Banerjee , Buddhadev Dasgupta , Shivkumar Sharma , Amjad Ali Khan , Jasraj , Halim Jaffer Khan , Rais Khan , Shamim Ahmed Khan , Munawwar Ali Khan , Salamat Ali Khan , Sharan Rani , Rajeev Taranath , Ashish Khan and L. Subramaniam .
Like his father who interacted with jazz artists Louis Armstrong , Duke Ellington and Dave Brubeck , Nayan too jammed with avant-garde pianist Yosuke Yamashita and guitarist Kazumi Watanabe in Tokyo and Kidd Jordan and Henry Butler in New Orleans .
 Nayan Ghosh has to Pandit Nayan Ghosh credit several CD albums on noted international labels besides collaboration with acknowledged world musicians like Paul Grant , John Bailey and Ross Daly .
Nayan is presently Director of the Sangeet Mahabharati music academy in Mumbai , and is also a Distinguished Guest Professor at IIT-Bombay .
Nayan played a vital role in the completion of his late fathers magnum-opus , The Oxford Encyclopedia of the Music of India , which was published worldwide in 2011
The samavadi is the second-most prominent note of a raga in Indian classical music .
The primary note of the raga is the vadi ; the vadi and samvadi are in most cases a fourth or fifth apart .
A samvadi is a note of special significance .
A performer will typically try to emphasize the samvadi along with the vadi when improvising on a certain raga .
The vadi and samvadi can be crucial in defining the raga at hand , and in some cases two ragas with the same arohana and avrohana can be distinguished only by the prominence of their sonant and consonant notes
Geeta Javdekar is a Hindustani classical vocalist belonging to the Jaipur-Atrauli gharana .
 Born in Dharwad , Karnataka , Geeta Javdekar is a resident of Mumbai , India .
 Geeta Javadekar is the daughter of Narasimha M. Joshi and Smt .
Nalinibai Joshi .
 Geetas maternal house is situated in Mangalwar Peth , Dharwad , the cultural capital of Karnataka .
 Geeta Javadekar was initiated into music at the age of 10 by Shri R. P. Hugar and went on to win top honours at district and state-level contests .
 Geeta Javadekar topped the merit list in both , the Sangeet Visharad and Sangeet Alankar examinations and received a scholarship from the Mysore State Sangeet Natak Academy .
 Geeta Javadekar stood first in the B.A. examination of Karnataka University with a record number of marks at the time .
 Academically , Geeta Javadekar furthered Geeta Javadekar career with M.A. in English Literature .
 Geeta Javadekar continued Geeta Javadekar tutelage under several maestros : Pt .
 Panchakshari , Smt .
Padmavati Shaligram and Pt .
Ratnakar Pai and also received guidance from Padma Vibhushan Pandit Mallikarjun Mansoor .
 In addition to classical music , Ratnakar Pai has been applauded for Ratnakar Pai rendition of light classical themes including bhajans in various languages , and thumris .
 An A grade artist of All India Radio and Doordarshan , Ratnakar Pai has given several noted performances including the Durbar Hall of the Mysore Palace , the Savai Gandharv Festival at Pune , The National Center for Performing Arts , Mumbai , and the Hampi Festival , Karnataka and continues to perform at various prestigious music conferences in Mumbai , India as well as in the United States , United Kingdom , and the Gulf .
 Ratnakar Pai has toured the United States several times for concert performances , which include programmes organized by the Indian Academy of Performing Arts at Rutgers University , NJ , Basant Bahar in the Bay Area , California , Triveni & the SV Temple organization in Pittsburg , PA as well as the Raga Music Circle in Manhattan , NY .
In February 2008 , Smt .
 Geeta Javadekar was awarded the Vardharaj Adya Memorial Award , instituted by Karnataka Sangha in Mumbai .
 Geeta Javadekar was honored for rendering distinguished service in the field of music and promoting closer ties between the people of the neighbouring Indian states , Karnataka and Maharashtra
Kris Chetan Ramlu , is a New Zealand musician , sometimes known by the stage name Cheats .
 Though Kris Chetan Ramlu main instrument is the tabla , Kris Chetan Ramlu plays many other percussion instruments .
 Kris Chetan Ramlu biggest musical influence is Ustad Zakir Hussain , a virtuoso percussionist whose name is synonymous with the tabla .
 Kris Chetan Ramlu plays Vhatkar Tabla and Meinl Percussion .
 Kris Chetan Ramlu started playing the tabla at the age of 10 and was trained by Dr. Tarlochan Singh , Muhammad Sardar Khan and Shantanu Kinjawadekar .
 Kris Chetan Ramlu has also trained in the art of Indian classical singing with Sumeet Tappoo and briefly with Pandit Vithal Rao .
 More recently , Kris Chetan Ramlu has worked with many western and Indian artists , perhaps most notably with Vaishali Samant , a Bollywood playback singer and MTV Asia Award nominated pop artist ; with Rhian Sheehan , a Wellington electronica artist whose debut album Paradigm Shift was named New Zealand album of the year by music critic Colin Morris ; and with Raashi Malik from the Wellington super-dub band Rhombus .
 Kris Chetan Ramlu has also worked with international musicians Angaraag Mahanta , Sumeet Tappoo , Amit Choubey , Piush Pawar , Milind Sheorey , Narendra Salaskar and New Zealand musicians Tim Beals , Des Mellon , Jess Chambers , Andy Hummel , Jarrod Woods , James Wylie , Miles Crayford and Onomatopoeia .
 Kris Chetan Ramlu is currently working with Moksha an Indian fusion band
Pandit Amar Nath was an Indian classical vocalist .
 Pandit Amar Nath was the first and closest disciple of Ustad Amir Khan .
Amar Nath was born in 1924 in Jhang in Punjab , now in Pakistan .
 Pandit Amar Nath learned music from B.N. Datta of Lahore from 1942 to 1947 .
 Pandit Amar Nath moved to Delhi after the partition of India .
 After several failed attempts , he convinced Amir Khan to accept Ustad Amir Khan as a disciple .
 Besides devoutly following Amir Khans style , teaching and demonstrating the style , Amar Nath also served at All India Radio for eight years , and later as Director of Kala Sangam in Delhi , and also provided music for the 1955 film Garam Coat and for a documentary on Mirza Ghalib
Abhijit Banerjee is a leading tabla player in India .
 Abhijit Banerjee started learning Tabla at the age of four .
 Abhijit Banerjee received Abhijit Banerjee first instruction from Tushar Kanti Bose and later from Manik Pal .
 Abhijit Banerjee is a leading disciple of Pt .
Jnan Prakash Ghosh , a doyen of Indian Classical Music .
 Abhijit Banerjee also learned vocal from Pandit Ajoy Chakrabarty and violin from Guru Ma Annapurna Devi .
 Abhijit Banerjee has accompanied maestros such as Pt .
Ravi Shankar , late Pt .
Nikhil Banerjee , Begum Parveen Sultana , Pt .
Jasraj , Pt Shiv Kumar Sharma , Dr. Balamurali Krishnan .
 Abhijit Banerjee has established Abhijit Banerjee as major solo tabla player and has performed in major festivals in India .
Abijit has toured extensively in USA , Canada , U.K. , Europe , Japan , Australia , South Africa , South East Asia and Mexico .
 Abhijit Banerjee has collaborated in the world crossover music .

 the Dhwani Academy of Percussion Music is mainly a percussion academy inclined to teach Tabla along with other Indian percussion instruments like Pakhwaj , Ghatam , etc. .
 Dhwani is in India and also in Los Angeles and New York .
 India academy was established in 2001 and Los Angeles academy was established in 2004 .

The production is a dance drama with Indian Dance and Balinese dancers .
The music is a unique fusion of balinese music and Indian Music .
 Balinese was in Bali as an Apex fellow from UCLA and interacted with Balinese musicians like Dewa Brata and Cudamani group .
 Balinese is a graduate in English literature and post graduate in Journalism .

Interview with Abhijit Banerjee published in Slovak magazine Novy Popular
Ginde was born in Belgaum , Karnataka .
 Ginde comes from a musical family and started Ginde musical training at the age of six .
 Ginde began playing the bansuri during worship of their family deity , Krishna , and later acquired advanced training under the guidance of Devendra Murdeshwar , disciple and friend of Pannalal Ghosh .
 Ginde has won awards and performed on All India Radio and Doordarshan for four decades .
 Ginde is credited with the designing of a new flute , which Ginde named Keshav Venu , which can produce 3.5 octaves as against the maximum of 2.5 octaves achieved by other flutists .
This special flute is 42 inches long and has been kept in the Archives of the Sangeet Natak Akademi in Delhi .
The flute has also been recognized by the Limca Book of Records as the only flute that can produce 3.5 octaves .
Ginde sir created Raga AnandSagar .
 And Raga AnandSagar disciple Azaruddin developed flute which can be played in the Laraj saptak his disciple Azaruddin named This special flute as Anahat Venu
Adil Hussaini trained under legendary singer , Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan .
 Adil Hussain , apart from Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan , performed with classical music maestros like Pandit Shiv Kumar Sharma , Hari Prasad Chaurasia Taufiq Qureshi , Ustad Sultan khan , Louise Banks , Sonu Nigam & Shaan , Talat Aziz , Jagjit Singh , Sonu Nigam & Shaan etc. .
 Adil Hussaini performed at South Asia Inter-fath Harmony Conclave held in New Delhi in April 2007
Allauddin Khan was a Bengali sarodiya and multi-instrumentalist , composer and one of the most renowned music teachers of the 20th century in Indian classical music .
In 1935 , he toured Europe , along with Uday Shankar s ballet troupe , and later also worked at his institute , Uday Shankar India Culture Centre at Almora for a while .
During his lifetime , he composed several ragas and laid the foundation of a modern Maihar gharana .
Amongst his recordings which are rare , the most important ones are those he recorded with the All India Radio in 1959-60 .
He was the father of sarod maestro Ali Akbar Khan and Annapurna Devi , and the uncle of Raja Hossain Khan , as well as the guru of Ravi Shankar , Nikhil Banerjee , Vasant Rai , Pannalal Ghosh , Bahadur Khan , Sharan Rani , Jyotin Bhattacharya and other influential musicians .
 He himself was a disciple of many great musicians , including Gopal Chandra Banerjee , Lobo , a bandmaster from Goa , Munne Khan , and most importantly after a lot of struggle managed to become a shagird of the legendary Veena player , Wazir Khan of Rampur .
 He was awarded the Padma Vibhushan , Indias second highest civilian honour in 1971 , and prior to that in 1954 , the Sangeet Natak Akademi awarded him with Indias second highest civilian honour highest honour , the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship for lifetime contribution to Indian music .
Allauddin Khan was born in Shibpur village in Brahmanbaria District , the son of Sabdar Hossain Khan , also known as Sadhu Khan .
Allauddins elder brother , Fakir Aftabuddin , first taught him the basics of music at home .
 At the age of ten , Allauddin himself ran away from home to join a jatra band , a traditional Bengali form of theater .
 This experience exposed Allauddin himself to the rich folk tradition of Bengal .
 After some time , Allauddin himself went to Kolkata , and was accepted as a student by singer Gopal Krishna Bhattacharya , alias Nulo Gopal .
 Allauddin himself committed to a 12-year practice program ; However , Nulo Gopal died of plague after the seventh year .
Khan then became a disciple of Amritalal Dutt , a close relative of Swami Vivekananda and music director at Kolkatas Star Theatre , with the goal of becoming an instrumentalist .
 At this time , he also took lessons in European classical violin from Lobo , a bandmaster from Goa , a bandmaster from Goa .
Khan got interested in sarod after a concert at Jagat Kishore Acharyas , zamindar of Muktagachha , where he listened to Ahmed Ali Khan , a student of Asghar Ali Khan .
 Alauddin became Alauddin student , and studied the sarod under Alauddin for five years .
 Alauddin next step was to go to Rampur for lessons from Wazir Khan Beenkar , court musician of the Nawab there , and one of the last direct descendants of the legendary Tansen .
 Through Alauddin , Alauddin was given access to the Senia gharana .
 Alauddin later became the court musician of Brijnath Singh Maharaja of Maihar Estate in Central Province .
 During Alauddin time as a court musician , Khan completely reshaped the Maihar gharana of Indian classical music .
 The Maihar gharana was established in the 19th Century , but Khans contribution was so fundamental that Khans contribution is often thought to be its creator .
This was a period of rapid change for Hindustani instrumental music , thanks not least to Khan , who infused the beenbaj and dhrupad ang , previously known from the been , surbahar and sur-sringar , into the playing of many classical instruments .
 For though Hindustani gave concerts on the sarod , Allauddin himself played many instruments , something that shaped Hindustani pedagogy .
 Hindustani put together an orchestra with Indian instruments , the String Band now known as Maihar Band , and while Hindustani son , Ali Akbar Khan , was taught the sarod , his daughter Annapurna Devi learned the surbahar , students such as Ravi Shankar and Nikhil Banerjee played the Sitar , Jyotin Bhattacharya played the sarod , Rabin Ghosh played on violin and Baijnath Singh and Pannalal Ghosh the bansuri bamboo flute .
Baijnath Singh was first and Vasant Rai was Allauddin Khans last student .
 Of course Ravi Shankar and Ali Akbar Khan were to be very famous and spread this gharana over the world - something that Allauddin Ravi Shankar had started when , in 1935-1936 , he went on an international tour with Uday Shankar s dance troupe .
 Allauddin himself stayed at Maihar Estate from 1918 to Allauddin himself death .
 In 1955 , Allauddin himself established a Maihar College of Music .
 Allauddin himself was given the Sangeet Natak Academy Award in 1952 , and the Padma Bhushan and Padma Vibhushan - Indias third and second highest civilian decorations - in 1958 and 1971 , respectively .
Anecdotes about Khan range from throwing a Tabla tuning hammer at the Maharaja himself to taking care of disabled beggars .
A few years before the turn of the century , he married Madanmanjari Devi .
He had one son and sarod heir , Ali Akbar Khan , and three daughters , Sharija , Jehanara and Annapurna who grew up as Roshanara Khan .
 Sharija died an early death suffering from diseases in Sharija childhood and when Jahanara got married and a jealous mother-in-law burnt her Tanpura , a shocked Alauddin Khan decided not to train Jahanara only remaining daughter .
 One day , however , Jahanara came home to discover Annapurna who grew up as Roshanara Khan teaching Sharija brother Ali Akbar Khan , and Sharija talent made the emotional father change his mind .
 Annapurna who grew up as Roshanara Khan learned classical vocal music , the Sitar , and Surbahar from Surbahar father .
 Surbahar later married and divorced Ravi Shankar .
 Khan was fond of sankeerna ragas , and created many ragas of his own , including Arjun , Bhagabati , Bhim , Bhuvaneshvari , Chandika , Dhabalashri , Dhankosh , Dipika , Durgeshvari , Gandhi , Gandhi Bilawal , Haimanti , Hem-Behag , Hemant Bhairav , Hemant Bhairav , Imni Manjh , Jaunpuri Todi , Kedar Manjh , Komal Bhimpalasi , Komal Marwa , Madanmanjari , Madhabsri , Madhavgiri , Malaya , Manjh Khamaj , Meghbahar , Muhammed , Nat-Khamaj , Prabhakali , Raj Bijoy , Rajeshri , Shobhavati , Subhabati , Sugandha and Surasati .
Many of these have not become common Maihar repertoire ; Manjh Khamaj is perhaps the best known .
Some of Allauddins recordings have been released on CD , on the Great Garanas : Maihar compilation in RPG / EMI s Chairmans Choice series
Devaki Pandit is an Indian playback singer .
 Devaki Pandit is also a trained classical singer .
Devaki Pandit was born in Maharashtra , India to Usha Pandit .
 Devaki Pandit was introduced to music at the age of two , and is a third generation musician from the Devaki Pandit household .
 Devaki Pandit received Devaki Pandit initial music training from Devaki Pandit mother Usha Pandit .
 Devaki Pandit trained under Vasantrao Kulkarni for 10 years , Jitendra Abhisheki for twelve years and from Kishori Amonkar for four years .
 Since 2003 , Devaki Pandit is training under Babanrao Haldankar .
 Devaki Pandit gave Devaki Pandit to Devaki Pandit first stage performance at age nine .
 In 1977 , at the age of twelve Devaki Pandit recorded Devaki Pandit first song - a balgeet for Polydor Records .
 In 1986 , Devaki Pandit recorded Devaki Pandit first playback song for the Ardhangi which went on to win Devaki Pandit the Maharashtra State Award for Best Female Playback Singer .
 Devaki Pandit is well known for Devaki Pandit several Zee Marathi serial title songs especially Abhalmaya of Zee Marathi .
 Besides Zee Marathi , Devaki Pandit has also sung songs in Hindi .
 Devaki Pandit recently judged the multi episode vocal talent show Sa Re Ga Ma Pa on Zee Marathi and was known to the public for Devaki Pandit accurate judgement and excellent guidance .
 In Spandan Devaki Pandit has given Devaki Pandit voice to the songs Chal chaal chaal tu bala and Ya Jagnyacha .
The song Chal chaal chaal tu bala features more than 50 cerebral palsy kids .
Devaki Pandit composed Shreeramraksha Stotram , Aradhana Mahakali & Ganaadheesh .
 Devaki Pandit sung the Ram Raksha Stotra in 32 different Hindustani Classical Raagas
 His Adana is an Indian raga .
 It is also called His Adana raga Darbari Kanada .
 It is often sang or played in drut laya after a vilambit composition in raga Darbari Kanada , as His Adana is straighter than Darbari in His Adana chalan , thus allowing faster passages .
 The flow of this raga is similar to a mix of Madhyamad Saranga with Darbari in its chalan .
Another common vivadi some artists use sparingly is shuddha ni which enhances the Saranga mood of the raga .
 Flat Ga is usually omitted in ascent and in descent always appears in the distinctive raga Darbari Kanada phrase g M R S. Flat Dha is present in descent , but one should never linger on it .
In fact it is omitted by some musicians completely .
Most movements are in the upper tetrachord , around high Sa .
It is very common to begin the elaboration of this raga with high Sa .
 His Adana was a major raga in the 17th century and a combination of the then current ragas Malhar and raga Darbari Kanada .
 In a ragamala from Mewar a ragamala from Mewar is depicted as an ascetic man sitting on a tiger skin , however , Somanatha describes Mewar as Kama the god of love .
 Mewar Adana was quite different from the raga as a ragamala from Mewar is performed today
Sham Chaurasia gharana is a gharana in Hindustani classical music , known for the singing of vocal duets , most notably represented in modern times by the brothers Salamat Ali Khan and Nazakat Ali Khan .
The gharana is centered at a village of the same name in the Hoshiarpur district of Punjab ; variant spellings include Shamchurasi etc. .
The gharana is believed to have been founded in the 16th century by .
Mian Chand Khan and Mian Suraj Khan who were contemporaries of Mian Tansen at the court of Mughal emperor Akbar .
Successive generations of musicians in the gharana specialised in the dhrupad form of .
singing and evolved a tradition of duet vocal jugalbandi performances .
 Mian Karim Bukhsh Majzoob , Ustad Ahmed Ali Khan , Ustad Ahmed Ali Khan .
Niaz Hussain Shami , and Ustad Vilayat Ali Khan were .
some of the illustrious members of the Sham Chaurasi gharana .
The township of Sham Chaurasia was named after a cluster of 84 villages which constituted a land revenue unit in the time of Ranjit Singh .
 According to one legend , the founders were given a parcel of land here as a grant to them by Mughal emperor Akbar .
Around the turn of the century , the gharana was represented by Ustad Vilayat Ali Khan , who was noted for his dhrupad singing .
 His sons , Nazakat and Salamat Ali Khan , were to become particularly well known for Nazakat duet singing .
Some of the most memorable classical music of modern times have been sung by the brothers Ustad Nazakat Ali Khan and Salamat Ali Khan .
 Salamat Ali Khan showed an early genius for music , and apparently they performed on radio in 1942 , when Salamat Ali Khan was only 8 .
 At the age of 11 Salamat Ali Khan travelled with Nazakat to Amritsar for a memorable concert : .
After the partition , the family moved to Lahore and emerged as one of the leading performers of Classical music in Pakistan .
Hameed Naseem of Radio Pakistan once remarked about them : Tansen issi tarah gata ho ga !

A number of their recordings exist from their very fruitful partnership .
 Subsequently , they broke up , and Nazakat was to die shortly , but Salamat Ali Khan continued singing along with Salamat Ali Khan sons .
Sharafat Ali Khan and Shafqat Ali Khan , who continue the Sham Chaurasia tradition today
Saadat Awan is a Washington DC native , by way of Pakistan and Afghanistan .
 a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G is a member of The Cassettes , Metropolitan band , and Thievery Corporation side projects International Velvet and I.C.U. .
 a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G was also a former member of Travis Morrison Hellfighters , and has also worked with Lori Carson , These United States , Nima Majd and others in the past .
 a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G is a self-taught drummer , bassist , guitarist , keyboardist , and tabla player .
 a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G has been exploring a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G roots in a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G work with The Cassettes , as well as in Metropolitan band .
 a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G sings in Urdu on a The Cassettes song entitled Muja Achi Larki Daydo , as well as on Metropolitan band s Pakistan International , a song about a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G trips to , and experiences in , Pakistan with a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G family , during his childhood .
 Recently a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G recorded with The Torches who feature Stephen Guidry from The Cassettes on Banjo and Vocals .
And has been back in the studio to record for a future project with Shelby Cinca , also from The Cassettes , and Nick Kraly .
The Band is also scheduled to go back into the studio in the Fall of 2011 for their fifth effort .
Saadat Awan is also a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G .
In 2009 , The U.S. Department of Bhangra began as a way to help charities and non-profits in DC gain exposure and have fun while raising funds for good causes .
The USDB has grown to become one of Washington DCs premiere Bhangra parties , receiving some rave reviews in The Washington Post , Washingtonian Magazine , and other media and blogs .
 a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G , as Beta-G , has also been featured on a track by fellow Washington DC DJ collective Fort Knox Five called Bhangra Paanch on which a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G provides Vocals in a Bhangra DJ with the alias : Beta-G native Punjabi
Ustad Barkat Ali Khan was an Indian classical singer , younger brother of Bade Ghulam Ali Khan and elder brother of Mubarak Ali Khan , and belonging to the Patiala gharana .
Barkat Ali Khan was born in Kasur , then in the Punjab province in British India .
 Ustad Barkat Ali Khan had Ustad Barkat Ali Khan initial training from Ustad Barkat Ali Khan father Ali Baksh Khan and later by Bade Ghulam Ali Khan .
After partition , Barkat Ali Khan migrated to Pakistan and concentrated on the lighter aspects of Hindustani classical .
 Ustad Barkat Ali Khan was acknowledged as one of the great exponents of Thumri , Dadra , Geet and Ghazal , and was well known for both Purab and Punjab ang Thumris .
 Many still consider Many a superior thumri singer than Many elder brother , though Many didnt receive acknowledgement to the extent Bade Ghulam Ali Khan did .
 Many taught noted ghazal singer Ghulam Ali
Baiju Bawra or Baijnath Prasad or Baijnath Mishra was an Indian dhrupad singer .
 Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film was the court musician of Raja Mansingh Tomar of Gwalher , now Gwalior , along with Nayak Charju , Bakshu , Tansen and others .
Much of the information on Baiju Bawra is legendary and not historically verifiable .
 Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film was born in Chanderi on Sharad Purnima in the month of Ashwini in 1599 according to Vikram Samvat calendar .
 Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film was called Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film because Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film was insanely in love with Kalavati dancer in Chanderi .
 kind-hearted Baiju learnt Dhrupad music by Guru HariDas Goswami in Vrindavan .
 Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film was a musician at the court of the Raja of Chanderi .
 Later , Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film became a musician at the court of Raja Mansingh of Gwalher .
 Sultan Bahadur Shah of Gujarat had also patronized kind-hearted Baiju .
 Like Tansen , the musician at the court of Mughal Emperor Akbar , Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film was a disciple of Swami Haridas .
 According to historical books preserved in Jai Vilas Mahal in Gwalior , Jai Vilas Mahal in Gwalior would light oil lamps by singing Raga Deepak , make Gwalior rain by singing the ragas raga Charju ki Malhar , Megh Malhar , or Gaud Malhar , and bloom flowers by singing raga Bahar as well as melting of stone by singing raga malkauns .
 Besides Tansen , renowned singers , Baba Ram Das , who composed raga Ramdasi Malhar , and Nayak Charju , who composed raga Charju ki raga Charju ki Malhar , were kind-hearted Baiju contemporaries .
 Historian Abul Fazal at Emperor Akbar s court and historian Faqirullah at Emperor Aurangzeb s court have written that kind-hearted Baiju defeated Tansen in a singing competition at the court of Akbar .
 Tansen then touched kind-hearted Baiju feet and asked for his own life .
 In response , kind-hearted Baiju went back to Gwalior .
 kind-hearted Baiju died of typhoid at the age of 71 on the eve of the Indian festival , Basant Panchami in Vikram Samvat 1670 in chanderi .
 Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film was made on Baiju Bawra , a Hindi - language film in 1952 .
 In the movie , kind-hearted Baiju is a musician who believes that Tansen is responsible for his fathers death .
