 kind-hearted Baiju attempts to avenge kind-hearted Baiju fathers death by challenging Tansen to a musical duel and is successful in defeating kind-hearted Baiju .
 This films story is completely different from kind-hearted Baiju real life , but still became a huge commercial success , especially due to the songs like O Duniya Ke Rakhwale sung by the legendary singer Mohammed Rafi
Geet Ramayan is a collection of 56 Marathi language songs chronologically describing events from the Indian Hindu epic , the Ramayana .
It was broadcast by All India Radio , Pune in 1955-1956 , four years before television was introduced in India .
 Written by G. D. Madgulkar and the songs being composed by Sudhir Phadke , Geet Ramayan was acclaimed for writer G. D. Madgulkar lyrics , music and singing .
 It is considered a milestone of Marathi light music and the most popular Marathi version of the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana .
 The team of writer G. D. Madgulkar and Musical director Sudhir Phadke presented a new song every week for a year with every song being aired first on a Friday morning and then again on Saturday and Sunday a Friday morning , between 8:45 AM and 9:00 AM IST .
The programs first song Kusa Lava Ramayan Gati was aired on 1 April 1955 .
 Though Geet Ramayan is based on sage Valmiki s epic the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana , writer G. D. Madgulkar chose a different narrative format and was praised for the lyrics , and was called Adhunik Valmiki .
The Geet Ramayan is considered as the crescendo of Madgulkars literary vigour .
 Musical director Sudhir Phadke mainly used ragas of Hindustani classical music to compose the songs .
 Musical director Sudhir Phadke also selected the raga and the Tala of a song to suit the time of the incident and the narrative mood .
 The poet and composer were praised for The poet and composer contribution to the series .
 The series showcased a total of 32 various characters from the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana .
 Rama being the lead character of the series was given maximum number of songs , followed by eight songs for the loss Sita .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar expressed The poet and composer various moods , ranging from The poet and composer divinity to the human weaknesses .
 Incidentally , the central antagonist of the the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana and Geet Ramayan , the demon-king Ravana , was not given any song .
 The series is narrated by Kusha and Lava , twin sons of Rama and the loss Sita , and the writer of the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana was also given one song in the series .
With increasing popularity since its release , Geet Ramayan has been translated into nine other languages : five Hindi translations and one each in Bengali , English , Gujarati , Kannada , Konkani , Sanskrit , Sindhi and Telugu .
It has also been transliterated into Braille .
Geet Ramayan was conceptualized in 1955 , four years before the introduction of television in India in 1959 .
 During the early days of All India Radio , Pune , station director Sitakant Lad wanted to begin a radio programme which would be entertaining and provide moral education .
 station director Sitakant Lad hence outlined station director Sitakant Lad plan to poet and writer G. D. Madgulkar .
Since the Ramayana is an Indian epic , Lad and Madgulkar came up with an idea of a version in singable verse .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar accepted the challenge , enlisting station director Sitakant Lad music-director friend Sudhir Phadke for the collaboration .
 The team of writer G. D. Madgulkar and Musical director Sudhir Phadke would present a new song every week for a year .
 Every song would be aired first on a Friday morning and then again on Saturday and Sunday a Friday morning , between 8:45 am and 9:00 am IST .
The programme was initially planned for a year , but 1955 in the Hindu calendar had an extra month ; therefore , four songs were added to extend the series to a total of fifty-six .
 Apart from the number of songs , writer G. D. Madgulkar and Musical director Sudhir Phadke left music , lyrics and choice of singers ad libitum .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar was given artistic liberty for the choice of the meters for the song , execution of the story line , and the message Musical director Sudhir Phadke could convey through it .
Initially , the programme was scheduled to begin on the occasion of Gudi Padwa , beginning of the New year according to the lunisolar Hindu calendar but later finalized to be Rama Navami , traditional birthday of Rama .
The programs first song Kusa Lava Ramayan Gati was aired on 1 April 1955 at 8:45 am IST .
 Vidya Madgulkar , the poets wife , recalled in an interview that writer G. D. Madgulkar wrote the first song and gave it to Musical director Sudhir Phadke the day before the recording ; however , Musical director Sudhir Phadke lost the lyrics .
 With the broadcast already scheduled , station director Sitakant Lad requested writer G. D. Madgulkar to re-write the song which was readily declined by an angered poet .
 Lad then decided to lock the poet in one of recording rooms equipped with all the required writing material and agreed to unlock the door only when writer G. D. Madgulkar is ready with the lyrics .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar then rewrote the lyrics from memory in fifteen minutes so Musical director Sudhir Phadke could compose the music .
 Though Adhunik Valmiki was the main inspiration for the Geet Ramayan , writer G. D. Madgulkar chose a different narrative format .
 Adhunik Valmiki used a simple lyrical format with a flexible number of stanzas .
The metre used was similar to Bhavageete , with roughly the same number of matras in each line .
The metre was also suited to the narration and the characters who sang the song .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar used various formats , including narrative , descriptive and communal songs .
 Bhavageete was praised for Bhavageete lyrics , and was called Adhunik Valmiki ; and the Geet Ramayan is considered the crescendo of Madgulkars literary vigour .
 Madgulkars narrative format was different than that of Valmikis where Bhavageete did not end the series with the coronation of Rama and the loss Sita , but included Sitas abandonment by Rama , and her giving birth to the twins , Lava and Kusha .
 However , Bhavageete chose not to include the last episode of Sitas final confrontation in Ramas court and Ramas entering the earth .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar ended the series with the song Ga Balano , Shriramayan which was voiced by Adhunik Valmiki where Adhunik Valmiki tells Adhunik Valmiki disciples , Lava and Kusha , how his disciples , Lava and Kusha should recite the Ramayana in front of Rama .
 Evidently , this also completes the cycle of songs where it had begun , with Lava and Kusha singing in Ramas court .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar did not make any attempt to provide new interpretation or meaning to the Ramayana but told the same story in the simpler and poetic format .
 With inclusion of characters like Ahalya and Shabari , Ahalya included the sentiments of religious devotion and also gave divine touch to the story while describing the marriage of the loss Sita and Rama as a union of Maya and Brahman .
 Ahalya composed songs on all seven chapters or Kanda of the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana .
Out of 56 songs , poet composed twelve songs on Balakanda , seven on Ayodhya Kanda , fourteen on Aranya Kanda , three on Kishkindha Kanda , four on Sundara Kanda , twelve on Yuddha Kanda and three on Uttara Kanda .
 As the series became popular , the daily newspapers in Pune began to print the text of the new song every week after its first airing .
The first official edition of the text of these fifty-six poems and their prose narrations came out on the occasion of Vijayadashami , October 3 , 1957 , published for Akashwani by the director of the Publications Division , Delhi , in pocketbook size .
 Musical director Sudhir Phadke composed the songs based on the ragas of Hindu classical music , including Bhopali , Bhimpalasi and Madhuvanti .
The raga and Tala of a song was selected to suit the time of the incident and the narrative mood .
For example , the song Cala Raghava Cala is composed as a Bibhas raga , and the song describes an event taking place in the morning .
The songs Aj Mi Sapmucta Jahale and Yacka , Thambu Nako Darata are not based on a specific raga , but include several ragas in each song .
The singers , which included Vasantrao Deshpande , Manik Varma , Suresh Haldankar , Ram Phatak and Lata Mangeshkar , were familiar with the vocal style of Indian classical music .
 Musical director Sudhir Phadke voiced all the songs for Rama , and well-known Kirana gharana singer Manik Varma voiced the character of the loss Sita .
 Lata Mangeshkar sang one song for the loss Sita , Maj Sang Laksmana , in which the loss Sita questions Rama about Lata Mangeshkar abandonment but Lata Mangeshkar question remains unanswered .
A total of 32 characters from the Ramayana were voiced in the Geet Ramayan .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar expressed the emotions of characters such as Rama , the loss Sita , Hanuman - the monkey god and devotee of Rama - and Lakshmana ; Hanuman also attempted to give voice to the humblest characters in the epic .
The vanara are given a song describing a bridge forming over the ocean so Rama and his army could cross to Lanka .
The poet noted that the song described the sacrifice of joint labour and was an example of the principle , Union is strength .
Nishadraj Guha and the boatmen who helped Rama in crossing the Ganges river expressed themselves in Nakos Nauke Parat Phiru .
 The author of the Ramayana , Adhunik Valmiki , was also given a song with The author of the Ramayana advice to Ramas sons Kusha and Lava before Kusha appear before Ramas .
 Being hero of the the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana and Geet Ramayan , writer G. D. Madgulkar expressed the varied moods of Ramas ; he was the most-voiced character in the Geet Ramayan with ten songs , followed by Sita with eight .
 He portrayed Ramas as a complex character full of emotions and passions , with some of the questionable deeds , yet bound by a traditional virtue and the sanctity of a promise .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar voiced Ramas personal ethical dilemmas along with his courage , and steadfastness .
He was shown to be patient with his brothers and mothers , obedient of father and sages , heroic on the battlefield , and diplomatic when dealing with the monkey king , Vali .
 writer G. D. Madgulkar is said to have successfully shown Ramas divinity alongside his human weaknesses .
 He was shown to be distracted at the loss the loss Sita , and wailed in Lakshmana presence .
 In another situation , he uttered some heart-wrenching words to the loss Sita , in front of his army with blaming Lakshmana for all the happenings , and then he was also shown to explain his behavior with oaths and confessions of loyalty to the loss Sita .
 Ramas mother , Kausalya , sang three on Kishkindha Kanda songs ; Bharata brother Bharata , Bharata father Dasharatha , Hanuman , Lakshmana , the demon Surpanakha , Ramas guru-sage Vishvamitra and Kusha-Lava have two songs each .
 The central antagonist of the Ramayana , the demon-king Ravana , was not given a song ; his oppressive presence was expressed in prose narration , poetic descriptions and songs sung by the other characters .
After Geet Ramayans original broadcast was over in March of 1956 , requests of re-broadcast were flooding the radio station .
All-India Radio repeated the entire series of fifty-six weekly songs due to popular demand .
 After the broadcast , Musical director Sudhir Phadke produced public concerts of selected songs .
The first public performance was held in the Madgulkars bungalow , Panchavati at Wakdewadi , Pune on 28 May 1958 .
In 1979 , a Silver Jubilee celebration of the programme took place at the New English School in Pune for eight nights .
 Atal Bihari Vajpayee , the then Minister of External Affairs , attended the show as the guest of honour along with the then Deputy Prime Minister of India Yashwantrao Chavan , Bollywood film director Basu Bhattacharya , actor Dada Kondke , and celebrated classical singers such as Bhimsen Joshi and Kishori Amonkar .
 Atal Bihari Vajpayee also attended the Golden Jubilee celebration with Sharad Pawar and Bal Thackeray .
National Award-winning art director Nitin Chandrakant Desai designed the stage depicting scenes from the Ramayana .
The event featured all the songs from the original Geet Ramayan now vocalized by Shridhar Phadke , Suresh Wadkar , Upendra Bhat , Padmaja Phenany Joglekar and others .
 As the radio programme became popular , daily newspapers in Pune began printing the lyrics of the new songs each week .
The publication department of All India Radio also compiled the lyrics and excerpts from the introductory comments in a book form .
 The 179-page volume , then priced at 2 , was launched on 3 October 1957 on the occasion of Vijayadashami .
In 1965 , the HMV released ten LPs featuring the voice of Sudhir Phadke .
In 1968 , the Gramophone Company of India released a 10 - cassette set , again featuring Phadkes voice , and 50,000 records were sold .
Madgulkars son , Anand , produced a televised version showcasing twenty-eight episodes of the Geet Ramayan on Zee Marathi ; however , it received a lukewarm response .
 Anand has also written a book , Geet Ramayanache Ramayan , describing the making of the radio programme .
Live shows of Geet Ramayan are still produced on occasion of Rama Navami .
 Geet Ramayan has been translated into nine other languages and also transliterated into Braille .
The translations are :
Swaralipi is any system used in sheet music in order to represent aurally perceived music through the use of written for Indian classical music .
 The Indian scholar and musical theorist Pingala , in The Indian scholar Chanda Sutra , used marks indicating long and short syllables to indicate meters in Sanskrit poetry .
In the notation of Indian raga , a solfege-like system called sargam is used .
As in Western solfege , there are names for the seven basic pitches of a major scale .
The tonic of any scale is named Sa , and the dominant Pa. .
 Sa is fixed in any scale , and Pa is fixed at a fifth above Pa .
These two notes are known as achala swar .
 Each of the other five notes , Re , Ga , ma , Dha and Ni , can take a regular pitch , which is equivalent to Re pitch in a standard major scale , or an altered pitch , either a half-step above or half-step below the shuddha pitch .
 Re , Ga , Dha and Ni all have altered partners that are a half-step lower .
Ma has an altered partner that is a half-step higher .
 Re , Ga , ma , Dha and Ni are called vikrut swar .
 In the written system of Indian notation devised by Ravi Shankar , the pitches are represented by Western letters .
Capital letters are used for the achala swar , and for the higher variety of all the vikrut swar .
Lowercase letters are used for the lower variety of the vikrut swar
Szalai Peter is a Hungarian tabla player musician .
Peter Szalai plays North-Indian classical music and is one of the best west-born tabla musicians of our time .
 In Peter Szalai childhood Peter Szalai played the piano , and as stepson of Gyorgy Petri at the age of 16 on the advice of a family-friend Gyorgy Kurtag , he chose the Indian tabla drum pair as his instrument .
 The tabla is also a curiosity even among other Indian percussion instruments : the Indian tabla can be tuned to a specific pitch .
The many layers of skin and the special finger technique ensures a distinctive polyrhythmical sound .
 Because of all this the tabla does not only fill the role of a rhythmical instrument , but the Indian tabla also has a rich tone and musicality .
In the beginning Peter Szalai was the student of the magnificent Anthony Dass between 1982 and 1984 in both Budapest and India .
 In 1979/80 Peter Szalai tried Peter Szalai in two formations , the Creative Studio Five led by Zoltan Krulik and the Dimension led by Laszlo Des .
 Since 1980 Peter Szalai works together with the Indian classical music-playing Calcutta Trio and the Makam formation .
 In 1987 Peter Szalai played as a guest performer at the Jazz Jamboree in Warsaw with the S. Kulpowicz International Band on tabla and on other percussion instruments .
 In 1988 , during a longer Western-European tour and recording , Western-European played alongside Albert Mangelsdorf , W. Dauner and the Family of Percussion .
 The world-famous tabla master , Ustad Alla Rakha invited Peter Szalai to be Peter Szalai student .
 Upon Ustad Alla Rakha effect Ustad Alla Rakha still strictly follows the traditions of the Punjab gharana .
 Parallel to this , Ustad Alla Rakha also developed a special master-student bond with Pandit Ravi Shankar , who Ustad Alla Rakha considers Ustad Alla Rakha guru not only in the field of Indian classical music .
Beside being a frequent guest of several Indian music festivals , he has intensive and lasting connections with his masters sons - Ustad Zakir Hussain , Fazal Qureshi and Taufiq Qureshi - even after the death of Ustad Alla Rakha in 2000 .
 As the member of the Calcutta Trio the member of the Calcutta Trio plays classical Indian music since 1980 to this very day .
The club of the formation is still functioning and meets monthly at the Marczibanyi Square Cultural Centre .
 Besides being the member of the Calcutta Trio , the member of the Calcutta Trio gave many thousands of concerts since 1980 .
 Many prominent Indian musicians chose the member of the Calcutta Trio as partner in Europe since the beginning of the 90s : Pr .
Debu Choudury , Nandkishor Muley , Gaurav Mazumdar , Shubhendra Rao Ustad Ikhlaq Hussain Khan and Debasish Ganguly .
 In 1992 , while still playing in a duo , Debu Choudury founded the Tin Tin with Szabolcs Szoke .
 Since 1994 Debu Choudury is the member of the Tin Tin Quartet and after a small hiatus Debu Choudury returned to the formation in 1997 which was at that time called the Tin Tin the Miklos Lukacs Quintet .
 In 2000 Debu Choudury contributed together with violinist Zoltan Lantos , jazz guitarist Gabor Juhasz and Debu Choudury own student Ivan Nyusztay to the establishment of the Samsara Quartet .
In 2002 the group also published a record .
 At present Debu Choudury is still a wanted musician for different jazz , etno and fusion productions .
 Since 2003 and 2006 Debu Choudury plays in such multi-faceted formations like Mitsoura , the Miklos Lukacs Quintet , the M. Trio and the Rubai Trio , etc. .
 As a guest performer he played at the concerts of Bea Palya , the Dresch Quartet , Bea Palya , Agi Szaloki , etc. .
He participated in the production of many records like Peter Ogi , Palle Mikkelborg , Djabe , Tibor Szemzo , etc. .
He considers teaching at RIMPA an important part of his work .
He was invited by Zoltan Racz to the Music Academy where he teaches classical Indian music theory for classical and jazz music students since 2009 .
In 2010 he organised the Spirit and Sound and String and Spirit performer nights with such musicians like Bea Palya , Agi Szaloki , Miklos Lukacs , Kalman Balogh , Rozsa Farkas , and the Miklos Lukacs Quintet .
A biographical documentary shortfilm made in 2011 about Peter Szalai title : Without Sheet Music .
And a portrait film made in 2013 about him title : Angel in the details
Ganapati Bhat is an Indian Hindustani classical vocalist .
 Ganapati Bhat lives and works in Hasanagi , a small village in the state of Karnataka in India .
Ganapati Bhat became interested in Hindustani classical music at a young age .
 Ganapati Bhat is a disciple of Basavaraj Rajguru , the maestro from Dharwad whose gayaki is based on the Kirana , the Gwalior and the Patiala gharanas .
 Ganapati Bhat started Ganapati Bhat training in music as a sitarist , but was drawn into Hindustani vocal music .
 Ganapati Bhat studied with C. R. Vyas and now trains young musicians in a Gurukula style setting in Hasanagi .
 Ganapati Bhat has performed in all the major Hindustani forums in India and abroad .
 Ganapati Bhat third tour to the United States of America , starts in May 2008 .
 In Ganapati Bhat last two trips to the US , Ganapati Bhat had concerts at Boston , Chicago , Dallas , Philadelphia , Pittsburgh , New York , San Francisco , Washington etc
Rambhau Kundgolkar , popularly known as Pandit Sawai Gandharva , was a popular Hindustani Classical vocalist and Marathi stage actor of the Kirana Gharana .
 Rambhau Kundgolkar was the first and foremost disciple of Utd .
Abdul Karim Khan and guru of Bharat Ratna laureate Pt .
Bhimsen Joshi .
Pt .
 Gandharva is most well known for popularizing the stylings of the Kirana Gharana through Pandit Bhimsen Joshi accomplished disciples , including Pt .
Bhimsen Joshi , Dr. Gangubai Hangal , Firoz Dastur , and Pt .
Basavaraj Rajguru .
Born Ramchandra Kundgolkar on January 19 , 1886 , in Kundgol , 19 km .
from Dharwad , Karnataka , he grew to be known as Rambhau .
His father , Ganesh Saunshi , was a local clerk employed by Ranganagowda Nadiger , a landlord .
Early on , Pt .
 Gandharva did not show interest in academics but progressed in school through the admiration Ganesh Saunshi teachers had for how sweetly Ganesh Saunshi sang poems .
 Later , Ganesh Saunshi was admitted to Lamington High School in Hubli which Ganesh Saunshi would travel to everyday by train .
Pt .
 Gandharvas father found Pt increasingly difficult to fund Gandharvas father sons education and eventually Gandharvas father schooling stopped .
 After discontinuing Gandharvas father education , Pt .
 Gandharvas father put Gandharvas father under the tutelage of Balwantrao Kolhatkar who found Gandharvas father in Kundgol .
From Kolhatkar , Pt .
Gandharva learned 75 Dhrupad compositions , 25 Tarana compositions , a hundred other compositions and also mastered a few Taals .
Kolhatkar died in 1898 , leaving Pt .
Gandharvas tutelage incomplete and without guidance .
 In traveling to high school everyday to Hubli , Pt .
 Gandharva would actively participate in the daily cultural events in Hubli , where Gandharvas spent Gandharvas time watching Nataks and listening to music .
 Once , Gandharvas found Gandharvas listening to a young Utd .
Abdul Karim Khan and was immediately captivated .
From then onwards , Pt .
Gandharva wished for the Ustads tutelage .
After Balwantrao Kolhatkars passing , Utd .
Abdul Karim Khan began touring Karnataka , where he often stayed with the Nadiger family , Pt .
Gandharvas fathers employer , whom Pt .
Gandharva was staying with .
It was a time when Ustad Abdul Karim Khan , the founder of Kirana Gharana , was touring Karnataka .
He would often stay with the Nadigers for days on end .
On such a trip , Ramchandra hovered around Abdul Karim Khan , humming jamunaa ke teer , the Ustad 's Bhairavi cheez .
It caught Abdul Karim Khan 's ear who asked , Kaun hai yeh ladkaa ?
Galaa achchaa hai .
 Rangangowda Nadiger pounced upon this opportunity : Ustadji , Rangangowda Nadiger is our clerk 's son .
 Rangangowda Nadiger wants to learn music from you .
Yeh baath hai tho chalo hamaare saath .
Fortune smiled on Ramchandra .
This was in 1901 .
Abdul Karim Khan did not want his name to be spoilt by disciples learning haphazardly .
He made a contract with them that they would learn from him for at least 8 years .
Rambhau did not complete his musical education .
 Against the wishes of his teacher , he joined a drama company and became popular as a singer in Marathi theatre .
 He received acclaimed for playing female roles , and also the title , Sawai Gandharva after , Bal Gandharva , the doyen of Marathi theatre .
He worked for Govindrao Tembe s Shivraj Natak Mandali for some time , becoming famous for playing female roles .
In 1942 , at the age of 56 , his concert career ended abruptly after he suffered a paralytic stroke .
Though he continued teaching , till the end of his life in 1952 .
 Although he became a well known classical vocalist , his most enduring legacy is that he trained great artists who would carry on the name of the Kirana Gharana , like Gangubai Hangal , Pandit Bhimsen Joshi , Basavaraj Rajguru and Pt .
Feroze Dastur .
 Pandit Bhimsen Joshi started the annual Sawai Gandharva Music Festival in Pune , in memory of Pandit Bhimsen Joshi guru Sawai Gandharva .
The festival was held on a modest scale for first two decades .
In 1970s and 1980s , its popularity skyrocketed
The Bhendibazaar gharana is one of the vocal gharanas of Indian classical music , which originated in Bhendi Bazaar area of Mumbai in 1890 .
The roots of bhendibazaar gharana lies in the much older Moradabad Gharana which is a complete Gharana both vocal and instrumental .
 The Bhendibazaar gharana was founded around 1890 by brothers Chhajju Khan , Nazir Khan and Khadim Hussain Khan in the Bhendi Bazaar bazaar area of Mumbai .
The features of this gharana include using aakaar for presenting khyals in an open voice , with clear intonation , a stress on breath-control , singing long passages in a single breath , a preference for madhyalaya and use of the well-known Khandmeru or Merukhand system for extended alaps .
Ustad Chhajju Khans son Ustad Aman Ali Khan , and Anjanibai Malpekar , are well-known exponents of this gharana .
 Amir Khan s father Shahmir Khan belonged to this gharana and passed on the tradition to Shahmir Khan son .
Ustad Chhajjoo Khan , Ustad Nazeer Khan , Ustad Khadim Hussain Khan .
Faiyyaz Khan ; Dr. Jyoti Dhamdhere ; Anupama Chandratreya .
Anupama Chandratreya ; Anuradha Kuber ; Anuradha Marathe ; Kishori Janorikar ; Kumudini Mundkur ; Sadhana Joshi ; Sharad Karmarkar ; .
Dr. Suhasini Koratkar ; Vasundhara Pandit ; Shrikant Padgaonkar ; Padmakar Kulkarni ; .
Neelatai Nagpurkar ; Upendra Kamat ; Mandakini Gadre ; Shubha Joshi ; Shaila Pipalpure ; Pramila Datar ; Madhura Jasraj ; .
Those disciples who took guidance from stalwarts of Bhendibazaar Gharana for some time but developed their own style and pursued Classical or Light Music or chose to work in Film industry : .
Shahmir Khan ; Chand Khan ; Kaderbaksh ; Mamman Khan ; Zande Khan ; Miyan Jaan ; Wadilal Shivram .
Lata Mangeshkar ; Nisar Bazmi ; Vasantrao Deshpande ; Manna Dey ; Wali Ahmed Khan ; B C Chaitanya Dev ; Shantilal ; Parshurambuwa Parsekar ; Mridungacharya Narayanrao Koli .
Kumar Gandharva ; Kishori Amonkar ; Begum Akhtar ; Nainadevi .
Asha Bhosle ; Jitendra Abhisheki ; Suman Kalyanpur ; Pankaj Udhas .
Sakuntala Narsimhan ; Devendra Murdeshwar ; Mahendra Kapoor
Jai Uttal is an American musician .
He is a Grammy nominated singer and `` a pioneer in the world music community with his eclectic East-meets-West sound . ''
He is a `` sacred music composer , recording artist , multi-instrumentalist , and ecstatic vocalist , combines influences from India with American rock and jazz to create a stimulating and exotic multicultural fusion that is truly world spirit music . ''

Uttal grew up in New York City and lived in a home filled with music : `` He began studying classical piano at the age of seven , and later learned to play old time banjo , harmonica , and guitar . ''
At the age of 17 , Uttal heard Indian music for the first time , which he said , `` touched his heart like sounds of home . ''
At 19 , Uttal moved to California and studied under the famous Sarod player , Ali Akbar Khan .
 He later began `` regular pilgrimages to India , living among the Bauls , the wandering street musicians of Bengal , and singing with the kirtan wallahs in the temple of his guru , the highly revered saint , Neem Karoli Baba . ''
Uttal spent time with many beings of both the Hindu and Buddhist traditions .
He became deeply absorbed in the practice of kirtan , the ancient yoga of chanting , or singing to God .
This form of prayer became the core to Uttal 's musical and spiritual life .
Uttal 's music is very popular in the yoga community , being described as `` very hypnotic . ''
One reviewer stated , `` He does a great job of explaining the purpose of chanting and kirtan . ''
`` The practice of calling to the divine creates a bridge between the individual and the eternal , opening the heart and welcoming the spirit . ''
Uttal says , `` These ancient chants contain a transformative power and healing energy .
By singing these prayers we join a stream of consciousness and devotion that has been flowing for centuries . ''
Uttal says , `` Music that creates bridges .
Music that unites hearts and cultures .
Music that brings peace . ''

Uttal has led kirtans around the world for more than 30 years .
In one biography it is said , `` Jai Uttal has cultivated a voice and musical styles that carries the listener into the heart of devotion , prayer , and healing , and to an ecstatic remembrance of the divine . ''

In 1991 Uttal released his debut album , Footprints , with Triloka Records , which featured `` world music innovator Don Cherry and Indian vocalist Lakshmi Shankar . ''
The album was in the top ten on the world music charts .
 In 1993 , Uttal released the Monkey .
The next year , in 1994 , Beggars and Saints was released , which was a `` tribute to the Bauls of Bangal . ''
 In addition to the new album , Uttal produced The two CD 's for his teacher , Ustad Ali Akbar .
Journey and Garden of Dreams became extremely popular in the Indian community .
Three years later , Shiva Station was released , which was mixed by innovative producer , Bill Laswell .
Shiva Station presented traditional chants in a totally new way .
The concerts united the temple and the nightclub , the sacred and the worldly ; emphasizing the underlying theme that spirituality and devotion can pervade all aspects of life .
Around this time the popularity of yoga was on the rise .
Uttal began to receive more requests to lead kirtan workshops and concerts all over the world .
Uttal released a live kirtan CD entitled Nectar to begin to chronicle these kirtan events .
 In 2000 , a compilation of his four Triloka Records albums appeared as Spirit Room .
 In February 2002 , Jai Uttal and the Pagan Love Orchestra released , on Narada Records , Mondo Rama , which means World is Mondo Rama or Everything is God .
The album has been called Uttals most personal expression to date .
`` Combining Brazilian influences , Hebrew prayers , Appalachian Blues , Beatles psychedelia , and , of course , Indian music and chants , Mondo Rama explodes from the speakers in celebration and rebirth . ''

In 2009 , Uttal released Thunder Love .
 One reviewer said the following about the album , '' a true example of ` world music , ' One 's a pan-cultural potpourri of sounds and styles from around the globe , seamlessly sewn into a contemporary pop/rock format .
Uttal 's soulful singing and spiritual themes provide the crucial connective thread throughout the album .
2011 saw the release of Queen of Hearts , a `` unique mixture of reggae , ska , and samba rhythms , used as a backdrop for call and response , dance oriented kirtan , and invoking Queen Radha , the bestower of devotion . ''

In 2003 , Uttal began the first of several recordings focused on the practice of bhakti yoga for the Sounds True label .
These have included : Kirtan !
 The Art and Practice of Ecstatic Chant , Music for Yoga and Other Joys , Loveland , Dial M for Mantra , and Pranayama , a collaboration with Pranayama wife , yoga teacher and bhakti dancer , Nubia Teixeira .
The two had a son , Ezra , which led to Uttal 's inspiration to focus his work towards kids .
Uttal began to lead children 's kirtan events near his home in Northern California and he created an album especially for children entitled Kirtan Kids : The Elephant , the Monkey , and the Little Butter Thief .
In addition to those , Uttal also hosted donation-based events at several yoga studios .
At these particular events , children would sit around in a circle and listen as Uttal told `` colorful stories drawn from Ramayana and other Indian myths . ''
The chants during these events were kid-friendly versions .
`` Kirtan Kids recreates the feeling of these events and gives parents a new way to introduce children to kirtan . ''
The album features `` an elephant solo , the sounds of banging pots and pans , and music from about a dozen instruments , including the glockenspiel and a toy piano . ''
The album also includes `` narrated tales of Gopala , the child form of Krishna ; the elephant-headed god Ganesha ; and the monkey god Hanuman . ''
Rabin Ghosh , a 20th-century violin virtuoso of ' Seni-Maihar ' Gharana of North Indian Classical Music , India , was a disciple of Baba Ustad Allauddin Khan Saheb .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh was noted for the young artist Rabin Ghosh unique style of playing ` Ati-Vilambit ' with an extensive use of ` Micro-Tone ' to imitate the Indian Singing style .
Rabin Ghosh hailed from a family with a strong musical background .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh father was His father .
 From a very early age , Rabin Ghosh was influenced by the musical atmosphere , which drove the young artist Rabin Ghosh into playing Esraj , Flute , and Tabla .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh finally focused on Five-String Violin ' , under the guidance of Mr. Mani Majumder , one of the renowned violinists of the contemporary time of Western Classical Music .
 After continuous training on Western Classical Music the young artist Rabin Ghosh shifted to North Indian Classical Music under the guidance of Sangeetacharya ' Haripada Chattopadhay , exponent violinist of ` Dagar Gharana ' of North Indian Classical Music .
 Rabin Ghosh continued the young artist Rabin Ghosh training more than a decade under the tutelage of Haripada Chattopadhay .
 During this time the young artist Rabin Ghosh not only won violin Competitions , also performed in concerts along with All India Radio , Calcutta .
In the year 1955 , Rabin Ghosh got an opportunity to play violin before Baba Allauddin Khan Saheb , the doyen of Hindustani Classical Music .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh played Raga Mian ki Todi before the young artist Rabin Ghosh .
 Baba Allauddin Khan Saheb was satisfied to accept Baba Ustad Allauddin Khan Saheb as Baba Ustad Allauddin Khan Saheb disciple .
In the mid of 1955 , Rabin Ghosh left for Maihar .
Life at Maihar for Rabin Ghosh was very dedicated .
 Besides receiving training from Baba Allauddin Khan Saheb , Baba Ustad Allauddin Khan Saheb was appointed as a teacher of Maihar Government Music College .
 Rabin Ghosh had a very strict and long duration practice session which the young artist Rabin Ghosh maintained till the last day in Maihar .
 In the young artist Rabin Ghosh own words I used to light a thick fragrance stick and would continue practice till it burned out totally .
At that time , Rabin Ghoshs practice sessions lasted about 12 hours a day but reached a peak of 14 to 16 hours a day .
 During the young artist Rabin Ghosh stay at Maihar over seven and half years , the young artist Rabin Ghosh experimented with different techniques on violin sound production and researched sitting posture which helped with the long duration of practice sessions .
 During the years of rigorous training under the tutelage of Baba Alauddin Khan Saheb in Maihar , Rabin Ghosh was inspired to ` Design and Develop Five-String Violin ' .
The need to access and explore the lower octave in expressing the mood of Raga RamDashi Malhar , in 1958 , the young artist Rabin Ghosh , had an extensive experimentation , which augmented 4 string violin to 5 string violin without compromising the original tonal quality of conventional violin .
For Five-String Violin he used to use 1st string ` E ' as ` Rishav ' , 2nd string ` A ' as ` Pancham ' , 3rd string 'D ' as ` Saraj ' , 4th string ` G ' as ` Madhyam ' , and 5th string ` C ' as ` Komol Nishad ' .
 From 1960 , Rabin Ghosh used ` Five String Violin ' starting with the young artist Rabin Ghosh performances at Tansen Sangeet Sanmelan , Calcutta .
Rabin Ghosh 's playing style was enriched with the amalgamation of singing as well as tantrakari .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh used to use extensive ` Micro-Tone ' to imitate the Indian Singing style .
 Another distinct feature of the young artist Rabin Ghosh playing style was holding the violin .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh used the young artist Rabin Ghosh ` specially made violin case ' for resting the young artist Rabin Ghosh violin .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh realized that playing could be more comfortable if the instrument is held from the both end facilitating to play finest Meend , Gamak and other technical applications .
Other aspect was to avoid the ` Excessive Flexion ' of the vertebral column of the performer , instead of resting violin somewhere of the body .
Maestro Rabin Ghosh composed ` Someswara Tala ' imagining the dancing posture of Nataraj , of 11 Beats , having division of 3 - 2 - 3 - .
 Going beyond the periphery of performing and teaching Maestro Rabin Ghosh has put the young artist Rabin Ghosh earnest endeavor to compose a few orchestrations on Indian Classical Music .
 During the young artist Rabin Ghosh tenure in Maihar , when the young artist Rabin Ghosh was completely engulfed in receiving training in Indian Classical Music from Baba Alauddin Khan Saheb , the motif kindled within the young artist Rabin Ghosh heart a unique feeling which prompted the young artist Rabin Ghosh to compose some pieces on Indian Classical Ragas completely orchestrated .
 The ragas in which the young artist Rabin Ghosh explored the young artist Rabin Ghosh are Jhila Kafi , Bhupali , Kirwani , Khamaj etc. .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh honest effort to con flux two parallel voices in a composition tuned out to be a grand success .
 Abhisarika , Niharika , Sanchari and more such compositions shaped between 1973 and 1992 and were staged by Abhisarika disciples from time to time .
 A compact disc album named ` Niharika ' played by Abhisarika disciples was released with orchestral works .
From 1970 and 1972 The Gramophone Company of India Limited released Three Long Playing Discs .
 The stereo recordings consists solo performance of Raga Pahari Jhinjhoti , Raga Ahir Bhairav by Rabin Ghosh , Raga Gunkali with Himangshu Biswas in Flute , Patdeep .
HMV released a disk consists of Raga Brindabani Sarang , Raga Bageshree by Rabin Ghosh with Himangshu Biswas , Dinesh ch .
Chandra and Shyamal Bose .
 Maestro Rabin Ghosh published a book ` Swarankan Sanghati ' - integration of notation system , where the young artist Rabin Ghosh described and analyzed the common features as well as comparison and method of translating music between Indian Classical Music Notation System and Western Classical Music Notation System .
Maestro Rabin Ghosh established a new dimension in the field of Indian Classical Music on Violin .
 As a result the young artist Rabin Ghosh was associated with Ali Akbar College of Music , Calcutta , Tansen Music College as teacher of violin .
Rabin Ghosh was associated with Rabindra Bharati University as lecturer of Instrumental Music Department .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh held the position of Examiner for Vishwa Bharati University and for Prayag Sangit Samiti .
Maestro Ghosh also gave many Lecture-Demonstrations in various places , including in the Department of Music of Emory University , and Sacramento state University , California , USA .
 Awarded certificate for standing first in the Baranagar Music Competition on Indian Classical Music by the Baranagar Godhuli Sangha , Calcutta , West Bengal in 1946 .
Awarded certificate for standing first in ` All Bengal Music Competition ' on Indian Classical Music .
 Also awarded prestigious ` Tulsidas Chatterjee Medal ' for outstanding performance in the competition , Calcutta , in 1950 .
 Awarded ` Sangeet Prabesikha ' and certified for standing first in Indian Classical Music by All India Music Conference Trust , Calcutta , in 1953 .
Awarded ` Sangeet Gunakar ' by the All India Music Conference , in 1954 .
Awarded certificate for standing first in the ` All India Music Competition on Indian Classical Music ' , Allahabad , in 1954 .
 Awarded ` Sangeet Prabhakar ' with gold medal and certified for standing first , Allahabad , in 1966 .
Awarded ` Sangeet Dishari ' title from the ` Critic Association ' for two consecutive years .
Honored with Gold Medal by All India Music Conference .
 Awarded Three Long Gold Medals in Berlin Festival in 1973 in Berlin Festival in 1973 , Germany .
 Awarded ` Sangeet Pravin ' with Three Long gold medals and certified for standing first , Allahabad , in 1982 .
Awarded title ` Sangeet Sagaram ' by the Hon ` ble Finance Minister of Tamil Nadu for the Cultural Centre of Performing Arts , Madras , in 1986 .
But Maestro Rabin Ghosh is a musician whose eminence can not be measured in gold medals and titles alone .
 the young artist Rabin Ghosh ultimate value in the perfection and sublimity of the music that flows with such easy grace and sweetness from the depths of the young artist Rabin Ghosh heart through the young artist Rabin Ghosh violin to our souls
Anjanibai Malpekar was a noted Indian classical singer , belonging to the Bhendibazaar gharana of Hindustani classical music .
 Anjanibai Malpekar was a disciple of Ustad Nazeer Khan of the gharana , with whom Anjanibai Malpekar started training at age 8 .
 Anjanibai Malpekar made Anjanibai Malpekar professional debut at age 16 in Mumbai , where Anjanibai Malpekar spent the rest of Anjanibai Malpekar life .
 Anjanibai Malpekar had a flourishing music career , till 1920 , when after death of Anjanibai Malpekar guru , Anjanibai Malpekar moved away from public performances , eventually retiring from public after 1923 .
 Thereafter Anjanibai Malpekar focussed on training Anjanibai Malpekar music disciples , notably Kumar Gandharva and Kishori Amonkar .
 In 1958 , Anjanibai Malpekar became the first woman to be awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship the highest honour conferred by Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy for Music , Dance and Drama .
 Anjanibai Malpekar was born on April 22 , 1883 , in Malpe in Goa , in music loving family that belonged to Goan Kalavant community .
 Both Gujabai grandmother Gujabai and mother Nabubai were respected names in music circles .
 At young age of 8 , Gujabai started Gujabai musical training under the tutelage of Ustad Nazeer Khan of Bhendibazaar gharana .
 The gharana had its origins in the much older Moradabad gharana , and was based in the Bhendi Bazaar area of Mumbai .
 Anjanibai Malpekar gave Anjanibai Malpekar debut performance at a concert in Mumbai in 1899 , at the age of 16 .
In those days , women of respectable families never sang in public , while Malepakar went on to have a flourishing singing career , with both public and royal patronage .
 In time , Malepakar became the doyenne of the gharana .
 Besides Malepakar singing , Malepakar also got acclaim for Malepakar beauty .
 When painter M. V. Dhurandhar did an oil painting of painter M. V. Dhurandhar , another painter Raja Ravi Verma was inspired , and went to do a series of paintings with painter M. V. Dhurandhar as muse , including Lady in the Moonlight , Lady Playing Swarbat , Mohini and The Heartbroken , painter M. V. Dhurandhar modeled for another painter Raja Ravi Verma during another painter Raja Ravi Verma stay in Mumbai in 1901 and 1903 .
However this wasnt without its drawback , especially when singing in public concerts meant singing primarily to a male audience , this often led to harassment .
 Thus in 1904 , painter M. V. Dhurandhar even developed fear of singing in public , and lost painter M. V. Dhurandhar voice , though painter M. V. Dhurandhar regained it after a year .
 Meanwhile painter M. V. Dhurandhar married Seth Wasanji Ved .
After a successful career as a singer , after the death of her Guru Ustad Nazeer Khan in 1920 , she lost interest in concerts .
 Finally , after a last performance at Town Hall , Mumbai , she gave up her public singing career in 1923 .
Thus at age 40 , she decided to devote the rest of her years , to teaching music .
In the coming decades , she taught some notable names in Indian classical music , including Kumar Gandharva who was her first disciple , Kishori Amonkar , Pandit T.D. Janorikar , Begum Akhtar and Naina Devi .
 By the 1960s , Bhendibazar gharana based in Mumbai , became famous all over India , with number of popular musicians , besides Aman Ali Khan , it had Jhande Khan , Mamman Khan , Shabbir and Amir Khan .
 In 1958 , when for Bhendibazar contribution to music , Bhendibazar was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship the highest honour conferred by Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy for Music , Dance and Drama , Bhendibazar became the first woman to received the award .
 Bhendibazar died on August 7 , 1974 in Bombay , at the age of 91
Ivor Cutler was a Scottish poet , songwriter and humorist .
 Ivor Cutler became known for Ivor Cutler regular performances on BBC radio , and in particular Ivor Cutler numerous sessions recorded for John Peel s influential radio programme , and later for Andy Kershaw s programme .
 Ivor Cutler appeared in The Beatles Magical Mystery Tour film in 1967 and on Neil Innes television programmes .
 Ivor Cutler also wrote books for children and adults and was a teacher at A. S. Neill s Summerhill School and for 30 years in inner-city schools in London .
 Ivor Cutler told Andy Kershaw on Ivor Cutler radio show that Ivor Cutler also gave private poetry lessons to individuals .
 In live performances Ivor Cutler would often accompany Ivor Cutler on a harmonium .
 Phyllis King appears on several of Phyllis King records , and for a number of years was a part of Phyllis King concerts .
She usually read small phrases but also read a few short stories .
 The two starred in a BBC radio series , King Ivor Cutler , in which they performed their material jointly and singly .
 Ivor Cutler also collaborated with pianist Neil Ardley and singer Robert Wyatt .
 Ivor Cutler was a noted eccentric , dressing in a distinctive style including plus-fours and hats adorned with many badges , travelling mainly by bicycle and often communicating by means of sticky labels printed with Cutlerisms , one of which , never knowingly understood came to be applied by supporters and detractors alike .
Others included Kindly disregard , reserved for official correspondence , and to remove this label take it off .
The hallmarks of Cutlers work are surreal , bizarre juxtapositions and close attention to small details of existence , all described in seemingly naive language .
 In performance Ivor Cutler delivery was frail , halting and minimally inflected .
 Ivor Cutler writing sometimes edged into whimsy or the macabre .
 Many of Ivor Cutler poems and songs are in the form of conversations delivered as a monologue .
In these , one party is often Cutler as a child , a poetic voice which he adopted in order to bypass the intellect .
 Ivor Cutler describes the poverty of Ivor Cutler early life and the neglect Ivor Cutler experienced from Ivor Cutler parents with great stoicism .
 Ivor Cutler expresses acceptance of Ivor Cutler lot and gratitude for the basic elements of life , for nature , and for parental love , even though that love might bear the marks of strain .
In these works the humour arises from the childs curiosity and the playful or self-serving lies the parent tells him in instructing him to do a chore or in order to stop the incessant questions .
 Ivor Cutler earned a faithful cult following .
 John Peel once remarked that Ivor Cutler was probably the only performer whose work had been featured on Radio 1 , 2 , 3 and 4 .
 Ivor Cutler was a member of the Noise Abatement Society and the Voluntary Euthanasia Society .
 Ivor Cutler retired from performing in 2004 , and died on 3 March 2006 .
 The reception room of Ivor Cutler home contained a number of pieces of ivory cutlery , intended as a pun on Ivor Cutler name .
 Ivor Cutler was born in Glasgow into a middle-class Jewish family of Eastern European descent .
 Ivor Cutler cited Ivor Cutler childhood as the source of Ivor Cutler artistic temperament , recalling a sense of displacement when Ivor Cutler younger brother was born : Without that I would not have been so screwed up as I am , and therefore not as creative .
 In 1939 Ivor Cutler was evacuated to Annan .
 Ivor Cutler joined the Royal Air Force as a navigator in 1942 but was soon dismissed for dreaminess .
 Ivor Cutler moved to London where Ivor Cutler was employed by the Inner London Education Authority to teach music , dance , drama and poetry to 7 - to 11-year-olds .
 Cutlers deeply held views on humanity meant Ivor Cutler disliked corporal punishment and on leaving a teaching job Ivor Cutler held in the 1950s Ivor Cutler cut up Ivor Cutler tawse and handed the pieces to the class .
 Ivor Cutler was married briefly and had The two children .
 Ivor Cutler began writing songs and poetry in the late 1950s , making the first of many appearances on BBC radio on the Home Service , where Ivor Cutler featured on the Monday Night at Home programme on 38 occasions between 1959 and 1963 .
 Ivor Cutler gained popularity playing songs where Ivor Cutler would often accompany Ivor Cutler on either a piano or the harmonium , and this success led to the release of a series of records starting with 1959s Ivor Cutler of YHup EP .
 Ivor Cutler continued to make appearances on the BBCs programmes during the 1960s , and as a result of an appearance on the television show Late Night Line-Up , Ivor Cutler was noticed by Paul McCartney , who invited Ivor Cutler to appear in The Beatles Magical Mystery Tour film .
 In the film , Ivor Cutler plays bus conductor Buster Bloodvessel , who becomes passionately attracted to Ringo Starr s Aunt Jessie .
 Following this film role , Ivor Cutler recorded an LP , Ludo , produced by The Beatles George Martin , and credited to the Ivor Cutler Trio , made up of Ivor Cutler with bassist Gill Lyons and percussionist Trevor Tomkins .
 The LP , taking inspiration from trad jazz and boogie-woogie , sees Ivor Cutler playing the piano as well as Ivor Cutler usual harmonium , and is considered the most traditionally musical of all Ivor Cutler records .
 After an LP release Ivor Cutler continued to perform for BBC radio , recording the first of Ivor Cutler sessions for John Peel in 1969 .
 Cutlers work on Peels shows would introduce Ivor Cutler to successive generations of fans , and in the early 1990s , Ivor Cutler said , Thanks to John Peel in 1969 , I gained a whole new audience , to the amazement of I older fans , who find themselves among 16-to-35s in theatres , and wonder where they came from .
 In the 1970s , Neil Ardley had Ivor Cutler sing on Ivor Cutler A Symphony of Amaranths LP , and A Symphony of Amaranths LP - Soft Machine singer Robert Wyatt asked Ivor Cutler to play harmonium and sing on two of the tracks on Ivor Cutler Rock Bottom LP .
 The collaboration with Soft Machine singer Robert Wyatt led to Cutler being signed to Wyatts record label Virgin Records , for whom Ivor Cutler recorded three LPs in the mid-1970s : Dandruff , Velvet Donkey and Jammy Smears .
 Each of these discs intersperses Cutlers poems and songs with readings by Each of these discs performing companion Phyllis King .
 During the decade Ivor Cutler used Ivor Cutler sessions for John Peel to introduce numerous episodes of Ivor Cutler Life in a Scotch Sitting Room series , culminating in the 1978 LP Life in a Scotch Sitting Room , Vol , Vol .
 2 , regarded as a particularly autobiographical work , on which Ivor Cutler recounts tales from Ivor Cutler childhood amid an environment of exaggerated Scottishness .
 Ivor Cutler also produced the work as a book , which was published in 1984 with illustrations by Martin Honeysett .
 Ivor Cutler also collaborated with Portal artist Frances Broomfield on an illustrated alphabet book , which was never completed .
 Ivor Cutler contributed the track Brooch Boat to the cult 1980 album Miniatures , produced and edited by Morgan Fisher , which consisted entirely of one-minute-long recordings .
In the 1980s , Rough Trade Records released three LPs -- Privilege , Prince Ivor and Gruts .
 Ivor Cutler also released the single Women of the World , recorded with Linda Hirst , through the label in 1983 .
 Ivor Cutler enjoyed further interest from the Creation record company in the 1990s , best known at the time as Oasis record label .
 The label released The two new volumes of poems and spoken word work : A Wet Handle and A Flat Man
Asad Ali Khan was an Indian musician who played the plucked string instrument rudra veena .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan performed in the style dhrupad and was described as the best living rudra veena player in India by The Hindu .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan was awarded the Indian civilian honor Padma Bhushan in 2008 .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan was born 1937 in Alwar in the seventh generation of rudra veena players in His grandfather Musharraf Khan family .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan ancestors were royal musicians in the courts of Rampur , Uttar Pradesh , and Jaipur , Rajasthan in the 18th century .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan great-grandfather Rajab Ali Khan was head of the court musicians in Jaipur and owned a village land holding .
 His great-grandfather Rajab Ali Khan grandfather Musharraf Khan was court musician in Alwar , and performed in London in 1886 .
 Khans father Sadiq Ali Khan worked as a musician for the Alwar court and for the Nawab of Rampur for 35 years .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan grew up in a musical surrounding and was taught the Beenkar gharana of Jaipur and vocals for fifteen years .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan was one of a few active musicians who played the rudra veena and the last surviving master of one of the four schools of dhrupad , the Khandar school .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan performed in many countries , including Australia , the United States , Afghanistan , and Italy and several other European countries , and conducted music courses in the United States .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan worked at All India Radio , taught the sitar in the Faculty of Music and Fine Arts at the University of Delhi for 17 years , and continued to train students privately after His grandfather Musharraf Khan retirement .
 Students of Khan who perform include His grandfather Musharraf Khan son Zaki Haidar and Bikramjeet Das of Kolkata .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan criticized the lack of willingness among Indians to study the rudra veena and has more foreign than Indian students .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan was involved in preserving the playing of the instrument , which His grandfather Musharraf Khan believed to be created by the deity Shiva , and performed for SPIC MACAY , promoting Indian classical music to young Indians .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan was a Shia Muslim .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan received several national awards , including the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1977 and the civilian honor Padma Bhushan in 2008 , which was awarded by Indian President Pratibha Patil .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan was described as the best living rudra veena player in India by The Hindu and lived in New Delhi .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan died on 14 June 2011 in the All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi .
 His grandfather Musharraf Khan never married and is survived by His grandfather Musharraf Khan nephew and adopted son Zaki Haidar
Nirmala Devi , also known as Nirmala Arun , was a Punjabi Hindustani classical vocalist of the Patiala Gharana , in far northern India .
She is the mother of Bollywood actor Govinda .
Nirmala Devi was the wife of a popular actor , of the 1940s , Arun Ahuja .
 She has five children , including actor Bollywood actor Govinda and director Kirti Kumar .
She died in 1996
The Sarana Chatushtai is the only experiment according to Bharata Muni to obtain the correct physical configuration of Sruti swara arrangement to Shadja Grama Notes on a musical instrument .
The 22 Srutis are the only notes which can be useful for music in an `` octave '' , in this view .
The sections below describe the experiment .
Sarana Chatushtai experiment on two similar sitars .
The two veenas or sitars having the same qualities in all respect can be used to perform the Sarana Chatushtai experiment .
Establish the Shadjagrama on both the similar sitars as per the methodology explained in Natya Shastra chapter 28 to keep shruties distance wise for the respective notes of the shadjagrama .
Now we can measure the sruti value and hence provide 22 frets starting from the 5th sruti of second note Re .
 The assumption here which needs to be made to realize Bharata Munis shruti of first datum note being the sound of free string Sa , requires the assumption of 4 virtual shruties of Sa which are actually obtained in the higher octave after Ni .
This assumption though not explicitly stated in the Natya Shastra needs to be made as was discovered by Avinash Balkrishna Patwardhan and is required to prove the Sarana Chatushtai experiment .
The shruti distances as per the compression factors are calculated for all the 34 length of the string .
18 frets are required to reach up to the end note Ni of the saptak in both the instruments .
When finally both the instruments are set in the Shadjagrama , one sitar is to be kept as Achala i.e. the string tuning of this instrument remains unchanged during the entire experiment , whereas the other sitar is named as Chala i.e. the changes in tuning strings during the experiment are to be performed on this sitar .
The Panchama note of this Chala sitar is to be lowered by one Pramana-Shruti that is to bring this sitar in the Madhyamagrama .
 The procedure of Bharata Muni states that the Achala sitar Re note is first played as Sa note and the Pa note of the Chala sitar is lowered down in sound to be played as Ma note of the Achala sitars Re note .
Setting the Chala sitar in the Madhyamagrama by lowering the Pa note by one Pramana Shruti is the first part of the first Sarana .
The next part is to sound the Chala sitar to Shadjagrama tune .
Here all notes on the Chala sitar will sound less by one Pramana shruti than the notes on the permanently set Achala sitar in the Shadjagrama .
Repeat the above mentioned procedure to further lower down the Chala sitar by one more Pramana Sruti .
 Here we find when asked to play both the instruments , then the Ga note of Achala sitar will exactly match in tune or rather merge with the Re note of the Chala sitar , and the Ni note of Achala instrument merges with the Dha note of the Chala sitar .
Here we get the pair of 2 shruti values .
Repeat the above procedure once again and further lower down the Chala sitar by one more sruti in shadjagrama .
Now the difference in both the instruments set in Shadjagrama is of 3 Pramana Shruti values .
 Here we see the notes Sa and Pa of Achala sitar will merge in second note Re & Dha notes of Chala sitar .
Repeat this procedure once again to finally bring down the Chala sitar lower by 4 sruties than the Achala sitar initially set in Shadjagrama .
 Here we find the notes Ni , Ga , Ma of Achala sitar are found merging in the notes Sa , Ga , Ma of Achala sitar and Pa of Achala sitar of the Chala sitar .
 Only when all 4 sarana 's are successfully tuned and the sound notes cross checked as mentioned by Bharata Muni , then only one can know the 22 shrutis of Shadjagrama as required by the Natya Shastra
Madhup Mudgal is an Indian Hindustani classical music vocalist .
 , known for Madhup Mudgal khayal and bhajan renditions .
 A disciple of Kumar Gandharva , A disciple of Kumar Gandharva is also a composer , conductor and has been Principal of the Gandharva Mahavidyalaya , New Delhi , a music and dance school since 1995 .
 A disciple of Kumar Gandharva received the prestigious Padma Shri award from Government of India in 2006 .
Madhup Mudgal was born in New Delhi to Professor Vinay Chandra Maudgalya , a renowned classical musician from the Gwalior gharana .
 Madhup Mudgal father started Gandharva Mahavidyalaya , New Delhi in 1939 from their home near Plaza cinema , Connaught Place .
 Because of the Gandharva Mahavidyalaya , Madhup Mudgal grew up in a musical environment , where veteran musicians like Pt .
Omkarnath Thakur and Ali Akbar Khan would come by regularly for sangeet baithaks .
The school shifted to its present building at Deen Dayal Upadhayaya Marg in 1972 and today has over 1200 dance and music students and a faculty of 60 teachers .
 Omkarnath Thakur did Omkarnath Thakur schooling from Modern School , New Delhi Omkarnath Thakur holds an M.A. and a M.Phil degree from the Music Faculty of University of Delhi for Omkarnath Thakur research in the structure of Khayal .
 Omkarnath Thakur received Omkarnath Thakur early training in Hindustani classical music from Omkarnath Thakur father , and went on to learn under the tutelage of musician like , Pandit Vasant Thakar , Pandit Jasraj and finally the musical stalwart Kumar Gandharva .
 Madhup Mudgal travels across the world for Madhup Mudgal performances .
 Madhup Mudgal has remained the conductor of the Gandharva Choir , a music group for many years .
 the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya has been the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya , New Delhi the oldest music school in New Delhi , since 1995 , where the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya has trained several musicians under the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya .
 the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya also composes music for the productions of the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya sister , Odissi dancer and choreographer , Madhavi Mudgal .
 the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya sister is noted Odissi dancer Madhavi Mudgal , who also teaches at Gandharva Mahavidyalaya .
 the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya daughter , Arushi , former student of Carmel Convent School in New Delhi , and trained by Madhavi at Gandharava Mahavidyalaya , made her stage debut a solo Odissi dancer in 2003 .
 In 2008 , she was the only Indian dancer to participate in International Dance Festival 2008 organised by German choreographer Pina Bausch , where Pina Bausch performed a self choreographer piece , Bageshri .
 the Principal of Gandharva Mahavidyalaya brother Mukul Mudgal is a retired Chief Justice of the Punjab and Haryana High Court .
Born on January 4 , 1949 , Justice Mudgal was appointed as a Judge of the Delhi High Court on March 2 , 1998 .
 a Judge of the Delhi High Court was sworn in as Chief Justice of the High Court on December 5 , 2009 and retired on January 3 , 2011
Madhuvanti is the name of a raga used in Indian classical music .
It is a Hindustani music raga , which is reported to have been borrowed into Carnatic music , and is structurally similar to Multani .
This Raag is based on Kalyan Thaat.It is a romantic raga based on the foundation , eternity and colors of love .
Madhu literally means honey .
 Madhu is a very sweet raga with a very simple philosophy of love and romance .
Madhuvantis notes are S g M P N S while ascending and all the swaras , S N D P M g R S , in the descent .

 Madhuvanti belongs to thaat Todi .
 Madhuvanti expresses a gentle loving sentiment .
Refer to the introduction .
 Madhuvanti is the janya raga of the 59th Melakarta of Carnatic Music , Dharmavati .
The notes used are Chathusruthi Rishabham , Sadharana Gandharam , Prati Madhyamam , Chathusruthi Dhaivatham and Kakali Nishadham .
 Notations of Carnatic music and Hindustani music differ a little bit .
 Carnatic is an audava-sampurna raga .
 Madhuvanti is a very melodious raga .
This raga has been used to compose many tukadas .
Sri Sadasiva Brahmendras composition , Sarvam Brahmamayam is often rendered in this raga .
 There is also a composition by Manachanallur Giridharan about Lord Ganesha as Pillaiyarpatti Deity in Sri Sadasiva Brahmendras composition 2012 album titled Uchi Pillaiyare Charanam in raaga Madhuvanti .
It has also been used in Indian movie songs and music as it lends itself to lilting melodies
Sameer Gupta is a San Francisco - based jazz percussionist , tabla player , and composer .
 Sameer Gupta is the founder of the jazz ensemble The Supplicants and drummer for the Marc Cary Focus Trio .
 Sameer Gupta has also worked with vidyA , Kosmic Renaissance , Grachan Moncur III , Victor Goines , Vincent Gardner , Sekou Sundiata , Sonny Simmons , Marcus Shelby , Calvin Keys , Richard Howell , Dayna Stephens , and Julian Lage .
 The Jazz Observer called The Jazz Observer playing , kinetic , bass-heavy , and tender
Pradeep Barot is a sarod maestro based in Bombay , India .
Born to a gifted clarionet player Mohan lal Barot , Pradeep from a young age displayed immense musical talent .
 At the age of fourteen , Mohan lal Barot was accepted as a student by the legendary sarodya Vasant Rai .
 For five years the legendary sarodya Vasant Rai taught Mohan lal Barot and groomed the legendary sarodya Vasant Rai to be a formidable performer .
 After 1969 the legendary sarodya Vasant Rai decided to concentrate on the legendary sarodya Vasant Rai career in the west and was unable to continue teaching Mohan lal Barot , and so referred the young student to Smt Annapurna Devi .
who was Vasants gurus daughter .
 Hearing Barot Annapurna Devi was impressed , and accepted Barot Annapurna Devi as a pupil .
 Mohan lal Barot still continues Mohan lal Barot training with Annapurana .
 Mohan lal Barot has established Mohan lal Barot as one of the leading Indian classical musicians of Mohan lal Barot generation , and is the director of music of the Films Division Mumbai .
 Mohan lal Barot is also an accomplished teacher , and is instrumental in the training of Mohan lal Barot own teacher Vasant Rai s son Satyam s musical progress
Pandit Kishan Maharaj was an Indian tabla player who belonged to the Benares gharana of Hindustani classical music .
Kishan Maharaj was born in Kabir Chaura , Benaras into a family of professional musicians .
 Pandit Kishan Maharaj was initially trained in classical music by Pandit Kishan Maharaj father , Hari Maharaj .
 After Pandit Kishan Maharaj fathers death , Pandit Kishan Maharaj training was taken over by Pandit Kishan Maharaj uncle , Kanthe Maharaj , a disciple of Baldeo Sahai of the Benares gharana .
 Kishan Maharaj , by the time Pandit Kishan Maharaj was eleven , Pandit Kishan Maharaj began performing in concerts .
Within a few years , Kishan Maharaj was sharing the stage with stalwarts like Faiyaz Khan , Omkarnath Thakur , Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Bhimsen Joshi , Ravi Shankar , Ali Akbar Khan , Vilayat Khan , Girija Devi , Sitara Devi and many others .
 Pandit Kishan Maharaj had the ability to play cross-rhythms and produce complex calculations , particularly in tihai patterns .
 Known as an excellent accompanist , Pandit Kishan Maharaj was extremely versatile and capable of playing with any accompaniment , be it with the Sitar , Sarod , Dhrupad , Dhamar or even dance .
 Pandit Kishan Maharaj gave a number of solo concerts during Pandit Kishan Maharaj career and also gave ` Sangat ` to some great dancers like Sri Shambhu Maharaj , Sitara Devi , Natraj Gopi Krishna , and Birju Maharaj .
 Among all Pandit Kishan Maharaj compositions , Pandit Kishan Maharaj Tala Vadya Kacheri with the Mridangam Vidwan , Palghat Raghu stood out .
 Pandit Kishan Maharaj extensively toured and participated in several prestigious events across the world , including the Edinburgh festival and the Commonwealth Arts festival in the United Kingdom in 1965 .
 Pandit Kishan Maharaj won the Padma Shri in 1973 and the Padma Vibhushan in 2002 .
 For many years , Pandit Kishan Maharaj was married to Savita Devi , daughter of Siddheshwari Devi .
Kishan Maharaj died on May 4 , 2008 at Khajuri near Varanasi at the age of 84 .
Maharajs disciples include Pandit Nandan Mehta , Pandit Kumar Bose , Pandit Balkrishna Mahant , sukhwinder singh namdhari sandeep das , arivind kumar azad vineet vyas , Himanshu Mahant , Balkrishna Iyer , Shubh Maharaj , Pandit Pooran Maharaj , Anand Lahiri , Arvind Kumar Azad , Ranesh Mishra , Shashi Bellare
Vishwa Mohan Bhatt also known as V. M. Bhatt is Grammy - winning Hindustani classical music instrumentalist who plays the Mohan Veena .
Vishwa Mohan lives in Jaipur , Rajasthan , India , with his wife and two sons .
 His elder son Salil Bhatt is a renowned Mohan veena player , whose album Slide to Freedom Part II was nominated for the Canadian JUNO AWARD , while Mohan Veena Player younger son Saurabh Bhatt is a well known composer .
Vishwa Mohan Bhatts grandson Satvik Bhatt is also a musician and a Limca Book Of World Record holder for being worlds youngest Mohan Veena Player at the age of 3 and a half years and also for identifying 45 ragas at the age of 3 and a half years .
Vishwa Mohan Bhatts parents late Manmohan Bhatt and late Chandrakala Bhatt were also teaching and performing musicians who imparted knowledge of music to V.M Bhatt .
His nephew , Krishna Bhatt , plays the sitar and tabla .
Bhatt is best known for his Grammy award winning album A Meeting by the River with Ry Cooder released on Water Lily Acoustics label .
He is also known for other fusion and pan-cultural collaborations with Western artists such as Taj Mahal , Bela Fleck and Jerry Douglas .
 Exposure such as an appearance on the 2004 Crossroads Guitar Festival , organized by Eric Clapton , allows Eric Clapton playing to reach a larger audience .
Folk musician Harry Manx , who studied with Salil Bhatt and Vishwa Mohan Bhatt for five years , plays a Mohan Veena .
Counting Crows Bassist Matt Malley also plays a Mohan Veena and is a student and friend of Vishwa Mohan Bhatt .
Australian Musician Lawrie Minson also learnt Mohan Veena from Salil and Vishwa Mohan Bhatt
Tejendra Narayan Majumdar is an Indian sarod player and pupil of Bahadur Khan .
Tejendra Narayan Majumdar is one of the most popular and celebrated modern sarod players .
 Tejendra Narayan Majumdar started Tejendra Narayan Majumdar music training under Tejendra Narayan Majumdar grandfather Bibhuti Ranjan Majumdar with mandolin .
 Tejendra Narayan Majumdar also received vocal and tabla training under Amaresh Chowdhury and Anil Palit .
 Later Tejendra Narayan Majumdar trained under Bahadur Khan for 18 years until the latter died .
 Tejendra Narayan Majumdar then continued under Ajay Sinha Roy and Ali Akbar Khan .
 Tejendra Narayan Majumdar stood first in the All India Radio music competition in 1981 and was awarded the Presidents gold medal and the Pandit D. V. Paluskar award .
 Tejendra Narayan Majumdar has played duets with Shujaat Khan .
The rendering of raag Charukeshi is especially notable .
 raag Charukeshi is married to Manasi Majumder and has one son , Indrayudh .
 raag Charukeshi directed music for a Bengali movie called Tollylights , directed by Arjun Chakraborty .
 raag Charukeshi is also directing music for another Bengali movie Hanankaal due to be released in 2010
Kattassery Joseph Yesudas is an Indian classical musician and playback singer .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas sings Indian classical , devotional , and popular music .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas has recorded more than 50,000 songs in many languages including Malayalam , Tamil , Hindi , Kannada , Telugu , Bengali , Gujarati , Oriya , Marathi , Punjabi , Sanskrit , Tulu , Malay , Russian , Arabic , Latin and English during a career spanning five decades .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas has performed in most Indian languages except Assamese , Konkani and Kashmiri .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas also composed a number of Malayalam film songs in the 1970s and 1980s .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas is fondly called Gana Gandharvan .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas has won the National Award for the Best Male Playback Singer seven times and the State Award for the Best Playback Singer 43 times , which consists of awards by the state governments of Kerala State , Tamil Nadu , Andhra Pradesh , Karnataka , and West Bengal .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas was awarded Padma Shri in 1975 and Padma Bhushan in 2002 by the Government of India for Kattassery Joseph Yesudas contributions to the arts .
 In 2011 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas was honoured with the CNN-IBN outstanding achievement award having recorded over 50,000 songs in a five-decade career .
 In 2006 , Kattassery Joseph Yesudas sang 16 film songs in four South Indian languages on the same day at AVM Studio , Chennai .
K. J. Yesudas was born at Fort Kochi , in the erstwhile Kingdom of Cochin , into a Roman Catholic Latin Rite family to late Augustine Joseph and late Alicekutty .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas father , who was a well-known Malayalam classical musician and stage actor , was his first guru .
Later he joined the R.L.V. Music Academy at Thrippunithura and underwent training .
Later he studied at Sree Swati Thirunal music college , Thiruvananthapuram under the late Semmangudy Sreenivasa Iyer .
But he could not complete his studies due to financial constraints .
For a brief period , he was with Sri Vechur Harihara Subramania Iyer , after which he took advanced training from Chembai Vaidyanatha Bhagavatar .
In 2011 he completed his 50 Years as a Play Back Singer .
 The first song sung by Kattassery Joseph Yesudas is Jaathi Bhedam Matha Dwesham on 14 Nov 1961 , which Kattassery Joseph Yesudas usually sings on all the special occasions in front of the audience .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas began Kattassery Joseph Yesudas career in playback singing in the Malayalam movie Kaalpadukal and Tamil , Telugu and Kannada movies in the early 1960s .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas got the first break in Kattassery Joseph Yesudas music career with the hit Malayalam film named Bharya .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas sang in Tamil for Bommai first , but the first released movie was Konjum Kumari .
 The trio of Salil Chowdhury , Kattassery Joseph Yesudas and Prem Nazir took the Malayalam Cinema Industry of the 70s by storm .
 It was generally agreed that Kattassery Joseph Yesudas voice was the most suited one for Prem Nazir .
 In 1970 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas was nominated to head the Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Academy and was the youngest person ever to occupy the post .
 On 9 Dec 1971 , Kattassery Joseph Yesudas missed a flight which later crashed on the way to Madurai .
 A Hawker Siddeley HS 748 near Chinnamanur was descending into Madurai in reduced visibility .
 A Hawker Siddeley HS flew into high terrain about 50 mi from the airport , killing the four crew members and 17 passengers .
 By the 1970s Kattassery Joseph Yesudas entered Bollywood .
 The first Hindi song Hindi sang was for the movie Jai Jawan Jai Kissan , but the first released movie was Chhoti Si Baat .
 Hindi has sung Hindi songs for many leading actors in Hindi cinema including Amitabh Bachchan , Amol Palekar and Jeetendra .
 Hindi has sung many evergreen Hindi film songs for music directors including Ravindra Jain , Bappi Lahiri , Khayyam , Rajkamal and Salil Chowdhury .
 Yesudass most popular Hindi songs are in the 1976 movie Chitchor , with music given by Ravindra Jain .
 The greatest tribute to Kattassery Joseph Yesudas was paid by Ravindra Jain , in an interview wherein the blind music director confessed that if ever he happened to regain vision , the first person he would like to see would be Kattassery Joseph Yesudas .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas has performed in many major cities around the world .
 In 1965 , Kattassery Joseph Yesudas was invited by the Soviet Union government to perform at music concerts in various cities in the USSR and also sang a Russian song over Radio Kazakhstan .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas became one of the senate members in the International Parliament for Safety and Peace .
 On 14 November 1999 , Kattassery Joseph Yesudas was presented with an honorary award by UNESCO for Outstanding Achievements in the Music and Peace at the Music for Peace event in Paris.a concert held to mark the dawn of the new millennium and whose attendees included artistes such as Lionel Richie , Ray Charles , Montserrat Caballe , and Zubin Mehta .
 In 1971 , during the Indo-Pakistani War , Kattassery Joseph Yesudas travelled all around Kerala State with Kattassery Joseph Yesudas musical troupe to raise funds for the Indian prime ministers National Defense Fund .
 In 2001 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas sang for album Ahimsa in Sanskrit , Latin and English and in a mix of styles including New Age and Carnatic .
 In Kattassery Joseph Yesudas music concerts in the Middle East Kattassery Joseph Yesudas sings Arabic songs in the Carnatic style .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas frequently serves as a cultural ambassador for India for his contributions through Kattassery Joseph Yesudas performances abroad , promoting Indian music .
 In 2009 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas began a cross-country musical campaign against terrorism in Thiruvananthapuram , with the motto Music For Peace .
 Kavita Karkare , wife of Hemant Karkare , handed over the torch to Kattassery Joseph Yesudas to mark the launch of the Shanthi Sangeetha Yatra .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas is married to Prabha .
They have three sons , Vinod , Vijay and Vishal .
 They second son Vijay Yesudas is a musician who won the Kerala State State Film Award for Best Male Playback Singer in 2007 and 2013 .
 The family is currently settled in Chennai and Trivandrum .
 a Roman Catholic Latin Rite family also owns estates in Fort Lauderdale , Florida , USA and Flower Mound , TX , USA for personal and business reasons .
 Sree Narayana Guru 's great message , One religion and One God for all humanity , influenced young Yesudas in Sree Narayana Guru 's dealings with Sree Narayana Guru 's fellow men .
 Sree Narayana Guru 's had Sree Narayana Guru 's own heroes among the musicians too .
 Mohammed Rafi , Chembai Vaidyanatha Bhagavatar and Balamurali Krishna are the ones Mohammed Rafi admires the most .
 For the past 30 years Kattassery Joseph Yesudas has been visiting Kollur Mookambika temple , Kollur , Karnataka on Kattassery Joseph Yesudas birthday to sing keerthans of Saraswati devi , the Goddess of knowledge , music and the arts .
 The music festival started on Kattassery Joseph Yesudas 60th birthday .
The nine-day music festival begins every January at Kollur Mookambika Temple .
 On Sunday , 10 January 2010 , Kattassery Joseph Yesudas celebrated Kattassery Joseph Yesudas 70th birthday at Kollur Sri Mookambika Temple with the special Sangeetharchana , along with 70 singers before goddess Mookambika .
The Sangeetharchana included Pancharatna Gayana of Thyagarajas poems .
 the special Sangeetharchana also took part in the Vidyarambha function .
 All India Radio broadcast the special Sangeetharchana all over Kerala State .
 In 1980 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas established the Tharangani Studio at Trivandrum .
 In 1992 the office and studio were moved to Chennai , Tamil Nadu and the company was incorporated in the US in 1998 .
 Tharangni Studio and Tharangni Records became a recording center in Kerala State which , for the first time , brought out audio cassettes of Malayalam film songs in stereo .
 The record company also had a voice mixing studio in Studio27 , Chennai .
 The studio continues to produce and present events of Kattassery Joseph Yesudas both for film and Indian classical music concerts throughout the world .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas has recorded over 50,000 songs and has won scores of accolades including the coveted Padma Shri , Padma Bhushan and seven National Awards for Best Male Playback Singer Playback Singer .
 Kattassery Joseph Yesudas is the only singer who has been accorded the title Asthana Gayakan of Kerala State
