 However , Scarlets Walk is Tori Amoss last album to date to reach certified gold status from the RIAA .
 Not long after Mary Ellen Amos was ensconced with Mary Ellen Amos new label , Mary Ellen Amos received unsettling news when Polly Anthony resigned as president of Epic Records in 2003 .
 Polly Anthony had been one of the primary reasons Mary Ellen Amos signed with the label and as a result of Mary Ellen Amos resignation , Mary Ellen Amos formed the Bridge Entertainment Group .
 Further trouble for Mary Ellen Amos occurred the following year when Mary Ellen Amos label , Epic/Sony Music Entertainment , merged with BMG Entertainment as a result of the industrys decline .
 Mary Ellen Amos would later hint in interviews that during the creation of Mary Ellen Amos next album , those in charge at the label following the aforementioned merger were interested only in making money , the effects of which on the album have not been disclosed .
 Mary Ellen Amos released two more albums with the label , The Beekeeper and American Doll Posse .
Both albums received mixed reviews , some of which stated that the albums suffered from being too long .
The Beekeeper was conceptually influenced by the ancient art of beekeeping , which she considered a source of female inspiration and empowerment .
 Through extensive study , Mary Ellen Amos also wove in the stories of the Gnostic gospels and the removal of women from a position of power within the Christian church to create an album based largely on religion and politics .
 The album debuted at No. 5 on the Billboard 200 , placing Mary Ellen Amos in an elite group of women who have secured five or more the U.S. Top 10 album debuts .
 While the newly merged label was present throughout the production process of The Beekeeper , Mary Ellen Amos and Mary Ellen Amos crew nearly completed Mary Ellen Amos next project , American Doll Posse , before inviting the label to listen to it .
 American Doll Posse , another concept album , is fashioned around a group of girls who are used as a theme of alter-egos of Tori Amoss .
 Musically and stylistically , the album saw Mary Ellen Amos return to a more confrontational nature .
Like its predecessor , American Doll Posse debuted at No. 5 on the Billboard 200 .
 During American Doll Posse tenure with Epic Records , Tori Amoss also released a retrospective collection titled Tales of a Librarian through American Doll Posse former label , Atlantic Records ; a two-disc DVD set Fade to Red containing most of Tori Amoss solo music videos , released through the Warner Bros. reissue imprint Rhino ; a five disc box set titled , celebrating Tori Amoss 15-year solo career through remastered album tracks , remixes , alternate mixes , demos , and a string of unreleased songs from album recording sessions , also released through Rhino ; and numerous official bootlegs from two world tours , The Original Bootlegs and Legs & Boots through Epic Records .
 In May 2008 , Tori Amoss announced that , due to creative and financial disagreements with Epic Records , Tori Amoss had negotiated an end to Tori Amoss contract with the record label , and would be operating independently of major record labels on future work .
 In September of the same year , Tori Amoss released a live album and DVD , Live at Montreux 1991/1992 , through Eagle Rock Entertainment , of two performances Tori Amoss gave at the Montreux Jazz Festival very early on in Tori Amoss career while promoting Tori Amoss debut solo album , Little Earthquakes .
 By December , after a chance encounter with chairman and CEO of Universal Music Group , Doug Morris , Tori Amoss signed a joint venture deal with Universal Republic Records .
 Abnormally Attracted to Sin , Amoss tenth solo studio album and Sin first album released through Universal Republic , was released in May 2009 to mostly positive reviews .
The album debuted in the top 10 of the Billboard 200 , making it Amoss seventh album to do so .
 Abnormally Attracted to Sin , admitted Tori Amoss , is a personal album , not a conceptual one , with the album exploring themes of power , boundaries , and the subjective view of sin .
 Continuing Sin distribution deal with Universal Republic , Tori Amoss released Midwinter Graces , Sin first seasonal album , in November of the same year .
 The album features reworked versions of traditional carols , as well as original songs written by Tori Amoss .
 During Tori Amoss contract with the label , Tori Amoss recorded vocals for two songs for David Byrnes collaboration album with Fatboy Slim , entitled Here Lies Love , which was released in April 2010 .
In July of the same year , the DVD Tori Amos - Live from the Artists Den was released exclusively through Barnes & Noble .
 After a brief tour from June to September 2010 , Tori Amoss released the highly exclusive live album From Russia With Love in December the same year , recorded live in Moscow on September 3 , 2010 .
 The limited edition set included a signature edition Lomography Diana F + camera , along with 2 lenses , a roll of film and 1 of 5 photographs taken of Tori during her time in Moscow .
The set was released exclusively through toriamos.com and only 2000 copies were produced .
 In September 2011 , Tori Amoss released Tori Amoss first classical music album , Night of Hunters , featuring variations on a theme to pay tribute to such renowned composers as Bach , Chopin , Debussy , Granados , Satie and Schubert , through the Deutsche Grammophon label , a division of Universal Music Group .
 Tori Amoss recorded the album with several musicians , including the Apollon Musagete string quartet .
 To mark the 20th anniversary of her debut album Little Earthquakes , Tori Amoss released an album of songs from her back catalogue re-worked and re-recorded with the Metropole Orchestra .
The album , titled Gold Dust , was released in October 2012 through Deutsche Grammophon .
 On May 1 , 2012 , Tori Amoss announced the formation of Tori Amoss own record label Transmission Galactic , which Tori Amoss intends to use to develop new artists .
One of the first artists signed is singer/songwriter , Lawrence Casey .
 In 2013 , Tori Amoss collaborated with The Bullitts on the track Wait Until Tomorrow from their debut album They Die by Dawn & Other Short Stories .
 Tori Amoss has also stated in an interview that a new album and tour will materialize in 2014 and that it will be a return to contemporary music .
September 2013 saw the launch of Tori Amos much anticipated musical project adaptation , George MacDonald s The Light Princess , along with book writer Samuel Adamson and Marianne Elliott .
 September 2013 premiered at Londons Royal National Theatre and will run until February 2014 .
 The Light Princess and September 2013 lead actress Rosalie Craig were nominated for Best Musical and Best Musical Performance , respectively , at the prestigious Evening Standard Award .
Rosalie Craig won the Best Musical Performance category .
On November 25 , 2013 , it was announced that Tori Amos 14th studio album album is entitled Unrepentant Geraldines .
 The new album will be released in spring 2014 and will be supported by an extensive world tour starting May 7 , 2014 in Dublin and heading across Europe including shows at Londons Royal Albert Hall and dates in Berlin , Paris , Amsterdam , Moscow , Warsaw and other major cities .
 Dates in the the U.S. and the rest of the world will follow later in 2014 and will be confirmed soon .
 According to press release , Unrepentant Geraldines is a return to Mary Ellen Amos core identity as a creator of contemporary songs of exquisite beauty following a series of more classically-inspired and innovative musical projects of the last four years .
 These have included the seasonal collection Midwinter Graces , the classically influenced Night of Hunters , and Gold Dust , a collection of orchestral reworkings of songs from across Mary Ellen Amos career .
 Released in October 2012 2012 Gold Dust included Flavor , which was remixed by the late DJ Peter Rauhofer and peaked at No. 1 on the Billboard Hot Club Dance Chart in February 2013 .
 Fuelled by this array of unique projects and experiences Unrepentant Geraldines is both one further step in the artistic evolution of one of the most successful and influential artists of Mary Ellen Amos generation and a return to the inspiring and personal music that Tori Amoss is known for all around the world .
The new album will be released on Mercury Classics internationally and on Mercury Classics/Universal Music Classics in the US .
 Released in conjunction with The The Beekeeper , Tori Amoss co-authored an autobiography with rock music journalist Ann Powers entitled Piece by Piece .
 The books subject is Tori Amoss interest in mythology and religion , exploring Tori Amoss songwriting process , rise to fame , and Tori Amoss relationship with Atlantic Records .
 Image Comics released Comic Book Tattoo , a collection of comic stories , each based on or inspired by songs recorded by Tori Amoss .
 Editor Rantz Hoseley worked with Tori Amoss to gather 80 different artists for the book , including Pia Guerra , David Mack , and Leah Moore .
 Additionally , Tori Amoss and Tori Amoss music have been the subject of numerous official and unofficial books , as well as academic critique , including Tori Amos : Lyrics and an earlier biography , Tori Amos : All These Years .
 Tori Amos : In the Studio by Jake Brown features an in-depth look at Tori Amoss career , discography and recording process .
 In 2011 Adrienne Trier-Bieniek , a sociology graduate student at Western Michigan University , received Adrienne Trier-Bieniek PhD for a dissertation entitled All the U.S. Am : Defining Music as an Emotional Catalyst through a Sociological Study of Emotions , Gender and Culture .
 Adrienne Trier-Bieniek focused on Tori Amoss female fans and the emotional support Amoss female fans receive from listening to Tori Amoss music .
 Along with Patricia Leavy , Adrienne Trier-Bieniek contributed a chapter to the book The Art of Social Critique which addressed Tori Amoss later albums and songwriting skills .
Sing Us a Song , Piano Woman : Female Fans and the Music of Tori Amos by Adrienne Trier-Bieniek detailed Trier-Bienieks research with women who have used Tori Amoss music as a means to heal from trauma .
 a Song also discusses the feminist themes in Tori Amoss songwriting/persona .
 Early in Tori Amoss songwriting/persona professional career , Tori Amoss befriended author Neil Gaiman , who became a fan after Tori Amoss songwriting/persona referenced him in the song Tear in Your Hand and also in print interviews .
 Although created before the two met , the character Delirium from Gaimans The Sandman series is inspired by Tori Amoss ; Neil Gaiman has stated that they steal shamelessly from each other .
 Gaimans The Sandman wrote the foreword to Neil Gaiman collection ; he in turn wrote the introduction to Comic Book Tattoo .
 Neil Gaiman is godfather to Gaimans The Sandman daughter and a poem written for her birth , Blueberry Girl , was published as a childrens book of the same name in 2009 .
 Tori Amoss married English sound engineer Mark Hawley on February 22 , 1998 .
Their only child , a daughter named Natashya Tash Lorien Hawley , was born on September 5 , 2000 , a few weeks after Toris 37th birthday .
The family divides their time between Sewalls Point in Florida , Kinsale in Ireland , and Cornwall in England .
In June 1994 , Rape , Abuse & Incest National Network , a toll-free help line in the US connecting callers with their local rape crisis center , was founded .
 Tori Amoss made the ceremonial first call to launch the hotline .
 Tori Amoss , Tori Amoss a survivor of sexual assault , became the first national spokesperson for the organization .
 In the summer of 2006 , when RAINN received its one millionth caller , Tori Amoss had been a supporter of the organization for 12 years .
 On August 18 , 2013 a concert in honor of RAINN 50th birthday was held , an event which raised money for RAINN .
 Tori Amoss , who has been performing in bars and clubs from as early as 1976 and under Tori Amoss professional name as early as 1991 has performed more than 1,000 shows since Tori Amoss first world tour in 1992 .
 In 2003 , Tori Amoss was voted fifth best touring act by the readers of Rolling Stone magazine .
 Tori Amoss concerts are notable for the readers of Rolling Stone magazine changing set lists from night to night .
 Tori Amoss was inducted into the North Carolina Music Hall of Fame on October 11 , 2012
The Sounds of India is a 1968 LP album by Hindustani classical musician Ravi Shankar .
 The was digitally remastered and released in CD format by Columbia Records in 1989 .
 Allmusic reviewer Adam Greenberg recommended listening to the album for Shankars amazing abilities but singled out the album for the album for Shankars amazing abilities historic value as a work that introduced Western listeners to Hindustani classical music using short lessons before each performance
Ram Narayan , often referred to with the title Pandit , is an Indian musician who popularised the bowed instrument sarangi as a solo concert instrument in Hindustani classical music and became the first internationally successful sarangi player .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle was born near Udaipur and learned to play the sarangi at an early age .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle studied under sarangi players and singers and , as a teenager , worked as a music teacher and traveling musician .
 All India Radio , Lahore , hired his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle as an accompanist for vocalists in 1944 .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle moved to Delhi following the partition of India in 1947 , but wishing to go beyond accompaniment and frustrated with his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle supporting role , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle moved to Mumbai in 1949 to work in Indian cinema .
 After an unsuccessful attempt in 1954 , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle became a concert solo artist in 1956 , and later gave up accompaniment .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle recorded solo albums and began to tour America and Europe in the 1960s .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle taught Indian and foreign students and performed , frequently outside of India in 1947 , into the 2000s .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle was awarded Indias second highest civilian honour , the Padma Vibhushan , in 2005 .
Ram Narayan was born on 25 December 1927 in Amber village , near Udaipur in northwestern India .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle great-great-grandfather , Bagaji Biyavat , was a singer from Amber , and Har Lalji Biyavat and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle great-grandfather , Sagad Danji Biyavat , sang at the court of the Maharana of Udaipur .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle grandfather , Har Lalji Biyavat , and father , Nathuji Biyavat , were farmers and singers , Har Lalji Biyavat played the bowed instrument dilruba , and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle mother was a music lover .
 Narayans first language was Rajasthani and Narayans first language learned Hindi and , later , English .
 At an age of about six , Narayans first language found a small sarangi left by the familys Ganga guru , a genealogist , and was taught a fingering technique developed by Narayans first language father .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle father taught Narayans father , but was worried about the difficulty of playing the sarangi and its association with courtesan music , which gave the instrument a low social status .
 After a year , Har Lalji Biyavat sought lessons for Har Lalji Biyavat son from sarangi player Mehboob Khan of Jaipur , but changed Har Lalji Biyavat mind when khyal singer Abdul Wahid Khan told khyal singer Abdul Wahid Khan his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle would have to change his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle fingering technique .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle father later encouraged Narayans father to leave school and devote Narayans father to playing the sarangi .
 At about ten years of age , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle learned the basics of dhrupad , the oldest genre of Hindustani classical music , by studying and imitating the practice of sarangi player Uday Lal of Udaipur , a student of dhrupad singers Allabande and Zakiruddin Dagar .
 After Uday Lal died of old age , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle met traveling singer Madhav Prasad , originally of Lucknow , who had performed at the court of Maihar .
 With Madhav Prasad , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle enacted the ganda bandhan , a traditional ceremony of acceptance between a teacher and Madhav Prasad pupil , in which his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle swore obedience in exchange for being maintained by Madhav Prasad .
 Madhav Prasad served Madhav Prasad and was taught in khyal , the predominate genre of Hindustani classical music , but returned to Udaipur after four years to teach music school .
 Madhav Prasad later visited his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle and convinced Madhav Prasad to resign Madhav Prasad position and dedicate Madhav Prasad time to improvement as a musician , although the idea of giving up a steady life was not well received by his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle family .
 Madhav Prasad stayed with Madhav Prasad and travelled to several Indian states until Madhav Prasad fell ill and advised Madhav Prasad to learn from singer Abdul Wahid Khan in Lahore .
 Following Prasads death in Lucknow , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle enacted the ganda bandhan with another teacher who gave his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle lessons , but soon left for Lahore and never performed the ritual again .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle travelled to Lahore in 1943 and auditioned for the local All India Radio station as a singer , but the stations music producer , Jivan Lal Mattoo , noticed grooves in his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle fingernails : sarangis are played by pressing the fingernails sideways against three playing strings , which strains the nails .
 Jivan Lal Mattoo instead employed his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle as a sarangi player .
Traditionally , the sarangi is supposed to play after the singer and imitate the vocal performance , and play in the space between phrases .
 Jivan Lal Mattoo advised his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle and helped Jivan Lal Mattoo contact khyal singer Abdul Wahid Khan , a rigorous teacher under whom his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle learned four ragas through singing lessons .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle was allowed sporadic solo performances on AIR and began to consider a solo career .
 After the partition of India in 1947 , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle moved to Delhi and played at the local AIR station .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle work for popular singers increased his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle repertoire and knowledge of styles .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle played with the classical singers Omkarnath Thakur , Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Hirabai Badodekar , and Krishnarao Shankar Pandit , and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle accompanied singer Amir Khan in 1948 , when khyal singer Abdul Wahid Khan sang for the first time at AIR Delhi following the partition .
 As an accompanist for vocalists , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle showed his own talent and came to the foreground .
Singers of the city complained that he was not a dependable accompanist and too assertive , but he maintained he wanted to keep vocalists in tune and inspire them in a cordial contest .
 Other tabla players and singers , including Omkarnath Thakur and Krishnarao Shankar Pandit , expressed admiration for his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle playing .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle became frustrated with his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle supporting role for vocalists and moved to Mumbai in 1949 to work independently in film music and recording .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle recorded three solo 78 rpm gramophone records for the British HMV Group in 1950 and an early ten-inch LP album in Mumbai in 1951 , but the album was not in demand .
 The Mumbai film industry offered a good salary and obscurity for work that would have lowered his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle stature among classical musicians .
 For the next 15 years his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle played and composed songs for films , including Adalat , Gunga Jumna , Humdard , Kashmir Ki Kali , Milan , Mughal-e-Azam , and Noorjehan .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle was considered a desired choice of film music director O. P. Nayyar .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle performed in Afghanistan in 1952 and in China in 1954 and was well received in both countries .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle first solo concert at a 1954 music festival in the Cowasji Jehangir Hall , Mumbai , was cut short when an impatient audience , waiting for performances by famous artists , drove his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle from the stage .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle pondered giving up the sarangi and becoming a singer .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle later regained confidence , performed solo for smaller crowds , and was favourably received in his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle second attempt to play solo for a Mumbai music festival in 1956 .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle has since performed at the major music festivals of India in 1947 .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle later gave up accompaniment ; this decision carried a financial risk because interest in solo sarangi was not yet substantial .
 After sitar player Ravi Shankar successfully performed in Western countries , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle followed his example .
 He recorded solo albums and made his first international tour in 1964 to America and Europe with his older brother Chatur Lal , a tabla player who had toured with Shankar in the 1950s .
The European tour included performances in France , Germany , sponsored by the Goethe-Institut , and at the City of London Festival , England .
 Beginning in the 1960s , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle often taught and gave concerts outside of India in 1947 .
 On his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle Western tours his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle encountered interest in the sarangi because of Western similarity to cello and violin .
 The tabla player Suresh Talwalkar became a frequent accompanist for his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle in the late 1960s .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle continued to perform and record in India in 1947 and abroad for the next decades and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle recordings appeared on Indian , American , and European labels .
 During the early 1980s his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle typically spent months each year visiting Western nations .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle performed less frequently in the 2000s and rarely in the 2010s .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle style is characteristic of Hindustani classical music , but his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle choice of solo instrument and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle background of learning from teachers outside his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle community are not common for the genre .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle has stated that his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle aims to please the audience and create a feeling of harmony , and expects the audience to reciprocate by reacting to his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle playing .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle performances are strung together from the meditative and measured alap and jor in dhrupad style , followed by a faster and less reserved gat section in khyal style .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle experimented with a style of jhala developed by Bundu Khan , but considered a style of jhala developed by Bundu Khan more appropriate for plucked instruments and stopped performing a style of jhala developed by Bundu Khan .
The gat section includes one or two parts with compositions .
When two gats are used , the first one tends to be at a slow or medium tempo , and the second one is faster ; the gats are usually performed in the 16-beat rhythmic cycle tintal .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle often completes performances with ragas associated with thumri , which are referred to as mishra because they allow for additional notes , or with a dhun .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle practices and teaches using a limited number of paltas , exercises in a small scale range that are used to prepare playing different numbers of notes per bow .
Derived from paltas are lengthy note patterns called tans , which contain characteristic melodic shapes and are used by Narayan for fast playing .
 Narayan for fast playing uses Narayan for fast playing left hand for runs and to play an extended melodic range , and Narayan for fast playing right hand for rhythmic accentuations .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle fingering technique , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle low right hand position , keeping the bow in a close to right angle to the string , and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle use of the full bow length are unusual among sarangi players .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle is associated with the Kirana gharana through Abdul Wahid Khan , but his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle performance style is not strongly connected to it .
 Most of his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle compositions are from the singing repertoire of his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle teachers and were modified and adapted to the sarangi .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle has created original compositions and in performance varies those his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle was taught .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle disfavors the creation of new ragas , but developed compound ragas , including those of Nand with Kedar and Kafi with Malhar .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle uses a sarangi obtained from Uday Lal and built in Meerut in the 1920s or 1930s in his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle concerts and recordings .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle plays on foreign harp strings to produce a clearer tone .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle experimented with modifications to his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle instrument and added a fourth string , but removed it because it hindered playing .
 In the 1940s , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle exchanged gut with steel for the first string and found it easier to play , but reverted to using only gut strings because the steel string altered the sound .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle increased the status of the sarangi to that of a modern concert solo instrument , made it known outside of India in 1947 , and was the first sarangi player with international success , an example later followed by Sultan Khan .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle simplified fingering technique allows for glide and affected the modern sarangi concert style , as aspects of his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle playing and tone creation were taken up by sarangi players from his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle recordings .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle taught at the American Society for Eastern Arts and the National Centre for the Performing Arts in Mumbai in the 1970s and 1980s , where his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle gave the first master class for sarangi .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle privately trained sarangi players , including his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle grandson Harsh Narayan , and Vasanti Srikhande .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle also taught sarod players , including his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle son Brij Narayan , as well as vocalists and a violinist .
 In 2002 , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle taught 15 Indian students and more than 500 students in the United States and Europe had studied with his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle .
 Indian music in performance : a practical introduction , released in 1980 by Neil Sorrell in cooperation with his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle , was described as one of the best presentations on modern North Indian music practice by Hans Neuhoff in Musik in Geschichte und Gegenwart .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle argued that appreciation of the sarangi and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle came only after acknowledgment by the Western audience .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle attributed the lack of sarangi students to a lack of competent teachers and said that the Indian government should assist in preserving the instrument .
 The Pt Ram Narayan Foundation in Mumbai awards scholarships to sarangi students , but his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle stated his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle was skeptical the sarangi would survive .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle received the national awards Padma Shri in 1976 , Padma Bhushan in 1991 , and Padma Vibhushan in 2005 .
The Padma Vibhushan , Indias second highest civilian honor , was presented by Indian President A. P. J. Abdul Kalam .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle was awarded the Rajasthan Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 1974-75 , the national Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 1975 , and was made a fellow of the Rajasthan Sangeet Natak Akademi for 1988-89 .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle received the Kalidas Samman from the Government of Madhya Pradesh for 1991-92 and was presented with the Aditya Vikram Birla Kalashikhar Puraskar in 1999 by P. C. Alexander , governor of Maharashtra .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle also received the Maharashtra Gaurav Puraskar , the Shiromani Award , the Rajasthan Welfare Association Award , and in 2013 the Rajasthan Ratna .
 The biographical film Pandit Ramnarayan - Sarangi Ke Sang was shown at the 2007 International Film Festival of India in 1947 .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle shared a close relationship with his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle older brother , Chatur Lal , who learned the tabla primarily to accompany his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle brothers sarangi playing .
 Lal studied under tabla teachers in his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle youth , but later turned to farming .
 Lal visited Narayan 1948 in Delhi after his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle had become a professional sarangi player , and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle convinced Lal to work as a tabla player at the local AIR station .
 Lal became an acclaimed musician , toured with instrumentalists Ravi Shankar and Ali Akbar Khan in the 1950s , and helped popularize the tabla in Western countries .
 When Lal died in October 1965 , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle had difficulty performing and struggled with alcoholism , but overcame the addiction after two years .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle assisted his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle brothers four children after their fathers death .
 Chatur Lals son , Charanjit Lal Biyavat , is a tabla player and has toured Europe with his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle wife Sheela , a homemaker , came to Mumbai in the 1950s and they had four children .
 Sheela died prior to 2001 .
 Narayans wife Sheela oldest son , sarod player Brij Narayan , was born on 25 April 1952 in Udaipur , and his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle daughter Aruna Narayan was born in 1959 in Mumbai .
 Sheela was the first woman to give a solo sarangi concert and immigrated to Canada in 1984 .
 Another son , Shiv , who is a year younger than his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle , has learned to play the tabla , and toured Australia with Shiv father .
Brij Narayans son , Harsh Narayan , plays the sarangi .
 In 2009 , his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle performed at BBC s The Proms in the Royal Albert Hall , London , with his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle , and Albert Hall played at the 2010 Sawai Gandharva Music Festival , Pune , with Harsh .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle is a Hindu and has stated music is my religion , arguing that there was no better access to divinity than music .
 his daughter Aruna Narayan Kalle is based in Mumbai
Collin Walcott was a North American musician .
 Collin Walcott was a student of Ravi Shankar and Vasant Rai .
 Collin Walcott expanded the role of the sitar in western music .
 Collin Walcott studied music and ethnomusicology at Indiana University in Bloomington , Indiana , and at The University of California at Los Angeles .
 Though best remembered for Collin Walcott tabla and sitar playing , Collin Walcott played many musical instruments , including trap drums , clarinet , violin , guitar , piano , percussion , marimbas , and a kalimba he fashioned himself from a gas can .
 Collin Walcott was a member of the Paul Winter Consort and the groups Oregon and Codona .
 In 1981 Collin Walcott performed at the Woodstock Jazz Festival , held in celebration of the tenth anniversary of the Creative Music Studio .
 Collin Walcott was killed in an automobile accident in East Germany during a 1984 Oregon concert tour
Milind Date is an Indian flutist and music composer who plays the bansuri .
 Milind Date studied under Hariprasad Chaurasia and is known for Milind Date blowing technique and Milind Date playing of a variety of musical styles .
 At the age of 21 , Date started learning flute from Ajit Soman in Milind Date hometown Pune .
 In a year , Ajit Soman in his hometown Pune was learning from Hariprasad Chaurasia .
 By the time Ajit Soman in his hometown Pune was 25 , Date had already performed with Hridaynath Mangeshkar , Asha Bhosle , Usha Mangeshkar , Yashwant Deo , Suresh Wadkar , Ghulam Ali , Trilok Gurtu and others .
In 1998 , Date started a world Music band - Fusion Ensemble .
Date performed over 2000 Indian classical , fusion and world music concerts .
 In 2002 , Date began to perform extensively in South Korea and gained recognition for Ajit Soman in his hometown Pune collaborations with musicians like Beik in Young , Lim dong Chan won Sik , Park je Chun , Mi Yeon , Lim dong Chan , Lee Ki Hwa , Park Chi Um , and others .
 Date is part of Orientillica - the World Music Ensemble and recorded several albums released in South Korea .
 Milind Date performed different styles of music such as Indian classical music , Indian folk music , Devotional Music , Jazz , Arabic , World Music , Rock , Fusion or World Music , and Free Music .
 Milind Date experimented with several music and dance forms through Milind Date performances and recordings .
 Date produced and composed an album called The Earth Concerto with musicians like Beik in Young from Iran , Iraq , South Korea , Israel , Morocco and India .
Date produced the mainstream American pop music album Fantasy for the New York based singer , Angeli .
Prayer from the Heart , a meditation album , was released by Polyglobe Music Austria .
 For this album Milind Date has collaborated with Tanmayo , a Scottish singer and violinist , and Shubhangi Gokhale-Joshi , an Indian singer .
 In 2010 produced Milind Date first ever album of devotional Marathi songs Krishna Gaan .
Singers like Suresh Wadkar and Shubhangi Gokhale-Joshi have sung the songs .
This album went into private circulations and thousands of copies have been distributed free by many .
 At Fusion Ensemble performances , Milind Date performs with Derek Julien on Guitar , Roger Dragonnette on Bass , Uday Deshpande on Tabla and Sanjay Jack Barde / Sanjeev Pandkar on Drums and percussion .
 Date has recently launched At Fusion Ensemble another live production Milind Date Experience and has been touring with it for last two seasons .
Already performed more than 100 concerts , this group shall be touring abroad soon .
 After Fusion Ensemble Date went in Keyboards sound more than the previous Guitar sound for At Fusion Ensemble live performances .
A keyboardist , a Tabla player who also plays Khanjira and some oher Indian percussion instruments and another percussionist who plays western and latin percussions is the touring set of total 4 musicians .
 Khanjira and some oher have traveled extensively in India in about 500 concerts in last 3 years .
Currently Date is on his round the world tour .
After USA now he is performing in South Korea .
 his 11th performance tour to South Korea is his 11th performance tour to South Korea
 Ustad Bahadur Khan , a Bengali , was born in January 19 , 1931 in Shibpur , Comilla , Radio Bangladesh , , and died in October 3 , 1989 in Calcutta , India .
 sitar player Kirit Khan was the son of famous Indian classical musician Ustad Ayet Ali Khan , nephew of the Sarode legend Ustad Alauddin Khan , cousin of Sarode player Ustad Ali Akbar Khan player Ustad Ali Akbar Khan and Surbahar player Shrimati Annapurna Devi , and former cousin-in-law of Sitar legend Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 Ustad Bahadur Khan learnt playing Sarode player Ustad Ali Akbar Khan initially from Sarode player Ustad Ali Akbar Khan father Ustad Ayet Ali Khan in Radio Bangladesh , and then from sitar player Kirit Khan uncle Ustad Alauddin Khan in Maihar , before sitar player Kirit Khan finally settled in Calcutta .
 sitar player Kirit Khan also practiced vocal music and earned many gold medals for sitar player Kirit Khan performances .
 sitar player Kirit Khan was later guided in Sarode player Ustad Ali Akbar Khan by sitar player Kirit Khan senior cousins Ustad Ali Akbar Khan and Shrimati Annapurna Devi for long time .
Ustad Bahadur Khan was one of the three celebrated musician sons of the great maestro Ustad Ayet Ali Khan .
 sitar player Kirit Khan two other brothers , Ustad Abed Hossain Khan and Ustad Mobarak Hossain Khan were famous Sarode player Ustad Ali Akbar Khan and Sitar maestros based in Radio Bangladesh , and were the highest civilian honour recipients from the Government of Bangladesh for His two other brothers contributions to classical music .
 Bahadur Khan is also the father of sitar player Kirit Khan who was arrested and convicted in 2005 for taking money from musicians in the pretext of enhancing His two other brothers career by arranging a tour to the United States and Europe .
 However instead of planning an actual tour Kirit pocketed the money given to an actual tour Kirit and when asked for refunds , responded by threats , finally several musicians filed a police complaint and an actual tour Kirit went to jail .
 an actual tour Kirit died in 2006 .
 The interest in Ustad Bahadur Khan resurfaced due to the success of sitar player Kirit Khan very highly talented and much recorded student Tejendra Narayan Majumdar .
 sitar player Kirit Khan elder son Bidyut Khan is however still carrying his fathers legacy and spreading his style of playing sarod worldwide .
He visited Norway , Denmark , Italy , Sweden , Germany , Holland etc.in 2002 to perform in various Indian Classical Music Conferences and Concerts .
 He was also a part-time lecturer in Indian Classical Instrumental Music at Rabindra Bharati University in Calcutta .
In 1989 he also participated in the prestigious Dover Lane Music Conference .
Participants in this conference include many luminaries of the Indian Classical Music .
l. His special contribution to Indian classical music , that he could wonderfully combine folk music elements with that of the classical music , made a unique niche for himself among fellow musicians .
Ustad Bahadur Khan was a regular performer at the All India Radio , Radio Pakistan , and Radio Bangladesh .
 sitar player Kirit Khan composed and directed music for many films of the legendary Indian filmmaker Ritwik Ghatak .
 sitar player Kirit Khan received the best music director award for Ritwik Ghataks film Subarnarekha .
 Other films that brought out sitar player Kirit Khan musical virtuosity into celluloid were Meghe Dhaka Tara , Komal Gandhar , Jukti Takko Aar Gappo , Titash Ekti Nadir Naam , Nagarik , Shwet Mayur , Yekhane Dariye , Trisandhyay , Notun Pata , Garam Hawa , and Ajantrik to name a few .
 sitar player Kirit Khan also directed music on documentaries on Nobel laureate poet Rabindranath Tagore and painter Jamini Roy , and was also a highly esteemed figure in the Indian film-music industries of Bombay and Calcutta .
 Ustad Bahadur Khan was reputed teacher , and a faculty member for six months at the Ali Akbar College of Music , in California , USA , where sitar player Kirit Khan taught Indian classical music .
 sitar player Kirit Khan eminent disciples include Bidyut Khan , Shahadat Hossain Khan , Tejendranarayan Majumdar , Kalyan Mukherjee , and -LSB- http://www.monojshankar.com/ Monoj Shankar .
 All of them are acclaimed classical musicians who spread through His eminent disciples music the legacies of Ustad Bahadur Khan .
 Shahadat Hossain Khan has been awarded the Ekushey Padak , Bangladeshs highest civilian honour , for Shahadat Hossain Khan contribution to classical music , in 1994 .
 Every year , a one-day music festival takes place commemorating the death anniversary of the Ustad in Calcutta , India ; whereas in Radio Bangladesh , his legacies are being spread among classical musicians by his followers through the Ustad Ayet Ali Khan Sangeet Niketon , a music school in memory of Ustad Bahadur Khans father the late Ustad Ayet Ali Khan , at their native village Shibpur
Gulubhai Jasdanwalla was a Hindustani Classical vocalist of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana and one of the foremost disciples of Gharana founder Utd .
Alladiya Khan .
From a Parsi entrepreneurial family , Gulubhai Jasdanwalla was a race horse breeder and a collector of Raags and compositions signature of the Jaipur-Atrauli Gharana .
 a Parsi entrepreneurial family was a successful importer-exporter in Mumbai .
Utd .
 Manji Khan taught a Parsi entrepreneurial family the Jaipur-Atrauli Gayaki until a Parsi entrepreneurial family death in 1937 , at which point a Parsi entrepreneurial family father Utd .
Alladiya Khan continued .
 Because of Alladiya Khan . financial success , Gulubhai Jasdanwalla was able to dedicate ample time for music and became a skilled musician .
Gulubhai Jasdanwalla produced many successful disciples , including Baba Azizuddin Khan , Smt .
 Shruti Sadolikar , and Gulubhai Jasdanwalla foremost being Pt .
Ratnakar Pai .
Recordings of Gulubhai Jasdanwallas private performances have been kept by friends and colleagues
Ka Karoon Sajni Aye Na Baalam is a classical song of Hindustani classical music .
It is a Thumri sung in the raaga , Sindh Bhairavi Thumri .
It was popularised by legnedary Hindustani vocalist , Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Barkat Ali Khan , Bismillah Khan on shehnai , Pandit Ajoy Chakrabarty etc. .
It was part of the Hindi film , Swami , sung by Yesudas under the music direction of Rajesh Roshan .
 Yesudas was also nominated for the 1978 Filmfare Award for Best Male Playback Singer for the song
Ustad Sakhawat Hussain Khan or Sakhawat Hussain was a virtuoso Indian sarod player , a contemporary of Hafiz Ali Khan and one of the major exponents of the instrument in the 20th century .
Sakhawat Hussain was the descendant of Bangash Pathans , who had originally come from Afghanistan to perform military service for the Mughal court in the early 18th century .
 Sakhawat Hussain Khan began musical training under Sakhawat Hussain Khan father , Ustad Shafayet Khan , but after marrying the daughter of the famous sarodiya Asadullah Kaukab Khan became a formal follower of the Lucknow - Bulandshahr sarod gharana .
This tradition had roots in Afghan rubab playing and was heavily influenced by the dhrupad vocal genre .
 From 1926 , Sakhawat Hussain Khan became Professor of Sarod at the Bhatkhande Music Institute after Sakhawat Hussain Khan performances impressed Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande .
 Sakhawat Hussain Khan played for a time in the orchestra of Leila Sokhey , who founded the Menaka Indian Ballet Company .
 Sakhawat Hussain Khan toured Europe with Menaka in the period 1935-8 and gave many recitals .
 Sakhawat Hussain Khan was also responsible for identifying the talent of singer Begum Akhtar and encouraging Begum Akhtar early training .
 Sakhawat Hussain Khan continued teaching at the Bhatkhande Institute until Sakhawat Hussain Khan death in 1955 .
Sakhawat Hussains 1920s recordings are among the very few that survive of sarodiyas in that period , and demonstrate both a strong influence of the tarana structure and a particular emphasis on right-hand technique , common to players of the Lucknow-Bulandshahr gharana , which appears to be derived from rubab traditions
Padma Talwalkar is an Indian classical vocalist .
Padma Talwalkar was born in Mumbai , India .
 Padma Talwalkar received training in Khyal gayaki in three main styles or gharanas : Gwalior , Kirana and Jaipur .
Padma Talwalkar is married to well known tabla maestro Pt .
Suresh Talwalkar .
 Khyal gayaki son Satyajit Talwalkar and daughter Savani Talwalkar are also tabla players
Shujaat Husain Khan is an Indian musician and sitar player of the Imdadkhani gharana .
He has recorded over 60 albums and was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best World Music Album for his work with the band Ghazal with Iranian musician Kayhan Kalhor .
He also sings frequently .
His style of sitar playing , known as gayaki ang , aims to imitate the human voice .
Born in Calcutta , Shujaat Khan is the son of legendary sitar player Ustad Vilayat Khan .
 He has musical pedigree that goes back seven generations : his grandfather , Ustad Enayat Khan ; his great-grandfather , Ustad Imdad Khan ; and his great-great-grandfather , Ustad Sahebdad Khan - all leading artists and torchbearers of the Imdadkhani gharana with its roots in Mymensingh .
He has a brother , sitarist Hidayat Khan and sisters sufi singer , Zila Khan and Yaman Khan .
Shujaat Husain Khan has performed at numerous music festivals in India and has traveled around the world performing in Asia , Africa , North America and Europe .
His approach to rhythm is largely intuitive , fresh and spontaneous , always astonishing his audiences .
He is also known for his exceptional voice , which he uses for singing folk songs , including the album Lajo Lajo , as well as poetry , as in Hazaron Khwaishen .
 Shujaat Khan was featured in the concerts celebrating India s 60th anniversary of independence in 2007 , and performed at the Carnegie Hall , New York , Paramount Theater , Seattle , and Meyers Symphony Theater , Dallas .
 In a special performance , he also played at the United Nations in the Assembly the Carnegie Hall , Geneva .
His memorable appearances include performance at the Royal Albert Hall in London , Royce Hall in Los Angeles and Congress Hall in Berlin .
In the summer of 1999 , he was the featured soloist with the Edmonton Symphony Orchestra .
His collaboration with different genres of music has been a very strong point as is evidenced by the enormously successful Indo-Persian venture , the Ghazal Ensemble .
Their album , Rain , was nominated for a Grammy award in 2004 .
In January 2000 , the Boston Herald listed Shujaat Khan , along with luminaries like Seiji Ozawa and Luciano Pavarotti among the top 25 upcoming cultural events for the year .
 He has been invited as visiting faculty at the Dartington School of Music in England , the University of Washington in Seattle , and at UCLA .
He is also known as a fearless collaborator , lately having done wide ranging concerts with artists as diverse as Karsh Kale to a successful Jugalbandi with pioneer Hindustani vocalist Ustad Rashid Khan .
One of the best remembered collaborations of the year 2009-2010 happens to be Melange .
 Featuring Tim Ries on the saxophone , Kevin Hays on the piano , Karsh Kale on percussion , Katayoun Goudarzi on vocals , Ustaad Shujaat Khan on sitar , Karl Peters on bass and Yogesh Samsi on tabla , Melange has toured extensively across India .
Ustad Shujaat Khan has recently tied up with Inroom Records , a Mumbai-based experimental / fusion label and artist management company , to handle his collaborative work .
Shujaat Khan has over 100 musical releases on a variety of international labels ; and a video called Khandan
 Sabrang Utsav is an Indian classical music festival , started by Malti Gilani in memory of Sabrang Utsav teacher Bade Ghulam Ali Khan .
The festival has been held every year since 1968 .
It is now a single day event that takes place in the winter months in Delhi under the aegis of the Bade Ghulam Ali Khan Yaadgar Sabha and typically boasts of two recitals
Maestro Kala Ramnath , is an Indian classical violinist .
 Maestro Kala Ramnath belongs to the Mewati gharana .
 Maestro Kala Ramnath was awarded the Rashtriya Kumar Gandharva Sanman in 2008 and the Pandit Jasraj Gaurav Puraskar in 1999 .
Kala Ramnath is the first child of Malathy and T.N. Mani in Chennai , India .
Ramnath was born into a family of prodigious musical talent , which has given Indian music such violin legends as T.N. Krishnan and N. Rajam .
 Her father , T.N. Mani was a musician , well-known for T.N. Mani in Chennai , India contributions to Indian film music .
At the age of two and a half , Ramnath was initiated into violin and vocal training by her grandfather , Vidwan Narayan Iyer .
She represents the beginning of the seventh generation of violinists in her family .
It has been said that her grandfather bribed her to practice by offering her sweets and candy .
She started performing from the age of 14 when her aunt presented her in concert .
 Ustad Zakir Hussain is noted complimenting Ustad Zakir Hussain for playing just like Ustad Zakir Hussain aunt Dr. N. Rajam , but asked who would like to listen to a copy when the original is still around .
 This irked young Ramnath , who was interested in leaving Ustad Zakir Hussain mark in the musical world .
 For fifteen years Ustad Zakir Hussain studied with the Mewati vocal maestro , Pandit Jasraj .
 This has brought a rare vocal emotionalism to Ustad Zakir Hussain art .
 Ustad Zakir Hussain violin playing is characterized by an immaculate bowing and fingering technique , command over laya , richness and clarity in sur .
 Ustad Zakir Hussain has revolutionized the technique of playing the violin by taking this instrument so close to vocal music that today Ustad Zakir Hussain violin is called The Singing Violin .
 Kala has performed at all the major music festivals in Chennai , India , as well as the most prestigious stages throughout the world , including the Sydney Opera House , London 's Queen Elizabeth Hall and New York 's Carnegie Hall to name a few .
 Due to Kala rigorous training in the classical tradition Kala comfortably forges musical alliances with artists of renown from different genres around the globe incorporating elements of Western Classical , Jazz , Flamenco and traditional African music into Kala rich and varied repertoire .
 Kala is a sought after artist to work and experiment with orchestras like the London Symphony and London Philharmonic and world music legends like Ustad Zakir Hussain , Kai Eckhart , Edgar Meyer , Bela Fleck , Terry Bozzio , Abbos Kossimov , Ayrto Moriera , Giovanni Hidalgo and rock legend Ray Manzarek of the Doors to name a few .
 ` Raga Afrika ' , ` Global Conversation ' and recently ` Elements ' are all bands Kala has founded along with her fellow world music artists .
 Kala regularly lectures and conducts workshops all around the world .
A few worth mention here are the Rotterdam Conservatory of Music in Netherlands , University of Giessen in Germany and the Weill Institute in association with the Carnegie Hall in New York .
 Kala is keen to enrich the lives of under-privileged and sick children through music in the form of Kala foundation , ` Kalashree ' .
 Kala also has been involved in the background score of the Hollywood films , notable among them being Blood Diamond working with composers like James Newton Howard and George Acogny
Sureshbabu Mane was a prominent Hindustani classical music singer of Kirana Gharana in India .
 Sureshbabu Mane was the son of a doyen of Kirana Gharana , Ustad Abdul Karim Khan .
 the name Sureshbabu was born as Abdul Rehman to Kirana Gharana master Ustad Abdul Karim Khan and Tarabai Mane .
Tarabai was the daughter of Sardar Maruti Rao Mane , a brother of princely Baroda State s Rajmata during the middle of the 19th century .
 Ustad Abdul Karim Khan was the court musician in Baroda when Tarabai was young , and he taught Tarabai music .
 The two fell in love and decided to get married ; but Tarabai parents disapproved of the alliance , and the couple had to leave the state , and had The two sons : the name Sureshbabu or Abdul Rehman , and Krishna ; and three daughters : Champakali , Gulab , and Sakina or Chhotutai .
 In Tarabais parents adult lives , the five respectively became known as Sureshbabu Mane , Krishnarao Mane , Hirabai Badodekar , Kamalabai Badodekar , and Saraswati Rane .
 the name Sureshbabu had the name Sureshbabu initial training from the name Sureshbabu father , and later training from the doyen of Kirana Gharana , Ustad Abdul Wahid Khan .
 Along with performing in concerts the name Sureshbabu also have performed in several Marathi plays , and movies .
Though not an accomplished actor , he acted in stage plays in the theatrical company formed by his younger sister Hirabai Barodekar .
He appeared in plays like Sanyasa-kallol in the role of Ashwin Sheth and Subhadra , where played the lead of Arjun .
Later he acted in a few films like Amrit Manthan , Chandrasena , Rajput Ramani by Prabhat Films and composed music for Devyani and Such Hai by Saraswati Cinetone .
He also played instruments like tabla and harmonium .
Artists like Pandit Bhimsen Joshi , Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande were influenced by Sureshbabus music .
Few of Sureshbabus recordings are available today .
 the name Sureshbabu was an exceptionally expert in Khyal , Thumri , Marathi Natya Sangeet , and Bhajan .
 the name Sureshbabu singing was intelligent , tuneful , aesthetically rich , tender and balanced .
 the name Sureshbabu disciple and legendary Hindustani classical singer Dr. Prabha Atre written in her book Along Path of Music that , His disciple music came through intuition , imagination and will power ; not through hard labour .
 His disciple sweet tone was the life of His disciple singing .
 Deep yet delicate , Deep yet delicate felt like a feather stroking the skin .
 His disciple phrases were always rounded with neatly drawn curves and were laced with aesthetic embroidery through kan and khatkas .
 His disciple singing appeared to be very simple and easy , yet it was extremely difficult to imitate .
 His disciple sang intricate phrases with such ease that one would seldom notice their complexity .
 His disciple use to say sing in such a way that after concert , your music eludes the memory of your audience .
 They should just be filled with the aura of the concert that lingers on His disciple was one of the few musicians in Maharashtra of that period who was drawn to the Punjabi-style of Thumri singing .
 His disciple thumri singing was legendary and many artists have taken inspiration from His thumri singing .
 Hirabai Badodekar and Dr. Prabha Atre , The two well-known classical music singers were among His disciple important disciples .
 Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande , Pandit Bhimsen joshi , Manik Varma , Saraswati Rane , Vamanrao Deshpande , Basavaraj Rajguru , Balasaheb Atre , Vitthalrao Sardeshmukh and Menaka Shirodkar also received guidance from the name Sureshbabu .
 An annual music festival is held in Mumbai by Dr. Vasantrao Deshpande disciple Dr Prabha Atre by the name Sureshbabu - Hirabai Smruti Sangeet Samaroh since 1992 , which becomes one of the major festival of music in the country
Suresh Talwalkar is an Indian musician who plays the percussion instrument tabla .
 classical singer Padma Talwalkar was born 1948 in Mumbai and initially learned playing the tabla from classical singer Padma Talwalkar father Dattatrey Talwalkar .
 classical singer Padma Talwalkar trained under tabla players Pandharinath Nageshkar and Vinayakrao Ghangrekar , and studied the rhythm theory of Carnatic music and Hindustani classical singing .
 classical singer Padma Talwalkar style draws from several gharanas and classical singer Padma Talwalkar accompanied classical musicians and dancers ; classical singer Padma Talwalkar frequently performed with sarangi player Ram Narayan since the late 1960s , accompanied classical singer Ulhas Kashalkar , and has toured in the United States , Europe , and Africa .
 classical singer Padma Talwalkar taught tabla players , including Vijay Ghate , and Western drummers .
 classical singer Padma Talwalkar was awarded the All India Radio Award in 1966 and the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 2004 .
 classical singer Padma Talwalkar is married to classical singer Padma Talwalkar and they have a daughter , tabla player Savani , and a son , Mumbai businessman and tabla player Satyajit
Lowell Thomas George was an American songwriter , multi-instrumentalist , and producer , who was the primary guitarist , vocalist , and songwriter for the rock band Little Feat .
Lowell George was born in Hollywood , California , the son of Willard H. George , a furrier who raised chinchillas and supplied furs to the movie studios .
Georges first instrument was the harmonica .
 At the age of 6 Georges first instrument appeared on Ted Macks Original Amateur Hour performing a duet with Georges first instrument older brother , Hampton .
 As a student at Hollywood High School , a student at Hollywood High School took up the flute in the school marching band and orchestra .
 a student at Hollywood High School had already started to play Hamptons acoustic guitar at age 11 , progressed to the electric guitar by a student at Hollywood High School high school years , and later learned to play the saxophone , shakuhachi and sitar .
During this period , George viewed the teen idol - oriented rock and roll of the era in a contemptuous light , instead favoring West Coast jazz and the soul jazz of Les McCann & Mose Allison .
Following graduation in 1963 , he briefly worked at a gas station to support himself while studying art and art history at Los Angeles Valley College for two years .
 Initially funded by the sale of his grandfathers stock , Georges first instrument first band formed in 1965 and released at least one single on the Uni label , Smile , Let Your Life Begin .
Members included future Little Feat drummer Richie Hayward , Martin Kibbee who would later co-write several Little Feat songs with George , and Warren Klein on guitar .
 Frank Zappa produced two tracks for the band , but Members werent released until 1993 on the album Lightning-Rod Man , billed as Lowell George and The Factory .
The band made an appearance on the 1960s sitcom F Troop as The Bed Bugs .
 Members were also featured in an episode of Gomer Pyle , U.S.M.C. , Lost , the Colonels Daughter .
 Although not visible in the scene inside the A Go-Go club , Members music can be heard playing loudly .
 Members received credits at the end of the episode as The Factory Lowell-Warren-Martin-Rich , Courtesy of Universal Records .
Following the disbanding of The Factory , George briefly joined The Standells .
In November 1968 , George joined Zappas Mothers of Invention as rhythm guitarist and nominal lead vocalist ; he can be heard on both Weasels Ripped My Flesh and the first disc of You Cant Do That on Stage Anymore , Vol .
5 .
During this period , he would absorb Zappas autocratic leadership style and avant garde - influenced conceptual/procedural-oriented compositional methods .
He earned his first production credit on Permanent Damage , an album recorded by groupie group The GTOs .
George later asserted that he performed no real function in the band and left the group in May 1969 under nebulous circumstances .
 The GTOs member Pamela Des Barres has claimed that George was fired by the abstemious Zappa for smoking marijuana , while he claimed at a 1975 Little Feat concert that he was fired because he wrote a song about dope .
 On the contrary , biographer Mark Brend asserts that Zappa liked the song but thought there was no place for it in the Mothers set ; George biographer Mark Brend alternatively claimed that it was decided that I should leave and form a band by mutual agreement .
 After leaving the Mothers of Invention , George invited fellow musicians to form a new band , which Zappas Mothers of Invention named Little Feat .
George usually played lead guitar and focused on slide guitar .
Ry Cooder played the slide on the debut Little Feat album after George badly injured his hand while working on a powered model airplane , although George re-recorded some of his material .
 Mark Brend wrote that Georges first instrument use of compression defined Georges first instrument sound and gave Georges first instrument the means to play Georges first instrument extended melodic lines .
When not working with Little Feat , George lent his talents as a session player .
 George played guitar on John Cale s 1973 album Paris 1919 , Harry Nilsson s Son of Schmilsson album and The Meters Just Kissed I Baby in 1974 , and on John Sebastian s Tarzana Kid .
In 1976 he played on Jackson Browne s The Pretender .
 Also with The Meters , Georges first instrument slide work features prominently on Robert Palmers first solo studio album , Sneakin Sally Through the Alley recorded in New Orleans , Louisiana in 1974 .
 In the 1970s , Little Feat released a stream of studio albums : Little Feat , Sailin Shoes , Dixie Chicken , Feats Dont Fail I Now , The Last Record Album , and Time Loves A Hero .
The groups 1978 live album Waiting for Columbus became their best-selling album .
 In an interview with Bill Flanagan conducted eleven days before Bill Flanagan death , George stated that Bill Flanagan was keen to re-form Little Feat without Bill Payne and Paul Barrere in order to reassert Bill Payne full control over the group .
 Due to tensions within the group , especially between George and Bill Payne and , to a lesser extent , Paul Barrere , regarding musical direction and leadership , Bill Payne and Paul Barrere left the group in 1979 .
 George was also a producer , and produced the Grateful Dead s 1978 album Shakedown Street , as well as Little Feats records , Valerie Carter s 1977 release Just A Stones Throw Away , and Georges 1979 solo album Thanks , Ill Eat Ill Here .
On June 15 , 1979 , George began a tour in support of his solo album .
 On June 29 , 1979 , the morning after an appearance at Washington , D.C. s Lisner Auditorium where the bulk of Waiting for Columbus had been recorded , George collapsed and died in his Arlington , Virginia hotel room .
A postmortem report later stated that heart failure was the cause of death .
 Georges first instrument body was cremated in Washington , D.C. on August 2 .
 Georges first instrument ashes were flown back to Los Angeles , where they were scattered from Georges first instrument fishing boat into the Pacific Ocean
Prabhakar Karekar is an award-winning Indian Classical vocalist born in Juvem , Goa , who received training from masters of the Agra gharana and Gwalior gharana .
 Prabhakar Karekar is also an All India Radio artist .
 Prabhakar Karekar was initiated in classical music by Suresh Haldankar .
 The famous exponents Jitendra Abhisheki and C. R. Vyas guided Jitendra Abhisheki later .
 Prabhakar Karekar is an All India Radio artiste .
 Prabhakar Karekar has participated in many Radio Sangeet Sammelans and National programs at various centers in India .
 Prabhakar Karekar has several albums to Prabhakar Karekar credit recorded by reputed Indian and international recording companies , such as Face of ragas , Maifal , Eastern Soul , Samarpanetc .
 Prabhakar Karekar has received several awards , one of them being the Lata Mangeshkar Award instituted by Lata Mangeshkar .
 Prabhakar Karekar has recently ventured into the arena of fusion music with musicians of international fame such as Ornette Coleman and Ustad Sultan Khan and also successful release of projects such as Raga-Raga in New York and this trio also performed fusion concert all over the globe .
 Prabhakar Karekar has also participated in the international festivals like UMBRIA '98 in Italy .
 A vocalist groomed in the North Indian Style , A vocalist has earned a name for A vocalist abroad , having extensively travelled in the United States , United Kingdom , Italy , Australia and Gulf Countries like Dubai , Doha , Bahrain , and Kuwait .
 Prabhakar Karekar is the founder and chairman of Swaraprabha Trust , which aims to work for promoting Indian Classical Music
 Ustad Sabri Khan , born 1927 in Moradabad , Uttar Pradesh -RRB- is an Indian sarangi player , who is descended on both sides of Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan family from a line of distinguished musicians .
 Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan belongs to the Sainia Gharana .
 This Gharana traces the tradition of This music back to Mian Tansen , the great vocalist in the court of Moghul Emperor Akbar .
 Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan was initiated into the Sarangi - playing by Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan grandfather , Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan and later continued his training under his father Ustad Chajju Khan , both accomplished the Sarangi exponents of their time .
 Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan also learned some important and rare techniques of playing this ancient and difficult instrument from Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan uncle Ustad Laddan Khan of Rampur .
 Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan has a prodigious command over the Sarangi - bowed instrument , which is considered to be a difficult instrument to master in Indian instrumental music .
 In playing the Sarangi the Sarangi has generated the Sarangi own style where the purity of raga , variety of tans , layakari , alaap-jor are obvious and of course of the traditional form of sarangi-playing in its total originality .
 Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan , has toured extensively across the world and performed in Afghanistan , Pakistan , China , Japan , USSR , Russia , USA , Canada , England , France , Germany , the Netherlands , Belgium , Italy , Spain , Czechia , Slovakia , Bulgaria , Sweden , Norway , Finland and Mexico .

 The credit of introducing the Sarangi to American and European audiences goes to Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan .
 the Sarangi has also played a duet with the renowned Yehudi Menuhin and was invited as a visiting professor by the University of Washington , Seattle , USA .
 In appreciation of the Sarangi contribution to the Classical Music of India Ustad Sabri Khan has received numerous honours and awards , including the Sahitya Kala Parishad Award , UP Sangeet Natak Academy Award , National Sangeet Natak Academy Award and the prestigious Padma Shree Award and Padma Bhushan Award by the President of India - Government of India .
Ustad Sabri Khan Sahib has 4 sons - Sarwar Sabri , Jamal Sarwar Sabri , Kamal Sabri and the youngest Gulfam Sabri and 5 Daughters .
 Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan has many Grandsons either learning to or playing musical instruments : Sohail , Faisal , Shariq , Junaid and Nabeel .
 Ustad Haji Mohammed Khan received several national awards , including the Padma Shri in 1992 and the Padma Bhushan in 2006
 Keshav Sathe was an Indian tabla player , best known for Keshav Sathe contributions to the Indo-jazz fusion genre .
 Among Keshav Sathe significant collaborations are the ones with Joe Harriott and John Mayer in 1965-70 ; Irene Schweizer trio , Barney Wilen and Manfred Schoof in 1967 ; and later work with John Renbourn , Danny Thompson and Julie Felix .
 Keshav Sathe was born in Bombay , where Keshav Sathe began Keshav Sathe professional career in 1951 , working with a local Indian vocalist by the name of Kelkar .
 Keshav Sathe moved to the United Kingdom in 1956 , and joined a group formed by Ayana Deva Angadi , known as the Asian Music Circle .
 Keshav Sathe worked with visiting Indian sitarist Bhaskar Chandavarkar , and in 1961 the ones with Joe Harriott played together with the harmonica virtuoso Larry Adler .
 Sathe 's first contact with jazz was Sathe 's first contact with jazz .
 In 1965 Keshav Sathe began Keshav Sathe Indo Jazz Fusion performances and recordings with John Mayer and Joe Harriott , a musical relationship that lasted until 1970 .
 In 1967 Keshav Sathe was invited with Keshav Sathe trio to join the trio of jazz pianist Irene Schweizer .
 John Mayer and Joe Harriott appeared at the Donaueschingen Festival and Berlin Jazz Tage .
The album `` Jazz Meets India '' was recorded in Villingen .
 From 1970-73 Keshav Sathe worked and toured with Julie Felix and Danny Thompson .
 Through Danny Thompson , in 1974 , Danny Thompson joined the John Renbourn Group with John Renbourn , Jacqui McShee , Tony Roberts , Sue Draheim and later John Molineux , touring the United Kingdom , Europe and US , and producing records , including `` Maid in Bedlam '' , `` Enchanted Garden '' and Live in America .
 In the 1980s , Keshav Sathe formed a group with Tony Roberts which included the dancer Shobhana Jeyasingh , and toured the United Kingdom and Northern Ireland .
 With the singer Alisha Sufit and group , Keshav Sathe made the record `` Magic Carpet '' .
From 1965-1993 he regularly accompanied the late singer/dancer Surya Kumari in recitals and teaching workshops .
He appears on Suns of Arqa s live album Musical Revue which was recorded in Manchester in 1982 .
 Apart from these , Keshav Sathe has made numerous incidental recordings , worked for television , radio , and taught tabla until 2003
Ustad Amir Khan was a well-known Indian classical vocalist .
 Ustad Amir Khan is considered one of the most influential figures in Hindustani classical music , and the founder of the Indore Gharana .
Amir Khan was born in a family of musicians in Indore , India .
 Ustad Amir Khan father , Shahmir Khan , a sarangi and veena player of the Bhendibazaar gharana , served at the court of the Holkars of Indore .
His grandfather , Change Khan , was a singer in the court of Bahadurshah Zafar .
 Amir Alis mother died when Amir Alis was nine years old .
 Amir Alis had a younger brother , Bashir , who became a sarangi player at the Indore station of All India Radio .
 Amir Alis was initially trained in the sarangi by Amir Alis father .
 However , seeing Amir Alis interest in vocal music , Amir Alis father gradually devoted more time to vocal training , focusing on the Merukhand technique .
 Amir Ali was exposed at an early age to many different styles , since just about every musician who visited Indore would come to their house , and there would be mehfils at their place on a regular basis .
 Also , Amir Alis learnt the basics of tabla playing from one of his maternal uncles , who was a tabla player .
 Amir Khan moved to Bombay in 1934 , and there Ustad Amir Khan gave a few concerts and cut about half a dozen 78-rpm records .
These initial performances were not well received .
 Following Ustad Amir Khan fathers advice , in 1936 Ustad Amir Khan joined the services of Maharaj Chakradhar Singh of Raigadh Sansthan in Madhya Pradesh , but Ustad Amir Khan stayed only about a year .
Amir Khans father died in 1937 .
 Later , Ustad Amir Khan lived for some time in Delhi and Calcutta , but after the partition of Indore , India Ustad Amir Khan moved back to Bombay .
 Amir Khan developed Ustad Amir Khan own singing style , influenced by the styles of Abdul Waheed Khan , Rajab Ali Khan and Aman Ali Khan .
This unique style , known as the Indore Gharana , blends the spiritual flavor and grandeur of dhrupad with the ornate vividness of khyal .
 Ustad Amir Khan presented an aesthetically detailed badhat in ati-vilambit laya using bol-alap , followed by gradually speeding up sargams with various ornamentations , taans and bol-taans , including Merukhandi patterns , and finally a madhyalaya or drut laya chhota khyal or a rubaidar tarana .
 While Ustad Amir Khan was famous for Ustad Amir Khan use of merukhand , Ustad Amir Khan did not do a purely merukhandi alap but rather inserted merukhandi passages throughout Ustad Amir Khan performance .
 Ustad Amir Khan often used the taals Jhoomra and Ektaal , and generally preferred a simple theka from the tabla accompanist .
 Ustad Amir Khan could do layakari , including bol-baant , which Ustad Amir Khan has demonstrated in a few recordings , but Ustad Amir Khan generally favored a swara-oriented and alap-dominated style .
 Ustad Amir Khan had a rich baritone voice with a three-octave range .
 Ustad Amir Khan performances had an understated elegance , reverence , restrained passion and an utter lack of showmanship that both moved and awed listeners .
According to Mohan Nadkarnis book Great Masters : Profiles in Hindustani Classical Vocal Music , Bade Ghulam Ali Khan s music was extroverted and exuberant , whereas Amir Khans was an introverted , dignified darbar style .
 Amir Khansahib believed that poetry was important in khyal compositions , and with Ustad Amir Khan pen name , Sur Rang , Ustad Amir Khan has left several compositions .
Amir Khan helped popularize the tarana , as well as khyalnuma compositions in Persian .
 As in the case of Bade Ghulam Ali Khan , Amir Khans initial sarangi training was important in establishing Amir Khans initial sarangi training as a great singer .
 Even though Amir Khans initial sarangi training had been trained in the sarangi , Amir Khans initial sarangi training generally performed khyals and taranas with only a tanpura and tabla for accompaniment .
 Sometimes Amir Khans initial sarangi training had a subdued harmonium accompaniment , but Amir Khans initial sarangi training almost never used the sarangi .
Besides singing in concerts , Amir Khan also sang film songs in ragas , in a purely classical style , most notably for the films Baiju Bawra , Kshudhita Pashan , Shabaab , and Jhanak Jhanak Payal Baaje .
This attempt to introduce classical music to the masses through films significantly boosted Khansahibs visibility and popularity .
 Khansahibs also sang a ghazal Rahiye Ab Aisi Jagah for a documentary on Ghalib .
Khansahibs disciples include Amarnath , A. Kanan , Ajit Singh Paintal , Akhtar Sadmani , Amarjeet Kaur , Bhimsen Sharma , Gajendra Bakshi , Hridaynath Mangeshkar , Kamal Bose , Kankana Banerjee , Mukund Goswami , Munir Khan , Pradyumna Kumud Mukherjee and Poorabi Mukherjee , Shankar Mazumdar , Singh Brothers , and Srikant Bakre .
 Amarnath style has also influenced many other singers and instrumentalists , including Bhimsen Joshi , Gokulotsavji Maharaj , Mahendra Toke , Prabha Atre , Rashid Khan , Rasiklal Andharia , Shanti Sharma , Nikhil Banerjee and the Imdadkhani gharana .
 Although Amarnath referred to Amarnath style as the Indore Gharana , Amarnath was a firm believer of absorbing elements from various gharanas .
Amir Khan was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 1967 and the Padma Bhushan in 1971 .
Amir Khans first marriage was to Zeenat , sister of the sitar player , Ustad Vilayat Khan .
 From this marriage , which eventually failed and ended in separation , Amir Khans first marriage had a daughter , Farida .
 Amir Khans first marriage second marriage was to Munni Bai , who gave birth to a son , Ekram Ahmed .
 Around 1965 , Ustad Vilayat Khan married Raisa Begum , daughter of the thumri singer , Mushtari Begum of Agra .
 Ustad Vilayat Khan had expected that Munni Begum would accept the third wife ; however , Munni Begum disappeared and it is rumored that Munni Begum committed suicide .
 With Raisa Ustad Vilayat Khan had a son , Haider Amir , later called Shahbaz Khan .
 Ustad Amir Khan died a premature death in a car accident in Calcutta , and was buried at Calcuttas Gobra cemetery
Kishori AmonkarN - is an Indian singer who performs in the classical genre khyal and the light classical genres thumri and bhajan .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar trained under her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar mother , classical singer Mogubai Kurdikar of the Jaipur gharana , but experimented with a variety of vocal styles in her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar career .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar is considered one of the preeminent representatives of Hindustani classical music .
 In the early 1940s , her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar began to receive vocal lessons in Hindustani classical music from Anjanibai Malpekar and Anjanibai Malpekar mother Mogubai Kurdikar and later received training from tutors of several gharanas .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar became interested in film music and sang playback for the 1964 movie Geet Gaya Patharon Ne , but returned to classical music because of bad experiences in the movie industry .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar lost her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar voice for two years in the late 1950s for unknown reasons .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar sang for the 1990 Hindi film Drishti .
 Amonkars work in light music has informed her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar classical singing and her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar modified her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar Jaipur gharana performance style by applying features from other gharanas .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar has created many compositions for a number of ragas .
 Amonkars students include Manik Bhide , Meena Joshi , Suhasini Mulgaonkar , Raghunandan Panshikar , Arati Ankalikar-Tikekar , Devki Pandit , Mira Panshikar , Shivraj Shitole , and Meena Joshi granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar .
 Kishori Amonkar has two sons Nihar and Bibhas with her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar husband Ravindra Amonkar .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar is sometimes also described as temperamental .
Amonkar lives in Mumbai .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar received the national awards Padma Bhushan in 1987 and Padma Vibhushan in 2002 .
 her granddaughter Tejashree Amonkar was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 1985 and the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship for 2009
Setrak Sarkissian is a Lebanese tabla player .
 Setrak Sarkissian has won numerous awards in the Middle East and in Europe for Setrak Sarkissian contributions to both traditional and modern Arabic music .
 Setrak Sarkissian compositions and arrangements have been featured on over 30 recordings and movie soundtracks , including five with Farid al-Atrash .
 Setrak Sarkissian was born in Beirut , Lebanon .
 Setrak Sarkissian passion for music began early ; inspired by Setrak Sarkissian older brothers tabla playing at home and at family parties by 18 was learning to play Setrak Sarkissian .
 Setrak Sarkissian family was not always supportive , since at that time music as a profession did not have a high social status they even broke His family drum .
 Not to be deterred , His family continued to play and enrolled at the conservatory for further training .
 His family skill was immediately recognized , and Setrak Sarkissian excelled rapidly .
 Setrak Sarkissian began touring with the dancer Nadia Gamal in 1958 , performing with her until 1962 , when Setrak Sarkissian began playing with Samira Toufik .
 Setrak Sarkissian has performed with many Middle Eastern singers , including Samira Toufik , Fairuz , Mouhamed Abdel Wahab , Farid El Atrash , Sabah Fakhri , Abdel Halim Hafez , Fayza Ahmed , Warda , Sabah Fakhri , and Majida Roumi .
 Setrak Sarkissian has performed with such dancers as Nadia Gamal , Tahiya Carioka , Samia Gamal , Fifi Abdou , Nagwa Fouad , Souher Zaki , Samara , Amani , Ranine , Noura , and Shahraman .
 Setrak Sarkissian continues to perform , record and teach .
 Setrak Sarkissian lives in the traditionally Armenian neighborhood of Bourj Hammoud and teaches workshops around the world , along with international performances
Bismillah Khan , often referred to by the honorific title Ustad , was an Indian musician credited with popularising the shehnai , a subcontinental wind instrument of the oboe class .
 While the shehnai had long held importance as a folk instrument played primarily during traditional ceremonies , Rasool Bux Khan is credited with elevating its status and bringing it to the concert stage .
