 Rasool Bux Khan was awarded India 's highest civilian honour , the Bharat Ratna , in 2001 , becoming the Third classical musician after M. S. Subbulakshmi and Ravi Shankar to be accorded this distinction .
Bismillah Khan was born on 21 March 1913 in Dumraon , Bihar in northern India .
 Rasool Bux Khan was the second son of Paigambar Khan and Mitthan .
 Rasool Bux Khan parents had initially named Rasool Bux Khan Qamaruddin to rhyme with His parents first-born son Shamshuddin .
 However , Rasool Bux Khan grandfather , Rasool Bux Khan , the shehnai master of the court of Bhojpur , exclaimed Rasool Bux Khan !
 at the sight of Rasool Bux Khan and thereafter Rasool Bux Khan came to be known by this name .
 Rasool Bux Khan ancestors were court musicians and used to play in Naqqar khana in the princely states of Bhojpur , now in Dumraon , Bihar in northern India .
 Rasool Bux Khan father was a shehnai player in the court of Maharaja Keshav Prasad Singh of Dumraon Estate , Dumraon , Bihar in northern India .
 At the age of six , he moved to old Varanasi .
He received his training under his uncle , the late Ali Baksh Vilayatu , a shehnai player attached to Varanasis Vishwanath Temple .
 Though a pious Shiite Muslim , he was also , like many Indian musicians , regardless of religion , a devotee of Saraswati , the Hindu Goddess of wisdom and arts , and often played at Hindu temples , including the famous Vishwanath Temple in old Varanasi , on the banks of the river Ganga .
He also performed for spiritual master Prem Rawat .
Bismillah Khan was perhaps single-handedly responsible for making the shehnai a famous classical instrument .
 Rasool Bux Khan brought the shehnai to the center stage of Indian music with Rasool Bux Khan concert in the Calcutta All India Music Conference in 1937 .
 Rasool Bux Khan was credited with having almost monopoly over the instrument as Rasool Bux Khan and the shehnai are almost synonyms .
 Rasool Bux Khan is one of the finest musicians in post-independent Indian classical music and one of the best examples of Hindu-Muslim unity in India 's .
 Rasool Bux Khan played shehnai to audience across the world .
 Rasool Bux Khan was known to be so devoted to Rasool Bux Khan art form that Rasool Bux Khan referred to shehnai as Rasool Bux Khan begum after Rasool Bux Khan wife died .
 On Rasool Bux Khan death , as an honour , Rasool Bux Khan shehnai was buried with Rasool Bux Khan .
 Rasool Bux Khan was known for Rasool Bux Khan vision of spreading peace and love through music .
 Rasool Bux Khan had the rare honor of performing at Delhis Red Fort on the eve of Indias Independence in 1947 .
 Rasool Bux Khan also performed raga Kafi from the Red Fort on the eve of India 's first Republic Day ceremony , on January 26 , 1950 .
 Rasool Bux Khan recital had become a cultural part of Indias Independence Day celebrations , telecast on Doordarshan every year on August 15 .
 After the prime ministers speech from Lal Qila in Old Delhi , Doordarshan would broadcast a live performance by the shehnai maestro .
This tradition dated from the days of Pandit Nehru .
 Rasool Bux Khan had a brief association with movies .
 Rasool Bux Khan played the shehnai for Rajkumar s role of Appanna in the Kannada movie Sanaadi Appanna .
 Rasool Bux Khan acted in Jalsaghar , a movie by Satyajit Ray and provided sound of shehnai in Goonj Uthi Shehnai .
 Noted director Goutam Ghose directed Sange Meel Se Mulaqat , a documentary about the life of Rasool Bux Khan .
In the 1967 film The Graduate , there is a poster advertising Bismillah Khan and the seven musicians on a busy street of Berkeley , California .
 The Graduate thought that if The Graduate would be able to share The Graduate knowledge it would not be so useful as it gives them a little knowledge .
 On August 17 , 2006 , Rasool Bux Khan was taken ill and admitted to the Heritage Hospital , Varanasi for treatment .
 Rasool Bux Khan died after four days on August 21 , 2006 due to a cardiac arrest .
 Rasool Bux Khan is survived by five daughters , three sons and a large number of grandchildren and great-grandchildren , and Rasool Bux Khan adopted daughter Dr Soma Ghosh .
 The Government of India 's declared a day of national mourning on Rasool Bux Khan death .
 Rasool Bux Khan body along with a Shehnai was buried at Fatemain burial ground of old Varanasi under a neem tree with 21-gun salute from Indian Army .
 Sangeet Natak Akademi , New Delhi , instituted the Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar in 2007 , in Natak Akademi honour .
 New Delhi is given to young artists in the field of music , theatre and dance .

 ^ Life history of Bismillah Khan , the Legend of old Varanasi .
14 .
Meeting a Milestone : Ustad Bismillah Khan .
A Documentary by Goutam Ghose , 1989
Lucknow gharana , also known as Purab Gharana , is one of the six main gharanas or styles in tabla .
 The Gharana is characterized by the full usage of the palm besides the fingers , resonant sounds , and the use of ring and little fingers on the Dayan .
 The Gharana branched out of the Delhi gharana when the two brothers Modu and Bakshu Khan , the third generation of the lineage of Delhis Mia Siddhar Khan , moved to Lukhnow , due to political disturbances in Delhi , while one brother Makkhu Khan stayed on in Delhi .
 In Lucknow , the Nawabs mainly patronised Kathak , a classical dance form of the North accompanied by the pakhavaj , the still living ancestor of tabla .
 the two brothers Modu and Bakshu Khan collaborated with the performers of these arts and ended up in creating a unique style of tabla playing adapted from Kathak and pakhavaj compositions , the style now being termed as Khula Baaj or Hatheli ka Baaj .
 Among these upgrades , Gat and Paran are two types of compositions that are very common in Lucknow gharana .
 Lucknow style has also conceived Lucknow style very own item , known as Raon : Lucknow style consists of extremely fast , delicate and colourful fillings within broad and bold rhythmic designs working as a framework .
Prominent names in this Gharana include Khalifa Abid Hussain Khan , Wajid Hussain Khan , Afaaq Hussain , Ilmas Hussain , Hirendra Kumar Ganguly , Santosh Krishna Biswas , Anil Bhattacharjee and Pt .
Swapan Chaudhuri .
 Lucknow Gharana gave birth to two other Gharanas : Banaras and Farukhabad
Deenanath Mangeshkar was a well-known Marathi theatre actor , a renowned Natya Sangeet musician and an exceptional Hindustani classical vocalist .
 a well-known Marathi theatre actor was also popularly and reverentially addressed as Master Deenanath Mangeshkar .
 a well-known Marathi theatre actor is also the father of well-known singers Lata Mangeshkar , Asha Bhosle , and Usha Mangeshkar as well as composers Hridayanath Mangeshkar and Meena Khadikar .
 Deenanath Mangeshkar , popularly known as Dina , was born at Mangeshi , Ponda , Goa , Goa on 29 December 1900 .
 a well-known Marathi theatre actor fathers name was Ganesh Bhatt Abhisheki , who was a Brahmin and served as priest at .
 the famous Mangueshi Temple , and a well-known Marathi theatre actor mother was Yesubai .
 Yesubai Rane , Yesubai Rane mother belonged to Devadasi , community of Mangeshi , Goa on 29 , .
 Yesubai occasionally sang at the temple festivals and had an erring genius for music .
 Dinanaths father surname was Hardikar whose family bathed the Linga of lord Shiva at Mangueshi temple , thus they were known as Ganesh Bhatt Abhisheki .
 Dina adopted the surname Mangeshkar which means from the village of Mangeshi , Ponda , Goa in Marathi .
The father of the late Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki was Deenanath Mangeshkars half-brother .
Deenanath Mangeshkar started taking singing and music lessons from Shri Baba Mashelkar at the age of five .
 Shri Baba Mashelkar at the age of five was also to become a disciple at Gwalior school .
 Shri Baba Mashelkar at the age of five was fascinated by the variety & aggressive style of Gayanacharya Pt Ramkrishna bua Vaze and became gandabandh shagird .
 In Shri Baba Mashelkar at the age of five youth , he traveled to Bikaner and took formal training in classical music from Pt .
Sukhdev Prasad , father of Pt .
Mani Prasad , of the Kirana Gharana .
 Mani Prasad joined the Kirloskar Sangeet Mandali and the Kirloskar Natak Mandali at the age of 11 .
 Later , Mani Prasad left Kirloskar Mandali , and formed Balwant Mandali with Mani Prasad friends Chintamanrao Kolhatkar and Krishnarao Kolhapure .
 This new group had Gadkaris blessing , but shortly after the group was formed , Gadkaris died in January 1919 .
 Deenanaths good looks and melodious voice won Gadkaris popularity on the Marathi theatre .
 So much so that the then giant of the Marathi stage , Bal Gandharva publicly declared that Bal Gandharva would welcome the entry of Deenanath in Bal Gandharva organization by throwing a carpet of rupee coins under Bal Gandharva feet .
 During the period of 1935 , Bal Gandharva produced 3 films , one of them being Krishnarjun Yuddha .
 It was made in both Hindi and Marathi , and a song from it , sung by and filmed on Dina .
 Dina also studied Indian classical music music under Ramkrishna Vaze .
 Ramkrishna bua Vaze also studied astrology .
 Partly out of Ramkrishna bua Vaze interest in astrology and numerology , Ramkrishna bua Vaze believed that dramas with 5 letters , with anuswar on the third letter , were lucky for him .
Examples : Ranadundubhi , Rajsanyas , Deshkantak .
 Ranadundubhi , Rajsanyas , Deshkantak was the first musician to openly defy the British Empire by performing and singing songs penned by Veer Savarkar in the presence of the British Viceroy , in Simla .
 The dramas produced by Dina were extremely popular amongst the masses due to Ranadundubhi , Rajsanyas , Deshkantak masterly presentation of the songs composed by Ramkrishna bua Vaze bua and the patriotic content .
 Deenanath in his organization first wife was Narmada .
 Deenanath in his organization was the daughter of Seth Haridas Ramdas Lad - a prosperous businessman of the town of Thalner , Maharastra .
 Dina and Narmada were married in 1922 .
 Dina changed Narmada wifes name to Shrimati .
 Dina was 19 at the time and Dinanath was 21 .
 They had a daughter named Latika , who died in Latika infancy .
Dinanaths wife died shortly after .
 Deenanath in his organization second wife was Latika , who died in her infancy first wifes sister .
 Deenanath in his organization name was Shevanti .
 Some sources claim that Dina named Shevanti second wife Shrimati as well .
 Some have Some name as Shuddhamati .
 The marriage of Deenanath in his organization and Shevanti was solemnised at a quiet ceremony within the house in 1927 .
Shevantis mother chose not to attend .
 Deenanath in his organization and Shevanti second wife had five children : her Lata , Meena Khadikar , Asha Bhosle , Usha , and Hridaynath .
 Deenanath and his second wife first child was named Hridayanath Mangeshkar .
 But Deenanath in his organization called Deenanath in his organization Lata in memory of Their first child deceased daughter .
 The name stuck and Her name is by that name that Their first child legendary eldest daughter , Lata Mangeshkar , is known today .
 Deenanath in his organization was determined to take Their first child first step in Their first child professional life with a distinctive surname .
 So , Their first child chose the last name Mangeshkar .
 The surname was derived from name of Their first child family deity - Shri Mangesh located at Mangeshi , Ponda , Goa , Ponda , Goa .
 Deenanath in his organization took to alcohol during the days of financial hardship in 1930s .
After being ill for a few weeks , he died in Pune in April 1942 .
He was only 41 at the time his death .
 His family has erected a Deenanath Mangeshkar Hospital and research center in His family name in Pune .
 Some of His family theatrical productions , in which His family sang and starred too , are
Shrutinandan is an Indian classical music academy located in Kolkata , India .
It is run by vocalist , Pandit Ajoy Chakrabarty .
 Shrutinandan was inaugurated on July 1997 .
 July 1997 objective towards promotion of music and identifying young talent and training them on Hindustani music and Carnatic music .
The academy carries out research in Hindustani classical music in order to restore some of the undocumented works by the maestros
Rasbehari Datta was born in an illustrious family of intellectuals .
 Rasbehari Datta late father Ranbir Singh Amar was a famous author , journalist and poet of the country .
 His late father Ranbir Singh Amar maternal grand father was a well known tabla player , who served both All India Radio Lahore and Jullundur .
 His late father introduced His late father Ranbir Singh Amar to music at the age of five .
 Later His late father Ranbir Singh Amar continued His late father Ranbir Singh Amar study of sitar playing in the Patiala Gharana at the Patiala Gharana , then at a music academy at Chandigarh .
 His late father Ranbir Singh Amar finally completed His late father Ranbir Singh Amar training under Pandit Uma Shankar Mishra , the equally famous disciple of world renowned Pandit Ravi Shankar .
 Apart from acquiring a bachelors degree in Arts , His late father Ranbir Singh Amar is proficient in many languages such as Hindi , Urdu , Bengali and English .
 Rasbehari Datta started giving performances from All India Radio when Rasbehari Datta was 18 years old and from there Rasbehari Datta never looked back .
 Today Rasbehari Datta has carved a place for Rasbehari Datta amongst the few leading sitar players of the present generation .
Apart from performing in all the prominent music festivals and music conferences throughout the country .
 Rasbehari Datta has had the distinction of performing in the National Programme of Music by All India Radio and Doordarshan many times .
 Rasbehari Datta is on the panel of Music Director for Film Division and Rasbehari Datta has about hundred films to Rasbehari Datta credit including many award-winning films .
 Rasbehari Datta has comprised music for many T.V. serials and stage ballets including Gangavataran , a ballet Rasbehari Datta comprised in New York .
In addition to these achievements , Rasbehari was a conductor to the famous National Orchestra of All India Radio and has many beautiful orchestral compositions to his credit
Dr. Vikas Kashalkar is a noted Hindustani classical vocalist , scholar , teacher and musicologist .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar has received training in the Gwalior , Jaipur and Agra gharanas .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar hails from a family with music tradition .
Dr. Kashalkar was born in Pandharkawada , Maharashtra .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar was initiated in music from Dr. Vikas Kashalkar father N D Kashalkar , a lawyer by profession and a renowned musicologist and writer .
The tradition of Guru-shishya tradition plays an important role in Hindustani classical music .
 Vikas Kashalkar received Dr. Vikas Kashalkar advanced training in music from Pandit Gajananrao Joshi , a stalwart of the Gwalior gharana and a violin virtuoso .
 Dr. Dr. Vikas Kashalkar singing reflects all the facets of systematic training : Talim ka Gana , in the language of the music connoisseurs .
Vikas Kashalkar worked as a Producer at Balbharati , Pune .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar retired from Balbharati and now teaches music along with performances all over Pandharkawada , Maharashtra and abroad .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar regularly performs on Doordarshan & All India Radio .
Dr Kashalkar is a recognized guide for Hindustani Classical Vocal at Lalit Kala Kendra , University of Pune .
He also guides Phd students at S.N.D.T University and Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya Mandal , Mumbai .
 Dr. Kashalkar 's guru Pandit Gajananrao Joshi a stalwart of Gwalior gharana had a long tradition of this gharana from Pt .
Balkrishnabua Ichalkaranjikar to Pt .
 Anant Manohar Joshi to Balkrishnabua Ichalkaranjikar to Pt . .
Along with Gwalior Gharana Gajananbuwa learnt from other gharanas viz .
 Agra & Jaipur .
Vikas Kashalkar has melodious voice and intricacies of ` Tanas ' give immense joy to the listeners .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar style is deeply rooted in traditions but due to Dr. Vikas Kashalkar imagination and thought process there is always a feeling of newness in Dr. Vikas Kashalkar rendering .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar has a large repertoire of uncommon and mixed ragas and Dr. Vikas Kashalkar presents many of Tanas with great mastery and ease .
 Apart from Pandit Gajananrao Joshi , Pt .
 Mallikarjun Mansur , Surashri Kesarbai Kerkar , Pt .
 Bhimsen Joshi and Dr. Prabha Atre also influenced Bhimsen Joshi .
 Bhimsen Joshi Tana patterns incorporate the behlaos peculiar to Jaipur style .
 Bhimsen Joshi tana patterns have different varieties like saral , vakra , bol tana , mukhbandi and so on .
 Bhimsen Joshi is also a composer of new bandishes .
 Bhimsen Joshi voice is distinctively known for quality , volume and vigor .
 Bhimsen Joshi is gifted with a mellifluous and flexible voice and tremendous ability to make an immediate impact on the audience .
 Connoisseurs and common listeners alike enjoy Bhimsen Joshi concerts .
 Bhimsen Joshi also effectively presents Thumris , Bhajans at times .
 The effectiveness of Bhimsen Joshi music is greatly enhanced by Bhimsen Joshi joyous and amiable disposition .
 Bhimsen Joshi is also continuously involved in exploring new possibilities of Tana pattern .
 Dr. Kashalkar has been awarded a PhD by the Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya for Dr. Vikas Kashalkar work in the field of `` Creativity in Sawai Gandharva Music '' .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar is certified `` A '' grade artist on All India Radio .
 Dr. Kashalkar strongly believes in sharing Dr. Vikas Kashalkar wealth of knowledge to interested students .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar has teaching sessions almost every day in Balbharati , Pune .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar is one of the first Hindustani Classical vocalists who started teaching online and due tho this Dr. Vikas Kashalkar shishya pariwar is spread all around the world .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar is closely associated with Shadjamadhyam , a web portal for teaching vocal music online .
 Dr. Vikas Kashalkar teaches music to students from USA , Europe and other countries .
 Several of Dr. Vikas Kashalkar students have already established Several of his students as concert vocalists .
Manjusha Patil , Aparna Gurav , Hrishikesh Ghangurde , Mukul Kulkarni & Matt Rahaim are few of them .
 Apart from this Manjusha Patil is a Guest educator for under-graduate , post graduate and PhD students at Center for Performing Arts , Lalit Kala Kendra , University of Pune since 1987 .
 Manjusha Patil is guide to PhD students of S.N.D.T University and Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya Mandal , Mumbai .
 Manjusha Patil works as an examiner for PhD thesis in various centers like Aurangabad , Kolhapur and Amravati in Maharashtra India .
 Manjusha Patil is guest Lecturer for NET guidance workshop at SNDT , Pune .
 Also works as a guide to Refresher Course for teachers , SNDT University , Balbharati , Pune .
 A number of students are working for PhD under Manjusha Patil guidance .
 Many of Manjusha Patil students have been awarded the `` Sangeetacharya '' Degree .
 Many of his students has published many articles in news papers as well as in Magazines .
in Sawai Gandharva Music Festival Vikas has wonderfully interviewed Legendary Swaryogini Dr. Prabha Atre in interactive session Antarang which was a rare opportunity to listen and interact with the living legend .
 This was another fine facet of Festival Vikas
 An Avarohana , Avarohana or Avarohana , in the context of Indian classical music , is the descending scale of any raga .
The notes descend in pitch from the upper tonic down to the lower tonic , possibly in a crooked manner .
In raga Darbari , an Asavari - thaat raga with vadi - samvadi R-P , the avroha is R n S d ~ n P , m P g ~ m R S , with andolan on the dhaivat and gandhar .
In Malahari , which is janya raga of 15th melakarta Mayamalavagowla , the avarohana is S D1 P M1 G2 R1 S. See swaras in Carnatic music for description of this notation .
In Sahana , a janya raga of 28th melakarta Harikambhoji , the Avarohana is S N2 D2 P M1 G3 M1 R2 G3 R2 S .
This raga in its avarohana has the notes jumping from one to another .
This changes the whole feel of the raga , making Sahana a beautiful to listen to Raga
Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari was an Indian classical singer and leading exponent of Dhrupad - genre of Hindustani classical music .
 Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari belonged to the Darbhanga gharana and was based in Patna .
 Though Darbhaga gharam is known for Darbhaga gharam laykari techniques , Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari was the first exponent of the gharana to promote fast paced laykari in Dhrupad , which developed in the second half of 20th-century .
 In 1971 , Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari was awarded the Padma Shri by Government of India , Europe , etc .
 Thereafter in 1984 , Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship the highest honour conferred by the Sangeet Natak Akademi , Indias National Academy of Music , Dance & Drama .
 Born in 1919 in Darbhanga , Bihar , Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari received Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari training in Dhrupad from Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari maternal grandfather , of Dharbhanga gharana .
 Subsequently his learnt Khyal , Thumri and Bhajan genre from Khyal father Baldev Tiwari .
 Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari singing , gayaki was known for Swara , Meend , Gamak and Laykari .
 Besides improvisation of complicated Chhand , complicated Chhand allowed Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari to move from one rhythm pattern to another .
 Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari also performed in other genres such as Khyal , Thumri , Tappa and bhajan .
 Pandit Padma Shree Siyaram Tiwari was a leading performer at All India Radio , Patna .
Awards : Padma Shri in 1971 , gold medal .
 From Pres. Dr.Rajendra Prasad 1955 , Bihar ratna 1989 , tansen award and many other awards by numerous music organisations of India , Europe , etc and abroad .
 performed in concerts all over India , Europe , etc , Europe , etc
Vidyadhar Koparkar is a Hindustani classical singer .
Vijay Koparkar started taking singing lessons at the age of eight .
 Initially Vijay Koparkar learned from Madhusudan Patwardhan for eight years , followed by training under renowned artiste of yesteryear , Vasantrao Deshpande for five years and then under Pandit Jitendra Abhisheki for seven years .
 Vijay Koparkar has a Master 's degree in Engineering from the College of Engineering , Pune and runs a small-scale manufacturing plant .
 Vijay Koparkar has been trained by gurus belonging to different gharanas , and it reflects in Vijay Koparkar singing .
 Vijay Koparkar has received several honors including a scholarship given by Master Sudhir Phadke Through ` Surashree Pratishthan ' for six years from 1983 to 1990 and the ` Pandit Ramkrishna Vaze Puraskar ' by Gandharva Mahamandal .
Vijay Koparkar has performed all over the world , including the USA , Canada , the Middle East , Paris and UK .
 Vijay Koparkar performed twice at the prestigious ' Sawai Gandharva Music Festival ' held in Pune , India every year .
 Vijay Koparkar is a graded artiste at All India Radio and Indian Television .
Vijay Koparkar has been imparting music lessons for many years .
 Among Vijay Koparkar students , Hrishikesh Ranade , Prajakta Ranade and Yogita Godbole-Pathak have made their marks in the field of popular light music , while Pushkar Lele , Mandar Phatak and Mandar Gadgil are emerging young artists in the field of classical music
Bandish Projekt is a musical act featuring a blend of Indian elements in an electronica format .
 The title Bandish Projekt is derived from Bandish -- an Indian classical composition , and The title Bandish Projekt , which reflects the experimental and evolving nature of the music .
Bandish Projekt was formed in 1998 by Mayur Narvekar , Udyan Sagar , and Mehirr Nath Choppra .
 Mayur Narvekar regularly collaborates with producers and musicians on Udyan Sagar albums , Udyan Sagar performs as Nucleya , and Mehirr Nath Choppra is a media entrepereneur , based in Dubai , where Mehirr Nath Choppra operates radio stations and supports Bandish Projekt and Bheja Fry Records as a mentor .
Mayur was raised in Ahmedabad by a family of classical musicians and arts enthusiasts .
 Mayur father and paternal uncle introduced His father to the dholak at an early age .
 Through His father interest and talent for percussion , His father was encouraged to formally learn the tabla .
 Mayur studied classical tabla with Mayur guru Shri Divyang Vakil for 20 years .
 Mayur went on to win the All India Radio competition for percussion in 2000 , and was honoured with the prestigious Pt .
Nikhil Ghosh Memorial Promising Artist Award in 2001 .
 Inspired by the music and producers of the West , Mayur began to add to Mayur repertory of classical sounds .
 Thus , Mayur electronic act , Bandish Projekt , was conceived .
 After graduating from St. Xaviers College , Ahmedabad , in 2000 with a BA in psychology , Mayur decided to pursue a full-time career in music .
 After several years as a live performer , composer and producer , Mayur moved to Mumbai in 2008 .
Bandish Projekt 's first album , Correkt , was released in October 2009 , followed by the single Brown Skin Beauty featuring Last Mango in Paris in 2010 , and the EP Chase in March 2011 .
In December 2011 , Bandish Projekt released another EP , Lover , featuring Shaa'ir , which was nominated for the 2012 MTV EMA award for Best Indian Act .
Bandish Projekt released two EPs in 2012 , I Am Not Alone and Correkt Remixed
 Badal Roy is a Bangladeshi tabla player , percussionist , and recording artist known for the only Pakistanis in attendance work in jazz , world music , and experimental music .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance was born in Comilla , East Bengal , British India in 1945 .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance was born into a Hindu family in a predominantly Muslim eastern East Bengal region of the British empire in the Indian Subcontinent .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance speaks the Bengali , English , Hindi , and Urdu languages .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance father was a government official who served in the distinguished position of Joint Secretary .
 His nickname , the only Pakistanis in attendance , was given to him by his grandfather after he began crying in the rain as a baby .
 An early inspiration for the only Pakistanis in attendance was American popular music , and the only Pakistanis in attendance particularly enjoyed the music of artists such as Elvis Presley , Pat Boone , and Nat King Cole .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance first exposure to jazz came when the only Pakistanis in attendance saw a concert by Duke Ellington and the only Pakistanis in attendance 60-member orchestra at the Metropole Hotel in Karachi , West Pakistan in 1959 ; the only Pakistanis in attendance and the only Pakistanis in attendance brother were the only Pakistanis in attendance .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance received a masters degree in statistics .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance came to New York City in 1968 to work on a Ph.D. .
 With only eight dollars in the only Pakistanis in attendance pocket , the only Pakistanis in attendance began working as a busboy and waiter in various Indian restaurants , including Taste of British India in 1945 and Raga .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance later settled in East Brunswick Township , New Jersey .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance began playing the tabla at age 10 or 11 , under guidance from the only Pakistanis in attendance maternal uncle in comilla .
 After coming to New York , the only Pakistanis in attendance began performing with Steve Gorn at a Manhattan restaurant called Raga , eventually attracting the attention of Miles Davis .
 Miles Davis invited the only Pakistanis in attendance to join the only Pakistanis in attendance group , and Miles Davis recorded on Miles Davis albums On the Corner , Big Fun , and Get Up with Big Fun .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance subsequently performed and recorded with many leading jazz musicians , including Miles Davis , Dave Liebman , Pharoah Sanders , John McLaughlin , Herbie Hancock , Herbie Mann , Pat Metheny , Lester Bowie , Airto Moreira , Charlie Haden , Purna Das Baul , Yoko Ono , and Ornette Coleman .
 In the 1990s the only Pakistanis in attendance began performing with the Brazilian guitar duo Duofel .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance has also collaborated with Ken Wessel and Stomu Takeishi in a fusion trio named Alankar .
 Ken Wessel and Stomu Takeishi currently have one album entitled Daybreak .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance has appeared and offered workshops at RhythmFest , the Starwood Festival , and at the SpiritDrum Festival , a special tribute to the late Babatunde Olatunji with Muruga Booker , Jim Donovan of Rusted Root , Halim El-Dabh , Richie Shakin Nagan , Jeff Rosenbaum and Sikiru Adepoju , among others .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance often plays with Muruga Booker in the Global Village Ceremonial Band , and with Michael Wolff & Impure Thoughts .
 In 2004 , the only Pakistanis in attendance worked with Richie Havens on the album The Grace of the Sun .
 In the first half of 2006 , the only Pakistanis in attendance traveled to Japan in order to appear in a tribute for David Baker , David Baker recently deceased recording engineer and friend .
 In addition to tabla , the only Pakistanis in attendance also plays a variety of percussion instruments including shakers , bells , rain stick , and flexatone .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance notable students include Geoffrey Gordon .
 In 2008 , the album Miles From British India in 1945 , a tribute to Miles Davis on which the only Pakistanis in attendance appeared , received a Grammy nomination .
 Unlike many tabla players , the only Pakistanis in attendance does not come from a family of professional musicians and is essentially self-taught , although the only Pakistanis in attendance studied with the only Pakistanis in attendance late maternal uncle Dwijendra Chandra Chakraborty as a child , and also studied briefly with Alla Rakha .
 Consequently , the only Pakistanis in attendance playing is freer than that of many other tabla players , who adhere more strictly to the tala system of Indian rhythm .
 the only Pakistanis in attendance often plays a set of up to eight tabla and two baya at a time , which the only Pakistanis in attendance plays melodically as well as rhythmically
Ahir Bhairav is a Hindustani classical raga .
 Hindustani is a mixture of Ahir Bhairav and the ancient but now rare raga Ahiri or Abhiri , or perhaps a mixture of Ahir Bhairav and Kafi .
Pa and Sa are sometimes avoided in ascending .

 The descend can be direct , but is often expressed as S n D P m , G m Gr ~ S with a slight oscillation on komal re to express the character of Ahir Bhairav .
 Also there may be impressions of Kafi , the image of Ahir Bhairav is easily maintained with the characteristic passage n D n/r ~ S. Specially the characteristic Ahir Bhairav andolan on komal re .
 Sometimes shuddha Ni is used in the lower octave to emphazise the Ahir Bhairav character .
The Carnatic music equivalent to this raga is Chakravakam .
Ahir Bhairav is typical uttarang raga , which means emphasis is on the upper tetrachord .
The second Prahar of the morning , around 6 - 9 AM .
Wasif-ud-din Dagar , Music Today Cassette : A97015 , ; Chalo sakhi braj raje .
Ravi Shankar , HMV LP , Three Classical Ragas 1957 , free improvisation and Gat in Rapuktala
Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan is a vocalist of Hindustani music genre .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan belongs to the musical tradition of Miya Tansen .
 Apart from khayal , Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan sings dhrupad , dhamar and thumri with equal versatility .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan was born in a family of musicians tracing back to Behram Khan , who was a singer of traditional the Gwalior Gayaki gharana gayaki .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan fathers elder brother Bade Yusuf Khan and Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan father initially trained Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan father Chhote Yusuf Khan was His father Chhote Yusuf Khan guru .
 This was followed with extensive taleem from His father Chhote Yusuf Khan family elders , like Chand Khan , Barkhudar Khan , Mahtab Khan who had imbibed the Gwalior Gayaki .
 His father Chhote Yusuf Khan further developed this style suiting His father Chhote Yusuf Khan own artistic sensitivity .
Khans traditional compositions have been recorded by the BBC and Iraq Radio .
 Organizations like Uttar Pradesh Sangeet Natak Academi , Lucknow and ITC Sangeet Research Academy , Press club Kolkata have recorded and preserved more than 1500 compositions .
 During the past several decades , Uttar Pradesh Sangeet Natak Academi has been a regular performer on Akashvani and Doordarshan Lucknow .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan has participated in many national and regional conferences like Sadarang Conference , Godrej Conference , Lucknow Mahotsav , Dover Lance Conference , ITC Sangeet Sammelan , Prayag Sangeet Samiti Sangeet Sammelan all over India and has been felicited by Critics , fellow artists and many reputed recognized institutions like Uttar Pradesh Sangeet Natak Academy , , Banaras Hindu University , Eastern Zone cultural center and Press club Kolkata .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan has composed more than two thousand compositions and is also a prolific writer and poet under the pseudonym Rasan Piya .
 Many compositions that Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan sings are Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan own creations .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan has trained numerous students in Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan lifetime .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan is now a guru at ITC Sangeet Research Academy , Press club Kolkata .
 Ustad Abdul Rashid Khan has been a member of the All India Radio Audition Committee , New Delhi and has been awarded with many titles by the different reputed organizations like Sangeet Maharishi , Sangeet Sartaz , Rassagar , Bandish Samarat
Vishwanathbuwa Jadhav , also referred as Proudh Gandharva or with title Pandit , was an Indian Hindustani classical khyal singer .
He was a celebrated disciple of Ustad Abdul Karim Khan , the founder of Kirana gharana .
He learned under Ustad from 1906 until Ustads death in 1937 under the gharanedaar style of teaching with one student at a time .
He also took lessons from Ustad Nissar Hussein Khan of Gwalior gharana .
Jadhav was appointed as the darbar gayak of the former princely state of Kolhapur by Chhatrapati Shahu Maharaj in 1920s .
He had also been invited to perform on various occasions by Krishna Raja Wadiyar IV , the Maharaja of Mysore State .
 In 1938 , he was also bestowed with the title of Proudh Gandharva by Krishna Raja Wadiyar IV .
He used to also perform at the royal functions of Sangli State .
 Being friends with Pandit Dinanath Mangeshkar , Pandit Dinanath Mangeshkar has also taught the veteran Bollywood singer Lata Mangeshkar in her childhood days at Sangli State .
Jadhav also composed music for films in the early talkie era .
He was the music composer of the 1937 film Gangavataran .
The film was written and directed by Dadasaheb Phalke s , who is known as the father of Indian cinema .
 It was the first sound film and the last film to be directed by Dadasaheb Phalke .
 In 1938 , Dadasaheb Phalke also composed music for the mythological film Dhurva Kumar based on Dhruva s story .
The film starred actors Kumar Prabhakar and Raja Paranjape .
On 4 April 1952 Pandit Vishwanathbuwa Jadhav was honoured by the first President of India - Dr. Rajendra Prasad at the golden jubilee celebrations of the Gandharva Mahavidyalaya at Delhi .
Jadhav has three sons , Pandit B.V. Jadhav , Pandit R.V. Jadhav , Pandit P.V. Jadhav , who are also classical Hindustani singers .
At Nashik , they have setup and loom after the Pandit Vishwanathbuwa Jadhav Memorial Committee which promotes Hindustani music .
In May 2012 , the committee submitted a collection of about 500 notations of various bandishes that Jadhav preserved of his learning from his gurus Ustad Nissar Hussein Khan and Ustad Abdul Karim Khan , to a Pune based group Pune Bharat Gayan Samaj
Jeffrey Scott Martin is a Canadian guitarist and singer-songwriter best known for fronting the rock band The Tea Party .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin began Jeffrey Scott Martin career as a solo artist in October 2005 , when The Tea Party disbanded .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin began playing guitar as a child and in his adolescence played in bands The Shadows , Modern Movement and The Stickmen .
 In 1988 , Jeff Burrows graduated from Sandwich Secondary School along with future Tea Party bandmates Jeff Burrows and Stuart Chatwood .
 Jeff Burrows went on to study music at the University of Windsor before leaving Jeff Burrows studies prematurely due to philosophical differences with Jeff Burrows music professor .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin has perfect pitch , as highlighted on The Science of Rock n Roll , an episode of Daily Planet on Discovery Channel Canada .
 Forming The Tea Party in 1990 after a marathon jam session at the Cherry Beach Rehearsal Studios in Toronto , Jeffrey Scott Martin produced all of The Tea Partys albums , including Jeff Burrows and Stuart Chatwood eponymous debut album in 1991 , distributing it through the bands own label , Eternal Discs .
 In 1993 The Tea Party signed to EMI Music Canada and released Jeff Burrows and Stuart Chatwood first major label recording entitled Splendor Solis .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin employed open tunings to imitate Indian instruments such as the sitar , something Jeffrey Scott Martin has continued to employ throughout Jeffrey Scott Martin career .
 Further developing The Tea Partys sound in 1995 , The Edges of Twilight was recorded with an array of Indian and Middle-eastern instrumentation while Jeffrey Scott Martin drew lyrical inspiration from occult themes and pagan influenced literature .
 Upon returning from successful tours in Discovery Channel Canada , Europe and Australia in 1996 , The Tea Party went onto record Canada known as Alhambra , an Enhanced CD which features acoustic re-recordings of songs from The Edges of Twilight , followed by a brief tour around Canada known as Canada known as Alhambra acoustic and eclectic .
 Transmission , released in 1997 , saw Jeffrey Scott Martin first foray into electronica , with Jeffrey Scott Martin conceding that Transmission was an honest attempt at going somewhere poetically where most people would be unnerved to go .
 Transmission was very dark , extremely angry and you could only listen to Transmission in a certain mindset .
 I mean for I , going to where I went with Transmission , almost destroyed I .
Triptych followed in 1999 ; the first single Heaven Coming Down rose to # 1 on Canadian radio .
 Lyrically , Jeffrey Scott Martin was less enigmatic than Jeffrey Scott Martin was on previous albums : on Triptych Jeffrey Scott Martin wrote about the experiences of Jeffrey Scott Martin years in the band .
 After releasing , a singles compilation , in 2000 and Illuminations , a DVD compilation of music videos which Jeffrey Scott Martin remixed in Surround sound , The Tea Party released The Interzone Mantras in 2001 and Seven Circles in 2004 .
In October 2005 , The Tea Party disbanded due to creative differences .
 The band members regrouped in 2011 for a series of shows in The band members native Canada .
The success of these dates led to The Tea Party reforming permanently .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin debut solo album titled Exile and the Kingdom was released in Discovery Channel Canada and Australia in 2006 .
 Among those who worked with Jeffrey Scott Martin were Michael Lee and Ritesh Das .
The first single , titled The World is Calling , is an open letter to the Bush administration .
 During this time Jeffrey Scott Martin was supposed to collaborate with Scott Stapp but it did not ensue .
 In November 2006 , Jeffrey Scott Martin released a live album recorded that September , titled Live in Brisbane 2006 .
The two-disc album features Ritesh Das and the Toronto Tabla Ensemble , and consists of both solo and Tea Party songs .
 The album is a complete recording of a live performance full of Jeff Burrows banter with bandmates and the audience , including Jeff Burrows thoughts on the disbanding of The Tea Party and where Jeff Burrows sees Jeff Burrows in life .
 In May 2007 , Jeffrey Scott Martin released Jeffrey Scott Martin second live album Live in Dublin recorded with drummer Wayne P. Sheehy , while Martins first solo music DVD Live at the Enmore Theatre was released through Shock DVD in July 2007 .
 In early 2008 Jeffrey Scott Martin and Wayne P. Sheehy formed The Armada .
The bands debut album , which features a similar sound to the Tea Party , was released on 4 November 2008 .
 In 2010 , Jeffrey Scott Martin began work on new music with Jay Cortez and Malcolm Clark for a new album to be entitled The Ground Cries Out under the new bandname of Jeff Martin 777 .
 On January 10 , 2011 , the title track from the album was released on Jeffrey Scott Martin myspace page .
 The Ground Cries Out was released in Discovery Channel Canada on March 1 , 2011 and has subsequently been released in Australia .
 Following a Jeff Martin 777 Canadian tour , the band toured Australia from May 2011 .
 During the tour Jeffrey Scott Martin announced a reunion of The Tea Party for some Canadian shows in July 2007 and August .
Following the success of those shows , The Tea Party announced the reunion was permanent .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin has also produced albums for other artists including Hundred Mile Houses EP , The Jay Murphy Bands Propaganda and Tenth Planets The Prophet Curse EP .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin also played upon Roy Harper s The Green Man .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin recently produced the new album for Australian dark rock band The Eternal called Under A New Sun .
The album features a duet with singer Mark Kelson on the track The Sleeper .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin wife Nicole gave birth to their first child in December 2004 in King Edward Memorial Hospital , Perth , Western Australia , named Django James Patrick after Jeff Burrows heroes Django Reinhardt and Jimmy Page .
 The song Daystar from Exile and the Kingdom was written for Martins wife Nicole .
 June 19 2011 , Jeff Burrows became a father for the second time to a baby boy with Byron Bay Photographer , Kate Nutt .
 Jeffrey Scott Martin maintains a studio in Byron Bay , Australia
Sunanda Patnaik is an Indian classical singer of Gwalior gharana from Odisha .
 Popularly known as guruma , Sunanda Patnaik is considered one of the great dames of Hindustani music .
 Sunanda Patnaik is the daughter of legendary Oriya poet Baikunthanath Patnaik .
 Sunanda Patnaik started singing at All India Radio in Cuttack in 1948 at the age of 14 .
 The then Odisha Governor Asaf Ali once heard Sunanda Patnaik on Radio and was very impressed with Sunanda Patnaik singing and Sunanda Patnaik became a regular fixture at the Raj Bhavan whenever the Governor had guests .
 Once , President Rajendra Prasad heard Sunanda Patnaik at Puri .
 President Rajendra Prasad was very impressed with Sunanda Patnaik singing and arranged Sunanda Patnaik training under Pandit Vinayak Rao Pattavardhan at Pune with a scholarship .
 Sunanda Patnaik was awarded with the degree of Masters in Music by Pune School in 1956 .
 Sunanda Patnaik performed at All India Sadrang Sageet Sammelan in Calcutta in September 1957 were Sunanda Patnaik received 13 gold coins.Since then has done many concerts in India and is known internationally .
 Sunanda Patnaik is best known for Sunanda Patnaik tarana that Sunanda Patnaik sings at a high pace and is considered one of the best contemporary interpreters of Odissi music .
 Sunanda Patnaik has been staying at Kolkata since 1983 .
 Sunanda Patnaik received Odisha Sangeet Natak Akademi award in 1970-71 .
 Sunanda Patnaik received Indian lifetime achievement award in 2009 and lifetime achievement award from The Orissa society of the Americas in 2012 .
 Sunanda Patnaik is the recipient of sangeet natak academy award for the year 2012 .
 The degree of doctor of literature was conferred to Sunanda Patnaik by the Utkal University in 1999 and the degree of doctor of music was conferred by the Akhil Bharatiya Gandharva Mahavidyalaya Mandal in 1975 .
 Nilamadhada is a National Film Award - winning documentary film about Nilamadhada .
The film was directed by Sri Dilip Patnaik and produced by Films Division .
 It won the Best Biographical documentary for the year 2010 at the 58th National Film Awards in India
Asad was born in 1963 to the famous violinist K.H. Qizilbash , who introduced many talented Pakistani musicians to the world , Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan among others .
 After attending a concert performed by India 's most legendary Sarod player , Amjad Ali Khan , Asad decided to devote Amjad Ali Khan to the instrument .
 As a result Asad listened to many recordings by Amjad Ali Khan , practising the Sarod and putting Asad mind and soul into the Sarod .
 The discovery of Asad master 's live performance became the paradigm for his music .
 In 1992 Asad became the only recognised Sarod player in the country and five years later Asad received Ganda Band Shagerd of Ustad Amjad Ali Khan in New Delhi .
 Asad Qizilbash started learning violin when K.H. Qizilbash was around 8 years old .
 At 10 years age , K.H. Qizilbash was asked to perform in a function patronized by UNICEF : The Universal Children Day , Islamabad .
 It was K.H. Qizilbash first public performance .
Asad Qizilbash became a performing member of the Childrens Art Workshop at the Pakistan National Council of Arts .
 K.H. Qizilbash was playing violin and the guitar .
 K.H. Qizilbash remained member of this workshop till 1982 , when K.H. Qizilbash left for the Middle East .
 During those days K.H. Qizilbash used to play daily at the workshop .
 At that same period , K.H. Qizilbash signed a contract with the Pakistan Television PTV .
Asad Qizilbash was selected with some other musicians to represent Pakistan at the Attaturk Festival , in Ankara .
 K.H. Qizilbash was playing violin and guitar .
This was an invitation from the Radio-Television authorities of Turkey .
 The same year Radio-Television met Ustad Amjad Ali Khan in Pakistan at the Attaturk Festival , for the first time .
 KASBEY QAMAL , a television serie by the Pakistan Television PTV where Asad Qizilbash performed the Sarod and violin .
PANGNAT , a television series by the PTV where Asad Qizilbash was performing for the musical background .
Sarod concerts at the Tagore Institute in Bonn , Federal Republic of Germany .
Since his return to Pakistan in 1992 , Asad Qizilbash is mainly playing the Sarod .
His talent is largely recognized and he has performed already in four Rag Rang .
These are very exclusive concerts reserved only for classical musicians of the highest level .
RASELAY LOG a television series by the PTV where Asad Qizilbash was performing sarod .
SATNBY STUDIO , a special program run during the election campaign where Asad Qizilbash was participating in a music event with other musicians .
Asad Qizilbash performs live at the Marcus Mingus Jazz Club in Brussels , Belgium .
 Asad performs for Peter Gabriel 's WOMAD in the UK .
 Chinese Minister of Culture invites Asad to perform on the 7th Asia Art Festival in Foshan .
 Asad Qizilbash performs live at the Tree & Leaf in Brussels and at the Dranouter Festival for the Pax Mundial project with Patrick Riguelle and Jan Hautekiet .
 Asad also plays on the track Bodyless Friend by Sutrastore .
 Asad Qizilbash signs a publishing , recording and production contract with womb Editions in Brussels .
 Together with Andrew Goldberg and Pely , Asad recorded Andrew Goldberg first solo album , The Magic of the Sarod .
 From a total of 90 minutes of recorded music , K.H. Qizilbash performs live , four Ragas and one traditional Folk Tune ranging between early morning and midnight moods
Surbahar , , sometimes known as bass sitar , is a plucked string instrument used in the Hindustani classical music of North India .
 Surbahar is closely related to the sitar , but has a lower tone .
Depending on the instruments size , it is usually pitched two to five whole steps below the standard sitar , but Indian classical music having no concept of absolute pitch , this may vary .
The instrument can emit frequencies lower than 20 Hz .
The surbahar is over 130 cm .
 Surbahar uses a dried gourd as a resonator , and has a neck with very wide frets , which allow a glissando of six notes on the same fret through the method of pulling .
The neck is made out of tun , or teak wood .
 Surbahar has four rhythm strings , four playing strings , and 15 to 17 unplayed sympathetic strings .
There are two bridges ; the playable strings pass over the greater bridge , which is connected to the tabli with small legs , which are glued in place .
The sympathetic strings pass over the smaller bridge which is directly glued on the tabli .
The main bridge has a slightly bent upper surface which results in a droning sound , because the vibrating span of the strings quivers ever so slightly .
The instrumentalist plays the strings using a metallic plectrum , the mizrab , which is fixed on the index finger of the players right hand .
Three plectrums are used to play the dhrupad style of alap , jor , and jhala on surbahar .
In the dhrupad style , instead of performing the sitarkhani and masitkhani gats , the instrumentalist plays the slow dhrupad composition in accompaniment with pakhawaj .
Some researchers believe that surbahar was invented around 1825 .
Though the invention is generally attributed to Ustad Sahebdad Khan , recent research shows that Lucknow - based sitarist Ustad Ghulam Mohammed may have been the inventor
Anant Lal , often referred to by the title Pandit , was an Indian classical musician and teacher who played the shehnai .
Lal was born in Varanasi , in the northern Indian province of Uttar Pradesh , in 1927 .
The oboe - like shehnai had been a musical instrument played in his family for over 200 years , and he initially received tuition from his father , Pandit Mithai Lal , as well as his uncles , from the age of nine .
 Later , Lal became a student of thumri vocal teacher Pandit Mahadev Prasad Mishra of Varanasi .
In addition to the shehnai , Lal played bamboo flute , known as the bansuri .
 Following the example of master musician Bismillah Khan , Bismillah Khan dedicated Bismillah Khan musical career to furthering the role of the shehnai in Hindustani classical music , since the instrument had traditionally been reserved for religious ceremonies .
 Lal established Bismillah Khan as a staff artist for All India Radio , with whom Bismillah Khan served until 1987 .
 Among Bismillah Khan works as a performer and recording artist in India , Bismillah Khan played with sitar virtuosos Ravi Shankar and Debu Chaudhuri .
 In 1974 , Shankar chose Lal to join his Music Festival from India revue , which was the largest Indian orchestra to perform in Europe up to that time .
 In addition to recording a studio album in England with Shankars ensemble , released on George Harrison s Dark Horse Records in 1976 , Lal toured Europe with the Music Festival .
 His fellow performers included leading figures of Indian classical music - among His fellow performers , Alla Rakha , Lakshmi Shankar , Shivkumar Sharma , Hariprasad Chaurasia , Sultan Khan and L. Subramaniam .
 As on the Music Festival from India album , Lals featured spot as a soloist was on the piece Kajri ; the debut performance , filmed at Londons Royal Albert Hall on 23 September 1974 , was released on DVD in 2010 , as part of the four-disc box set Ravi Shankar-George Harrison , Collaborations .
Lals own recordings include Splendour in Shehnai , issued in 1990 on the T-Series record label .
Also a teacher , in the Benares gharana tradition , his students included modern shehnai players Shanjeev Shankar and Daya Shankar .
His grandson , Anand Shankar , also trained under Lal , before dedicating himself to the tabla .
In 1984 , Lal received the Uttar Pradesh Sangeet Natak Akademi Award .
 Five years later , he was honoured with a national Sangeet Natak Akademi Award , the highest recognition afforded artists in India .
Lal died on 3 March 2011 , aged 84 , from a heart attack .
Along with Daya Shankar , his musician sons include shehnai player Ashok Kumar and flautist Vijay Kumar
He was born Husseinuddin Dagar , the youngest son of Allabande Khan .
 He other three brothers , Nasiruddin , Rahimuddin and Imanuddin Khan Dagar , were also famous singers of Dhrupad style .
 Nasiruddin decided to return to the familys original religion , became a Hindu , and took the name Tansen Pande .
 Nasiruddin son Saeeduddin Dagar is a Dhrupad performer who resides in Pune in western India
Rattan Mohan Sharma is an Indian classical vocalist .
 Rattan Mohan Sharma sings in Hindustani style of music .
 Rattan Mohan Sharma performs in classical music forms like Khayal , Tarana , Dhrupad , Haveli Sangeet , Tappa and also in light classical forms and folk music including Bhajan as well as Rajasthani Folk .
 Rattan Mohan Sharma is anA grade artist on All India Radio .
Rattan Mohan Sharma was born in Rajasthan to Padma and Mohan Lal Sharma .
 Rattan Mohan Sharma is the nephew of classical vocalist , Pandit Jasraj .
 It was found that young Rattan had an affinity towards percussion instruments so till the age of 15 , young Rattan also learned tabla .
Rattan Mohan Sharma hails from the illustrious Mewaati Gharana and belongs to the family of vocalist like Pandit Motiram , Pandit Maniram , Pandit Pratapnarayan , and Pandit Jasraj .
 Rattan Mohan Sharma has performed solos in many concerts and festivals in India and abroad .
 Rattan Mohan Sharma performs regularly at the classical music festivals , Pandit Motiram Pandit Maniram Sangeet Samaroh organized by Pandit Jasraj and Harivallabh Sangeet Sammelan , Sawai Gandharva Bhimsen Festival .
Also a successful music director and composer giving music to a number of tele-serials and private albums .
Rattan Mohan Sharma is married to Ekta Sharma and has a son , Swar Sharma
Late Pt .
Vishwanath Rao Ringe Tanarang born on 6 December 1922 was a Hindustani Classical Music vocalist and composer .
He belonged to Gwalior Gharana of Hindustani Classical Music .
He composed more than 2000 bandishs in about 200 ragaas , for which he has been enlisted in Limca Book of Records .
He wrote couple of books in past named Sangitanjali and Swaranjali and a recent book ` Aacharya Tanarang ki Bandishen ` was published .
Pt .
Ringe was the disciple of late Pandit Krishnarao Pandit of Gwalior gharana .
 Ringe started learning music from Ringe childhood .
 Ringe received rigorous and intensive training and full guidance as a performer Khyal Gayakee , in Gwalior Gharana style .
 In 1939 , Ringe established a music school named Bhartiya Sangeet Kala Mandir .
More than 2000 compositions in about 200 raagas , have been composed in various Talas .
Viz ... Ektal , Deepchandi , Tritala , Tilwada , Chanchar , Dadra , Keharva , Jhaptala , Ada-Choutal , Roopak etc. .
 Pt Ringe had Ektal composed a Raga Hemashri , which Ektal has Rendered in All India Radio Programme .
 Ektal compositions include Bada Khyal , Chota Khyal , Chaturang , Tarana , Sadra , Sargam , Tillana , Sur Sagar .
Sur Sagar is a unique composition , in which the lyrics are same as the notes .
Pt .
 Ringe died at the age of 83 at Ringe residence in Indore , Madhya Pradesh in 2005 .
